abbreviate.name: abbreviate
abbreviate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a word or phrase shorter by using only the first letters of each word

example.eg: "Daniel" is often abbreviated to "Dan".
example.egtrans: Daniel常简称为Dan。

example.eg: "Chief Executive Officer" is abbreviated as "CEO".
example.egtrans: Chief Executive Officer（首席执行官）缩写为CEO。

above.name: above
above.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: above
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or to a higher position than something else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（或向）…上面；在（或向）…较高处

example.eg: There's a mirror above the sink.
example.egtrans: 洗碗槽上方有面镜子。

example.eg: He waved the letter excitedly above his head.
example.egtrans: 他兴奋地把信举过头顶挥舞着。

example.eg: She's rented a room above a shop.
example.egtrans: 她在一家店铺的楼上租了个房间。

example.eg: Her name comes above mine on the list.
example.egtrans: 名单上她的名字列在我的前面。

example.eg: The helicopter was hovering above the building.
example.egtrans: 直升机在大楼上空盘旋。

example.eg: It's on the shelf just above your head.
example.egtrans: 就在你头顶上方的架子上。

example.eg: A crack had started to appear just above the light on the ceiling.
example.egtrans: 灯具上方的天花板上已经出现了一道裂缝。

dsense.name: above
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: more than an amount or level

example.eg: It says on the box it's for children aged three and above.
example.egtrans: 包装盒上标明适于3岁及以上的儿童。

example.eg: Rates of pay are above average.
example.egtrans: 工资高于平均水平。

example.eg: Temperatures rarely rise above zero in winter.
example.egtrans: 冬季气温很少高于零度。

example.eg: She values her job above her family.
example.egtrans: 她把工作看得比家庭重要。

example.eg: They value their freedom above (and beyond) all else.
example.egtrans: 他们把自由看得高于一切。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: most importantly
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 最重要的是；尤其是；首先

example.eg: Above all, I'd like to thank my family.
example.egtrans: 首先，我要感谢我的家人。

example.eg: Above all, I'd say I value kindness.
example.egtrans: 我认为仁慈是最重要的（情操）。

dsense.name: above
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a more important or advanced position than someone else

example.eg: Sally's a grade above me.
example.egtrans: 萨莉比我高一年级。

dsense.name: above
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: too good or important for something

example.eg: No one is above suspicion in this matter.
example.egtrans: 这件事情上没有人可以避开嫌疑。

example.eg: He's not above lying (= he sometimes lies) to protect himself.
example.egtrans: 为了保护自己，他也不免要撒谎。

above.name: above
above.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: above
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: When used in a piece of writing, "above" means higher on the page, or on a previous page.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （同页中）上面提到的（地）；上文（的），前文（的）

example.eg: Please send the articles to the address given above.
example.egtrans: 请将文章寄到上述地址。

example.eg: The letter was sent to the above address.
example.egtrans: 此信件已被送往上述地址。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: all the people or things listed earlier
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 前面列出的所有人（或事物）

example.eg: All of the above should be invited.
example.egtrans: 上面列出的所有人都应该受到邀请。

example.eg: Once we've finished all of the above we can start on the next project.
example.egtrans: 上述所有事情一完成，我们就可以立刻开始下一个项目。

absence.name: absence
absence.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: absence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of not being where you are usually expected to be

example.eg: A new manager was appointed during/in her absence.
example.egtrans: 她不在的时候任命了一位新经理。

example.eg: She has had repeated absences from work this year.
example.egtrans: 今年她屡次旷工。

dsense.name: absence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of not existing

example.eg: He drew attention to the absence of concrete evidence against the defendant.
example.egtrans: 他使大家注意到，可以证明被告有罪的确凿证据并不存在。

example.eg: In the absence of (= because there were not) more suitable candidates, we decided to offer the job to Mr Conway.
example.egtrans: 由于没有更为合适的人选，我们决定任命康韦先生。

abstract.name: abstract
abstract.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: abstract
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing as an idea, feeling, or quality, not as a material object
trans_examp.trans_cn: 抽象的；纯理论的；纯概念的

example.eg: Truth and beauty are abstract concepts.
example.egtrans: 真和美都是抽象的概念。

trans_examp.trans_en: An abstract argument or discussion is general and not based on particular examples.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （辩论或讨论）抽象的；空泛的；空洞的

example.eg: This debate is becoming too abstract - let's have some hard facts!
example.egtrans: 这场辩论变得太空洞了，拿出一些具体的事实根据来吧！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: general ideas

example.eg: I have difficulty dealing with the abstract - let's discuss particular cases.
example.egtrans: 我难以理解抽象概念，我们讨论一些具体的案例吧。

example.eg: So far we've only discussed the question in the abstract (= without referring to any real examples).
example.egtrans: 目前我们只是泛泛地讨论过这个问题。

dsense.name: abstract
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to a type of painting, drawing, or sculpture that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things

example.eg: abstract art
example.egtrans: 抽象艺术

example.eg: an abstract painter
example.egtrans: 抽象派画家

abstract.name: abstract
abstract.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: abstract
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a short form of a speech, article, book, etc., giving only the most important facts or ideas

example.eg: There is a section at the end of the magazine that includes abstracts of recent articles/books.
example.egtrans: 杂志的最后一部分收录了近期发表的文章／出版的书籍的摘要。

dsense.name: abstract
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a painting that uses shapes, lines, and colour in a way that does not try to represent the appearance of people or things
trans_examp.trans_cn: 抽象画；抽象派艺术作品

access.name: access
access.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: access
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the method or possibility of getting near to a place or person
trans_examp.trans_cn: 通道；途径；（接近某地或某人的）机会（或方法）；（使用某物的）权利

example.eg: The only access to the village is by boat.
example.egtrans: 到那个村子去的唯一方法是乘船。

example.eg: The main access to (= entrance to) the building is at the side.
example.egtrans: 大楼的主入口在侧面。

example.eg: The children's father was refused access to them at any time (= refused official permission to see them).
example.egtrans: 孩子们的父亲任何时候都无权探视他们。

dsense.name: access
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the right or opportunity to use or look at something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使用或看见某物的权利或机会

example.eg: The system has been designed to give the user quick and easy access to the required information.
example.egtrans: 系统旨在方便用户快速地获取所需信息。

example.eg: Hackers had/gained complete access to the company files.
example.egtrans: 黑客入侵了公司所有的文件。

access.name: access
access.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to open a computer file (= a collection of information stored on a computer) in order to look at or change information in it

accessible.name: accessible
accessible.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to be reached or easily got
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可进入的，可接近的；可得到的

example.eg: The resort is easily accessible by road, rail, and air.
example.egtrans: 这个旅游胜地交通便利，坐汽车、火车和飞机都可以到达。

example.eg: The problem with some of these drugs is that they are so very accessible.
example.egtrans: 此类毒品的问题在于其中的一些很容易获取。

trans_examp.trans_en: easy to understand

example.eg: Lea Anderson is a choreographer who believes in making dance accessible.
example.egtrans: 作为一个舞蹈编导，利•安德森认为应该使舞蹈通俗易懂。

example.eg: Covent Garden has made some attempt to make opera accessible to a wider public.
example.egtrans: 考文特花园皇家歌剧院已做出一些努力，以让更多的人来欣赏歌剧。

accidental.name: accidental
accidental.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening by chance

example.eg: Reports suggest that eleven soldiers were killed by accidental fire from their own side.
example.egtrans: 报道暗示11名士兵被己方炮火误射而丧生。

example.eg: The site was located after the accidental discovery of bones in a field.
example.egtrans: 有人在田地里意外地发现遗骨后，这个遗址才被发现。

accidental.name: accidental
accidental.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: accidental
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sign showing that there is a temporary change from the key signature (= the set of musical notes that should normally be played for a particular piece of music)
trans_examp.trans_cn: 临时变音记号，临时升降号

dsense.name: accidental
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a bird that is found in a place where birds of its type are not usually found
trans_examp.trans_cn: 出现在非通常栖息地的鸟

example.eg: You may spot accidentals driven in by the stormy weather.
example.egtrans: 你可能会观察到一些鸟因为恶劣天气而被迫飞到它们通常不会出现的地方。

accidentally.name: accidentally
accidentally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: by chance or by mistake

example.eg: I accidentally knocked a glass over.
example.egtrans: 我不小心打翻了一个杯子。

accomplish.name: accomplish
accomplish.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to finish something successfully or to achieve something

example.eg: The students accomplished the task in less than ten minutes.
example.egtrans: 学生们不到10分钟就完成了任务。

example.eg: She accomplished such a lot during her visit.
example.egtrans: 她在访问期间取得了丰硕的成果。

example.eg: I feel as if I've accomplished nothing since I left my job.
example.egtrans: 我觉得辞掉工作以后就一直在虚度光阴。

accordion.name: accordion
accordion.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a box-shaped musical instrument consisting of a folded central part with a keyboard, played by pushing the two ends towards each other

accumulate.name: accumulate
accumulate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to collect a large number of things over a long period of time

example.eg: As people accumulate more wealth, they tend to spend a greater proportion of their incomes.
example.egtrans: 人们积累了更多财富后，他们的花费占收入的比重也往往会增加。

example.eg: The company said the debt was accumulated during its acquisition of nine individual businesses.
example.egtrans: 该公司称其在收购9家个体公司的过程中，债务越积越多。

example.eg: We've accumulated so much rubbish over the years.
example.egtrans: 多年来我们已经堆积了这么多的垃圾。

trans_examp.trans_en: to gradually increase in number or amount

example.eg: A thick layer of dust had accumulated in the room.
example.egtrans: 房间里积了厚厚一层灰尘。

example.eg: If you don't go through the papers on your desk on a regular basis, they just keep on accumulating.
example.egtrans: 如果你不去定期整理办公桌上的文件，它们就会越积越多。

accuracy.name: accuracy
accuracy.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of being exact or correct

example.eg: We can predict changes with a surprising degree of accuracy.
example.egtrans: 我们可以出奇准确地预测变化。

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability to do something without making mistakes

action.name: action
action.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: action
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of doing something, especially when dealing with a problem or difficulty
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指应对问题或困难的）行动；行动过程；行为

example.eg: This problem calls for swift/prompt action from the government.
example.egtrans: 这一问题需要政府马上采取行动。

example.eg: Action to prevent the spread of the disease is high on the government's agenda.
example.egtrans: 采取行动防止疾病蔓延是政府的当务之急。

example.eg: We must take action (= do something) to deal with the problem before it spreads to other areas.
example.egtrans: 在这一问题蔓延到其他地区之前我们一定要采取行动将其解决。

example.eg: So what's the plan of action? (= What are we going to do?)
example.egtrans: 那么行动计划是什么？

example.eg: The complaints system swings into action (= starts to work) as soon as a claim is made.
example.egtrans: 一旦有人提出索赔，马上启动投诉处理系统。

example.eg: The committee was spurred into action (= encouraged to do something) by the threat of government cuts.
example.egtrans: 政府威胁要削减经费，这促使委员会采取了行动。

dsense.name: action
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you do

example.eg: She has to accept the consequences of her actions.
example.egtrans: 她必须对自己行为的后果负责。

example.eg: I asked him to explain his actions.
example.egtrans: 我要求他为自己的所作所为作出解释。

trans_examp.trans_en: a physical movement

example.eg: I'll say the words and you can mime the actions.
example.egtrans: 我会说出这些词，你可以做动作把它们的意思表达出来。

example.eg: It only needs a small wrist action (= movement of the wrist) to start the process.
example.egtrans: 只需动一动手腕，程序就启动了。

dsense.name: action
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: things that are happening, especially exciting or important things
trans_examp.trans_cn: 发生的事情；（尤指）令人激动的事或大事

example.eg: I like movies with a lot of action.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢情节紧凑的影片。

example.eg: In her last novel, the action (= the main events) moves between Greece and southern Spain.
example.egtrans: 在她最近发表的那本小说里，故事情节在希腊和西班牙南部交替展开。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: at the place where something important or interesting is happening
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 大事（或趣事）发生的地方

example.eg: A journalist has to be where the action is.
example.egtrans: 记者必须要身临事件的现场。

dsense.name: action
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the effect something has on another thing

example.eg: They recorded the action of the drug on the nervous system.
example.egtrans: 他们记录下了这种药物对神经系统的作用。

dsense.name: action
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: fighting in a war

example.eg: Her younger son was killed in action.
example.egtrans: 她的小儿子在战斗中阵亡。

example.eg: He was reported missing in action.
example.egtrans: 报告称他在战斗中失踪了。

example.eg: He saw action (= fought as a soldier) in the trenches.
example.egtrans: 他参加了堑壕战。

dsense.name: action
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way something moves or works

example.eg: We studied the action of the digestive system.
example.egtrans: 我们研究了消化系统的机能。

example.eg: The car has a very smooth braking action.
example.egtrans: 这辆轿车刹车性能很平稳。

dsense.name: action
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a legal process that is decided in a law court

example.eg: a libel action
example.egtrans: 诽谤诉讼

example.eg: She brought an action (for negligence) against the hospital.
example.egtrans: 她起诉医院（玩忽职守）。

example.eg: A criminal action was brought against him.
example.egtrans: 他被提起刑事诉讼。

example.eg: The book was halted in South Africa by a threat of legal action.
example.egtrans: 因为遭到起诉的威胁，该书在南非停止发行。

action.name: action
action.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to do something to deal with a particular problem or matter
trans_examp.trans_cn: 对…采取行动；就…采取措施

example.eg: I'll just run through the minutes of the last meeting, raising those points that still have to be actioned.
example.egtrans: 下面我将扼要重述一下上次会议的记录，把亟待处理的问题提出来。

actual.name: actual
actual.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing in fact
trans_examp.trans_cn: 现实的，实际的；真实的，真正的

example.eg: We had estimated about 300 visitors, but the actual number was much higher.
example.egtrans: 我们估计大约会有300名来宾，可实到人数要多得多。

example.eg: The exams are in July, but the actual results (= the results themselves) don't appear until September.
example.egtrans: 考试是在7月份，但是真正成绩公布要等到9月份。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: really

example.eg: I thought she was Portuguese, but in actual fact she's Brazilian.
example.egtrans: 我以为她是葡萄牙人，可实际上她是巴西人。

actually.name: actually
actually.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: actually
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in fact or really

example.eg: I didn't actually see her - I just heard her voice.
example.egtrans: 实际上我并没有看见她，只是听到了她的声音。

example.eg: So what actually happened?
example.egtrans: 那么到底发生了什么事呢？

dsense.name: actually
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used in sentences in which there is information that is in some way surprising or the opposite of what most people would expect
trans_examp.trans_cn: （表示意外或与通常预期的相反）居然，竟然

example.eg: I didn't like him at first, but in the end I actually got quite fond of him.
example.egtrans: 起初我对他并没有好感，可最后我竟然挺喜欢他的。

example.eg: I'm one of the few people who doesn't actually like champagne.
example.egtrans: 有个别人还真是不喜欢香槟酒，我就是其中之一。

example.eg: Don't tell me he actually paid for you!
example.egtrans: 别跟我说他居然替你付了钱！

dsense.name: actually
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used as a way of making a sentence slightly more polite, for example when you are expressing an opposing opinion, correcting what someone else has said, or refusing an offer
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于礼貌地表示反对、纠正他人或拒绝他人提议等）其实，说实话，实际上

example.eg: "Alexander looks like he'd be good at sports." "Actually, he's not."
example.egtrans: “亚历山大看上去很擅长运动。”“事实并非如此。”

example.eg: Actually, Gavin, it was Tuesday of last week, not Wednesday.
example.egtrans: 实际上呢，加文，那是上星期二，不是星期三。

example.eg: "Do you mind if I smoke?" "Well, actually, I'd rather you didn't."
example.egtrans: “我抽支烟你介意吗？”“嗯，说实话，我希望你还是别抽。”

additional.name: additional
additional.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: extra
trans_examp.trans_cn: 外加的，附加的；额外的；另外的

example.eg: additional costs/problems
example.egtrans: 额外的费用／另外的问题

example.eg: There will be an extra charge for any additional passengers.
example.egtrans: 如额外再上乘客，将会加收费用。

adhere.name: adhere
adhere.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stick firmly

example.eg: A smooth, dry surface helps the tiles adhere to the wall.
example.egtrans: 平滑、干燥的墙面有助于瓷砖粘在墙上。

adjust.name: adjust
adjust.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: adjust
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change something slightly, especially to make it more correct, effective, or suitable
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指为了使某物更正确、有效或合适而）调整；调节

example.eg: If the chair is too high you can adjust it to suit you.
example.egtrans: 如果椅子太高了，你可以把它调到适合你的高度。

example.eg: As a teacher you have to adjust your methods to suit the needs of slower children.
example.egtrans: 作为一名老师，你必须调整教学方法来适应那些学得较慢的孩子的需要。

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange your clothing to make yourself look tidy

example.eg: She adjusted her skirt, took a deep breath, and walked into the room.
example.egtrans: 她整了整裙子，深吸一口气，走进了房间。

dsense.name: adjust
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to become more familiar with a new situation

example.eg: I can't adjust to living on my own.
example.egtrans: 我不习惯独自生活。

example.eg: Her eyes slowly adjusted to the dark.
example.egtrans: 她的眼睛慢慢适应了黑暗。

example.eg: The lifestyle is so very different - it takes a while to adjust.
example.egtrans: 生活方式差别太大了，得过一段时间才能适应。

admirable.name: admirable
admirable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: deserving respect or approval
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可钦佩的；值得羡慕的；令人赞赏的

example.eg: I think you showed admirable tact/restraint/self-control in your answer.
example.egtrans: 我认为你在回答问题时表现出的机敏／克制／自控令人敬佩。

example.eg: The police did an admirable job in keeping the fans calm.
example.egtrans: 警方在控制球迷们的激动情绪方面表现可嘉。

affect.name: affect
affect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: affect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an influence on someone or something, or to cause a change in someone or something

example.eg: Both buildings were badly affected by the fire.
example.egtrans: 两座楼都在大火中严重受损。

example.eg: The divorce affected every aspect of her life.
example.egtrans: 离婚使她生活的各个方面都受到了影响。

example.eg: It's a disease that affects mainly older people.
example.egtrans: 这是一种主要侵扰老年人的疾病。

example.eg: I was deeply affected by the film (= it caused strong feelings in me).
example.egtrans: 我被电影深深地打动了。

dsense.name: affect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pretend to feel or think something

example.eg: To all his problems she affected indifference.
example.egtrans: 对他所有的问题，她都装作漠不关心的样子。

trans_examp.trans_en: to start to wear or do something in order to make people admire or respect you
trans_examp.trans_cn: （为引人注意或自抬身价而）刻意穿戴，故作

example.eg: At university he affected an upper-class accent.
example.egtrans: 在大学里他拿腔捏调假装上流社会口音。

example.eg: He's recently affected a hat and cane.
example.egtrans: 近来，他头上戴了顶帽子，手上拿了根拐杖，装腔作势起来。

affected.name: affected
affected.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: artificial and not sincere
trans_examp.trans_cn: 矫揉造作的，做作的，装模作样的；不自然的

example.eg: an affected manner/style of writing
example.egtrans: 矫揉造作的行为/文风

example.eg: I found her very affected.
example.egtrans: 我觉得她非常做作。

against.name: against
against.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: disagreeing with a plan or activity

example.eg: She spoke against the decision to close the college.
example.egtrans: 她声言反对关闭学院的决定。

example.eg: 50 people voted against the new proposal.
example.egtrans: 50人投票反对这一新提案。

example.eg: I'm very much against the idea that it is the woman's job to bring up the child.
example.egtrans: 对于抚养孩子是女人的活儿这一想法，我坚决反对。

example.eg: Germany are playing against Brazil in the cup final tonight.
example.egtrans: 德国队在今晚的决赛中对阵巴西队。

example.eg: She's always rebelled against authority.
example.egtrans: 她总是对抗权威。

example.eg: She sold the house even though it was against his wishes.
example.egtrans: 她卖掉了房子，尽管这违背了他的愿望。

example.eg: They called a demonstration to protest against proposed job cuts.
example.egtrans: 他们召集了示威游行来抗议削减工作机会的提议。

example.eg: Are you for or against my proposal?
example.egtrans: 你赞成还是反对我的提议？

example.eg: Sanctions against the country should be lifted.
example.egtrans: 应该取消对这个国家的制裁。

example.eg: Stricter controls will help in the fight against inflation.
example.egtrans: 更加严厉的调控措施将有助于抑制通货膨胀。

example.eg: Criminal charges will be brought against the driver.
example.egtrans: 将对司机提起刑事诉讼。

example.eg: They decided not to take legal action against him.
example.egtrans: 他们决定不起诉他。

example.eg: They were up against a powerful pressure group.
example.egtrans: 他们面临一个强大的压力集团。

example.eg: We came up against a lot of problems in the course of building our extension.
example.egtrans: 我们在扩建过程中遇到好多问题。

example.eg: The chances/odds against you winning such a competition are enormous.
example.egtrans: 你赢得这样一场比赛的可能性极小。

example.eg: It's against the law (= illegal) to leave children under a certain age alone in the house.
example.egtrans: 将某个年龄以下的孩子单独留在家里是违法的。

example.eg: It's against my beliefs/principles to be nice to someone I dislike just because they're in a senior position.
example.egtrans: 对于我厌恶的人，我不会仅仅因为他比我职位高就对其和颜悦色，这有违我的处世原则。

example.eg: Against all probability (= although it was extremely unlikely) we found ourselves in the same hotel.
example.egtrans: 不可思议的是，我们发现自己竟然住进了同一家旅馆。

example.eg: I wouldn't dare say anything against him (= criticize him) to his mother!
example.egtrans: 我不敢对他妈妈说他的坏话！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you have something against someone, you dislike them for a reason.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 因（某种原因）不喜欢（某人）

example.eg: I've nothing against him - I just don't have much in common with him.
example.egtrans: 我一点都不讨厌他，只是和他没有太多相似之处。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something counts/goes/works against you, it gives you a disadvantage.

example.eg: Lack of experience will generally count against you in an interview.
example.egtrans: 一般而言，缺乏工作经验会成为面试的不利因素。

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: next to and touching or being supported by (something)

example.eg: Why don't we put the bed against the wall?
example.egtrans: 为什么不把床紧靠墙放呢？

example.eg: He loved the feel of her soft hair against his skin.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢她那柔滑的头发贴着他的肌肤的感觉。

example.eg: The rain beat against her face as she struggled through the wind.
example.egtrans: 她在风雨中艰难行进，雨水打在她的脸上。

example.eg: The police officer had him up against the wall, both arms behind his back.
example.egtrans: 警察把他双手别在身后按到墙上。

example.eg: She leaned against the door.
example.egtrans: 她倚着门。

trans_examp.trans_en: in front of or compared to
trans_examp.trans_cn: 以…为背景；以…作衬托；和…对照

example.eg: Paintings look best against a simple white wall.
example.egtrans: 画挂在没有任何装饰的白墙上看上去效果最好。

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the opposite direction to

example.eg: The last part of the course was hard because I was running against the wind.
example.egtrans: 最后一段赛程很艰难，因为我是顶风跑。

example.eg: Commuting is not so bad when you are travelling against the traffic.
example.egtrans: 如果你是逆着主车流而行，乘车上下班倒也不错。

dsense.name: against
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: as a protection or defence from the bad effects of

example.eg: We've insured the car against fire, theft, and accident.
example.egtrans: 我们给车上了火灾险、窃盗险和交通事故险。

example.eg: The police have to arm themselves against attack.
example.egtrans: 警察必须得配备武器以防受到攻击。

ahead.name: ahead
ahead.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: ahead
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in front

example.eg: The road ahead is very busy.
example.egtrans: 前面路上很拥挤。

example.eg: Turn left at the traffic lights, and you'll see the hospital straight ahead.
example.egtrans: 在交通灯那儿左转，正前方就是医院，你一眼就能看见。

example.eg: Rick walked on ahead of us.
example.egtrans: 里克走在我们前面。

example.eg: You go on ahead of (= before) me, and I'll meet you there.
example.egtrans: 你先走，我们在那儿会合。

trans_examp.trans_en: having more points, votes, etc. than someone else in a competition, election, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在比赛或竞争中）领先，占优势

example.eg: Apparently, the latest opinion polls put the Democrats 15 percent ahead of the Republicans.
example.egtrans: 据最近的一次民意测验显示，民主党领先了共和党15个百分点。

example.eg: Barcelona was ahead after ten minutes.
example.egtrans: 10分钟后巴塞罗那队领先。

trans_examp.trans_en: making more progress than someone else

example.eg: Sophie is way (= far) ahead of the other children in her class.
example.egtrans: 索菲的成绩远远超过班上其他孩子。

dsense.name: ahead
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or into the future

example.eg: She has a difficult time ahead of her.
example.egtrans: 以后她会面临一段艰难的日子。

example.eg: He couldn't bear to think of the lonely year ahead.
example.egtrans: 今后一年要一个人孤零零地度过，他一想到这个就受不了。

alert.name: alert
alert.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: quick to see, understand, and act in a particular situation

example.eg: I'm not feeling very alert today - not enough sleep last night!
example.egtrans: 今天我感觉特迟钝——昨晚没睡好！

example.eg: A couple of alert readers posted comments on the website pointing out the mistake.
example.egtrans: 有几个眼尖的读者在网上发表评论，指出了这个错误。

example.eg: Parents should be alert to sudden changes in children's behaviour.
example.egtrans: 父母应该对孩子行为的突然变化有所警觉。

alert.name: alert
alert.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a warning to people to be prepared to deal with something dangerous

example.eg: a bomb alert
example.egtrans: 炸弹警报

example.eg: The army was put on (full) alert as the peace talks began to fail.
example.egtrans: 当和谈开始破裂的时候，军队进入（全面）戒备状态。

example.eg: The public were warned to be on the alert for (= watching carefully for) suspicious packages.
example.egtrans: 有关部门提醒公众，要警惕可疑包裹。

alert.name: alert
alert.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to warn someone of a possibly dangerous situation
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使警觉，使警惕；向…发出警报

example.eg: An anonymous letter alerted police to the possibility of a terrorist attack at the airport.
example.egtrans: 有人给警察写了一封匿名信，警告机场可能会受到恐怖袭击。

algebraic.name: algebraic
algebraic.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to algebra

example.eg: algebraic numbers/equations
example.egtrans: 代数数字/代数方程

example.eg: For the eleven- to thirteen-year-olds, teachers need to build algebraic and geometric thinking.
example.egtrans: 对于11至13岁的孩子，教师需要培养代数和几何思维。

algorithm.name: algorithm
algorithm.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of mathematical instructions or rules that, especially if given to a computer, will help to calculate an answer to a problem
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指计算机使用的）算法，计算程序

example.eg: Music apps use algorithms to predict the probability that fans of one particular band will like another.
example.egtrans: 音乐应用程序使用算法来预测一个特定乐队的粉丝喜欢另一个乐队的概率。

alias.name: alias
alias.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: used when giving the name that a person is generally known by, after giving their real name

example.eg: Malcolm Little, alias Malcolm X
example.egtrans: 他名为Malcolm Litt，也称Malcolm X。

alias.name: alias
alias.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a false name, especially one used by a criminal

example.eg: He travels under (= using) an alias.
example.egtrans: 他使用化名旅行。

alleviate.name: alleviate
alleviate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something bad such as pain or problems less severe

example.eg: The drugs did nothing to alleviate her pain/suffering.
example.egtrans: 这些药物对减轻她的病痛／痛苦没有丝毫作用。

allowed.name: allow
allowed.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: allow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give permission for someone to do something, or to not prevent something from happening
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使有可能；允许，准许；容许

example.eg: Do you think Dad will allow you to go to Jamie's party?
example.egtrans: 你认为爸爸会允许你去参加杰米的聚会吗？

example.eg: You're not allowed to talk during the exam.
example.egtrans: 考试期间不许交谈。

example.eg: Her proposals would allow (= make it possible for) more people to stay in full-time education.
example.egtrans: 她的提议会使更多的人能够继续接受全日制教育。

example.eg: The loophole has allowed hundreds of drink-drivers to avoid prosecution.
example.egtrans: 这个法律漏洞使得数以百计的酒后驾车者钻了空子，逃避了起诉。

example.eg: The government has refused to allow foreign journalists into the area for several weeks.
example.egtrans: 该政府禁止外国记者进入这个地区已经有好几周了。

example.eg: Prisoners have been moved to allow the demolition of part of the prison.
example.egtrans: 犯人已经转移走了，以便拆除监狱的一部分。

example.eg: Pets aren't allowed in this hotel.
example.egtrans: 这个旅馆不准许将宠物带入。

example.eg: Smoking is not allowed in this restaurant.
example.egtrans: 这个饭店内不许抽烟。

example.eg: He didn't allow us enough time to finish the test.
example.egtrans: 他没有给我们留足够的时间完成测验。

example.eg: Red Cross officials were allowed access to the prison for the first time a few days ago.
example.egtrans: 几天前，红十字会的官员首次获准进入该监狱。

example.eg: The referee decided to allow (= officially accept) the goal.
example.egtrans: 裁判判定该进球有效。

example.eg: At the weekend I allow myself (= I give myself the special pleasure of having) a box of chocolates.
example.egtrans: 每逢周末我给自己开戒，吃一盒巧克力。

example.eg: How much time do you allow yourself (= make available to yourself) to get ready in the morning?
example.egtrans: 早晨你给自己留出多少时间来准备？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a polite expression used when offering to help in some way

example.eg: You can't carry all those bags yourself - please, allow me.
example.egtrans: 那些袋子你自己拎不了——我来帮你吧。

dsense.name: allow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to admit or agree that something is true

example.eg: She allowed that she might have been too suspicious.
example.egtrans: 她承认自己可能太多心了。

almost.name: almost
almost.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: nearly
trans_examp.trans_cn: 几乎，差不多，差一点，将近

example.eg: She's almost 30.
example.egtrans: 她差不多快30了。

example.eg: It was almost six o'clock when he left.
example.egtrans: 他离开时将近6点了。

example.eg: I almost wish I hadn't invited him.
example.egtrans: 我甚至有点希望自己没邀请他。

example.eg: It'll cost almost as much to repair it as it would to buy a new one.
example.egtrans: 修理要花的钱差不多都可以买个新的了。

example.eg: Almost all the passengers on the ferry were French.
example.egtrans: 渡船上的乘客几乎都是法国人。

example.eg: They'll almost certainly forget to do it.
example.egtrans: 几乎可以肯定他们会忘记做这件事的。

example.eg: The town was almost entirely destroyed during the war.
example.egtrans: 战争期间，这个城市几乎完全被夷为平地。

example.eg: We were bitten by mosquitoes almost every night.
example.egtrans: 几乎每天晚上我们都挨蚊子叮。

example.eg: The boat sank almost immediately after it had struck the rock.
example.egtrans: 船撞到岩石上，几乎一瞬间就沉了。

example.eg: Most artists find it almost impossible to make a living from art alone.
example.egtrans: 多数艺术家发现几乎不可能只靠艺术谋生。

alongside.name: alongside
alongside.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: next to, or together with

example.eg: A car pulled up alongside (ours).
example.egtrans: 一辆车开过来停在（我们车的）旁边。

example.eg: The new pill will be used alongside existing medicines.
example.egtrans: 这种新药将配合现有药物一起服用。

example.eg: Most of the staff refused to work alongside the new team.
example.egtrans: 大多数职员拒绝和这个新团队一起工作。

example.eg: The UK fought alongside France, Turkey, and Sardinia during the Crimean War.
example.egtrans: 在克里米亚战争中，英国和法国、土耳其以及撒丁王国并肩作战。

alpha.name: alpha
alpha.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the first letter of the Greek alphabet
trans_examp.trans_cn: （希腊语字母表的第一个字母）

alpha.name: alpha
alpha.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: alpha
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Alpha software is at the first stage of development.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 初期的（用来描述在研发初阶的软件）

example.eg: an alpha version of the program
example.egtrans: 该程序研发初期版本

dsense.name: alpha
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe someone who is strong or powerful, and who likes to be in charge of others
trans_examp.trans_cn: 主导型人格；阿尔法人格

example.eg: She demonstrated a knack for managing the difficult alpha personalities on her team.
example.egtrans: 对于管理团队中那些难以相处的阿尔法性格的人，她特别有一套。

alphanumeric.name: alphanumeric
alphanumeric.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: containing or using letters of the alphabet and also numbers
trans_examp.trans_cn: 包含字母和数字的，字母和数字一起使用的

example.eg: alphanumeric characters
example.egtrans: 文字数字式字符

alternate.name: alternate
alternate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to happen or exist one after the other repeatedly

example.eg: She alternated between cheerfulness and deep despair.
example.egtrans: 她时而情绪亢奋，时而又深陷绝望之中。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something happen or exist one after the other repeatedly

example.eg: He alternated working in the office with long tours overseas.
example.egtrans: 他在办公室工作一段时间后就会安排一次海外长途旅行。

alternate.name: alternate
alternate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: with first one thing, then another thing, and then the first thing again

example.eg: a dessert with alternate layers of chocolate and cream
example.egtrans: 巧克力和奶油层叠的甜点

trans_examp.trans_en: If something happens on alternate days, it happens every second day.

example.eg: Private cars are banned from the city on alternate days.
example.egtrans: 该市私家车限隔日出行。

trans_examp.trans_en: An alternate plan or method is one that you can use if you do not want to use another one.

alternate.name: alternate
alternate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person or thing that can take the place of another

example.eg: David was too sick to attend, so Janet served as his alternate.
example.egtrans: 戴维重病不能出席，珍妮特作为他的替代者参加。

alternative.name: alternative
alternative.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: An alternative plan or method is one that you can use if you do not want to use another one.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （计划或方法）可替代的；可供选择的

example.eg: The opposition parties have so far failed to set out an alternative strategy.
example.egtrans: 反对党到目前为止还没有提出其他的策略。

example.eg: An alternative venue for the concert is being sought.
example.egtrans: 正在寻找其他可举办音乐会的地方。

trans_examp.trans_en: Alternative things are considered to be unusual and often have a small but enthusiastic group of people who support them.

example.eg: alternative comedy
example.egtrans: 另类喜剧

alternative.name: alternative
alternative.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is different from something else, especially from what is usual, and offering the possibility of choice
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指不同于平常事物的）可供选择的事物；可供选择的解决办法

example.eg: an alternative to coffee
example.egtrans: 咖啡代用品

example.eg: There must be an alternative to people sleeping on the streets.
example.egtrans: 一定要想法解决街头露宿者的问题。

example.eg: I'm afraid I have no alternative but to ask you to leave (= that is what I have to do).
example.egtrans: 恐怕我别无选择，只有让你离开。

alternatively.name: alternatively
alternatively.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to suggest another possibility
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用来建议别种可能性）要不，或者

example.eg: We could go to the Indian restaurant, or alternatively, we could try that new Italian place.
example.egtrans: 我们可以去那家印度餐馆，要不，也可以到那家新开的意大利餐馆尝尝。

altogether.name: altogether
altogether.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in total

example.eg: That'll be $52.50 altogether, please.
example.egtrans: 一共是52.5英镑。

trans_examp.trans_en: completely

example.eg: The government ought to abolish the tax altogether.
example.egtrans: 政府应该彻底取消这一税收。

example.eg: She wrote less and less often, and eventually she stopped altogether.
example.egtrans: 她动笔的次数越来越少，最后完全停笔了。

example.eg: It's all right working with him, but living with him would be a different matter altogether.
example.egtrans: 跟他一起工作还可以，但跟他一起生活可完全是另外一码事。

example.eg: I'm not altogether sure I want that (= I have doubts about it).
example.egtrans: 我不能完全肯定我想要那个。

example.eg: I think Graham will agree, but convincing Mary will be altogether more (= much more) difficult.
example.egtrans: 我觉得格雷厄姆会同意，但要说服玛丽就肯定难多了。

trans_examp.trans_en: considering everything

example.eg: He's bad-tempered, selfish, and altogether an unpleasant man.
example.egtrans: 他脾气暴躁，自私自利，总之很令人讨厌。

altogether.name: altogether
altogether.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be naked

ambient.name: ambient
ambient.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of environmental conditions) existing in the surrounding area
trans_examp.trans_cn: 周围的；（尤指）周围环境条件的

example.eg: ambient conditions/lighting/noise/temperature
example.egtrans: 周围环境／光照／噪声／温度

ancestor.name: ancestor
ancestor.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person related to you who lived a long time ago

example.eg: There were portraits of his ancestors on the walls of the room.
example.egtrans: 房间墙壁上挂着他祖先的画像。

trans_examp.trans_en: a plant, animal, or object that is related to one existing at a later point in time

example.eg: This wooden instrument is the ancestor of the modern metal flute.
example.egtrans: 这种木质乐器是现代金属长笛的雏形。

angle bracket.name: angle bracket
angle bracket.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the symbol < or >, found on a computer keyboard and used, for example, around tags (= codes for marking particular types of information)

annotate.name: annotate
annotate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to add a short explanation or opinion to a text or drawing

example.eg: Annotated editions of Shakespeare's plays help readers to understand old words.
example.egtrans: 莎士比亚剧作的注释本可以帮助读者理解剧中较古老的词语。

anonymous.name: anonymous
anonymous.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: made or done by someone whose name is not known or not made public
trans_examp.trans_cn: 匿名的；不知姓名的；名字不公开的

example.eg: The money was donated by an anonymous benefactor.
example.egtrans: 这笔钱来自一位不愿透露姓名的捐赠者。

example.eg: Police said an anonymous caller warned that a bomb was about to go off.
example.egtrans: 警方说有人打来匿名电话，警告一枚炸弹即将爆炸。

example.eg: An attempt to implant an embryo using an egg from an anonymous woman donor was unsuccessful.
example.egtrans: 用一位匿名女性捐献的卵子来植入胚胎的尝试未获成功。

example.eg: He received an anonymous letter threatening to disclose details of his affair if he didn't pay the money.
example.egtrans: 他收到一封匿名信，威胁说如果他不付钱，就把他的风流韵事都抖搂出来。

example.eg: For reasons of personal safety, the informant wishes to remain anonymous.
example.egtrans: 为了自身安全，举报人不希望透露姓名。

trans_examp.trans_en: having no unusual or interesting features
trans_examp.trans_cn: 无特色的，无个性特征的

example.eg: He has a rather anonymous face.
example.egtrans: 他相貌平平。

anymore.name: anymore
anymore.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you do not do something or something does not happen anymore, you have stopped doing it or it does not now happen.

example.eg: I don't do yoga anymore.
example.egtrans: 我不再做瑜伽了。

anyway.name: anyway
anyway.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: whatever else is happening, without considering other things
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不管怎样；无论如何；仍然

example.eg: Of course I don't mind taking you home - I'm going that way anyway.
example.egtrans: 我当然可以把你送回家——反正我也是顺路。

example.eg: "I thought you said everyone had left." "Well, some of them have anyway."
example.egtrans: “你不是说所有人都走了？”“噢，反正有些人已经走了。”

example.eg: Her parents were opposed to her giving up her course, but she did it anyway.
example.egtrans: 她父母反对她放弃学业，但她还是没有听。

trans_examp.trans_en: In conversation, anyway is also used to change the subject, return to an earlier subject, or get to the most interesting point.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于谈话中表示改变话题、回到原来说的话题或者即将谈到最有趣的一点）对了，好吧，无论如何，反正

example.eg: Anyway, as I said, I'll be away next week.
example.egtrans: 好了，我说过了，我下周就要离开了。

example.eg: Anyway, in the end I didn't wear your jacket.
example.egtrans: 不管怎么说，我终究也没有穿你的夹克。

example.eg: What was he doing with so much of the company's money in his personal account anyway?
example.egtrans: 他把那么多的公司资金存在他个人账户里到底是在搞什么名堂？

trans_examp.trans_en: used to give a more important reason for something that you are saying
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于谈话中表示强调正在说的话）而且，加之，到底

example.eg: I don't have time to go, and anyway it's too expensive.
example.egtrans: 我没有时间去，再说，也太贵了。

appear.name: appear
appear.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to start to be seen or to be present

example.eg: He suddenly appeared in the doorway.
example.egtrans: 他突然出现在门口。

example.eg: We'd been in the house a month when dark stains started appearing on the wall.
example.egtrans: 墙上开始出现一些深色的斑迹时，我们在这幢房子里已经住了一个月。

example.eg: His name appears in the film credits for lighting.
example.egtrans: 他作为灯光师出现在电影演职人员名单中。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you appear in court, you are there officially because you are involved in a trial.

example.eg: Both women will be appearing before magistrates later this week.
example.egtrans: 本周晚些时候这两名妇女都将在地方法院出庭。

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to seem

example.eg: You've got to appear (to be) calm in an interview even if you're terrified underneath.
example.egtrans: 在面试时，即使内心很怕，也要显出很镇定的样子。

example.eg: To people who don't know him he probably appears (to be) rather unfriendly.
example.egtrans: 在不了解他的人看来，他可能很不友好。

example.eg: Things aren't always what they appear to be.
example.egtrans: 事情并不总像表面看上去的那样。

example.eg: She appears to actually like the man, which I find incredible.
example.egtrans: 她好像真的很喜欢那个男的，这让我觉得难以置信。

example.eg: There appears to be some mistake.
example.egtrans: 好像出了什么错误。

example.eg: It appears (that) she left the party alone.
example.egtrans: 好像她独自离开了聚会。

example.eg: It appears to me (that) (= I think that) we need to make some changes.
example.egtrans: 在我看来，我们要作些变动。

example.eg: It would appear (that) (= it seems that) nobody on board the aircraft actually had a licence to fly it.
example.egtrans: 事实上好像飞机上的所有人都没有飞行执照。

example.eg: It appears as if/as though I was wrong.
example.egtrans: 好像我错了似的。

example.eg: Everything was not as it appeared - secret deals had been done.
example.egtrans: 一切并非看上去的那样——实际上有暗箱交易。

example.eg: I know how it must appear, but it's not really as bad as it looks.
example.egtrans: 我知道看起来会是个什么样子，但实际上也并不像看上去的那么糟糕。

example.eg: "Has he left?" "It appears not/so."
example.egtrans: “他走了吗？”“好像没有／是的。”

example.eg: "I think we're late." "So it appears."
example.egtrans: “我想我们迟到了。”“看来是的。”

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to perform publicly in a play, film, or show

example.eg: She will be appearing in the latest adaptation of "Bleak House".
example.egtrans: 她将在《荒凉山庄》最新的改编版本中出演角色。

example.eg: She appears briefly in the new Bond film.
example.egtrans: 她在新的007电影中有几个镜头。

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to start to exist or become available

example.eg: I've noticed that smaller cars are starting to appear (= be produced or sold) again.
example.egtrans: 我注意到小型轿车又开始出现了。

example.eg: The film, currently showing in the States, will be appearing on our screens (= we will be able to see it) later this year.
example.egtrans: 这部正在美国上映的电影今年晚些时候将在我国播映。

dsense.name: appear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrive

example.eg: If she hasn't appeared by ten o'clock I'm going without her.
example.egtrans: 她要是10点钟还到不了，我就自己去了。

appearance.name: appearance
appearance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: appearance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when someone appears in public

example.eg: It was his first appearance on television/television appearance as president.
example.egtrans: 这是他就任总统以来首次在电视上亮相。

example.eg: She will be making a public appearance, signing copies of her latest novel.
example.egtrans: 她将公开亮相，为自己刚刚出版的小说签名售书。

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when someone goes to court to be officially involved in a trial

example.eg: This was the defendant's third court appearance for the same offence.
example.egtrans: 这是被告因为同一桩罪行第三次出庭受审。

trans_examp.trans_en: a public performance by an entertainer

example.eg: He made his first stage/TV appearance at the age of six.
example.egtrans: 在6岁时他首次登台演出／在电视上亮相。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be present somewhere for a short time
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 露一下面；到场稍作停留

example.eg: I didn't really want to go to the party, but I thought I'd better put in an appearance.
example.egtrans: 我真不想参加这个聚会，但是我想还是露个面的好。

dsense.name: appearance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way a person or thing looks to other people

example.eg: a middle-aged man of smart appearance
example.egtrans: 一个外表整洁的中年男子

example.eg: You can alter/change the whole appearance of a room just by lighting it in a certain way.
example.egtrans: 只要在灯光上做些文章，整个房间面貌就会焕然一新。

example.eg: There was nothing unusual about/in her physical appearance.
example.egtrans: 她的外表并没有什么特别之处。

example.eg: The large car outside the house gave the appearance of wealth (= suggested wealthy people lived there).
example.egtrans: 住宅外面停的那辆大轿车显示出主人很富有。

example.eg: Appearances can be deceptive.
example.egtrans: 人不可貌相。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: what things look like or seem to be rather than what they actually are

example.eg: He was a far more complicated man than outward appearances suggested.
example.egtrans: 他这个人实际上很难懂，与其外表相去甚远。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: judging from what can be seen

example.eg: To all appearances their marriage is fine, but I think she gives him a bad time in private.
example.egtrans: 从表面看他们的婚姻很美满，但我觉得在私下里她不会给他好日子过。

Applicable.name: applicable
Applicable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: affecting or relating to a person or thing

example.eg: This part of the law is only applicable to companies employing more than five people.
example.egtrans: 该法律这一部分条款仅适用于有5名以上雇员的公司。

example.eg: The new qualifications are applicable to all European countries.
example.egtrans: 新的限定性条件适用于所有欧洲国家。

apply.name: apply
apply.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: apply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to request something, usually officially, especially in writing or by sending in a form
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指通过书面或表格形式）申请，请求

example.eg: By the time I saw the job advertised it was already too late to apply.
example.egtrans: 我看到招聘广告的时候，已经太晚了，错过了应聘时机。

example.eg: I've applied for a new job with the local newspaper.
example.egtrans: 我已经申请了地方报纸的一个职位。

example.eg: Please apply in writing to the address below.
example.egtrans: 请将书面申请寄到以下地址。

example.eg: We've applied to a charitable organization for a grant for the project.
example.egtrans: 我们已经向一家慈善组织提出申请，请求其对这个项目提供资助。

example.eg: Mandy applied to join the police.
example.egtrans: 曼蒂已报名做警察。

dsense.name: apply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of rules or laws) to have a connection or be important
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指规章法律）适用，有关，涉及

example.eg: That part of the form is for UK citizens - it doesn't apply to you.
example.egtrans: 表格的那一项是给英国公民填的——和你无关。

example.eg: Those were old regulations - they don't apply any more.
example.egtrans: 那些都是旧规定，不再适用了。

dsense.name: apply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make use of something or use it for a practical purpose

example.eg: He wants a job in which he can apply his foreign languages.
example.egtrans: 他想找一份工作，可以用到他的多门外语知识。

example.eg: The court heard how the driver had failed to apply his brakes in time.
example.egtrans: 法庭听司机陈述了他如何没能及时刹车的原委。

example.eg: If you apply pressure to a cut it's meant to stop the bleeding.
example.egtrans: 如果你按压住伤口，就会止住流血。

dsense.name: apply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spread or rub a substance such as cream or paint on a surface

example.eg: Apply the cream liberally to exposed areas every three hours and after swimming.
example.egtrans: 每3小时及游泳后将防晒霜充分涂抹于身体裸露部位。

example.eg: The paint should be applied thinly and evenly.
example.egtrans: 漆应该薄薄地刷上一层，且要刷得均匀。

dsense.name: apply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you apply yourself to something, you work hard at it, directing your abilities and efforts in a determined way so that you succeed.

example.eg: You can solve any problem if you apply yourself.
example.egtrans: 如果你努力，任何问题都能解决。

approach.name: approach
approach.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: approach
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to come near or nearer to something or someone in space, time, quality, or amount

example.eg: We could just see the train approaching in the distance.
example.egtrans: 我们刚好能看到火车从远处驶来。

example.eg: If you look out of the window on the left, you'll see that we're now approaching the Eiffel Tower.
example.egtrans: 如果你从左侧的窗口望出去，就可以看到我们正在驶向埃菲尔铁塔。

example.eg: I see it's approaching lunchtime, so let's take a break.
example.egtrans: 午饭时间快到了，我们休息一下吧。

example.eg: In my opinion, no other composers even begin to approach (= come near in quality to) Mozart.
example.egtrans: 我认为，任何作曲家和莫扎特相比，都难以望其项背。

example.eg: The total amount raised so far is approaching (= almost) $1,000.
example.egtrans: 目前筹集到的金额总数将近1000美元了。

example.eg: He's very active for a man approaching 80 (= who is almost 80 years old).
example.egtrans: 对于一个年近80的老人来说，他精力旺盛。

dsense.name: approach
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to deal with something

example.eg: I'm not sure how to approach the problem.
example.egtrans: 怎样处理这个问题，我没有把握。

dsense.name: approach
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to speak to, write to, or visit someone in order to do something such as make a request or business agreement

example.eg: We've just approached the bank for/about a loan.
example.egtrans: 我们刚刚联系银行要求贷款。

example.eg: She's been approached by a modelling agency.
example.egtrans: 一家模特代理公司曾与她接洽过。

approach.name: approach
approach.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: approach
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of considering or doing something

example.eg: Since our research so far has not produced any answers to this problem, we need to adopt a different approach to it.
example.egtrans: 到目前为止，我们还没有研究出任何解决这一问题的方法，所以我们得换一种思路了。

example.eg: I've just read an interesting book which has a new approach to Shakespeare.
example.egtrans: 我刚读了一本非常有趣的书，它提供了一种对莎士比亚作品的全新解读方式。

example.eg: Michael is always very logical in his approach.
example.egtrans: 迈克尔的处事方法一贯非常合情合理。

dsense.name: approach
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of getting nearer in distance or time

example.eg: The siren signalled the approach of an ambulance.
example.egtrans: 警笛声表明一辆救护车正在驶来。

example.eg: Many kinds of birds fly south at the approach of winter.
example.egtrans: 很多鸟在冬天来临之际飞向南方。

example.eg: Please fasten your seat belts, the plane is now making its final approach (in)to (= is coming near to and preparing to land at) Heathrow.
example.egtrans: 请系好安全带，飞机马上就要在希思罗机场降落。

trans_examp.trans_en: a route that leads to a place

example.eg: There is a very steep approach to the house.
example.egtrans: 有一条很险的路通往那座房子。

example.eg: We got stuck in a traffic jam on the approach road.
example.egtrans: 我们遇上塞车，被堵在引道上了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the most similar thing to something else that is mentioned
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 与…最近似（或相似）的事物

example.eg: That's the nearest approach to an apology you're going to get from Paula.
example.egtrans: 你别想从葆拉那儿得到真正的道歉，她那样做就已经是很不错了。

dsense.name: approach
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of communicating with another person or group in order to ask for something

example.eg: The hospital is making approaches to local businesses (= asking them to help) in their bid to raise money.
example.egtrans: 为了筹款，医院正在同当地的公司商谈，请求他们解囊相助。

example.eg: I hear that Everton have made an approach to (= an attempt to make a business arrangement with) Arsenal to buy one of their players.
example.egtrans: 我听说艾弗顿队跟阿森纳队进行过接洽，意欲出钱转入他们的一名球员。

appropriate.name: appropriate
appropriate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: suitable or right for a particular situation or occasion

example.eg: appropriate footwear for the country
example.egtrans: 适于在乡间穿的鞋

example.eg: Is this film appropriate for small children?
example.egtrans: 这部电影适合幼童观看吗？

example.eg: I didn't think his comments were very appropriate at the time.
example.egtrans: 我觉得他在当时发表那些评论很不妥当。

example.eg: Is this an appropriate occasion to discuss finance?
example.egtrans: 这个场合适于讨论财政问题吗？

example.eg: Please complete the appropriate parts of this form (= the parts that are right or necessary for your particular situation) and return it as soon as possible.
example.egtrans: 请正确填写表中相关部分并尽快交回。

appropriate.name: appropriate
appropriate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: appropriate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take something for your own use, usually without permission

example.eg: He lost his job when he was found to have appropriated some of the company's money.
example.egtrans: 他被发现侵吞公司钱款后就丢了工作。

dsense.name: appropriate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep an amount of money to use for a particular purpose

example.eg: The government have appropriated millions of pounds for the project.
example.egtrans: 政府已经为该项目拨款数百万英镑。

approved.name: approved
approved.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to something that is generally or officially accepted as being correct or satisfactory

example.eg: What's the approved way of dealing with this?
example.egtrans: 怎样处理这种事情才合适？

example.eg: This school only offers approved language courses.
example.egtrans: 这所学校只开设经过审批的语言课程。

arbitrary.name: arbitrary
arbitrary.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: arbitrary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: based on chance rather than being planned or based on reason
trans_examp.trans_cn: 任意的；随机的；随心所欲的

example.eg: arbitrary decision-making
example.egtrans: 随意决策

example.eg: Did you have a reason for choosing your destination or was it arbitrary?
example.egtrans: 你根据什么选择目的地？还是随意选定的？

dsense.name: arbitrary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: using unlimited personal power without considering other people's wishes

example.eg: an arbitrary ruler
example.egtrans: 专制的统治者

example.eg: The company has been the subject of an arbitrary take-over.
example.egtrans: 这家公司被强行接管。

argument.name: argument
argument.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: argument
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a disagreement, or the process of disagreeing

example.eg: The children had an argument about/over what game to play.
example.egtrans: 孩子们为了玩哪个游戏吵了起来。

example.eg: He got into an argument with Jeff in the pub last night.
example.egtrans: 昨晚他和杰夫在酒馆里起了争执。

example.eg: A decision was finally made after some heated argument.
example.egtrans: 经过激烈的争辩，最终作出了一项决定。

dsense.name: argument
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a reason or reasons why you support or oppose an idea or suggestion, or the process of explaining these reasons
trans_examp.trans_cn: 理由，论据，论点；论证，说理

example.eg: Now that we've heard all the arguments for and against the proposal, let's vote on it.
example.egtrans: 既然支持和反对这项提议的所有理由我们都已经听过了，现在投票表决吧。

example.eg: Her husband was not convinced by her argument that they needed a bigger house.
example.egtrans: 她提出理由说他们需要一个大些的房子，但是她的丈夫没有被说服。

example.eg: I don't think that's a very strong/convincing/powerful argument.
example.egtrans: 我认为这个论点不太站得住脚／令人信服／有说服力。

example.eg: The central argument (= main point) of the book is that some of the plays were not written by Shakespeare.
example.egtrans: 这本书的中心论点是，有几个剧本并非出自莎士比亚之手。

arise.name: arise
arise.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: arise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to happen

example.eg: Should the opportunity arise, I'd love to go to China.
example.egtrans: 要是有机会的话，我很想去中国。

example.eg: Could you work on Saturday, should the need arise (= if it were to be necessary)?
example.egtrans: 万一有需要，你可以在星期六工作吗？

example.eg: Are there any matters arising from (= caused by) the last meeting?
example.egtrans: 上次会议有没有引出什么问题？

dsense.name: arise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get out of bed

example.eg: We arose early on Christmas morning.
example.egtrans: 圣诞节早晨，我们早早地起了床。

arithmetic.name: arithmetic
arithmetic.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the part of mathematics that involves the adding and multiplying, etc. of numbers

example.eg: I've never been very good at arithmetic.
example.egtrans: 我从来不擅长算术。

example.eg: an arithmetic test
example.egtrans: 算术考试

trans_examp.trans_en: calculations involving adding and multiplying, etc. numbers

example.eg: I did some quick mental arithmetic and decided it was going to cost too much.
example.egtrans: 我快速心算了一下，觉得费用会太高。

example.eg: I can't figure out which of these is cheaper - could you do the arithmetic?
example.egtrans: 我弄不清楚哪种便宜些，你能算一算吗？

around.name: around
around.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: around
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a position or direction surrounding, or in a direction going along the edge of or from one part to another (of)
trans_examp.trans_cn: 四处，周围；围绕，（环）绕；掉转

example.eg: We sat around the table.
example.egtrans: 我们围着桌子坐着。

example.eg: He put his arm around her.
example.egtrans: 他用胳膊搂着她。

example.eg: A crowd had gathered around the scene of the accident.
example.egtrans: 事故现场围了一群人。

example.eg: She had a scarf around her neck.
example.egtrans: 她脖子上围了一条围巾。

example.eg: The moon goes around the earth.
example.egtrans: 月亮围绕地球转。

example.eg: I walked around the side of the building.
example.egtrans: 我从楼的一侧绕了过去。

example.eg: As the bus left, she turned around (= so that she was facing in the opposite direction) and waved goodbye to us.
example.egtrans: 公共汽车开动时，她转过身来向我们挥手告别。

example.eg: He put the wheel on the right/wrong way around (= facing the right/wrong way).
example.egtrans: 他把轮子装对了／安反了。

example.eg: The children were dancing around the room.
example.egtrans: 孩子们在房间里来回跳舞。

example.eg: I spent a year travelling around Africa and Asia.
example.egtrans: 我用了一年时间周游了非洲和亚洲。

example.eg: The museum's collection includes works of art from all around the world.
example.egtrans: 这个博物馆的馆藏包括来自世界各地的艺术品。

example.eg: She passed a plate of biscuits around (= from one person to another).
example.egtrans: 她端出一盘饼干让大家传着分享。

example.eg: This virus has been going around (= from one person to another).
example.egtrans: 这种病毒已经传播开来。

dsense.name: around
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: positioned or moving in or near a place, often without a clear direction, purpose, or order
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在…）附近，在（…）近处；到处，四处；随便

example.eg: He always leaves his clothes lying around (on the floor).
example.egtrans: 他总是随手把衣服（往地板上）一扔。

example.eg: She went into town and spent two hours just walking around.
example.egtrans: 她进了城，四处转悠了两个小时。

example.eg: Let's take the children to the park so they can run around for a while.
example.egtrans: 我们把孩子们带到公园去让他们到处跑跑吧。

example.eg: I used to live around (= near) here.
example.egtrans: 过去我就住在这一带。

example.eg: She's never around (= near here) when you need her.
example.egtrans: 你用得着她的时候，她就没影了。

example.eg: Will you be around next week?
example.egtrans: 你下周在吗？

example.eg: There's a lot of flu around (= a lot of people have it) at the moment.
example.egtrans: 现在流感肆虐。

example.eg: Smartphones have been around (= existed) for quite a while.
example.egtrans: 智能手机问世已经有一段时间了。

around.name: around
around.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: around
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: approximately

example.eg: around six feet tall
example.egtrans: 大约6英尺高

example.eg: around two months ago
example.egtrans: 大约两个月前

example.eg: around four o'clock
example.egtrans: 4点左右

example.eg: She earns around $40,000 a year.
example.egtrans: 她一年大约挣4万美元。

arrow.name: arrow
arrow.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a weapon that is like a long, thin stick with a sharp point at one end and often feathers at the other, shot from a bow (= a long, thin piece of wood bent into a curve by a piece of string)

example.eg: Robin Hood asked to be buried where his arrow landed.
example.egtrans: 罗宾汉让人们把他安葬在他的箭落下的位置。

trans_examp.trans_en: a sign consisting of a straight line with an upside down V shape at one end of it that points in a particular direction, used to show where something is

example.eg: I followed the arrows to the car park.
example.egtrans: 我顺着箭头所指方向开到了停车场。

as far as..(is concerned).name: concerned
as far as..(is concerned).posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: concerned
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: worried

example.eg: I'm a bit concerned about/for your health.
example.egtrans: 我有点担心你的健康。

example.eg: Aren't you concerned (that) she might tell someone?
example.egtrans: 难道你不担心她会跟别人讲吗？

example.eg: He was concerned to hear that two of his trusted workers were leaving.
example.egtrans: 听到他信任的两名工人要走，他感到担忧。

example.eg: Concerned parents have complained about the dangerous playground.
example.egtrans: 忧心忡忡的家长们抱怨那个儿童游乐场太危险。

dsense.name: concerned
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: involved in something or affected by it

example.eg: I'd like to thank everyone concerned for making the occasion run so smoothly.
example.egtrans: 我要感谢为本次活动顺利进行而付出努力的所有相关人员。

example.eg: It was quite a shock for all/everyone concerned.
example.egtrans: 相关人员都很震惊。

example.eg: Her job is something concerned with computers.
example.egtrans: 她的工作跟计算机有关。

example.eg: I'm not very good where money is concerned (= when dealing with money).
example.egtrans: 我不太会理财。

phrase.phrase_title: as far as sb is concerned

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a particular person's opinion

example.eg: As far as I'm concerned, feng shui doesn't work.
example.egtrans: 在我看来，有关风水的说法根本就沒有道理。

phrase.phrase_title: as far as sth is concerned

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: if we are discussing or thinking about a particular thing

example.eg: As far as unemployment's concerned, a change of policy on job creation would be a good idea.
example.egtrans: 就失业问题而言，改变创造工作机会的有关政策会是个好主意。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be about a particular thing or person

example.eg: Today's lesson is concerned with punctuation.
example.egtrans: 今天的课是关于标点符号的。

as long as.name: long
as long as.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: long
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: continuing for a large amount of time

example.eg: a long film/meeting
example.egtrans: 很长的电影／会议

example.eg: I've been waiting a long time.
example.egtrans: 我已经等了很久了。

example.eg: It's a long time since I worked there.
example.egtrans: 我不在那里工作已经很久了。

example.eg: Apparently the sessions are an hour long.
example.egtrans: 显然这些会议都长达1个小时。

dsense.name: long
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: being a distance between two points that is more than average or usual

example.eg: long hair
example.egtrans: 长发

example.eg: long legs
example.egtrans: 长腿

example.eg: a long dress
example.egtrans: 长裙

example.eg: There was a long queue at the post office.
example.egtrans: 邮局里排起了长队。

example.eg: We're still a long way from the station.
example.egtrans: 我们离车站还很远。

dsense.name: long
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe a piece of writing that has a lot of pages or words

example.eg: a long letter/book/report
example.egtrans: 长信／大部头的书／长篇报告

as long as.name: long
as long as.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: long
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to mean "(for) a long time", especially in questions and negative sentences
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤用在疑问句和否定句中）长久地，长时间地

example.eg: Have you been waiting (for) long?
example.egtrans: 你等了很久吗？

example.eg: I'm just writing a letter but it won't take long.
example.egtrans: 我在写信，很快就写完了。

example.eg: How long have you been in England?
example.egtrans: 你在英格兰呆多久了？

example.eg: Don't rush - take as long as you like.
example.egtrans: 别着急——慢慢来。

example.eg: We've been walking all day long.
example.egtrans: 我们走了整整一天。

example.eg: I've known her longer than you have.
example.egtrans: 我认识她的时间比你长。

example.eg: I won't be staying much longer.
example.egtrans: 我不会呆很久。

trans_examp.trans_en: a long period of time before or after something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在…之前（或之后）的很长一段时间

example.eg: She left the house long before I arrived.
example.egtrans: 在我到达前很久，她就离开这座屋子了。

example.eg: It wasn't long before he was back with his family.
example.egtrans: 不久之后他和全家就回来了。

example.eg: He did not join them until long after they had eaten.
example.egtrans: 当他们早就吃完时他才加入他们。

trans_examp.trans_en: used with the past participle or the -ing form of the verb to mean that a state or activity has continued for a long time
trans_examp.trans_cn: （与过去分词或动词的 ing 形式连用表示持续了很久的状态或活动）

example.eg: a long-awaited letter
example.egtrans: 期盼已久的来信

example.eg: long-serving employees
example.egtrans: 老雇员

dsense.name: long
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to say that something must happen before something else can happen

example.eg: I can come as long as I can leave by 4.00.
example.egtrans: 只要我能在4点钟之前出发，我就能来。

example.eg: Bring your friends by all means - just so long as I know how many are coming.
example.egtrans: 一定要把你的朋友们带来——只要让我知道来多少人就行。

as long as.name: long
as long as.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

phrase.phrase_title: long for sth; long to do sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to want something very much

example.eg: She longed to see him again.
example.egtrans: 她很想再见到他。

example.eg: I'm longing for news of him.
example.egtrans: 我正在盼望着得到他的消息。

as long as.name: long
as long as.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
written abbreviation for
        
         longitude

as long as.name: long.
as long as.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
written abbreviation for 
        
         longitude

as soon as.name: soon
as soon as.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or within a short time; before long; quickly

example.eg: She'll soon be here./She'll be here soon.
example.egtrans: 她很快就到。

example.eg: It will soon be impossible for foreigners to enter the country.
example.egtrans: 不久以后，外国人就不能进入这个国家了。

example.eg: The sooner we leave, the sooner we'll get there.
example.egtrans: 我们出发得越早，到那儿也就越早。

example.eg: Soon after agreeing to go, she realized she'd made a mistake.
example.egtrans: 同意去之后不久，她就意识到自己犯了一个错误。

example.eg: How soon (= when) can we sign the contract?
example.egtrans: 我们什么时候能签订合同？

example.eg: "When would you like to meet?" "The sooner the better."
example.egtrans: “你想什么时候见面？”“越快越好。”

example.eg: I couldn't get out of that place soon enough.
example.egtrans: 我恨不得马上离开那个地方。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: at the same time or a very short time after

example.eg: As soon as I saw her, I knew there was something wrong.
example.egtrans: 我一看到她就知道出事了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something as soon as possible, you do it as quickly as you can.

example.eg: We need the repairs done as soon as possible.
example.egtrans: 我们需要尽快修好。

as such.name: such
as such.posTip: A word used before a determiner.

trans_examp.trans_en: used before a noun or noun phrase to add emphasis
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于名词或名词短语前表示强调）如此，这么

example.eg: That's such a good film.
example.egtrans: 那部电影真不错。

example.eg: It seems like such a long way to drive for just one day.
example.egtrans: 一天之内要开这么远的路好像不太可能。

example.eg: You're such an idiot!
example.egtrans: 你真是个白痴！

example.eg: Such cruelty really is beyond my comprehension.
example.egtrans: 如此残忍真是让我无法理解。

example.eg: It was such a small room that the bed only just fit.
example.egtrans: 那个房间实在太小了，刚够放进去一张床。

as such.name: such
as such.posTip: A word used before a determiner.

trans_examp.trans_en: of a particular or similar type

example.eg: Small companies such as ours are very vulnerable in a recession.
example.egtrans: 像我们这样的小公司在经济不景气的时候非常容易受影响。

example.eg: I'm looking for a cloth for cleaning silver. Do you have such a thing?
example.egtrans: 我在找擦银器的布。你有这样的东西吗？

example.eg: Present on this grand occasion were Andrew Davies, Melissa Peters, and other such stars.
example.egtrans: 出席这次盛大典礼的有安德鲁‧戴维斯、梅利莎‧彼得斯等大牌明星。

example.eg: I tried to tell her in such a way that she wouldn't get offended.
example.egtrans: 我尽量用一种不得罪她的方式告诉她。

example.eg: He said it was an Edwardian washstand or some such thing - I can't remember exactly.
example.egtrans: 他说那是一个爱德华时代的盥洗盆之类的东西——我记不清了。

example.eg: I just bought one or two things - bread and milk and such (also suchlike).
example.egtrans: 我只买了一两样东西——面包、牛奶之类的。

example.eg: Our lunch was such (= of a type) that we don't really need dinner.
example.egtrans: 我们午饭大吃了一顿，都不怎么需要再吃晚饭了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for example

example.eg: That money is to cover costs such as travel and accommodation.
example.egtrans: 那笔钱是用来支付交通费和住宿费的。

as such.name: such
as such.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in the true or exact meaning of the word or phrase
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 从字面意义来看，严格地说

example.eg: There wasn't much vegetarian food as such, although there were several different types of cheese.
example.egtrans: 尽管有几种不同的奶酪，但严格意义上的素食没有多少。

example.eg: We don't have a secretary as such, but we do have a student who comes in to do some filing.
example.egtrans: 我们没有真正意义上的秘书，不过确实有个学生来做些文件整理工作。

as though.name: though
as though.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: despite the fact that

example.eg: She hasn't called, even though she said she would.
example.egtrans: 虽然她说过要打电话，可还没打。

trans_examp.trans_en: but

example.eg: They're coming next week, though I don't know which day.
example.egtrans: 他们下周要来，但我不知道是哪天。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as if

example.eg: You look as though you've been running a marathon!
example.egtrans: 你看上去好像跑了个马拉松似的！

as though.name: though
as though.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: despite this

example.eg: We went to high school together. I haven't seen her for years, though.
example.egtrans: 我们是高中校友，但我已多年没见过她了。

as well as.name: well
as well as.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: well
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a good way, to a high or satisfactory standard

example.eg: The documentary presented both sides of the problem very well.
example.egtrans: 这部纪录片很好地展示了问题的两个方面。

example.eg: The concert was advertised well enough but ticket sales were poor.
example.egtrans: 这场音乐会的宣传搞得很不错，但是票房却不好。

example.eg: a well-cut suit
example.egtrans: 剪裁合身的西服

example.eg: a well-paid job
example.egtrans: 薪酬优厚的工作

example.eg: Her points were well put (= expressed in a good or intelligent way).
example.egtrans: 她的观点表达得很巧妙。

example.eg: His point about the need to reduce waste was well taken (= it was accepted as a good criticism).
example.egtrans: 他关于有必要减少浪费的观点得到了认同。

example.eg: They took two hours to discuss the plans and considered it time well spent (= it had been a useful discussion).
example.egtrans: 他们花了两个小时讨论这些计划，并且认为时间花得很值。

example.eg: I can't do it as well as Marie can.
example.egtrans: 我无法做得像玛丽那样好。

dsense.name: well
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.
