trans_examp.trans_en: very much, to a great degree, or completely

example.eg: Knead the dough well, then divide it into four pieces.
example.egtrans: 充分揉捏面团，然后将它分成4块。

example.eg: He could well imagine how much his promise was going to cost him.
example.egtrans: 他完全能想象出他要为自己的诺言付出多大的代价。

example.eg: I can't catch the bus - there are no buses after midnight, as you well know.
example.egtrans: 我没法坐公共汽车——午夜过后就没有公共汽车了，你很清楚这一点。

example.eg: He plays the piano well enough (= to a satisfactory standard).
example.egtrans: 他钢琴弹得非常好。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize some prepositions

example.eg: The results are well above/below what we expected.
example.egtrans: 结果比我们预想的要好／差得多。

example.eg: Keep well away from the edge of the cliff.
example.egtrans: 离悬崖边远远的。

example.eg: It cost well over £100.
example.egtrans: 它的价格远远高于100英镑。

example.eg: Stand well clear of the doors!
example.egtrans: 离门远点！

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize some adjectives

example.eg: The police are well aware of the situation.
example.egtrans: 警方非常清楚形势。

example.eg: The museum is well worth a visit.
example.egtrans: 那家博物馆很值得参观。

example.eg: Some machines look more like cheap, plastic toys - leave these well alone.
example.egtrans: 有些机器看着更像那种廉价的塑料玩具——千万别去碰它们。

trans_examp.trans_en: very

example.eg: The film was well good.
example.egtrans: 那部电影非常不错。

example.eg: Watch out for those two - they're well hard (= strong and willing to use violence).
example.egtrans: 小心那两个人——他们都不好惹。

dsense.name: well
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: with good reason

example.eg: She might well be the best person to ask.
example.egtrans: 问她可能最合适。

example.eg: I can't very well (= it would not be acceptable to) refuse their generous offer.
example.egtrans: 我没有理由拒绝他们慷慨的提议。

dsense.name: well
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in addition (to)

example.eg: Invite Emily - and Scott as well.
example.egtrans: 邀请埃米莉——还有斯科特。

example.eg: I want to visit Andrew as well as Martin.
example.egtrans: 我想去拜访安德鲁，还有马丁。

as well as.name: well
as well as.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: healthy; not ill

example.eg: He hasn't been very well lately.
example.egtrans: 他最近身体不太好。

example.eg: When she came home from school she really didn't look well.
example.egtrans: 她从学校回到家里时气色看起来真不好。

example.eg: I'm sorry you're ill - I hope you get well soon.
example.egtrans: 你生病了我很难过——希望你尽快好起来。

example.eg: They sent a get well card.
example.egtrans: 他们寄了一张祝愿早日康复的慰问卡。

as well as.name: well
as well as.posTip: A word or phrase that you say loudly or suddenly to express strong feelings.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to introduce something you are going to say, often to show surprise, doubt, slight disagreement, or anger, or to continue a story
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于引出要说的话题，常用来表示惊讶、怀疑、不太同意或生气，也用来继续讲故事）啊，哎呀，哟，那么，好吧

example.eg: Well, what shall we do now?
example.egtrans: 那么，我们现在该做什么？

example.eg: Well now/then, how are we going to arrange things?
example.egtrans: 那么，现在我们该怎样安排呢？

example.eg: "Who was that?" "Well, I can't remember her name."
example.egtrans: “那人是谁呀啊？”“嗯，我记不起她的名字了。”

example.eg: "He's decided to give up his job and move to Seattle with her." "Well, well - that's what love does for you."
example.egtrans: “他已经决定放弃自己的工作同她一起搬到西雅图去了。”“嗯，嗯——这就是爱情的力量。”

example.eg: Well, really, that was thoughtless of him!
example.egtrans: 唉，说真的，他真是太轻率了！

example.eg: Well? What did you do next?
example.egtrans: 嗯？你接下来做了什么？

example.eg: Well, after that we went camping in the mountains.
example.egtrans: 唔，那之后我们就去山里露营了。

example.eg: Well/Oh well, it doesn't matter - I can always buy another one.
example.egtrans: 哦，没关系——我可以再买一个。

example.eg: Very well, if you insist I'll meet him next week.
example.egtrans: 好吧，如果你坚持，那我下周就见他一面。

as well as.name: well
as well as.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a deep hole in the ground from which you can get water, oil, or gas

as well as.name: well
as well as.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of liquid) to appear on the surface of something or come slowly out from somewhere

example.eg: Dirty water welled (up) out of the damaged pipe.
example.egtrans: 污水从损坏的管道中冒了出来。

example.eg: As she read the letter tears welled up in her eyes.
example.egtrans: 她读信的时候眼泪夺眶而出。

example.eg: Conflicting emotions welled up in his heart.
example.egtrans: 他心里感到很矛盾。

trans_examp.trans_en: short form of we will

example.eg: We'll do better next time, I'm sure.
example.egtrans: 下次我们会做得更好，我保证。

as well.name: well
as well.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: well
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a good way, to a high or satisfactory standard

example.eg: The documentary presented both sides of the problem very well.
example.egtrans: 这部纪录片很好地展示了问题的两个方面。

example.eg: The concert was advertised well enough but ticket sales were poor.
example.egtrans: 这场音乐会的宣传搞得很不错，但是票房却不好。

example.eg: a well-cut suit
example.egtrans: 剪裁合身的西服

example.eg: a well-paid job
example.egtrans: 薪酬优厚的工作

example.eg: Her points were well put (= expressed in a good or intelligent way).
example.egtrans: 她的观点表达得很巧妙。

example.eg: His point about the need to reduce waste was well taken (= it was accepted as a good criticism).
example.egtrans: 他关于有必要减少浪费的观点得到了认同。

example.eg: They took two hours to discuss the plans and considered it time well spent (= it had been a useful discussion).
example.egtrans: 他们花了两个小时讨论这些计划，并且认为时间花得很值。

example.eg: I can't do it as well as Marie can.
example.egtrans: 我无法做得像玛丽那样好。

dsense.name: well
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very much, to a great degree, or completely

example.eg: Knead the dough well, then divide it into four pieces.
example.egtrans: 充分揉捏面团，然后将它分成4块。

example.eg: He could well imagine how much his promise was going to cost him.
example.egtrans: 他完全能想象出他要为自己的诺言付出多大的代价。

example.eg: I can't catch the bus - there are no buses after midnight, as you well know.
example.egtrans: 我没法坐公共汽车——午夜过后就没有公共汽车了，你很清楚这一点。

example.eg: He plays the piano well enough (= to a satisfactory standard).
example.egtrans: 他钢琴弹得非常好。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize some prepositions

example.eg: The results are well above/below what we expected.
example.egtrans: 结果比我们预想的要好／差得多。

example.eg: Keep well away from the edge of the cliff.
example.egtrans: 离悬崖边远远的。

example.eg: It cost well over £100.
example.egtrans: 它的价格远远高于100英镑。

example.eg: Stand well clear of the doors!
example.egtrans: 离门远点！

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize some adjectives

example.eg: The police are well aware of the situation.
example.egtrans: 警方非常清楚形势。

example.eg: The museum is well worth a visit.
example.egtrans: 那家博物馆很值得参观。

example.eg: Some machines look more like cheap, plastic toys - leave these well alone.
example.egtrans: 有些机器看着更像那种廉价的塑料玩具——千万别去碰它们。

trans_examp.trans_en: very

example.eg: The film was well good.
example.egtrans: 那部电影非常不错。

example.eg: Watch out for those two - they're well hard (= strong and willing to use violence).
example.egtrans: 小心那两个人——他们都不好惹。

dsense.name: well
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: with good reason

example.eg: She might well be the best person to ask.
example.egtrans: 问她可能最合适。

example.eg: I can't very well (= it would not be acceptable to) refuse their generous offer.
example.egtrans: 我没有理由拒绝他们慷慨的提议。

dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

example.eg: I want to visit Andrew as well as Martin.
example.egtrans: 我想去拜访安德鲁，还有马丁。

example.eg: They sent a get well card.
example.egtrans: 他们寄了一张祝愿早日康复的慰问卡。

trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于引出要说的话题，常用来表示惊讶、怀疑、不太同意或生气，也用来继续讲故事）啊，哎呀，哟，那么，好吧

example.eg: Well, what shall we do now?
example.egtrans: 那么，我们现在该做什么？

example.eg: "He's decided to give up his job and move to Seattle with her." "Well, well - that's what love does for you."
example.egtrans: “他已经决定放弃自己的工作同她一起搬到西雅图去了。”“嗯，嗯——这就是爱情的力量。”

example.eg: Well, really, that was thoughtless of him!

example.eg: Very well, if you insist I'll meet him next week.
example.egtrans: 好吧，如果你坚持，那我下周就见他一面。

as well.name: well
as well.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a deep hole in the ground from which you can get water, oil, or gas

as well.name: well
as well.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of liquid) to appear on the surface of something or come slowly out from somewhere

example.eg: Dirty water welled (up) out of the damaged pipe.
example.egtrans: 污水从损坏的管道中冒了出来。

example.eg: As she read the letter tears welled up in her eyes.
example.egtrans: 她读信的时候眼泪夺眶而出。

example.eg: Conflicting emotions welled up in his heart.
example.egtrans: 他心里感到很矛盾。

trans_examp.trans_en: short form of we will

example.eg: We'll do better next time, I'm sure.
example.egtrans: 下次我们会做得更好，我保证。

aspect.name: aspect
aspect.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: aspect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one part of a situation, problem, subject, etc.

example.eg: Which aspects of the job do you most enjoy?
example.egtrans: 你最喜欢这个工作的哪些方面？

example.eg: His illness affects almost every aspect of his life.
example.egtrans: 他的疾病几乎影响到他生活的每个方面。

example.eg: That's the most worrying aspect of the situation.
example.egtrans: 这是局势最令人担心的一面。

example.eg: Lighting is a vitally important aspect of filmmaking.
example.egtrans: 灯光是电影制作中一个至关重要的方面。

example.eg: Have you thought about the problem from every aspect?
example.egtrans: 你是不是已经全面地考虑过这个问题？

dsense.name: aspect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the direction in which a building, window, room, or sloping field faces, or the view that can be seen because of this direction
trans_examp.trans_cn: 朝向；方位；朝着某个方向的一面

example.eg: The dining room has a southern aspect, which allows us to make the most of the sun.
example.egtrans: 餐室是南向的，这就使我们能够最大限度地利用阳光。

dsense.name: aspect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the appearance of a place, or the expression on a person's face

example.eg: The glasses and the beard lend him a rather scholarly aspect.
example.egtrans: 他戴着眼睛，蓄着胡子，颇有一副学者的样子。

dsense.name: aspect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the form of a verb that shows how the meaning of that verb is considered in relation to time, typically expressing if an action is complete, repeated, or continuous

dsense.name: aspect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a measurement of the width compared to the height of the picture on a TV or computer screen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （电视或其他屏幕的）屏幕比例，长宽比，纵横比

example.eg: A widescreen picture has an aspect ratio of 16:9.
example.egtrans: 宽屏幕的长宽比为16:9。

assertion.name: assertion
assertion.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a statement that you strongly believe is true

example.eg: I certainly don't agree with his assertion that men are better drivers than women.
example.egtrans: 他言之凿凿地说男人比女人更擅长驾驶，对此我当然不能赞同。

assign.name: assign
assign.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: assign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give a particular job or piece of work to someone

example.eg: UN troops were assigned the task of rebuilding the hospital.
example.egtrans: 重建这所医院的任务被指派给了联合国部队。

example.eg: The case has been assigned to our most senior officer.
example.egtrans: 这个案件已经指派给我们最高级别的警官来处理。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you assign a time for a job or activity, you decide it will be done during that time.

example.eg: Have you assigned a day for the interviews yet?
example.egtrans: 你们定下哪一天进行面试了吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: If you assign a characteristic or value to something, you say that it has it.

example.eg: Each visitor to the site chooses an online alter ego, which is assigned a name.
example.egtrans: 该网站的每个访问者都会选择一个线上的分身，后者会分配到一个名称。

trans_examp.trans_en: to decide a reason for something

example.eg: Detectives have been unable to assign a motive for the murder.
example.egtrans: 侦探们一直无法确定谋杀的动机。

example.eg: The report assigned the blame for the accident to inadequate safety regulations.
example.egtrans: 报告中，事故的责任被归咎于安全规章不健全。

dsense.name: assign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send someone somewhere to do a job

example.eg: She was assigned to the newspaper's Berlin office.
example.egtrans: 她被派到报社驻柏林的办事处。

dsense.name: assign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a value in a particular position in the memory of a computer

dsense.name: assign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give property, money, or rights using a legal process
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把（财产、权利等）让与，转让

example.eg: Her property was assigned to her grandchildren.
example.egtrans: 她的财产转让给了她的孙辈。

assignment.name: assignment
assignment.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of work given to someone, typically as part of their studies or job
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指学习或工作方面的）任务，作业

example.eg: a freelance/photo assignment
example.egtrans: 自由职业／摄影任务

example.eg: I have a lot of reading assignments to complete before the end of term.
example.egtrans: 期末前我有大量阅读作业要完成。

trans_examp.trans_en: a job that someone is sent somewhere to do

example.eg: a foreign/diplomatic assignment
example.egtrans: 外交任命

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of giving a particular job or piece of work to someone, or of sending someone to a chosen place to do a job

example.eg: assignment of the various tasks
example.egtrans: 各种任务的分配

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: Someone who is on assignment is doing a particular job or piece of work, usually in a particular place where they have been sent for a period of time.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 执行任务；（通常指被派遣到特定地点从事一段时间的）工作

example.eg: Both journalists were killed by terrorists while on assignment in the region.
example.egtrans: 两名记者在派往这一地区工作期间被恐怖分子杀害。

associate.name: associate
associate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to connect someone or something in your mind with someone or something else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…（与…）联系起来，把…联系在一起

example.eg: Most people associate this brand with good quality.
example.egtrans: 大多数人把这个品牌和优良品质联系在一起。

associate.name: associate
associate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: associate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who is closely connected to another person as a companion, friend, or business partner

example.eg: A close associate of the author denied reports that she had cancer.
example.egtrans: 作者的一个密友否认了她患癌症的报道。

example.eg: a business associate
example.egtrans: 生意伙伴

dsense.name: associate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who holds an associate's degree

example.eg: an associate of arts
example.egtrans: 文科准学士

associate.name: associate
associate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used in the title of a person whose rank is slightly lower or less complete than the full official position described

example.eg: an associate member of an organization
example.egtrans: 一个组织的准会员

example.eg: associate director/producer
example.egtrans: 副导演／制片人

assume.name: assume
assume.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: assume
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to accept something to be true without question or proof
trans_examp.trans_cn: 假定，假设；臆断，想当然地认为

example.eg: I assumed (that) you knew each other because you went to the same school.
example.egtrans: 你们不是上的同一所学校嘛？我还以为你们两个认识呢。

example.eg: Let's assume (that) they're coming and make plans on that basis.
example.egtrans: 我们还是假定他们会来，并以此来作出计划。

example.eg: We can't assume the suspects to be guilty simply because they've decided to remain silent.
example.egtrans: 我们不能仅仅因为疑犯选择保持沉默就断定他们有罪。

example.eg: We mustn't assume the suspects' guilt.
example.egtrans: 我们千万不能臆断犯罪嫌疑人有罪。

dsense.name: assume
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pretend to have a different name or be someone you are not, or to express a feeling falsely

example.eg: Moving to a different town, he assumed a false name.
example.egtrans: 搬家到了另外一个城镇后，他用了个假名字。

example.eg: During the investigation, two detectives assumed the identities of antiques dealers.
example.egtrans: 在案件调查中，两名侦探假装成古董商。

example.eg: He assumed a look of indifference but I knew how he felt.
example.egtrans: 他装出一副无所谓的样子，但我明白他的内心感受。

dsense.name: assume
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take or begin to have responsibility or control, sometimes without the right to do so, or to begin to have a characteristic
trans_examp.trans_cn: 承担，担任；僭取，夺取；呈现，具有

example.eg: The new president assumes office at midnight tonight.
example.egtrans: 新总统在今晚午夜就职。

example.eg: The terrorists assumed control of the plane and forced it to land in the desert.
example.egtrans: 恐怖分子控制了飞机，并使其迫降在沙漠中。

example.eg: The issue has assumed considerable political proportions (= has become a big political problem).
example.egtrans: 这已经成为一个很大的政治问题。

astute.name: astute
astute.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to understand a situation quickly and see how to take advantage of it

example.eg: an astute investor/businesswoman
example.egtrans: 精明的投资者／女商人

example.eg: his astute handling of the situation
example.egtrans: 他对局势的巧妙处理

example.eg: an astute observer of human behaviour
example.egtrans: 人类行为的敏锐观察者

at a glance.name: glance
at a glance.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: glance
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give a quick short look
trans_examp.trans_cn: 瞥一眼，迅速地看一眼，扫视

example.eg: She glanced around/round the room to see who was there.
example.egtrans: 她扫视了一眼房间，看看谁在里面。

example.eg: He glanced up from his book as I passed.
example.egtrans: 我走过的时候，正埋头读书的他抬头瞥了我一眼。

example.eg: Could you glance over/through this letter and see if it's alright?
example.egtrans: 你能不能看一下这封信，看看写得行不行？

dsense.name: glance
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to shine, reflect light, or sparkle

example.eg: The sunlight glanced on the lake.
example.egtrans: 湖面上波光粼粼。

at a glance.name: glance
at a glance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quick short look
trans_examp.trans_cn: 瞥一眼，迅速地看一眼，扫视

example.eg: She took/cast a glance at her watch.
example.egtrans: 她看了一下手表。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: immediately

example.eg: He could tell at a glance that something was wrong.
example.egtrans: 他一眼就看出问题了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: when first looking

example.eg: At first glance I thought it was a dog (but I was mistaken).
example.egtrans: 乍一看我还以为是一条狗呢（但是我看走眼了）。

attached.name: attached
attached.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to like someone or something very much

example.eg: The children are very attached to their grandparents.
example.egtrans: 孩子们非常依恋他们的祖父母。

example.eg: I'm very attached to my old guitar.
example.egtrans: 我很喜欢我的旧吉他。

attacker.name: attacker
attacker.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who uses violence to hurt someone

example.eg: The police think she must have known her attacker.
example.egtrans: 警方认为她肯定认识袭击她的人。

attention.name: attention
attention.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: attention
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: notice, thought, or interest

example.eg: Ladies and gentlemen, could I have your attention, please?
example.egtrans: 女士们、先生们，请大家注意一下好吗？

example.eg: They're organizing a campaign to draw people's attention to the environmentally harmful effects of using their cars.
example.egtrans: 他们正在组织一场运动，目的是使人们意识到开车对环境造成的危害。

example.eg: Wait a moment and I'll give you my full/undivided attention (= I'll listen to and think about only you).
example.egtrans: 等一下，过一会儿我就可以全神贯注听你说了。

example.eg: After an hour, my attention started to wander (= I stopped taking notice).
example.egtrans: 一小时后，我开始走神儿了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make someone notice you

example.eg: I knocked on the window to get her attention.
example.egtrans: 我敲了敲窗，以使她注意到我。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to watch, listen to, or think about something or someone carefully or with interest

example.eg: If you don't pay attention now, you'll get it all wrong later.
example.egtrans: 如果你现在不注意，后面就会错得一塌糊涂。

example.eg: Don't pay any attention to Nina - she doesn't know what she's talking about.
example.egtrans: 别理睬尼娜——她都不知道自己在说什么。

example.eg: He wasn't paying attention to the safety instructions.
example.egtrans: 他没有注意安全指示。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the thing or person that a lot of people notice

example.eg: He likes telling jokes and being the centre of attention at parties.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢讲笑话，成为派对上的焦点。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to start to think about or consider a particular thing or person

example.eg: Many countries are starting to turn their attention to new forms of energy.
example.egtrans: 许多国家现在已开始把注意力转到新型能源上来。

dsense.name: attention
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: special care or treatment

example.eg: The paintwork will need a little attention.
example.egtrans: 油漆活需要特别下些功夫。

example.eg: If symptoms persist, seek medical attention.
example.egtrans: 如果症状不减轻，请马上就医。

dsense.name: attention
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially in the armed forces) a way of standing, with the feet together, arms by your sides, head up, and shoulders back, and not moving

example.eg: soldiers standing at/to attention
example.egtrans: 立正站立的士兵

attribute.name: attribute
attribute.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quality or characteristic that someone or something has

example.eg: Organizational ability is an essential attribute for a good manager.
example.egtrans: 组织能力是一个优秀经理必备的素质。

authentication.name: authentication
authentication.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of proving that something is real, true, or what people say it is

example.eg: password/biometric authentication
example.egtrans: 密码/生物特征身份认证

example.eg: A technique for identifying the age of wood can be used for authentication of violins.
example.egtrans: 一种识别木材年代的技术可用于鉴定小提琴。

authoring.name: authoring
authoring.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the design and production of computer programs and websites, using special software
trans_examp.trans_cn: 计算机程序编写；网站设计

example.eg: authoring tools/software
example.egtrans: 编程工具／软件

example.eg: web authoring
example.egtrans: 网站设计

automate.name: automate
automate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a process in a factory or office operate by machines or computers, in order to reduce the amount of work done by humans and the time taken to do the work

example.eg: Massive investment is needed to automate the production process.
example.egtrans: 要实现生产过程的自动化需要大量的投资。

available.name: available
available.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to be bought or used

example.eg: Is this dress available in a larger size?
example.egtrans: 这件衣服有大一号的吗？

example.eg: Our autumn catalogue is now available from our usual stockists.
example.egtrans: 秋季商品目录现已推出，请到我们公司零售处索取。

example.eg: There's no money available for an office party this year.
example.egtrans: 今年没有钱举办办公室聚会了。

example.eg: It is vital that food is made available to the famine areas.
example.egtrans: 一定要把食品送到遭受饥荒的地区，这是至关重要的。

example.eg: Do you have any double rooms available this weekend?
example.egtrans: 你们旅馆本周末有没有双人间？

trans_examp.trans_en: If someone is available, they are not busy and therefore able to do something.

example.eg: I'm afraid I'm not available to help with the show on the 19th.
example.egtrans: 19号的演出恐怕我没有时间来帮忙了。

example.eg: Every available officer will be assigned to the investigation.
example.egtrans: 每一名可以调用的警官都将会被派去进行调查。

avatar.name: avatar
avatar.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: avatar
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an image that represents you in online games, chat rooms, etc. and that you can move around the screen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （网络游戏或网络聊天中的）虚拟化身

example.eg: You can talk to other avatars with your words displayed in a cartoon bubble.
example.egtrans: 你可以和其他玩家的虚拟化身交谈，你所键入的话语会出现在你虚拟化身头上的一个卡通对话框中。

dsense.name: avatar
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: especially in Hinduism, a god who appears on earth as a person
trans_examp.trans_cn: （印度神话中）下凡化作人形的神，化身

avoid.name: avoid
avoid.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay away from someone or something

example.eg: I try to avoid supermarkets on Saturdays - they're always so busy.
example.egtrans: 我尽量避开周六去超市——那时总是人特别多。

example.eg: I'm anxious to avoid the motorway at rush hour.
example.egtrans: 在交通高峰时段，我对高速公路唯恐避之不及。

example.eg: Do you think Lukas is avoiding me? I haven't seen him all day.
example.egtrans: 你认为卢卡斯是不是在躲着我啊？我一整天都没见到他。

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent something from happening or to not allow yourself to do something

example.eg: I try to avoid going shopping on Saturdays.
example.egtrans: 我尽量不在周六去购物。

example.eg: The report studiously avoided any mention of the controversial plan.
example.egtrans: 这份报告有意避而不谈那个有争议的计划。

example.eg: The plane narrowly avoided disaster when one of the engines cut out on take-off.
example.egtrans: 飞机起飞时一个发动机熄火，差点酿成重大事故。

example.eg: I left the pub to avoid a fight (= prevent a fight from happening).
example.egtrans: 我不想动手打架，就离开了酒吧。

example.eg: Unnecessary paperwork should be avoided (= prevented) at all costs.
example.egtrans: 应该尽可能避免不必要的文书工作。

aware.name: aware
aware.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 意识到的；明白的；知道的

example.eg: I wasn't even aware that he was ill.
example.egtrans: 我都不知道他生病了。

example.eg: Were you aware of the risks at the time?
example.egtrans: 你当时意识到危险了吗？

example.eg: She was well (= very) aware that he was married.
example.egtrans: 她很清楚他已结婚了。

example.eg: "Has Claude paid the phone bill?" "Not as far as I'm aware." (= I don't think so)
example.egtrans: “克劳德交电话费了吗？”“据我所知没有。”

example.eg: I suddenly became aware of (= started to notice) him looking at me.
example.egtrans: 我突然意识到他在看着我。

trans_examp.trans_en: having special interest in or experience of something and so knowing what is happening in that subject at the present time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有…意识的；有…觉悟的；有…知识的

example.eg: to be ecologically/politically aware
example.egtrans: 有生态保护／政治意识

example.eg: sexually aware
example.egtrans: 有性意识的

awkward.name: awkward
awkward.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: awkward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: difficult to use, do, or deal with
trans_examp.trans_cn: 难用的；棘手的；难处理的，难对付的

example.eg: It's an awkward corner, so take it slowly.
example.egtrans: 这个转弯不好过，开慢点儿。

example.eg: Some of the questions were rather awkward.
example.egtrans: 有些问题很难回答。

example.eg: It was an awkward ascent, but we reached the top eventually.
example.egtrans: 那段上坡路很难走，但最后我们还是爬到了山顶。

example.eg: My car's quite awkward to drive.
example.egtrans: 我的车很难开。

example.eg: He's an awkward customer (= a difficult person to deal with).
example.egtrans: 他是个很难应付的顾客。

dsense.name: awkward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: causing problems, worry, or embarrassment
trans_examp.trans_cn: 令人尴尬的；使人难堪的

example.eg: an awkward position/situation
example.egtrans: 令人尴尬的位置／局面

example.eg: There followed an awkward silence while we all tried to think of something to say.
example.egtrans: 然后是一段令人尴尬的沉默，我们都绞尽脑汁地想说点儿什么。

example.eg: They'd chosen an awkward time to call as I'd just got into the bath.
example.egtrans: 他们偏偏在我刚开始洗澡的时候来电话，真不是时候。

example.eg: The police asked some awkward questions about where the money had come from.
example.egtrans: 警方围绕钱的来源问了一些让人很难作答的问题。

trans_examp.trans_en: embarrassed or nervous
trans_examp.trans_cn: 尴尬的；局促不安的；为难的

example.eg: I always feel awkward when I'm with Chris - he's so difficult to talk to.
example.egtrans: 我跟克里斯在一起总感到别扭——与他这人交谈太费劲儿。

example.eg: He seemed a little awkward when I first met him.
example.egtrans: 我第一次见他的时候，他有点儿放不开。

dsense.name: awkward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: intentionally not helpful
trans_examp.trans_cn: 难相处的；不合作的；故意为难的

example.eg: Just stop being so awkward and help me push the car, will you!
example.egtrans: 别再跟我闹别扭了，快帮我推推车，好不好！

dsense.name: awkward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: moving in a way that is not natural, relaxed, or attractive
trans_examp.trans_cn: 笨拙的；别扭的；不灵活的；难看的

example.eg: His movements were slow and awkward.
example.egtrans: 他的动作迟缓笨拙。

backspace.name: backspace
backspace.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the key that you press on a computer keyboard to move the cursor (= symbol showing your place on the screen) to an earlier point
trans_examp.trans_cn: 退格键（计算机键盘上的按键，用于将屏幕显示的光标位置后移）

backward.name: backward
backward.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: backward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not advanced

example.eg: When he was a child, his teachers thought he was backward (= unable to learn as much as most children).
example.egtrans: 小时候，老师认为他愚笨迟钝。

example.eg: People still think of it as a backward country/region/area (= one without industry or modern machines).
example.egtrans: 人们仍然认为这是一个落后的国家／区域／地区。

dsense.name: backward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: towards the direction that is the opposite to the one in which you are facing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 向后的；与面对方向相反的

example.eg: She left without a backward glance.
example.egtrans: 她头也不回地离去了。

example.eg: He did a fantastic backward somersault.
example.egtrans: 他做了一个漂亮的后空翻。

backward.name: backward
backward.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en:
→ 
        
         backwards mainly UK

badge.name: badge
badge.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of metal, plastic, cloth, etc., with words or a picture on it, that you carry with you or that is fastened or sewn to your clothing, often to show your support for a political organization or belief, or to show who you are, your rank, or that you are a member of a group, etc.

example.eg: Everyone at the conference wore a badge with their name on.
example.egtrans: 与会人员都戴着写有自己名字的证章。

bandwidth.name: bandwidth
bandwidth.pos: noun [ C usually singular or U ]
bandwidth.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bandwidth
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a measurement of the amount of information that can be sent between computers, through a phone line, etc.

example.eg: The system will handle signals that need high bandwidth, for instance those that encode TV pictures.
example.egtrans: 这个系统可以处理需要高带宽的信号，比如编码压缩过的电视图像信号。

example.eg: high-bandwidth services/applications
example.egtrans: 高带宽服务／应用

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability or time to deal with a situation, especially one that involves a large amount of information or a number of problems
trans_examp.trans_cn: 处理大信息或复杂情况所需的时间、精力和综合能力

example.eg: I don't have the bandwidth to read stuff I know isn't going to lead to productive discussion.
example.egtrans: 我没有精力去看那种没什么正面意义的东西。

example.eg: If people misreport or misrepresent my arguments, I am using more of my bandwidth to correct the misreporting.
example.egtrans: 如果我的论点被误传或歪曲了，那我会花多一点精力去加以纠正。

dsense.name: bandwidth
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the range of frequencies used to send information over a distance using phone wires
in radio, the width of a particular waveband

bar.name: bar
bar.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bar
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a place where drinks, especially alcoholic drinks, are sold and drunk, or the area in such a place where the person serving the drinks stands

example.eg: They noticed him going into the hotel bar.
example.egtrans: 他们看见他进了宾馆酒吧间。

example.eg: There weren't any free tables, so I sat at the bar.
example.egtrans: 没有空桌子了，我只好坐在吧台旁。

example.eg: Why don't you ask the guy behind the bar (= serving drinks there)?
example.egtrans: 你怎么不问一问吧台里的那个服务员？

dsense.name: bar
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin, straight piece of metal or wood

example.eg: The gorilla rattled the bars of its cage.
example.egtrans: 大猩猩把笼子的铁栅栏弄得吱嘎吱嘎响。

trans_examp.trans_en: a substance that has been made into a solid rectangular shape

example.eg: a bar of soap
example.egtrans: 一块肥皂

example.eg: a chocolate bar
example.egtrans: 一条巧克力棒

trans_examp.trans_en: The bar of an electric heater is a long, thin wire in the shape of a spring that is wrapped tightly around a tube. When electricity passes through it, it produces heat and red light.

dsense.name: bar
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the small equal parts into which a piece of music is divided, containing a fixed number of beats

example.eg: Waltzes have three beats in/to the bar (= in each bar).
example.egtrans: 华尔兹每小节有3拍。

trans_examp.trans_en: a vertical line that divides one bar from another in a written piece of music

dsense.name: bar
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         stripe

dsense.name: bar
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that prevents a particular event or development from happening
trans_examp.trans_cn: 阻碍某事发生或发展的东西

example.eg: A lack of formal education is no bar to becoming rich.
example.egtrans: 没有接受正规教育并不妨碍致富。

bar.name: bar
bar.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bar
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent something or someone from doing something or going somewhere, or to not allow something

example.eg: The centre of the town was barred to football supporters.
example.egtrans: 镇中心不准球迷进入。

example.eg: The incident led to him being barred from the country/barred from entering the country.
example.egtrans: 这起事件导致他被禁止进入该国。

example.eg: I tried to push past her but she barred my way/path (= stood in front of me and prevented me from getting past).
example.egtrans: 我试图从她旁边挤过去，但她还是挡住了我的去路。

dsense.name: bar
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put bars across something, especially to keep it closed

example.eg: We barred the door to stop anyone getting into the room.
example.egtrans: 我们闩上门以防有人进入房间。

bar.name: bar
bar.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: except

example.eg: Everyone is leaving the village, bar the very old and ill.
example.egtrans: 除了年老体弱者，其他人都要离开村庄。

example.eg: They're the best songwriters of this century, bar none (= no one else is better).
example.egtrans: 他们是本世纪最优秀的曲作者，无人能比。

bar.name: the Bar
bar.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: lawyers who are allowed to argue a case in a higher court
all lawyers thought of as a group

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to gain a qualification as a lawyer who can argue a case in a higher court
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 取得（出席高级法庭的）大律师资格，成为（出席高级法庭的）大律师

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to gain a qualification as a lawyer
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 取得律师资格，成为律师

beforehand.name: beforehand
beforehand.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: earlier (than a particular time)

example.eg: I knew she was coming that afternoon because she had phoned beforehand to say so.
example.egtrans: 我知道她那天下午要来，因为她事先打电话跟我说过。

behave.name: behave
behave.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to act in a particular way

example.eg: She always behaves well/badly when her aunts come to visit.
example.egtrans: 每当她姨妈来作客时，她总是表现很好／很差。

example.eg: Whenever there was a full moon he would start behaving strangely.
example.egtrans: 每当月圆之时他就行为怪异。

example.eg: They behaved as if nothing had happened.
example.egtrans: 他们表现得好像什么也没有发生过一样。

trans_examp.trans_en: to show particular behaviour in a particular situation or under particular conditions
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在某种环境或条件下）做出特定行为

example.eg: They learn how particles behave in solids, liquids, and gases.
example.egtrans: 他们了解到粒子在固体、液体和气体中如何运动。

example.eg: It is believed that animals behave differently before a natural disaster.
example.egtrans: 据信动物在自然灾害发生之前会行动异常。

trans_examp.trans_en: to be good by acting in a way that has society's approval

example.eg: Did the children behave (themselves)?
example.egtrans: 孩子们守规矩吗？

behind.name: behind
behind.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: at the back (of)

example.eg: Look behind you!
example.egtrans: 朝后看！

example.eg: I hung my coat behind the door.
example.egtrans: 我把大衣挂在门后了。

example.eg: Alex led, and I followed along behind.
example.egtrans: 亚历克斯带头，我紧随其后。

example.eg: As hard as she tried, she always fell behind the other swimmers in the races.
example.egtrans: 比赛中不管怎样努力，她总是落在其他游泳选手的后面。

example.eg: I knew that behind (= hidden by) her smile was sadness.
example.egtrans: 我知道她在用微笑掩饰着内心的忧伤。

behind.name: behind
behind.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: behind
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the place where someone or something was before

example.eg: I was annoyed to discover that I'd left my bag behind.
example.egtrans: 发现自己把包落下了，我很气恼。

example.eg: After the party a few people stayed behind to help clean up.
example.egtrans: 晚会结束后，一些客人留下来帮助收拾打扫。

dsense.name: behind
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: slower or later than someone else, or than you should be

example.eg: The old woman was behind with (= late paying) the rent.
example.egtrans: 老妇人迟迟未交房租。

behind.name: behind
behind.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: responsible for or the cause of

example.eg: He wondered what was behind his neighbour's sudden friendliness.
example.egtrans: 他疑惑为何邻居的态度突然友好起来。

example.eg: Marie Curie was the woman behind enormous changes in the science of chemistry.
example.egtrans: 居里夫人使整个化学领域发生了巨变。

behind.name: behind
behind.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the part of the body on which a person sits

example.eg: He tripped and fell on his behind.
example.egtrans: 他绊了一跤，一屁股摔在地上。

example.eg: Why don't you get off your behind (= stand up) and do something!
example.egtrans: 你为何不起来干点儿什么！

beneath.name: beneath
beneath.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: beneath
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or to a lower position than someone or something, under someone or something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（或往）…下面；在（或往）…下方

example.eg: Jaime hid the letter beneath a pile of papers.
example.egtrans: 海梅把信藏在一叠文件下面。

example.eg: We huddled together for warmth beneath the blankets.
example.egtrans: 我们裹着毛毯挤在一起取暖。

example.eg: After weeks at sea, it was wonderful to feel firm ground beneath our feet once more.
example.egtrans: 在海上呆了几星期之后，脚下再次接触坚实土地的感觉真棒。

example.eg: Emma was so tired and hungry that her legs were beginning to give way beneath her (= she was about to fall over).
example.egtrans: 埃玛又累又饿，双腿已经开始发软了。

dsense.name: beneath
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not be good enough for someone

example.eg: Office work of any description he felt was beneath him.
example.egtrans: 他觉得做任何办公室的工作都有失他的身份。

beneath.name: beneath
beneath.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: below

example.eg: She looked out of the window at the children playing beneath.
example.egtrans: 她透过窗户看着孩子们在下面玩耍。

besides.name: besides
besides.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in addition to; also

example.eg: She won't mind if you're late - besides, it's hardly your fault.
example.egtrans: 她不会因你迟到而耿耿于怀——何况这并不是你的错。

example.eg: Do you play any other sports besides basketball?
example.egtrans: 除了篮球外，你还从事别的体育活动吗？

between.name: between
between.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or into the space that separates two places, people, or objects

example.eg: The town lies halfway between Rome and Florence.
example.egtrans: 此城镇位于罗马和佛罗伦萨的中间。

example.eg: Standing between the two adults was a small child.
example.egtrans: 站在两个大人之间的是个小孩。

example.eg: She squeezed between the parked cars and ran out into the road.
example.egtrans: 她在停放的车子间挤来挤去，最后跑到了马路上。

example.eg: There were two houses with a narrow path in between.
example.egtrans: 一条狭窄的小路从两幢房子之间穿过。

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something is between two amounts, it is greater than the first amount but smaller than the second.

example.eg: She weighs between 55 and 60 kilograms.
example.egtrans: 她的体重在55公斤到60公斤之间。

example.eg: The competition is open to children between six and twelve years of age.
example.egtrans: 比赛是为6岁至12岁的孩子而设的。

example.eg: The room was either extremely cold or hot, never anything in between (= in the middle).
example.egtrans: 这间屋子不是极冷就是极热，从来都没有不冷不热的时候。

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the period of time that separates two different times or events

example.eg: You shouldn't eat between meals.
example.egtrans: 你不应该吃零食。

example.eg: There is a break of ten minutes between classes.
example.egtrans: 课间有10分钟的休息时间。

example.eg: The office is closed for lunch between 12.30 and 1.30.
example.egtrans: 办公室午饭时间关闭，时间从12点半到1点半。

example.eg: In between sobs, he managed to tell them what had happened.
example.egtrans: 他泣不成声，呜咽着向他们诉说所发生的一切。

example.eg: He visits his parents every month and sometimes in between.
example.egtrans: 他每个月都去看望父母，有时候去得更频繁一些。

between.name: between
between.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: among two or more people or things
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（两个或两个以上的人或事）之间

example.eg: The money was divided equally between several worthy causes.
example.egtrans: 那笔钱被平均分配给几个有价值的项目。

example.eg: We drank two bottles of wine between the four of us.
example.egtrans: 我们4个人分享了两瓶酒。

example.eg: Trade between the two countries (= their trade with each other) has increased sharply in the past year.
example.egtrans: 在过去的一年里，两国之间的贸易额急剧增加。

example.eg: There is a great deal of similarity between Caroline and her mother (= they are very similar).
example.egtrans: 卡罗琳和她的母亲之间有许多相似之处。

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: A discussion, argument, or game between two or more people or groups of people involves both people or groups.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （讨论、争论或比赛）发生在…之间

example.eg: The negotiations between the union and management have broken down.
example.egtrans: 工会和资方的谈判已经破裂。

example.eg: There has always been a fierce rivalry between the two schools.
example.egtrans: 这两所学校之间的竞争一直很激烈。

example.eg: Tonight's game is between the New Orleans Saints and the St. Louis Rams.
example.egtrans: 今晚的比赛在新奥尔良圣徒队和洛杉矶公羊队之间举行。

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you choose between two things, you choose one thing or the other.

example.eg: You'll have to choose between a holiday or a new washing machine.
example.egtrans: 你必须在度假和买洗衣机之间作出选择。

example.eg: She was torn between loyalty to her father and love for her husband (= she could not decide which one to support).
example.egtrans: 对父亲的感情和对丈夫的爱不能两全，这让她左右为难。

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: connecting two or more places, things, or people

example.eg: There is a regular train service between Glasgow and Edinburgh.
example.egtrans: 在格拉斯哥和爱丁堡之间有定期列车开行。

example.eg: The survey shows a link between asthma and air pollution.
example.egtrans: 调查表明哮喘病与大气污染有关。

trans_examp.trans_en: from one place to another

example.eg: He commutes daily between Baltimore and Washington, D.C.
example.egtrans: 他每天往返于巴尔的摩和华盛顿特区之间。

dsense.name: between
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: separating two places or things

example.eg: The wall between East and West Berlin came down in 1989.
example.egtrans: 将东西柏林隔开的柏林墙于1989年被推倒了。

example.eg: The report states that the gap between the rich and the poor has increased dramatically over the past decade.
example.egtrans: 报告表明在过去10年里贫富差距明显增大了。

beyond.name: beyond
beyond.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: beyond
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: further away in the distance (than something)

example.eg: In the distance, beyond the river, was a small town.
example.egtrans: 在河对岸的远处有一座小镇。

example.eg: From the top of the hill we could see our house and the woods beyond.
example.egtrans: 站在这个小山顶，能看到我们的房子和远处的森林。

dsense.name: beyond
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: outside or after (a stated limit)

example.eg: Few people live beyond the age of a hundred.
example.egtrans: 很少有人活过100岁。

example.eg: We cannot allow the work to continue beyond the end of the year.
example.egtrans: 我们不能允许这项工作延续到下一年。

example.eg: I've got nothing to tell you beyond (= in addition to) what I told you earlier.
example.egtrans: 除了先前告诉你的以外，我没有别的可说了。

example.eg: The repercussions will be felt throughout the industry and beyond (= in other areas).
example.egtrans: 影响将波及整个产业及其他领域。

example.eg: Tonight's performance has been cancelled due to circumstances beyond our control (= events that we are unable to deal with).
example.egtrans: 由于出现了一些我们无法控制的情况，今晚的演出取消了。

example.eg: She has always lived beyond her means (= spent more than she has earned).
example.egtrans: 她生活总是入不敷出。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be more than or not limited to something

example.eg: The appeal of this device goes beyond convenience.
example.egtrans: 这个设备的特点不仅是便利。

example.eg: The behaviour of people with ADHD goes beyond occasional fidgeting or disorganization.
example.egtrans: 多动症患者的行为不仅仅是偶尔的坐立不安或无序。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: too great or bad for anyone to believe, repair, recognize, etc.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 太…而难以置信（无法修复，难以辨认等）

example.eg: His thoughtlessness is beyond belief.
example.egtrans: 他的轻率令人不可思议。

example.eg: He survived the accident, but his car was damaged beyond repair.
example.egtrans: 在车祸中他幸存了下来，但他的车却彻底报废了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: extremely excited, serious, angry, etc.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 极其兴奋、极其严肃、极其愤怒等

example.eg: She says she is beyond excited to see her son for the first time in more than three years.
example.egtrans: 她说，三年多来第一次见到她儿子，她感到极其兴奋。

example.eg: These days, I'm beyond happy.
example.egtrans: 这些天，我高兴极了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a legal case or a person's guilt is proved beyond reasonable doubt, there is enough proof for the person accused of a crime to be judged guilty.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （案件或罪行）证据确凿的，确实的

example.eg: Her guilt was established beyond reasonable doubt.
example.egtrans: 她的罪行确凿无疑。

dsense.name: beyond
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is beyond you, you are unable to understand it.

example.eg: Physics is completely beyond me.
example.egtrans: 恐怕我根本就学不会物理。

bill.name: bill
bill.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bill
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a request for payment of money owed, or the piece of paper on which it is written

example.eg: an electricity/gas/phone bill
example.egtrans: 电／煤气／电话费账单

example.eg: They sent us a bill for the work they had done.
example.egtrans: 他们寄给我们要求为其所提供工作支付酬金的账单。

example.eg: She ran up (= caused herself to have) a huge phone bill.
example.egtrans: 她的电话费大增。

example.eg: They asked the waitress for the bill.
example.egtrans: 他们叫女服务员把账单拿来。

example.eg: Could we have the bill, please?
example.egtrans: 请给我们结账好吗？

example.eg: Her mother agreed to foot (= pay) the bill.
example.egtrans: 她母亲同意付账单。

dsense.name: bill
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a formal statement of a planned new law that is discussed before being voted on

example.eg: The bill was amended (= changed).
example.egtrans: 议案被修订了。

example.eg: When a bill is passed in Parliament it becomes law.
example.egtrans: 一旦某项法案在议会通过，便成为法律。

example.eg: The bill was thrown out (= did not go past the first stage of discussion and will not become law).
example.egtrans: 这项议案被否决了。

dsense.name: bill
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper money

example.eg: a dollar/one-dollar bill
example.egtrans: 1美元的钞票

example.eg: a ten-dollar bill
example.egtrans: 面值10美元的钞票

dsense.name: bill
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the beak of a bird

dsense.name: bill
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a paper sign giving information about something, especially an event or performance

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be performing in a show

example.eg: There were lots of big names (= famous people) on the bill.
example.egtrans: 有许多明星参加演出。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be the most important actor in a show

bill.name: bill
bill.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bill
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give or send someone a bill asking for money that they owe for a product or service

example.eg: Please bill me for any expenses you incur.
example.egtrans: 请把你的所有花费都记在我的账上。

dsense.name: bill
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to advertise something with a particular description; to describe someone in a particular way in order to advertise them or make them known

example.eg: The movie was billed as a romantic comedy.
example.egtrans: 该电影被宣传成浪漫喜剧。

example.eg: The young author was billed as "the new Beckett."
example.egtrans: 这位年轻作家被吹捧为“新贝克特”。

trans_examp.trans_en: to list a person or performance on a programme of events

example.eg: She was billed to perform every night for a period of two weeks.
example.egtrans: 她被要求在两个星期内每晚出演。

bill.name: the Bill
bill.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the police

bloated.name: bloated
bloated.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: bloated
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: swollen and rounded because of containing too much air, liquid, or food

example.eg: a bloated stomach
example.egtrans: 鼓起的肚子

example.eg: a bloated (= uncomfortably full) feeling
example.egtrans: 饱胀感

dsense.name: bloated
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: larger or richer than necessary

example.eg: a bloated bureaucracy
example.egtrans: 臃肿的官僚机构

example.eg: a bloated capitalist
example.egtrans: 富得流油的资本家

body.name: body
body.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: body
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the whole physical structure that forms a person or animal

example.eg: A good diet and plenty of exercise will help you to keep your body healthy.
example.egtrans: 良好的饮食和充足的锻炼将有助于保持身体健康。

example.eg: She rubbed suncream over her entire body.
example.egtrans: 她全身都擦了防晒霜。

trans_examp.trans_en: the main part of a person's or animal's body, without the head, or without the head, arms, and legs

example.eg: He had a fat body but thin legs and arms.
example.egtrans: 他身上很胖，但腿和胳膊却很瘦。

trans_examp.trans_en: a dead person

example.eg: A body was washed up on the beach last week.
example.egtrans: 上周有具尸体被冲上了海滩。

trans_examp.trans_en: the painted metal shell of a vehicle, such as a car or an aircraft
a person

example.eg: How is a body supposed to live in these conditions?
example.egtrans: 人怎么可能住在这种环境里呢？

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of tight-fitting women's clothing that covers the top half of the body and fastens between the legs
trans_examp.trans_cn: （女子上半身穿的）连体紧身内衣

dsense.name: body
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people who have joined together for a particular reason

example.eg: a governing body
example.egtrans: 管理机构

example.eg: an advisory body
example.egtrans: 顾问团

example.eg: The RSPCA is a respected body working for animal welfare.
example.egtrans: 皇家防止虐待动物协会是一个致力于维护动物福利的受人尊重的团体。

example.eg: There is a large body of people who are unaware of their basic rights.
example.egtrans: 有很大一部分人没有意识到自己的基本权利。

example.eg: Chatsworth High School’s student body raised $5,000 for the charity.
example.egtrans: 查茨沃斯高中的学生团体为该慈善机构筹集了5千美元。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If people do something in a body, they do it together as a group, in an official way.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （以正式或官方的方式）全体一致地；一起地

example.eg: The cleaning staff went in a body to the manager to complain.
example.egtrans: 清洁工一起去找经理投诉。

dsense.name: body
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large amount of something

example.eg: There is a growing body of evidence to support their claim.
example.egtrans: 有越来越多的证据支持他们的说法。

example.eg: She collected a huge body of information on the subject.
example.egtrans: 她收集了大量有关这个主题的信息。

example.eg: A substantial body of opinion (= a large group of people with the same opinion) is opposed to any change.
example.egtrans: 很多人反对作任何变动。

trans_examp.trans_en: A body of water is a large area of water, such as a lake.

dsense.name: body
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the main part of a book, article, etc.

example.eg: I thought the most interesting details in the book were not in the body of the text, but in the notes at the end.
example.egtrans: 我认为本书最有趣的部分不在正文中，而在书后的注释中。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the main part of a large building

example.eg: to enter the body of the cathedral
example.egtrans: 进入大教堂的主体部分

dsense.name: body
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a separate object or mass

example.eg: The distance between the two bodies in space was measured daily.
example.egtrans: 每天都测量这两个天体在太空中的距离。

dsense.name: body
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a strong or thick quality

example.eg: This Bordeaux has plenty of body (= strong flavour).
example.egtrans: 这种波尔多葡萄酒味道浓郁香醇。

example.eg: Conditioner can give your hair more body.
example.egtrans: 护发素能使你的头发更浓密。

bogus.name: bogus
bogus.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: false, not real, or not legal
trans_examp.trans_cn: 假的；假冒的，伪造的；非法的

example.eg: On investigation, his claim was found to be bogus.
example.egtrans: 调查发现，他的说法并不属实。

example.eg: She produced some bogus documents to support her application.
example.egtrans: 她制作了一些伪造的文件来支持她的申请。

bounce.name: bounce
bounce.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause to) move up or away after hitting a surface

example.eg: The ball bounced off the goalpost and into the net.
example.egtrans: 球击中门柱弹进了球网。

example.eg: She bounced the ball quickly.
example.egtrans: 她快速地拍球。

example.eg: Her bag bounced (= moved up and down) against her side as she walked.
example.egtrans: 她走起路来身侧的挎包一颠一颠的。

example.eg: The children had broken the bed by bouncing (= jumping up and down) on it.
example.egtrans: 孩子们老在床上蹦，把床蹦坏了。

example.eg: He bounced the baby (= lifted it up and down) on his knee.
example.egtrans: 他把婴儿放在膝上颠着玩。

example.eg: Television pictures from all over the world are bounced off satellites (= are sent to and returned from them).
example.egtrans: 世界各地的电视画面都通过卫星转播。

trans_examp.trans_en: to move in an energetic and enthusiastic manner

example.eg: Tom bounced in, smiling broadly.
example.egtrans: 汤姆蹦蹦跳跳地进来了，脸上笑开了花。

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause a cheque to) not be paid or accepted by a bank because there is no money in the account
trans_examp.trans_cn: （因账上存款不敷）（使支票）拒付，退回

example.eg: I had to pay a penalty fee when my cheque bounced.
example.egtrans: 由于支票被银行拒付，我不得不付一笔罚金。

example.eg: To my horror the bank bounced the cheque.
example.egtrans: 令我震惊的是，银行拒付了支票。

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If an email that you send bounces or is bounced, it comes back to you because the address is wrong or there is a computer problem.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （电子邮件）被退回，发送（电子邮件）失败

bounce.name: bounce
bounce.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of bouncing, or the quality that makes something able to bounce

example.eg: In tennis you have to hit the ball before its second bounce.
example.egtrans: 打网球时必须在球第二次落地之前出手击打。

example.eg: This shampoo will give your hair bounce (= make it look attractively thick) and shine.
example.egtrans: 这种洗发精会使头发富有弹性和光泽。

dsense.name: bounce
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an improvement or change to a higher level, for example in how popular a politician or party is

example.eg: His speech to the convention may have given him a bounce.
example.egtrans: 他在大会做的演讲可能已让他一战成名。

example.eg: The city has seen a bounce in homicide.
example.egtrans: 这座城市杀人凶案数反弹了。

bound.name: bound
bound.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: certain or extremely likely to happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: 肯定的；极有可能的；必然的；注定了的

example.eg: You're bound to forget people's names occasionally.
example.egtrans: 你肯定会偶尔忘记别人的名字。

example.eg: You're bound to feel nervous about your interview.
example.egtrans: 面试时你很可能会感到紧张。

example.eg: These two young musicians are bound for international success (= are certain to be successful).
example.egtrans: 这两位年轻的音乐家一定会蜚声国际。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be seriously intending to do something

example.eg: They are bound and determined to build their own house someday.
example.egtrans: 他们坚信总有一天他们会盖起自己的房子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: I am certain

example.eg: He's in the pub, I'll be bound.
example.egtrans: 我敢肯定他在酒吧。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a moral or legal duty to do something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 受束缚的，受约束的；（法律或道德上）有义务的

example.eg: The company is bound by a special agreement to involve the union in important decisions.
example.egtrans: 公司受一项特殊协定的约束，须请工会参与重大决策。

example.eg: She feels (duty)-bound to tell him everything.
example.egtrans: 她觉得自己有义务告诉他一切。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: tied with rope, cord, string, etc.

example.eg: We found the girl bound and gagged.
example.egtrans: 我们发现女孩被绑住了，嘴也堵上了。

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a book) having a cover made of paper, leather, or other material

example.eg: The book was bound in shiny green leather.
example.egtrans: 该书是用闪亮的绿皮面装帧的。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: going to
trans_examp.trans_cn: 去…的；准备前往…的；开往…的

example.eg: She was on a plane bound for Moscow when she got sick.
example.egtrans: 她在前往莫斯科的飞机上突然生病了。

bound.name: bound
bound.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move quickly with large jumping movements

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to mark or form the limits of
trans_examp.trans_cn: 形成…的疆界；成为…的界线

example.eg: The town is bounded on one side by a river.
example.egtrans: 村庄的一边以一条河为界。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en:
past simple and past participle of
        
         bind

bound.name: bound
bound.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quick, long jump

example.eg: With one bound the dog was over the fence.
example.egtrans: 那条狗一下就跃过了篱笆。

dsense.name: bound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: legal or social limits
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （法律或社会的）界限；限制；限定区域

example.eg: The committee felt that newspaper coverage of the murder went beyond reasonable bounds.
example.egtrans: 委员会觉得报纸对谋杀案的报道超出了正常的范围。

example.eg: What you did was beyond/outside the bounds of acceptable behaviour.
example.egtrans: 你的所作所为令人无法接受。

example.eg: His desire for political power apparently knows no bounds (= seems to be unlimited).
example.egtrans: 他对政治权力的欲望显然没有止境。

bound.name: -bound
bound.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

dsense.name: -bound
dsense.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: travelling in the stated direction

example.eg: Northbound traffic is moving very slowly because of the accident.
example.egtrans: 由于交通事故，北去的车辆移动非常缓慢。

example.eg: The line did not close completely, but inbound and outbound trains (= trains which were arriving and leaving) had to share one of the two tracks near the station.
example.egtrans: 铁路线没有全部关闭，但进出站的火车只能使用车站附近两条轨道中的一条。

dsense.name: -bound
dsense.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: (causing people to be) unable to leave a place because of an unwanted condition

example.eg: During his long illness he was completely housebound (= he could not leave the house).
example.egtrans: 久病期间，他只能一直呆在家里。

example.eg: She has been wheelchair-bound for several years.
example.egtrans: 她已经坐轮椅好几年了。

example.eg: The airport was completely fogbound (= covered by fog).
example.egtrans: 机场完全被大雾封住了。

dsense.name: -bound
dsense.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe a book that is covered or held together in the stated way

example.eg: a leather-bound book
example.egtrans: 皮面书

example.eg: a spiral-bound notebook
example.egtrans: 螺旋钢丝装订的笔记本

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe clothes or other objects that have edges covered in the stated way

example.eg: leather-bound cuffs
example.egtrans: 镶皮边的袖口

boundless.name: boundless
boundless.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having no limit

example.eg: boundless optimism
example.egtrans: 无比乐观

example.eg: She has boundless energy and enthusiasm.
example.egtrans: 她有无穷的精力和无限的热情。

brace.name: brace
brace.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: brace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is used to support or connect things, or to make something stronger

example.eg: He was recently fitted with a brace for his bad back.
example.egtrans: 他最近因背部受伤戴了一个支撑架。

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of connected wires that is attached to a person's teeth in order to make them straight

example.eg: I had to wear a brace for my crooked teeth when I was a teenager.
example.egtrans: 十几岁时我不得不给我的畸形齿上戴上牙箍。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a pair of narrow straps that stretch from the front of the trousers over your shoulders to the back to hold them up

example.eg: a pair of braces
example.egtrans: 一副背带

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: metal supports that are fastened to the legs of people who have difficulties with walking
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （固定在腿部，协助行走的）腿部金属支撑物

dsense.name: brace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: two things of the same type, especially two wild birds that have been killed for sport or food
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指猎获的野鸟的）一双，一对

example.eg: a brace of pheasants
example.egtrans: 一对野鸡

brace.name: brace
brace.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: brace
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to support an object in order to stop it from falling down

example.eg: The side wall of the old house was braced with a wooden support.
example.egtrans: 老房子的边墙用木结构加固了。

dsense.name: brace
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to prepare yourself physically or mentally for something unpleasant
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （为困难或坏事）使防备；使作准备

example.eg: The passengers were told to brace themselves (= to press their bodies hard against something or hold them very stiff) for a crash landing.
example.egtrans: 乘客们被告知要做好迫降准备。

example.eg: She told me she had some bad news for me and I braced myself for a shock.
example.egtrans: 她说有坏消息要告诉我，我已做好了承受打击的准备。

bracket.name: bracket
bracket.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bracket
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: either of two symbols put around a word, phrase, or sentence in a piece of writing to show that what is between them should be considered as separate from the main part

example.eg: Biographical information is included in brackets.
example.egtrans: 括号里给出了作者的个人信息。

example.eg: You should include the date of publication in round brackets after the title.
example.egtrans: 你应该在题目后面的圆括号里注明出版日期。

dsense.name: bracket
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group with fixed upper and lower limits

example.eg: They were both surgeons in a high income bracket.
example.egtrans: 他俩都属于高收入阶层的外科医生。

example.eg: Most of our students are in the 18–22 age bracket.
example.egtrans: 我们大多数的学生都属于18至22岁这个年龄段。

example.eg: Her pay rise brought her into a new tax bracket.
example.egtrans: 她薪水的增加使她进入了新的纳税等级。

dsense.name: bracket
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of metal, wood, or plastic, usually L-shaped, that is fastened to a wall and used to support something such as a shelf
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通常呈L形、固定在墙上的）托架，支架，小壁架

dsense.name: bracket
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a diagram (= drawing) showing a series of games played in a tournament (= sports competition)

example.eg: In some tournaments, the full bracket is determined before the first game.
example.egtrans: 有些锦标赛的总赛程表在第一场比赛前就已经确定好了。

bracket.name: bracket
bracket.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bracket
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put brackets around words, phrases, numbers, etc.

example.eg: I've bracketed the parts of the text that could be omitted.
example.egtrans: 我已把文章可省略的部分用括号括起来了。

dsense.name: bracket
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you bracket two or more things or people, you consider them to be similar or connected to each other.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…相提并论；把…归入同一类

example.eg: He's often bracketed with the romantic poets of this period although this does not reflect the range of his work.
example.egtrans: 人们常常把他与这个时期的浪漫诗人相提并论，尽管这并不能反映出他的作品的涉猎范围。

branch.name: branch
branch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: branch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of something larger

example.eg: Immunology is a branch of biological science.
example.egtrans: 免疫学是生物科学的一个分支。

example.eg: One branch of their family (= one group of relatives) emigrated to Brazil.
example.egtrans: 他们家族的一支移居到了巴西。

example.eg: In the US, the president is part of the executive branch of the government.
example.egtrans: 在美国，总统是政府行政分支的一部分。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the offices or groups that form part of a large business organization
trans_examp.trans_cn: 分支机构；分部；分行；分店

example.eg: I used to work in the local branch of a large bank.
example.egtrans: 我曾在一家大型银行设在当地的分行工作。

example.eg: She's a branch manager.
example.egtrans: 她是个分部经理。

example.eg: Take the forms into your local branch office.
example.egtrans: 把这些表格带到你们的地方分部。

dsense.name: branch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the parts of a tree that grows out from the main trunk and has leaves, flowers, or fruit on it

example.eg: bare/leafy/flowering branches
example.egtrans: 光秃秃／叶子茂密／开满花的树枝

example.eg: The fruit on the lower branches was protected from the sun.
example.egtrans: 下边树枝上的果子见不到阳光。

example.eg: Watch out for overhanging branches.
example.egtrans: 小心下垂的树枝。

dsense.name: branch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a river or road that leaves the main part

example.eg: This branch of the river eventually empties into the Atlantic.
example.egtrans: 大河的这条支流最终注入大西洋。

dsense.name: branch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a smaller blood vessel or nerve that grows out of the main part

branch.name: branch
branch.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: branch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to produce branches

example.eg: The top of the tree had been cut off to encourage it to branch (out) lower down.
example.egtrans: 树冠已被砍去，目的是为了促使它从下面抽出新枝。

dsense.name: branch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to divide into two

example.eg: The road branches at the bottom of the hill.
example.egtrans: 公路在山脚下分岔。

brand.name: brand
brand.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of product made by a particular company

example.eg: This isn't my usual brand of deodorant.
example.egtrans: 这不是我通常用的那种牌子的除臭剂。

example.eg: When I go to a supermarket I usually buy own (US store) brands (= the cheaper products with the shop's own name on them).
example.egtrans: 我去超市时常常购买超市的自有品牌产品。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a particular type of something, or way of doing something

example.eg: a team that plays a distinctive brand of football
example.egtrans: 打法很独特的足球队

example.eg: Do you like his brand of humour?
example.egtrans: 你喜欢他那种幽默吗？

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of burning wood used to give light

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a mark that is burned or frozen into the skin of an animal such as a cow to show who owns it

example.eg: The brand was still visible on the animal's hide.
example.egtrans: 兽皮上还可以看见烙印。

brand.name: brand
brand.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say that you think someone is the sort of person that is stated

example.eg: Because of one minor offence he was branded (as) a common criminal.
example.egtrans: 由于一次小过错，他蒙上了罪犯的污名。

example.eg: The newspapers have branded the rebel MP a fool.
example.egtrans: 报纸谴责反叛的下院议员背信弃义。

dsense.name: brand
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to mark an animal such as a cow by burning or freezing its skin to show you own it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 打烙印于；以烙铁打（标记）

example.eg: The cattle were rounded up and branded.
example.egtrans: 那些牛都被圈了起来打上烙印。

brief.name: brief
brief.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: brief
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: lasting only a short time or containing few words

example.eg: His acceptance speech was mercifully brief.
example.egtrans: 幸而他的获奖感言很简短。

example.eg: I had a brief look at her report before the meeting.
example.egtrans: 会前我浏览了一下她的报告。

example.eg: It'll only be a brief visit because we really don't have much time.
example.egtrans: 我们的时间真的不多，所以只能作短暂的参观游览。

example.eg: After a brief spell/stint in the army, he started working as a teacher.
example.egtrans: 在部队呆了短暂的一段时间以后，他当起了教师。

example.eg: The company issued a brief statement about yesterday's accident.
example.egtrans: 那家公司就昨天的事故发表了简短的声明。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to express how quickly time goes past

example.eg: For a few brief weeks we were very happy.
example.egtrans: 在短短的几周里，我们过得十分愉快。

dsense.name: brief
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of clothes) very short

example.eg: She was wearing a fairly brief skirt, as I recall.
example.egtrans: 我记得她当时穿了件非常短的裙子。

brief.name: brief
brief.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone detailed instructions or information

example.eg: We had already been briefed about/on what the job would entail.
example.egtrans: 已经有人向我们介绍了工作内容。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make information about someone or something public, with the intention of criticizing/praising him, her, or it
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 通过非正式背景说明活动来否定/支持（人或事件），吹风否定/支持（人或事件）

example.eg: On several occasions government officials briefed against their own ministers.
example.egtrans: 政府官员曾数次以情况通报的方式批评部长们的做法。

brief.name: brief
brief.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: brief
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is said in brief, it is said in a very short form, with very few details.

example.eg: "So you didn't enjoy the party much." "In brief, no."
example.egtrans: “那么，你不喜欢这个聚会喽?”“简单说吧，不喜欢。”

dsense.name: brief
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a piece of underwear worn by men or women, covering the area between the waist and the tops of the legs

example.eg: cotton briefs
example.egtrans: 棉质内裤

dsense.name: brief
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.
