trans_examp.trans_en: a set of instructions or information

example.eg: It was my brief to make sure that the facts were set down accurately.
example.egtrans: 我的要求是确保准确记录所有事实。

trans_examp.trans_en: a document or set of documents containing the details about a court case

dsense.name: brief
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a lawyer who will speak for someone in a court of law

example.eg: My brief advised me to plead guilty.
example.egtrans: 我的律师建议我认罪。

briefly.name: briefly
briefly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: briefly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: for a short time

example.eg: We chatted briefly about the weather.
example.egtrans: 我们聊了几句天气。

dsense.name: briefly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: using few words or without giving a lot of details

example.eg: Briefly, the company needs to cut its expenditure.
example.egtrans: 简言之，公司需要缩减开支。

browse.name: browse
browse.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: browse
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to look through a book or magazine without reading everything, or to walk around a shop looking at several things without intending to buy any of them

example.eg: I was browsing through fashion magazines to find a new hairstyle.
example.egtrans: 我在浏览时尚杂志，想找一种新发型。

example.eg: "Are you looking for anything in particular, sir?" "No, I'm just browsing."
example.egtrans: “先生，您想要些什么?”“不，我只是随便看看。”

dsense.name: browse
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to look at information on the internet
trans_examp.trans_cn: 浏览（互联网）；在网上浏览（信息）

example.eg: to browse the Web
example.egtrans: 浏览万维网

dsense.name: browse
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of animals) to feed on grass, leaves, etc. in a relaxed way

example.eg: Deer were browsing (on grass) under the trees.
example.egtrans: 鹿正在树下悠闲地吃草。

browse.name: browse
browse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of browsing or period of time spent browsing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 随便看看，浏览；随便看看（或浏览）所花的时间

example.eg: We went for a browse around an antique shop.
example.egtrans: 我们去一家古董店随便看了看。

example.eg: I had a browse through the books on his desk.
example.egtrans: 我随便翻了翻他桌上的书。

Browser.name: browser
Browser.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: browser
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a computer program that makes it possible for you to read information on the internet

example.eg: a Web browser
example.egtrans: 网页浏览器

dsense.name: browser
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who browses, for example through books or goods for sale
trans_examp.trans_cn: 浏览者；随意观看（商品等）的人

buffer.name: buffer
buffer.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: buffer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something or someone that helps protect from harm
trans_examp.trans_cn: 缓冲物；起缓冲作用的人

example.eg: I bought a house as a buffer against inflation.
example.egtrans: 我买了一幢房子以缓解通货膨胀带来的影响。

trans_examp.trans_en: the metal parts at the front and back of a train or at the end of a track, that help protect the train and reduce damage if the train hits something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （火车的首尾或轨道末端的）减震器，缓冲器

trans_examp.trans_en: a chemical that keeps a liquid from becoming more or less acidic

dsense.name: buffer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an extra supply of materials that a company keeps in order to prevent a situation where none are available

example.eg: "Just-in-time production" means that no buffer stocks are held in the factory.
example.egtrans: “即时生产”意味着工厂里不留缓冲库存。

dsense.name: buffer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a silly old man

example.eg: Silly old buffer!
example.egtrans: 愚蠢的老古板！

buffer.name: buffer
buffer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: buffer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide protection against harm

dsense.name: buffer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: When a computer buffers information or buffers, it stores information temporarily in its memory while dealing with it or sending it.

built in.name: built-in
built in.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a place or piece of equipment has built-in objects, they are permanently connected and cannot be easily removed.

example.eg: built-in storage
example.egtrans: 嵌入式储物间

example.eg: All the rooms have built-in cupboards/wardrobes.
example.egtrans: 所有的房间都安装了嵌入式壁橱／衣橱。

trans_examp.trans_en: A built-in quality is an original part of something or someone and cannot be separated from it, him, or her.

example.eg: an built-in advantage/problem
example.egtrans: 内在的优势／固有的问题

bunch.name: bunch
bunch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: bunch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of things of the same type fastened together or in a close group

example.eg: a bunch of flowers/grapes/bananas/keys
example.egtrans: 一束花／一串葡萄／一串香蕉／一串钥匙

example.eg: The reorganization will give us a whole bunch (= a lot) of problems.
example.egtrans: 重组将会给我们带来一堆问题。

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people

example.eg: They're a bunch of jerks.
example.egtrans: 他们是一帮笨蛋。

example.eg: Your friends are a nice bunch.
example.egtrans: 你的一帮朋友都很好。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the best person or thing from a group of similar people or things
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 出类拔萃的人（或物）；精英；精品

example.eg: Send in your poems and we'll publish the best of the bunch.
example.egtrans: 把你的诗歌寄过来，我们将择优出版。

dsense.name: bunch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a girl has her hair in bunches, it is tied together in two parts with one at each side of her head.

example.eg: As a little girl she wore her hair in bunches.
example.egtrans: 小时候她把头发梳成两个小辫。

bundle.name: bundle
bundle.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of things that have been fastened or are held together

example.eg: a bundle of clothes/newspapers/books
example.egtrans: 一捆衣服／报纸／书

example.eg: a bundle of sticks
example.egtrans: 一捆柴火

bundle.name: bundle
bundle.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: bundle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to push or put someone or something somewhere quickly and roughly
trans_examp.trans_cn: 推搡；匆匆送走；乱堆；乱塞

example.eg: He bundled his clothes into the washing machine.
example.egtrans: 他把衣服塞进洗衣机里。

example.eg: She was bundled into the back of the car.
example.egtrans: 她被匆匆推进了车后座上。

example.eg: The children were bundled off to school early that morning.
example.egtrans: 那天一大早孩子们就被匆匆送往学校。

dsense.name: bundle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to include an extra computer program or other product with something that you sell
trans_examp.trans_cn: （计算机软件等的）捆绑销售；搭售

example.eg: The system came bundled with a word processor, spreadsheet, and graphics program.
example.egtrans: 这个系统销售时还外带文字处理、电子制表和图像制作软件。

cadence.name: cadence
cadence.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: cadence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the regular rise and fall of the voice

dsense.name: cadence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of chords (= different notes played together) at the end of a piece of music

call.name: call
call.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone or something a name, or to know or address someone by a particular name

example.eg: They've called the twins Edward and Thomas.
example.egtrans: 他们给双胞胎取名为爱德华和托马斯。

example.eg: What's that actor called that we saw in the film last night?
example.egtrans: 我们昨晚在电影里看到的那个演员叫什么名字？

example.eg: His real name is Jonathan, but they've always called him Johnny.
example.egtrans: 他的真名叫乔纳森，但他们总是叫他“约翰尼”。

example.eg: What's her new novel called?
example.egtrans: 她的新小说叫什么名字？

example.eg: I wish he wouldn't keep calling me "dear" - it's so patronizing!
example.egtrans: 我希望他不要老是叫我“亲爱的”——太居高临下了！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a person, especially a child, calls someone names, he or she addresses that person with a name that is intended to be offensive.

example.eg: Tom's worried that if he wears glasses at school the other children will call him names.
example.egtrans: 汤姆担心如果他在学校戴眼镜会被其他孩子取笑。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use a phone to talk to someone

example.eg: He called (you) last night when you were out.
example.egtrans: 昨晚你不在时，他（给你）打过电话。

example.eg: She called (me) this morning at the office and we had a brief chat.
example.egtrans: 今天早上她打电话到我的办公室，我们简短地闲聊了会儿。

example.eg: I've been calling all morning but I can't get through.
example.egtrans: 我一早上都在打电话，可是没打通。

example.eg: Do you think we should call the police?
example.egtrans: 你觉得我们应该报警吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make a phone call that is paid for by the person who receives it

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to consider someone or something to be

example.eg: He knows a lot of people, but only one or two that he'd call close friends.
example.egtrans: 他认识很多人，但他称之为亲密朋友的只有一两个。

example.eg: One sandwich and a lettuce leaf - I don't call that a meal!
example.egtrans: 一个三明治和一片生菜叶——我可不把那叫一顿饭！

example.eg: I'm not calling you a liar - I'm just suggesting that you misunderstood the facts of the situation.
example.egtrans: 我没说你在撒谎——我只是提醒一下，你误解了实际情形。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to consider something as belonging to you

example.eg: I don't aspire to anything very grand - I just want a place I can call my own.
example.egtrans: 我不奢望特别气派的东西——我只想拥有一个属于我自己的地方。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say something in a loud voice, especially in order to attract someone's attention, or (of animals) to make a loud, high sound, especially to another animal

example.eg: Someone in the crowd called (out) his name.
example.egtrans: 人群中有人大声叫（出）他的名字。

example.eg: Did you call?
example.egtrans: 是你在叫吗？

example.eg: "Hey, you! Come over here!" she called.
example.egtrans: “嗨，你！到这儿来！”她叫道。

example.eg: The blackbird called to its mate.
example.egtrans: 乌鸫呼唤它的配偶。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to ask people in a meeting to stop talking so that the meeting can continue
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 要求（会场）安静下来，要求别吵

example.eg: She called for order/called the meeting to order.
example.egtrans: 她要求会场安静下来。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to ask someone to come to you

example.eg: She called me over to where she was sitting.
example.egtrans: 她把我叫到了她坐着的地方。

example.eg: I keep the bedroom door open in case the children call (for) me in the night.
example.egtrans: 我让卧室门开着，以防孩子们晚上叫我。

example.eg: I was called to an emergency meeting this morning.
example.egtrans: 我今早被叫去参加一个紧急会议。

example.eg: At school she was always being called into the headteacher's office.
example.egtrans: 在学校时，她总是被叫到校长办公室去。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to visit someone, especially for a short time

example.eg: The electrician must have called (round) this morning when we were out - there's a note on the door mat.
example.egtrans: 今天上午我们出去的时候电工一定来过了——门垫上留了张字条。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to decide officially to have a particular event or take particular action

example.eg: The managing director has called a meeting to discuss pay levels.
example.egtrans: 总经理决定召开会议商讨工资标准。

example.eg: The papers are predicting that the prime minister will call an election in the spring.
example.egtrans: 报纸预言首相将宣布在春季举行大选。

example.eg: It's reckoned that the unions will call a strike if management will not agree to their demands.
example.egtrans: 如果管理层不同意他们的要求，预计工会将发动罢工。

example.eg: They had to call a halt to (= end) the match because of the heavy rain.
example.egtrans: 因为下大雨，他们不得不中止了比赛。

call.name: call
call.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of using the phone

example.eg: I got a call from an old college friend last night.
example.egtrans: 昨晚我接到了一位大学老友的电话。

example.eg: If there are any calls for me, could you write them down next to the phone?
example.egtrans: 如果有我的电话，你能在电话边记一下吗？

example.eg: I've just got a couple of calls to make.
example.egtrans: 我正要打几个电话。

example.eg: That decorator you called about painting the house - did he ever return your call?
example.egtrans: 为粉刷房子的事你打电话找的那个油漆工——他给你回过电话了吗？

example.eg: The radio station received a lot of calls complaining about the show's bad language.
example.egtrans: 广播电台接到很多电话，投诉那个节目用语污秽。

example.eg: Before six o'clock, calls are charged at peak rate.
example.egtrans: 6点之前，拨打电话按高峰费率收费。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the sound an animal makes or the sound of someone shouting something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 叫声；呼喊，呼叫；（动物的）鸣叫声

example.eg: The whale has a very distinctive call.
example.egtrans: 鲸的叫声很特别。

example.eg: She could hear calls for help from inside the burning building.
example.egtrans: 她能听到从燃烧的大楼里传出的呼救声。

example.eg: I'll be in the next room, so give me a call if you need any help.
example.egtrans: 我会在隔壁房间，需要帮助就叫我。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of people wanting or needing a particular thing

example.eg: There's not much call for fur coats these days.
example.egtrans: 现在人们对毛皮大衣的需求量不大。

example.eg: I certainly don't think there's any call for that sort of language, young lady!
example.egtrans: 我的确认为没有必要说那样的话，小姐！

trans_examp.trans_en: a demand for something to happen

example.eg: Management have so far ignored the union's calls for stricter safety regulations.
example.egtrans: 迄今为止管理层一直无视工会对加强安全规章的呼吁。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a short visit, especially an official one made by someone whose job is connected with health
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指正式的）短暂拜访；（通常指医疗从业者的）出诊

example.eg: Doctor Seward is out on a call this morning.
example.egtrans: 苏厄德医生今天上午出诊去了。

example.eg: The nurse has got a few calls to make this afternoon.
example.egtrans: 护士今天下午有几次出诊。

example.eg: I thought I'd pay a call on (= visit) an old friend of mine this weekend.
example.egtrans: 我想这个周末去拜访一位老朋友。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a decision

example.eg: It was a tough call, but eventually I decided to give up my job.
example.egtrans: 尽管做这个决定很难，但我最终还是打算辞职。

example.eg: More investment? That's got to be your call - you're the one that's paying!
example.egtrans: 增加投资？这该由你来决定——毕竟你是付款人。

called.name: call
called.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone or something a name, or to know or address someone by a particular name

example.eg: They've called the twins Edward and Thomas.

example.egtrans: 6点之前，拨打电话按高峰费率收费。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the sound an animal makes or the sound of someone shouting something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 叫声；呼喊，呼叫；（动物的）鸣叫声

example.eg: The whale has a very distinctive call.
example.egtrans: 鲸的叫声很特别。

example.eg: She could hear calls for help from inside the burning building.
example.egtrans: 她能听到从燃烧的大楼里传出的呼救声。

example.eg: I'll be in the next room, so give me a call if you need any help.
example.egtrans: 我会在隔壁房间，需要帮助就叫我。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of people wanting or needing a particular thing

example.eg: There's not much call for fur coats these days.
example.egtrans: 现在人们对毛皮大衣的需求量不大。

example.eg: I certainly don't think there's any call for that sort of language, young lady!
example.egtrans: 我的确认为没有必要说那样的话，小姐！

trans_examp.trans_en: a demand for something to happen

example.eg: Management have so far ignored the union's calls for stricter safety regulations.
example.egtrans: 迄今为止管理层一直无视工会对加强安全规章的呼吁。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a short visit, especially an official one made by someone whose job is connected with health
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指正式的）短暂拜访；（通常指医疗从业者的）出诊

example.eg: Doctor Seward is out on a call this morning.
example.egtrans: 苏厄德医生今天上午出诊去了。

example.eg: The nurse has got a few calls to make this afternoon.
example.egtrans: 护士今天下午有几次出诊。

example.eg: I thought I'd pay a call on (= visit) an old friend of mine this weekend.
example.egtrans: 我想这个周末去拜访一位老朋友。

dsense.name: call
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a decision

example.eg: It was a tough call, but eventually I decided to give up my job.
example.egtrans: 尽管做这个决定很难，但我最终还是打算辞职。

example.eg: More investment? That's got to be your call - you're the one that's paying!
example.egtrans: 增加投资？这该由你来决定——毕竟你是付款人。

caller.name: caller
caller.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: caller
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who makes a phone call, especially a member of the public who calls a radio or television programme while it is being broadcast
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指给电台或电视台直播节目）打（进）电话的人

example.eg: I'd just like to comment on what your previous caller was saying.
example.egtrans: 我只想就前一位打进电话的人所说的事情谈谈我的看法。

dsense.name: caller
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a visitor

candidate.name: candidate
candidate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who is competing to get a job or elected position

example.eg: There are three candidates standing in the election.
example.egtrans: 有3位候选人参加竞选。

trans_examp.trans_en: a person or thing considered likely to receive or experience something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可能有…结局者，被认定会经历…者

example.eg: The English Department is a likely candidate for staff cuts.
example.egtrans: 英语系很有可能要裁员。

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who is taking an exam

example.eg: Candidates must write their names on the top page of the exam paper.
example.egtrans: 考生必须将自己的名字写在试卷首页。

capability.name: capability
capability.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: capability
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability to do something

example.eg: These tests are beyond the capability of an average twelve-year-old.
example.egtrans: 这些测试超出了一个普通12岁孩子的能力。

example.eg: With the new machines we finally have the capability (= power) to do the job properly.
example.egtrans: 有了新机器，我们终于有能力很好地完成该工作。

dsense.name: capability
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the number of weapons, soldiers, etc. a country has to fight a war

example.eg: Several countries are trying to develop a nuclear capability.
example.egtrans: 几个国家正在试图发展核力量。

capable.name: capable
capable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to do things effectively and skilfully, and to achieve results
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有能力的；熟练的；能干的

example.eg: She's a very capable woman/worker/judge.
example.egtrans: 她是个很能干的女人／很熟练的工人／能力很强的法官。

example.eg: We need to get an assistant who's capable and efficient.
example.egtrans: 我们需要一个能力强、效率高的助理。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: having the ability, power, or qualities to be able to do something

example.eg: Only the Democratic Party is capable of running the country.
example.egtrans: 只有民主党才有能力治理这个国家。

example.eg: A force ten wind is capable of blowing the roofs off houses.
example.egtrans: 10级的大风能吹走屋顶。

example.eg: When she's drunk she's capable of saying (= likely to say) awful, rude things.
example.egtrans: 她喝醉后会说些难听粗鲁的话。

example.eg: I think your plan is capable of being (= could be) improved.
example.egtrans: 我认为你的计划还可以改进。

capable.name: -capable
capable.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: added to nouns to form adjectives that mean able to use the stated thing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可…的，有…能力的（加在名次后形成形容词）

example.eg: These are nuclear-capable aircraft (= they can carry nuclear weapons).
example.egtrans: 这些飞机可载核武器。

capitalize.name: capitalize
capitalize.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: capitalize
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to write a letter of the alphabet as a capital, or to write the first letter of a word as a capital
trans_examp.trans_cn: 用大写字母书写；大写首字母

example.eg: The names of political parties are always capitalized, e.g. the Green Party.
example.egtrans: 政党名称的首字母总是要大写，如 the Green Party。

dsense.name: capitalize
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to supply money to a business so that it can develop or operate as it should

capture.name: capture
capture.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: capture
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take someone as a prisoner, or to take something into your possession, especially by force
trans_examp.trans_cn: 俘虏；俘获；（尤指用武力）夺取

example.eg: Two of the soldiers were killed and the rest were captured.
example.egtrans: 两名士兵被杀，其余被俘。

example.eg: Rebel forces captured the city after a week-long battle.
example.egtrans: 叛军经过一周的战斗攻取了该市。

trans_examp.trans_en: to succeed in getting something when you are competing with other people

example.eg: The Democratic Party captured 70 percent of the vote.
example.egtrans: 民主党获得了70%的选票。

dsense.name: capture
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to represent or describe something very accurately using words or images
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用文字或图象）表现，描绘，刻画

example.eg: It would be impossible to capture her beauty in a painting.
example.egtrans: 她的美无法用画笔描绘。

trans_examp.trans_en: to record or take a picture of something using a camera

example.eg: A passer-by captured the whole incident on film.
example.egtrans: 一位路人拍摄下了事件的全过程。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a computer or similar machine captures information, it takes it in and stores it.

dsense.name: capture
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something captures your imagination or attention, you feel very interested and excited by it.

example.eg: The American drive to land a man on the Moon captured the imagination/attention of the whole world.
example.egtrans: 美国的载人登月行动引起了全世界的遐想／关注。

careful.name: careful
careful.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: giving a lot of attention to what you are doing so that you do not have an accident, make a mistake, or damage something

example.eg: Be careful with the glasses.
example.egtrans: 小心玻璃杯。

example.eg: Be careful where you put that hot pan.
example.egtrans: 要注意把热锅放在合适的地方。

example.eg: Be careful to look both ways when you cross the road.
example.egtrans: 过马路时要注意向两边看。

example.eg: Michael is a very careful worker.
example.egtrans: 迈克尔工作起来很细心。

example.eg: After careful consideration of your proposal, I regret to say that we are unable to accept it.
example.egtrans: 仔细考虑了你的建议后，我很遗憾地告诉你我们不能接受。

example.eg: He's in a really foul temper so be careful (about/of) what you say to him.
example.egtrans: 他心情很糟，所以跟他说话要当心。

caret.name: caret
caret.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the symbol ^ , found on a keyboard and used in marking text
a cursor on a screen that shows where text should be entered

cascade.name: cascade
cascade.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small waterfall, often one of a group
trans_examp.trans_cn: 小瀑布（常指瀑布群的分支）

trans_examp.trans_en: a large amount of something that hangs down

example.eg: A cascade of golden hair fell down his back.
example.egtrans: 金发如瀑布般披散在他的肩头。

cascade.name: cascade
cascade.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: cascade
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fall quickly and in large amounts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 如瀑布般下落；大量倾泻

example.eg: Coins cascaded from/out of the fruit machine.
example.egtrans: 大量硬币从吃角子老虎机中倾泻而出。

dsense.name: cascade
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pass on information by giving it to just a few people, who then give it to more people; to be passed on in this way

example.eg: Guest information is cascaded through employee shift briefings.
example.egtrans: 客人信息是在员工轮班简报时传达的。

example.eg: Communication cascades down the organization until the information has been communicated through each level, to the front lines.
example.egtrans: 整个组织逐级沟通，直到信息通过各阶层传达到一线员工。

catch.name: catch
catch.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take hold of something, especially something that is moving through the air

example.eg: I managed to catch the glass before it hit the ground.
example.egtrans: 我在玻璃杯落地之前接住了它。

example.eg: We saw the eagle swoop from the sky to catch its prey.
example.egtrans: 我们看到老鹰从空中猛扑下去抓捕猎物。

example.eg: Our dog ran past me and out of the house before I could catch it.
example.egtrans: 我们的狗从我身边跑过，我没抓住，让它跑出了屋子。

example.eg: He caught hold of my arm.
example.egtrans: 他一把抓住了我的胳膊。

example.eg: We placed saucepans on the floor to catch (= collect) the drops of water coming through the roof.
example.egtrans: 我们把平底锅放在地上接屋顶漏下的水。

example.eg: The batsman was caught (out) (= someone in the other team caught the ball when he hit it).
example.egtrans: 击球手击出的球被接住了。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to find and stop a person or animal that is trying to escape

example.eg: Great pressure was put on the police to catch the terrorists as soon as possible.
example.egtrans: 警方面临着很大的压力，要尽早抓获恐怖分子。

example.eg: Two armed men were caught trying to cross the frontier at night.
example.egtrans: 两名武装分子企图在夜间越境时被抓获。

example.eg: They were happy because they had caught a lot of fish that day.
example.egtrans: 那天他们很高兴，因为抓到了很多鱼。

example.eg: I can see you're busy right now, so I'll catch you (= speak to you) later.
example.egtrans: 看得出你现在很忙，一会儿再跟你说。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to discover, see, or realize something, especially someone doing something wrong

example.eg: He caught her reading his old love letters.
example.egtrans: 她看他过去的情书时被他撞见了。

example.eg: If the virus is caught (= discovered) in time, most patients can be successfully treated.
example.egtrans: 要是能及时发现病毒，大多数患者都可以治愈。

example.eg: I caught sight of/caught a glimpse of (= saw for a moment) a red coat in the crowd.
example.egtrans: 我在人群中看到／瞥见一个穿红色外套的人。

phrase.phrase_title: catch sb's attention, imagination, interest, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make someone notice something and feel interested
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 引起…的注意（想象，兴趣等）

example.eg: A ship out at sea caught his attention.
example.egtrans: 一艘出海的船吸引了他的注意。

example.eg: Her pictures caught my imagination.
example.egtrans: 她的照片引起了我的遐想。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not have something, especially when it is needed
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （尤指在需要的时候）没有，缺乏

example.eg: He doesn't like to be caught without any biscuits in the house.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢家里备些饼干。

phrase.phrase_title: you won't catch sb doing sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: said to mean that you will certainly not see someone doing a particular thing or in a particular place

example.eg: You won't catch me at work after four o'clock.
example.egtrans: 别指望我4点以后工作。

example.eg: You won't catch Carla eating in a cheap restaurant, oh no.
example.egtrans: 卡拉不可能在便宜的餐馆吃饭，不可能的。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to travel or be able to travel on an aircraft, train, bus, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 赶，乘，搭乘（飞机、火车、公共汽车等）

example.eg: He always catches the 10.30 a.m. train to work.
example.egtrans: 他总是乘上午10点30分的那班火车上班。

example.eg: She was worried that she'd arrive too late to catch the last bus home.
example.egtrans: 她担心到得太晚，赶不上回家的末班车。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get an illness, especially one caused by bacteria or a virus
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指因感染细菌或病毒）患（病），染（疾）

example.eg: He caught a cold on holiday.
example.egtrans: 他度假时患了感冒。

example.eg: A lot of children in the school caught measles last term.
example.egtrans: 上学期许多在校的孩子得了麻疹。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stick somewhere, or to make something stick somewhere

example.eg: The sleeve of my jacket (got) caught on the door handle and ripped.
example.egtrans: 我的夹克衫的袖子钩在了门把手上，给扯破了。

example.eg: Her hair got caught (up) in her hairdryer.
example.egtrans: 她的头发缠在了吹风机上。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to manage to be in time to see or do something

example.eg: I went home early to catch the beginning of the programme.
example.egtrans: 为了看到节目的开头，我就稍微早了一点回家。

example.eg: You'll have to run if you want to catch the post (= send a letter before the post has been collected).
example.egtrans: 要是你想赶得上寄信，就得赶紧了。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to manage to hear something

example.eg: I couldn't catch what the announcer said, with all the other noise going on.
example.egtrans: 这么吵，我听不清播音员在说什么。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hit something, especially without intending to

example.eg: His head caught the edge of the table as he fell.
example.egtrans: 他摔倒的时候头撞到了桌子边。

example.eg: Medical teams were caught in the crossfire of the opposing armies.
example.egtrans: 医疗队陷入了敌军的交叉火力中。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to become involved in something, often without wanting to

example.eg: They were having an argument and somehow I got caught up in it.
example.egtrans: 他们在争论，不知怎地把我给卷了进去。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to stop breathing for a moment, or to begin to breathe correctly again after running or other exercise
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 屏住呼吸；（跑步或运动后）调整呼吸

example.eg: I had to sit down and catch my breath.
example.egtrans: 我只好坐下喘口气。

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you have caught the sun, the sun has made your skin a slightly darker brown or red colour.

example.eg: You've caught the sun on the back of your neck.
example.egtrans: 你脖子后面晒黑了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something catches the light, a light shines on it and makes it look shiny.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 被光照射；在光照下闪闪发亮

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to begin to burn

example.eg: This wood's too wet, the fire won't catch.
example.egtrans: 木头太湿，点不着。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to start burning

example.eg: For reasons which are not yet known, the factory caught fire late yesterday evening.
example.egtrans: 昨晚工厂失火，原因尚不清楚。

catch.name: catch
catch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a hidden problem or disadvantage
trans_examp.trans_cn: 隐藏的问题；暗藏的不利因素

example.eg: Free food? It sounds too good to be true. What's the catch?
example.egtrans: 免费食物？这么好的事，不像是真的。这里面有什么蹊跷？

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of fish caught

example.eg: The fishermen were disappointed with their catch that day.
example.egtrans: 渔夫们不满意当天的收获。

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who is considered to be very suitable for a relationship

example.eg: Her new boyfriend's not much of a catch really, is he?
example.egtrans: 她的新男朋友和她不太般配，是吧？

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small device on a door, window, bag, etc. that keeps it fastened

dsense.name: catch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a feeling of stiffness in part of your body

example.eg: She would complain of catch in the joints during winter.
example.egtrans: 冬天的时候她会说自己关节僵硬。

caution.name: caution
caution.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: caution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: great care and attention

example.eg: We need to proceed with/exercise caution (= be careful in taking action, making decisions, etc.)
example.egtrans: 我们必须谨慎行事。

example.eg: They treated the story of his escape with (some/great/extreme) caution (= thought that it might not be true).
example.egtrans: 他们对他逃跑的报道有些／相当／极为怀疑。

dsense.name: caution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a spoken warning given by a police officer or official to someone who has broken the law

example.eg: As it was her first offence, she was only given a caution.
example.egtrans: 由于是初犯，所以只给了她一个口头警告。

trans_examp.trans_en: advice or a warning

example.eg: Just a word of caution - the cheaper models probably aren't worth buying.
example.egtrans: 只是提醒一句——更为便宜的型号很可能不值得购买。

dsense.name: caution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a punishment for breaking the rules in a football game in which the referee writes the player's name in a book and holds up a yellow card
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球比赛中，裁判出示黄牌作出的）警告

caution.name: caution
caution.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: caution
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If the police caution someone, they give them an official warning.
to warn someone

example.eg: The newspaper cautioned its readers against buying shares without getting good advice first.
example.egtrans: 报纸告诫读者事先没有获得好的建议，不要购买股票。

dsense.name: caution
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a football referee cautions a player, he punishes them for breaking the rules by writing their name in a book and holding up a yellow card.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球比赛中，裁判出示黄牌）警告

certain.name: certain
certain.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: certain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having no doubt or knowing exactly that something is true, or known to be true, correct, exact, or effective
trans_examp.trans_cn: 肯定的，无疑的；有把握的；确定的

example.eg: Are you absolutely certain (that) you gave them the right number?
example.egtrans: 你敢肯定你给他们的号码没错吗？

example.eg: I feel certain (that) you're doing the right thing.
example.egtrans: 我确信你做得对。

example.eg: You should make certain (that) everyone understands the instructions.
example.egtrans: 你应该确保大家都能听懂指令。

example.eg: The police seem certain (that) they will find the people responsible for the attack.
example.egtrans: 警方似乎确信他们会查出这起袭击事件的责任人。

example.eg: I'm not certain how much it will cost.
example.egtrans: 我不能确定这要花费多少钱。

example.eg: He was quite certain about/of his attacker's identity.
example.egtrans: 他对袭击他的人的身份很肯定。

example.eg: One thing is certain - she won't resign willingly.
example.egtrans: 有一点是肯定的——她不会心甘情愿地辞职。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to know or say something without doubt

example.eg: I don't know for certain if she's coming.
example.egtrans: 我不能肯定她是否会来。

example.eg: I can't say for certain how long I'll be there.
example.egtrans: 我说不准我在那儿会呆多久。

dsense.name: certain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: impossible to avoid or extremely likely
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不可避免地，必然地；极可能地

example.eg: The population explosion is certain to cause widespread famine.
example.egtrans: 人口激增必然会引起大范围的饥荒。

example.eg: Oil prices are certain to rise following the agreement to limit production.
example.egtrans: 限制石油生产的协议签订后油价必然会上涨。

example.eg: After all his hard work, he's certain to pass his exams.
example.egtrans: 凭他这么用功，一定会通过考试的。

example.eg: The team looks almost certain to win the match.
example.egtrans: 这支球队看上去几乎准能赢得比赛。

example.eg: It is virtually certain (that) she will win the gold medal.
example.egtrans: 几乎可以肯定她会赢得金牌。

example.eg: Even if a ceasefire can be agreed, how can they make certain (that) neither side breaks it?
example.egtrans: 即便双方都同意停火，又怎么能确保他们不会出尔反尔呢？

example.eg: Cancer sufferers no longer face certain death as they once did.
example.egtrans: 癌症患者不再像从前那样面临着必死的命运了。

example.eg: This scandal will mean certain defeat for the party in the election.
example.egtrans: 这一丑闻将意味着该党在选举中必败无疑。

dsense.name: certain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: named but neither famous nor known well

example.eg: I had lunch today with a certain George Michael - not the George Michael, I should explain.
example.egtrans: 我今天和一位叫乔治‧迈克尔的人共进了午餐——我得说明一下，不是那个乔治‧迈克尔。

dsense.name: certain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: limited

example.eg: I like modern art to a certain extent/degree, but I don't like the really experimental stuff.
example.egtrans: 在一定程度上我还是喜欢现代艺术的，可是不喜欢太实验性的东西。

certain.name: certain
certain.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

trans_examp.trans_en: particular but not named or described
trans_examp.trans_cn: （没有指明或描述的）某，某个，某些

example.eg: We have certain reasons for our decision, which have to remain confidential.
example.egtrans: 我们作出这样的决定是有一定原因的，这些原因仍得保密。

example.eg: Do you think war is justifiable in certain circumstances?
example.egtrans: 你是否认为在某些情况下战争是正当的？

example.eg: Certain members of the audience may disagree with what I'm about to say.
example.egtrans: 听众中某些人可能会对我要说的话有异议。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used before a noun when it is difficult to describe something exactly or give its exact amount
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用于名词之前，用于表示难以描述或估算的）某一个，某一种

example.eg: The song has a certain appeal, but I'm not sure what it is.
example.egtrans: 这首歌有某种感染力，可是我说不出到底是什么。

certain.name: certain
certain.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: some

example.eg: Certain of the candidates were well below the usual standard, but others were very good indeed.
example.egtrans: 有些候选人离通常的标准差得很远，但其他一些确实很出色。

certainly.name: certainly
certainly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: certainly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to reply completely or to emphasize something and show that there is no doubt about it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于肯定的答复或强调）当然，毫无疑问，确实，肯定

example.eg: She certainly had a friend called Mark, but I don't know whether he was her boyfriend.
example.egtrans: 她确实有个朋友叫马克，不过我不知道他是不是她男友。

example.eg: "This is rather a difficult question." "Yes, it's certainly not easy."
example.egtrans: “这实在是个难题。”“是呀，确实不容易。”

example.eg: "Do you think more money should be given to education?" "Certainly!"
example.egtrans: “你认为应当给教育拨更多经费吗?”“当然啦！”

example.eg: "Had you forgotten about our anniversary?" "Certainly not! I've reserved a table at Michel's restaurant for this evening."
example.egtrans: “你是不是把我们的结婚纪念日给忘了?”“当然没有！我已经在米歇尔餐厅预订了今晚的桌位。”

trans_examp.trans_en: used when agreeing or disagreeing strongly to a request
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于对请求表示强烈同意或不同意）当然，行

example.eg: "Could you lend me £10?" "Certainly."
example.egtrans: “你能借给我10英镑吗？”“当然可以。”

example.eg: "Did you take any money out of my purse?" "Certainly not!"
example.egtrans: “你是不是从我钱包里拿钱了?”“绝对没有！”

dsense.name: certainly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very likely to happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: 必然地；很有可能发生地

example.eg: She will certainly win the election if the opinion polls are accurate.
example.egtrans: 如果民意调查准确无误，她定会赢得这场选举。

certainty.name: certainty
certainty.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: certainty
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that cannot be doubted
trans_examp.trans_cn: 确定的事情；必然的事情

example.eg: There are few absolute certainties in life.
example.egtrans: 世事无绝对。

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of being completely confident or having no doubt about something

example.eg: I'm unable to answer that question with any certainty.
example.egtrans: 我不能确切地回答出那个问题。

dsense.name: certainty
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is very likely to happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: 必然的事；很有可能发生的事

example.eg: Joan will win - that's a certainty.
example.egtrans: 琼会赢的——这是必然的。

example.eg: Joan is a certainty to win.
example.egtrans: 琼一定会赢。

channel.name: channel
channel.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: channel
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a television station

example.eg: a cable/terrestrial/satellite channel
example.egtrans: 有线／地面／卫星频道

example.eg: a music/movie/news/shopping/sports channel
example.egtrans: 音乐／电影／新闻／购物／体育频道

example.eg: the news on Channel 4
example.egtrans: 四频道的新闻

example.eg: She switched/turned to another channel to watch football.
example.egtrans: 她换到另一个频道看足球赛。

dsense.name: channel
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a passage for water or other liquids to flow along, or a part of a river or other area of water that is deep and wide enough to provide a route for ships to travel along
trans_examp.trans_cn: （水或其他液体流通的）管道，渠道；航道

example.eg: There are drainage/irrigation channels all over this flat agricultural land.
example.egtrans: 在这片平坦的农田上遍布着排水／灌溉渠。

example.eg: The boats all have to pass through this narrow channel.
example.egtrans: 所有船只都必须通过这条狭窄的航道。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the area of sea that separates England from France

example.eg: We're going to have a day-trip across the Channel.
example.egtrans: 我们将进行一次横渡英吉利海峡的一日游。

example.eg: We took the car to France overnight on a (cross-)channel ferry.
example.egtrans: 我们用横渡英吉利海峡的渡船把汽车运到了法国。

dsense.name: channel
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of communicating with people or getting something done

example.eg: We must open the channels of communication between the two countries.
example.egtrans: 我们必须打开两国之间的交流渠道。

example.eg: The government pursued every diplomatic/official channel to free the hostages.
example.egtrans: 政府寻求一切外交／官方渠道以使人质获释。

example.eg: Complaints should be made through the proper/usual channels.
example.egtrans: 应当通过适当的／正常的渠道进行投诉。

dsense.name: channel
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of making a product, information, etc. available
trans_examp.trans_cn: （提供产品、信息等的）渠道，方法

example.eg: The insurer sells its products through a variety of distribution channels, including banks.
example.egtrans: 保险公司通过包括银行在内的各种渠道销售其产品。

dsense.name: channel
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a route or way out of an airport or port where travellers' bags are examined
trans_examp.trans_cn: （机场或港口检查旅客行李的）通道

example.eg: If you have nothing to declare, go through the green channel.
example.egtrans: 如果你没有东西要申报，就走绿色通道。

example.eg: Goods to declare - use the red channel.
example.egtrans: 有商品要报税——走红色通道。

channel.name: channel
channel.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: channel
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to direct something into a particular place or situation

example.eg: Ditches were constructed to channel water away from the buildings.
example.egtrans: 修造了沟渠把水引离建筑物。

example.eg: If she could only channel all that energy into something useful.
example.egtrans: 要是她能把那些精力都倾注到有用的事情上就好了。

example.eg: A lot of money has been channelled into research in that particular field.
example.egtrans: 大笔经费投入到了那个领域的研究中。

dsense.name: channel
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to behave like or copy another person, so that you almost seem to be that other person

example.eg: The band were dressed in 1960s outfits and seemed to be channelling the Beatles.
example.egtrans: 这支乐队身着60年代的服装，似乎是在模仿甲壳虫乐队。

charge.name: charge
charge.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to ask an amount of money for something, especially a service or activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指对某一服务或活动）收费，要价，开价

example.eg: How much/What do you charge for a haircut and blow-dry?
example.egtrans: 剪发和吹风要收多少钱？

example.eg: The bank charged commission to change my traveller's cheques.
example.egtrans: 银行兑现我的旅行支票收取了手续费。

example.eg: They charge you $20 just to get in the nightclub.
example.egtrans: 进夜总会的门他们就收你20美元。

example.eg: The local museum doesn't charge for admission.
example.egtrans: 当地博物馆不收门票费。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to record an amount that a customer has spent for them to pay at a later time, according to an agreement between a business and the customer

example.eg: Charge the bill to my account, please.
example.egtrans: 请把账单记在我账上。

example.eg: Shall we charge the flowers to your account?
example.egtrans: 我们把买花的钱记到你的账上，行吗？

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of the police) to make a formal statement saying that someone is accused of a crime

example.eg: She's been charged with murder.
example.egtrans: 她被控谋杀。

example.eg: She is charged with murdering her husband.
example.egtrans: 她被指控谋害了自己的丈夫。

trans_examp.trans_en: to publicly accuse someone of doing something bad

example.eg: The paper charged her with using the company's money for her own purposes.
example.egtrans: 报纸指责她把公司的钱挪作己用。

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move forward quickly and violently, especially towards something that has caused difficulty or anger

example.eg: The bull lowered its horns and charged.
example.egtrans: 公牛俯下牛角发动进攻。

example.eg: The violence began when the police charged (at) a crowd of demonstrators.
example.egtrans: 当警察冲向一群示威者时，暴力冲突开始了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to hurry from one place to another

example.eg: I've been charging about/around all day and I'm exhausted.
example.egtrans: 我一整天跑来跑去，累坏了。

example.eg: He came charging up the stairs to tell me the good news.
example.egtrans: 他匆匆跑上楼来告诉我这个好消息。

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put enough explosive into a gun to fire it once

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to order someone to do something

example.eg: He was charged with taking care of the premises.
example.egtrans: 他被吩咐去看管那些房屋。

trans_examp.trans_en: When a judge charges a jury, he or she explains the details of the law to them.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （法官）向（陪审团）解释法律细节

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put electricity into an electrical device such as a battery

example.eg: She drove the car round the block to charge (up) its batteries.
example.egtrans: 为了给电池充电她开车围着街区转。

example.eg: It's not working - I don't think the battery is charging.
example.egtrans: 不行呀——我觉得电池没有在充电。

charge.name: charge
charge.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of money that you have to pay for something, especially for an activity or service
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指某一活动或服务的）收费，费用，价格

example.eg: Is there a charge for children or do they go free?
example.egtrans: 小孩要收费还是免费？

example.eg: There's an admission charge of £5.
example.egtrans: 要收5英镑的入场费。

example.eg: They fixed my watch free of charge.
example.egtrans: 他们免费修好了我的手表。

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a formal police statement saying that someone is accused of a crime

example.eg: The 19-year-old will be appearing in court on Thursday where she will face criminal charges.
example.egtrans: 这位19岁的少女将于周四出庭，她将面临刑事指控。

example.eg: He has been arrested on a charge of murder.
example.egtrans: 他因被控谋杀而遭逮捕。

example.eg: The police brought a charge of theft against him.
example.egtrans: 警方指控他犯了盗窃罪。

example.eg: The police have had to drop (= stop) charges against her because they couldn't find any evidence.
example.egtrans: 警方因为找不到任何证据不得不撤销了对她的指控。

example.eg: He claimed he had been arrested on a trumped-up (= false) charge.
example.egtrans: 他声称自己是受诬告而被捕的。

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of accusing someone of something bad

example.eg: The president responded angrily to the charge that she had lost touch with her country's people.
example.egtrans: 有指责说总统和自己的国民失去了联系，对此她做出了愤怒的回应。

example.eg: Her refusal to condemn the violence laid/left her open to the charge of positive support for the campaign (= allowed people to say that she supported it).
example.egtrans: 她拒绝谴责暴力，这很容易给人留下她支持那场运动的口实。

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: responsibility for controlling or caring for something

example.eg: Her ex-husband has charge of the children during the week and she has them at the weekend.
example.egtrans: 她的前夫在工作日照看孩子，她则在周末照顾孩子。

example.eg: His boss asked him to take charge of the office for a few days while she was away.
example.egtrans: 老板让他在她离开的这段时间负责办公室工作。

trans_examp.trans_en: a person, especially a child, who is in your care and who you are responsible for

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: being the person who has control of or is responsible for someone or something

example.eg: Who will be in charge of the department when Sophie leaves?
example.egtrans: 索菲离开后，谁来管理这个部门？

example.eg: I left Jack in charge of the suitcases while I went to get the tickets.
example.egtrans: 我去买票时让杰克看着箱子。

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of explosive to be fired at one time, or the bullet or other explosive object shot from a gun

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an attack in which people or animals suddenly run forward

example.eg: a charge of buffalo/elephants
example.egtrans: 野牛／大象的猛冲

example.eg: a police charge
example.egtrans: 警方的突然袭击

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an order to do something

dsense.name: charge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of electricity that an electrical device stores or that a substance carries

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is on charge, you are putting an amount of electricity into it.

example.eg: Is it all right to leave/put the battery on charge overnight?
example.egtrans: 让电池充一夜电可以吗？

chunk.name: chunk
chunk.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a roughly cut piece

example.eg: a chunk of cheese/meat
example.egtrans: 一大块奶酪／肉

example.eg: pineapple/tuna chunks
example.egtrans: 菠萝／金枪鱼块

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of something, especially a large part
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一部分；（尤指）大部分，一大块

example.eg: a chunk of text
example.egtrans: 一大段文字

example.eg: a substantial chunk of our profits
example.egtrans: 我们利润的很大一部分

example.eg: Three hours is quite a chunk out of my working day.
example.egtrans: 3个小时占了我一个工作日中相当长的一段时间。

circuit.name: circuit
circuit.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: circuit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a regular pattern of visits or the places visited

example.eg: They first met each other on the tennis circuit (= while at different tennis competitions).
example.egtrans: 他们在网球巡回赛上首次交锋。

example.eg: He was a familiar figure on the lecture circuit.
example.egtrans: 他是巡回讲学中的座上常客。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular area containing different courts that a judge visits

example.eg: The judge had served for many years on the northeastern Circuit.
example.egtrans: 这位法官多年来供职于东北部巡回法庭。

example.eg: a circuit judge
example.egtrans: 巡回法官

dsense.name: circuit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something shaped approximately like a circle, especially a route, path, or sports track that starts and ends in the same place
trans_examp.trans_cn: 环行物；（尤指）环形道路（或路线、赛道）

example.eg: They test the car tyres on a motor racing circuit.
example.egtrans: 他们在环形赛车道上测试轮胎。

example.eg: We made a leisurely circuit of the city walls.
example.egtrans: 我们悠闲地围着城墙转悠。

dsense.name: circuit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a closed system of wires or pipes through which electricity or liquid can flow

example.eg: A defect was found in the water-cooling/electrical circuit.
example.egtrans: 在水冷回路／电路中发现了一点毛病。

clause.name: clause
clause.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: clause
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular part of a written legal document, for example a law passed by Parliament or a contract (= an agreement)

example.eg: They have added/deleted/amended a clause in the contract which says the company can make people redundant for economic reasons.
example.egtrans: 他们在合同中增加／删除／修改了一项条款，该条款称公司可以因为经济原因裁减人员。

example.eg: Clause 4 of the constitution is thought to be the most important section.
example.egtrans: 宪法第四条被认为是最重要的部分。

dsense.name: clause
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of words, consisting of a subject and a finite form of a verb

example.eg: In the sentence "I can't cook very well but I make quite good pancakes", both "I can't cook very well" and "I make good pancakes" are main/independent clauses (= they are of equal importance and could each exist as a separate sentence).
example.egtrans: 在 I can't cook very well but I make good pancakes（我菜烧得不太好，可是蛋饼煎得很不错）这句话中，I can't cook very well 和 I make good pancakes 都是主句／独立分句。

example.eg: In the sentence "I'll get you some stamps if I go to town", "if I go to town" is a subordinate/dependent clause (= it is not as important as the main part of the sentence and could not exist as a separate sentence).
example.egtrans: 在 I'll get you some stamps if I go to town（如果我去城里，会给你带些邮票）这句话中，if I go to town 是从句／从属分句。

clean.name: clean
clean.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: clean
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not dirty

example.eg: a clean white shirt
example.egtrans: 干净的白衬衫

example.eg: clean air/water
example.egtrans: 清洁的空气／水

example.eg: Make sure your hands are clean before you have your dinner.
example.egtrans: 饭前一定要把手洗干净。

example.eg: Hospitals need to be kept spotlessly (= extremely) clean.
example.egtrans: 医院必须保持一尘不染，干干净净。

dsense.name: clean
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: honest or fair, or showing that you have not done anything illegal
trans_examp.trans_cn: 诚实的；公正的；光明正大的；清白的

example.eg: a good clean fight/contest
example.egtrans: 公正的比赛／竞赛

example.eg: The judge took the defendant's clean record (= the absence of previous involvement in crime) into account when passing sentence.
example.egtrans: 法官在宣判时考虑到了被告没有前科。

example.eg: I've always had a clean driving licence.
example.egtrans: 我开车一直都无违章记录。

example.eg: It was a clean tackle.
example.egtrans: 那个阻截真是干净利落。

trans_examp.trans_en: not doing anything illegal, or not having or carrying illegal drugs or stolen goods
trans_examp.trans_cn: 清白的；没有私藏（或携带）毒品的；没有赃物的

example.eg: The police busted Pete last night, but he was clean.
example.egtrans: 警察昨夜搜查了皮特，可是未搜出他有任何违禁品。

dsense.name: clean
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: morally acceptable

example.eg: It's all good, clean fun.
example.egtrans: 这完全是个正派纯洁的玩笑。

example.eg: clean living
example.egtrans: 生活清白的

trans_examp.trans_en: not about sex
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不猥亵的，不下流的；无色情的

example.eg: Can't you think of any clean jokes?
example.egtrans: 你脑子里难道就没有点正经的笑话么？

dsense.name: clean
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having no rough edges, and smooth, straight, or equally balanced
trans_examp.trans_cn: 边缘整齐的；平滑的；流线型的；简洁流畅的

example.eg: I've broken my leg, but the doctor says that it's a clean break, so it should heal easily.
example.egtrans: 我摔断了腿，不过医生说断口很整齐，应该很快就会长好。

example.eg: A good clean hit from Pietersen sent the ball straight out to the boundary.
example.egtrans: 皮特森干净利落的一击将球直接击出边界。

example.eg: What he liked about the car was its clean lines.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢这辆车简洁流畅的线条。

example.eg: I tried to make a clean cut, but the knife wasn't sharp enough.
example.egtrans: 我想切得整整齐齐，可是刀子不够锋利。

dsense.name: clean
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete

example.eg: It's better for both of us if we make a clean break (of it) (= end our relationship completely).
example.egtrans: 要是我们一刀两断，对双方都好。

example.eg: Sara says she needs a clean break with the past.
example.egtrans: 萨拉说自己需要和过去彻底决裂。

example.eg: The new prime minister is expected to make a clean sweep (= a complete change) of the government.
example.egtrans: 人们期望新首相对政府进行大换班。

dsense.name: clean
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: When something you write on is clean, there is nothing on it or it is not yet used.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 未写过的；未用过的；空白的

example.eg: Take a clean sheet of paper.
example.egtrans: 拿一张白纸来。

clean.name: clean
clean.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove dirt from something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…弄干净；打扫；清洁；清洗

example.eg: I'm going to clean the windows this morning.
example.egtrans: 今天上午我要擦窗户。

example.eg: You should always clean your teeth after meals.
example.egtrans: 每次饭后你都应当清洁牙齿。

example.eg: Would you clean the fingermarks from/off the door?
example.egtrans: 你把门上的指纹擦掉，好吗？

example.eg: He asked her to help him clean out the stables.
example.egtrans: 他叫她帮忙打扫马厩。

trans_examp.trans_en: to become clean

example.eg: This carpet doesn't clean very well.
example.egtrans: 这地毯不太好清洗。

example.eg: I hope these bloodstains will clean off my shirt.
example.egtrans: 我希望我衬衫上的这些血迹能洗掉。

trans_examp.trans_en: to prepare a fish or an animal killed for food by removing the inside parts of it that are not eaten
trans_examp.trans_cn: 清除（鱼或动物）的内脏（以备烹饪）

clean.name: clean
clean.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: when something is cleaned

example.eg: These windows need a really thorough clean.
example.egtrans: 这些窗户需要彻底擦洗一遍。

clean.name: clean
clean.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely

example.eg: I clean forgot that I was supposed to be meeting Lucy last night.
example.egtrans: 昨晚我本来应该跟露西见面的，结果我忘得一干二净。

example.eg: He's been cheating his customers for years, and getting clean away with it.
example.egtrans: 他欺骗顾客多年，还一点事都没有。

example.eg: The bullet went clean through his shoulder.
example.egtrans: 子弹穿透了他的肩膀。

clearer.name: clear
clearer.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: easy to understand, hear, read, or see
trans_examp.trans_cn: 明白的；清楚的；易懂的；清晰的

example.eg: clear instructions/directions
example.egtrans: 清楚易懂的说明／指示

example.eg: Can we make the sound any clearer?
example.egtrans: 我们能把声音再调清晰一点吗？

example.eg: Our new television has a very clear picture.
example.egtrans: 我们的新电视图像十分清晰。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: something you say in order to emphasize what you have just said, or to express your authority
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （强调刚说的话或表达自己的权威）我讲清楚了吗？听明白我的意思了吗?

example.eg: I will not tolerate this behaviour any longer. Do I make myself clear?
example.egtrans: 我不会再容忍这样的行为了。我的话你明白吗？

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: certain, having no doubt, or obvious
trans_examp.trans_cn: 确定的；无可置疑的；明白无误的；明显的

example.eg: He isn't at all clear about what he wants to do with his life.
example.egtrans: 他根本不清楚自己想过怎样的生活。

example.eg: It is rapidly becoming clear (to me) (that) I'm not suited to being a teacher.
example.egtrans: 我很快明白过来我不适合当老师。

example.eg: It isn't clear how long the strike will go on for.
example.egtrans: 不知这次罢工会持续多久。

example.eg: It's a clear case of corruption.
example.egtrans: 这明显是一起贪腐案。

example.eg: You've made your position quite clear (= there is no doubt about what you think).
example.egtrans: 你的立场已经十分明确了。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: pure or easy to see through, with no marks or areas that are less transparent
trans_examp.trans_cn: 晴朗的；纯净的；透明的；清澈的

example.eg: clear glass
example.egtrans: 透明的玻璃

example.eg: The water in the lake is so clear that you can see the bottom.
example.egtrans: 湖水清澈见底。

example.eg: We could see hundreds of stars in the clear desert sky.
example.egtrans: 沙漠上明朗的天空中可以看到数以百计的星星。

example.eg: She has a beautifully clear skin/complexion (= with no marks or spots).
example.egtrans: 她肤色光洁美丽。

example.eg: The weather is expected to remain clear for the next few days.
example.egtrans: 预计今后几天天气会持续晴朗。

example.eg: You can see the mountains from here on a clear day.
example.egtrans: 天气晴朗的时候，从这里可以看到层层山峦。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe a pleasant, pure sound

example.eg: the clear sound of the flute
example.egtrans: 清亮的笛声

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe something that you remember easily

example.eg: I have clear memories of visiting my grandfather's farm as a child.
example.egtrans: 我清楚地记得小时候去爷爷的农场时的情形。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not covered or blocked by anything
trans_examp.trans_cn: 无遮盖的；无阻碍的；畅通的

example.eg: We have a clear view of the ocean from our hotel window.
example.egtrans: 从酒店的窗口我们可以一览无余地看到大海。

example.eg: The journey was quite quick because the road was clear (= there was not much traffic on it).
example.egtrans: 因为交通顺畅，所以路上走得很快。

example.eg: I always like to leave my desk clear (= with no work on it) at the end of the day.
example.egtrans: 每天工作结束时，我总是喜欢把案头收拾得干干净净。

trans_examp.trans_en: not busy or filled by any planned activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不忙的，空闲的；没有安排的

example.eg: The only time I have clear next week is Tuesday afternoon.
example.egtrans: 下星期我只有周二下午有空。

example.eg: We've got two clear (= whole) weeks in which to finish the decorating.
example.egtrans: 我们有整整两周时间来完成装修。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: without being or feeling guilty

example.eg: to have a clear conscience
example.egtrans: 问心无愧

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: free from confusion; able to think quickly and well
trans_examp.trans_cn: 头脑清醒的；思维清晰的；思维敏捷的

example.eg: Marie is good at making decisions because she's a very clear thinker.
example.egtrans: 玛丽擅长作决断，因为她思维清晰。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: without problems or difficulties

example.eg: This is the first time in his life that he's been clear of (= without) debt.
example.egtrans: 这是他生平第一次偿清了债务。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe an amount of money that is left after all necessary payments have been made

example.eg: The school summer fair made a clear profit of £1,500.
example.egtrans: 学校的夏季义卖会净赚了1500英镑。

example.eg: Bill earns a clear $400 a week/earns $400 a week clear.
example.egtrans: 比尔每星期净赚400美元。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not touching something, or away from something

example.eg: Only one competitor made a clear jump of the highest fence (= jumped over it without touching it).
example.egtrans: 只有一位骑手利落地跨过了最高的障碍物。

example.eg: When we're clear of the main road, we'll stop for our picnic.
example.egtrans: 等我们离开大路后就停车野餐。

clearer.name: clear
clearer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove or get rid of whatever is blocking or filling something, or to stop being blocked or full
trans_examp.trans_cn: 移走；清除；清理；清扫；疏通

example.eg: It took several hours to clear the road after the accident.
example.egtrans: 事故发生后，用了好几个小时来清理道路。

example.eg: I'll make the coffee if you'll clear the table.
example.egtrans: 你要是去收拾桌子，我就去煮咖啡。

example.eg: If you use this nasal spray, your nose should clear.
example.egtrans: 用了这种鼻腔喷剂，你的鼻塞就会好一点。

example.eg: After my aunt died, we arranged for her house to be cleared (= for the furniture to be removed from it).
example.egtrans: 我姑妈过世后，我们安排清理了她的房间。

example.eg: If you press this key, the computer screen will clear (= the text and pictures will be removed from it).
example.egtrans: 按这个键可以清除电脑屏幕上的文档和图片。

example.eg: Shops are currently holding sales to clear their summer stock (= get rid of goods by selling them cheaply).
example.egtrans: 现在商店都在搞特价促销来清理夏季库存。

example.eg: Paul helped his elderly neighbour by clearing her path of snow/clearing snow from her path.
example.egtrans: 保罗帮助那位上了年纪的邻居清扫她家门前路上的积雪。

example.eg: Could you clear your things off/from the sofa?
example.egtrans: 把你的东西从沙发上拿走好吗？

example.eg: I never leave work until I've cleared my in-tray (= have finished the work that needs to be done).
example.egtrans: 我总是完成手头的工作才下班。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to give a small cough

example.eg: She cleared her throat nervously before she began to speak.
example.egtrans: 她讲话前紧张地清了清嗓子。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to prove that someone is not guilty of something that they were accused of

example.eg: After many years in prison, the men were finally cleared of the bombings.
example.egtrans: 在被监禁多年之后，这些人终于洗清了罪名，证明与爆炸事件无关。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give official permission for something

example.eg: Despite local opposition, the plans for the new supermarket have been cleared by the council.
example.egtrans: 议会不顾当地居民的反对，批准了建新超市的计划。

example.eg: Ladies and gentlemen, air-traffic control has now cleared the plane for take-off.
example.egtrans: 女士们先生们，飞机已得到空中管制的起飞许可。

example.eg: I don't know if I can get the car tonight - I'll have to clear it with Mum.
example.egtrans: 我不知道今晚能否拿到车——我得征得母亲的同意。

trans_examp.trans_en: to satisfy the official conditions of something

example.eg: Before you can enter the country, you have to clear customs.
example.egtrans: 进入该国必须先通过海关检查。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to become or make something pure or easy to see through

example.eg: The children enjoyed stirring the mud at the bottom of the pond, then watching the water slowly clear again.
example.egtrans: 孩子们喜欢搅动池底的淤泥，然后看着水重新慢慢变清。

example.eg: Your skin would clear (= become free of spots) if you had a healthier diet.
example.egtrans: 更健康的饮食，你的皮肤就会变光洁的。

example.eg: After the thunderstorm, the sky cleared (= stopped being cloudy).
example.egtrans: 雷雨过后，天放晴了。

example.eg: The fog is expected to have cleared (away) (= gone) by midday.
example.egtrans: 到正午时分雾有望散去。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make your mind free from confusion so that you can think quickly and well
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使头脑清醒；使思维清晰

example.eg: I need to get some fresh air to clear my head (= to make me able to think well).
example.egtrans: 我需要呼吸点新鲜空气来清醒一下头脑。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

phrase.phrase_title: clear your debts/clear yourself of debts

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to pay back all the money that you owe

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an amount of money left from your earnings after any necessary payments, charges, taxes, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （支付各种费用后）净剩下，纯收入为

example.eg: Bill clears $200 a week.
example.egtrans: 比尔每星期净赚200美元。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause a cheque to) go from one bank to another through a central organization, so that money can be paid to the person it is owed to

example.eg: It usually takes four to five working days for a cheque to clear.
example.egtrans: 支票过户一般需要4到5个工作日。

dsense.name: clear
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to jump or go over something without touching it

example.eg: The horse cleared the fence with inches to spare.
example.egtrans: 马腾空越过篱笆，还高出了好几英寸。

clearer.name: clear
clearer.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: not touching, or away from

example.eg: Stand clear of the doors, please.
example.egtrans: 请站得离门远一点。

example.eg: Make sure you park clear of the kerb.
example.egtrans: 千万不要贴着路缘停车。

example.eg: The children were saved from the fire only because a neighbour pulled them clear.
example.egtrans: 孩子们能从火灾中幸存下来，多亏了一位邻居把他们拉出火场。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to avoid something or someone

example.eg: His parents warned him to steer clear of trouble.
example.egtrans: 父母告诫他不要惹麻烦。

clever.name: clever
clever.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having or showing the ability to learn and understand things quickly and easily

example.eg: Judy has never been very clever, but she tries hard.
example.egtrans: 朱迪向来不是很聪明，可是她很用功。

example.eg: Fiona is very clever at physics.
example.egtrans: 菲奥纳很擅长物理。

example.eg: Charlie has a clever idea/plan for getting us out of our present difficulties.
example.egtrans: 查利有个妙计可以使我们摆脱现在的困境。

trans_examp.trans_en: skilful

example.eg: My mother is very clever with her hands.
example.egtrans: 我妈妈手很巧。

trans_examp.trans_en: well-designed

example.eg: I've got a clever little gadget for opening jars.
example.egtrans: 我有个设计巧妙的开罐器。

trans_examp.trans_en: showing intelligence, but not sincere, polite, or serious

example.eg: That's enough clever talk, young lady.
example.egtrans: 别跟我油嘴滑舌了，小姐。

cleverness.name: cleverness
cleverness.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: ability to understand and learn quickly and easily
intelligent design

example.eg: Everyone was impressed by the cleverness of the machine.
example.egtrans: 这台机器的巧妙设计给大家都留下了深刻印象。

closely.name: closely
closely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: closely
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is directly connected or has a strong relationship
trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧密地，密切地，直接联系地

example.eg: English and German are closely related.
example.egtrans: 英语和德语的亲缘关系很近。

example.eg: Both politicians have been closely associated with the movement for some time.
example.egtrans: 这两位政界人士与这场运动有密切联系，而且都已经有一段时间了。

example.eg: We are working closely with the police.
example.egtrans: 我们正与警方密切合作。

dsense.name: closely
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: carefully and paying attention to details

example.eg: Pollution levels are closely monitored.
example.egtrans: 污染等级受到严密的监控。

example.eg: He looked again more closely at the marks.
example.egtrans: 他又更加仔细地看了看分数。

dsense.name: closely
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: without a big difference between two people, groups, or things

example.eg: The two teams are closely matched.
example.egtrans: 两队的实力不相上下。

example.eg: It was a closely fought election.
example.egtrans: 竞选相当激烈，不分胜负。

dsense.name: closely
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that tries hard to keep something secret

example.eg: a closely guarded secret
example.egtrans: 严格保守的秘密

dsense.name: closely
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: not far in time or position
trans_examp.trans_cn: （时间或空间上）接近地，不远地

example.eg: The Swiss boat is in the lead, followed closely by the French.
example.egtrans: 瑞士队的船处于领先地位，紧随其后的是法国队。

clue.name: clue
clue.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sign or some information that helps you to find the answer to a problem, question, or mystery

example.eg: Police are still looking for clues in their search for the missing girl.
example.egtrans: 警方仍在寻找失踪女孩的线索。

example.eg: I'm never going to guess the answer if you don't give me a clue.
example.egtrans: 要是你不给我一点提示，我永远也猜不到答案。

clutter.name: clutter
clutter.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (a lot of objects in) a state of being untidy

example.eg: Sorry about the clutter in the kitchen.
example.egtrans: 对不起，厨房里杂乱不堪。

example.eg: My desk is covered in/full of clutter.
example.egtrans: 我书桌上堆得乱七八糟。

clutter.name: clutter
clutter.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fill something in an untidy or badly organized way

example.eg: The kids always clutter the hall (up) with school bags and coats and stuff.
example.egtrans: 孩子们总是在厅里乱放书包、外套和乱七八糟的东西。

example.eg: Every shelf is cluttered with ornaments.
example.egtrans: 每层架子上都塞满了装饰品。

example.eg: I try not to clutter (up) my mind with useless information.
example.egtrans: 我尽量不往脑子里装那些无用的东西。

collaborate.name: collaborate
collaborate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: collaborate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to work with someone else for a special purpose

example.eg: Two writers collaborated on the script for the film.
example.egtrans: 两位作家合写了这部电影的剧本。

example.eg: A German company collaborated with a Swiss firm to develop the product.
example.egtrans: 一家德国公司与一家瑞士小公司合作开发该产品。

example.eg: The British and Italian police collaborated in catching the terrorists.
example.egtrans: 英国警方和意大利警方通力合作，抓住了恐怖分子。

dsense.name: collaborate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to work with an enemy who has taken control of your own country

example.eg: Anyone who was suspected of collaborating with the occupying forces was arrested.
example.egtrans: 任何涉嫌与占领军勾结的人都被逮捕了。

collapse.name: collapse
collapse.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: collapse
