dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fall down suddenly because of pressure or having no strength or support
trans_examp.trans_cn: （由于压力、无力或缺乏支持而）倒塌，坍塌；崩溃，垮掉

example.eg: Thousands of buildings collapsed in the earthquake.
example.egtrans: 数以千计的建筑物在地震中倒塌了。

example.eg: The chair collapsed under her weight.
example.egtrans: 椅子承受不了她的重量散架了。

example.eg: He thought his whole world had collapsed when his wife died.
example.egtrans: 妻子去世后他觉得自己的整个世界都坍塌了。

trans_examp.trans_en: If someone collapses, they fall down because of being sick or weak.

example.eg: He collapsed and died of a heart attack.
example.egtrans: 他心脏病发作，倒地而亡。

trans_examp.trans_en: to fold something into a smaller shape, usually so it can be stored, or (especially of furniture) to fold in this way

example.eg: All chairs collapse for easy storage.
example.egtrans: 所有的椅子折叠起来以方便存放。

dsense.name: collapse
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of people and business) to suddenly be unable to continue or work correctly

example.eg: Lots of people lost their jobs when the property market collapsed.
example.egtrans: 房地产市场崩溃后，许多人丢了工作。

example.eg: Talks between management and unions have collapsed.
example.egtrans: 劳资谈判彻底破裂。

example.eg: Share prices collapsed (= became lower suddenly) after news of poor trading.
example.egtrans: 贸易不景气的消息传出后股价暴跌。

collapse.name: collapse
collapse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: collapse
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the sudden failure of a system, organization, business, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （系统、组织、企业等的）崩溃，瓦解，失败

example.eg: I don't know what caused the collapse of her marriage.
example.egtrans: 我不知道她婚姻失败的原因是什么。

example.eg: A poor economy has caused the collapse of thousands of small businesses.
example.egtrans: 经济萧条导致数以千计的小型企业破产。

example.eg: Negotiations between the two countries are on the brink/verge of collapse (= very soon going to fail).
example.egtrans: 两国的谈判濒临破裂。

example.eg: He suffered a mental/nervous collapse after ten years' teaching.
example.egtrans: 执教10年后，他的精神／神经崩溃了。

dsense.name: collapse
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the sudden falling movement of a person or structure that has become too weak to stand
trans_examp.trans_cn: 昏倒，昏迷；（建筑物的）倒塌，坍塌

example.eg: He was taken to hospital after his collapse on the pitch.
example.egtrans: 他昏倒在赛场后被送往医院。

example.eg: the collapse of a building during the earthquake
example.egtrans: 地震中一座大楼的倒塌

collection.name: collection
collection.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: collection
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of objects of one type that have been collected by one person or in one place

example.eg: a private art collection
example.egtrans: 私人艺术收藏品

example.eg: a valuable stamp collection
example.egtrans: 珍贵的邮票收藏品

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of money collected from several people, or the act of collecting money
trans_examp.trans_cn: 募集的钱；捐的款；募捐的钱

example.eg: We're having a collection for Tom's retirement present.
example.egtrans: 我们正凑钱准备给汤姆买退休礼物。

trans_examp.trans_en: a lot of things or people

example.eg: There's quite a collection of toothbrushes in the bathroom.
example.egtrans: 浴室里有一大堆牙刷。

trans_examp.trans_en: a range of new clothes produced by one clothes designer
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某位服装设计师的）一系列新装作品

example.eg: Kenzo's summer/winter collection
example.egtrans: 高田贤三的夏装／冬装系列

dsense.name: collection
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of taking something away from a place

example.eg: The photos will be ready for collection on Tuesday afternoon.
example.egtrans: 照片周二下午就可以取。

example.eg: Which day is the rubbish collection?
example.egtrans: 哪天收垃圾？

example.eg: There are three collections a day from the post box on the corner.
example.egtrans: 街角的邮箱每天收取信件3次。

collision.name: collision
collision.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: collision
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an accident that happens when two vehicles hit each other with force

example.eg: There has been a collision on the southbound stretch of the motorway.
example.egtrans: 在高速公路南向路段上发生了一起撞车事故。

example.eg: Two drivers were killed in a head-on (= direct) collision between a car and a taxi last night.
example.egtrans: 昨晚，一辆轿车与一辆出租车迎面相撞，两名司机身亡。

example.eg: The cyclist was in a collision with a bus.
example.egtrans: 那个骑自行车的人与一辆公共汽车相撞。

dsense.name: collision
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a strong disagreement

example.eg: There was a collision of interests/opinions.
example.egtrans: 存在利益冲突／意见不和。

colon.name: colon
colon.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: colon
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the lower and bigger half of the bowels in which water is removed from solid waste

dsense.name: colon
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the symbol : used in writing, especially to introduce a list of things or a sentence or phrase taken from somewhere else

colon.name: colón
colon.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the standard unit of money used in Costa Rica and El Salvador
trans_examp.trans_cn: （哥斯达黎加和萨尔瓦多的标准货币单位）科朗

column.name: column
column.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: column
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of several vertical blocks of print into which a page of a newspaper or magazine is divided

example.eg: I didn't have time to read the whole article - just the first column.
example.egtrans: 我没有时间读整篇文章——只看了第一栏。

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of writing in a newspaper or magazine, usually on a particular subject, that is always written by the same person and appears regularly

example.eg: She writes a weekly fashion/gossip column for the Evening Standard.
example.egtrans: 她每周都在《旗帜晚报》的时尚／漫谈专栏中发表文章。

trans_examp.trans_en: any vertical block of words or numbers

example.eg: Add the column of figures and divide the sum by three.
example.egtrans: 把这列数字相加，再将总数除以3。

dsense.name: column
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a tall, vertical stone post, used as a support for a roof or in classical buildings (= in the style of ancient Greece or Rome) for decoration, or standing alone as a monument (= a symbol of respect for a special person or event)

example.eg: The roof of the temple was held up by a row of thick stone columns.
example.egtrans: 这座寺庙的屋顶由一排粗大的石柱支撑着。

example.eg: Nelson's Column in Trafalgar Square
example.egtrans: 特拉法尔加广场上的纳尔逊纪念碑

trans_examp.trans_en: a line of moving people or vehicles
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一队，一列（移动的人或车辆）

example.eg: a column of refugees
example.egtrans: 一队难民

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: something with a tall, narrow shape

example.eg: A column of smoke rose from the chimney.
example.egtrans: 烟囱里冒出了一柱烟。

combination.name: combination
combination.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the mixture you get when two or more things are combined

example.eg: Strawberries and cream - a perfect combination.
example.egtrans: 草莓加奶油——完美的组合。

example.eg: A combination of tiredness and boredom caused me to fall asleep.
example.egtrans: 疲倦而又无聊使我昏昏入睡。

example.eg: This drug can be safely used in combination with other medicines.
example.egtrans: 这药可以同其他药物一起安全服用。

example.eg: Her experience and energy are a winning combination (= a successful mixture) in business.
example.egtrans: 经验加干劲是她在生意上成功的秘诀。

trans_examp.trans_en: an arrangement in a particular order

example.eg: From the letters X Y Z, we can get three combinations of two letters: XY, XZ, and YZ.
example.egtrans: 由字母XYZ，我们可以得到3种两个字母的组合方式：XY，XZ和YZ。

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of letters or numbers in a particular order that can be used to open some types of locks
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于开某些锁的）数码组合，密码

example.eg: a combination lock
example.egtrans: 密码锁

combine.name: combine
combine.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause to) exist together, or join together to make a single thing or group
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）结合；（使）联合；（使）合并；（使）综合

example.eg: None of us has much money so let's combine what we've got.
example.egtrans: 我们谁都没多少钱，因此就把我们所有的钱凑在一起吧。

example.eg: Sickness, combined with (= together with) terrible weather, contrived to ruin the trip.
example.egtrans: 疾病，加上恶劣的天气，毁掉了这次旅行。

example.eg: The two countries combined against their common enemy.
example.egtrans: 两国联合起来对抗共同的敌人。

example.eg: These normally harmless substances combine to form a highly poisonous gas.
example.egtrans: 通常情况下这些是无害物质，但混合在一起后会形成一种毒性很强的气体。

trans_examp.trans_en: If someone combines two or more qualities, they have both of those qualities.

example.eg: As a writer, he combined wit and/with passion.
example.egtrans: 作为一名作家，他既诙谐又不乏激情。

trans_examp.trans_en: to do two activities at the same time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 兼办，兼做，同时做（两种活动）

example.eg: She manages to successfully combine family life and/with a career.
example.egtrans: 她成功地做到了家庭事业两不误。

combine.name: combine
combine.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: combine
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people or organizations acting together in business

example.eg: a Japanese industrial combine
example.egtrans: 日本工业联合集团

dsense.name: combine
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large farming machine that cuts the plant, separates the seed from the stem, and cleans the grain as it moves across a field

comma.name: comma
comma.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the symbol , used in writing to separate parts of a sentence showing a slight pause, or to separate the single things in a list

comment.name: comment
comment.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you say or write that expresses your opinion

example.eg: I don't want any comments on/about my new haircut, thank you!
example.egtrans: 我不想听到谁对我新剪的头发说三道四，谢谢各位了！

example.eg: He made negative comments to the press.
example.egtrans: 他向报界作了些负面的评论。

example.eg: I suppose his criticism was fair comment (= a reasonable opinion).
example.egtrans: 我认为他的批评合乎情理。

example.eg: She was asked about the pay increase but made no comment (= did not give an opinion).
example.egtrans: 有人问她关于加薪的事，但她未置评论。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to say that you do not want to answer someone's question

comment.name: comment
comment.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a comment

example.eg: My mum always comments on what I'm wearing.
example.egtrans: 我妈妈总是对我的穿着指指点点。

example.eg: He commented that the two essays were rather similar.
example.egtrans: 他评论说两篇文章颇为相似。

example.eg: The official refused to/declined to comment on the matter.
example.egtrans: 那位官员拒绝对此事发表意见。

common.name: common
common.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: common
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: the same in a lot of places or for a lot of people
trans_examp.trans_cn: 常见的；经常的；普遍的；普通的；平常的

example.eg: It's quite common to see couples who dress alike.
example.egtrans: 夫妻穿着相似是司空见惯的事儿。

example.eg: "Smith" is a very common name in Britain.
example.egtrans: “史密斯”是英国很常见的姓氏。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the basic level of politeness that you expect from someone
a fact that everyone knows

example.eg: It's common knowledge that they live together.
example.egtrans: 他们住在一起，这事儿尽人皆知。

dsense.name: common
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: belonging to or shared by two or more people, or things

example.eg: a common goal/interest
example.egtrans: 共同的目标／兴趣

example.eg: English has some features common to many languages.
example.egtrans: 英语的一些特点是许多语言所共有的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is done for the common good, it is done to help everyone.
to act together with someone in order to achieve something

example.eg: Environmental protesters have made common cause with local people to stop the motorway being built.
example.egtrans: 环境抗议者与当地人联合起来共同阻止修建高速公路。

dsense.name: common
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: typical of a low social class

example.eg: My mum thinks dyed blonde hair is a bit common.
example.egtrans: 我妈妈认为染出来的金发有点俗气。

common.name: common
common.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: common
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of grass that everyone is allowed to use, usually in or near a village
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通常在村子里或附近的）公地，共享草地

dsense.name: common
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to share interests, experiences, or other characteristics with someone or something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 有相同（兴趣、经历或特点）

example.eg: We don't really have much in common.
example.egtrans: 我们其实没有多少共同点。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in the same way as someone or something

example.eg: In common with many mothers, she feels torn between her family and her work.
example.egtrans: 与许多母亲一样，她觉得家庭与工作难以兼顾。

commonly.name: commonly
commonly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: commonly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: often or usually
trans_examp.trans_cn: 经常地；普通地；通常；一般

example.eg: Elbow injuries are commonly found among tennis players.
example.egtrans: 肘伤在网球运动员中很常见。

dsense.name: commonly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: shared by two or more people

example.eg: commonly held values
example.egtrans: 共同的信仰

community.name: community
community.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the people living in one particular area or people who are considered as a unit because of their common interests, social group, or nationality

example.eg: He's well known in the local community.
example.egtrans: 他在当地非常出名。

example.eg: There's a large black/white/Jewish community living in this area.
example.egtrans: 在该地区有一个大的黑人／白人／犹太人社区。

example.eg: Her speech caused outrage among the gay community.
example.egtrans: 她的演说激起了同性恋群体的愤怒。

example.eg: Drug trafficking is a matter of considerable concern for the entire international community (= all the countries of the world).
example.egtrans: 毒品走私是整个国际社会都相当关注的问题。

example.eg: There's a real sense of community (= caring and friendly feeling) in this neighbourhood.
example.egtrans: 在该地区有一种真正的社区归属感。

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of animals or plants that live or grow together

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the general public

example.eg: Unlike the present government, we believe in serving the community.
example.egtrans: 与现任政府不同，我们信奉服务大众。

compact.name: compact
compact.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: consisting of parts that are positioned together closely or in a tidy way, using very little space

example.eg: compact soil/sand
example.egtrans: 密实的土壤／沙子

example.eg: a compact camera/bag
example.egtrans: 小巧的相机／提包

example.eg: What a compact office! How did you fit so much into so little space?
example.egtrans: 多么小的办公室！你们是如何把这么多东西塞进这么小的空间的？

compact.name: compact
compact.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: compact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small, flat case that contains women's face powder
trans_examp.trans_cn: （装女性扑面用香粉的）带镜粉盒

example.eg: a powder compact
example.egtrans: 粉盒

dsense.name: compact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small car

dsense.name: compact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a formal agreement between two or more people, organizations, or countries

example.eg: They made a compact not to reveal any details.
example.egtrans: 他们互相约定不透露任何细节。

compact.name: compact
compact.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to press something together in a tight and solid way

example.eg: Cars had compacted the snow until it was like ice.
example.egtrans: 汽车把雪碾得越来越实，直到变得像冰一样。

comparable.name: comparable
comparable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: similar in size, amount, or quality to something else
trans_examp.trans_cn: （大小、数量或品质上）类似的，相当的，可比的

example.eg: The girls are of comparable ages.
example.egtrans: 女孩们年龄相仿。

example.eg: Our prices are comparable to/with those in other shops.
example.egtrans: 我们的价格和其他商店的差不多。

example.eg: The two experiences aren't comparable.
example.egtrans: 这两段经历不能相比。

compare.name: compare
compare.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: compare
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to examine or look for the difference between two or more things

example.eg: If you compare house prices in the two areas, it's quite amazing how different they are.
example.egtrans: 如果比较一下两个地段的房价，你会惊讶地发现它们的差别竟如此之大。

example.eg: That seems expensive - have you compared prices in other shops?
example.egtrans: 那好像很贵——你有没有比较一下其他店里的价格？

example.eg: Compare some recent work with your older stuff and you'll see how much you've improved.
example.egtrans: 把你近来的作品与以前的对照一下，你就会知道你的进步有多大。

example.eg: This road is quite busy compared to/with ours.
example.egtrans: 与我们那条路相比，这条路很繁忙。

example.eg: Children seem to learn more interesting things compared to/with when we were at school.
example.egtrans: 与我们上学时相比，孩子们现在学的有趣的东西似乎更多一些。

dsense.name: compare
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to judge, suggest, or consider that something is similar or of equal quality to something else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…比作；拿…与…相比；认为…和…相似（或不相上下）

example.eg: The poet compares his lover's tongue to a razor blade.
example.egtrans: 诗人把他恋人的舌头比作剃须刀刀片。

example.eg: Still only 25, she has been compared to the greatest dancer of all time.
example.egtrans: 她才25岁就被誉为有史以来最伟大的舞蹈家。

example.eg: People compared her to Elizabeth Taylor.
example.egtrans: 人们把她比作伊丽莎白‧泰勒。

example.eg: You can't compare the two cities - they're totally different.
example.egtrans: 你不能把这两座城市相提并论——它们完全不同。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something or someone does not compare with something or someone else, the second thing is very much better than the first.

example.eg: Instant coffee just doesn't compare with freshly ground coffee.
example.egtrans: 速溶咖啡根本比不上现磨的咖啡。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something compares favourably with something else, it is better than it.

example.eg: The hotel certainly compared favourably with the one we stayed in last year.
example.egtrans: 这家酒店当然比我们去年住的那家要好。

compare.name: compare
compare.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: so good that everyone or everything else is of worse quality
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 无与伦比；无可比拟；举世无双

example.eg: Her beauty is beyond compare.
example.egtrans: 她的美丽无与伦比。

compatibility.name: compatibility
compatibility.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of being able to exist, live, or work successfully with something or someone else

example.eg: Every person and pet in a household must visit with the potential new pet to ensure compatibility.
example.egtrans: 家里的每个人和宠物都必须和可能成为新宠物的动物见面，以保证他们能和睦相处。

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of being able to be used with a particular type of computer, machine, device, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （电脑、机器或仪器的）兼容性，相容性

example.eg: I am not impressed by the file compatibility with previous versions.
example.egtrans: 我觉得文件与先前版本的兼容性不佳。

compatible.name: compatible
compatible.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to exist, live together, or work successfully with something or someone else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可共存的；协调的；兼容的

example.eg: It was when we started living together that we found we just weren't compatible.
example.egtrans: 等到开始生活在一起时，才发现我们根本合不来。

example.eg: This software may not be compatible with older operating systems.
example.egtrans: 该软件可能与较老的操作系统不兼容。

example.eg: Such policies are not compatible with democratic government.
example.egtrans: 此类政策与民主政体格格不入。

example.eg: Are their two blood groups compatible (= can blood from one person be given to the other person)?
example.egtrans: 他俩的血型相容吗？

compilation.name: compilation
compilation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of compiling something

example.eg: A team of four was involved in the compilation of the book.
example.egtrans: 一个4人小组参与了这本书的编写工作。

trans_examp.trans_en: a book, CD, etc. that has been made from several separate parts

example.eg: a compilation of their greatest hits
example.egtrans: 他们的最热门歌曲选辑

compiler.name: compiler
compiler.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: compiler
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who compiles something

example.eg: a dictionary compiler
example.egtrans: 词典编纂者

dsense.name: compiler
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a computer program that changes instructions into machine language
trans_examp.trans_cn: 编译程序，编译器（把指令翻译成可执行机器语言的程序）

example.eg: She ran her code through the compiler.
example.egtrans: 她把编码输入编译程序中运行。

complement.name: complement
complement.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something else seem better or more attractive when combining with it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 补充；补足；使完善；为…增色

example.eg: Strawberries and cream complement each other perfectly.
example.egtrans: 草莓加奶油相得益彰。

example.eg: The music complements her voice perfectly.
example.egtrans: 音乐完美地衬托出她的嗓音。

complement.name: complement
complement.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a clause that usually follows the verb in English and adds more information about the subject or object

complete.name: complete
complete.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: complete
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make whole or perfect

example.eg: Complete the sentence with one of the adjectives provided.
example.egtrans: 从所给形容词中选择一个将句子补充完整。

example.eg: He only needs two more cards to complete the set.
example.egtrans: 他只需再有两张牌就凑成一副了。

example.eg: All she needed to complete her happiness was a baby.
example.egtrans: 只需再有个孩子她就幸福美满了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to write all the details asked for on a form or other document

example.eg: Have you completed your application form yet?
example.egtrans: 你的申请表填好了吗？

dsense.name: complete
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to finish doing something

example.eg: He's just completed filming his 17th feature film.
example.egtrans: 他刚刚完成他第17部故事片的拍摄工作。

example.eg: The palace took over 20 years to complete.
example.egtrans: 这座宫殿耗时20多年才竣工。

example.eg: She will complete her studies in France.
example.egtrans: 她将在法国完成学业。

complete.name: complete
complete.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: complete
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very great or to the largest degree possible

example.eg: The man's a complete fool!
example.egtrans: 这人是个十足的傻瓜！

example.eg: I need a break, a complete change of scene.
example.egtrans: 我需要休息一下，彻底换换环境。

example.eg: I made a complete and utter mess of it!
example.egtrans: 我把它彻底弄糟了！

dsense.name: complete
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: with all the parts

example.eg: the complete works of Oscar Wilde
example.egtrans: 奥斯卡‧王尔德全集

example.eg: The report comes complete with (= including) diagrams and colour photographs.
example.egtrans: 报告中有图表和彩色图片，非常齐全。

example.eg: Sun, sand, and romance - her holiday was complete.
example.egtrans: 阳光、沙滩加上浪漫的爱情——她的假期完美无缺。

completely.name: completely
completely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in every way or as much as possible

example.eg: I agree with you completely.
example.egtrans: 我完全同意你的意见。

example.eg: She's completely mad.
example.egtrans: 她彻底疯了。

example.eg: He'd completely changed - I didn't recognize him.
example.egtrans: 他彻底变样了——我当时没认出来。

complex.name: complex
complex.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: involving a lot of different but related parts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 由许多相关的不同部分组成的；构造复杂的

example.eg: a complex molecule/carbohydrate
example.egtrans: 复杂的分子／碳水化合物

example.eg: a complex network of roads
example.egtrans: 错综复杂的道路网

example.eg: a complex procedure
example.egtrans: 复杂的程序

example.eg: The company has a complex organizational structure.
example.egtrans: 公司组织结构非常复杂。

trans_examp.trans_en: difficult to understand or find an answer to because of having many different parts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 难懂的，费解的；错综复杂的

example.eg: It's a very complex issue to which there is no straightforward answer.
example.egtrans: 这个问题错综复杂，没有简单直接的答案。

example.eg: The film's plot was so complex that I couldn't follow it.
example.egtrans: 这部电影的情节太复杂，我看不懂。

complex.name: complex
complex.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: complex
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large building with various connected rooms or a related group of buildings

example.eg: a shopping/sports and leisure complex
example.egtrans: 购物／运动休闲中心

example.eg: They live in a large apartment complex.
example.egtrans: 他们住在一幢大型的公寓楼里。

dsense.name: complex
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular anxiety or unconscious fear that a person has, especially as a result of an unpleasant experience that they have had in the past or because they have a low opinion of their own worth
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指由过去的不快经历或自我评价不高造成的）情结，心理负担，病态心理

example.eg: an inferiority complex
example.egtrans: 自卑情结

example.eg: I think he's got a complex about being bald.
example.egtrans: 我觉得他因谢顶而有心理负担。

example.eg: Don't go on about her weight - you'll give her a complex!
example.egtrans: 别再没完没了地谈她的体重了——你会让她有心理负担的！

compliance.name: compliance
compliance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of obeying an order, rule, or request

example.eg: It is the job of the inspectors to enforce compliance with the regulations.
example.egtrans: 强制人们遵守法规是督察的责任。

example.eg: The company said that it had always acted in compliance with environmental laws.
example.egtrans: 该公司称其一向遵守环境法。

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of being too willing to do what other people want you to do

example.eg: It's his compliance that amazes me.
example.egtrans: 让我吃惊的是他言听计从。

compliant.name: compliant
compliant.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: willing to do what other people want you to do

example.eg: a compliant child
example.egtrans: 听话的孩子

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe something that obeys a particular rule or law

example.eg: The company expects to be reclassified as soon as its factories are fully compliant with the Federal Clean Air Act.
example.egtrans: 一旦属下工厂完全符合《联邦清洁空气法案》定下的规则，这家公司预计将会尽快被重新定类。

complicate.name: complicate
complicate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something more difficult to deal with, do, or understand
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使复杂化；使更难懂；使更麻烦

example.eg: It will only complicate the situation if we invite his old girlfriend as well.
example.egtrans: 如果我们同时也邀请他以前的女友，只会使事情更加复杂。

example.eg: The rescue operation has been complicated by bad weather.
example.egtrans: 恶劣的天气使救援工作变得更加艰难。

example.eg: These new rules have complicated the tax system even further.
example.egtrans: 这些新规定使税收制度更加复杂。

trans_examp.trans_en: If one illness complicates another illness, it makes the other illness worse.

example.eg: The breathing problem has now been complicated by a chest infection.
example.egtrans: 因为胸腔感染，他的呼吸问题变得更加严重了。

component.name: component
component.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part that combines with other parts to form something bigger

example.eg: television/aircraft/computer components
example.egtrans: 电视／飞机／计算机零部件

example.eg: The factory supplies electrical components for cars.
example.egtrans: 这家工厂供应汽车电器部件。

example.eg: The course has four main components: business law, finance, computing and management skills.
example.egtrans: 这门课由4大部分组成：商业法、金融、计算机操作和管理技巧。

example.eg: Fresh fruit and vegetables are an essential component of a healthy diet.
example.egtrans: 新鲜水果和蔬菜是健康饮食的一个基本要素。

example.eg: The control of inflation is a key component of the government's economic policy.
example.egtrans: 控制通货膨胀是政府经济政策中的关键环节。

compound.name: compound
compound.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a chemical that combines two or more elements

example.eg: Salt is a compound of sodium and chlorine.
example.egtrans: 盐是钠和氯的化合物。

example.eg: Many fertilizers contain nitrogen compounds.
example.egtrans: 许多化学肥料都含有氮化合物。

trans_examp.trans_en: something consisting of two or more different parts

example.eg: Then there was his manner, a curious compound of humour and severity.
example.egtrans: 还有他的态度，那是一种幽默与严厉的奇异混合。

trans_examp.trans_en: a word that combines two or more different words. Often, the meaning of the compound cannot be discovered by knowing the meaning of the different words that form it. Compounds may be written either as one word or as separate words

example.eg: 'Bodyguard' and 'floppy disk' are two examples of compounds.
example.egtrans: bodyguard 和 floppy disk 是两个复合词。

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area surrounded by fences or walls that contains a group of buildings

example.eg: The gates opened and the troops marched into their compound.
example.egtrans: 大门开了，部队进入他们的大院。

example.eg: The embassy compound has been closed to the public because of a bomb threat.
example.egtrans: 因受到炸弹威胁，使馆区停止对公众开放。

compound.name: compound
compound.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a problem or difficult situation worse

example.eg: Her terror was compounded by the feeling that she was being watched.
example.egtrans: 她有种被人监视的感觉，这加剧了她的恐惧感。

example.eg: His financial problems were compounded when he unexpectedly lost his job.
example.egtrans: 他意外地失去了工作，这使他手头更紧了。

example.eg: Severe drought has compounded food shortages in the region.
example.egtrans: 严重的干旱加剧了该地区的食品短缺问题。

dsense.name: compound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to mix two things together

example.eg: Most tyres are made of rubber compounded with other chemicals and materials.
example.egtrans: 大多数轮胎都是用橡胶和其他化学制品、材料混合制成的。

compound.name: compound
compound.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: consisting of two or more parts

used to refer to a system of paying interest in which interest is paid both on the original amount of money invested (= given to companies hoping to get more back) or borrowed and on the interest that has collected over a period of time

example.eg: compound interest
example.egtrans: 复利

example.eg: The investment fund has achieved annual compound returns of 18.2 percent.
example.egtrans: 投资得到了18.2%的复利年回报率。

compress.name: compress
compress.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to press something into a smaller space

example.eg: Firmly compress the soil in the pot so that the plant is secure.
example.egtrans: 把盆里的土压实使植株固定。

example.eg: compressed air
example.egtrans: 压缩空气

trans_examp.trans_en: to make information, a piece of writing, etc. shorter
trans_examp.trans_cn: 压缩（文字）；使（信息、作品等）精炼，缩短

example.eg: The course compresses two year's training into six intensive months.
example.egtrans: 这项课程把两年的培训内容压缩成6个月的强化训练。

example.eg: I managed to compress ten pages of notes into four paragraphs.
example.egtrans: 我设法把10页的笔记压缩成了4个段落。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a computer file use less space when it is stored in the memory of a computer or on a disk, by using a special program

example.eg: to compress data/files
example.egtrans: 压缩数据／文件

compress.name: compress
compress.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thick, soft piece of cloth that is pressed to a part of a person's body to stop bleeding or to reduce pain or swelling
trans_examp.trans_cn: （止血、止痛或消肿的）敷布，压布

example.eg: a cold/hot compress
example.egtrans: 冷／热敷布

compute.name: compute
compute.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to calculate an answer or amount by using a machine

example.eg: Compute the ratio of the object's height to its weight.
example.egtrans: 计算一下该物体的高度和重量之比。

concatenate.name: concatenate
concatenate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put things together as a connected series
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使连接,使连锁，把…连成一串

example.eg: The filename is a series of concatenated words with no spaces.
example.egtrans: 文件名是一串单词连接在一起，之间没有空格。

concept.name: concept
concept.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a principle or idea

example.eg: The concept of free speech is unknown to them.
example.egtrans: 他们没有言论自由的概念。

example.eg: It is very difficult to define the concept of beauty.
example.egtrans: 很难给美这个概念下一个定义。

example.eg: I failed to grasp the film's central concept.
example.egtrans: 我没理解这部电影的中心思想。

example.eg: Kleenbrite is a whole new concept in toothpaste!
example.egtrans: Kleenbrite 是牙膏生产领域的一个全新概念！

phrase.phrase_title: not have any concept/have no concept of sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not understand about something

example.eg: I don't think you have any concept of the pain you have caused her.
example.egtrans: 我觉得你对自己给她造成的痛苦根本就一无所知。

concern.name: concern
concern.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: concern
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause worry to someone

example.eg: The state of my father's health concerns us greatly.
example.egtrans: 我父亲的健康状况让我们非常担心。

example.eg: It concerns me that he hasn't been in contact.
example.egtrans: 还没有联系到他，我很担心。

dsense.name: concern
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be important to someone or to involve someone directly
trans_examp.trans_cn: 对…很重要；与…相关；涉及到…，关系到…

example.eg: Matters of pollution and the environment concern us all.
example.egtrans: 污染和环境的问题与我们每个人都息息相关。

example.eg: What I have to say to Amy doesn't concern you.
example.egtrans: 我要跟埃米说的事与你无关。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a story, film, or article concerns a particular subject, person, etc., it is about that person or subject.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （故事、电影或文章）涉及，是关于…的

example.eg: The documentary concerns a woman who goes to China as a missionary.
example.egtrans: 电影讲述的是一位去中国传教的女子的故事。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to become involved with something, or worried about something

example.eg: There's no need for you to concern yourself with what happened.
example.egtrans: 你不用操心发生了什么事情。

example.eg: Don't concern yourself. She'll be home soon.
example.egtrans: 别担心，她很快就会回家的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: something you write at the start of a formal letter or notice when you do not know exactly who it should be sent to
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用于正式信函开头处）敬启者

concern.name: concern
concern.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: concern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a worried or nervous feeling about something, or something that makes you feel worried
trans_examp.trans_cn: 担心；忧虑；挂念；忧虑的事情

example.eg: Concern for the safety of the two missing teenagers is growing.
example.egtrans: 两名失踪少年的安危越来越令人担忧。

example.eg: There's a lot of public concern about/over dangerous toxins recently found in food.
example.egtrans: 公众对近来在食物中发现危险毒素一事非常不安。

example.eg: My concern is that you're not getting enough work done.
example.egtrans: 我担心的是你你工作的完成量不够。

dsense.name: concern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a company

example.eg: a family concern
example.egtrans: 家族企业

example.eg: It started slowly, but the company is now a going concern (= doing business effectively).
example.egtrans: 公司起步很慢，但现在生意做得很好。

dsense.name: concern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is important to you, or the fact of being important
trans_examp.trans_cn: 重要的事；关心的事，关切的事；关心，关切

example.eg: His concern to appear sophisticated amused everyone.
example.egtrans: 他一心要显得老练，让大家觉得很好笑。

example.eg: The company's sole concern is to ensure the safety of its employees.
example.egtrans: 公司唯一关注的是要确保其员工的安全。

example.eg: There's a matter of some concern that I have to discuss with you.
example.egtrans: 我有件重要的事得跟你商量。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that involves or affects you or is important to you
trans_examp.trans_cn: 关切的事；关心的事；有利害关系的事

example.eg: What were the major concerns of the writers from this period?
example.egtrans: 这一时期作家们主要关注的是什么？

example.eg: I don't want to hear about it - it's no concern of mine!
example.egtrans: 我不想听那事——它与我无关！

example.eg: "What's happening?" "That's none of/not any of your concern."
example.egtrans: “发生什么事了?”“不关你的事。”

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be important

example.eg: The results of the election are of concern to us all.
example.egtrans: 选举的结果对我们所有人都有重大影响。

concise.name: concise
concise.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: short and clear, expressing what needs to be said without unnecessary words
trans_examp.trans_cn: 简洁的；简明的；简练的；简明扼要的

example.eg: Make your answers clear and concise.
example.egtrans: 回答要言简意赅。

conclude.name: conclude
conclude.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: conclude
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to end a speech, meeting, or piece of writing

example.eg: She concluded the speech by reminding us of our responsibility.
example.egtrans: 她在演讲结束时提醒我们所担负的责任。

example.eg: Before I conclude, I'd like to thank you all for coming.
example.egtrans: 在结束发言前，我想感谢诸位的光临。

example.eg: The concert concluded with a rousing chorus.
example.egtrans: 音乐会以激动人心的大合唱结束。

trans_examp.trans_en: to complete an official agreement or task, or arrange a business deal

dsense.name: conclude
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to judge or decide something after thinking carefully about it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 断定；决定；推断出；作出（结论）

example.eg: The jury concluded from the evidence that the defendant was innocent.
example.egtrans: 陪审团依据证据判裁决告无罪。

example.eg: The discussions continued late into the night, but nothing was concluded.
example.egtrans: 一直谈到深夜，可是没有作出任何决定。

Conclusion.name: conclusion
Conclusion.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: conclusion
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the final part of something

example.eg: Be careful not to introduce new ideas in the conclusion of your essay.
example.egtrans: 注意不要在你的论文结论部分引入新的想法。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: finally

example.eg: In conclusion, I would like to thank our guest speaker.
example.egtrans: 最后，我要感谢我们的演讲嘉宾。

dsense.name: conclusion
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of arranging or agreeing something formally

example.eg: the conclusion of the deal/treaty
example.egtrans: 协议的达成／条约的缔结

dsense.name: conclusion
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the opinion you have after considering all the information about something

example.eg: Did you come to/reach/draw any conclusions at the meeting this morning?
example.egtrans: 今天上午的会议上你们有没有作出什么决定？

example.eg: At first I thought he was a bit shy, but I've come to the conclusion that he's simply unfriendly!
example.egtrans: 起初我以为他有点害羞，可是后来我断定他就是不友好！

condense.name: condense
condense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: condense
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to reduce something, such as a speech or piece of writing, in length

example.eg: I condensed ten pages of comments into/to two.
example.egtrans: 我将十页的评论压缩成了两页。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a liquid thicker by removing some of the water

dsense.name: condense
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change or make something change from a gas to a liquid or solid state
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使气体）变成液体或固体；（使）凝固；（使）凝结

example.eg: Water vapour in the air condenses into fog.
example.egtrans: 空气中的水汽凝结形成雾。

condition.name: condition
condition.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: condition
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the particular state that something or someone is in

example.eg: Mum's still got our pram - it's very old, but it's in perfect condition.
example.egtrans: 妈妈还留着我们的婴儿车——虽然很旧了，但仍然完好。

example.eg: They left the flat in a terrible condition - there was mess everywhere.
example.egtrans: 他们把公寓弄得一团糟——到处一片狼藉。

example.eg: The hospital say her condition (= state of health) is improving slowly.
example.egtrans: 医院说她的健康状况正在慢慢好转。

example.eg: He's in no condition (= he is too sick or too drunk) to drive home.
example.egtrans: 他的状况根本不能自己开车回家。

trans_examp.trans_en: any of different types of diseases

example.eg: to suffer from a heart/skin condition
example.egtrans: 患有心脏／皮肤病

example.eg: a medical condition
example.egtrans: 内科疾病

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the physical situation that someone or something is in and affected by
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 物质条件；情况；实际环境

example.eg: weather conditions
example.egtrans: 天气条件

example.eg: Working conditions here are primitive.
example.egtrans: 这里的工作条件很简陋。

example.eg: The prisoners were kept in the most appalling conditions.
example.egtrans: 犯人们被关押在条件异常恶劣的地方。

example.eg: Under what conditions do plants grow best?
example.egtrans: 植物在什么条件下生长得最好？

example.eg: Riis devoted his life to improving conditions in urban slums.
example.egtrans: 里斯为改善城市贫民窟的生活条件倾注了大量心力。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: not healthy enough for hard physical exercise, as a result of not taking part in sport or other physical activities
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （由于不参加锻炼或其他体力活动而）身体状况不佳，不在状态

dsense.name: condition
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an arrangement that must exist before something else can happen

example.eg: One of the conditions in the contract is that we don't build on the land.
example.egtrans: 合同条款之一是我们不在这片土地上建造房子。

example.eg: We're not in a position to make/set any conditions - we'll have to accept what they offer us.
example.egtrans: 我们没有资格提任何条件——我们只能接受他们提供的一切。

example.eg: Under the conditions of the agreement, she must vacate the house on 12 July .
example.egtrans: 根据协议条款，她必须在7月12日腾出这所房子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: only if

example.eg: I'll come to the party on the condition that you don't wear those ridiculous trousers!
example.egtrans: 我会参加聚会，条件是你不要穿那条丢人现眼的裤子！

condition.name: condition
condition.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: condition
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to train or influence a person or animal mentally so that they do or expect a particular thing without thinking about it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 训练；使习惯于；使适应；使（人或动物）形成条件反射

example.eg: a conditioned reflex/response
example.egtrans: 条件反射／反应

example.eg: Pavlov conditioned dogs to salivate at the sound of a bell.
example.egtrans: 巴甫洛夫通过训练使狗一听到铃声就流口水。

example.eg: Women were conditioned to expect lower wages than men.
example.egtrans: 女性以前习惯于接受比男性低的工资。

dsense.name: condition
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to try to improve the quality or appearance of your hair, skin, etc. by putting a conditioner on it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使用护发或护肤品）改善，养护（发质、皮肤等）

conditionally.name: conditionally
conditionally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in way that depends on something else being done

example.eg: Six prisoners were released conditionally.
example.egtrans: 六名囚犯被有条件释放。

example.eg: The club announced they had conditionally agreed a £22m deal.
example.egtrans: 俱乐部宣布他们有条件地同意了一笔2200万英镑的交易。

conform.name: conform
conform.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to behave according to the usual standards of behaviour that are expected by a group or society
trans_examp.trans_cn: 顺从；遵从；随大流，顺应习俗

example.eg: At our school, you were required to conform, and there was no place for originality.
example.egtrans: 我们学校要求每个人循规蹈矩，容不得创新求变。

confused.name: confused
confused.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: unable to think clearly or to understand something

example.eg: Grandpa gets pretty confused sometimes, and doesn't even know what day it is.
example.egtrans: 祖父有的时候很糊涂，甚至不知道当天是星期几。

example.eg: I'm a bit confused. Was that her husband or her son she was with?
example.egtrans: 我有些糊涂。跟她在一起的是她丈夫还是她儿子？

trans_examp.trans_en: not clear and therefore difficult to understand

example.eg: Your essay gets a bit confused halfway through when you introduce too many ideas at once.
example.egtrans: 你的文章写到一半时一下子提出了太多观点，显得有些混乱。

consecutive.name: consecutive
consecutive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Consecutive events, numbers, etc. follow one after another without an interruption.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 连续的，连贯的，不间断的

example.eg: This is the fifth consecutive weekend that I've spent working.
example.egtrans: 这是我连续第五个周末加班。

consequence.name: consequence
consequence.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a result of a particular action or situation, often one that is bad or not convenient
trans_examp.trans_cn: （常指不好或不利的）结果，后果

example.eg: Not making a will can have serious consequences for your children and other family members.
example.egtrans: 不立遗嘱可能会给你的子女或者家庭其他成员带来严重后果。

example.eg: Scientists think it is unlikely that any species will actually become extinct as a consequence of the oil spill.
example.egtrans: 科学家们认为实际上不太可能会有什么物种因为石油泄漏而灭绝。

example.eg: I told the hairdresser to do what she wanted to my hair, and look at the consequences!
example.egtrans: 我告诉理发师就按她的想法来做我的头发好了，可瞧瞧结果！

example.eg: Well, if you insist on eating so much, you'll have to suffer/take (= accept and deal with) the consequences!
example.egtrans: 好吧，要是你坚持吃这么多，你会自食其果的！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: not important
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 不重要的；无足轻重的；无关紧要的

example.eg: The money was of little consequence to Tony.
example.egtrans: 这钱对于托尼来说无足轻重。

consider.name: consider
consider.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: consider
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spend time thinking about a possibility or making a decision

example.eg: Don't make any decisions before you've considered the situation.
example.egtrans: 在仔细考虑过这个问题之前别作任何决定。

example.eg: Have you considered what you'll do if you don't get the job?
example.egtrans: 你有没有考虑过，要是得不到这份工作你该怎么办？

example.eg: We're considering selling the house.
example.egtrans: 我们在考虑卖掉房子。

example.eg: She's being considered for the job.
example.egtrans: 目前正在考虑是否由她来做这项工作。

example.eg: I'd like some time to consider before I make a decision.
example.egtrans: 我想花点时间斟酌斟酌再作决定。

dsense.name: consider
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give attention to a particular subject or fact when judging something else

example.eg: You've got to consider the time element when planning the whole project.
example.egtrans: 你在规划整个工程时必须考虑到时间因素。

example.eg: If you consider how long he's been learning the piano, he's not very good.
example.egtrans: 要是你考虑到他学钢琴有多久了，你就知道他弹得并不好。

dsense.name: consider
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to care about or respect other people or their feelings and wishes

example.eg: Did you consider your mother and how she's going to feel about you leaving?
example.egtrans: 你考虑过你母亲吗？对你离开她会怎么想？

example.eg: She never considers anyone but herself - she's totally selfish!
example.egtrans: 她从来只考虑自已不顾别人——太自私了！

dsense.name: consider
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to believe someone or something to be, or think of him, her, or it as something

example.eg: He is currently considered (to be) the best British athlete.
example.egtrans: 他目前被认为是英国最出色的运动员。

example.eg: We don't consider her to be right for the job.
example.egtrans: 我们认为她不适合干这项工作。

example.eg: It is considered bad manners in some cultures to speak with your mouth full of food.
example.egtrans: 在某些文化习俗中，说话时嘴里塞满食物被认为是不礼貌的。

example.eg: I consider myself lucky that I only hurt my arm in the accident.
example.egtrans: 我觉得自己还算幸运，在事故中只伤了手臂。

example.eg: Do you consider him a friend of yours?
example.egtrans: 你把他当作朋友吗？

example.eg: She considers (that) she has done enough to help already.
example.egtrans: 她认为自己已经够帮忙的了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be very much admired
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 受人尊敬；为人重视；受到高度评价

example.eg: I don't like her books, but I know she's very highly considered.
example.egtrans: 我从不爱看她的书，可是我知道她备受推崇。

consistent.name: consistent
consistent.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: consistent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: always behaving or happening in a similar, especially positive, way
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一贯的；坚持的；始终如一的

example.eg: There has been a consistent improvement in her attitude.
example.egtrans: 她的态度一直在改进。

example.eg: Her work is sometimes good, but the problem is she's not consistent.
example.egtrans: 她工作有时不错，可问题是她不能始终如一。

dsense.name: consistent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: in agreement with other facts or with typical or previous behaviour, or having the same principles as something else

example.eg: What the witness said in court was not consistent with the statement he made to the police.
example.egtrans: 证人在法庭上的证词和他对警方的陈述不一致。

example.eg: We do not consider his behaviour to be consistent with the holding of a high-ranking job.
example.egtrans: 我们认为他的行为与他位居要职的身份不相符。

consolidate.name: consolidate
consolidate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to become, or cause something to become, stronger, and more certain

example.eg: The success of their major product consolidated the firm's position in the market.
example.egtrans: 公司主打产品取得的成功巩固了该公司在市场上的地位。

example.eg: She hoped that marriage would consolidate their relationship.
example.egtrans: 她希望婚姻能巩固他们的关系。

example.eg: The party consolidated its hold on power during its term of office.
example.egtrans: 该党在执政期间加强了对政权的控制。

example.eg: The company has been expanding rapidly, and I feel it's now time to consolidate (= stop growing and make our present position stronger).
example.egtrans: 公司一直在快速扩展，我觉得该是巩固的时候了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to combine several things, especially businesses, so that they become more effective, or to be combined in this way

example.eg: The two firms consolidated to form a single company.
example.egtrans: 两家小公司合并成了一家公司。

constant.name: constant
constant.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: constant
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening a lot or all the time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 经常发生的；连续发生的；连续不断的

example.eg: He's in constant trouble with the police.
example.egtrans: 他与警方麻烦不断。

example.eg: machines that are in constant use
example.egtrans: 经常使用的机器

dsense.name: constant
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: staying the same, or not getting less or more

example.eg: We ran at a fairly constant speed.
example.egtrans: 我们保持了比较平稳的跑动速度。

example.eg: The fridge keeps food at a constant temperature.
example.egtrans: 冰箱在恒温下保存食物。

dsense.name: constant
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A constant companion or friend who is loyal to you.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （伴侣或朋友）忠实的，忠贞不渝的，始终如一的

constant.name: constant
constant.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular number or amount that never changes

constituent.name: constituent
constituent.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: constituent
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the parts that a substance or combination is made of

example.eg: What are the basic constituents of the mixture?
example.egtrans: 这种混合物的基本成分是什么？

dsense.name: constituent
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a voter (= person who can vote) in a particular area of the country

example.eg: The MP worked hard, always talking to his constituents and listening to their problems.
example.egtrans: 这位参议员工作努力，总是跟本区选民交谈，听取他们的难处。

constraint.name: constraint
constraint.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that controls what you do by keeping you within particular limits

example.eg: The constraints of politeness wouldn't allow her to say what she really thought about his cooking.
example.egtrans: 出于礼貌，她不会说出自己对他的厨艺的真实看法。

example.eg: Financial constraints on the company are preventing them from employing new staff.
example.egtrans: 公司财务紧张使得他们不能再聘请新员工。

trans_examp.trans_en: unnatural behaviour that is sometimes the result of forcing yourself to act in a particular way

example.eg: She tried to appear friendly, but her constraint was obvious.
example.egtrans: 她尽力显得友好，可是显然很拘束。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something under constraint, you do it only because you have been forced to.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 被强迫地；迫于压力；在强制下

example.eg: They confessed, but only under severe constraint.
example.egtrans: 他们迫于巨大的压力才说出了真相。

construct.name: construct
construct.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to build something or put together different parts to form something whole

example.eg: to construct a new bridge/building
example.egtrans: 建造新桥梁／大楼

example.eg: The walls are constructed of concrete.
example.egtrans: 墙是用混凝土筑成的。

example.eg: to construct a story/sentence/argument
example.egtrans: 构思故事／造句／构筑论点

construct.name: construct
construct.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an idea or an imaginary situation

example.eg: His reputation as an eccentric is largely a media construct.
example.egtrans: 他行为古怪的名声多半源于媒体的杜撰。

constructor.name: constructor
constructor.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who builds something or puts it together from different parts

example.eg: The firm produces kits for amateur car constructors.
example.egtrans: 这家公司为非专业的汽车装配者生产成套工具。

consult.name: consult
consult.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get information or advice from a person, book, etc. with special knowledge on a particular subject

example.eg: If the symptoms get worse, consult your doctor.
example.egtrans: 如果症状恶化就要去就医。

example.eg: I'm not quite sure how to get there - I'd better consult a map.
example.egtrans: 我不是很清楚怎么去那儿——我最好查查地图。

trans_examp.trans_en: to discuss something with someone before you make a decision

example.eg: Why didn't you consult me about this?
example.egtrans: 你怎么没跟我商量这件事？

example.eg: This afternoon the president was consulting with his advisers.
example.egtrans: 今天下午总统在征求顾问们的意见。

contact.name: contact
contact.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: contact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: communication with someone, especially by speaking or writing to them regularly
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指经常通过交谈、书信的）联系，联络，交往

example.eg: "Have you been in contact with Andrew recently?" "Only by phone."
example.egtrans: “你最近跟安德鲁联系过吗？”“只是打过电话。”

example.eg: I'm still in contact with her - we write a couple of times a year.
example.egtrans: 我和她仍有联系——我们一年写几封信。

example.eg: There isn't enough contact between teachers and parents.
example.egtrans: 老师和家长间联系不够。

example.eg: I've been busy at home and have hardly had any contact with the outside world.
example.egtrans: 我一直都在家里忙乎，和外面的世界几乎没有什么联系。

example.eg: I'd hate to lose contact with my college friends.
example.egtrans: 我不愿和从前的校友失去联系。

example.eg: She finally made contact with him in Italy.
example.egtrans: 她最终在意大利和他取得了联系。

example.eg: Air traffic control lost radio contact with the pilot of the plane ten minutes before the accident.
example.egtrans: 事故发生前10分钟，空中交通管制中心失去了和飞机驾驶员的无线电联系。

example.eg: The school needs a contact number (= phone number, especially for emergencies) for parents during school hours.
example.egtrans: 学校希望有上课时间能联系到家长的电话号码。

dsense.name: contact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of two people or things touching each other

example.eg: Don't let that glue come into contact with your skin.
example.egtrans: 别让那种胶水粘到你的皮肤上。

example.eg: Have you been in contact with (= touched or been very near) anyone with the disease?
example.egtrans: 你接触过患这种病的人吗？

example.eg: He hates physical contact of any kind - he doesn't even like to shake your hand.
example.egtrans: 他讨厌任何形式的身体接触——甚至不愿和人握手。

dsense.name: contact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person, especially someone in a high position, who can give you useful information or introductions that will help you at work or socially
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指身居高位，能提供有用信息或引见的）熟人，（社会）关系

example.eg: I don't really know how she got the job, but I think her mother has contacts.
example.egtrans: 我不知道她到底怎么得到这份工作的，不过我想她母亲有些门路。

example.eg: He gave me the name of one of his contacts in a design firm, who offered me a job.
example.egtrans: 他给了我一个他在一家设计公司熟人的名字，我在那里得到了工作。

example.eg: We're building up (= increasing the number of) our contacts in the business.
example.egtrans: 我们在业内逐渐建立起自己的关系网。

trans_examp.trans_en: the people whose names, telephone numbers, addresses, etc. you keep, for example stored on your mobile phone

example.eg: How do you add a new contact?
example.egtrans: 如何添加新的联系人？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the place on your mobile phone or computer where you store people's names, telephone numbers, addresses, etc.

example.eg: Click the icon to go to contacts.
example.egtrans: 点击图标进入通讯录。

example.eg: I've added her number to my contacts.
example.egtrans: 我已经把她的号码加到我的通讯录里。

dsense.name: contact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part in a circuit that makes the circuit complete when it touches another part

dsense.name: contact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small round curved piece of transparent plastic, worn on the surface of the eye to improve your sight

dsense.name: contact
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a photograph produced by allowing light to pass through the film onto paper that is pressed tightly to it

contact.name: contact
contact.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to communicate with someone by calling or sending them a letter, email, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通过电话或写电子邮件等）联系，联络

example.eg: I tried to contact him at his office, but he wasn't in.
example.egtrans: 我试着给他的办公室打电话，但是他不在。

example.eg: You can contact me on (US also at) (= speak to me using the phone) 388 9146.
example.egtrans: 你可以拨3889146和我联系。

example.eg: Unless the money is paid, we will be contacting our legal department.
example.egtrans: 如果不付款，我们马上就和法律部门联系。

contents.name: content
contents.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: pleased with your situation and not hoping for change or improvement

example.eg: He seems fairly content with (his) life.
example.egtrans: 他好像对生活相当满足。

example.eg: They're content to socialize with a very small circle of people.
example.egtrans: 他们满足于只和一小群人交往。

contents.name: content
contents.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: content
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the ideas that are contained in a piece of writing, a speech, or a film

example.eg: It's a very stylish and beautiful film, but it lacks content.
example.egtrans: 这部电影很新潮而且画面美丽，但内容空洞。

example.eg: We've discussed the unusual form of the book - now, what about the content?
example.egtrans: 我们已经讨论了这本书与众不同的形式——现在，谈谈它的内容怎么样？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the articles or parts contained in a magazine or book, with the number of the page they begin on

example.eg: the table of (= list of) contents
example.egtrans: 目录

example.eg: the contents page
example.egtrans: 目录页

dsense.name: content
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of a particular substance contained in something

example.eg: Chocolate has a high fat content.
example.egtrans: 巧克力脂肪含量很高。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: everything that is contained within something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 所含之物；容纳的东西；内容

example.eg: The contents of his bag spilled all over the floor.
example.egtrans: 他包里的东西掉了一地。

example.eg: He didn't need to open the letter because he already knew the contents.
example.egtrans: 他不用拆那封信，因为他已经知道内容了。

contents.name: content
contents.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone feel happy and satisfied

example.eg: You're quite easily contented, aren't you?
example.egtrans: 你很容易满足，是不是？

example.eg: My explanation seemed to content him.
example.egtrans: 我的解释似乎让他很满意。

context.name: context
context.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: context
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the situation within which something exists or happens, and that can help explain it

example.eg: It is important to see all the fighting and bloodshed in his plays in historical context.
example.egtrans: 结合历史背景解读他戏剧作品中所有的争斗和流血事件，这点很重要。

example.eg: This small battle is very important in the context of Scottish history.
example.egtrans: 这场小战役在苏格兰历史上非常重要。

dsense.name: context
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the text or speech that comes immediately before and after a particular phrase or piece of text and helps to explain its meaning

example.eg: In this exercise, a word is blanked out and you have to guess what it is by looking at the context.
example.egtrans: 在这个练习中，有一个单词被抽去了，你必须根据上下文猜测这个单词是什么。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If words are used out of context, only a small separate part of what was originally said or written is reported, with the result that their meaning is not clear or is not understood.

example.eg: The reporter took my remarks completely out of context.
example.egtrans: 记者引用我的话完全是断章取义。

contextual.name: contextual
contextual.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: related to the context of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 上下文的；与语境相关的

example.eg: It's impossible to understand the nuances of an isolated word without some contextual clues.
example.egtrans: 没有上下文提示不可能弄清单个单词意义上的细微差别。

continuous.name: continuous
continuous.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: without a pause or interruption

example.eg: continuous pain
example.egtrans: 持续的疼痛

example.eg: My computer makes a continuous low buzzing noise.
example.egtrans: 我的电脑不停地发出低沉的嗡嗡声。

example.eg: A continuous whiteline (= line without spaces) in the middle of the road means no overtaking.
example.egtrans: 公路中间白色实线表示禁止超车。

contract.name: contract
contract.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a legal document that states and explains a formal agreement between two different people or groups, or the agreement itself

example.eg: a contract of employment
example.egtrans: 雇用合同

example.eg: a temporary/building contract
example.egtrans: 临时／建筑合同

example.eg: They could take legal action against you if you break (the terms of) the contract.
example.egtrans: 如果你违反合同（条款），他们可以起诉你。

example.eg: My solicitor is drawing up (= writing) a contract.
example.egtrans: 我的律师正在起草一份合同。

example.eg: Don't sign/enter into any contract before examining its conditions carefully.
example.egtrans: 仔细核查合同条款之前，不要签定任何合同。

example.eg: They're the firm of architects who won the contract to design the Museum of Fine Art extension.
example.egtrans: 他们就是赢得国家美术馆扩建工程设计合同的那家建筑公司。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have formally agreed to work for a company or person on a stated job for a stated period of time
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 签订合同（为某公司或某人工作）；有合同约束

contract.name: contract
contract.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: contract
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make or become shorter or narrower or generally smaller in size

example.eg: In spoken English, "do not" often contracts to "don't".
example.egtrans: 在英语口语中，do not 常常缩略成 don't。

example.eg: As it cooled, the metal contracted.
example.egtrans: 金属冷却后收缩了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to become smaller in amount or quantity

example.eg: A recession is a period when the economy is contracting.
example.egtrans: 经济衰退期是指经济萎缩的一个时期。

example.eg: Agricultural output has contracted by 2.3 percent.
example.egtrans: 农业产量下降了百分之二点三。

dsense.name: contract
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to catch or become ill with a disease

example.eg: He contracted malaria while he was travelling.
example.egtrans: 他旅行时染上了疟疾。

dsense.name: contract
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a legal agreement with someone to do work or to have work done for you

example.eg: Our company was contracted to build shelters for the homeless.
example.egtrans: 我们公司刚刚签订合同，为无家可归的人建造收容所。

contrary.name: contrary
contrary.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the opposite
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 相反；反面；对立面；相反事物

example.eg: I was worried that it might be too hard for me but it turned out the contrary was true.
example.egtrans: 我原来担心那可能对我来说太难了，可是我发现恰恰相反。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to show that you think or feel the opposite of what has just been stated

example.eg: "I thought you said the film was exciting?" "On the contrary, I nearly fell asleep half way through it!"
example.egtrans: “你不觉得这部电影很精彩吗？”“正相反，看到一半我差点睡着！”

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: saying or showing the opposite

example.eg: For a long time it was thought to be a harmless substance, but we now have proof/evidence to the contrary.
example.egtrans: 长期以来这种物质被认为是无害的，但最近我们有了相反的证据。

contrary.name: contrary
contrary.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: contrary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: opposite
trans_examp.trans_cn: 相反的，对立的；完全不同的

example.eg: a contrary point of view
example.egtrans: 相反的观点

example.eg: Contrary to all our expectations, he found a well-paid job and a nice girlfriend.
example.egtrans: 出乎我们的意料，他找到了一份报酬不菲的工作和一个漂亮的女友。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a different way from what most people believe
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 与大多数人的看法不同

example.eg: Contrary to popular opinion, I don't dye my hair!
example.egtrans: 与大多数人的想法不同，我不染头发！

dsense.name: contrary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A contrary person wants to disagree with and annoy other people.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 乖戾的；故意作对的；执拗的

example.eg: He doesn't really mean it - he's just being contrary.
example.egtrans: 这不是他的本意——他只是在故意作对。

contrast.name: contrast
contrast.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an obvious difference between two or more things

example.eg: I like the contrast of the white trousers with the black jacket.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢白色长裤与黑色夹克形成的反差。

example.eg: The antique furnishing provides an unusual contrast to the modernity of the building.
example.egtrans: 这座建筑物的古典装饰与它自身的现代风格形成了不同寻常的反差。

example.eg: There's a marked contrast between his character and hers.
example.egtrans: 他的性格与她形成了鲜明对比。

example.eg: Their economy has expanded, while ours, by/in contrast, has declined.
example.egtrans: 他们的经济快速增长，相比之下，我们的经济则滑坡了。

example.eg: The amount spent on defence is in stark/sharp (= in very noticeable) contrast to that spent on housing and health.
example.egtrans: 国防支出与住房及医疗保健的支出形成了鲜明的对照。

example.eg: I love his use of contrast (= strong differences between light and darkness) in his later photographs.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢他后期摄影作品中光暗对比的运用。

contrast.name: contrast
contrast.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to compare two people or things in order to show the differences between them

example.eg: If you contrast some of her early writing with her later work, you can see just how much she improved.
example.egtrans: 如果你对比一下她的早期作品和后期的作品，就会看出她进步有多大。

trans_examp.trans_en: If one thing contrasts with another, it is very different from it.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 形成对照；显出明显的差异

example.eg: The styles of the two film makers contrast quite dramatically.
example.egtrans: 两位电影导演风格迥异。

example.eg: The tartness of the lemons contrasts with the sweetness of the honey.
example.egtrans: 柠檬的酸味和蜂蜜的甜味形成鲜明的对比。

convenient.name: convenient
convenient.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: suitable for your purposes and needs and causing the least difficulty

example.eg: Our local shop has very convenient opening hours.
example.egtrans: 我们当地的商店营业时间很合宜。

example.eg: A bike's a very convenient way of getting around.
example.egtrans: 骑自行车四处走动很方便。

example.eg: It's very convenient that you live near the office.
example.egtrans: 你们住在办公室附近很方便。

example.eg: I find it convenient to be able to do my banking online.
example.egtrans: 我觉得在网上办理银行业务很方便。

example.eg: What time would it be convenient for me to come over?
example.egtrans: 我什么时候过来您方便呢？

trans_examp.trans_en: near or easy to get to or use
trans_examp.trans_cn: 近的；容易得到的；好用的

example.eg: a very convenient bus service
example.egtrans: 非常便利的公交服务

example.eg: Our new house is very convenient for (= near to) the kids' school.
example.egtrans: 我们的新公寓离孩子们的学校很近。

convention.name: convention
convention.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: convention
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large formal meeting of people who do a particular job or have a similar interest, or a large meeting for a political party

example.eg: the national Democratic convention
example.egtrans: 民主党全国大会

example.eg: Where are they holding their party convention?
example.egtrans: 他们在哪里召开党员大会？

dsense.name: convention
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a usual or accepted way of behaving, especially in social situations, often following an old way of thinking or a custom in one particular society
trans_examp.trans_cn: 传统；（尤指社会）习俗，常规，惯例

example.eg: They defied/flouted/broke with convention by giving up their jobs and becoming self-sufficient.
example.egtrans: 他们离经叛道，放弃了工作，开始过自给自足的生活。

example.eg: Convention dictates that it is the man who asks the woman to marry him and not the other way round.
example.egtrans: 根据习俗，应由男人向女人求婚而不是反过来。

example.eg: In many countries it is the/a convention to wear black at funerals.
example.egtrans: 在葬礼上穿黑色的衣服是许多国家的习俗。

trans_examp.trans_en: a common way of showing something in art or writing

example.eg: an artistic convention
example.egtrans: 传统艺术手法

dsense.name: convention
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a formal agreement between country leaders, politicians, and states on a matter that involves them all

example.eg: the Geneva Convention
example.egtrans: 日内瓦公约

example.eg: a convention on human rights
example.egtrans: 人权公约

conventional.name: conventional
conventional.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: traditional and ordinary

example.eg: conventional behaviour/attitudes/clothes
example.egtrans: 传统行为／态度／服装

example.eg: conventional medicine/farming
example.egtrans: 常规药物／耕作

example.eg: a conventional wedding
example.egtrans: 传统婚礼

example.eg: I find his art dull and conventional.
example.egtrans: 我觉得他的艺术作品乏味俗套。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to weapons that are not nuclear, or to methods of fighting a war that do not involve nuclear weapons

example.eg: conventional weapons/bombs
example.egtrans: 常规武器／炸弹

convert.name: convert
convert.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: convert
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause something or someone to) change in form or character
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）改变，（使）转变；（使）改信；（使）皈依

example.eg: Could we convert the small bedroom into a second bathroom?
example.egtrans: 我们能把这间小卧室改建成第二间浴室吗？

example.eg: What's the formula for converting pounds into kilograms?
example.egtrans: 把磅换算成公斤的公式是什么？

trans_examp.trans_en: to change to a new religion, belief, opinion, etc., or to make someone do this
trans_examp.trans_cn: 改变信仰（或态度）；归附，皈依

example.eg: He converted to (= started believing in) Catholicism when he got married.
example.egtrans: 他婚后皈依了天主教。

example.eg: I used to hate exercise, but my sister has converted me (to it).
example.egtrans: 我以前不喜欢锻炼，但我姐姐改变了我。

dsense.name: convert
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: in sport , to score extra points such as a conversion, free throw, or penalty shot

convert.name: convert
convert.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who changes their beliefs, habits, or way of living
trans_examp.trans_cn: 改变信仰（或习惯、生活方式）的人

example.eg: a Christian/Buddhist convert
example.egtrans: 皈依基督教／佛教者

example.eg: a convert to vegetarianism/wholemeal bread
example.egtrans: 改食素食者／全麦面包者

convey.name: convey
convey.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: convey
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to express a thought, feeling, or idea so that it is understood by other people
trans_examp.trans_cn: 表达，传达（思想、感情或想法）

example.eg: His poetry conveys a great sense of religious devotion.
example.egtrans: 他的诗歌表达了献身宗教的强烈感情。

example.eg: Please convey our condolences to the family.
example.egtrans: 请向家人转达我们的哀思。

example.eg: I tried to convey in my speech how grateful we all were for his help.
example.egtrans: 在发言中，我竭力地表达我们大家对他所给予帮助的感激之情。

example.eg: You don't want to convey the impression that we're not interested.
example.egtrans: 你不想给人留下我们不感兴趣的印象吧。

dsense.name: convey
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take or carry someone or something to a particular place

example.eg: The goods are usually conveyed by rail.
example.egtrans: 这种货物通常通过铁路运输。

example.eg: Could you convey a message to Mr Merrick for me, please?
example.egtrans: 你能替我给梅里克先生传个口信吗？

coordinate.name: coordinate
coordinate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: coordinate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make many different things work effectively as a whole

example.eg: We need someone to coordinate the whole campaign.
example.egtrans: 我们需要有个人来协调整个活动。

example.eg: A number of charities are coordinating their efforts to distribute food to the region.
example.egtrans: 几家慈善机构通力协作为该地区分发食品。

dsense.name: coordinate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.
