trans_examp.trans_en: to match or look attractive together

example.eg: The bed linen coordinates with the bedroom curtains.
example.egtrans: 床单和卧室的窗帘很相配。

example.eg: a coordinating jacket and skirt
example.egtrans: 搭配得体的上衣和裙子

coordinate.name: coordinate
coordinate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: coordinate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of a pair of numbers and/or letters that show the exact position of a point on a map or graph

dsense.name: coordinate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: clothes, especially for women, that are made in matching colours or styles so that they can be worn together
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （尤指颜色、样式协调的女性）配套服装，套装

copyright.name: copyright
copyright.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the legal right to control the production and selling of a book, play, film, photograph, or piece of music

example.eg: Who owns/holds the copyright on this article?
example.egtrans: 谁拥有这篇文章的著作权？

example.eg: His work is no longer protected by copyright.
example.egtrans: 他的作品不再受版权保护。

example.eg: The symbol © shows that something is protected by copyright.
example.egtrans: ©这个标志表示受版权保护。

corner.name: corner
corner.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the point, area, or line that is formed by the meeting of two lines, surfaces, roads, etc.

example.eg: You go around corners too fast when you're driving!
example.egtrans: 你转弯时开得太快！

example.eg: There's a postbox on the corner (= the place where the street crosses another).
example.egtrans: 街角处有个邮筒。

example.eg: Click the icon in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen.
example.egtrans: 点击屏幕右下方的图标。

example.eg: I have a bruise where I hit my leg on the corner of the table.
example.egtrans: 我的腿撞到桌角上，起了一块淤青。

example.eg: They live just around/round the corner (= very close although not in the same road) - so we see them all the time.
example.egtrans: 他们就住在附近——所以我们常看见他们。

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a larger area, often somewhere quiet or far away
trans_examp.trans_cn: 角落，冷僻处；边远处；隐蔽的地方

example.eg: They live in a remote corner of Scotland, miles from the nearest store.
example.egtrans: 他们住在苏格兰一个边远的角落，离最近的商店也有几十英里。

trans_examp.trans_en: a kick in football or a shot in hockey that is taken from the corner of the playing area

corner.name: corner
corner.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: corner
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a vehicle corners well, badly, etc., it drives around corners in the stated way.

example.eg: It's a powerful car, but it doesn't corner well.
example.egtrans: 这辆车马力强劲，但转弯性能欠佳。

dsense.name: corner
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to force a person or an animal into a place or situation from which they cannot easily escape
trans_examp.trans_cn: 将（人或动物）逼入困境；使陷入绝境，使走投无路

example.eg: Once the police had cornered her in the basement, she gave herself up.
example.egtrans: 一旦警察把她困在地下室里，她便束手就擒了。

correct.name: correct
correct.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: in agreement with the true facts or with what is generally accepted

example.eg: a correct answer
example.egtrans: 正确答案

example.eg: "Is that the correct spelling?" "I don't know - look it up in a dictionary."
example.egtrans: “那个拼写对吗？”“不知道——查查词典吧。”

example.eg: It's not correct to describe them as "students".
example.egtrans: 把他们说成学生不确切。

example.eg: "Your name is Angela Black?" "That is correct."
example.egtrans: “你叫安杰拉·布莱克？”“没错。”

trans_examp.trans_en: taking or showing great care to behave or speak in a way that is generally accepted and approved of

example.eg: He's very correct in his dress/speech/manner, isn't he?
example.egtrans: 他穿着／谈吐／举止很得体，是不是？

correct.name: correct
correct.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show or tell someone that something is wrong and to make it right

example.eg: Students said it was helpful if the teacher corrected their pronunciation.
example.egtrans: 学生们说老师纠正他们的发音错误会对他们很有帮助。

example.eg: I have 30 homework assignments to correct.
example.egtrans: 我有30份家庭作业要阅改。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a medical treatment corrects a particular condition, it cures the condition or makes it easier to manage.

example.eg: glasses to correct poor vision
example.egtrans: 矫正视力的眼镜

example.eg: a chair that corrects bad posture
example.egtrans: 矫正不良坐姿的椅子

phrase.phrase_title: correct me if I'm wrong but...

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: said as a polite and slightly formal way of disagreeing with someone
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 如果我没说错的话（委婉地表示不同意）

example.eg: Correct me if I'm wrong, but I think we arranged the meeting for the 12 December.
example.egtrans: 如果我没记错的话，我想我们是把会议安排在了12月12日。

correctly.name: correctly
correctly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is in agreement with the true facts or with what is generally accepted

example.eg: Have I pronounced your name correctly?
example.egtrans: 我把你的名字念对了吗？

example.eg: Correctly answer this question for your chance to win a car!
example.egtrans: 答对这个问题，你就有机会赢得一辆汽车！

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a way of speaking or behaving) in a way that is generally accepted and approved of

example.eg: My mother took elocution lessons so she could speak correctly.
example.egtrans: 为了能言谈得体，我母亲去上了口才课。

example.eg: My parents have taught me to behave correctly.
example.egtrans: 我父母教我要举止得体。

correspond.name: correspond
correspond.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: correspond
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to match or be similar or equal

example.eg: The money I've saved corresponds roughly to the amount I need for my plane ticket.
example.egtrans: 我存的钱大致够我买机票所需。

example.eg: The American FBI corresponds to the British MI5.
example.egtrans: 美国的联邦调查局相当于英国的军情五处。

example.eg: His story of what happened that night didn't correspond with the witness's version.
example.egtrans: 关于那天晚上发生的事情他的陈述和证人所说的不相符。

dsense.name: correspond
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to communicate by writing a letter or sending an email

example.eg: I've been corresponding with several experts in the field.
example.egtrans: 我一直在与该领域的几位专家保持通信往来。

corresponding.name: corresponding
corresponding.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: similar to, connected with, or caused by something else

example.eg: Company losses were 50 percent worse than in the corresponding period last year.
example.egtrans: 与去年同期相比，公司亏损增加了50%。

example.eg: As the course becomes more difficult, there's usually a corresponding drop in attendance.
example.egtrans: 随着课程逐渐变难，来上课的人也越来越少了。

count.name: count
count.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say numbers one after the other in order, or to calculate the number of people or things in a group

example.eg: Let's count out loud (= speak the words) from one to ten.
example.egtrans: 我们来大声地从1数到10。

example.eg: The teachers counted the students as they got on to the bus.
example.egtrans: 学生们上车时老师点了一下人数。

example.eg: Count your money carefully to make sure it's all there.
example.egtrans: 好好数数你的钱，看看是不是都在。

example.eg: We need to count who's here, so we can make sure that no one's missing.
example.egtrans: 我们要点一下谁在这儿，以确定无人缺席。

example.eg: There'll be eight for dinner, counting (= including) ourselves.
example.egtrans: 算上我们自己，共有8人就餐。

example.eg: We're still waiting for the votes to be counted (up).
example.egtrans: 我们仍在等待统计选票。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to count the number of people present somewhere

example.eg: There look to be about 50 people here - I haven't counted heads yet.
example.egtrans: 看起来大概有50人在场——我还没有清点人数。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have value or importance

example.eg: I've always believed that happiness counts more than money.
example.egtrans: 我一直认为幸福比金钱更重要。

example.eg: My opinion doesn't count for anything around here (= no one values my opinion).
example.egtrans: 我的看法在这儿丝毫不受重视。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to consider or be considered as

example.eg: I count myself fortunate to have had such a good education.
example.egtrans: 能受到如此良好的教育我认为自己很幸运。

example.eg: I've had three jobs in the last five years, but one of them was unpaid, so it doesn't count (= cannot be considered as a real job).
example.egtrans: 过去5年中我干过3份工作，但其中有1份没有薪水，因此不能算。

example.eg: I've always counted Sophia among my closest friends.
example.egtrans: 我一直把索非亚当作我最知心的朋友之一。

example.eg: I didn't think his grudging remarks really counted as an apology.
example.egtrans: 我觉得他那些勉强说出的话不能算是真正的道歉。

count.name: count
count.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of counting, or the total number of things counted

example.eg: Having done a quick count, I find I've planted 25 different ferns.
example.egtrans: 很快地数了下，我发现自己已经种了 25 种不同的蕨类植物。

example.eg: The current head count (= total number of people) is about 31,500 employees.
example.egtrans: 目前的清点人数约为 31,500 名员工。

example.eg: We had 450 members at the last count (= when they were last counted).
example.egtrans: 根据最新统计，我们有450位成员。

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of counting the votes in an election, or the event when this happens

example.eg: Early counts show Mr Adams in the lead.
example.egtrans: 早先的计票显示亚当斯先生领先。

example.eg: The candidate's spouse and election agent are also entitled to be present at the count.
example.egtrans: 候选人的配偶和选举代理人也有权在计票时出席。

example.eg: He lost by 3% of the vote, and has challenged the count in court.
example.egtrans: 他以3%的票数落败，并已在法庭上对计票提出质疑。

trans_examp.trans_en: a scientifically measured amount of something

example.eg: a high pollen count
example.egtrans: 高花粉数量

example.eg: a low blood/sperm count
example.egtrans: 低血细胞／精子数量

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to record how many of something there are, or how many times something has happened
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 记录（数量或发生的次数）

example.eg: So many people asked us for help, it was hard to keep count.
example.egtrans: 太多人请求我们帮助了，很难记录准确的数字。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not be able to remember how many times something has happened

example.eg: I've lost count of how many times she's been late for work this month.
example.egtrans: 我已记不清她这个月迟到多少次了。

phrase.phrase_title: on the count of three, four, five, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: when a particular number is reached

example.eg: On the count of three, I'd like you all to stand up.
example.egtrans: 我数到3时希望你们全都起立。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a European man of the same social rank as an English earl

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular crime that a person is accused of

example.eg: The prisoner was found guilty on two counts of murder.
example.egtrans: 该囚犯被判定犯有两宗谋杀罪。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an opinion in a discussion or argument

example.eg: I'm afraid I disagree with you on all/several counts (= I disagree with all/several of your opinions).
example.egtrans: 恐怕我完全不能同意你的看法／恐怕我不能同意你的几点看法。

countdown.name: countdown
countdown.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of counting backwards to zero

example.eg: The countdown to the rocket launch will begin at 9.00 a.m.
example.egtrans: 火箭发射将于上午9点进入倒计时。

trans_examp.trans_en: a short period of time leading to an important event

example.eg: The countdown to the election has already begun.
example.egtrans: 选举已开始进入倒计时阶段。

counts.name: count
counts.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a European man of the same social rank as an English earl

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular crime that a person is accused of

example.eg: The prisoner was found guilty on two counts of murder.
example.egtrans: 该囚犯被判定犯有两宗谋杀罪。

dsense.name: count
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an opinion in a discussion or argument

example.eg: I'm afraid I disagree with you on all/several counts (= I disagree with all/several of your opinions).
example.egtrans: 恐怕我完全不能同意你的看法／恐怕我不能同意你的几点看法。

couple.name: couple
couple.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: couple
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: two or a few things that are similar or the same, or two or a few people who are in some way connected
trans_examp.trans_cn: （相似或相同事物的）一对，一双，几个；（有某种联系之人的）一对，几个

example.eg: The doctor said my leg should be better in a couple of days.
example.egtrans: 医生说我的腿过两天就会好转。

example.eg: A couple of people objected to the proposal, but the vast majority approved of it.
example.egtrans: 有几个人反对该提议，但绝大多数人赞同。

example.eg: We'll have to wait another couple of hours for the paint to dry.
example.egtrans: 我们还得再等几个小时油漆才干。

example.eg: She'll be retiring in a couple more years.
example.egtrans: 她再过几年就退休了。

example.eg: The weather's been terrible for the last couple of days.
example.egtrans: 这几天天气糟透了。

example.eg: Many economists expect unemployment to fall over the next couple of months.
example.egtrans: 许多经济学家预测在未来的几个月失业率将会下降。

example.eg: I'm sorry I didn't call you, but I've been very busy over the past couple of weeks.
example.egtrans: 很抱歉我没打电话给你，这几个星期我实在是太忙了。

dsense.name: couple
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: two people who are married or in a romantic or sexual relationship, or two people who are together for a particular purpose
trans_examp.trans_cn: 夫妻；情侣；（有共同目的的）两个人

example.eg: a married couple
example.egtrans: 一对夫妻

example.eg: An elderly couple live (US lives) next door.
example.egtrans: 一对老夫妻住在隔壁。

example.eg: Should the government do more to help young couples buy their own homes?
example.egtrans: 政府应该更多地帮助年轻夫妇购买他们自己的住房吗？

example.eg: The couple skated spectacularly throughout the competition.
example.egtrans: 这对选手在整个比赛中滑得棒极了。

couple.name: couple
couple.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: couple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to join or combine

example.eg: The sleeping car and restaurant car were coupled together.
example.egtrans: 卧铺车厢和餐车挂在一起。

example.eg: High inflation coupled with low output spells disaster for the government in the election.
example.egtrans: 低产出下的高通胀导致政府在选举中惨败。

dsense.name: couple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: When two people or two animals couple, they have sex.

cover.name: cover
cover.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put or spread something over something, or to lie on the surface of something

example.eg: The light was so bright that I had to cover my eyes.
example.egtrans: 灯光太亮，我只好遮住眼睛。

example.eg: Snow covered the hillsides.
example.egtrans: 白雪覆盖了山坡。

example.eg: She covered him (up) with a blanket.
example.egtrans: 她给他盖上了毯子。

example.eg: Cover the meat with a layer of cheese.
example.egtrans: 在肉上铺一层奶酪。

example.eg: The bandages were covered with/in blood.
example.egtrans: 鲜血浸透了绷带。

example.eg: How much of the earth's surface is covered by/with water?
example.egtrans: 地球表面有多大面积被水覆盖？

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to deal with or direct attention to something

example.eg: This leaflet covers what we've just discussed in more detail.
example.egtrans: 这本小册子有我们刚才讨论问题的更多细节。

example.eg: Do these parking restrictions cover residents as well as visitors?
example.egtrans: 这些停车限制对住户和访客同样适用吗？

example.eg: The salesman's territory covers the whole of the southeast.
example.egtrans: 这名销售员的业务覆盖整个东南部。

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to report the news about a particular important event

example.eg: She's covering the American election for BBC television.
example.egtrans: 她在为英国广播公司的电视台报道美国大选。

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to protect someone against loss, damage, accident, or having something stolen, by having insurance

example.eg: Does your travel insurance cover you against/for the loss or theft of cash?
example.egtrans: 你的旅行保险能为你的现金丢失或失窃提供保险补偿吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do something to protect yourself from blame or criticism in the future
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 采取措施保护自己（不在未来因此受到责怪或批评）

example.eg: I kept copies of my expense receipts, just to cover myself.
example.egtrans: 我把花费的票据都复印保留了一份，免得让人挑出毛病。

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to travel a particular distance

example.eg: We covered 400 km in three hours.
example.egtrans: 3个小时我们赶了400公里。

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be enough money to pay for something

example.eg: The selling price barely covered the cost of the raw materials.
example.egtrans: 销售价刚刚够抵付原材料费。

example.eg: Would £50 cover your expenses?
example.egtrans: 50英镑够你花吗？

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to aim a gun or shoot at someone to try to stop them from shooting or escaping, or to protect someone else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 以枪瞄准（以防射击或逃跑）；（用枪炮）掩护

example.eg: The police officer was covered by her colleagues while she ran towards the gunman's hideout.
example.egtrans: 警察在她同伴的掩护下奔向持枪歹徒藏身之处。

trans_examp.trans_en: When soldiers or police officers cover a place such as a road or building, they are in a position from which they can watch and defend it.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 守住；封锁（道路、建筑物等）

example.eg: All the exits are covered, so they can't escape.
example.egtrans: 所有出口都被封锁了，所以他们插翅难逃。

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent a member of the opposing team from taking control of the ball by staying close to them all the time

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to do someone else's job or duty when they are absent
trans_examp.trans_cn: 代替，顶替（某人的工作或职责）

example.eg: I'm going to the doctor's tomorrow, so do you think you could cover my shift for me?
example.egtrans: 明天我要去看医生，你能顶我的班吗？

example.eg: Sorry, I'm already covering for someone else.
example.egtrans: 抱歉，我已经在帮别人顶班了。

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a recording of a song or tune that has already been recorded by someone else

example.eg: I think more singers have covered "Yesterday" than any other song.
example.egtrans: 我想翻唱《昨日》的歌手人数超过其他任何一首歌的翻唱人数。

cover.name: cover
cover.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is put on or over something else, usually to protect it, to keep something in, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 盖子；罩子；遮盖物；覆盖物

example.eg: I keep my computer printer under a protective plastic cover.
example.egtrans: 我用塑料保护罩盖住电脑打印机。

example.eg: Remove the packaging and pierce the plastic cover before microwaving.
example.egtrans: 去掉包装，扎破保护膜，然后用微波炉加热。

trans_examp.trans_en: the stiff outside part of a book or magazine, usually made of thick paper or cardboard

example.eg: Who should we put on the cover of the magazine this month?
example.egtrans: 本月我们杂志的封面人物该上谁呢？

example.eg: Paperback books have soft covers.
example.egtrans: 平装书用软书皮。

trans_examp.trans_en: an envelope

phrase.phrase_title: read sth from cover to cover

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to read a book, magazine, etc. all the way through from the beginning to the end
to send something in a plain/separate envelope
the blankets, sheets, etc. on a bed

example.eg: Martha threw back the covers and bounced out of bed.
example.egtrans: 玛莎掀掉毯子，跳下床来。

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: shelter or protection in an unpleasant or dangerous situation

example.eg: We took cover from the storm in a bus shelter.
example.egtrans: 我们在公交车站躲避暴风雨。

example.eg: The burglar broke into the house under cover of darkness.
example.egtrans: 窃贼在夜幕掩护下闯进那所房子。

trans_examp.trans_en: plants, especially bushes, that are used as shelter by animals
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指动物藏身的）覆盖植物，灌木丛

trans_examp.trans_en: protection by someone who has a gun

example.eg: We needed more cover from the enemy aircraft.
example.egtrans: 我们需要更多掩护以躲避敌人的空袭。

trans_examp.trans_en: financial protection so that you get money if something bad happens

example.eg: I've got £20,000 worth of cover for the contents of my house.
example.egtrans: 我为家里的东西投了价值2万英镑的保险。

example.eg: Do you have cover for accidental damage?
example.egtrans: 你保了意外损伤险了吗？

dsense.name: cover
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a performance or recording of a song or tune that has already been recorded by someone else

example.eg: How many cover versions have been made of "My Way"?
example.egtrans: 《我的路》有多少个翻唱版本？

crash.name: crash
crash.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a vehicle crashes or someone crashes it, it is involved in an accident, usually a serious one in which the vehicle is damaged and someone is hurt.

example.eg: We skidded on the ice and crashed.
example.egtrans: 我们在冰上打滑撞了（另一辆）车。

example.eg: The plane crashed into a mountainside.
example.egtrans: 飞机撞到了山坡上。

example.eg: Her brother borrowed her motorbike and crashed it.
example.egtrans: 她弟弟借用她的摩托车，结果给撞坏了。

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hit something, often making a loud noise or causing damage
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）猛撞（常发出巨大声响或造成破坏）

example.eg: We could hear waves crashing on/against the shore.
example.egtrans: 我们能听到海浪哗哗地拍打着海岸。

example.eg: Suddenly, cymbals crashed and the orchestra began playing.
example.egtrans: 突然，铙钹声砰然响起，乐队开始了演奏。

example.eg: A dog came crashing through the bushes.
example.egtrans: 狗嗖的一声蹿过灌木丛。

example.eg: Without warning, the tree crashed through the roof.
example.egtrans: 在毫无前兆的情况下，那棵树轰隆一下子压塌了屋顶。

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something such as a business crashes, it suddenly fails or becomes unsuccessful.

example.eg: Investors were seriously worried when the stock market began to crash.
example.egtrans: 股市开始狂跌，投资者们人心惶惶。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a computer or system crashes, it suddenly stops operating.

example.eg: My laptop's crashed again.
example.egtrans: 我的笔记本电脑又死机了。

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to sleep at someone else's house for the night, especially when you have not planned it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指事先无计划而留在别人家里）过夜，睡觉

example.eg: They crashed on my floor after the party.
example.egtrans: 聚会后他们在我家打了地铺。

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go to a party or other event without an invitation

example.eg: We tried to crash the party, but the bouncers wouldn't let us in.
example.egtrans: 我们想闯进去参加聚会，可是保安拦住了我们。

crash.name: crash
crash.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an accident involving a vehicle, usually a serious one in which the vehicle is damaged or someone is hurt

example.eg: a car crash
example.egtrans: 撞车事故

example.eg: She had a crash on the way to work.
example.egtrans: 她在上班路上撞车了。

example.eg: They were only slightly injured in the crash.
example.egtrans: 他们在撞车事故中只受了点轻伤。

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sudden loud noise made when something breaks or falls
trans_examp.trans_cn: （物体破裂或掉落时发出的）咔嚓声，哗啦声

example.eg: I heard a loud crash in the kitchen.
example.egtrans: 我听见厨房里哗啦一声巨响。

example.eg: The vase landed on the floor with a crash.
example.egtrans: 花瓶砰的一声掉在了地板上。

dsense.name: crash
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sudden large fall in the value of a country's businesses

example.eg: They lost a lot of money in the Stock Market crash.
example.egtrans: 股市暴跌让他们损失了很多钱。

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation when a computer or system suddenly stops operating
trans_examp.trans_cn: （计算机或系统的）突然瘫痪，死机

example.eg: a computer crash
example.egtrans: 计算机瘫痪

crash.name: crash
crash.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: quick and involving a lot of effort
trans_examp.trans_cn: 迅速全面的；速成的；应急的

example.eg: The company undertook a crash programme of machine replacement.
example.egtrans: 公司采取了更换机器的应急方案。

creative.name: creative
creative.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: producing or using original and unusual ideas
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有创造力的；创造性的；有创意的

example.eg: a creative person/artist/designer/programmer
example.egtrans: 有创意的人／艺术家／设计师／程序设计员

example.eg: creative talents/powers/abilities
example.egtrans: 创造才能／力／能力

example.eg: creative thinking
example.egtrans: 创造性思维

creative.name: creative
creative.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person whose job involves producing original ideas or doing artistic work
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有创造力的员工；创意人员

example.eg: Several leading creatives are involved in the advertising campaign.
example.egtrans: 好几位顶级创意人员参与策划了这次广告宣传运动。

credential.name: credential
credential.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of information that is sent from one computer to another to check that a user is who they claim to be or to allow someone to see information
trans_examp.trans_cn: （计算机用户的）身份验证信息

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the abilities and experience that make someone suitable for a particular job or activity, or proof of someone's abilities and experience
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 资历，资格；资格证书，资质证明

example.eg: All the candidates had excellent academic credentials.
example.egtrans: 所有候选人都具有优秀的学历。

example.eg: She was asked to show her press credentials.
example.egtrans: 她被要求出示记者证。

creep.name: creep
creep.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move slowly, quietly, and carefully, usually in order to avoid being noticed
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通常指为避免注意而）缓慢行进，悄悄移动，潜行

example.eg: She turned off the light and crept through the door.
example.egtrans: 她关上灯，悄悄溜出门。

example.eg: Someone was creeping around outside my window.
example.egtrans: 有人在我的窗户外蹑手蹑脚地走动。

example.eg: The spider crept up the wall.
example.egtrans: 蜘蛛缓缓地爬上墙。

example.eg: The traffic was creeping along at a snail's pace.
example.egtrans: 车辆如蜗牛般缓慢移动。

creep.name: creep
creep.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: creep
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who tries to make someone more important like them by being very polite and helpful in a way that is not sincere
trans_examp.trans_cn: 谄媚者，奴颜婢膝者，阿谀奉承者

example.eg: Making coffee for the boss again? You creep!
example.egtrans: 又在给老板冲咖啡？你这个马屁精！

trans_examp.trans_en: an unpleasant person, especially a man
trans_examp.trans_cn: 讨厌鬼，令人恶心的人（尤指男人）

example.eg: He was such a creep - he was always staring at me in the canteen.
example.egtrans: 他真是个讨厌鬼——在饭厅里他老盯着我看。

example.eg: Leave me alone, creep!
example.egtrans: 让我一个人呆一会儿，你这个讨厌鬼！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to cause someone to have uncomfortable feelings of nervousness or fear
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 使…毛骨悚然；使…紧张害怕

example.eg: Living next to a graveyard would give me the creeps.
example.egtrans: 住在墓地旁边会令我毛骨悚然。

curate.name: curate
curate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a priest of the lowest rank, especially in the Church of England, whose job is to help the vicar (= priest of a particular area)
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指英国国教会的）助理牧师

curate.name: curate
curate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be in charge of selecting and caring for objects to be shown in a museum or to form part of a collection of art, an exhibition, etc.

example.eg: She curated a recent exhibition of Indian artwork.
example.egtrans: 她最近策划了一个印度艺术展。

curly.name: curly
curly.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having curls or a curved shape

example.eg: He has blond, curly hair.
example.egtrans: 他有一头卷曲的金发。

example.eg: These pigs all have curly tails.
example.egtrans: 这些猪都是卷尾巴。

current.name: current
current.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: of the present time

example.eg: Have you seen the current issue of (= the most recently published) Vogue magazine?
example.egtrans: 最新一期《时尚》杂志你看过了吗？

example.eg: The word is no longer in current use.
example.egtrans: 这个单词现在已不再使用了。

current.name: current
current.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: current
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a movement of water, air, or electricity in a particular direction

example.eg: to swim against/with the current
example.egtrans: 逆流／顺流而游

example.eg: He was swept out to sea by the strong current.
example.egtrans: 他被急流冲到了海里。

example.eg: Switch off the electric current before changing the bulb.
example.egtrans: 换灯泡前先把电源切断。

dsense.name: current
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular opinion or feeling that a group of people have

example.eg: There is a growing current of support for environmental issues among voters.
example.egtrans: 投票者对环境问题的支持呈增长趋势。

currently.name: currently
currently.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: at the present time

example.eg: The Director is currently having talks in the US
example.egtrans: 局长目前正在美国进行会谈。

example.eg: The device is currently available only in Japan.
example.egtrans: 该设备目前只在日本有售。

example.eg: Currently, about 82 billion pictures are printed each year.
example.egtrans: 目前，每年大约印制820亿张图片。

custom.name: custom
custom.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: custom
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of behaving or a belief that has been established for a long time

example.eg: a local/ancient custom
example.egtrans: 当地的／古老的风俗

example.eg: In my country, it's the custom (for women) to get married in white.
example.egtrans: 在我国，女子结婚穿白衣是一种习俗。

trans_examp.trans_en: something you usually do

example.eg: He left the house at nine exactly, as is his custom.
example.egtrans: 他9点准时离开了家，这是他的习惯。

dsense.name: custom
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the support given to a business, especially a shop, by the people who buy things or services from it

example.eg: Most of our custom comes from tourists nowadays.
example.egtrans: 如今我们大部分生意来自游客。

example.eg: If we don't give good service, people will take their custom elsewhere.
example.egtrans: 如果我们不能提供良好的服务，人们就会光顾别处。

dsense.name: custom
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the place at a port, airport, or border where travellers' bags are looked at to find out if any goods are being carried illegally

example.eg: to go through customs
example.egtrans: 通过海关

custom.name: custom-
custom.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: used before another word to mean "specially designed for a particular person or purpose"

example.eg: custom-designed
example.egtrans: 按顾客要求专门设计的

example.eg: custom-built software
example.egtrans: 按客户要求专门设计的软件

cycle.name: cycle
cycle.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: cycle
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a bicycle

dsense.name: cycle
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of events that happen in a particular order, one following the other, and are often repeated

example.eg: the life cycle of a moth
example.egtrans: 蛾的生命周期

trans_examp.trans_en: one in a series of movements that a machine performs

example.eg: the washing machine's spin cycle
example.egtrans: 洗衣机脱水程序

dsense.name: cycle
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of plays, poems, songs, etc. written by one person and connected with each other by dealing with the same characters or ideas
trans_examp.trans_cn: （表现相同人物或思想的）全套剧目，组诗

example.eg: It's one in a cycle of plays that are being performed on successive evenings.
example.egtrans: 这几部连台戏连续几晚都在上演，这只是其中一部。

cycle.name: cycle
cycle.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to ride a bicycle

dangle.name: dangle
dangle.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hang loosely, or to hold something so that it hangs loosely
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）垂下；（使）悬荡；悬挂；提着来回摆动

example.eg: Loose electric wires were dangling from the wall.
example.egtrans: 松散的电线从墙上垂了下来。

example.eg: He dangled the puppet in front of the children.
example.egtrans: 他在孩子们面前耍木偶。

trans_examp.trans_en: to offer someone something that they want in order to persuade that person to do something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （为了说服某人去做某事而）用…作为许诺，答应用…作为回报

example.eg: I've tried dangling all kinds of offers in front of him to get him to work harder at school, but nothing works.
example.egtrans: 为了让他学习用心点儿，我曾试过种种许诺，可是根本不起任何作用。

darn.name: darn
darn.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to repair a hole or a piece of clothing with long stitches across the hole and other stitches across them

example.eg: She still darns the holes in her socks.
example.egtrans: 她还穿补过的袜子。

darn.name: darn
darn.posTip: A word or phrase that you say loudly or suddenly to express strong feelings.

trans_examp.trans_en: used instead of damn to express anger
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于替代 damn）可恶，可恨，讨厌

example.eg: Darn it! There goes my bus!
example.egtrans: 讨厌！我要坐的公共汽车刚刚开走！

darn.name: darn
darn.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize what you are saying

example.eg: She runs so darn fast!
example.egtrans: 她跑得真的很快！

debug.name: debug
debug.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: debug
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove bugs (= mistakes) from a computer program

example.eg: to debug a program
example.egtrans: 排除程序中的错误

dsense.name: debug
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to look for and remove bugs (= hidden listening or recording devices) from a place

example.eg: Security officers had debugged the room before the meeting.
example.egtrans: 保安人员在开会前已对室内进行了检查，以防有人安放窃听装置。

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to or expressed in a system of counting based on the number ten

example.eg: If you calculate the result to two decimal places (= give two numbers after the decimal point, as in 3.65), that should minimize any possible errors.
example.egtrans: 如果将计算结果保留两位小数，就会最大限度地减小可能的误差。

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number expressed using a system of counting based on the number ten

example.eg: Three fifths expressed as a decimal is 0.6.
example.egtrans: 3/5用小数表示就是0.6。

declaration.name: declaration
declaration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: declaration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an announcement, often one that is written and official

example.eg: Members of Congress have to make a declaration of their business interests.
example.egtrans: 议员们必须将自己的商业股权公诸于众。

example.eg: As witnesses to the accident, we were asked to make written declarations of what we had seen.
example.egtrans: 作为事故的目击者，我们被要求以书面的形式陈述看到的一切。

example.eg: The company made a declaration of intent to follow an equal opportunities policy.
example.egtrans: 公司宣称愿意遵守机会均等原则。

dsense.name: declaration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in cricket, a situation in which a team stops batting (= hitting the ball) because they think they already have enough runs (= points) to win
trans_examp.trans_cn: （板球比赛中，一方因已达足够分数获胜而在一局未结束前的）宣布停止击球，宣布结束赛局

example.eg: a cleverly timed declaration
example.egtrans: 时机掌握得恰到好处的宣布结束赛局

declarative.name: declarative sentence
declarative.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sentence that makes a statement or states a fact

declare.name: declare
declare.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: declare
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to announce something clearly, firmly, publicly, or officially

example.eg: They declared their support for the proposal
example.egtrans: 他们宣布支持这个提议。

example.eg: She declared (that) it was the best chocolate cake she had ever tasted.
example.egtrans: 她说那是她吃过的最好的巧克力蛋糕。

example.eg: They declared themselves (to be) bankrupt.
example.egtrans: 他们宣布破产了。

example.eg: "I won't do it!" he declared.
example.egtrans: “我不干！”他坚定地说。

example.eg: America declared war on Japan in 1941 (= announced officially that it was at war).
example.egtrans: 1941年美国对日本宣战。

example.eg: The government has declared war on (= announced that thaey intended to stop) the drug dealers.
example.egtrans: 政府已对贩毒者宣战。

example.eg: The country declared independence in 1952 (= announced that it was no longer under the control of another country).
example.egtrans: 该国于1952年宣布独立。

trans_examp.trans_en: to officially tell someone the value of goods you have bought, or the amount of money you have earned because you might have to pay tax
trans_examp.trans_cn: 申报（应纳税的货物价值或收入）

example.eg: Nothing to declare.
example.egtrans: 无可申报。

example.eg: Goods to declare.
example.egtrans: 需要申报的货物。

example.eg: You have to declare any earnings over a certain amount.
example.egtrans: 收入在超过了一定数字后需要申报。

dsense.name: declare
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a cricket team declares, they stop batting (= hitting the ball) because they think they already have enough runs (= points) to win.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （板球比赛中，一方因已达足够分数获胜而在一局未结束前的）宣布停止击球，宣布结束赛局

example.eg: Pakistan declared at 350 for 7.
example.egtrans: 巴基斯坦队在第7局获得350分后宣布结束赛局。

decoration.name: decoration
decoration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: decoration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of making something look more attractive by putting things on it or around it, or something that you use to do this
trans_examp.trans_cn: 装饰，装潢；装饰品，装饰物

example.eg: He's good at cake decoration.
example.egtrans: 他擅长做蛋糕装饰。

example.eg: Christmas/party/table/cake decorations
example.egtrans: 圣诞／聚会／餐桌／蛋糕装饰

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of covering the walls or other surfaces of rooms or buildings with paint or paper

example.eg: This place is badly in need of decoration.
example.egtrans: 这个地方急需粉刷一下。

dsense.name: decoration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a medal given to someone and worn as an honour
trans_examp.trans_cn: （作为荣誉而佩戴的）奖章，勋章

example.eg: The Victoria Cross and George Cross are British decorations for bravery.
example.egtrans: 维多利亚十字勋章和乔治十字勋章是英国对英勇行为的嘉奖。

dedicated.name: dedicated
dedicated.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: believing that something is very important and giving a lot of time and energy to it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 尽心尽力的，尽职尽责的

example.eg: a dedicated father/teacher
example.egtrans: 尽职尽责的父亲／教师

example.eg: She's completely dedicated to her work.
example.egtrans: 她对自己的工作十分尽心尽力。

example.eg: The Green Party is dedicated to protecting the environment.
example.egtrans: 绿党致力于环境保护工作。

trans_examp.trans_en: designed to be used for one particular purpose

example.eg: a dedicated computer
example.egtrans: 专用计算机

example.eg: a dedicated sports channel
example.egtrans: 专门的体育频道

deem.name: deem
deem.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to consider or judge something in a particular way

example.eg: The area has now been deemed safe.
example.egtrans: 该地区现在被认为很安全。

example.eg: We will provide help whenever you deem it appropriate.
example.egtrans: 无论何时只要你认为合适，我们就会提供帮助。

example.eg: Anyone not paying the registration fee by 31 March will be deemed to have withdrawn from the offer.
example.egtrans: 凡未在3月31日前交纳注册费者，将被视为退出该项计划。

defer.name: defer
defer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to delay something until a later time

example.eg: My bank has agreed to defer the repayments on my loan.
example.egtrans: 银行同意让我延缓偿还贷款。

example.eg: Can we defer making a decision until next week?
example.egtrans: 我们可以推迟到下周再决定吗？

defined.name: define
defined.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: define
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say what the meaning of something, especially a word, is
trans_examp.trans_cn: 给（尤指单词）下定义；说明，解释

example.eg: In the dictionary, "reality" is defined as "the state of things as they are, rather than as they are imagined to be".
example.egtrans: 在本词典中，“reality（现实）”被解释为 “the state of things as they are, rather than as they are imagined to be（事物存在的状况，而非其想象中的状态）”。

example.eg: Before I answer your question, could you define your terms a little more (= explain what you mean by the words you have used)?
example.egtrans: 在回答你的问题之前，你能不能再解释一下你用词的意思？

trans_examp.trans_en: to explain and describe the meaning and exact limits of something

example.eg: Your rights and responsibilities are defined in the citizens' charter.
example.egtrans: 你的权利和义务在公民宪章中有明确的界定。

example.eg: Your role in the project will be strictly defined (= limited to particular areas).
example.egtrans: 你在这个项目里的任务将有明确的界定。

example.eg: I'd hate to feel that I was defined by (= that my life got its meaning and importance only from) my job.
example.egtrans: 我讨厌我的生活中除了工作别无重心。

dsense.name: define
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show clearly the edge of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 显示出…的轮廓；确定…的界线

example.eg: The outline of the castle on the hill was clearly defined against the evening sky.
example.egtrans: 山上城堡的轮廓在夜色的映衬下显得格外清晰。

definitely.name: definitely
definitely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: without any doubt

example.eg: Have you definitely decided to go to Costa Rica?
example.egtrans: 你百分之百决定去哥斯达黎加了吗？

example.eg: He definitely said he'd be here.
example.egtrans: 他肯定地说了他会到这里来的。

example.eg: "Are you going to have children?" "Oh, definitely (= without any doubt)."
example.egtrans: “你们打算要孩子吗？”“噢，当然了。”

example.eg: "She's not coming?" "No, definitely not."
example.egtrans: “这么说她不会来了？”“对，肯定不会来了。”

definition.name: definition
definition.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: definition
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a statement that explains the meaning of a word or phrase

example.eg: a dictionary definition
example.egtrans: 词典中的定义

example.eg: What is the definition of "mood"?
example.egtrans: 单词 mood 的定义是什么？

trans_examp.trans_en: a description of the features and limits of something

example.eg: The legal definition of what is and what is not pornography is very unsatisfactory.
example.egtrans: 法律对什么是色情、什么不是色情的解释令人很不满意。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: because of its own features
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 根据自身特点；从本质上来讲

example.eg: Psychology is by definition an inexact science.
example.egtrans: 从本质上来讲，心理学不是一门精确的科学。

dsense.name: definition
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: how clear an image or sound is
trans_examp.trans_cn: （图像或声音的）清晰度，保真度

example.eg: The photograph lacks definition.
example.egtrans: 那张照片的清晰度很差。

degree.name: degree
degree.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: degree
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (an) amount or level of something

example.eg: This job demands a high degree of skill.
example.egtrans: 这项工作对技术的要求很高。

example.eg: There isn't the slightest degree of doubt that he's innocent.
example.egtrans: 毫无疑问，他是无辜的。

example.eg: I have to warn you that there's a degree of (= some) danger involved in this.
example.egtrans: 我必须警告你这里面有一定的危险。

example.eg: The number of terrorist attacks has increased to a terrifying degree.
example.egtrans: 恐怖袭击的次数已经到了骇人的程度。

example.eg: There was some degree of truth in what she said.
example.egtrans: 她说的有一定的真实性。

example.eg: To what degree do you think we will be providing a better service?
example.egtrans: 你认为我们的服务还有多大的改进空间？

example.eg: "That's really bad." "Well, it's all a matter/question of degree (= there are other things better and other things worse)."
example.egtrans: “那可真是太糟糕了。”“只是程度不同而已。”

dsense.name: degree
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any of various units of measurement, especially of temperature or angles, usually shown by the symbol ° written after a number
trans_examp.trans_cn: 度，度数（尤指温度或角度的度量单位，通常在数字后用符号°来表示）

example.eg: a difference of three degrees
example.egtrans: 3度之差

example.eg: Water boils at 212° Fahrenheit and 100° Celsius/Centigrade.
example.egtrans: 水在212华氏度，即100摄氏度沸腾。

example.eg: A right angle is an angle of 90°.
example.egtrans: 直角为90度。

example.eg: New York is on a latitude of 41°N and a longitude of 74°W.
example.egtrans: 纽约位于北纬41度、西经74度。

dsense.name: degree
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a course of study at a college or university, or the qualification given to a student after he or she has completed his or her studies

example.eg: She has a physics degree/a degree in physics from Edinburgh.
example.egtrans: 她获得了爱丁堡大学的物理学学位。

example.eg: She has a bachelor's/master's degree in history from Yale.
example.egtrans: 她获得了耶鲁大学历史学专业的学士／硕士学位。

example.eg: "What degree did you do at York?" "Geography."
example.egtrans: “你在约克大学学的什么课程？”“地理学。”

degree.name: -degree
degree.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: used with an ordinal number to show how serious something is
trans_examp.trans_cn: …度，…级（与序数词并用，表示某事物的严重性）

example.eg: She suffered first-/second-/third-degree (= least serious/serious/very serious) burns on her legs.
example.egtrans: 她的腿部受到一度／二度／三度烧伤。

example.eg: He's being charged with first-degree (= the most serious type of) murder.
example.egtrans: 他被指控犯有一级谋杀罪。

Delivery.name: delivery
Delivery.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: delivery
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of taking goods, letters, parcels, etc. to people's houses or places of work

example.eg: We get two deliveries of mail (= it is delivered twice) a day.
example.egtrans: 我们每天会接收到两次邮件。

example.eg: You can pay for the carpet on delivery (= when it is delivered).
example.egtrans: 地毯可以货到付款。

example.eg: We expect to take delivery of (= receive) our new car next week.
example.egtrans: 我们预计下周能拿到新车。

example.eg: a delivery van
example.egtrans: 小货车

dsense.name: delivery
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which someone speaks in public
trans_examp.trans_cn: 演讲风格（或方式）；表演风格（或方式）

example.eg: the actor's delivery
example.egtrans: 演员的表演风格

trans_examp.trans_en: in some sports, such as cricket or baseball, the act of throwing the ball towards the person with the bat, in order for that person to try to hit the ball

example.eg: That was a good delivery from Thompson.
example.egtrans: 那是汤姆森投出的一个好球。

example.eg: The pitcher is famous for the speed of his delivery.
example.egtrans: 那个投手以投球速度快而闻名。

dsense.name: delivery
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a birth

demonstrate.name: demonstrate
demonstrate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: demonstrate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show or make make something clear

example.eg: These numbers clearly demonstrate the size of the economic problem facing the country.
example.egtrans: 这些数字清楚表明了该国经济问题的严重程度。

example.eg: Research has demonstrated that babies can recognize their mother's voice very soon after birth.
example.egtrans: 研究表明，婴儿出生后很快就能辨识母亲的声音。

example.eg: These problems demonstrate the importance of strategic planning.
example.egtrans: 这些问题显示出了战略规划的重要性。

trans_examp.trans_en: to show something and explain how it works

example.eg: He got a job demonstrating kitchen equipment in a department store.
example.egtrans: 他找到一份在百货店演示厨房设备的工作。

example.eg: The teacher demonstrated how to use the equipment.
example.egtrans: 老师演示了如何使用这种设备。

dsense.name: demonstrate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to express or show that you have a particular feeling, quality, or ability

example.eg: He has demonstrated a genuine interest in the project.
example.egtrans: 他对该项目表现出了极大的兴趣。

example.eg: His answer demonstrated a complete lack of understanding of the question.
example.egtrans: 他的回答表明他完全没有理解这个问题。

dsense.name: demonstrate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a public expression that you are not satisfied about something, especially by marching or having a meeting

example.eg: Thousands of people gathered to demonstrate against the new proposals.
example.egtrans: 数千人聚集在一起示威，抗议这些新提案。

denomination.name: denomination
denomination.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: denomination
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a religious group that has slightly different beliefs from other groups that share the same religion

example.eg: Protestantism and Roman Catholicism are both denominations of the Christian faith.
example.egtrans: 新教和天主教都是基督教的分支。

dsense.name: denomination
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a unit of value, especially of money

example.eg: It always takes time to get used to the different denominations of coins when you go to a foreign country.
example.egtrans: 到了国外，总要花些时间才能熟悉不同面额的硬币。

denote.name: denote
denote.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to represent something

example.eg: The colour red is used to denote passion or danger.
example.egtrans: 红色用于表示激情或危险。

dense.name: dense
dense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: dense
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having parts that are close together so that it is difficult to go or see through

example.eg: dense fog
example.egtrans: 浓雾

example.eg: a dense forest
example.egtrans: 密林

example.eg: The body was found hidden in dense undergrowth.
example.egtrans: 尸体被发现时藏在密密的树丛下面。

dsense.name: dense
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: stupid

example.eg: There are some really dense people in our class.
example.egtrans: 我们班有些人特别笨。

dsense.name: dense
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a substance) containing a lot of matter in a small space

example.eg: Plutonium is very dense.
example.egtrans: 钚的密度很大。

dependency.name: dependency
dependency.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a country that is supported and governed by another country

Dependent.name: dependent
Dependent.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: dependent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: needing the support of something or someone in order to continue existing or operating
trans_examp.trans_cn: 需要供养的，需要照料的；依赖的

example.eg: He has three dependent children.
example.egtrans: 他有3个需要照料的孩子。

example.eg: It's very easy to become dependent on sleeping pills.
example.egtrans: 人很容易对安眠药产生依赖性。

dsense.name: dependent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: influenced or decided by something

example.eg: Whether I get into college or not is dependent on how good my grades are.
example.egtrans: 我能不能上大学要看我能考多少分。

Dependent.name: dependent
Dependent.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
US spelling of 
        
         dependant

deployment.name: deployment
deployment.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the use of something or someone in an effective way

example.eg: the deployment of technologies to address this challenge
example.egtrans: 为应对这一挑战的高科技运用

trans_examp.trans_en: the movement of soldiers or equipment to a place where they can be used when they are needed

example.eg: The Chief of Police ordered the deployment of 300 troops to try to stop the rioting.
example.egtrans: 警察局长下令调集300名警察来镇压暴乱。

deprecate.name: deprecate
deprecate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: deprecate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to not approve of something or say that you do not approve of something

example.eg: We deprecate this use of company funds for political purposes.
example.egtrans: 我们反对这种将公司资金用于政治目的的做法。

dsense.name: deprecate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say that you think something is of little value or importance

example.eg: He always deprecates my achievements.
example.egtrans: 他总是贬低我的成就。

deprecation.name: deprecation
deprecation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: deprecation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the action of not approving of something or saying that you do not approve of something

example.eg: She couldn't hide the deprecation in her voice.
example.egtrans: 她无法掩饰自己声音中的不满。

example.eg: The barman shook his head in deprecation.
example.egtrans: 酒保不屑地摇了摇头。

dsense.name: deprecation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the action of saying that you think something is of little value or importance

example.eg: He was generous with praise for the Philharmonic and with deprecation for himself.
example.egtrans: 他对爱乐乐团赞赏有加，自己却很谦逊。

example.eg: I resent your implicit deprecation of American skills.
example.egtrans: 我讨厌你隐晦的贬低美国人的能力。

derive.name: derive
derive.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to get something from something else

example.eg: The institute derives all its money from foreign investments.
example.egtrans: 该机构的资金均来自于国外投资。

example.eg: She derives great pleasure/satisfaction from playing the violin.
example.egtrans: 拉小提琴能让她获得极大的乐趣／满足。

descendant.name: descendant
descendant.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who is related to you and who lives after you, such as your child or grandchild

example.eg: He has no descendants.
example.egtrans: 他没有后代。

example.eg: They claim to be descendants of a French duke.
example.egtrans: 他们自称是一位法国公爵的后代。

example.eg: We owe it to our descendants (= people younger than us who will live after we have died) to leave them a clean world to live in.
example.egtrans: 给子孙后代留下一个清洁的生活环境是我们的职责。

deserve.name: deserve
deserve.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have earned or to be given something because of the way you have behaved or the qualities you have

example.eg: After all that hard work, you deserve a holiday.
example.egtrans: 干了那么多活儿，你该休假了。

example.eg: Chris deserves our special thanks for all his efforts.
example.egtrans: 我们应该特别感谢克里斯所付出的心血。

example.eg: I hope they get the punishment they deserve.
example.egtrans: 我希望他们受到应有的惩罚。

example.eg: They certainly deserved to win that game.
example.egtrans: 他们当然应该赢得那场比赛。

desire.name: desire
desire.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: desire
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to want something, especially strongly

example.eg: I desire only to be left in peace.
example.egtrans: 我只想清清静静地不受打扰。

example.eg: The hotel had everything you could possibly desire.
example.egtrans: 该酒店有你可能想要的任何东西。

example.eg: What does her Ladyship desire me to do/desire of me?
example.egtrans: 夫人她想要我做些什么？

example.eg: The president desires to meet the new prime minister.
example.egtrans: 总统希望与新首相会面。

dsense.name: desire
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have a strong sexual attraction to someone

desire.name: desire
desire.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: desire
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a strong feeling that you want something

example.eg: I certainly have no desire to have children.
example.egtrans: 我完全没有想要孩子的愿望。

example.eg: There is a strong desire for peace among the people.
example.egtrans: 人民亟盼和平。

example.eg: He needed to satisfy his desire for revenge.
example.egtrans: 他需要满足自己复仇的愿望。

example.eg: She had a burning/strong desire to go back to her home country before she died.
example.egtrans: 她极其渴望在临死之前回到祖国。

example.eg: Several people have expressed a desire to see the report.
example.egtrans: 有几个人表示想要看看这份报告。

dsense.name: desire
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the strong feeling that you want to have sex with someone

example.eg: sexual desire
example.egtrans: 性欲

example.eg: Beatrice was the object of Dante's desire.
example.egtrans: 比阿特丽斯是勾动但丁情欲的女人。

despite.name: despite
despite.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: without taking any notice of or being influenced by; not prevented by

example.eg: I still enjoyed the week despite the weather.
example.egtrans: 尽管天气不好，这一周我过得还是很愉快的。

example.eg: Despite repeated assurances that the product is safe, many people have stopped buying it.
example.egtrans: 尽管已反复保证了该产品的安全性，很多人还是不再购买。

example.eg: He managed to eat a big lunch despite having eaten an enormous breakfast.
example.egtrans: 尽管早餐吃了很多，他午饭还是大吃了一顿。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something despite yourself, you do it although you do not want to or although you know you should not.

example.eg: He laughed despite himself.
example.egtrans: 他忍不住笑了起来。

example.eg: She took the money from her mother's purse, despite herself.
example.egtrans: 她忍不住从母亲的钱包里拿了钱。

detect.name: detect
detect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to notice something that is partly hidden or not clear, or to discover something, especially using a special method
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指用特殊方法）发现，察觉，看出

example.eg: Some sounds cannot be detected by the human ear.
example.egtrans: 有些声音是人的耳朵无法察觉到的。

example.eg: Financial experts have detected signs that the economy is beginning to improve.
example.egtrans: 金融专家已经注意到了经济开始有好转的迹象。

trans_examp.trans_en: to discover something, usually using special equipment
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通常指用特殊设备）探测，检测，测出

example.eg: High levels of lead were detected in the atmosphere.
example.egtrans: 经检测发现大气中铅的含量很高。

example.eg: Radar equipment is used to detect (= find the position of) enemy aircraft.
example.egtrans: 雷达装置用于探测敌机的位置。

determine.name: determine
determine.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: determine
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to control or influence something directly, or to decide what will happen

example.eg: The number of staff we can take on will be determined by how much money we're allowed to spend.
example.egtrans: 我们雇用的人数将取决于可支配资金的多少。

example.eg: Your health is determined in part by what you eat.
example.egtrans: 在某种程度上你的健康状况取决于你的饮食。

example.eg: Eye colour is genetically determined.
example.egtrans: 眼睛的颜色是由遗传基因决定的。

example.eg: Officials will determine whether or not the game will be played.
example.egtrans: 官员将决定这场比赛能否进行。

example.eg: People should be allowed to determine their own future.
example.egtrans: 应该允许人们决定自己的未来。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a strong decision

example.eg: She determined that one day she would be an actor.
example.egtrans: 她决心将来当演员。

example.eg: On leaving jail, Joe determined to reform.
example.egtrans: 出狱后乔决心改过自新。

dsense.name: determine
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to discover the facts or truth about something

example.eg: The police never actually determined the cause of death.
example.egtrans: 警方实际上从未查明死因。

example.eg: It is the responsibility of the court to determine whether these men are innocent.
example.egtrans: 确定这些人是否无辜是法庭的责任。

example.eg: The jury determined that the men were guilty.
example.egtrans: 陪审团裁决那些人有罪。

diagnose.name: diagnose
diagnose.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to recognize and name the exact character of a disease or a problem, by examining it

example.eg: The specialist diagnosed cancer.
example.egtrans: 那位专家作出的诊断是癌症。

example.eg: His condition was diagnosed as some type of blood disorder.
example.egtrans: 他的病被诊断为某种血液病。

example.eg: She was diagnosed with/as having diabetes.
example.egtrans: 她被查出患有糖尿病。

example.eg: The electrician has diagnosed a fault in the wiring.
example.egtrans: 电工查出了一处线路故障。

diagram.name: diagram
diagram.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a simple plan that represents a machine, system, or idea, etc., often drawn to explain how it works

example.eg: The teacher drew a diagram showing how the blood flows through the heart.
example.egtrans: 老师画了一张示意图来说明血液如何进出心脏。

dictate.name: dictate
dictate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: dictate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give orders, or tell someone exactly what they must do, with total authority

example.eg: The UN will dictate the terms of troop withdrawal from the region.
example.egtrans: 联合国将决定军队从该地区撤军的条件。

example.eg: He disagrees with the government dictating what children are taught in schools.
example.egtrans: 他不同意由政府来决定孩子在学校学习哪些课程。

example.eg: The rules dictate that only running shoes must be worn on the track.
example.egtrans: 规则规定跑道上只能穿跑鞋。

trans_examp.trans_en: to influence something or make it necessary

example.eg: The party's change of policy has been dictated by its need to win back younger voters.
example.egtrans: 该党政策上的变化是由于需要赢回年轻选民的支持。

example.eg: I wanted to take a year off, but my financial situation dictated that I got a job.
example.egtrans: 我想休息一年，但我的经济状况却迫使我必须工作。

dsense.name: dictate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to speak something aloud for a person or machine to record what is said, so that it can be written down

example.eg: I dictated my order over the phone.
example.egtrans: 我通过电话口述了命令。

example.eg: She spent the morning dictating letters to her secretary.
example.egtrans: 她花了一上午的时间向秘书口述信件。

dictate.name: dictate
dictate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an order that should be obeyed, often one that you give to yourself

example.eg: the dictates of conscience/common sense
example.egtrans: 良心／情理的驱使

differ.name: differ
differ.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be not like something or someone else, either physically or in another way
trans_examp.trans_cn: 与…不同，跟…不一样，有区别

example.eg: The twins look alike, but they differ in temperament.
example.egtrans: 这对双胞胎长得相像，但性格却不同。

example.eg: His views differ considerably from those of his parents.
example.egtrans: 他的观点与其父母大相径庭。

example.eg: The findings of the various studies differ significantly/markedly/radically.
example.egtrans: 各项研究的结果之间相差极大／明显／巨大。

example.eg: The incidence of the illness differs greatly between men and women.
example.egtrans: 该病的发病率男女相差很大。

trans_examp.trans_en: to disagree

example.eg: Economists differ on the cause of inflation.
example.egtrans: 经济学家们对通货膨胀的原因看法不一。

example.eg: I beg to differ with you on that point.
example.egtrans: 在那一点上恕我与你看法不同。

difference.name: difference
difference.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: difference
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which two or more things which you are comparing are not the same

example.eg: What's the difference between an ape and a monkey?
example.egtrans: 猿和猴有什么区别？

example.eg: Is there any significant difference in quality between these two items?
example.egtrans: 这两件东西在质量方面有明显的差别吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to improve a situation (a lot)

example.eg: Exercise can make a big difference to your state of health.
example.egtrans: 锻炼会极大地改善你的健康状况。

example.eg: Putting up some new wallpaper has made all the difference to the place.
example.egtrans: 贴上一些新壁纸后这个地方变得焕然一新了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not change a situation in any way

example.eg: You can ask him again if you want, but it won't make any difference - he'll still say no.
example.egtrans: 你如果愿意可以再去问他，但结果还是一样——他还会说不。

example.eg: It makes no difference where you put the plants - they won't grow in this soil.
example.egtrans: 不管你把这些植物放在什么位置结果都一样，它们在这种土壤里成活不了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to say that something is unusual, and more interesting or better than other things of the same type
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 与众不同，不同寻常，别具一格，更胜一筹

example.eg: Try new Cremetti - the ice cream with a difference.
example.egtrans: 试试新的克里梅蒂——不同寻常的冰激凌。

dsense.name: difference
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a disagreement

example.eg: They had a terrible argument a few weeks ago, but now they've settled/resolved their differences.
example.egtrans: 几个星期前他们发生过一次激烈的争吵，不过现在他们的分歧已经消除了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to disagree

example.eg: They had a difference of opinion about/over their child's education.
example.egtrans: 他们在孩子的教育问题上意见不一。

dsense.name: difference
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount by which one thing is different from another

example.eg: a(n) age/price/temperature difference
example.egtrans: 年龄差距/价格差异/温度不同

example.eg: There's a big difference in age between them.
example.egtrans: 他们年龄相差很大。

example.eg: There's a difference of eight years between them.
example.egtrans: 他们之间差八岁。

differentiate.name: differentiate
differentiate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: differentiate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show or find the difference between things that are compared

example.eg: We do not differentiate between our employees on the basis of their race, religion, or national origin.
example.egtrans: 我们不会因员工的种族、宗教或原籍国不同而区别对待。

dsense.name: differentiate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone or something different

example.eg: The slate roof differentiates this house from others in the area.
example.egtrans: 石板瓦屋顶使这座房子在该地区与众不同。

direct.name: direct
direct.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: going in a straight line towards somewhere or someone without stopping or changing direction

example.eg: a direct route/line
example.egtrans: 直通的路径／线路

example.eg: Is there a direct train to Edinburgh?
example.egtrans: 有到爱丁堡的直达列车吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: without anyone or anything else being involved or between

example.eg: She decided to take direct control of the project.
example.egtrans: 她决定直接管理这个项目。

example.eg: He denied that he had any direct involvement in the deal.
example.egtrans: 他否认自己与这笔交易有任何直接关系。

example.eg: Do you have any direct experience of this kind of work?
example.egtrans: 你有没有这种工作的直接经验？

example.eg: He left as a direct result/consequence of what she said.
example.egtrans: 她的话是他离去的直接原因。

example.eg: There is a direct link/connection between smoking and lung cancer.
example.egtrans: 吸烟与肺癌有直接的联系。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: strong light or heat that has nothing protecting and separating you from it

example.eg: This plant should be kept out of direct sunlight.
example.egtrans: 这种植物应避免阳光直射。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a relation who is related to you through one of your parents, not through an aunt or uncle, etc.

example.eg: Diana is a direct descendant of Robert Peel.
example.egtrans: 黛安娜是罗伯特‧皮尔的直系后代。

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete

example.eg: a direct contrast
example.egtrans: 完全的对比

example.eg: She's very thoughtful - the direct opposite of her sister.
example.egtrans: 她想得很周到——和她姐姐截然相反。

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Someone who is direct says what they think in a very honest way without worrying about other people's opinions.

example.eg: I like her open and direct manner.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢她坦率直接的态度。

direct.name: direct
direct.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a straight line towards somewhere without stopping or changing direction

example.eg: Does this bus go direct to the airport?
example.egtrans: 这路公共汽车直接去机场吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: without anyone or anything else being involved or between

example.eg: I intended to go direct to the manager with my complaint.
example.egtrans: 我打算直接向经理投诉。

direct.name: direct
direct.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to control or be in charge of an activity, organization, etc.

example.eg: She directs a large charity.
example.egtrans: 她主管一家大型慈善机构。

trans_examp.trans_en: to tell people the direction in which they must drive

example.eg: There was a police officer directing the traffic.
example.egtrans: 有一位警察在指挥交通。

trans_examp.trans_en: to be in charge of a film or play and tell the actors how to play their parts

example.eg: He wanted to give up acting and start directing (his own films).
example.egtrans: 他想放弃表演转而开始导演（自己的电影）。

example.eg: "Jaws" was directed by Steven Spielberg.
example.egtrans: 《大白鲨》是史蒂文•斯皮尔伯格导演的。

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to aim something in a particular direction

example.eg: Was that remark directedat/towards me?
example.egtrans: 这话是对我说的吗？

example.eg: Criticism was directed against/at the manufacturers of the product.
example.egtrans: 批评意见直指该产品的生产厂家。

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to tell someone how to get somewhere

example.eg: Could you direct me to the airport?
example.egtrans: 你能告诉我去机场的路吗？

example.eg: I couldn't find the station, so I asked someone if they could direct me.
example.egtrans: 我找不到车站，只好问路。

dsense.name: direct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to order someone, especially officially

example.eg: The judge directed the defendant to remain silent.
example.egtrans: 法官命令被告保持安静。

direct.name: direct
direct.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: without having to stop or change direction

example.eg: Does this train go direct to Edinburgh?
example.egtrans: 这是到爱丁堡的直达列车吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: without anything or anyone else being involved or in between

example.eg: Can I dial this number direct or do I have to go through the switchboard?
example.egtrans: 我可以直接拨这个号码还是需要总机接转？

directive.name: directive
directive.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official instruction

example.eg: The boss issued a directive about not using the fax machine.
example.egtrans: 老板下令不要使用那台传真机。

directly.name: directly
directly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: directly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: without anything else being involved or in between

example.eg: Our hotel room was directly above a construction site.
example.egtrans: 我们在酒店住的房间就在建筑工地的上方。

example.eg: The disease is directly linked to poor drainage systems.
example.egtrans: 这种病与下水管线不完善有直接关系。

example.eg: The sun shone directly in my eyes.
example.egtrans: 阳光直射我的眼睛。

dsense.name: directly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: honestly, even when it might make people feel uncomfortable

example.eg: Let me answer that question directly.
example.egtrans: 让我来坦率地回答那个问题吧。

example.eg: "Did you tell him to go?" "Not directly, no."
example.egtrans: “是你让他离开的吗？”“我没直接说，没有。”

dsense.name: directly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very soon

example.eg: Dr Schwarz will be with you directly.
example.egtrans: 施瓦茨医生很快就到。

trans_examp.trans_en: immediately

example.eg: When you get home you're going directly to bed.
example.egtrans: 到家后你要马上睡觉。

directly.name: directly
directly.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: immediately after

example.eg: Directly he was paid, he went out shopping.
example.egtrans: 他刚一领到钱就出去购物了。

trans_examp.trans_en: as soon as

example.eg: I'll be with you directly I've finished this letter.
example.egtrans: 我一写完这封信就来。

disambiguate.name: disambiguate
disambiguate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show the differences between two or more meanings clearly
trans_examp.trans_cn: 消除…的歧義，表明（不同釋義之間的）差異

example.eg: Good dictionary definitions disambiguate between similar meanings.
example.egtrans: 好的词典释义能表明相似意思之间的差异。

discard.name: discard
discard.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to throw something away or get rid of it because you no longer want or need it

example.eg: Discarded food containers and bottles littered the streets.
example.egtrans: 街上到处都是被丢弃的食品包装和瓶子。

trans_examp.trans_en: to get rid of a card you are holding during a card game

discard.name: discard
discard.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a card game, a card that you have got rid of

discourage.name: discourage
discourage.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: discourage
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone feel less confident, enthusiastic, and positive about something, or less willing to do something
