trans_examp.trans_cn: 使泄气，给…泼冷水，使心灰意冷

example.eg: The thought of how much work she had to do discouraged her.
example.egtrans: 一想到还有那么多工作得做她就泄了气。

dsense.name: discourage
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent or try to prevent something happening or someone doing something, by making things difficult or unpleasant, or by showing disapproval

example.eg: a campaign to discourage people from smoking
example.egtrans: 阻止人们吸烟的运动

example.eg: The authorities have put tanks on the streets to discourage any protest.
example.egtrans: 当局调动坦克上街以阻止抗议活动。

discover.name: discover
discover.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to find information, a place, or an object, especially for the first time

example.eg: Who discovered America?
example.egtrans: 谁发现了美洲？

example.eg: We searched all morning for the missing papers and finally discovered them in a drawer.
example.egtrans: 我们一上午都在找那些失踪的文件，最后终于在一个抽屉里找到了。

example.eg: Scientists have discovered how to predict an earthquake.
example.egtrans: 科学家们找到了预测地震的方法。

example.eg: She discovered (that) her husband was having an affair.
example.egtrans: 她发现丈夫有外遇。

example.eg: Following a routine check-up, Mrs Mason was discovered to have heart disease.
example.egtrans: 例行体检发现梅森夫人患有心脏病。

example.eg: The boss discovered him stealing money from the cash register.
example.egtrans: 老板发现他从钱箱里偷钱。

trans_examp.trans_en: to notice that a person has a special ability or quality and to help them to become successful

example.eg: Los Angeles is full of young actors working as waiters, hoping to be discovered by a movie agent.
example.egtrans: 有很多年轻的演员在洛杉矶做服务员，他们希望能够被电影星探发现提携。

discriminate.name: discriminate
discriminate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: discriminate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to treat a person or particular group of people differently, especially in a worse way from the way in which you treat other people, because of their skin colour, sex, sexuality, etc.

example.eg: She felt she had been discriminated against because of her age.
example.egtrans: 她认为自己受到了年龄歧视。

example.eg: In order to increase the number of female representatives, the selection committee decided to discriminate in favour of women for three years.
example.egtrans: 为了增加女性代表的人数，选拔委员会决定在3年内对妇女给予特别照顾。

dsense.name: discriminate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be able to see the difference between two things or people

example.eg: Police dogs can discriminate between the different smells.
example.egtrans: 警犬能辨别各种不同的气味。

discuss.name: discuss
discuss.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to talk about a subject with someone and tell each other your ideas or opinions

example.eg: The police want to discuss these recent racist attacks with local people.
example.egtrans: 警方希望与当地人讨论近期发生的种族主义袭击事件。

trans_examp.trans_en: to talk or write about a subject in detail, especially considering different ideas and opinions related to it

example.eg: The later chapters discuss the effects on the environment.
example.egtrans: 后面的几章阐述了对环境产生的影响。

disguise.name: disguise
disguise.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give a new appearance to a person or thing, especially in order to hide its true form
trans_examp.trans_cn: 给…化装，给…乔装打扮；将…伪装起来

example.eg: He disguised himself by wearing a false beard.
example.egtrans: 他粘上假胡须伪装自己。

example.eg: Minor skin imperfections can usually be disguised with a spot of make-up.
example.egtrans: 微小的皮肤瑕疵通常可以用化妆品来掩盖。

example.eg: We tried to disguise the fact that it was just a school hall by putting up coloured lights and balloons.
example.egtrans: 我们挂上彩灯和气球，不想让人看出这里实际上只是一个学校礼堂。

trans_examp.trans_en: to hide an opinion, a feeling, etc.

example.eg: I couldn't disguise my disappointment.
example.egtrans: 我无法掩饰自己的失望。

disguise.name: disguise
disguise.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that someone wears to hide their true appearance
trans_examp.trans_cn: 化装用具（服饰）；用于伪装的东西

example.eg: He put on a large hat and glasses as a disguise and hoped no one would recognize him.
example.egtrans: 他戴上大帽子和眼镜来伪装自己，希望没人会认出他来。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If people, objects, or activities are in disguise, they appear to be something that they are not, especially intentionally.

example.eg: She usually goes out in disguise to avoid being bothered by the public.
example.egtrans: 她外出时通常都要化装，以免受到公众的打扰。

example.eg: He claims that most Western aid to the Third World is just colonialism in disguise.
example.egtrans: 他说西方给第三世界提供的援助大多只是变相的殖民主义行为。

disruptive.name: disruptive
disruptive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: causing trouble and therefore stopping something from continuing as usual

example.eg: His teacher described him as a noisy, disruptive influence in class.
example.egtrans: 他的老师说他在班里是一个喜欢吵吵嚷嚷的捣乱分子。

trans_examp.trans_en: changing the traditional way that an industry operates, especially in a new and effective way
trans_examp.trans_cn: 改变行业传统运作方式的，颠覆性的

example.eg: disruptive technologies
example.egtrans: 颠覆性科技

distance.name: distance
distance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: distance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of space between two places

example.eg: What's the distance between Madrid and Barcelona/from Madrid to Barcelona?
example.egtrans: 马德里和巴塞罗那相距有多远？

example.eg: He travels quite a distance (= a long way) to work every day.
example.egtrans: 他每天上班的路途很远。

example.eg: Does she live within walking distance of her parents?
example.egtrans: 从她的住处到父母家可以走着去吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: from a place that is not near

example.eg: From a distance he looks a bit like Johnny Depp.
example.egtrans: 从远处看他有点儿像约翰尼·德普。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: at a point that is far away

example.eg: On a clear day you can see the temple in the distance.
example.egtrans: 在晴朗的日子里，远处的庙宇清晰可见。

dsense.name: distance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: behaviour that shows little interest or friendliness

example.eg: I noticed a certain distance between father and son.
example.egtrans: 我注意到父子之间有些疏远。

distinct.name: distinct
distinct.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: distinct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: clearly noticeable; that certainly exists

example.eg: There's a distinct smell of cigarettes in here.
example.egtrans: 这里确实有一股烟味儿。

dsense.name: distinct
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: clearly separate and different (from something else)
trans_examp.trans_cn: 明显不同的，差别明显的

example.eg: The two concepts are quite distinct (from each other).
example.egtrans: 这两个概念（之间）有显著的差别。

example.eg: There are two distinct factions within the one political party.
example.egtrans: 在同一政党内有两个不同的派系。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: rather than

example.eg: She's a personal assistant, as distinct from a secretary.
example.egtrans: 她是私人助理而不是秘书。

distinctly.name: distinctly
distinctly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is clearly noticeable or very definite

example.eg: His every word could be heard quite distinctly.
example.egtrans: 他的每个字都听得很清楚。

example.eg: I distinctly remember asking him.
example.egtrans: 我清楚地记得问过他。

example.eg: I began to feel distinctly disturbed.
example.egtrans: 我开始感到明显的不安。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is clearly separate and different from something else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 明显不同的，差别明显的

example.eg: The groups sang in distinctly different performing spaces.
example.egtrans: 这些团体在明显不同的表演空间里唱歌。

example.eg: He has a motivational style that is distinctly his own.
example.egtrans: 他有一种明显属于自己的激励风格。

example.eg: Internet chat rooms and messages are distinctly separate media.
example.egtrans: 互联网聊天室和短信是截然不同的媒体。

distinguish.name: distinguish
distinguish.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to notice or understand the difference between two things, or to make one person or thing seem different from another

example.eg: He's colour-blind and can't distinguish (the difference) between red and green easily.
example.egtrans: 他是色盲，很难分清红色和绿色（的不同）。

example.eg: I sometimes have difficulty distinguishing Spanish from Portuguese.
example.egtrans: 我有时很难分清西班牙语和葡萄牙语。

example.eg: It's important to distinguish between business and pleasure.
example.egtrans: 分清什么是正事什么是娱乐非常重要。

example.eg: It's not the beauty so much as the range of his voice that distinguishes him from other tenors.
example.egtrans: 他与其他男高音大不相同，并非因为他那华美的声音，而是他宽广的音域。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do something so well that you are admired and praised for it
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 使自己出类拔萃，表现突出

example.eg: He distinguished himself as a writer at a very early age.
example.egtrans: 他年纪轻轻就成为一名出类拔萃的作家。

distribute.name: distribute
distribute.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something out to several people, or to spread or supply something

example.eg: The books will be distributed free to local schools.
example.egtrans: 这些书将免费发放给当地学校。

example.eg: Several people were arrested for distributing racist leaflets/pamphlets (to the spectators).
example.egtrans: 数人因（向观众）散发宣扬种族主义的小册子而被捕。

example.eg: The company aims eventually to distribute (= supply for sale) its products throughout China.
example.egtrans: 公司计划最终让产品行销中国各地。

distribution.name: distribution
distribution.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of giving things out to several people, or spreading or supplying something

example.eg: Has the Channel Tunnel improved the distribution of goods between the British Isles and mainland Europe?
example.egtrans: 海峡隧道是否改善了不列颠群岛与欧洲大陆之间的货物流通？

example.eg: distribution costs
example.egtrans: 分销费用

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which people or things are spread out in a place

example.eg: a map showing distribution of global population
example.egtrans: 世界人口分布图

example.eg: They aimed to achieve a more equitable distribution of resources/wealth.
example.egtrans: 我们致力于寻找一种更为公平的资源／财富分配办法。

distributive.name: distributive
distributive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a mathematical operation) giving the same result whether parts are acted on in combination or separately
(of an adjective) showing that the members of a group are to be treated separately, rather than as a group
trans_examp.trans_cn: （形容词）分配的，个体的（而非整体的）

example.eg: "Each" and "every" are distributive adjectives.
example.egtrans: “Each”和“every”都是分布式形容词。

divided.name: divided
divided.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: split into two or more opposing groups who cannot agree
trans_examp.trans_cn: 分裂的；有分歧的；抵触的

example.eg: The party is deeply divided over fundamental issues, such as immigration and the budget deficit.
example.egtrans: 该党在移民和预算赤字等基本问题上存在严重分歧。

example.eg: More than ever we seem to be a divided nation.
example.egtrans: 我们作为一个国家似乎比以往任何时候都更加分裂。

document.name: document
document.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a paper or set of papers with written or printed information, especially of an official type

example.eg: official/confidential/legal documents
example.egtrans: 正式／机密／法律文件

example.eg: They are charged with using forged documents.
example.egtrans: 他们被控使用伪造的文件。

trans_examp.trans_en: a text that is written and stored on a computer

example.eg: I'll send you the document by email.
example.egtrans: 我会用电子邮件把文件发给你。

document.name: document
document.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to record the details of an event, a process, etc.

example.eg: His interest in cars has been well-documented (= recorded and written about) by the media.
example.egtrans: 他对汽车的兴趣在媒体的报道中都有详细的记载。

dot.name: dot
dot.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a very small round mark

example.eg: The full stop at the end of this sentence is a dot.
example.egtrans: 这个句子末尾的句号是一个小圆点。

example.eg: Her skirt was blue with white dots.
example.egtrans: 她的蓝裙子上有一些白色小圆点。

trans_examp.trans_en: the spoken form of a full stop in an internet or email address, or some computer files
trans_examp.trans_cn: （互联网、电子邮件地址或某些计算机文件所使用的句号的口语形式）点

example.eg: "What's the web address?" "www dot cambridge dot org".
example.egtrans: 那个网址是什么? 「www.cambridge.org。」

trans_examp.trans_en: the short sounds or short flashes of light used with dashes when sending messages in Morse (code)

dot.name: dot
dot.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a dot or dots on something

example.eg: Your handwriting is hard to read because you don't dot your i's.
example.egtrans: 你的笔迹很难辨认，因为你在字母 I 上面不加点。

trans_examp.trans_en: to be spread across an area, or to spread many similar things across an area

example.eg: We have offices dotted around/all over the region.
example.egtrans: 我们的办事处在该地区星罗棋布。

example.eg: The area is dotted with beautiful churches.
example.egtrans: 这一地区有很多漂亮的教堂。

downgrade.name: downgrade
downgrade.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to reduce someone or something to a lower rank or position, or to cause something to be considered less important or valuable

example.eg: My job's been downgraded to that of ordinary editor.
example.egtrans: 我已经被降为普通编辑了。

example.eg: We can't let the management downgrade the importance of safety at work.
example.egtrans: 我们决不能允许管理层轻视安全生产问题。

downgrade.name: downgrade
downgrade.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of downgrading

example.eg: A credit rating downgrade would raise their cost of borrowing.
example.egtrans: 信誉等级的降低会导致借贷费用的上涨。

downside.name: downside
downside.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a disadvantage of a situation

example.eg: The downside of living here, of course, is that it is expensive.
example.egtrans: 在这里生活的不利因素当然就是生活费用很高。

example.eg: Unemployment, inflation, and greater inequality are often the downside of a market economy.
example.egtrans: 失业、通货膨胀和不平等的加剧常常是市场经济带来的不利一面。

downstream.name: downstream
downstream.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the direction a river or stream is flowing

example.eg: The current carried her downstream.
example.egtrans: 水流将她冲向下游。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe something that happens later in a process or series of events

example.eg: He has expanded the glass manufacturing firm by purchasing downstream businesses such as a glass distribution company.
example.egtrans: 他扩大了玻璃制造厂业务，途径是购买相关后阶段工序的企业，如一家玻璃制品经销公司。

drastically.name: drastically
drastically.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is severe and sudden or has very noticeable effects
trans_examp.trans_cn: 彻底地 ； 激烈地，大幅度地

example.eg: Their budget has been drastically reduced.
example.egtrans: 他们的预算被大幅削减。

example.eg: Our communication environment has changed drastically in the last 10 years.
example.egtrans: 过去10年中，我们的通信环境发生了巨大变化。

drop.name: drop
drop.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: drop
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fall or to allow something to fall

example.eg: She dropped her keys.
example.egtrans: 她把钥匙掉了。

example.eg: I'm always dropping things.
example.egtrans: 我总是掉东西。

example.eg: Amanda dropped her sunglasses in/into the fountain.
example.egtrans: 阿曼达把太阳镜掉进喷水池里了。

example.eg: The book dropped from/off the shelf.
example.egtrans: 书从书架上掉了下来。

example.eg: Don't drop it!/Don't let it drop!
example.egtrans: 别让那东西掉下来！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to die suddenly and unexpectedly

example.eg: He dropped dead on the squash court at the age of 43.
example.egtrans: 他猝死在壁球场上，年仅43岁。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to write someone a letter, especially a short informal one
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 给…写信（尤指非正式的简短书信）

example.eg: Just drop me a line when you decide on a date.
example.egtrans: 一旦你确定了日期给我写信就行。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to tell someone something in a way that is not direct

example.eg: She dropped a hint that she'd like to come to the party.
example.egtrans: 她暗示她想来参加聚会。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not pronounce the letter h at the beginning of words in which it should be pronounced

dsense.name: drop
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move to a lower level, or cause something to move to a lower level

example.eg: The water level in the flooded region has finally begun to drop.
example.egtrans: 受灾地区的洪水终于开始退去了。

example.eg: The land drops (away) (= slopes down) sharply behind the barrier.
example.egtrans: 在这道屏障的后面，地势急剧倾斜而下。

example.eg: We had to drop our prices because of the recession.
example.egtrans: 由于经济不景气，我们不得不降低了价格。

dsense.name: drop
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stop doing or planning something, especially an activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: 停止，放弃（尤指某种活动）

example.eg: I'm going to drop yoga and do aerobics instead.
example.egtrans: 我准备不再练瑜伽而开始做有氧运动。

example.eg: Can you drop what you're doing and help me with this report?
example.egtrans: 你能停下手里的活儿来帮我写这份报告吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: to stop including someone in a group or team
trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…排除在外；开除；使离队

example.eg: He's been dropped from the team because of injury.
example.egtrans: 他因受伤而未能入选球队。

dsense.name: drop
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take someone to a particular place, usually in a car, and leave them there
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通常指用汽车）捎，带（某人至某地）

example.eg: They dropped me off at the main entrance.
example.egtrans: 他们把我捎到正门。

example.eg: I dropped him at the library and went shopping.
example.egtrans: 我开车把他带到图书馆后就去买东西去了。

drop.name: drop
drop.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: drop
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small round-shaped amount of liquid

example.eg: I thought I felt a drop of rain.
example.egtrans: 我觉得有一滴雨落在了身上。

example.eg: There were little drops of paint on the kitchen floor.
example.egtrans: 厨房地板上有几小滴油漆。

trans_examp.trans_en: a small amount of liquid you can drink

example.eg: I'll have a drop more juice, please.
example.egtrans: 请再给我来一点果汁。

example.eg: "Would you like some milk?" "Just a drop, please."
example.egtrans: “你要牛奶吗？”“请稍加一点。”

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of sweet food made of sugar

example.eg: fruit/pear drops
example.egtrans: 水果／梨味糖

example.eg: chocolate drops
example.egtrans: 巧克力糖

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: liquid medicine given in very small amounts

example.eg: eye/nose/ear drops
example.egtrans: 眼药水／滴鼻剂／滴耳剂

dsense.name: drop
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the distance from one thing to something lower

example.eg: There's a drop of two metres from the window to the ground.
example.egtrans: 窗户离地面有两米的距离。

trans_examp.trans_en: a reduction in the amount or level of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 降低的程度；减少的数量

example.eg: The recent drop in magazine subscriptions is causing some concern.
example.egtrans: 最近杂志订阅数量的减少引起了一些关注。

dsense.name: drop
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of delivering things such as supplies, medicine, etc., often by dropping them from an aircraft

example.eg: a food drop
example.egtrans: 空投食品

example.eg: The helicopter made a drop of much-needed supplies to the stranded hikers.
example.egtrans: 直升机向被困的徒步旅行者空投了他们急需的用品。

trans_examp.trans_en: the situation in which something is left in a place and later collected by someone else, usually a spy

duck.name: duck
duck.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: duck
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a bird that lives by water and has webbed feet (= feet with skin between the toes), a short neck, and a large beak
the meat of this bird

dsense.name: duck
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a friendly way of talking to someone you like

example.eg: Come and sit beside me, duck.
example.egtrans: 过来坐我边上，乖乖。

duck.name: duck
duck.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move your head or the top part of your body quickly down, especially to avoid being hit
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指为避免被击中而）猛低头，猛弯腰

example.eg: I saw the ball hurtling towards me and ducked (down).
example.egtrans: 我看到球朝我飞过来就连忙低头躲了一下。

example.eg: Duck your head or you'll bang it on the doorframe.
example.egtrans: 把头低一下以免撞到门框。

trans_examp.trans_en: to push someone underwater for a short time

example.eg: The boys were splashing around and ducking each other in the pool.
example.egtrans: 男孩子们在游泳池里击水打闹，并按住对方往水里压。

trans_examp.trans_en: to move quickly to a place, especially in order not to be seen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指为了避免被发现而）赶忙躲藏起来

example.eg: When he saw them coming, he ducked into a doorway.
example.egtrans: 他一见他们来了就赶忙躲到了门口。

dumb.name: dumb
dumb.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: dumb
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: permanently or temporarily unable to speak

example.eg: He's been deaf and dumb since birth.
example.egtrans: 他生下来就又聋又哑。

example.eg: She was struck dumb by what she had seen.
example.egtrans: 她被自己看到的惊得说不出话来。

dsense.name: dumb
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: stupid

example.eg: Are they brave or just dumb?
example.egtrans: 他们是勇敢还是愚蠢而已？

example.eg: What a dumb idea!
example.egtrans: 这想法太蠢了！

duplicate.name: duplicate
duplicate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make an exact copy of something

example.eg: The documents had been duplicated.
example.egtrans: 这些文件已经被复印过了。

example.eg: Parenthood is an experience nothing else can duplicate.
example.egtrans: 当父母是任何其他经历都无法比拟的。

duplicate.name: duplicate
duplicate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: being an exact copy of something

example.eg: The thieves were equipped with duplicate keys to the safe.
example.egtrans: 窃贼带着配好的保险柜钥匙。

duplicate.name: duplicate
duplicate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is an exact copy of something else

example.eg: I lost the original form so they sent me a duplicate.
example.egtrans: 我把表格的原件给丢了，所以他们又寄给了我一份副本。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a form is in duplicate, an exact copy has been made of it.

example.eg: The application has to be completed in duplicate.
example.egtrans: 申请表格必须填写一式两份。

duration.name: duration
duration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the length of time that something lasts

example.eg: He planned a stay of two years' duration.
example.egtrans: 他计划停留两年。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for as long as something lasts

example.eg: I guess we're stuck with each other for the duration (of the journey).
example.egtrans: 我想（旅程结束之前）这段时间我们两个要一直呆在一起。

dynamic.name: dynamic
dynamic.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: dynamic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a lot of ideas and enthusiasm
trans_examp.trans_cn: 思维活跃的；活泼的，充满活力的，精力充沛的

example.eg: She's young and dynamic and will be a great addition to the team.
example.egtrans: 她年轻活泼，会给团队增添不少活力。

example.eg: We need a dynamic expansion of trade with other countries.
example.egtrans: 我们需要大力发展与其他国家的贸易。

dsense.name: dynamic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: continuously changing or developing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不断变化的；不断发展的

example.eg: Business innovation is a dynamic process.
example.egtrans: 商业革新是一个不断变化发展的过程。

example.eg: The situation is dynamic and may change at any time.
example.egtrans: 局势不稳定，可能随时发生变化。

dsense.name: dynamic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to forces that produce movement

example.eg: a dynamic force
example.egtrans: 动力

ease.name: ease
ease.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: ease
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make or become less severe, difficult, unpleasant, painful, etc.

example.eg: To ease the problem of overcrowding, new prisons will be built.
example.egtrans: 为了缓解监狱里人满为患的情况，将修建新的监狱。

example.eg: These pills should ease the pain.
example.egtrans: 这些药丸能缓解疼痛。

example.eg: After the arrival of the United Nations soldiers, tension in the area began to ease.
example.egtrans: 联合国维和士兵到达后，这个地区的紧张局势开始得到缓解。

dsense.name: ease
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move or to make something move slowly and carefully in a particular direction or into a particular position
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）小心缓慢地移动；（使）缓缓移动

example.eg: She eased the key into the lock, anxious not to wake anyone.
example.egtrans: 她小心翼翼地把钥匙插入锁孔，生怕惊醒任何人。

example.eg: I eased myself out of the chair.
example.egtrans: 我慢慢地从椅子上站起身。

ease.name: ease
ease.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of experiencing no difficulty, effort, pain, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 容易，不费力；舒适，安逸，自在

example.eg: She won the 400 metre race with ease.
example.egtrans: 她轻松赢得了400米赛跑的冠军。

example.eg: The doors are extra-wide for ease of access (= so that people can get in without difficulty).
example.egtrans: 门都是加宽的，出入方便。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: relaxed

example.eg: He felt completely at ease.
example.egtrans: 他感到全身放松。

example.eg: She soon put/set me at ease (= made me relaxed) .
example.egtrans: 她很快消除了我的紧张情绪。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If someone, especially a soldier, is at ease, they are standing with their feet apart and their hands behind their back.

ecosystem.name: ecosystem
ecosystem.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: all the living things in an area and the way they affect each other and the environment

example.eg: Pollution can have disastrous effects on the delicately balanced ecosystem.
example.egtrans: 污染会对脆弱的生态平衡造成灾难性的破坏。

edge-case.name: edge case
edge-case.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a problem or situation, especially in computer programming, that only happens at the highest or lowest end of a range of possible values or in extreme situations
trans_examp.trans_cn: 边缘案例（在计算机编程中，只出现在可能值范围的最高或最低端或极端情况下的问题或情况）

example.eg: You may run into an edge case where your program screws up.
example.egtrans: 你的程序出错的地方可能会出现边缘案例。

example.eg: In engineering, it is important not to overlook the task of planning for edge cases.
example.egtrans: 在工程中，不要忽视对边缘情况出现的准备非常重要。

edge.name: edge
edge.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: edge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the outer or furthest point of something

example.eg: He put pink icing around the edge of the cake.
example.egtrans: 他用粉色的糖霜沿蛋糕边裱花。

example.eg: They built the church on the edge of the village.
example.egtrans: 他们把教堂建在了村边。

example.eg: A man was standing at the water's edge with a small boy.
example.egtrans: 一名男子带着个小男孩站在水边。

example.eg: I caught (= hit) my leg on the edge of the table as I walked past.
example.egtrans: 我经过那张桌子的时候，腿磕在桌边上了。

dsense.name: edge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the side of a blade that cuts, or any sharp part of an object that could cut

example.eg: Careful with that open can - it's got a very sharp edge.
example.egtrans: 小心那罐打开的罐头——开口那地方很锋利。

dsense.name: edge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the point just before something very different and noticeable happens

example.eg: The company is on the edge of collapse.
example.egtrans: 公司濒临倒闭。

example.eg: The government had brought the country to the edge of a catastrophe.
example.egtrans: 这届政府将国家引向了灾难的边缘。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If an unpleasant event pushes someone over the edge, it makes them start to behave in a crazy way.

example.eg: She had been driven over the edge by the separation from her husband.
example.egtrans: 丈夫离她而去，把她逼向疯狂的边缘。

dsense.name: edge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an advantage over other people

example.eg: In terms of experience, she definitely had the edge over the other people that we interviewed.
example.egtrans: 就工作经验而言，她显然要比我们面试过的其他人都胜出一筹。

dsense.name: edge
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small but noticeable amount of anger in someone's voice
trans_examp.trans_cn: 尖刻的声调；厌烦的声调；愤怒的语气

example.eg: There's a definite edge to/in her voice when she talks to her husband.
example.egtrans: 她跟丈夫说话时，语气明显有些气恼。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: nervous and not relaxed
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 如坐针毡的；惴惴不安的；烦躁的

example.eg: Is something wrong? You seem a bit on edge this morning.
example.egtrans: 出什么事儿了？你今天上午好像有些心神不宁。

edge.name: edge
edge.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move slowly with gradual movements or in gradual stages, or to make someone or something move in this way

example.eg: A long line of traffic edged its way forward.
example.egtrans: 一条长长的车龙缓缓向前移动。

example.eg: Inflation has edged up to five percent over the last two years.
example.egtrans: 在过去两年中，通货膨胀慢慢攀升至5%。

example.eg: Those who disagreed with the CEO's viewpoint were gradually edged out of (= forced to leave) the company.
example.egtrans: 那些和总经理观点不一致的人慢慢地一个个被迫离开了公司。

effect.name: effect
effect.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: effect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the result of a particular influence

example.eg: The radiation leak has had a disastrous effect on/upon the environment.
example.egtrans: 核辐射泄漏给环境带来了灾难性的影响。

example.eg: I tried taking tablets for the headache but they didn't have any effect.
example.egtrans: 我试着吃了几片药，但头疼一点都没有减轻。

example.eg: I think I'm suffering from the effects of too little sleep.
example.egtrans: 我觉得我睡眠太少，健康受到了影响。

example.eg: She has a lot of confidence, which she uses to good effect (= to her advantage) in interviews.
example.egtrans: 她很自信，在面试时她充分利用这一点，占尽了优势。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to produce or achieve the results you want

example.eg: They had to wait ten minutes for the anaesthetic to take effect before they stitched up the cut.
example.egtrans: 他们不得不等了10分钟，在麻醉剂起作用后才缝合伤口。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you say or do something for effect, you intentionally do it to shock people or attract their attention.

example.eg: I get the impression that she uses bad language in meetings for effect.
example.egtrans: 我觉得她开会时说脏话是在故意引人注意。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in fact, or in practice

example.eg: So in effect the government have lowered taxes for the rich and raised them for the poor.
example.egtrans: 所以呢，实际上政府是为富人减了税，而给穷人加了税。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to express that what you are reporting is only a short and general form of what was really said
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 有…的意思；大意是…，意思是…

example.eg: She said she was unhappy, or words to that effect.
example.egtrans: 她说了一些她很不幸福之类的话。

example.eg: He said something to the effect that he would have to change jobs if the situation continued.
example.egtrans: 他的话的意思是，如果这种情况再持续下去，他将不得不换个工作。

dsense.name: effect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: use

example.eg: The present system of payment will remain in effect (= be used) until the end of the rental agreement.
example.egtrans: 在租期结束前，将会继续采用现行的付款方式。

example.eg: When do the new driving laws come into effect?
example.egtrans: 新的道路交通安全法规什么时候开始实施？

example.eg: The new salary increases will take effect (= begin) from January onwards.
example.egtrans: 新的加薪标准将从1月份起正式实行。

dsense.name: effect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: lighting, sounds, and objects that are specially produced for the stage or a film and are intended to make something that does not exist seem real

example.eg: This is a movie worth seeing for its effects alone.
example.egtrans: 这部电影仅凭其特技效果就值得一看。

dsense.name: effect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a person's possessions, especially after their death
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （尤指死后遗留的）财产，财物，所有物

example.eg: It says on the form that the insurance covers all personal effects.
example.egtrans: 表上写明，所有个人财产都在该保险承保范围之内。

effect.name: effect
effect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to achieve something and cause it to happen

example.eg: As a political party they are trying to effect a change in the way that we think about our environment.
example.egtrans: 作为一个政治党派，他们正在试图改变我们关于环境的观念。

effectively.name: effectively
effectively.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is successful and achieves what you want

example.eg: The tablets work more effectively if you take a hot drink after them.
example.egtrans: 服用这些药片后再喝杯热饮，药效会更好。

trans_examp.trans_en: used when you describe what the real result of a situation is

example.eg: His wife left him when the children were small, so he effectively brought up the family himself.
example.egtrans: 在孩子还很小的时候妻子就离开了他，所以实际上是他一手把孩子们拉扯大的。

example.eg: Effectively, we have to start again from scratch.
example.egtrans: 实际情况是，我们不得不重新从零开始。

efficient.name: efficient
efficient.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: working or operating quickly and effectively in an organized way
trans_examp.trans_cn: 效率高的；有能力的；有效的；生效的

example.eg: The city's transport system is one of the most efficient in Europe.
example.egtrans: 这座城市的交通系统运行效率很高，在全欧洲名列前茅。

example.eg: We need someone really efficient who can organize the office and make it run smoothly.
example.egtrans: 我们需要的人必须要高效干练，善于组织筹划，能使这个办事处顺畅运作。

effort.name: effort
effort.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: physical or mental activity needed to achieve something

example.eg: If we could all make an effort to keep this office tidier it would help.
example.egtrans: 如果我们都努力保持整洁，那么办公室的面貌肯定会大有改观。

example.eg: You can't expect to have any friends if you don't make the effort with people.
example.egtrans: 如果不努力去和人们交往，你就别想有朋友。

example.eg: In their efforts to reduce crime the government expanded the police force.
example.egtrans: 为了减少犯罪，政府扩大了警察的队伍。

example.eg: He's jogging around the park every morning in an effort to get fit.
example.egtrans: 为了调整好身体状况，他现在每天早晨都绕着公园慢跑。

example.eg: It takes a long time to prepare the dish but the results are so good that it's worth the effort.
example.egtrans: 做这道菜很费时间，但结果大家都很爱吃，工夫真没白费。

trans_examp.trans_en: the result of an attempt to produce something, especially when its quality is low or uncertain
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指不理想的或难以确定的）结果

example.eg: Do you want to have a look at his exam paper? It's a fairly poor effort.
example.egtrans: 你想看看他的试卷吗？成绩可是不太好。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be difficult, tiring, or boring to do

example.eg: I'm exhausted all the time, and everything is a real effort.
example.egtrans: 我总是觉得精疲力尽，无论做什么都很费劲。

elaborate.name: elaborate
elaborate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: containing a lot of careful detail or many detailed parts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 精心计划（或制作）的；详尽的；复杂的

example.eg: You want a plain blouse to go with that skirt - nothing too elaborate.
example.egtrans: 你应该用一件样式简单的衬衫来配那条裙子，不要样式太复杂的。

example.eg: They're making the most elaborate preparations for the wedding.
example.egtrans: 他们正为婚礼做极为精心周到的准备。

example.eg: He came out with such an elaborate excuse that I didn't quite believe him.
example.egtrans: 他突然说了那么一大套理由，我不太相信他。

elaborate.name: elaborate
elaborate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to add more information to or explain something that you have said

example.eg: The congresswoman said she was resigning, but refused to elaborate on her reasons for doing so.
example.egtrans: 这位国会女议员说她要辞职，但拒绝说明辞职的原因。

elementary.name: elementary
elementary.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: basic

example.eg: I have an elementary knowledge of physics.
example.egtrans: 我懂一些基本的物理知识。

example.eg: They made some elementary mistakes.
example.egtrans: 他们犯了一些很基础的错误。

example.eg: Millions of travellers fail to take even the most elementary of precautions.
example.egtrans: 上百万的旅行者甚至没有采取最基本的预防措施。

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the early stages of studying a subject

example.eg: This book contains a series of elementary exercises for learners.
example.egtrans: 本书含有为学习者设计的一系列基础练习。

elimination.name: elimination
elimination.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of removing something

example.eg: the elimination of disease/pain
example.egtrans: 消除疾病／解除疼痛

example.eg: their elimination from the competition
example.egtrans: 他们被淘汰出比赛

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: by removing from several possible answers the ones that are unlikely to be correct until only one is left

example.eg: We eventually found the answer by a process of elimination.
example.egtrans: 我们最终运用排除法得到了答案。

ellipse.name: ellipse
ellipse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a regular oval shape

elsewhere.name: elsewhere
elsewhere.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: at, in, from, or to another place or other places; anywhere or somewhere else

example.eg: The report looks at economic growth in Europe and elsewhere.
example.egtrans: 这份报告研究了欧洲和其他地区的经济增长状况。

example.eg: They couldn't find what they wanted and decided to look elsewhere.
example.egtrans: 他们找不到他们想要的东西，就决定到别处去看看。

embed.name: embed
embed.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fix something firmly into a substance
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…牢牢嵌入（或插入、埋入）

Emeritus.name: emeritus
Emeritus.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: no longer having a position, especially in a college or university, but keeping the title of the position
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指从学院或大学）退休后保留头衔的，荣誉退休的

example.eg: She became Emeritus Professor of Linguistics when she retired.
example.egtrans: 她退休后成为语言学荣誉退休教授。

emit.name: emit
emit.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send out a beam, noise, smell, or gas
trans_examp.trans_cn: 发出，射出，散发（光、噪声、气味或气体）

example.eg: The alarm emits infrared rays which are used to detect any intruder.
example.egtrans: 警报器能发出红外线探测闯入者。

example.eg: The machine emits a high-pitched sound when you press the button.
example.egtrans: 一按这个按钮，机器就会发出尖厉的鸣叫声。

emphasis.name: emphasis
emphasis.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the particular importance or attention that is given to something

example.eg: I think we should put as much emphasis on preventing disease as we do on curing it.
example.egtrans: 我认为我们应该像重视治疗一样重视疾病的预防。

example.eg: Schools here put/place/lay great emphasis on written work and grammar.
example.egtrans: 这里的学校特别重视写作和语法。

trans_examp.trans_en: the extra force that is given to a word or part of a word when it is spoken

example.eg: The emphasis is on the final syllable.
example.egtrans: 重音在最后一个音节上。

example.eg: Where do you put the emphasis in the word "controversy"?
example.egtrans: "controversy"这个词的重音在哪个音节上？

enable.name: enable
enable.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone able to do something, or to make something possible

example.eg: Computerization should enable us to cut production costs by half.
example.egtrans: 实现计算机化可以使我们的生产成本减半。

encapsulate.name: encapsulate
encapsulate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to express or show the most important facts about something

example.eg: It was very difficult to encapsulate the story of the revolution in a single one-hour documentary.
example.egtrans: 将革命的前后经过浓缩成一部一小时的纪录片是很难的。

example.eg: She encapsulates the stereotyped image that the British have of Americans.
example.egtrans: 她概括地描述了英国人眼里典型的美国人形象。

enclosed.name: enclosed
enclosed.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: enclosed
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: surrounded by walls, objects, or structures

example.eg: He doesn't like enclosed spaces.
example.egtrans: 他不喜欢封闭的空间。

dsense.name: enclosed
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: sent to someone in an envelope with a letter

example.eg: The enclosed card is for Julia.
example.egtrans: 随信附一张写给朱莉娅的明信片。

example.eg: Please find enclosed a cheque in settlement of your invoice.
example.egtrans: 兹附上支票一张用以结清贵方发货清单上的货款。

encounter.name: encounter
encounter.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a meeting, especially one that happens by chance
trans_examp.trans_cn: 偶然相遇，邂逅，不期而遇

example.eg: I had an alarming encounter with a wild pig.
example.egtrans: 我曾经意外地碰到过一头野猪，真是惊险。

example.eg: This meeting will be the first encounter between the party leaders since the election.
example.egtrans: 这是自大选以来两党领导人首次狭路相逢。

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when people have sex, usually with someone they have not met before
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对象通常为陌生人的）性经历

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when two teams play against each other

example.eg: In their last encounter with Italy, England won 3–2.
example.egtrans: 在上次和意大利队的对垒中，英格兰队3比2获胜。

encounter.name: encounter
encounter.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: encounter
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to meet someone unexpectedly
trans_examp.trans_cn: 邂逅，不期而遇，偶然碰到

example.eg: On their way home they encountered a woman selling flowers.
example.egtrans: 在回家的路上他们碰到一位卖花的女子。

dsense.name: encounter
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to experience something, especially something unpleasant
trans_examp.trans_cn: 遭遇，遇到（尤指不愉快的事情）

example.eg: When did you first encounter these difficulties?
example.egtrans: 你什么时候开始遇到这些困难的？

example.eg: The army is reported to be encountering considerable resistance.
example.egtrans: 据报道，部队正遭遇到顽强的抵抗。

encourage.name: encourage
encourage.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone more likely to do something, or to make something more likely to happen

example.eg: We were encouraged to learn foreign languages at school.
example.egtrans: 在校时，学校鼓励我们学习外语。

example.eg: The council is encouraging the development of the property for both employment and recreation.
example.egtrans: 市政委员会鼓励开发该房地产项目旨在促进就业和增加娱乐设施。

trans_examp.trans_en: to talk or behave in a way that gives someone confidence to do something

example.eg: They've always encouraged me in everything I've wanted to do.
example.egtrans: 不论我想做什么，他们总是会鼓励我。

endless.name: endless
endless.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: never finishing, or seeming never to finish

example.eg: We used to have endless arguments about politics.
example.egtrans: 我们过去老是对政治问题争论不休。

example.eg: He seems to think that I have an endless supply of money.
example.egtrans: 他好像觉得我的钱永远花不完似的。

example.eg: The possibilities are endless.
example.egtrans: 有无数种可能。

enforce.name: enforce
enforce.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make people obey a law, or to make a particular situation happen or be accepted
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使服从（法律）；（强制）实行，执行，把…强加于

example.eg: It isn't always easy for the police to enforce speed limits.
example.egtrans: 对警察来说，严格执行限速规定并不总是件易事。

example.eg: The new teacher had failed to enforce any sort of discipline.
example.egtrans: 这位新教师一点都管不住学生，搞得纪律涣散。

ensure.name: ensure
ensure.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something certain to happen

example.eg: The airline is taking steps to ensure safety on its aircraft.
example.egtrans: 航空公司正在采取措施以确保其航班的飞行安全。

example.eg: The role of the police is to ensure (that) the law is obeyed.
example.egtrans: 警察的职责就是确保法律得到遵守。

example.eg: Their 2–0 victory today has ensured the Italian team a place in the Cup Final/ensured a place in the Cup Final for the Italian team.
example.egtrans: 今天意大利队2比0获胜，稳操胜券进入世界杯的决赛。

enterprise.name: enterprise
enterprise.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: enterprise
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an organization, especially a business, or a difficult and important plan, especially one that will earn money
trans_examp.trans_cn: 组织；（尤指）公司，企业；（尤指营利性的、艰巨而重大的）计划，事业

example.eg: Don't forget this is a commercial enterprise - we're here to make money.
example.egtrans: 不要忘记这是一个商业组织——我们到这儿来是为了赚钱的。

example.eg: Those were the years of private enterprise (= businesses being run privately, rather than by the government), when lots of small businesses were started.
example.egtrans: 那是一个私人企业的时代，众多小公司就是那时创建的。

example.eg: Her latest enterprise (= plan) is to climb Mount Everest.
example.egtrans: 她最近的雄伟计划是攀登珠穆朗玛峰。

dsense.name: enterprise
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: eagerness to do something new and clever, despite any risks
trans_examp.trans_cn: 事业心；进取心；创业精神；冒险精神

example.eg: They've shown a lot of enterprise in setting up this project.
example.egtrans: 启动这个项目显示出他们豪迈的进取精神。

example.eg: We need someone with enterprise and imagination to design a marketing strategy.
example.egtrans: 我们需要一位有进取心和创新精神的人来为我们制定市场战略。

entire.name: entire
entire.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: whole or complete, with nothing missing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 全部的；整个的；完全的；完整的

example.eg: Between them they ate an entire cake.
example.egtrans: 他们两个吃了整整一个蛋糕。

example.eg: He'd spent the entire journey asleep.
example.egtrans: 他整个旅程都在睡觉。

example.eg: They got an entire set of silver cutlery as a wedding present.
example.egtrans: 他们收到了一件结婚礼物，是一整套银质餐具。

entry.name: entry
entry.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: entry
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of entering a place or joining a particular society or organization

example.eg: A flock of sheep blocked our entry to the farm.
example.egtrans: 一群羊挡住了我们进入农场的路。

example.eg: I can't go down that street - there's a "No entry" sign.
example.egtrans: 我不能走那条街——那儿有“禁止入内”的标志。

example.eg: The actress's entry into the world of politics surprised most people.
example.egtrans: 这位女演员进入了政界，这使得大多数人都感到诧异。

example.eg: She made her entry to the ceremony surrounded by a group of photographers.
example.egtrans: 她在一群摄影师的簇拥下走进典礼仪式现场。

example.eg: The burglars gained entry by a top window.
example.egtrans: 窃贼是从房顶的天窗进入室内的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a door, gate, etc. by which you enter a place

example.eg: I'll wait for you at the entry to the park.
example.egtrans: 我会在公园入口处等你。

dsense.name: entry
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a separate piece of information that is recorded in a book, computer, etc.

example.eg: They've updated a lot of the entries in the most recent edition of the encyclopedia.
example.egtrans: 在最新版百科全书中他们更新了很多条目。

example.eg: As his illness progressed, he made fewer entries in his diary.
example.egtrans: 随着病情加重，他日记记得越来越少。

dsense.name: entry
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of work that you do in order to take part in a competition, or the act of taking part in a competition

example.eg: There have been a fantastic number of entries for this year's poetry competition.
example.egtrans: 今年的诗歌创作大赛收到的参赛作品很多，令人惊喜。

example.eg: the winning entries
example.egtrans: 获奖参赛作品

example.eg: Entry to the competition is restricted to those who have a ticket.
example.egtrans: 持票者方可参加竞赛。

example.eg: Have you filled in your entry form yet?
example.egtrans: 你填写参赛表了吗？

enumeration.name: enumeration
enumeration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of naming things separately, one by one

example.eg: Graphs and enumerations accompany the report.
example.egtrans: 报告中附有图表和查点清单。

example.eg: The enumeration from the census is important in distributing federal dollars.
example.egtrans: 人口普查的统计数据对联邦资金的分配很重要。

epithet.name: epithet
epithet.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an adjective added to a person's name or a phrase used instead of it, usually to criticize or praise them
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通常指在褒贬人时使用的）表述形容词，修饰语

example.eg: The singer's 104-kilo frame earned him the epithet of "Man Mountain" in the press.
example.egtrans: 这位歌剧演员身躯魁梧，体重104公斤，新闻报道中他的名前因此而被冠以“巨人”的称号。

equality.name: equality
equality.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the right of different groups of people to have a similar social position and receive the same treatment
trans_examp.trans_cn: （社会地位、待遇上的）平等；均等

example.eg: equality between the sexes
example.egtrans: 男女平等

example.eg: racial equality
example.egtrans: 种族平等

example.eg: the government department responsible for equalities
example.egtrans: 负责平等问题的政府机构

equation.name: equation
equation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: equation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a mathematical statement in which you show that two amounts are equal using mathematical symbols

example.eg: In the equation 3x - 3 = 15, x = 6.
example.egtrans: 在方程式3x-3=15中，x=6。

trans_examp.trans_en: a statement containing chemical symbols, used to show the changes that happen during a particular chemical reaction

dsense.name: equation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a difficult problem that can only be understood if all the different influences are considered

example.eg: Managing the economy is a complex equation of controlling inflation and reducing unemployment.
example.egtrans: 经济管理包括控制通货膨胀、降低失业率等复杂的因素。

dsense.name: equation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of considering one thing to be the same as or equal to another

example.eg: There is a tendency in movies to make the equation between violence and excitement.
example.egtrans: 电影有把暴力和刺激相等同的倾向。

equivalent.name: equivalent
equivalent.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having the same amount, value, purpose, qualities, etc.

example.eg: She's doing the equivalent job in the new company but for more money.
example.egtrans: 她在新公司做同样的工作，但薪水比以前高。

example.eg: Is $50 equivalent to about £30?
example.egtrans: 50美元是不是大约相当于30英镑？

equivalent.name: equivalent
equivalent.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that has the same amount, value, purpose, qualities, etc. as something else

example.eg: There is no English equivalent for "bon appetit" so we have adopted the French expression.
example.egtrans: 英语中没有和 bon appetit 相对应的词，所以我们就借用了法语的这个表达方式。

example.eg: Ten thousand people a year die of the disease - that's the equivalent of the population of this town.
example.egtrans: 每年有一万人死于这种疾病——该数字相当于这个城镇的总人口。

escape.name: escape
escape.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: escape
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get free from something, or to avoid something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 逃走，逃脱，逃离；逃避，避开

example.eg: Two prisoners have escaped.
example.egtrans: 两个犯人逃走了。

example.eg: A lion has escaped from its cage.
example.egtrans: 一头狮子逃出了兽笼。

example.eg: She was lucky to escape serious injury.
example.egtrans: 她真是万幸，逃过一劫，没有受重伤。

example.eg: He narrowly (= only just) escaped a fine.
example.egtrans: 他差一点被罚款。

example.eg: His name escapes me (= I have forgotten his name).
example.egtrans: 我记不起他的名字了。

example.eg: Nothing important escapes her notice/attention.
example.egtrans: 任何重要的事情都不会逃过她的眼睛／注意。

dsense.name: escape
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to press the key on a computer keyboard that allows you to leave a particular screen and return to the previous one or to interrupt a process
trans_examp.trans_cn: 退出，结束（计算机运行程序）

example.eg: Escape from this window and return to the main menu.
example.egtrans: 从这个窗口退出，返回主菜单。

escape.name: escape
escape.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: escape
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of successfully getting out of a place or a dangerous or bad situation

example.eg: He made his escape on the back of a motorcycle.
example.egtrans: 他骑上摩托车逃之夭夭。

example.eg: an escape route
example.egtrans: 逃跑路线

example.eg: They had a narrow escape (= only just avoided injury or death) when their car crashed.
example.egtrans: 撞车事故中，他们九死一生，逃过一劫。

trans_examp.trans_en: a loss that happens by accident

example.eg: an escape of radioactivity
example.egtrans: 放射线泄漏

dsense.name: escape
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that helps you to forget about your usual life or problems
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对现实的）逃避，回避；解脱之物

example.eg: Romantic novels provide an escape from reality.
example.egtrans: 浪漫小说提供了一种逃避现实的方式。

dsense.name: escape
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the key on a computer keyboard that allows you to leave a particular screen and return to the previous one or to interrupt a process

example.eg: Press Esc to return to the main menu.
example.egtrans: 按退出键返回主菜单。

especially.name: especially
especially.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very much; more than usual or more than other people or things

example.eg: She's not especially interested in sport.
example.egtrans: 她对体育运动不是特别感兴趣。

example.eg: I love Australian wines, especially the white wines.
example.egtrans: 我非常喜欢澳大利亚葡萄酒，尤其是白葡萄酒。

trans_examp.trans_en: for a particular reason

example.eg: I chose this especially for your new house.
example.egtrans: 我特地为你的新家挑选了这个。

example.eg: They invited her to speak especially because of her experience in inner cities.
example.egtrans: 他们邀请她来发言，主要是因为她有在旧城区生活的经历。

essence.name: essence
essence.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: essence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the basic or most important idea or quality of something

example.eg: The essence of his argument was that education should continue throughout life.
example.egtrans: 他的观点的要旨是教育应该持续终生。

example.eg: Yet change is the very essence of life.
example.egtrans: 然而变迁恰恰是人生的本质。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: relating to the most important characteristics or ideas of something

example.eg: In essence, both sides agree on the issue.
example.egtrans: 从本质上说，双方在这个问题上的意见是一致的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be the most important thing

example.eg: In any of these discussions, of course, honesty is of the essence.
example.egtrans: 当然，在探讨任何问题时都必须坦诚。

example.eg: Time is of the essence.
example.egtrans: 时间至关重要。

dsense.name: essence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a strong liquid, usually from a plant or flower, that is used to add a flavour or smell to something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通常取自植物或花的）香精，香料，精油

example.eg: vanilla essence
example.egtrans: 香草香精

example.eg: essence of violets
example.egtrans: 紫罗兰香精

essential.name: essential
essential.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: necessary or needed

example.eg: Government support will be essential if the project is to succeed.
example.egtrans: 这个项目能否成功，政府的支持至关重要。

example.eg: There is essential work to be done before the building can be re-occupied.
example.egtrans: 这座楼在重新入住前必须进行必要的维修。

example.eg: Water is essential for/to living things.
example.egtrans: 水对于生物来说是必不可少的。

example.eg: It is essential (that) our prices remain competitive.
example.egtrans: 我们保持价格方面的竞争优势是至关重要的。

example.eg: For the experiment to be valid, it is essential to record the data accurately.
example.egtrans: 要保证实验的有效性，就必须精确地记录数据。

essential.name: essential
essential.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a basic thing that you cannot live without
trans_examp.trans_cn: 必需品；不可缺少的东西

example.eg: Because I live in a remote village, I regard my car as an essential.
example.egtrans: 因为我住在一个偏远的村子里，所以我把汽车看作是必需品。

example.eg: When we go on holiday, we only take the bare essentials.
example.egtrans: 我们去度假时，只带一些最基本的必需品。

example.eg: This leaflet will give you the essentials of how to prepare for a hurricane.
example.egtrans: 这本小册子会告诉你飓风到来前如何做好准备的基本知识。

essentially.name: essentially
essentially.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the most important characteristics or ideas of something

example.eg: It's essentially a dictionary but it differs in one or two respects.
example.egtrans: 本质上说这还是一本词典，但在一两个方面它又不同于一般词典。

example.eg: What he's saying is essentially true.
example.egtrans: 他说的基本上都是实话。

evaluate.name: evaluate
evaluate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to judge or calculate the quality, importance, amount, or value of something

example.eg: It's impossible to evaluate these results without knowing more about the research methods employed.
example.egtrans: 如不能对使用的研究方法有更多了解，就无法对其结果作出评价。

example.eg: We shall need to evaluate how the new material stands up to wear and tear.
example.egtrans: 我们需要对新材料的耐磨损度作出鉴定。

evaluated.name: evaluate
evaluated.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to judge or calculate the quality, importance, amount, or value of something

example.eg: It's impossible to evaluate these results without knowing more about the research methods employed.
example.egtrans: 如不能对使用的研究方法有更多了解，就无法对其结果作出评价。

example.eg: We shall need to evaluate how the new material stands up to wear and tear.
example.egtrans: 我们需要对新材料的耐磨损度作出鉴定。

evenly.name: evenly
evenly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: evenly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you say something evenly, you speak without showing emotion in your voice although you are angry or not satisfied in some way.

example.eg: "We are not terrorists," he said evenly. "We are freedom fighters."
example.egtrans: “我们不是恐怖分子，”他镇定地说：“我们是自由斗士。”

dsense.name: evenly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or into equal amounts

example.eg: Divide the mixture evenly between the baking pans.
example.egtrans: 将混合物分成等份放在烤盘中。

example.eg: Congress is still evenly divided on the issue.
example.egtrans: 在这个问题上，国会仍旧分成两个阵营，旗鼓相当。

eventually.name: eventually
eventually.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the end, especially after a long time or a lot of effort, problems, etc.

example.eg: Although she had been ill for a long time, it still came as a shock when she eventually died.
example.egtrans: 虽然她已病了好长时间，但当她最终去世时，我们仍然感到非常震惊。

example.eg: It might take him ages but he'll do it eventually.
example.egtrans: 这或许会花去他很长时间，但最终他会成功的。

ever.name: ever
ever.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: ever
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: at any time

example.eg: Nothing ever happens here in the evening.
example.egtrans: 这儿晚上从来没发生过什么事儿。

example.eg: Have you ever been to London?
example.egtrans: 你去过伦敦吗？

example.eg: If you're ever/If ever you're in Rio, do give me a call.
example.egtrans: 无论什么时候你到了里约，一定要给我打个电话。

example.eg: He hardly ever (= almost never) washes the dishes and he rarely, if ever, (= probably never) does any cleaning.
example.egtrans: 他几乎从不刷盘子，也难得打扫一次卫生。

example.eg: When there's a James Bond movie on TV, I never ever miss it.
example.egtrans: 只要电视上播出詹姆斯‧邦德电影，我从不错过。

example.eg: If ever there was a cause for celebration, this peace treaty was it.
example.egtrans: 这项和平条约确实值得庆祝。

example.eg: The smell is worse than ever.
example.egtrans: 这气味更加难闻了。

example.eg: I thought she was famous, but none of my friends have ever heard of her.
example.egtrans: 我觉得她很有名，但我的朋友中竟然从来没人听说过她。

phrase.phrase_title: better, bigger, more, etc. than ever

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: better, bigger, etc. than at any time before
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 比以前任何时候都好／大／多（等等）

example.eg: We are spending more than ever on education.
example.egtrans: 现在我们的教育开支之大是前所未有的。

phrase.phrase_title: as big, fast, good, etc. as ever

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as big, fast, etc. as at any time before
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 像往常一样大／快／好（等等）

example.eg: The restaurants are as good as ever and no more expensive.
example.egtrans: 这些饭店的饭菜仍像往常一样美味可口，而且也没有涨价。

dsense.name: ever
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: continuously

example.eg: United's record in cup competitions grows ever more impressive.
example.egtrans: 曼彻斯特联队在杯赛中的成绩越来越引人注目。

example.eg: The ever-increasing demand for private cars could be halted by more investment in public transport.
example.egtrans: 加大对公共交通的投资或许可以遏制对私车日益增长的需求。

example.eg: Nuclear devastation was an ever-present threat.
example.egtrans: 核毁灭是个永久存在的威胁。

example.eg: Susan and Guy moved to the country, where they lived happily ever after.
example.egtrans: 苏珊娜和盖伊搬到了乡下，此后一直在那里过着幸福的生活。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: continuously since that time

example.eg: He's been depressed ever since he got divorced.
example.egtrans: 他离婚后一直很消沉。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in the same way as always

example.eg: As ever, I was the last to find out.
example.egtrans: 像往常一样，我又是最后一个知道的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used at the end of a letter as a way of saying goodbye to someone you know well
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （熟人之间通信时用于书信末尾署名前的套语）你永远的朋友

example.eg: Yours ever, Yvonne.
example.egtrans: 你永远的朋友，伊冯。

dsense.name: ever
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used for emphasizing an adjective

example.eg: The orchestra is to perform its last ever concert/last concert ever tomorrow night at the Albert Hall.
example.egtrans: 管弦乐队将于明晚在艾伯特音乐厅举行最后一次演出。

example.eg: Yesterday the company announced its first ever fall in profits.
example.egtrans: 昨天这家公司宣布其利润首次出现下跌。

example.eg: Was she ever a fast runner! (= She was a very fast runner!)
example.egtrans: 她以前跑得多快啊！

example.eg: "Are you looking forward to your vacation?" "Am I ever!" (= Yes, very much!)
example.egtrans: “你盼望休假吗？”“每时每刻都盼着！”

trans_examp.trans_en: in questions, used to emphasize the question word
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于疑问句中强调疑问词）究竟，到底

example.eg: How ever did he manage that?
example.egtrans: 他到底是怎么应付过去的？

example.eg: What ever have you done to him?
example.egtrans: 你究竟对他做了什么？

example.eg: Why ever would anyone/Why would anyone ever want to hurt her?
example.egtrans: 有人要去伤害她究竟是为什么？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: very/a very

example.eg: She's ever so pretty.
example.egtrans: 她貌美至极。

example.eg: She's ever such a pretty girl.
example.egtrans: 她是个很漂亮的女孩。

evolve.name: evolve
evolve.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to develop gradually, or to cause something or someone to develop gradually
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）逐步发展；（使）逐步演变；（使）逐渐形成；（使）进化

example.eg: Did humans evolve from apes?
example.egtrans: 人类是由猿进化而来的吗？

example.eg: The company has evolved over the years into a multi-million dollar organization.
example.egtrans: 该公司在数年内逐步发展成为一个拥有数百万美元资产的大企业。

example.eg: Bacteria are evolving resistance to antibiotics.
example.egtrans: 细菌正逐渐对抗生素产生耐药性。

exacerbate.name: exacerbate
exacerbate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something that is already bad even worse

example.eg: This attack will exacerbate the already tense relations between the two communities.
example.egtrans: 这次袭击将使两个团体间已经紧张的关系更加恶化。

exact.name: exact
exact.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: in great detail, or complete, correct, or true in every way

example.eg: The exact distance is 1.838 metres.
example.egtrans: 精确距离是1.838米。

example.eg: The exact time of the accident was 2.43 p.m.
example.egtrans: 事故发生的确切时间是下午2点43分。

example.eg: "I still owe you £7, don't I?" "Actually, it's £7.30 to be exact."
example.egtrans: “我还欠你7英镑，是不是？”“实际上，确切地说应该是7.3英镑。”

example.eg: The exact location of the factory has yet to be decided.
example.egtrans: 该工厂的确切位置尚未确定下来。

example.eg: Unlike astronomy, astrology cannot be described as an exact science.
example.egtrans: 占星术与天文学不同，严格来说，占星术不能称为一门科学。

exact.name: exact
exact.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to demand and get something, sometimes using force or threats

example.eg: to exact revenge on someone
example.egtrans: 报复某人

example.eg: The blackmailers exacted a total of $100,000 from their victims.
example.egtrans: 敲诈者从几名受害人那里总共勒索钱款10万美元。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something necessary

example.eg: Heart surgery exacts tremendous skill and concentration.
example.egtrans: 心脏外科手术要求手术者技术高超且精神高度集中。

exactly.name: exactly
exactly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used when you are giving or asking for information that is completely correct
trans_examp.trans_cn: 精确地；确切地；完全准确地

example.eg: The journey took exactly three hours.
example.egtrans: 正好是3个小时的路程。

example.eg: That'll be £15 exactly, please.
example.egtrans: 正好15英镑，请付款。

example.eg: It tastes exactly the same as the real thing, but has half the fat.
example.egtrans: 它跟真品的口味完全一样，但脂肪含量却只有其一半。

example.eg: The building looks exactly as it did when it was built in 1877.
example.egtrans: 这座建筑物看上去和1877年建成时完全一样。

example.eg: "What you seem to be saying is that more should be invested in the road system and less in the railways." "Exactly" (= that is correct).
example.egtrans: “你的意思好像是说应该在公路系统上多投资，而在铁路系统上少投资。”“完全正确。”

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize what you are saying

example.eg: Do exactly what I tell you and no one will get hurt!
example.egtrans: 严格照我说的去做，就不会有人受伤！

example.eg: Exactly how do you propose to achieve this?
example.egtrans: 你究竟打算怎样做到这一点？

example.eg: What exactly do you mean?
example.egtrans: 你到底什么意思？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used for saying that someone or something is slightly different from a particular way of describing him, her, or it

example.eg: He's not exactly good-looking, but he has a certain attraction.
example.egtrans: 他算不上英俊，但有着一种魅力。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used for saying that something is not completely true

example.eg: "So you gave her your iPod?" "Not exactly, I lent it to her."
example.egtrans: “那你把你的iPod给她了？”“不完全是，我只是借给她罢了。”

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used for saying that something is the opposite of a particular way of describing it

example.eg: Answer the question - it's not exactly difficult.
example.egtrans: 回答这个问题——这个问题并不难啊。

except.name: except
except.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: not including; but not

example.eg: The museum is open daily except Monday(s).
example.egtrans: 博物馆除周一外每天都开放。

example.eg: The government has few options except to keep interest rates high.
example.egtrans: 政府除了保持高利率外，几乎没有其他的选择。

example.eg: It's cool and quiet everywhere except in the kitchen.
example.egtrans: 除了厨房，别的房间都很凉爽安静。

example.eg: Everyone was there except for Sally.
example.egtrans: 除了萨莉，大家都在那儿。

example.eg: There is nothing to indicate the building's past, except (for) the fireplace.
example.egtrans: 除了壁炉外，再没有什么地方可以表明这幢房子的历史了。

exception.name: exception
exception.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone or something that is not included in a rule, group, or list or that does not behave in the expected way

example.eg: Men are usually quite good at map-reading but Tim is the exception.
example.egtrans: 通常男性都很会看地图，但蒂姆却是个例外。

example.eg: There are exceptions to every rule.
example.egtrans: 每条规则皆有例外。

example.eg: I like all kinds of movies with the exception of (= but not) horror movies.
example.egtrans: 除了恐怖片，各种电影我都爱看。

example.eg: Her books are always entertaining and this one is no exception.
example.egtrans: 她写的书总是妙趣横生，这本也不例外。

example.eg: You must report here every Tuesday without exception.
example.egtrans: 你每周二都必须来此报告，不得有例外。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not treat someone or something according to the usual rules

example.eg: We don't usually accept late applications, but in this case we will make an exception.
example.egtrans: 通常我们不受理逾期的申请，但这种情况下我们可以破一次例。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be offended or made angry by something or someone
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 因…而不悦；生…的气；因…而忿恨

example.eg: Why did you take exception to what he said? He was only joking.
example.egtrans: 你何必因为他说的那些话生气呢？他只不过是在开玩笑嘛。

excess.name: excess
excess.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: excess
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount that is more than acceptable, expected, or reasonable

example.eg: An excess of enthusiasm is not always a good thing.
example.egtrans: 过分热情不见得总是件好事情。

example.eg: They both eat to excess (= too much).
example.egtrans: 他们两个都吃得太多了。

example.eg: There will be an increase in tax for those earning in excess of (= more than) twice the national average wage.
example.egtrans: 对于那些收入超过全国平均工资一倍以上的人，税收额将要增加。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: actions far past the limit of what is acceptable
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 过分的行为；越轨行为；暴行

example.eg: For many years people were trying to escape the excesses (= cruel actions) of the junta.
example.egtrans: 在过去很多年里，人们一直都在想方设法逃离胡作非为的军政府统治。

example.eg: As for shoes, her excesses (= the large number she owned) were well known.
example.egtrans: 说到鞋，众所周知她的鞋多得离谱。

dsense.name: excess
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of the cost of an accident, injury, etc. that you agree to pay yourself when you buy insurance

example.eg: She has an excess of £200 on her home insurance policy.
example.egtrans: 她的房屋保险免赔款金额是200镑。

excess.name: excess
excess.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: extra

example.eg: Cut off any excess pastry and put it to one side.
example.egtrans: 切掉多余的馅饼皮，放在一边。

exciting.name: exciting
exciting.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: making you feel excited
trans_examp.trans_cn: 令人兴奋的；使人激动的；刺激的

example.eg: an exciting movie/soundtrack
example.egtrans: 扣人心弦的电影／电影配乐

example.eg: You're going to Africa? How exciting!
example.egtrans: 你要去非洲？真是太刺激了！

example.eg: It was a really exciting match.
example.egtrans: 这的确是一场扣人心弦的比赛。

exclude.name: exclude
exclude.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent someone or something from entering a place or taking part in an activity

example.eg: Women are still excluded from the club.
example.egtrans: 这家俱乐部仍然把女性拒之门外。

example.eg: Microbes must, as far as possible, be excluded from the room during an operation.
example.egtrans: 在手术过程中，要尽可能防止细菌进入手术室。

example.eg: Tom has been excluded from school (= he is not allowed to go to school) for bad behaviour.
example.egtrans: 汤姆因为行为不端被学校开除了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to intentionally not include something

example.eg: The price excludes local taxes.
example.egtrans: 这个价格不包括地方税。

trans_examp.trans_en: to decide that something is not true or possible
trans_examp.trans_cn: 排除…；不考虑…；认为…不可能

example.eg: We can't exclude the possibility that he is dead.
example.egtrans: 我们不能排除他已经死亡的可能性。

exclusive.name: exclusive
exclusive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: exclusive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: limited to only one person or group of people
trans_examp.trans_cn: 专用的，专有的；独有的，独占的

example.eg: This room is for the exclusive use of guests.
example.egtrans: 这个房间是专供客人使用的。

example.eg: an exclusive interview
example.egtrans: 独家采访

trans_examp.trans_en: expensive and only for people who are rich or of a high social class

example.eg: an exclusive private club
example.egtrans: 豪华私人俱乐部

example.eg: an exclusive part of town
example.egtrans: 城镇的高档住宅区

dsense.name: exclusive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: not including something

example.eg: Is the total exclusive of service charges?
example.egtrans: 总金额是不是不包括服务费？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: not possible at the same time
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 相互排斥的；互不相容的

example.eg: Some people think that uncontrolled economic growth and environmental stability are mutually exclusive.
example.egtrans: 有些人认为，无节制的经济发展和生态环境的平衡稳定是互不相容的。

exclusive.name: exclusive
exclusive.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a story that is published in one magazine, website, etc., and no others
trans_examp.trans_cn: 独家新闻；独家报道；独家专访

example.eg: The newspaper published an exclusive about the escape.
example.egtrans: 这家报纸刊登了有关这次逃跑事件的独家报道。

executable.name: executable
executable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: An executable file or program can be understood by the operating system of a computer and makes the computer perform a particular task.

execute.name: execute
execute.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: execute
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to kill someone as a legal punishment

example.eg: He was executed for murder.
example.egtrans: 他因犯谋杀罪被处死。

dsense.name: execute
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to do or perform something, especially in a planned way
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指有计划地）实施，履行，表演

example.eg: to execute a deal/plan
example.egtrans: 进行交易／实施计划

example.eg: The whole play was executed with great precision.
example.egtrans: 这出戏从头到尾表演得丝丝入扣，有板有眼。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you execute someone's will, you deal with that person's money, property, etc., according to the instructions in it.

execution.name: execution
execution.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: execution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the legal punishment of killing someone

example.eg: Execution is still the penalty in some states for murder.
example.egtrans: 在一些国家，犯谋杀罪的人仍然被处以死刑。

example.eg: The executions will be carried out by a firing squad.
example.egtrans: 将由行刑队来执行枪决。

dsense.name: execution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of doing or performing something, especially in a planned way
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指有计划的）实行，履行，表演

example.eg: Sometimes in the execution of their duty the police have to use firearms.
example.egtrans: 有时为了履行职责，警察不得不使用武器。

example.eg: Although the original idea was good, its execution has been disappointing.
example.egtrans: 尽管最初的想法很好，但真正做起来却令人失望。

exhaustive.name: exhaustive
exhaustive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete and including everything

example.eg: an exhaustive study/report
example.egtrans: 全面的研究／详尽的报告

existing.name: existing
existing.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to something that exists now

example.eg: The existing laws covering libel in this country are thought by many to be inadequate.
example.egtrans: 很多人认为，这个国家现行的有关诽谤罪的法律很不完善。

example.eg: Under the existing conditions many children are going hungry.
example.egtrans: 在目前情况下，会有很多儿童忍饥挨饿。

exit.name: exit
exit.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: exit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the door through which you might leave a building or large vehicle, or the act of leaving something, especially a theatre stage
