trans_examp.trans_cn: （建筑物或大型交通工具的）出口，安全门；（尤指演员）退场

example.eg: a fire exit (= a door you can escape through if there is a fire)
example.egtrans: 消防出口

example.eg: an emergency exit
example.egtrans: 紧急出口

example.eg: He saw Emma arrive and made a quick exit.
example.egtrans: 他看到埃玛匆匆而来又匆匆离去。

example.eg: She made her exit from the stage to rapturous applause.
example.egtrans: 在观众热烈的掌声中，她退场走下舞台。

dsense.name: exit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a smaller road used to leave a main road

example.eg: Come off the motorway at the Duxford exit.
example.egtrans: 从达克斯福德出口驶出高速公路。

exit.name: exit
exit.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: exit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to leave a building or large vehicle
trans_examp.trans_cn: 离开（建筑物或大型交通工具）

example.eg: I exited quickly before anyone could see me.
example.egtrans: 趁没人看到，我赶快离开了。

example.eg: Please exit the theatre by the side doors.
example.egtrans: 请从侧门离开剧场。

dsense.name: exit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to end a computer program that you are using

example.eg: You have to exit the program before starting another.
example.egtrans: 你必须退出这个程序，才能打开另一个。

expand.name: expand
expand.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to increase in size, number, or importance, or to make something increase in this way
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）（尺寸、数量或重要性）扩大，增加；（使）膨胀

example.eg: The air in the balloon expands when heated.
example.egtrans: 气球里的空气加热后膨胀。

example.eg: They expanded their retail operations during the 1980s.
example.egtrans: 20世纪80年代他们扩大了零售业务。

expect.name: expect
expect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: expect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to think or believe something will happen, or someone will arrive

example.eg: We are expecting a lot of applicants for the job.
example.egtrans: 我们预计会有很多人来应聘这份工作。

example.eg: I expect (that) you'll find it somewhere in your bedroom.
example.egtrans: 我想你会在你卧室里找到它。

example.eg: I expect (that) he'd have left anyway.
example.egtrans: 我估计无论怎么说他都已经离开了。

example.eg: He didn't expect to see me.
example.egtrans: 他没有料到会碰见我。

example.eg: The financial performance of the business is fully expected (= almost certain) to improve.
example.egtrans: 确信公司的财务状况会大有改观。

example.eg: We were half expecting you not to come back.
example.egtrans: 我们一直以为你多半不会回来了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: normal and what usually happens

example.eg: All parents of small children get tired. It's to be expected.
example.egtrans: 所有带小孩的父母都会非常累，这是可以想见的。

dsense.name: expect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to think that someone should behave in a particular way or do a particular thing

example.eg: I expect punctuality from my students.
example.egtrans: 我要求我的学生守时。

example.eg: Borrowers are expected to (= should) return books on time.
example.egtrans: 借阅者应该按时归还图书。

dsense.name: expect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be pregnant

example.eg: She shouldn't be lifting those boxes if she's expecting.
example.egtrans: 如果有孕在身，她就不该搬这些箱子。

example.eg: Kate and Dom are expecting a baby.
example.egtrans: 凯特和多姆就要有孩子了。

expectation.name: expectation
expectation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling that good things are going to happen in the future

example.eg: The holiday lived up to all our expectations (= was as good as we were expecting).
example.egtrans: 假期过得一点也没有让我们失望。

example.eg: I have high expectations for this job (= I believe it will be good).
example.egtrans: 我对这份工作的期望值很高。

example.eg: We did so well - beyond all (= better than) our expectations.
example.egtrans: 我们做得非常好——远远超过了我们的预期。

example.eg: I think she had unrealistic expectations of motherhood.
example.egtrans: 我觉得她对做妈妈的憧憬有些不切实际。

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling of expecting something to happen

example.eg: Considering the injuries he's had there can be little expectation of him winning the race.
example.egtrans: 考虑到他的伤病，他赢得这场比赛的希望不大。

example.eg: Our expectations are that the UK will cut its interest rate.
example.egtrans: 我们预计英国会降低利率。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: different from what is expected
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 出乎所有人的预料；意想不到的是

example.eg: Contrary to all expectations, she was accepted by the academy.
example.egtrans: 意想不到的是，她竟然被学院录取了。

Expected.name: expected
Expected.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: expected
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: believed to be going to happen or arrive

example.eg: The expected counterattack never happened.
example.egtrans: 预期的反击从未发生。

example.eg: The painting sold for three times the expected price.
example.egtrans: 这幅画的售价是预期价格的三倍。

trans_examp.trans_en: going to be born soon

example.eg: They do not yet know the sex of their expected child.
example.egtrans: 他们还不知道预产的孩子的性别。

dsense.name: expected
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: believed to be something that should happen or be done

example.eg: A third of pupils are failing to reach the expected standards.
example.egtrans: 三分之一的学生未能达到预期标准。

example.eg: His findings suggest a significant departure from the expected level of professionalism and performance of the company's senior leadership.
example.egtrans: 他的研究结果表明，该公司高级领导层的专业水平和业绩与预期水平有很大出入。

experience.name: experience
experience.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (the process of getting) knowledge or skill from doing, seeing, or feeling things

example.eg: Do you have any experience of working with kids? (= Have you ever worked with them?)
example.egtrans: 你有照看孩子的工作经验吗？

example.eg: The best way to learn is by experience (= by doing things).
example.egtrans: 最好的学习方式是在实践中学习。

example.eg: I know from experience that Tony never keeps his promises.
example.egtrans: 经验告诉我，托尼从不会信守诺言。

example.eg: I don't think she has the experience for the job (= enough knowledge and skill for it).
example.egtrans: 我认为做这种工作她经验不足。

example.eg: In my experience, people generally smile back if you smile at them.
example.egtrans: 据我的经验，如果你对别人微笑，他们一般也会对你微笑的。

example.eg: The experience of pain (= what pain feels like) varies from one person to another.
example.egtrans: 对疼痛的感觉因人而异。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that happens to you that affects how you feel

example.eg: I had a pretty unpleasant experience at the dentist's.
example.egtrans: 我看牙医有一次很不愉快的经历。

example.eg: It was interesting hearing about his experiences as a policeman.
example.egtrans: 听他讲当警察时的那些经历很有意思。

example.eg: I did meet him once and it was an experience I shall never forget.
example.egtrans: 我的确跟他见过一面，那是我永生难忘的一段经历。

experience.name: experience
experience.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you experience something, it happens to you, or you feel it.

example.eg: We experienced a lot of difficulty in selling our house.
example.egtrans: 我们卖房子几经周折。

example.eg: New companies often experience a loss in their first few years.
example.egtrans: 新公司在刚起步的几年中经常亏损。

example.eg: It was the worst pain I'd ever experienced.
example.egtrans: 那是我一辈子经受过的最剧烈的疼痛。

experienced.name: experienced
experienced.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having skill or knowledge because you have done something many times
trans_examp.trans_cn: 经验丰富的；有阅历的；有见识的

example.eg: an experienced teacher
example.egtrans: 经验丰富的老师

example.eg: She is very experienced in marketing.
example.egtrans: 她在市场营销方面经验丰富。

experimental.name: experimental
experimental.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to tests, especially scientific ones
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指科学方面）实验（性）的，试验（性）的，根据实验（试验）的

example.eg: The drug is still at the experimental stage (= is still being tested).
example.egtrans: 这种药物仍处于试验阶段。

example.eg: The changes to the distribution system are purely experimental at the moment.
example.egtrans: 目前分配体系的变革纯粹是试验性的。

example.eg: experimental psychology
example.egtrans: 实验心理学

expire.name: expire
expire.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: expire
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something that lasts for a fixed length of time expires, it comes to an end or stops being in use.

example.eg: My passport expires next month.
example.egtrans: 我的护照下个月过期。

example.eg: The contract between the two companies will expire at the end of the year.
example.egtrans: 两公司之间的合同将在年底到期。

dsense.name: expire
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to die

explicit.name: explicit
explicit.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: clear and exact
trans_examp.trans_cn: 清楚明白的；明确的；不含糊的

example.eg: I gave her very explicit directions how to get here.
example.egtrans: 我明确地告诉她来这儿怎么走。

example.eg: She was very explicit about (= said very clearly and exactly) what she thought was wrong with the plans.
example.egtrans: 她明确地指出了计划中她认为有误的地方。

example.eg: I wasn't aware that I would be paying - you certainly didn't make it explicit (= state it clearly).
example.egtrans: 我不知道我得付款——毫无疑问是你没说清楚。

trans_examp.trans_en: showing or talking about sex or violence in a very detailed way
trans_examp.trans_cn: （描绘性或暴力）赤裸裸的，露骨的

example.eg: a sexually explicit movie
example.egtrans: 有露骨性爱场面的电影

explicitly.name: explicitly
explicitly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is clear and exact

example.eg: I told you quite explicitly to be home by midnight.
example.egtrans: 我非常明确地告诉过你要在午夜前回到家。

example.eg: It should be explicitly stated exactly what the grant covers.
example.egtrans: 应清楚说明拨款的确切适用范围。

explore.name: explore
explore.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to search and discover (about something)

example.eg: to explore space
example.egtrans: 探索太空

example.eg: The best way to explore the countryside is on foot.
example.egtrans: 探索农村地区，步行是最好的方法。

example.eg: The children have gone exploring in the woods.
example.egtrans: 孩子们到树林里观察大自然去了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to think or talk about something in order to find out more about it

example.eg: Let's explore this issue/idea more fully.
example.egtrans: 让我们进一步探讨一下这个问题／计划。

exponent.name: exponent
exponent.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: exponent
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who supports an idea or belief or performs an activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: （想法或信仰的）拥护者，鼓吹者；（某活动的）能手

example.eg: Adam Smith was an exponent of free trade.
example.egtrans: 亚当‧斯密提倡自由贸易。

example.eg: Jacqueline du Pré was a leading exponent of the cello.
example.egtrans: 杰奎琳•杜普雷是一流的大提琴演奏大师。

dsense.name: exponent
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number or sign that shows how many times another number is to be multiplied by itself

example.eg: In 64 and yn, 4 and n are the exponents.
example.egtrans: 在64和yn中，4和n是指数。

expose.name: expose
expose.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: expose
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove what is covering something so that it can be seen

example.eg: The plaster on the walls has been removed to expose the original bricks underneath.
example.egtrans: 墙上的灰泥已被除去，露出了里面原本的墙砖。

example.eg: He damaged his leg so badly in the accident that the bone was exposed.
example.egtrans: 车祸中他腿受了重伤，骨头都露了出来。

example.eg: This photograph was under-/over-exposed (= too little/too much light was allowed to reach the film).
example.egtrans: 这张照片曝光不足／过度。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a man exposes himself, he shows his sexual organs in a public place to people he does not know.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （男性由于病态心理在公共场合）裸露性器官，露阴

dsense.name: expose
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make public something bad or dishonest
trans_examp.trans_cn: 揭露，揭发，揭穿坏事（或不诚实之事）

example.eg: The review exposed widespread corruption in the police force.
example.egtrans: 这篇评论文章揭露了警察部队盛行的腐败现象。

example.eg: The newspaper story exposed him as (= showed that he was) a liar.
example.egtrans: 报纸上的这篇报道揭发他是个骗子。

expose.name: exposé
expose.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a public report of the facts about a situation, especially one that is shocking or has been kept secret
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指对令人震惊或保密之事的）曝光报道

example.eg: Today's newspaper contains a searing exposé of police corruption.
example.egtrans: 今天的报纸刊登了一篇尖锐揭露警方腐败内幕的文章。

express.name: express
express.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: express
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show a feeling, opinion, or fact

example.eg: Her eyes expressed deep sadness.
example.egtrans: 她眼神中流露出深切的悲伤。

example.eg: I would like to express my thanks for your kindness.
example.egtrans: 承蒙善意，谨表达对您的衷心感谢。

example.eg: Words can't express how happy I am.
example.egtrans: 言语无法形容我的快乐。

example.eg: These figures are expressed as a percentage of the total.
example.egtrans: 这些数字是用总量的百分比来表示的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to communicate what you think or feel, by speaking or writing, or in some other way
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 表达自己（的想法或感受）

example.eg: I'm afraid I'm not expressing myself very clearly.
example.egtrans: 恐怕我没把我的意思表达清楚。

example.eg: Children often express themselves in painting.
example.egtrans: 孩子们经常通过画画来表达内心的感受。

dsense.name: express
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send something somewhere very quickly

example.eg: Your order will be expressed to you within 24 hours.
example.egtrans: 您订的货将在24小时内快递送到。

express.name: express
express.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: express
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: moving or being sent fast

example.eg: Please send this letter by express delivery.
example.egtrans: 请用快递寄这封信。

example.eg: an express train
example.egtrans: 特快列车

example.eg: The dry cleaners offer a normal or an express service.
example.egtrans: 干洗店提供常规服务以及快洗服务。

dsense.name: express
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: clearly and intentionally stated
trans_examp.trans_cn: 明确的；明白表示的；特别指出的

example.eg: It is my express wish that after my death, my books be given to my old college library.
example.egtrans: 我明确表示，死后要把我的藏书捐给母校的图书馆。

example.eg: The lawyer argued that the accused had gone to the victim's house with the express purpose of killing her.
example.egtrans: 律师辩道，被告到被害人家中去时，怀有很明确的杀人动机。

express.name: express
express.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: using a service that does something faster than usual

example.eg: Send this parcel express.
example.egtrans: 用快件寄这个包裹。

express.name: express
express.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a train or bus that takes less time to do a journey than other trains or buses

example.eg: The quickest way to get here is to take the uptown express.
example.egtrans: 来这儿最便捷的方法就是坐从市中心开出来的特快列车。

example.eg: the Orient Express
example.egtrans: 东方快车

trans_examp.trans_en: a service that does something faster than usual

example.eg: This parcel needs to be sent by express.
example.egtrans: 这个包裹需要用快递寄。

extend.name: extend
extend.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: extend
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to add to something in order to make it bigger or longer

example.eg: We have plans to extend our house (= to make it bigger).
example.egtrans: 我们计划扩建房屋。

example.eg: The government has produced a series of leaflets designed to extend (= increase) public awareness of the dangers of AIDS.
example.egtrans: 政府印发了一系列传单，旨在加强公众对艾滋病危害的认识。

example.eg: We're planning to extend our publishing of children's books (= increase it).
example.egtrans: 我们正计划扩展儿童图书的出版业务。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something last longer

example.eg: The bar has recently extended its opening hours (= made them longer).
example.egtrans: 酒吧最近延长了营业时间。

example.eg: I need to extend my visa (= make it last longer).
example.egtrans: 我的签证需要延期。

dsense.name: extend
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stretch something out

example.eg: We've extended a clothesline (= made it reach) between two trees in the garden.
example.egtrans: 我们在花园里两棵树之间系了根晾衣绳。

example.eg: He extended his hand as a greeting (= held out his hand for someone to shake it).
example.egtrans: 他伸出手去表示欢迎。

dsense.name: extend
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to reach, stretch, or continue

example.eg: The Sahara Desert extends for miles.
example.egtrans: 撒哈拉沙漠绵延数百英里。

example.eg: The path extends beyond the end of the road.
example.egtrans: 这条小路一直通到大路尽头很远的地方。

example.eg: Rain is expected to extend to (= arrive in) all parts of the country by this evening.
example.egtrans: 预计今天傍晚之前降雨范围会扩大到全国各个地区。

example.eg: The effects of this legislation will extend (= reach) further than the government intends.
example.egtrans: 这项立法所产生的影响将比政府预期的更为深远。

dsense.name: extend
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to offer or give something to someone

example.eg: I should like to extend my thanks to you for your kindness.
example.egtrans: 对您的好意我谨致以衷心感谢。

example.eg: The chairperson extended a warm welcome to the guest speaker.
example.egtrans: 主席向特邀演讲人表示热烈欢迎。

example.eg: The government is extending aid to people who have been affected by the earthquake.
example.egtrans: 政府正在为地震受灾居民提供援助。

example.eg: The bank has agreed to extend us money/extend money to us (= lend us money) to buy our house.
example.egtrans: 银行已经同意向我们提供购房贷款。

dsense.name: extend
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to include or affect someone or something

example.eg: Parking restrictions do not extend to disabled people.
example.egtrans: 停车限制不适用于残疾人士。

example.eg: Her new-found tolerance does not extend to single mothers.
example.egtrans: 她近来培养出一颗包容之心，可是对单身母亲仍然谈不上宽容。

example.eg: The invitation did not extend to family members.
example.egtrans: 受邀者不能带家属赴约。

dsense.name: extend
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause someone to use all their ability
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使发挥才干；使才尽其用；使竭尽全力

example.eg: She feels that her job doesn't extend her enough.
example.egtrans: 她觉得她的工作不能充分发挥她的才干。

external.name: external
external.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: of, on, for, or coming from the outside
trans_examp.trans_cn: 外面的；外表的；来自外部的

example.eg: the external walls of the house
example.egtrans: 房屋的外墙

example.eg: Female kangaroos carry their young in pouches that are external to their bodies.
example.egtrans: 雌袋鼠把幼崽放在体外的育儿袋中。

example.eg: This cream is for external use only (= it must not be put inside the body).
example.egtrans: 这种药膏仅限外用。

example.eg: In later years, his paintings began to show a number of external influences (= influences coming from other people).
example.egtrans: 他晚年的画作开始表现出很多受其他画家影响的痕迹。

example.eg: Most news magazines have a section devoted to external affairs (= foreign news).
example.egtrans: 大多数新闻杂志都设有国外新闻专栏。

example.eg: You shouldn't judge people by their external appearances (= what they appear to be like).
example.egtrans: 不应该以貌取人。

extract.name: extract
extract.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove or take out something

example.eg: They used to extract iron ore from this site.
example.egtrans: 他们曾在这个地方开采铁矿。

example.eg: The oil which is extracted from olives is used for cooking.
example.egtrans: 这种橄揽油是用于烹饪的。

example.eg: The tooth was eventually extracted.
example.egtrans: 那颗牙终于拔掉了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone give you something when they do not want to

example.eg: After much persuasion they managed to extract the information from him.
example.egtrans: 做了大量说服工作后，他们终于从他那儿挖来了情报。

extract.name: extract
extract.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: extract
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a substance taken from a plant, flower, etc. and used especially in food or medicine
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指食物或药物的）提出物，精华，汁

example.eg: malt/yeast extract
example.egtrans: 麦芽精／酵母膏

example.eg: The cream contained extracts of/from several plants.
example.egtrans: 这种护肤霜中含有数种植物萃取精华。

dsense.name: extract
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular part of a book, poem, etc. that is chosen so that it can be used in a discussion, article, etc.

example.eg: They published an extract from his autobiography.
example.egtrans: 他们刊登了他自传的一个片断。

extremely.name: extremely
extremely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very

example.eg: They played extremely well.
example.egtrans: 他们演奏得非常精彩。

example.eg: She's extremely beautiful.
example.egtrans: 她非常美。

factor.name: factor
factor.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: factor
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a fact or situation that influences the result of something

example.eg: People's voting habits are influenced by political, social and economic factors.
example.egtrans: 人们的选举习惯受政治、社会和经济因素的影响。

example.eg: Heavy snow was a contributing factor in the accident.
example.egtrans: 大雪是引发这场事故的一个因素。

example.eg: Price will be a major/crucial factor in the success of this new product.
example.egtrans: 价格将是这款新产品能否畅销的主要／关键因素。

example.eg: The economy is regarded as the decisive/key factor in the outcome of the election.
example.egtrans: 经济被视为影响大选结果的决定性／关键性因素。

example.eg: The movie's success is largely due to its feel-good factor (= its ability to make people feel happy).
example.egtrans: 这部影片取得成功在很大程度上是由于它给人以虚幻的满足。

dsense.name: factor
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in mathematics, any whole number that is produced when you divide a larger number by another whole number

example.eg: Two, three, four and six are all factors of twelve.
example.egtrans: 2、3、4 和6都是12的因数。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular level on some systems of measurement

example.eg: a wind chill factor of -20
example.egtrans: 风寒指数-20

example.eg: a factor 20 suntan cream
example.egtrans: 防晒系数为20的防晒霜

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If an amount becomes larger or smaller by a factor of a particular number, it becomes that number of times larger or smaller.

example.eg: Cases of leukaemia in the area near the nuclear reactor have risen by a factor of four.
example.egtrans: 核反应堆附近地区白血病病例已增长4倍。

fake.name: fake
fake.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an object that is made to look real or valuable in order to deceive people

example.eg: Experts revealed that the painting was a fake.
example.egtrans: 专家透露那幅画是赝品。

example.eg: The gun in his hand was a fake.
example.egtrans: 他手里的枪是假的。

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who is not what or who they claim to be

example.eg: After working for ten years as a doctor, he was exposed as a fake.
example.egtrans: 行医10年后，他被揭发是个冒牌货。

fake.name: fake
fake.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not real, but made to look or seem real

example.eg: He was charged with possessing a fake passport.
example.egtrans: 他被控持有假护照。

example.eg: fake fur/blood
example.egtrans: 人造毛皮／假血

trans_examp.trans_en: showing or pretending to feel emotions that are not sincere

example.eg: a fake smile/laugh
example.egtrans: 虚情假意的微笑／大笑

example.eg: She's so fake, pretending to be everybody's friend.
example.egtrans: 她太矫揉造作了，假装每个人都是她的朋友。

fake.name: fake
fake.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: fake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pretend that you have a feeling or illness
trans_examp.trans_cn: 装出（某种感情）；假装（有病）

example.eg: to fake surprise
example.egtrans: 佯装惊讶

example.eg: to fake an orgasm
example.egtrans: 假装达到性高潮

example.eg: She didn't want to go out, so she faked a headache.
example.egtrans: 她不想出去，就假装头痛。

example.eg: He faked a heart attack and persuaded prison staff to take him to hospital.
example.egtrans: 他假装心脏病发作，说服狱警送他去医院。

example.eg: He isn't really crying, he's just faking.
example.egtrans: 他没有真哭，只是在装哭。

dsense.name: fake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make an object look real or valuable in order to deceive people

example.eg: to fake a document/signature
example.egtrans: 伪造文件／签名

falsehood.name: falsehood
falsehood.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: lying

example.eg: She doesn't seem to understand the difference between truth and falsehood.
example.egtrans: 她似乎并不明白真实与虚假的区别。

trans_examp.trans_en: a lie or a statement that is not correct

familiar.name: familiar
familiar.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: familiar
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: easy to recognize because of being seen, met, heard, etc. before

example.eg: There were one or two familiar faces (= people I knew).
example.egtrans: 那里有一两张熟悉的面孔。

example.eg: The house looked strangely familiar, though she knew she'd never been there before.
example.egtrans: 尽管她知道自己以前从未到过那里，那座房子看上去却有一种奇怪的熟悉感。

example.eg: The street was familiar to me.
example.egtrans: 这条街我很熟悉。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to know something or someone well

example.eg: I'm sorry, I'm not familiar with your poetry.
example.egtrans: 对不起，我对您的诗歌不甚了解。

dsense.name: familiar
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: informal and friendly, sometimes in a way that does not show respect to someone who is not a family member or close friend

example.eg: He patted her back in an overly familiar way.
example.egtrans: 他拍了拍她的背，显得有些过分亲昵。

example.eg: He doesn't like to be too familiar with his staff.
example.egtrans: 他不愿意跟员工过分亲近。

familiar.name: familiar
familiar.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a close friend, or a spirit in the shape of a cat, bird, or other animal that is the close companion of a witch
trans_examp.trans_cn: 知交；（以猫、鸟等形象出现，与女巫为伴的）妖精

fantastic.name: fantastic
fantastic.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: fantastic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: extremely good

example.eg: You look fantastic in that dress.
example.egtrans: 你穿着那件连衣裙看起来棒极了。

example.eg: We had a fantastic time.
example.egtrans: 我们玩得很痛快。

example.eg: They won the tournament? How fantastic!
example.egtrans: 他们赢了锦标赛？太棒了！

dsense.name: fantastic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: strange and imaginary, or not reasonable
trans_examp.trans_cn: 幻想的；怪诞的，荒诞不经的

example.eg: He drew fantastic animals with two heads and large wings.
example.egtrans: 他画了一些长着两个头和巨大翅膀的怪兽。

example.eg: fantastical tales (= about imaginary things)
example.egtrans: 幻想故事

trans_examp.trans_en: very unusual, strange, or unexpected
trans_examp.trans_cn: 非同寻常的；奇怪的；难以置信的

example.eg: It seemed fantastic that they still remembered her 50 years later.
example.egtrans: 50年过去了，他们依然记得她，这似乎令人难以置信。

dsense.name: fantastic
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A fantastic amount is very large.

example.eg: She must be earning a fantastic amount of money.
example.egtrans: 她一定是在赚大钱。

feature.name: feature
feature.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: feature
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a typical quality or an important part of something

example.eg: The town's main features are its beautiful mosque and ancient marketplace.
example.egtrans: 漂亮的清真寺和古老的集市是该镇的主要特色。

example.eg: Our latest model of phone has several new features.
example.egtrans: 我们最新款的电话机型有几个新特点。

example.eg: A unique feature of these rock shelters was that they were dry.
example.egtrans: 这些可供栖身的岩洞的一个独特之处在于它们是干燥的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a building or of an area of land

example.eg: a geographical feature
example.egtrans: 地理特征

example.eg: This tour includes the area's best-known natural features, including the Gullfoss waterfall.
example.egtrans: 本次旅行的线路包括了该地区最知名的自然景观，其中就有居德瀑布。

example.eg: The most striking feature of the house was a huge two-storey room running the entire width and height of the building.
example.egtrans: 这幢房子最显着的特点是有一间巨大的双层高的房间，与整幢房子同宽同高。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the parts of someone's face that you notice when you look at them

example.eg: He has wonderful strong features.
example.egtrans: 他五官分明，相貌英俊。

example.eg: regular (= even and attractive) features
example.egtrans: 五官端正的面孔

example.eg: Her eyes are her best feature.
example.egtrans: 她容貌中最引人注目的是她那双眼睛。

dsense.name: feature
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a special article in a newspaper or magazine, or a part of a television or radio broadcast, that deals with a particular subject
trans_examp.trans_cn: （报纸或杂志的）特写；（电视或广播的）专题节目

example.eg: a double-page feature on global warming
example.egtrans: 关于全球变暖的跨页特写

dsense.name: feature
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a film that is usually 90 or more minutes long

feature.name: feature
feature.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to include someone or something as an important part
trans_examp.trans_cn: 以…为特色；给…以显著的地位

example.eg: The movie features James Dean as a disaffected teenager.
example.egtrans: 这部电影由詹姆斯‧迪安饰演一个心怀不满的少年。

example.eg: This week's broadcast features a report on victims of domestic violence.
example.egtrans: 本周广播节目里有一则关于家庭暴力受害者的特别报道。

example.eg: It's an Australian company whose logo features a red kangaroo.
example.egtrans: 这是一家澳大利亚公司，其标志是一只红色袋鼠。

feedback.name: feedback
feedback.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: feedback
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: information or statements of opinion about something, such as a new product, that can tell you if it is successful or liked

example.eg: Have you had any feedback from customers about the new soap?
example.egtrans: 有关新款肥皂你有没有收到顾客的反馈意见？

example.eg: positive/negative feedback
example.egtrans: 正面的／负面的反馈信息

dsense.name: feedback
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the sudden, high, unpleasant noise sometimes produced by an amplifier when sound it produces is put back into it

example.eg: Jimi Hendrix loved to fling his guitar around to get weird and wonderful sounds from the feedback.
example.egtrans: 吉米‧亨德里克斯喜欢用力弹拨他的吉他，这样扬声器的啸声中就会传出一种怪诞奇妙的声音。

trans_examp.trans_en: the return back into a machine or system of part of what it produces, especially to improve what is produced
trans_examp.trans_cn: 反馈（到机器或产出系统，以改良产品）

example.eg: Feedback from the sensors ensures that the car engine runs smoothly.
example.egtrans: 探测器的反馈能确保汽车引擎平稳运转。

field.name: field
field.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of land, used for growing crops or keeping animals, usually surrounded by a fence

example.eg: We drove past fields of ripening wheat.
example.egtrans: 我们驱车经过快要成熟的麦田。

example.eg: The cows were all standing in one corner of the field.
example.egtrans: 奶牛全都站在牧场的一角。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a place where you are working or studying in real situations, rather than from an office, laboratory, etc.

example.eg: I spoke to an aid worker who had recently returned from the field.
example.egtrans: 我和一位最近刚从现场归来的援救人员谈过。

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area, usually covered with grass, used for playing sports

example.eg: the school playing/sports field
example.egtrans: 学校操场/运动场

example.eg: a football/hockey/rugby field
example.egtrans: 足球／曲棍球／橄榄球场

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to go onto the field at the start of a game

example.eg: There were loud cheers as the Irish team took the field.
example.egtrans: 爱尔兰队进场时欢声大作。

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of activity or interest

example.eg: the field of history/science/medicine
example.egtrans: 历史／科学／医学领域

example.eg: Are you still in the same field (= are you doing the same type of work)?
example.egtrans: 你还在干老本行吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be something you do not know much about

example.eg: Programming really isn't my field - you'd better ask Phil.
example.egtrans: 编程真的不是我的专长，你最好问问菲尔。

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: all the competitors taking part in a race or activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: （参加比赛或活动的）全体运动员，全体人员

example.eg: The race started with a field of eleven, but two horses fell.
example.egtrans: 比赛开始时有11匹马，但有两匹马摔倒了。

example.eg: We have a strong field this afternoon.
example.egtrans: 今天下午我们阵容强大。

example.eg: Jones finished ahead of the field.
example.egtrans: 琼斯率先到达终点。

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a division of a database (= a collection of similar information on a computer) that contains a particular type of information, such as names or numbers

field.name: field
field.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to catch or pick up the ball after it has been hit in a game such as cricket or baseball, and to try to prevent the other team from scoring
trans_examp.trans_cn: （板球或棒球运动中）接（球），截（球）；守（球），任守方

example.eg: He fielded the ball well.
example.egtrans: 他稳稳地接住了球。

example.eg: Our team is fielding first.
example.egtrans: 我们队先作守方。

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to avoid answering a question directly

example.eg: He fielded some awkward questions very skilfully.
example.egtrans: 他非常巧妙地回答了几个尴尬的问题。

dsense.name: field
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have or produce a team of people to take part in an activity or event
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使参加活动（或比赛）；组织参加

example.eg: The company fielded a group of experts to take part in the conference.
example.egtrans: 公司组建了一个专家团去参加会议。

field.name: -field
field.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of land containing a particular natural substance
trans_examp.trans_cn: （有某种天然物质的）大片地方，…田

example.eg: an oilfield
example.egtrans: 油田

example.eg: a coalfield
example.egtrans: 煤田

final.name: final
final.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: last

example.eg: a final warning/offer
example.egtrans: 最后一次警告／出价

example.eg: the final chapters of a book
example.egtrans: 书的最后几章

example.eg: the final years
example.egtrans: 最后几年

example.eg: The game is in its final stages.
example.egtrans: 比赛到了最后阶段。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used when you are talking about what is most important or true in a situation

example.eg: In the final analysis, it is the drug companies that are going to profit from this policy.
example.egtrans: 归根结底，从这项政策中获益的将是那些制药公司。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to show that you are certain you will not change your decision about something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （表示决定不会更改）就这么定了

example.eg: I'm not coming and that's final.
example.egtrans: 我已经决定了，我不会来的。

final.name: final
final.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: final
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the last in a series of games, races, or competitions, usually the one in which the winner is chosen

example.eg: Last year we got through to the final.
example.egtrans: 去年我们进入了决赛。

example.eg: The men's basketball final will be on Sunday.
example.egtrans: 男子篮球决赛将在星期天举行。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the last set of games in a competition

example.eg: Do you think she will make it to the finals this year in the US Open?
example.egtrans: 你认为她能够在今年的美国公开赛上进入决赛吗？

dsense.name: final
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a test taken on a subject at the end of a school year or college course
trans_examp.trans_cn: （中小学或大学的）期终考试；课程结业考试

example.eg: The final exam for this class will be on 21 May.
example.egtrans: 这门课的期终考试将在5月21日举行。

example.eg: When is your chemistry/French/algebra final?
example.egtrans: 你的化学／法语／代数期末考试是什么时候？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the exams taken at the end of a university or college course
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （大学或学院的）毕业考试；结业考试

example.eg: I'm taking my finals in June.
example.egtrans: 我6月份要参加大学毕业考试。

example.eg: The finals results have gone up on the noticeboard.
example.egtrans: 大学毕业考试的成绩已经公布在布告栏内。

firm.name: firm
firm.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: firm
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not soft but not completely hard

example.eg: I'd rather sleep on a firm mattress than a soft one.
example.egtrans: 我宁愿睡硬床垫，也不要软的。

example.eg: These pears are still too firm to eat.
example.egtrans: 这些梨还太硬，没法吃。

dsense.name: firm
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: well fixed in place or position

example.eg: The bridge provided a firm platform for the bungee jumpers.
example.egtrans: 这座桥为蹦极者提供了稳固的平台。

trans_examp.trans_en: fixed at the same level or opinion and not changing

example.eg: The government remains firm in its opposition to tax reform.
example.egtrans: 政府仍坚决反对税收改革。

dsense.name: firm
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: strong and tight
trans_examp.trans_cn: 强有力的；紧紧的，牢牢的

example.eg: a firm handshake
example.egtrans: 强有力的握手

example.eg: Keep a firm hold of the handrail as you go down.
example.egtrans: 下去时要牢牢抓住扶手。

example.eg: No one seems to have a firm grip on the company at the moment.
example.egtrans: 目前似乎没有人能牢牢掌控公司。

example.eg: You need a firm grasp of mathematics to become an astronaut.
example.egtrans: 要成为宇航员，数学知识必须非常扎实。

dsense.name: firm
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: certain and not likely to change

example.eg: He is a firm believer in traditional family values.
example.egtrans: 他坚信应遵循传统的家庭价值观念。

example.eg: Some people still claim that there is no firm evidence linking smoking with lung cancer.
example.egtrans: 有人仍声称没有确凿的证据表明吸烟与肺癌有关。

dsense.name: firm
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: forceful and making people do what you want

example.eg: I was always very firm with my children - they knew the rules and I made sure they followed them.
example.egtrans: 我对孩子们总是很严格——他们知道规矩，我则监督他们守规矩。

firm.name: firm
firm.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a company or business

example.eg: He works for a law firm called Neil and Vigliano.
example.egtrans: 他在一家名为尼尔和维利亚诺的律师事务所供职。

example.eg: He's just started working for an accountancy firm/a firm of accountants in Cambridge.
example.egtrans: 他刚刚开始在剑桥的一家会计师事务所工作。

firm.name: firm
firm.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: firm
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make soil harder by pressing on it

example.eg: Firm the soil around the cuttings and water them in.
example.egtrans: 把插条四周的土压实，再浇上水。

dsense.name: firm
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stop changing or to remain at the same level, amount, etc.

example.eg: After a turbulent week on the markets, share prices firmed today.
example.egtrans: 经过一周的市场动荡，股票价格今天稳定下来了。

fix.name: fix
fix.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to repair something

example.eg: They couldn't fix my old computer, so I bought a new one.
example.egtrans: 他们修不好我的旧电脑了，所以我买了台新的。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange or agree a time, place, price, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 安排，确定（时间、地点、价格等）

example.eg: Shall we fix a time for our next meeting?
example.egtrans: 我们确定一下下次会议的时间吧？

example.eg: I understand the rent is fixed at £750 a month.
example.egtrans: 我听说租金定为每月750英镑。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fasten something in position so that it cannot move

example.eg: We fixed the bookcase to the wall.
example.egtrans: 我们把书架固定在墙上。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep something or someone in sight

example.eg: His eyes were fixed on the distant yacht.
example.egtrans: 他双眼凝视着远处的游艇。

example.eg: She fixed the child with a stare of such disapproval he did not dare move.
example.egtrans: 她用责难的眼光紧盯着那个孩子，吓得他一动也不敢动。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to continue to think about or remember something

example.eg: It is somehow fixed in my mind that my fate and that woman's are intertwined.
example.egtrans: 我和那个女人的命运已经交织在一起了，这个想法在我脑海挥之不去。

example.eg: She was so frightened that she could not fix her thoughts on anything.
example.egtrans: 她害怕得大脑一片混乱，根本甚么也想不清楚。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to do something dishonest to make certain that a competition, race, or election is won by a particular person
trans_examp.trans_cn: 操纵；在（比赛或选举）中作弊

example.eg: Several jockeys were arrested on suspicion of fixing the race.
example.egtrans: 几名骑师因涉嫌在比赛中作弊而被捕。

example.eg: It sounds like the election was fixed.
example.egtrans: 听起来好像有人操纵这次选举。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make your hair, make-up, clothes, etc. look tidy
trans_examp.trans_cn: 梳洗，整理（头发、容妆、衣服等）

example.eg: Give me a couple of minutes while I fix my hair.
example.egtrans: 给我几分钟时间整理一下头发。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cook or prepare food or drink

example.eg: Whose turn is it to fix dinner?
example.egtrans: 轮到谁做晚饭了？

example.eg: Can I fix you a drink?/Can I fix a drink for you?
example.egtrans: 我给你倒杯饮料好吗？

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to punish especially someone who has been unfair
trans_examp.trans_cn: 惩罚，收拾（尤指待人不公者）

example.eg: I'm gonna fix her if she doesn't stop telling lies about me!
example.egtrans: 如果她还在不停地造我的谣，我就打算收拾她了！

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to treat something, especially photographic material, with chemicals to prevent its colours becoming pale

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove the reproductive organs of an animal so that it is unable to produce young animals

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to inject (= put into the body through a needle) an illegal drug

example.eg: We saw kids as young as twelve fixing in doorways.
example.egtrans: 我们看见门口那些年仅12岁的孩子在注射毒品。

fix.name: fix
fix.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which someone does something dishonest to make certain that a competition, race, or election is won by a particular person
trans_examp.trans_cn: 操纵；在（比赛或选举）中作弊

example.eg: The result was a fix!
example.egtrans: 结果是早就定好了的！

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an awkward or difficult situation

example.eg: I'm in a bit of a fix with the arrangements.
example.egtrans: 这样的安排让我陷入了窘境。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of an illegal drug, or of another substance that has an effect on someone

example.eg: He was shaking badly and needed a fix.
example.egtrans: 他抖得很厉害，需要一剂毒品。

example.eg: Ginny needs her daily fix of chocolate.
example.egtrans: 金妮每天不吃巧克力就过不去。

dsense.name: fix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (the calculation of) the position of a vehicle, usually in relation to the earth

example.eg: Do we still have a fix on that jet?
example.egtrans: 那架喷气机的方位我们还能确定吗？

fixed.name: fixed
fixed.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: fixed
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: arranged or decided already and not able to be changed

example.eg: a fixed price
example.egtrans: 固定价格

example.eg: fixed interest rates
example.egtrans: 固定利率

example.eg: Is the date of the wedding fixed yet?
example.egtrans: 婚礼日期确定了吗？

dsense.name: fixed
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: fastened somewhere and not able to be moved

flag.name: flag
flag.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: flag
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of cloth, usually rectangular and attached to a pole at one edge, that has a pattern that shows it represents a country or a group, or has a particular meaning

example.eg: Flags of all the participating countries are flying outside the stadium.
example.egtrans: 所有参赛国家的国旗都飘扬在体育场外。

example.eg: Flags were flapping/fluttering in the breeze.
example.egtrans: 旗子在和风中飘扬。

example.eg: The guard waved his flag and the train pulled away from the station.
example.egtrans: 护卫挥旗示意，火车从车站驶离。

dsense.name: flag
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         flagstone

dsense.name: flag
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flower that is a type of large iris

flag.name: flag
flag.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: flag
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a mark on something so it can be found easily among other similar things

example.eg: Flag any files that might be useful later.
example.egtrans: 给日后可能有用的文件做上标记。

trans_examp.trans_en: to mark computer information with one of two possible values so that you can deal with it later
trans_examp.trans_cn: 标记（计算机里某些信息，以便之后处理）

example.eg: We'll flag the records of interest in the database and then we can give you a print-out.
example.egtrans: 我们会在数据库中把值得关注的纪录标记出来，之后打印一份给你。

dsense.name: flag
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to become tired, weaker, or less effective

example.eg: I was starting to flag after the ninth mile.
example.egtrans: 走了9英里后，我开始感到疲倦了。

example.eg: The conversation was flagging.
example.egtrans: 谈话越来越乏味了。

flat.name: flat
flat.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: level and smooth, with no curved, high, or hollow parts

example.eg: An ice rink needs to be completely flat.
example.egtrans: 溜冰场地必须十分平坦。

example.eg: Roll out the pastry on a flat surface.
example.egtrans: 在平的面板上把油酥面团擀薄。

example.eg: Much of the countryside in that region is very flat.
example.egtrans: 那一地区的许多乡村都地势平坦。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: level but having little or no height

example.eg: flat shoes (= ones without a raised heel)
example.egtrans: 平底鞋

trans_examp.trans_en: Flat bread is made without yeast, and therefore does not rise.

example.eg: Pitta and nan are two types of flat bread.
example.egtrans: 皮塔饼和印度薄饼是两种未发酵的面包。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a hat that is not rounded on top and has little height

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not interesting, or without emotion or excitement
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不积极的；不感兴趣的；缺乏热情的

example.eg: After the excitement of the party, life seems somewhat flat now.
example.egtrans: 聚会的兴奋劲儿过去之后，生活现在似乎相当乏味。

example.eg: I thought her performance a little flat.
example.egtrans: 我觉得她的表演有点平淡。

example.eg: I think the colours in this painting are kind of flat (= not varied or bright).
example.egtrans: 我认为这幅油画的色彩有些平淡。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: with no electrical power left in it

example.eg: I left my car lights on and now the battery is flat.
example.egtrans: 我的车灯没关，现在电池没电了。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a drink is flat, it has stopped being fizzy (= with bubbles).

example.eg: If you don't put the top back on that bottle of beer, it will go flat.
example.egtrans: 你要是不把那瓶啤酒的瓶盖盖上，它会走气的。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete or certain, and not likely to change

example.eg: His request for time off work was met with a flat refusal.
example.egtrans: 他的休假要求遭到了断然拒绝。

example.eg: The official has issued a flat denial of the accusations against her.
example.egtrans: 那位官员矢口否认对她的那些指控。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something such as a tyre or ball is flat, it does not contain enough air.

example.eg: I got a flat tyre (= the air went out of it) after driving over a nail.
example.egtrans: 我的车胎扎了钉子后瘪了。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of an amount of money) fixed and not likely to change

example.eg: We charge a flat fee/rate of $25 per hour.
example.egtrans: 我们每小时统一收费25美元。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If profits, sales, etc. are flat, they are not growing or increasing.

example.eg: Demand for our machinery abroad is increasing, while growth is flat at home.
example.egtrans: 在海外对我们生产的机器需求在不断增长，在国内却十分平缓。

flat.name: flat
flat.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of rooms for living in that are part of a larger building and are usually all on one floor

example.eg: a furnished/unfurnished flat
example.egtrans: 配家具／未配家具的公寓

example.eg: a block of flats
example.egtrans: 一栋公寓楼

example.eg: They have a house in the country and a flat in Manchester.
example.egtrans: 他们在乡下有一套房子，在曼切斯特有一套公寓。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of low, level ground, often near water

example.eg: The salt flats are used for motor racing.
example.egtrans: 盐滩被用作摩托车比赛场地。

example.eg: The mud flats attract large numbers of birds.
example.egtrans: 潮泥滩吸引了大批鸟类。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the palm and fingers when they are held straight and level

example.eg: He hit me with the flat of his hand.
example.egtrans: 他打了我一巴掌。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be on a level surface, not on a slope or hill

example.eg: Most of the path is on the flat.
example.egtrans: 这条小径大部分都在平地上。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a tyre that does not have any or enough air in it

example.eg: We were late because we had to stop and fix a flat.
example.egtrans: 我们迟到了，因为中途不得不停下来修理漏气的轮胎。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: women's shoes without high heels

example.eg: I feel more comfortable in flats.
example.egtrans: 我穿平底鞋感觉更舒适。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (a symbol for) a note that is a semitone lower than a stated note

flat.name: flat
flat.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (in music) lower than a particular note or the correct note
trans_examp.trans_cn: （音乐）低于标准音高的，偏低的

example.eg: The top string on your violin is flat.
example.egtrans: 你的小提琴 E 弦音偏低。

example.eg: She sang flat throughout the song (= all the notes she sang were too low).
example.egtrans: 她把整首歌的音调都唱低了。

flat.name: flat
flat.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a level position, often against another surface
trans_examp.trans_cn: （常指贴着另一表面）水平地，平直地

example.eg: Lay the cloth flat across the table.
example.egtrans: 把布平铺在桌子上。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: into a flat shape without height

example.eg: These patio chairs will fold flat for storage.
example.egtrans: 这些花园坐椅可以折叠起来存放。

dsense.name: flat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely or to the greatest degree possible

example.eg: She told him flat that she would not go to the show.
example.egtrans: 她直截了当地告诉他她是不会去看表演的。

example.eg: Could you lend me some money, I'm flat broke (= I have no money).
example.egtrans: 你能借我些钱吗？我一个子儿也没有了。

phrase.phrase_title: three minutes, half an hour, etc. flat

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: exactly three minutes, half an hour, etc.

example.eg: We managed to get to the station in five minutes flat.
example.egtrans: 我们设法正好用了5分钟时间赶到了车站。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as fast or as hard as possible

example.eg: My car only does about 60 mph, even when it's going flat out.
example.egtrans: 我的车即使全速行驶，也只能跑到每小时60英里左右。

example.eg: We've been working flat out to get this done.
example.egtrans: 为了完成这项工作，我们一直在全力以赴。

flaunt.name: flaunt
flaunt.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show or make obvious something you are proud of in order to get admiration

example.eg: He's got a lot of money but he doesn't flaunt it.
example.egtrans: 他有很多钱，但从不炫耀。

example.eg: Flavio was flaunting his tan in a pair of white trunks.
example.egtrans: 弗拉维奥穿了一条白色的游泳裤，炫耀自己晒成棕褐色的肌肤。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to show your body in a confident and sexual manner

flexible.name: flexible
flexible.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: flexible
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to change or be changed easily according to the situation
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可变动的；灵活的；可变通的

example.eg: My schedule is flexible - I could arrange to meet with you any day next week.
example.egtrans: 我的时间安排很灵活——下周任何一天我都可以安排与你见面。

dsense.name: flexible
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to bend or to be bent easily without breaking
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可弯曲的；柔韧的；有弹性的

example.eg: Rubber is a flexible substance.
example.egtrans: 橡胶是一种有弹性的物质。

example.eg: Dancers and gymnasts need to be very flexible (= able to bend their bodies easily).
example.egtrans: 舞蹈演员和体操运动员的身体必须非常柔韧。

flow.name: flow
flow.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: flow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of liquids, gases, or electricity) to move in one direction, especially continuously and easily

example.eg: Lava from the volcano was flowing down the hillside.
example.egtrans: 火山岩浆顺着山坡往下流。

example.eg: Many short rivers flow into the Pacific Ocean.
example.egtrans: 许多小河汇入太平洋。

example.eg: The river flows through three counties before flowing into the sea just south of here.
example.egtrans: 这条河流在汇入此处正南边的大海之前流经了3个郡县。

example.eg: With fewer cars on the roads, traffic is flowing (= moving forward) more smoothly than usual.
example.egtrans: 路上的车少了，交通比平时更通畅了。

dsense.name: flow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to continue to arrive or be produced
trans_examp.trans_cn: 持续抵达；持续供应（或生产）

example.eg: Please keep the money flowing in!
example.egtrans: 请继续投钱进来！

example.eg: Offers of help are flowing into the disaster area from all over the country.
example.egtrans: 援助源源不断地从全国各地到达灾区。

example.eg: My thoughts flow more easily if I work on a computer.
example.egtrans: 如果在电脑上工作，我的想法会更流畅一些。

example.eg: By eleven o'clock, the wine was starting to flow.
example.egtrans: 到11点时，开始大量提供葡萄酒。

example.eg: After they'd all had a drink or two, the conversation began to flow.
example.egtrans: 他们都喝了一两杯之后，谈话开始无拘无束起来。

dsense.name: flow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hang down loosely and often attractively

example.eg: Her long red hair flowed down over her shoulders.
example.egtrans: 她红色的长发飘垂在肩头。

flow.name: flow
flow.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: flow
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the movement of something in one direction

example.eg: the flow of a river
example.egtrans: 河水的流动

example.eg: the flow of traffic
example.egtrans: 车流

example.eg: the flow of blood
example.egtrans: 血液的流动

dsense.name: flow
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a regular and quite large number of something

example.eg: There's been a steady flow of visitors.
example.egtrans: 参观者络绎不绝。

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which something is produced or moved continuously

example.eg: the flow of ideas/information
example.egtrans: 思想的流畅／信息的流动

flush.name: flush
flush.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: When you flush, you become red in the face, especially as a result of strong emotions, heat, or alcohol.

example.eg: She flushed with pleasure as she accepted the prize.
example.egtrans: 她领奖时高兴得红光满面。

example.eg: The champagne had caused his face to flush.
example.egtrans: 香槟使他脸色发红。

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you flush a toilet, or if a toilet flushes, its contents empty and it fills with water again.

example.eg: My children never flush the toilet after them.
example.egtrans: 我的孩子们用过马桶后从来不冲。

example.eg: I can't get the toilet to flush.
example.egtrans: 我无法让马桶冲水。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to get rid of something by putting it in the toilet and operating the toilet

example.eg: I tend to flush old medicines down the toilet.
example.egtrans: 我往往用马桶冲走过期药品。

flush.name: flush
flush.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: at the same level as another surface

example.eg: I want the light fittings to be flush with the ceiling.
example.egtrans: 我想让灯具配件与天花板齐平。

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a lot of money

example.eg: I've just been paid so I'm feeling flush.
example.egtrans: 我刚领了薪水，所以感觉挺有钱的。

flush.name: flush
flush.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a red colour that appears on your face or body because you are embarrassed, hot, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （因尴尬、发热等原因）脸红，皮肤发红

example.eg: A faint pink flush coloured her cheeks.
example.egtrans: 她的双颊泛出淡淡的红晕。

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

phrase.phrase_title: a flush of anger, excitement, pleasure, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a sudden strong feeling of anger, excitement, pleasure, etc.

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when the contents of a toilet empty and it fills with water
the handle or button that you push to make a toilet empty and fill with water
trans_examp.trans_cn: 马桶的冲水把手（或按钮）

example.eg: He pressed the flush with his hand.
example.egtrans: 他用手按下了冲水按钮。

dsense.name: flush
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of playing cards held by one player that are all from the same suit

force.name: force
force.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: force
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: physical, especially violent, strength, or power
trans_examp.trans_cn: 力，力量；力气；（尤指）暴力，武力

example.eg: The force of the wind had brought down a great many trees in the area.
example.egtrans: 强风刮倒了这一地区的许多树木。

example.eg: She slapped his face with unexpected force.
example.egtrans: 她扇了他一耳光，出乎意料地用力。

example.eg: Teachers aren't allowed to use force in the classroom.
example.egtrans: 老师管教学生时禁止使用体罚。

example.eg: The police were able to control the crowd by sheer force of numbers (= because there were more police than there were people in the crowd).
example.egtrans: 警方完全依靠人数上的优势才控制住了人群。

trans_examp.trans_en: in scientific use, (a measure of) the influence that changes movement

example.eg: the force of gravity
example.egtrans: 重力

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in large numbers

example.eg: Photographers were out in force at the White House today.
example.egtrans: 许多摄影师今天出现在王宫。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to work with someone else in order to achieve something that you both want

dsense.name: force
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (a person or thing with a lot of) influence and energy
trans_examp.trans_cn: 影响；活力；影响大的人（或事物）

example.eg: He was a powerful force in politics.
example.egtrans: 他曾是政坛上举足轻重的人物。

example.eg: Fishermen are always at the mercy of the forces of nature (= bad weather conditions).
example.egtrans: 渔夫们总是听天由命。

phrase.phrase_title: a force to be reckoned with

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If an organization or a person is described as a force to be reckoned with, it means that they are powerful and have a lot of influence.

example.eg: The United Nations is now a force to be reckoned with.
example.egtrans: 联合国现在是一个不可小视的组织。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something out of force of habit, you do it without thinking because you have done it so many times before.

dsense.name: force
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people organized and trained, especially for a particular purpose
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指）武装部队，部队；警察部门；（为某目的组织起来的）一群人

example.eg: the security forces
example.egtrans: 安保部队

example.eg: the work force
example.egtrans: 劳动大军

example.eg: He joined the police force right after graduating.
example.egtrans: 他从学校一毕业就当了警察。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the military organizations for air, land, and sea

dsense.name: force
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: (of laws, rules, or systems) existing and being used
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （法律、规定或制度）已生效／开始实施

example.eg: New driving regulations are going to come into force this year.
example.egtrans: 新的驾驶规章今年开始实施。

force.name: force
force.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: force
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something happen or make someone do something difficult, unpleasant, or unusual, especially by threatening or not offering the possibility of choice

example.eg: I really have to force myself to be nice to him.
example.egtrans: 我确实得要强迫自己才能做到对他和颜悦色。

example.eg: You can't force her to make a decision.
example.egtrans: 你不能强迫她作决定。

example.eg: Hospitals are being forced to close departments because of lack of money.
example.egtrans: 由于缺乏资金，医院正被迫关闭部分诊疗科。

example.eg: You could tell he was having to force back the tears (= stop himself from crying).
example.egtrans: 你能看得出他在强忍着泪水。

example.eg: I didn't actually want any more dessert, but Julia forced it on me (= made me accept it).
example.egtrans: 我其实不想再要甜点了，但是朱莉亚硬要我吃。

example.eg: I couldn't stay at their flat - I'd feel as if I was forcing myself on them (= making them allow me to stay).
example.egtrans: 我没法呆在他们的公寓——我会觉得好像是自己在勉强他们留我一样。

example.eg: You never tell me how you're feeling - I have to force it out of you (= make you tell me)!
example.egtrans: 你从不告诉我你的感受——我要逼你说才行！

trans_examp.trans_en: If plants or vegetables are forced, they are made to grow faster by artificially controlling growing conditions such as the amount of heat and light.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 催熟，加速植物生长（通过人为改变植物生长环境，如光热程度等）

example.eg: forced strawberries
example.egtrans: 催熟的草莓

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to manage, with difficulty, to laugh or smile
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 挤出一丝笑容，强颜欢笑

example.eg: I managed to force a smile as they were leaving.
example.egtrans: 他们离开时，我强装笑颜。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to take action to make certain that an urgent problem or matter is dealt with now

example.eg: If the management wouldn't listen to their demands, they would have to force the issue by striking.
example.egtrans: 如果管理层不理会他们的要求，他们就不得不通过罢工来迫使问题得到解决。

dsense.name: force
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use physical strength or effort to make something move or open

example.eg: Move your leg up gently when you're doing this exercise, but don't force it.
example.egtrans: 在做这一动作时把腿轻轻往上抬，但不要用力。

example.eg: If you force the zip, it'll break.
example.egtrans: 如果你使劲拉拉链，会拉坏的。

example.eg: She forced her way through the crowd.
example.egtrans: 她在人群中挤出一条路。

trans_examp.trans_en: to break a lock, door, window, etc. in order to allow someone to get in

example.eg: I forgot my key, so I had to force a window.
example.egtrans: 我忘带钥匙了，只好撬窗进去。

example.eg: The police had forced open the door because nobody had answered.
example.egtrans: 因为没人应门，警察强行将门砸开了。

example.eg: The burglar forced an entry (= broke a window, door, etc. to get into the house).
example.egtrans: 那个窃贼破门而入。

foremost.name: foremost
foremost.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: most important or best; leading
trans_examp.trans_cn: 最重要的；最佳的；领先的

example.eg: This is one of the country's foremost arts centres.
example.egtrans: 这是全国最重要的艺术中心之一。

example.eg: She's one of the foremost experts on child psychology.
example.egtrans: 她是儿童心理学领域最顶尖的专家之一。

form.name: form
form.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to begin to exist or to make something begin to exist

example.eg: A crowd formed around the accident.
example.egtrans: 事故现场围起了一群人。

example.eg: A solution began to form in her mind.
example.egtrans: 她想到了一个解决办法。

example.eg: I formed the impression (= the way she behaved suggested to me) that she didn't really want to come.
example.egtrans: 我形成了一种印象：她其实并不想来。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something into a particular shape

example.eg: She formed the clay into a small bowl.
example.egtrans: 她把陶土捏成了一只小碗。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make or be something

example.eg: The lorries formed a barricade across the road.
example.egtrans: 数辆卡车横在路上，形成了路障。

example.eg: Together they would form the next government.
example.egtrans: 他们将共同组建下届政府。

example.eg: This information formed the basis of the report.
example.egtrans: 这些信息奠定了报告的基础。

trans_examp.trans_en: If separate things form, they come together to make a whole.

example.eg: The children formed into lines.
example.egtrans: 孩子们排好了队。

form.name: form
form.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a paper or set of papers printed with spaces in which answers to questions can be written or information can be recorded in an organized way

example.eg: an application form (= document used for asking officially for something, for example a job)
example.egtrans: 申请表

example.eg: an entry form (= document used to enter a competition)
example.egtrans: 报名表

example.eg: Please fill in/out the form with black ink.
example.egtrans: 请用黑色墨水填写表格。

example.eg: When you have completed the form, hand it in at the desk.
example.egtrans: 填完表格后，请交到这张桌子上来。

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of something

example.eg: Swimming is the best form of exercise.
example.egtrans: 游泳是最佳的锻炼方式。

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the shape or appearance of something

example.eg: I could just about make out his sleeping form on the bed.
example.egtrans: 我只能隐约看出他在床上睡觉时的轮廓。

example.eg: The moon highlighted the shadowy forms of the hills.
example.egtrans: 月光凸显了山峦影影绰绰的轮廓。

example.eg: The lawn was laid out in the form of the figure eight.
example.egtrans: 草坪被设计成了8字形。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to gradually be seen or gradually develop

example.eg: Trees and hedges started to take form as the fog cleared.
example.egtrans: 随着雾气散去，树和篱笆开始渐渐显露。

example.eg: As they chatted, the idea of going skiing together gradually took form.
example.egtrans: 他们聊天时，逐渐形成了一起去度假的想法。

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: A competitor's form is their ability to be successful over a period of time.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （参赛者的）竞技状态，良好状态

example.eg: Both horses have shown good form over the last season.
example.egtrans: 两匹马在上个赛季中都表现出了良好的竞技状态。

example.eg: After a bad year, she has regained her form.
example.egtrans: 经过一年的低迷后，她已恢复了竞技状态。

phrase.phrase_title: be on good, great, etc. form

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be feeling or performing well

example.eg: Paul was on good form at the wedding and kept everyone entertained.
example.egtrans: 保罗在婚礼上情绪极佳，把大家都逗得乐呵呵的。

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one part of a verb or other word that has a special use or meaning

example.eg: The continuous form of "stand" is "standing".
example.egtrans: stand 的进行时形式是 standing。

example.eg: "Stood" is the irregular past tense form of "stand".
example.egtrans: stood 是 stand 的不规则过去形式。

example.eg: "Hers" is the possessive form of "her".
example.egtrans: hers 是 her 的所有格形式。

example.eg: "Isn't" is the short form of "is not".
example.egtrans: isn't 是 is not 的缩略形式。

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the UK, a class of school children or a group of classes of children of a similar age

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: rude behaviour

example.eg: Was that bad form then, leaving so early?
example.egtrans: 那么，这么早离开失礼吗？

dsense.name: form
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin seat, usually without a back

format.name: format
format.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a pattern, plan, or arrangement

example.eg: The meeting will have the usual format - introductory session, group work and then a time for reporting back.
example.egtrans: 这次会议将采取常规模式——情况介绍，分组讨论，然后是反馈汇报。

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which information is arranged and stored on a computer

format.name: format
format.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to organize or arrange text, especially on a computer, according to a chosen pattern
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指在计算机上）安排…的版式

trans_examp.trans_en: to prepare a computer disk for use with a particular type of computer

formula.name: formula
formula.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: formula
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a standard or accepted way of doing or making something

example.eg: We have changed the formula of the washing powder.
example.egtrans: 我们已经更换了洗衣粉的配方。

example.eg: There's no magic formula for success.
example.egtrans: 成功没有窍门儿。

trans_examp.trans_en: a mathematical rule expressed in a set of numbers and letters

example.eg: He developed a formula for calculating the area of a triangle.
example.egtrans: 他发明了计算三角形面积的公式。

dsense.name: formula
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a series of letters and symbols that show what substances make up a particular chemical element or compound

example.eg: We had to learn chemical formulas at school, but I can only remember H2O for water.
example.egtrans: 我们上学时都得学习化学分子式，但是我现在只记得得 H2O 代表的是水。

dsense.name: formula
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of milk that can be given to babies instead of milk from their mother

forward.name: forward
forward.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: forward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: towards the direction that is in front of you

example.eg: She leaned forward to whisper something in my ear.
example.egtrans: 她倾身向前，对我耳语了一番。

dsense.name: forward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: towards the future

example.eg: I always look forward, not back.
example.egtrans: 我总是放眼未来，而不是回首过去。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: after that point

example.eg: From that day forward they never spoke to each other.
example.egtrans: 从那天起，他们彼此再没说过话。

dsense.name: forward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used in expressions related to progress

example.eg: This is a big step forward for democracy.
example.egtrans: 这是向民主迈进的一大步。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used, especially in business, to mean "in the future"

example.eg: This could become a problem going forward.
example.egtrans: 未来这可能成为一个问题。

forward.name: forward
forward.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: forward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: towards the direction that is in front of you

example.eg: forward motion/movement
example.egtrans: 向前的运动

dsense.name: forward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the future

example.eg: forward planning/thinking
example.egtrans: 为未来作的计划／思考

dsense.name: forward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: confident and honest in a way that ignores the usual social rules and might seem rude

example.eg: Do you think it was forward of me to invite her to dinner when we'd only just met?
example.egtrans: 你觉得刚见面我就邀请她吃饭是不是有些鲁莽？

forward.name: forward
forward.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send a letter, etc., especially from someone's old address to their new address, or to send a letter, email, etc. that you have received to someone else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 转寄（信件）；转发（电子邮件）

example.eg: I'll forward any mail to your new address.
example.egtrans: 我会把信件都转寄至你的新地址。

example.eg: I'll forward his email to you if you're interested.
example.egtrans: 如果你感兴趣，我可以把他的电子邮件转发给你。

forward.name: forward
forward.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a player who is in an attacking position in a team

found.name: found
found.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: found
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en:
past simple and past participle of
        
         find

dsense.name: found
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to bring something into existence

example.eg: Boston was founded in 1630 by Puritan colonists from England.
example.egtrans: 波士顿是1630年由来自英格兰的清教徒殖民者兴建的。
