example.eg: She left a large sum of money in her will to found a wildlife sanctuary.
example.egtrans: 她在遗嘱里留下了一大笔钱用来创建野生动物保护区。

example.eg: We are planning a dinner to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the founding of the company.
example.egtrans: 我们正筹划一个晚宴，庆祝公司成立50周年。

dsense.name: found
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to build a support in the ground for a large structure such as a building or road
trans_examp.trans_cn: 为（建筑物或公路）打地基

dsense.name: found
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to base a belief, claim, idea, etc. on something

example.eg: Her lawyer accused the prosecution of founding its case on insufficient evidence.
example.egtrans: 她的律师谴责控方所控证据不足。

example.eg: I'd like to see the research that these recommendations are founded on.
example.egtrans: 我想看看这些建议所依据的研究基础。

example.eg: a society founded on egalitarian principles
example.egtrans: 建立在人人平等原则基础之上的社会

foundation.name: foundation
foundation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: foundation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when an organization, state, etc. is established

example.eg: the foundation of a new state
example.egtrans: 新州的建立

trans_examp.trans_en: an organization that has been created in order to provide money for a particular group of people in need of help or for a particular type of study

example.eg: the British Heart Foundation
example.egtrans: 英国心脏健康基金会

example.eg: the Environmental Research Foundation
example.egtrans: 环境研究基金会

trans_examp.trans_en: the first year of infant school, previously known as reception

example.eg: a foundation class/teacher
example.egtrans: 幼儿学校小班课堂／教师

example.eg: Her youngest child starts (in) foundation in September.
example.egtrans: 她最小的孩子9月份上幼儿学校小班。

dsense.name: foundation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the structures below the surface of the ground that support a building

example.eg: The foundations will have to be reinforced to prevent the house from sinking further into the ground.
example.egtrans: 地基必须进行加固以防房屋继续下陷。

dsense.name: foundation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be untrue

example.eg: These allegations are completely without foundation.
example.egtrans: 这些指控完全没有根据。

dsense.name: foundation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of make-up that is spread over the skin of the face, usually before other make-up is put on, giving it a better and more even colour and hiding unwanted marks

fragment.name: fragment
fragment.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece or a part, especially when broken from something whole
trans_examp.trans_cn: 小片，小块；（尤指）碎片，碎块

example.eg: The road was covered with fragments of glass from the shattered window.
example.egtrans: 公路上到处是车窗的碎玻璃片。

example.eg: Literary scholars are piecing together her last unpublished novel from fragments of a recently discovered manuscript.
example.egtrans: 文学研究者们正在把最近发现的她最后一部未发表小说的手稿残片一点点拼凑起来。

fragment.name: fragment
fragment.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to break something into small parts or to be broken up in this way

example.eg: The satellite will fragment and burn up as it falls through the earth's atmosphere.
example.egtrans: 卫星坠经地球大气层时会碎裂起火，化为灰烬。

example.eg: His day was fragmented by meetings and phone calls.
example.egtrans: 他一天的时间因为各种会议和电话而变得支离破碎。

framework.name: framework
framework.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a supporting structure around which something can be built
a system of rules, ideas, or beliefs that is used to plan or decide something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （规则、观念或信仰的）框架，体系，结构

example.eg: a legal framework for resolving disputes
example.egtrans: 解决争端的法律体系

frustration.name: frustration
frustration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: frustration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling of being annoyed or less confident because you cannot achieve what you want, or something that makes you feel like this
trans_examp.trans_cn: （因不能满足需求而）沮丧；令人沮丧的事物

example.eg: I could sense his frustration at not being able to help.
example.egtrans: 我可以感觉到他因无力帮忙而心感沮丧。

example.eg: This job has more than its fair share of frustrations.
example.egtrans: 做这份工作本不该有如此多的挫折。

dsense.name: frustration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that something prevents plans or efforts from being successful
trans_examp.trans_cn: 阻止计划实现；防碍成就获得

fully.name: fully
fully.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: fully
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely

example.eg: Have you fully recovered from your illness?
example.egtrans: 你完全康复了吗？

example.eg: I fully intended to call you last night.
example.egtrans: 昨天晚上我非常想给你打电话。

example.eg: I'm sorry, the restaurant is fully booked.
example.egtrans: 对不起，餐馆的座位已经预订满了。

example.eg: I fully understand the problem.
example.egtrans: 我对这一问题有完全的了解。

example.eg: a fully qualified teacher
example.egtrans: 完全符合资格的教师

dsense.name: fully
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: as much as possible
trans_examp.trans_cn: 尽可能地；完全地；充分地

example.eg: Kate has always participated fully in the life of the school.
example.egtrans: 凯特一直是彻底地融入到了学校生活中。

example.eg: He cooperated fully with the police.
example.egtrans: 他与警方全力合作。

fully.name: -fully
fully.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that shows the stated quality

example.eg: powerfully
example.egtrans: 强大地

example.eg: tearfully
example.egtrans: 哭泣地

example.eg: truthfully
example.egtrans: 诚实地

functionality.name: functionality
functionality.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any or all of the operations performed by a piece of equipment or a software program

fund.name: fund
fund.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of money saved, collected, or provided for a particular purpose

example.eg: a pension/trust fund
example.egtrans: 养老/信托基金

example.eg: The hospital has set up a special fund to buy new equipment.
example.egtrans: 医院专门设立了一项基金以购买新设备。

example.eg: Contributions are being sought for the disaster fund.
example.egtrans: 正在寻求对救灾基金的捐助。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: money needed or available to spend on something

example.eg: Following the repairs to the roof, church funds are now seriously depleted.
example.egtrans: 在对屋顶进行修缮之后，教堂的资金现在严重吃紧。

example.eg: The president has agreed to allocate further funds to develop the new submarine.
example.egtrans: 总统已经同意再拨一部分资金开发新潜艇。

example.eg: "Can I borrow £50?" "I'm a little short of/low on funds (= I have little money) at the moment".
example.egtrans: 我也想和你一起去度假，但最近我手头有点拮据。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a lot of something

example.eg: She has a fund of knowledge on the subject.
example.egtrans: 她对这一主题知之甚多。

fund.name: fund
fund.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide the money to pay for an event, activity, or organization

example.eg: The company has agreed to fund my trip to Australia.
example.egtrans: 公司同意资助我的澳大利亚之行。

example.eg: The new college is being privately funded (= money for it is not being provided from taxes).
example.egtrans: 这所新大学目前是由私人提供资金的。

fundamental.name: fundamental
fundamental.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: forming the base, from which everything else develops

example.eg: We need to make fundamental changes to the way in which we treat our environment.
example.egtrans: 我们需要从根本上改变对待环境的态度。

example.eg: It's one of the fundamental differences between men and women.
example.egtrans: 这是男女之间的基本差别之一。

example.eg: The school is based on the fundamental principle that all children should reach their full potential.
example.egtrans: 这所学校的基本原则是充分发挥每个孩子的最大潜力。

example.eg: Diversity is of fundamental importance to all ecosystems and all economies.
example.egtrans: 多样性对所有的生态系统和经济结构都极为重要。

trans_examp.trans_en: more important than anything else

example.eg: Some understanding of grammar is fundamental to learning a language.
example.egtrans: 掌握一些语法对学习一种语言来说很重要。

further.name: further
further.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en:
comparative of
        
         far  : to a greater distance or degree, or at a more advanced level
trans_examp.trans_cn: （far 的比较级）更远地，在更大程度上；进一步地

example.eg: I never got further than the first five pages of "Ulysses".
example.egtrans: 恐怕我看《尤利西斯》从未超过开头的5页，之后就看不下去了。

example.eg: We discussed the problem but we didn't get much further in actually solving it.
example.egtrans: 我们讨论了这个问题，但在实际解决方面没有取得多大进展。

example.eg: The whole matter is further complicated by the fact that Amanda and Jo refuse to speak to each other.
example.egtrans: 阿曼达和乔彼此拒绝说话，使得整个事件更加复杂了。

example.eg: Every day she sinks further and further into depression.
example.egtrans: 她一天天地消沉下去。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you go or take something further, you take it to a more advanced stage.

example.eg: Before we go any further with the project, I think we should make sure that there's enough money to fund it.
example.egtrans: 在我们推进这个计划之前，我觉得我们应该核实一下是否有足够的资金来支持。

example.eg: If you wish to take the matter further, you can file charges against him.
example.egtrans: 如果你想采取进一步行动的话，可以对他提出指控。

further.name: further
further.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: at a greater distance

example.eg: It was much further to the town centre than I remembered.
example.egtrans: 去市中心的路比我印象中要长得多。

example.eg: Fourteen miles is further than you'd think once you start to run it.
example.egtrans: 一旦开始跑，14英里的路程会比你想象的要长。

example.eg: Is that her at the further (= other) end of the room?
example.egtrans: 房间另一头的那个人是她吗？

further.name: further
further.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: more or extra

example.eg: Have you anything further to add?
example.egtrans: 你还有什么要补充的吗？

example.eg: If you have any further problems, let me know.
example.egtrans: 如果你还有什么问题，请一定让我知道。

example.eg: It cost me £50 a day and a further £60 for insurance.
example.egtrans: 花费为一天50英镑，再加上60英镑的保险费。

example.eg: This shop will be closed until further notice.
example.egtrans: 本店即将关闭，何时开业另行通知。

example.eg: We need to talk further about this.
example.egtrans: 我们需要就这一点进一步谈谈。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used in business letters to refer to an earlier letter, conversation, meeting, etc.

example.eg: Further to your letter of 11 March, I should like to inform you of a number of recent developments regarding the Saffron Hill site.
example.egtrans: 关于你方3月11日的来信，我们想通告你方关于藏红花山工地最近的一些进展情况。

further.name: further
further.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to develop or make progress in something

example.eg: He has probably done more to further the cause of interracial harmony than any other person.
example.egtrans: 在推进种族和谐方面他可能比其他人做的都要多。

example.eg: Additional training is probably the best way to further your career these days.
example.egtrans: 如今额外的培训可能是推进你事业发展的最佳途径。

furthermore.name: furthermore
furthermore.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in addition; more importantly

example.eg: The house is beautiful. Furthermore, it's in a great location.
example.egtrans: 这座房子很漂亮，而且位置也非常好。

gap.name: gap
gap.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: gap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an empty space or opening in the middle of something or between two things

example.eg: The children squeezed through a gap in the wall.
example.egtrans: 孩子们从墙的一个缺口处硬挤了过去。

example.eg: She has a small gap between her front teeth.
example.egtrans: 她的门牙之间有条细缝。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an opportunity for a product or service that does not already exist

example.eg: There is a gap in the magazine market that needs to be filled.
example.egtrans: 在杂志市场上还有一个空白需要填补。

dsense.name: gap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a difference between two things

example.eg: The gap between rich and poor is still widening (= becoming greater).
example.egtrans: 贫富差距仍在继续拉大。

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of time spent doing something different

example.eg: After a gap of five years, Jennifer decided to go back to work full-time.
example.egtrans: 时隔5年之后，珍妮弗决定回去做全职工作。

gather.name: gather
gather.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: gather
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to collect several things, often from different places or people

example.eg: I went to several libraries to gather information about the plans.
example.egtrans: 我去了数家图书馆去搜集有关这一计划的资料。

example.eg: We gathered blueberries from the bushes.
example.egtrans: 我们从灌木上采摘蓝莓。

example.eg: She gathered up the newspapers that were scattered around the floor.
example.egtrans: 她把散落在地板上的报纸收拾起来。

example.eg: We gathered our things together and left quickly.
example.egtrans: 我们收拾好自己的东西赶快离开了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to put your arms around someone and hold or carry them in a careful or loving way

example.eg: He gathered her in his arms and kissed her.
example.egtrans: 他把她拥入怀中亲吻。

example.eg: She gathered the children up and hurried into the house.
example.egtrans: 她抱起孩子赶快跑进了屋里。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to become faster, stronger, etc.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 加快速度／加大力量／势头增强（等等）

example.eg: The bicycle gathered speed as it went down the hill.
example.egtrans: 下山时自行车速度越来越快。

example.eg: Economic recovery is gathering pace.
example.egtrans: 经济复苏的速度加快了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to prepare to make a great effort to be strong or brave

example.eg: I spent a week gathering the courage to say no.
example.egtrans: 我憋了一星期，终于鼓足勇气说不。

dsense.name: gather
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: When people or animals gather, they come together in a group.

example.eg: A crowd had gathered to hear her speak.
example.egtrans: 一群人围拢过来听她演讲。

example.eg: Gather round, children, and I'll tell you a story.
example.egtrans: 孩子们，到我身边来，我给你们讲个故事。

trans_examp.trans_en: to get thicker and closer

example.eg: Storm clouds were gathering.
example.egtrans: 乌云密布，暴风雨即将来临。

dsense.name: gather
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to understand or believe something as a result of something that has been said or done

example.eg: Harry loves his new job, I gather.
example.egtrans: 我认为哈里很喜欢他的新工作。

example.eg: From what I can gather, they're old school friends.
example.egtrans: 据我推断，他们是过去上学时的朋友。

dsense.name: gather
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pull cloth into small folds by sewing a thread through it and then pulling the thread tight

example.eg: a gathered skirt
example.egtrans: 有褶裥的裙子

trans_examp.trans_en: If you gather a piece of clothing or loose cloth around yourself, you pull it close to your body.

example.eg: She shivered, and gathered the blanket around her.
example.egtrans: 她冻得瑟瑟发抖，便把身上的毯子裹紧了一些。

gather.name: gather
gather.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small fold that has been sewn into cloth

example.eg: a skirt with gathers at the back
example.egtrans: 后部有褶皱的裙子

general.name: general
general.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: general
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: involving or relating to most or all people, things, or places, especially when these are considered as a unit

example.eg: The general feeling is that justice was not served.
example.egtrans: 普遍的看法是这样做没有达成公平合理。

example.eg: There is general concern about rising crime rates.
example.egtrans: 人们普遍对犯罪率上升感到担忧。

example.eg: My general impression of the place was good.
example.egtrans: 我对这个地方总的印象很好。

example.eg: The talk is intended to be of general interest (= of interest to most people).
example.egtrans: 这次商谈是要探讨大家普遍感兴趣的话题。

example.eg: Rain will become more general in the southeast during the afternoon.
example.egtrans: 降雨范围将在下午进一步扩展到东南地区。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: usually, or in most situations
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 一般来说；通常；在一般情况下

example.eg: In general, men are taller than women.
example.egtrans: 一般来说，男人个子比女人高。

example.eg: As a general rule, we don't allow children in the bar.
example.egtrans: 一般情况下，我们不允许儿童进入酒吧。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: considering the whole of someone or something, and not just a particular part of him, her, or it

example.eg: So, apart from the bad ankle, how are you in general?
example.egtrans: 那么，除了踝部的伤病，你身体总的来说怎么样？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be a good thing for the public
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 对大多数人有好处；符合公众利益

example.eg: The government will only say it is not in the general interest to reveal any more information.
example.egtrans: 政府只能说，透露更多的信息有损公众的利益。

dsense.name: general
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not detailed, but including the most basic or necessary information

example.eg: What he said was very general.
example.egtrans: 他说得很笼统。

example.eg: The school aims to give children a general background in a variety of subjects.
example.egtrans: 学校旨在向孩子们概要介绍各种学科的背景知识。

example.eg: I'm not an expert, so I can only speak in general terms on this matter.
example.egtrans: 我不是专家，我只能泛泛地谈这个问题。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: things considered as a unit and without giving attention to details
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 一般事物；大致情况，总体情况

example.eg: His book moves from the general to the particular.
example.egtrans: 他的书先介绍总体情况然后探讨具体问题。

dsense.name: general
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: including a lot of things or subjects and not limited to only one or a few
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一般性的；普通的；非专门的

example.eg: general knowledge
example.egtrans: 常识

trans_examp.trans_en: used as part of the title of a job of someone who is in charge of a whole organization or company
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于头衔中，表示负责整个组织或公司）总管的，首席的，全面负责的

example.eg: the general manager
example.egtrans: 总经理

example.eg: the General Secretary of the UN
example.egtrans: 联合国秘书长

general.name: general
general.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an officer of very high rank, especially in the army

example.eg: He was promoted to the rank of general.
example.egtrans: 他被晋升为将军。

example.eg: General Brown/Roger Brown
example.egtrans: 布朗将军／罗杰·布朗将军

example.eg: Thank you, General.
example.egtrans: 谢谢，将军。

generated.name: generate
generated.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: generate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause something to exist

example.eg: Her latest film has generated a lot of interest/excitement.
example.egtrans: 她最近的一部影片引起了广泛的兴趣／使众多观众很是兴奋。

example.eg: The new development will generate 1,500 new jobs.
example.egtrans: 新开发项目将会创造1500个新的就业岗位。

example.eg: Selling food will increase the club's ability to generate revenue/income.
example.egtrans: 出售食品将会提升俱乐部的创收能力。

dsense.name: generate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to produce energy in a particular form
trans_examp.trans_cn: （以某种形式）产生，发生（能量等）

example.eg: The wind farm may be able to generate enough electricity/power for 2,000 homes.
example.egtrans: 这座风力发电站发的电或许足以供2000个家庭之用。

generator.name: generator
generator.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a machine that produces electrical power

example.eg: The hospital's emergency generators are designed to cope with power cuts.
example.egtrans: 医院的应急发电机是为应对停电而设计的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a machine or device that produces something

example.eg: a random number generator

trans_examp.trans_en: a company or organization that produces something
trans_examp.trans_cn: The two major electricity generators declined to comment. Within the United States, the military is the largest generator of hazardous waste. Tourism is Australia's greatest generator of employment.

example.eg: The two major electricity generators declined to comment.
Within the United States, the military is the largest generator of hazardous waste.
Tourism is Australia's greatest generator of employment.

generic.name: generic
generic.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: shared by, typical of, or relating to a whole group of similar things, rather than to any particular thing

example.eg: The new range of engines all had a generic problem with their fan blades.
example.egtrans: 这一新系列的发动机有一个通病，就是风机叶片有问题。

trans_examp.trans_en: generic drugs or other products do not have a trademark and are sold without the name of the company that produced them
trans_examp.trans_cn: （药物或商品）无专利的，未注册的

generic.name: generic
generic.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a product, especially a drug, that is no longer owned or legally controlled by a particular company
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指药品）无专利的，不受某一厂商控制的

example.eg: The biggest difference between the brand-name drugs and the generics is price.
example.egtrans: 品牌药品和仿制药品之间的最大差别是价格。

get rid of.name: rid
get rid of.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not now have an unwanted or unpleasant task, object, or person

example.eg: I didn't enjoy marking those papers and I was glad to be rid of them.
example.egtrans: 我不喜欢批改那些卷子，所以我很高兴能免去这一麻烦。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to remove or throw away something unwanted

example.eg: That cream got rid of my skin rash.
example.egtrans: 那种药膏治好了我身上的皮疹。

example.eg: I used weedkiller to get rid of the weeds in the garden.
example.egtrans: 我用了除草剂来除去花园里的杂草。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to sell an old or unwanted possession

example.eg: Have you managed to get rid of your old Volvo yet?
example.egtrans: 你处理掉你的旧沃尔沃车了吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to send away someone annoying or to persuade them to leave

example.eg: We got rid of our unwelcome guests by saying we had to go to bed.
example.egtrans: 我们说必须要上床睡觉了，这才把那一帮不受欢迎的客人打发走。

get up.name: get-up
get up.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of clothes, especially strange and unusual ones
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指奇怪少见的一类）衣服，装束

example.eg: He was in some kind of Mafia get-up, with a pinstriped suit and wide tie.
example.egtrans: 他穿着竖条纹西装和宽领带，像是黑手党的装束。

glob.name: glob
glob.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a round mass of a thick liquid or a sticky substance
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一滴，一团（粘或稠的东西）

example.eg: a glob of ketchup/yogurt
example.egtrans: 一滴西红柿酱／酸奶

go ahead.name: go-ahead
go ahead.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when permission is given for someone to start doing something or for an event or activity to happen

example.eg: The government has given the go-ahead for a multi-billion pound road-building project.
example.egtrans: 政府已经批准了一个投资数十亿英镑的道路修建工程。

example.eg: We're ready to start but we're still waiting to get the go-ahead from our head office.
example.egtrans: 我们一切准备就绪，但仍在等着得到总部的许可。

go ahead.name: go-ahead
go ahead.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: enthusiastic about using new products and modern methods of doing things
trans_examp.trans_cn: 进取心的；有开拓精神的

example.eg: We have a flexitime system and crèche facilities and like to think of ourselves as a go-ahead employer.
example.egtrans: 我们公司实行弹性工作时间制，还设有照顾员工子女的日托中心，并将自己定位为一家富于开拓精神的公司。

good.name: good
good.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very satisfactory, enjoyable, pleasant, or interesting
trans_examp.trans_cn: 令人满意的；令人愉快的；合意的；有趣的

example.eg: a good book
example.egtrans: 一本好书

example.eg: Did you have a good time at the party?
example.egtrans: 你在聚会上玩得开心吗？

example.eg: The weather has been really good for the time of year.
example.egtrans: 就这个季节而言，这段时间的天气真是难得的好。

example.eg: I've just had some very good news.
example.egtrans: 我刚得知一些特别令人开心的消息。

example.eg: It's so good to see you after all this time!
example.egtrans: 分开这么长时间，见到你真是高兴！

trans_examp.trans_en: used in greetings

example.eg: good morning/afternoon/evening
example.egtrans: 早上／下午／晚上好

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: healthy or well

example.eg: I didn't go into work because I wasn't feeling too good.
example.egtrans: 我今天没有去上班，因为感觉不太舒服。

example.eg: "How's your mother?" "She's good, thanks."
example.egtrans: “你母亲怎么样？” “她很好，谢谢。”

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used as a general reply when someone greets you
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用作别人向你问候时的回答语）我很好

example.eg: "How are you doing?" "I'm good, thanks."

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: of a high quality or level

example.eg: She speaks very good French.
example.egtrans: 她法语说得很好。

example.eg: I've heard it's a very good school.
example.egtrans: 我听说这是所很好的学校。

example.eg: The apple pie was as good as the one my grandmother used to make.
example.egtrans: 这苹果馅饼就像我奶奶以前做的一样好吃。

example.eg: This restaurant has a good reputation.
example.egtrans: 这家饭店声誉良好。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to express praise

example.eg: Good man! Splendid catch.
example.egtrans: 高手！球接得太绝了。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: successful, or able to do something well
trans_examp.trans_cn: 成功的；能干的；精通的；擅长的

example.eg: Kate's a good cook.
example.egtrans: 凯特厨艺很好。

example.eg: She's very good at geography.
example.egtrans: 她地理学得很好。

example.eg: They have a good relationship.
example.egtrans: 他们关系很好。

example.eg: She's very good with children.
example.egtrans: 她很会照看孩子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be of low quality or not useful

example.eg: Shoes are no good if they let in water.
example.egtrans: 鞋子如果透水的话就太差了。

example.eg: Food aid isn't much good until the fighting stops.
example.egtrans: 在战斗停止之前，食物援助是没有太大用处的。

phrase.phrase_title: get off to a good start

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to begin an activity successfully
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 有好的开端；开门红；顺利开始

example.eg: I didn't get off to a very good start this morning - I'd been at work five minutes and my computer stopped working!
example.egtrans: 我今天上午刚一开始工作就不顺——才做了5分钟，电脑就死机了！

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: kind or helpful
trans_examp.trans_cn: 好心的，心地善良的；乐于助人的

example.eg: a good friend
example.egtrans: 一个好朋友

example.eg: It's good of you to offer to help.
example.egtrans: 你主动提供帮助真是太好了。

example.eg: He's very good to his mother.
example.egtrans: 他对他妈妈很孝顺体贴。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to make a polite request

example.eg: Be so good as to close the door when you leave.
example.egtrans: 你离开时请把门关上。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do something kind that helps someone else

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: morally right or based on religious principles
trans_examp.trans_cn: 高尚的；虔诚的；好心的；助人为乐的

example.eg: She led a good life.
example.egtrans: 她一生虔诚向善。

example.eg: Try to set a good example to the children.
example.egtrans: 要努力给孩子们做个好榜样。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a positive or useful effect, especially on the health
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指在健康方面）有益的，有好处的，有用的

example.eg: Make sure you eat plenty of good fresh food.
example.egtrans: 一定要吃大量有益健康的新鲜食物。

example.eg: Too much sugar in your diet isn't good for you.
example.egtrans: 饮食中含糖量过高对你的身体没有好处。

example.eg: It's good for old people to stay active if they can.
example.egtrans: 尽量保持身心活跃对老年人是有益的。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A good child or animal behaves well.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （儿童）乖的，守规矩的，不调皮的；（动物）温顺的

example.eg: If you're a good boy at the doctor's, I'll take you swimming afterwards.
example.egtrans: 看医生的时候你要是听话，看完病我就带你去游泳。

trans_examp.trans_en: able to be trusted
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可信赖的；有信誉的；有信用的

example.eg: Her credit is good (= she can be trusted to pay her debts).
example.egtrans: 她信誉很好。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: suitable, convenient, or satisfactory
trans_examp.trans_cn: 合适的；方便的；令人满意的

example.eg: When would be a good time to phone?
example.egtrans: 什么时间打电话合适呢？

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize the large number, amount, or level of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 相当大的；相当多的；相当可观的

example.eg: We've walked a good distance today.
example.egtrans: 今天我们走了好长一段路。

example.eg: There was a good-sized crowd at the airport waiting for the plane to land.
example.egtrans: 机场里有很多人在等候飞机降落。

example.eg: Not all of his movies have been successful - there were a good few (= several) failures in the early years.
example.egtrans: 他拍的电影并非都是成功的——刚入道时他经历了好多次失败。

example.eg: You'll need a good length of rope to secure this properly.
example.egtrans: 你需要很长一段绳子来绑结实。

example.eg: You have a good cry and you'll feel better after.
example.egtrans: 痛痛快快哭一场吧，哭过之后感觉就会好很多。

example.eg: There's a good chance the operation will be successful.
example.egtrans: 手术成功的可能性很大。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: much

example.eg: The new law met with a good deal of opposition at the local level.
example.egtrans: 新法律在地方上遭到强烈反对。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: more than

example.eg: It's a good half hour's walk to the station from here.
example.egtrans: 从这儿步行到车站足需半个多小时。

example.eg: The police said a good 20 kilos of explosive were found during the raid.
example.egtrans: 警察说在突击搜查行动中发现了20多公斤的炸药。

example.eg: Driving through the deserted town we saw a good many (= a lot of) burned-out houses.
example.egtrans: 从被遗弃的城镇中开车驶过时，我们看到很多烧毁的房屋。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: said when you are satisfied or pleased about something, or to show agreement with a decision

example.eg: Oh good, he's arrived at last.
example.egtrans: 好，他总算来了。

example.eg: Good, I'll tell her it's all arranged, then.
example.egtrans: 好，那我就跟她说，一切已安排妥当。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to tell someone that you have everything that you need
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用来告诉别人你需要的东西都齐了）都有了，不必了

example.eg: "More coffee?" "No, I'm good, thanks."
example.egtrans: “再来点咖啡？“”不用了，我够了，谢谢！“

good.name: good
good.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: things for sale, or the things that you own

example.eg: There is a 25 percent discount on all electrical goods until the end of the week.
example.egtrans: 周末前所有电器商品全部七五折销售。

example.eg: The house insurance will not cover your personal goods.
example.egtrans: 这份房屋保险的承保范围不包括你的私人动产。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: things, but not people, that are transported by railway or road

example.eg: a goods train
example.egtrans: 货运列车

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is an advantage or help to a person or situation

example.eg: Even a small donation can do a lot of good.
example.egtrans: 即使一小笔捐助也可以帮上大忙。

example.eg: I'm telling you for your own good.
example.egtrans: 我告诉你这些是为了你好。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of being healthy or in a satisfactory condition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 健康，健全；美满；好处，益处

example.eg: You should stop smoking for your own good (= for your health).
example.egtrans: 你应该为了自身健康而戒烟。

example.eg: He goes running every day for the good of his health.
example.egtrans: 他每天都跑步健身。

example.eg: Modernizing historic buildings can often do more harm than good.
example.egtrans: 对有历史意义的建筑物进行现代化改造常常是弊大于利。

example.eg: The decision has been postponed for the good of all concerned.
example.egtrans: 为了所有相关人士的利益考虑，这次集会被取消。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to improve someone's health or life
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 有利（某人）的健康；对（某人）有好处；对（某人）有益处

example.eg: You can't work all the time - it does you good to go out and enjoy yourself sometimes.
example.egtrans: 你不能老是工作——有时也得出去享乐一下，这对你有好处。

example.eg: Take the medicine - it will do you (a power/world of) good (= improve your health a lot).
example.egtrans: 把药吃了——这对你身体（大）有好处。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: that which is morally right
trans_examp.trans_cn: 善；符合道德的行为；正直的行为

example.eg: There is an eternal struggle between good (= the force that produces morally right action) and evil.
example.egtrans: 善恶之争永不停息。

example.eg: Ambition can sometimes be a force for good.
example.egtrans: 雄心有时也可以成为行善的驱动力。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: all the people who are morally good
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 有道德的人；高尚的人；好人

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for ever

example.eg: She's gone and this time it's for good.
example.egtrans: 她走了，这一次是永不回头了。

goodies.name: goody
goodies.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: goody
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an object that people want or enjoy, often something nice to eat
trans_examp.trans_cn: 吸引人的东西；合意的东西；（常指）好吃的东西

example.eg: All the children were given a bag of goodies - mostly sweets and toys.
example.egtrans: 所有的孩子都得到一包好东西——主要是糖果和玩具。

dsense.name: goody
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone, especially in a film or story, who is good
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指电影或故事中的）好人，正面人物

example.eg: It's one of those films where you don't know until the last moment who are the goodies and who are the baddies.
example.egtrans: 这部电影属于那种你得看到最后才知道谁是好人谁是坏蛋的片子。

goodies.name: goody
goodies.posTip: A word or phrase that you say loudly or suddenly to express strong feelings.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to show pleasure

example.eg: Oh goody! Chocolate cake.
example.egtrans: 嘿，太好了！巧克力蛋糕。

goods.name: good
goods.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very satisfactory, enjoyable, pleasant, or interesting
trans_examp.trans_cn: 令人满意的；令人愉快的；合意的；有趣的

example.eg: a good book
example.egtrans: 一本好书

example.eg: Did you have a good time at the party?
example.egtrans: 你在聚会上玩得开心吗？

example.eg: The weather has been really good for the time of year.
example.egtrans: 就这个季节而言，这段时间的天气真是难得的好。

example.eg: I've just had some very good news.
example.egtrans: 我刚得知一些特别令人开心的消息。

example.eg: It's so good to see you after all this time!
example.egtrans: 分开这么长时间，见到你真是高兴！

trans_examp.trans_en: used in greetings

example.eg: good morning/afternoon/evening
example.egtrans: 早上／下午／晚上好

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: healthy or well

example.eg: I didn't go into work because I wasn't feeling too good.
example.egtrans: 我今天没有去上班，因为感觉不太舒服。

example.eg: "How's your mother?" "She's good, thanks."
example.egtrans: “你母亲怎么样？” “她很好，谢谢。”

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used as a general reply when someone greets you
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用作别人向你问候时的回答语）我很好

example.eg: "How are you doing?" "I'm good, thanks."

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: of a high quality or level

example.eg: She speaks very good French.
example.egtrans: 她法语说得很好。

example.eg: I've heard it's a very good school.
example.egtrans: 我听说这是所很好的学校。

example.eg: The apple pie was as good as the one my grandmother used to make.
example.egtrans: 这苹果馅饼就像我奶奶以前做的一样好吃。

example.eg: This restaurant has a good reputation.
example.egtrans: 这家饭店声誉良好。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to express praise

example.eg: Good man! Splendid catch.
example.egtrans: 高手！球接得太绝了。

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: successful, or able to do something well
trans_examp.trans_cn: 成功的；能干的；精通的；擅长的

example.eg: Kate's a good cook.
example.egtrans: 凯特厨艺很好。

example.eg: She's very good at geography.
example.egtrans: 她地理学得很好。

example.eg: They have a good relationship.
example.egtrans: 他们关系很好。

example.eg: She's very good with children.
example.egtrans: 她很会照看孩子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be of low quality or not useful

example.eg: Shoes are no good if they let in water.
example.egtrans: 鞋子如果透水的话就太差了。

example.eg: Food aid isn't much good until the fighting stops.
example.egtrans: 在战斗停止之前，食物援助是没有太大用处的。

phrase.phrase_title: get off to a good start

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to begin an activity successfully
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 有好的开端；开门红；顺利开始

example.eg: I didn't get off to a very good start this morning - I'd been at work five minutes and my computer stopped working!
example.egtrans: 我今天上午刚一开始工作就不顺——才做了5分钟，电脑就死机了！

dsense.name: good
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: kind or helpful
trans_examp.trans_cn: 好心的，心地善良的；乐于助人的

example.eg: a good friend
example.egtrans: 一个好朋友

example.eg: It's good of you to offer to help.
example.egtrans: 你主动提供帮助真是太好了。

example.eg: He's very good to his mother.
example.egtrans: 他对他妈妈很孝顺体贴。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to make a polite request

example.eg: Be so good as to close the door when you leave.
example.egtrans: 你离开时请把门关上。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do something kind that helps someone else

gotcha.name: gotcha
gotcha.posTip: A word or phrase that you say loudly or suddenly to express strong feelings.

trans_examp.trans_en: said to mean "I have got you" in order to surprise or frighten someone you have caught, or to show that you have an advantage over them
trans_examp.trans_cn: （为了吓唬人或表示占了上风时的用语）抓住你了，逮住你了，赢了你了

grace.name: grace
grace.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quality of moving in a smooth, relaxed, and attractive way

example.eg: Joanna has natural grace and elegance.
example.egtrans: 乔安娜举止自然优雅。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality of being pleasantly polite, or a willingness to be fair and honest

example.eg: They accepted their defeat with good grace.
example.egtrans: 他们很有风度地认输了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: ways of behaving that are considered polite and pleasant

example.eg: Ken is sadly lacking in social graces.
example.egtrans: 糟糕的是，肯在社交场合很没有风度。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: approval or kindness, especially (in the Christian religion) that is freely given by God to all humans
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指上帝赐予人类的）恩典，恩宠

example.eg: Betty believed that it was through divine grace that her husband had recovered from his illness.
example.egtrans: 贝蒂认为全靠上天开恩她的丈夫才得以痊愈。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: through the kindness or help of God
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 承蒙上帝的恩典，上帝开恩

example.eg: By the grace of God, the pilot managed to land the damaged plane safely.
example.egtrans: 蒙上帝开恩，飞行员成功地将受损的飞机安全降落。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a prayer said by Christians before a meal to thank God for the food

example.eg: The children always say grace at dinnertime.
example.egtrans: 孩子们在用餐前总是要做感恩祷告。

dsense.name: grace
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of time left or allowed before something happens or before something must be done

example.eg: The exams have been postponed, so the students have a few days' grace before they start.
example.egtrans: 考试推迟了，所以学生们得以晚几天进考场。

grace.name: grace
grace.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be in a place, on a thing etc. and make it look more attractive

example.eg: Her face has graced the covers of magazines across the world.
example.egtrans: 她的面孔出现在全世界各种杂志的封面上，使之赫然生辉。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to honour people by taking part in something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 光临…而使之蓬筚生辉；莅临而为（某人）增光

example.eg: We are delighted that the mayor will be gracing us with his presence at our annual dinner.
example.egtrans: 市长将光临我们每年一度的宴会，我们感到万分荣幸。

example.eg: So you've finally decided to grace us with your presence, have you? (= You are late.)
example.egtrans: 你看，你终于肯光临寒舍了，大驾难起啊，是吗？（幽默地表示“你迟到了”这个意思）

grace.name: Grace
grace.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to address or refer to a duke, duchess or archbishop
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 大人，阁下，夫人（对公爵、公爵夫人、女公爵或大主教的尊称）

gradually.name: gradually
gradually.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: slowly over a period of time or a distance

example.eg: Gradually, she realized that he wasn't telling her the truth.
example.egtrans: 她渐渐地意识到他不跟她说实话。

example.eg: The bank slopes gradually down to the river.
example.egtrans: 河岸平缓地向下一直延伸到水边。

grant.name: grant
grant.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of money given especially by the government to a person or organization for a special purpose
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指政府为特殊目的给予个人或组织的）拨款，补助金

example.eg: a student/research grant
example.egtrans: 助学金／研究拨款

example.eg: a local authority/government grant
example.egtrans: 当地行政机构／政府拨款

example.eg: They gave/awarded her a grant to study abroad for one year.
example.egtrans: 他们给／授予她一笔奖学金供她出国留学1年。

grant.name: grant
grant.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: grant
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give or allow someone something, usually in an official way

example.eg: They granted her an entry visa.
example.egtrans: 他们发给她入境签证。

example.eg: He was granted asylum.
example.egtrans: 他的避难请求被接受了。

example.eg: She granted their request/wish.
example.egtrans: 她答应了他们的请求／满足了他们的愿望。

dsense.name: grant
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to accept that something is true, often before expressing an opposite opinion
trans_examp.trans_cn: （常指在表达相反的意见之前表示让步）承认，同意

example.eg: I grant that it must have been upsetting but even so I think she overreacted.
example.egtrans: 我承认这事肯定很让人心烦，但即使是这样，我觉得她也有点小题大做。

example.eg: I grant you (= it is true that), it's a difficult situation but I feel sure he could have handled it more sensitively.
example.egtrans: 不错，这种局面是很棘手，但是我确实觉得他本可以更加理智地来处理。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to believe something to be the truth without even thinking about it

example.eg: I didn't realize that Melanie hadn't been to college - I suppose I just took it for granted.
example.egtrans: 我不知道梅拉妮没上大学——我只是想当然地认为她上过了。

phrase.phrase_title: take sth or sb for granted

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you take situations or people for granted, you do not realize or show that you are grateful for how much you get from them.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 视…为理所当然（而不去表示感激）；（认为理所当然而）不去重视…

example.eg: One of the problems with relationships is that after a while you just take each other for granted.
example.egtrans: 恋爱中会遇到的一个问题是，相处一段时间后，双方就都把对方为自己所做的一切当成理所当然。

greatly.name: greatly
greatly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very much, used especially to show how much you feel or experience something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤用于表示强烈感受或体验）非常，很，大大地

example.eg: I greatly regret not having told the truth.
example.egtrans: 我非常后悔没有说出实情。

example.eg: Her piano playing has greatly improved/has improved greatly.
example.egtrans: 她的钢琴弹奏大有进步。

grid.name: grid
grid.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: grid
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a pattern or structure made from horizontal and vertical lines crossing each other to form squares

example.eg: A metal grid had been placed over the hole to prevent people from falling in.
example.egtrans: 在洞口铺了一个铁格栅，以免有人跌入。

example.eg: In Barcelona the streets are laid out in/on a grid system.
example.egtrans: 巴塞罗那的街道是棋盘式的布局。

dsense.name: grid
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a system of wires through which electricity is connected to different power stations across a region

example.eg: the national grid
example.egtrans: 全国输电网

dsense.name: grid
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a pattern of squares with numbers or letters used to find places on a map

dsense.name: grid
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a pattern of lines marking the start of the track in motor racing (= a sport of racing very fast and powerful cars around a track)

example.eg: In all, 26 drivers will be on the starting grid tomorrow.
example.egtrans: 明天总共有 26 名车手将在起跑线上。

guarantee.name: guarantee
guarantee.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a promise that something will be done or will happen, especially a written promise by a company to repair or change a product that develops a fault within a particular period of time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 保证；（尤指公司保证对产品保修或包退的）保修单，包换单

example.eg: The system costs £99.95 including shipping and handling and a twelve-month guarantee.
example.egtrans: 包括邮资、包装费用，该系统价格共计99.95英镑，保用12个月。

example.eg: The TV comes with/has a two-year guarantee.
example.egtrans: 这台电视机保修期为两年。

example.eg: a money-back guarantee
example.egtrans: 退款保证

example.eg: The United Nations has demanded a guarantee from the army that food convoys will not be attacked.
example.egtrans: 联合国要求这支军队保证不攻击护送粮食的车队。

example.eg: There is no guarantee (that) the discussions will lead to a deal.
example.egtrans: 商谈不一定能达成任何协议。

example.eg: A product as good as that is a guarantee of commercial success (= it is certain to be successful).
example.egtrans: 那样好的产品质量就是成功获利的保证。

example.eg: The shop said they would replace the television since it was still under guarantee.
example.egtrans: 商店说会给我们退换那台电视机，因为它还没有过包退期。

trans_examp.trans_en: a formal agreement to take responsibility for something, such as the payment of someone else's debt
something valuable that you give to someone temporarily while you do what you promised to do for them, and that they will keep if you fail to do it

guarantee.name: guarantee
guarantee.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: guarantee
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a product is guaranteed, the company that made it promises to repair or change it if a fault develops within a particular period of time.

example.eg: The fridge is guaranteed for three years.
example.egtrans: 这台冰箱保修期是3年。

trans_examp.trans_en: to promise that something will happen or exist

example.eg: European Airlines guarantees its customers top-quality service.
example.egtrans: 欧洲航空公司保证为乘客提供最好的服务。

example.eg: The label on this bread says it is guaranteed free of/from preservatives (= it contains no preservatives).
example.egtrans: 这种面包的标签上写着保证不含防腐剂。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you guarantee someone's debt, you formally promise to accept the responsibility for that debt if the person fails to pay it.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 为…作保；担保；承诺对…负法律责任

dsense.name: guarantee
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something guarantees something else, it makes certain that it will happen.

example.eg: The £50 deposit guarantees (that) people return the boats after their hour has finished.
example.egtrans: 50英镑的押金会确保人们在划完船后将船归还。

trans_examp.trans_en: If something is guaranteed to happen or have a particular result, it is certain that it will happen or have that result.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 肯定…必然发生；肯定会有某种结果

example.eg: Just looking at a picture of the sea is guaranteed to make me feel sick.
example.egtrans: 哪怕是看一眼大海的图片，我都会有晕船的感觉。

guard.name: guard
guard.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: guard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person or group of people whose job is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack, or to prevent a person such as a criminal from escaping

example.eg: prison guards
example.egtrans: 狱警

example.eg: security guards
example.egtrans: 保安

example.eg: There are guards posted (= standing and watching) at every entrance.
example.egtrans: 每个入口处都设了卫兵。

example.eg: Armed guards are posted around the site.
example.egtrans: 现场周围布设了武装警卫。

example.eg: The frontier is patrolled by border guards.
example.egtrans: 边境警卫队沿国境巡逻。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be kept in a place by a group of people who have weapons
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 处于武装人员的保护（或守卫）之下

example.eg: The ex-president was under armed guard in the palace.
example.egtrans: 前总统在宫中处于武装警卫的保护之下。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be responsible for protecting someone or something, or for preventing someone from escaping

example.eg: Two of the soldiers kept guard over the captured guns.
example.egtrans: 两名士兵看守着缴获的枪支。

example.eg: Armed police stand guard outside the house.
example.egtrans: 武装警察在房外守卫。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a ceremony held outside Buckingham Palace in London, where one set of soldiers replaces the soldiers who have finished their time on duty standing outside the palace
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 白金汉宫皇家卫队换岗（仪式）

dsense.name: guard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a railway official who travels on and is responsible for a train

dsense.name: guard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a device that protects a dangerous part of something or that protects something from getting damaged
trans_examp.trans_cn: 保护装置；保护用品；保护器

example.eg: a fire guard
example.egtrans: 火灾防护装置

example.eg: a trigger guard
example.egtrans: （锁定）枪（扳机）的保险

example.eg: The helmet has a face guard attached.
example.egtrans: 这个头盔带有一个防护面罩。

guard.name: guard
guard.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: guard
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to protect someone or something from being attacked or stolen

example.eg: Soldiers guard the main doors of the embassy.
example.egtrans: 大使馆的主要门口都有士兵把守。

trans_examp.trans_en: to watch someone and make certain they do not escape from a place

example.eg: Five prison officers guarded the prisoners.
example.egtrans: 5名狱警看守着犯人。

dsense.name: guard
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep information secret

example.eg: Journalists jealously (= carefully) guard their sources of information.
example.egtrans: 记者们非常小心，对消息来源守口如瓶。

guard.name: the Guard
guard.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
informal for 
        
         the National Guard
trans_examp.trans_cn: 国民警卫队（the National Guard的非正式说法）

guideline.name: guideline
guideline.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: information intended to advise people on how something should be done or what something should be
trans_examp.trans_cn: 指导方针，指导原则，准则

example.eg: The EU has issued guidelines on appropriate levels of pay for part-time manual workers.
example.egtrans: 欧盟已经颁布了有关兼职体力劳动者适宜的酬劳标准。

hammer.name: hammer
hammer.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a tool consisting of a piece of metal with a flat end that is fixed onto the end of a long, thin, usually wooden handle, used for hitting things

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a heavy metal ball attached to a chain that is thrown as part of a sports event

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the event or sport in which a hammer is thrown as far as possible

example.eg: She qualified for the women's hammer final.
example.egtrans: 她进入了女子链球的决赛。

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the part of a gun that hits another part when you pull the trigger to send out the bullet

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the parts of a piano that hits the strings to make a sound

hammer.name: hammer
hammer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hit something with a hammer

example.eg: Can you hold this nail in position while I hammer it into the door?
example.egtrans: 你能捏住这颗钉子，好让我把它钉进门里吗？

example.eg: I could hear you hammering upstairs.
example.egtrans: 我能听见你在楼上敲打的声音。

example.eg: My car's got a dent, and I was hoping they'd be able to hammer it out (= remove it by hammering).
example.egtrans: 我的车上有一处凹痕，我希望他们能把它敲平。

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hit or kick something with a lot of force

example.eg: I was woken up suddenly by the sound of someone hammering on/at the front door.
example.egtrans: 有人重重地捶前门，把我惊醒了。

example.eg: He hammered the ball into the net, giving France a 3–2 win over Italy.
example.egtrans: 他将球劲射入网，使法国队以3比2战胜了意大利队。

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to defeat someone completely in a game or a fight
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在比赛或战斗中）彻底击败，击垮

example.eg: We were hammered in both games.
example.egtrans: 我们两场比赛都被击败了。

dsense.name: hammer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to criticize someone or something strongly

example.eg: Her latest film has been hammered by the critics.
example.egtrans: 她最新拍摄的电影遭到评论家们的猛烈批评。

handbook.name: handbook
handbook.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a book that contains instructions or advice about how to do something or the most important and useful information about a subject

example.eg: The student handbook gives details of all courses.
example.egtrans: 学生手册中有所有课程的详细介绍。

handful.name: handful
handful.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: handful
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of something that can be held in one hand

example.eg: He pulled out a handful of coins from his pocket.
example.egtrans: 他从口袋里掏出一把硬币。

dsense.name: handful
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small number of people or things

example.eg: She invited all her friends to her party, but only a handful of them turned up.
example.egtrans: 她请了很多朋友参加她的聚会，但只有少数几个到场。

dsense.name: handful
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person, often a child, who is difficult to control

example.eg: Her older son is fine but the little one is a bit of a handful.
example.egtrans: 她的大儿子很好，但小儿子有点难管。

handle.name: handle
handle.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: handle
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of an object designed for holding, moving, or carrying the object easily

example.eg: a door handle
example.egtrans: 门把手

example.eg: the handle on a suitcase
example.egtrans: 手提箱的提手

example.eg: I can't pick the kettle up - the handle's too hot.
example.egtrans: 我没法拿起茶壶，壶柄太烫了。

example.eg: She turned the handle and slowly opened the door.
example.egtrans: 她转动把手，慢慢地打开门。

dsense.name: handle
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a name of a person or place, especially a strange one

example.eg: That's some handle to go through life with!
example.egtrans: 一辈子取那样一个名字也够奇怪的！

handle.name: handle
handle.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: handle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to deal with, have responsibility for, or be in charge of

example.eg: I thought he handled the situation very well.
example.egtrans: 我认为他把局面处理得非常好。

example.eg: Some people are brilliant with computers, but have no idea how to handle (= behave with) other people.
example.egtrans: 有些人在计算机方面很出色，却不会与人打交道。

example.eg: If you can't handle the job I'll get someone else to do it.
example.egtrans: 如果你干不了这项工作，我会让别人来做。

example.eg: Who handles the marketing in your company?
example.egtrans: 你们公司谁负责市场营销？

dsense.name: handle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pick something up and touch, hold, or move it with your hands

example.eg: Always wash your hands before handling food.
example.egtrans: 拿食物之前一定要洗手。

example.eg: Please don't handle the vases - they're very fragile.
example.egtrans: 请不要触碰花瓶，它们极易破碎。

dsense.name: handle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to operate or control something that could be difficult or dangerous
trans_examp.trans_cn: 操作，控制（困难或危险的事物）

example.eg: Have you ever handled a gun before?
example.egtrans: 你以前打过枪吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: If a car handles well, it is easy and pleasant to drive.

dsense.name: handle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to buy and sell goods

example.eg: We only handle cosmetics that have not been tested on animals.
example.egtrans: 我们只经营未在动物身上做过试验的化妆品。

example.eg: He's been arrested for handling stolen goods.
example.egtrans: 他因倒卖赃物被捕。

handler.name: handler
handler.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: handler
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who trains and is in charge of animals, especially dogs

example.eg: police dog handlers
example.egtrans: 警犬训练员

dsense.name: handler
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who advises someone important

example.eg: The president's handlers are telling him to pull out of the talks.
example.egtrans: 总统的顾问建议他退出会谈。

dsense.name: handler
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who carries or moves things as part of their job

example.eg: airport baggage handlers
example.egtrans: 机场行李搬运工

handy.name: handy
handy.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: handy
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: useful or convenient

example.eg: a handy container/tool
example.egtrans: 实用的容器／工具

example.eg: First-time visitors to France will find this guide particularly handy.
example.egtrans: 初次来法国的游览者会发现这本旅游指南很有用。

example.eg: It's a nice house and it's handy for (= near) the train station.
example.egtrans: 这座房子很漂亮，离车站也很近。

example.eg: Don't throw those bottles away - they'll come in handy (= be useful) for the picnic next Sunday.
example.egtrans: 别把那些瓶子扔掉——下周日出去野餐会派上用场。

dsense.name: handy
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to use something skilfully

example.eg: Jonathan's good at putting up wallpaper, but he's not so handy with a paintbrush.
example.egtrans: 乔纳森贴壁纸很在行，但拿起漆刷来就不那么得心应手了。

example.eg: Susannah's very handy (= good at doing things that need skilled use of the hands) about the house.
example.egtrans: 苏珊娜非常善于打理房子。

happen.name: happen
happen.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: happen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a situation or an event) to have existence or come into existence

example.eg: No one knows exactly what happened but several people have been hurt.
example.egtrans: 没人确切了解发生了什么事，只知道有数人受伤。

example.eg: Anything could happen in the next half hour.
example.egtrans: 接下来的半小时内什么事都可能会发生。

example.eg: A funny thing happened in the office today.
example.egtrans: 今天，办公室里发生了一件有趣的事。

example.eg: I don't want to think about what might have happened if he'd been driving any faster.
example.egtrans: 我不愿意去想假如他再开快些会怎么样。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something happens to someone or something, it has an effect on him, her, or it.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 发生在（某人）身上；作用于…

example.eg: I don't know what I'd do if anything happened to him (= if he was hurt, became ill, or died).
example.egtrans: 我不知道一旦他出了事我该怎么办。

example.eg: What happened to your jacket? There's a big rip in the sleeve.
example.egtrans: 你的夹克怎么了？袖子上撕了一条大口子。

example.eg: What's happened to my pen? (= Where is it?) I put it down there a few moments ago.
example.egtrans: 我的钢笔哪儿去了？我刚刚把它放在那儿。

dsense.name: happen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to do or be by chance

example.eg: They happened to look (= looked by chance) in the right place almost immediately.
example.egtrans: 他们碰巧几乎一下就找对了地方。

example.eg: Fortunately it happened (that) there was no one in the house at the time of the explosion.
example.egtrans: 幸运的是，爆炸发生时，屋子里没有人。

example.eg: It just so happens that I have her phone number right here.
example.egtrans: 非常凑巧，我正好有她的电话号码。

example.eg: She happens to like cleaning (= she likes cleaning, although that is surprising).
example.egtrans: 她恰恰就喜欢打扫卫生。

example.eg: I happen to think he's right (= I do think so, although you do not).
example.egtrans: 我真的认为他是对的。

example.eg: As it happened (= although it was not planned), I had a few minutes to spare.
example.egtrans: 我碰巧有几分钟空闲。

happen.name: happen
happen.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: perhaps

example.eg: Happen it'll rain later on.
example.egtrans: 过一会儿可能会下雨。

harness.name: harness
harness.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of equipment with straps and belts, used to control or hold in place a person, animal, or object

example.eg: a safety harness
example.egtrans: 安全带

example.eg: a baby harness
example.egtrans: 婴儿学步用的系带

example.eg: a parachute harness
example.egtrans: 降落伞吊带

harness.name: harness
harness.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a harness on a horse, or to connect a horse to a vehicle using a harness
to control something, usually in order to use its power

example.eg: There is a great deal of interest in harnessing wind and waves as new sources of power.
example.egtrans: 人们对开发利用风和波浪这些新能源非常感兴趣。

hassle.name: hassle
hassle.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (a situation causing) difficulty or trouble

example.eg: I can't face the hassle of moving again.
example.egtrans: 我受不了再搬一次家这个麻烦。

example.eg: My boss has been giving me a lot of hassle this week.
example.egtrans: 这星期老板给我找了很多麻烦事。

example.eg: It's one of the few bars that women can go to and not get any hassle from men.
example.egtrans: 那是女性可以去的为数不多的几个酒吧之一，在那里女性不会受到男人的任何烦扰。

example.eg: It was such a hassle trying to get my bank account changed that I nearly gave up.
example.egtrans: 更换银行账号真是麻烦，我差点都想放弃了。

example.eg: I should have taken it back to the shop but I just didn't think it was worth (all) the hassle.
example.egtrans: 我应该把它退回商店，但我认为不值得这么麻烦。

hassle.name: hassle
hassle.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to annoy someone, especially by repeatedly asking them something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 烦扰（尤指通过反复提问）

example.eg: I'll do it in my own time - just stop hassling me!
example.egtrans: 我会自己安排时间做的——别烦我了！

example.eg: The children keep hassling me to take them to Disneyland.
example.egtrans: 孩子们不断地烦我，要我带他们去迪斯尼乐园。

heads up.name: heads-up
heads up.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a warning that something is going to happen, usually so that you can prepare for it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 小心，注意（用于提醒某事要发生）

example.eg: This note is just to give you a heads-up that Vicky will be arriving next week.
example.egtrans: 这张便条只是提醒一下你维基下星期要来。

trans_examp.trans_en: a short talk or statement about how a situation or plan is developing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有关形势（或计划）发展状况的讲话（或声明）

example.eg: The boss called a meeting to give us a heads-up on the way the project was going.
example.egtrans: 老板召集会议通报计划进行的情况。

helper.name: helper
helper.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who helps with an activity

example.eg: The teachers make great use of volunteer helpers.
example.egtrans: 教师们充分利用志愿者做帮手。

heuristics.name: heuristics
heuristics.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of solving problems by discovering things yourself and learning from your own experiences

hex.name: hex
hex.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an evil spell, bringing bad luck and trouble

example.eg: Someone's put a hex on my computer this morning - it keeps crashing.
example.egtrans: 今天早上我的计算机大概被人施魔法了——不停地死机。

hide.name: hide
hide.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put something or someone in a place where that thing or person cannot be seen or found, or to put yourself somewhere where you cannot be seen or found

example.eg: She used to hide her diary under her pillow.
example.egtrans: 她过去常把自己的日记藏在枕头下。

example.eg: A kilo of heroin was found hidden inside the lining of the suitcase.
example.egtrans: 在那个手提箱的内衬里发现藏有1公斤海洛因。

example.eg: I like wearing sunglasses - I feel I can hide behind them.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢戴太阳镜——我觉得我可以藏在镜片的后面。

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent something from being seen

example.eg: He tries to hide his bald spot by sweeping his hair over to one side.
example.egtrans: 他试图通过把头发梳向一边来掩盖他头顶上的秃块。

trans_examp.trans_en: to not show an emotion

example.eg: She tried to hide her disappointment at not getting the promotion.
example.egtrans: 她试图掩饰自己对没有得到提升的失望。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you hide information from someone, you do not allow that person to know it.

example.eg: I feel sure there's something about her past that she's trying to hide from me.
example.egtrans: 我确信她在试图对我隐瞒她过去的某些事情。

hide.name: hide
hide.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hide
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the strong, thick skin of an animal, used for making leather

dsense.name: hide
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a place where people can watch wild animals or birds without being noticed by them
trans_examp.trans_cn: （可以观察野兽或鸟类的）隐藏处，躲藏处

hiding.name: hiding
hiding.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hiding
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a punishment that consists of being beaten repeatedly
a total defeat

example.eg: "How did the French team get on in their match against Italy?" "They got a real hiding!"
example.egtrans: “法国队在和意大利队的比赛中表现如何？” “他们被打得一败涂地！”

dsense.name: hiding
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be/go somewhere where you cannot be found

hierarchical.name: hierarchical
hierarchical.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: arranged according to people's or things' level of importance, or relating to such a system
trans_examp.trans_cn: 按等级划分的；等级制度的

example.eg: The military has a hierarchical rank structure.
example.egtrans: 军队的军衔结构是按等级划分的。

example.eg: It's a very hierarchical organization in which everyone's status is clearly defined.
example.egtrans: 这是一个等级分明的组织，每个人的地位都有明确的界定。

hierarchy.name: hierarchy
hierarchy.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a system in which people or things are arranged according to their importance

example.eg: Some monkeys have a very complex social hierarchy.
example.egtrans: 有些猴群中出现了非常复杂的种群等级。

example.eg: He rose quickly through the political hierarchy to become party leader.
example.egtrans: 他的政治地位迅速上升，成了党的领导人。

trans_examp.trans_en: the people in the upper levels of an organization who control it

hint.name: hint
hint.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hint
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you say or do that shows what you think or want, usually in a way that is not direct

example.eg: He's dropped (= given) several hints to the boss that he'll quit if he doesn't get a promotion.
example.egtrans: 他已经向老板暗示了好几次，如果不获得升职他就会辞职。

example.eg: Did she give you any hints about where she was going?
example.egtrans: 她有没有向你暗示过她要去哪里呢？

example.eg: You can't take (= understand) a hint, can you? Just go away and leave me alone!
example.egtrans: 你就是听不懂暗示，对不对？滚开，不要烦我！

dsense.name: hint
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of advice that helps you to do something

example.eg: Could you give us a hint about how to do this exercise, please?
example.egtrans: 你能不能给我们一些关于如何做这个练习的建议？

example.eg: This recipe book is full of handy (= useful) hints.
example.egtrans: 这本烹饪书中有很多有用的建议。

dsense.name: hint
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a very small amount of something

example.eg: There's just a hint of brandy in the sauce.
example.egtrans: 调味汁中只有很少的白兰地。

example.eg: I detected a hint of doubt in his voice.
example.egtrans: 我察觉到他的语气中有些许怀疑。

hint.name: hint
hint.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say or do something that shows what you think or want, usually in a way that is not direct

example.eg: Mum's hinted (that) she might pay for my trip to Mexico.
example.egtrans: 妈妈暗示她或许可以资助我的墨西哥之行。

example.eg: He's hinted at the possibility of moving to Canada.
example.egtrans: 他暗示过有可能移居加拿大。

historical.name: historical
historical.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: connected with studying or representing things from the past

example.eg: Many important historical documents were destroyed when the library was bombed.
example.egtrans: 图书馆遭轰炸时很多重要的历史文献都毁于一旦。

example.eg: She specializes in historical novels set in 18th-century England.
example.egtrans: 她专门创作以18世纪英格兰为背景的历史小说。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe prices, values, etc. in the past

example.eg: The table compares historical exchange rates for five different currencies.
example.egtrans: 这张表比较五种货币在历史上的兑换率。

hit.name: hit
hit.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move your hand or an object onto the surface of something so that it touches it, usually with force

example.eg: Teachers are not allowed to hit their pupils.
example.egtrans: 不允许教师打学生。

example.eg: This type of glass won't shatter no matter how hard you hit it.
example.egtrans: 这种玻璃无论你怎么敲击都不会碎。

example.eg: She hit her thumb with the hammer.
example.egtrans: 她用锤子砸到自己的拇指。

trans_examp.trans_en: to touch something with sudden force

example.eg: They were going about 60 kilometres an hour when their car hit the tree.
example.egtrans: 他们的车撞到树上时正以约每小时60公里的车速行驶。

example.eg: One journalist was hit in the leg by a stray bullet.
example.egtrans: 一名记者被流弹击中了腿部。

example.eg: That new shelf in the bathroom is too low - I just hit my head on it.
example.egtrans: 浴室里的那个新架子太低——我的头刚刚撞在上面了。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an unpleasant or negative effect on a person or thing

example.eg: Production has been badly hit by the strike.
example.egtrans: 罢工严重影响了生产。

example.eg: Demand for transatlantic flights has been hit by fears of terrorist attacks.
example.egtrans: 由于害怕遭遇恐怖袭击，人们对飞越大西洋航班的需求受到了影响。

trans_examp.trans_en: If an idea or thought hits you, you suddenly think of it.

example.eg: That's when it hit me that my life would never be the same again.
example.egtrans: 那一刻我忽然明白我的人生再也不会和过去一样了。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to shoot at or bomb a place or person, causing damage or injury

example.eg: Two schools were hit during the air raid.
example.egtrans: 空袭中有两所学校遭到了轰炸。

example.eg: He was hit in the neck by a bullet from a sniper.
example.egtrans: 他被一名狙击手射出的子弹击中了颈部。

example.eg: Try to hit the middle of the target.
example.egtrans: 要尽量打中靶心。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrive at a place or position

example.eg: If we turn left at the next junction, we should hit the main road after five miles or so.
example.egtrans: 如果在下一个路口左转弯，走5英里左右后我们就会抵达大路。

trans_examp.trans_en: to succeed in reaching or achieving something

example.eg: Our profits hit an all-time high of $20 million last year.
example.egtrans: 去年我们的盈利达到了2000万英镑的最高纪录。

example.eg: I just can't hit (= sing) those high notes like I used to.
example.egtrans: 我就是不能像过去一样把那些高音唱上去。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to like someone and become friendly immediately

example.eg: I didn't really hit it off with his friends.
example.egtrans: 我和他的朋友们并不怎么合得来。

example.eg: Jake and Sue hit it off immediately.
example.egtrans: 杰克和苏一见如故。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to kill someone

example.eg: Three drug dealers were hit in the city over the weekend.
example.egtrans: 周末有3名毒贩在该市被击毙。

hit.name: hit
hit.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thing or person that is very popular or successful
trans_examp.trans_cn: 非常受欢迎的人（或事）；非常成功的人（或事）

example.eg: The Beatles had a string of number-one hits in the 1960s.
example.egtrans: 20世纪60年代甲壳虫乐队推出了一系列排行榜冠军曲目。

example.eg: Your cake was a real hit at the party - everyone commented.
example.egtrans: 聚会上你的蛋糕真是棒极了——每个人都在谈论。

example.eg: They've just released an album of their greatest hits (= their most successful songs).
example.egtrans: 他们刚刚发行了一张他们的上榜歌曲精选。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a request to use a web page on the internet that is then counted to calculate the number of people looking at the page

example.eg: Our page had 243 hits this week.
example.egtrans: 我们的网页本周的点击数为243次。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of hitting something or someone, or an occasion when something or someone hits you

example.eg: She gave him a hit on the head which knocked him flying.
example.egtrans: 她击中了他的头部，打得他眼冒金星。

trans_examp.trans_en: in baseball, when the batter (= person trying to hit the ball) safely reaches first base after hitting the ball

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when something that has been thrown, dropped, shot, etc. at a place or object reaches that place or object

example.eg: The rebel headquarters took a direct hit from a bomb during the attack.
example.egtrans: 在这次进攻中，一颗炸弹直接击中了叛军的总部。

example.eg: I scored a hit on my second shot.
example.egtrans: 我的第二枪击中了靶心。

dsense.name: hit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of murder

example.eg: He was the victim of a mafia hit.
example.egtrans: 他是被黑手党谋杀的。

hold.name: hold
hold.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take and keep something in your hand or arms

example.eg: Can you hold the bag while I open the door?
example.egtrans: 我开门时你能帮我拿一下包吗？

example.eg: He was holding a gun.
example.egtrans: 他当时正拿着一把枪。

example.eg: The little girl held her mother's hand.
example.egtrans: 这个小女孩抓着妈妈的手。

example.eg: He held her in his arms.
