example.egtrans: 他把她抱在怀里。

example.eg: Could you hold the door open, please?
example.egtrans: 你能扶住门让它一直开着吗？

example.eg: Rosie held out an apple for the horse.
example.egtrans: 罗西拿着一个苹果伸向那匹马。

example.eg: All those who agree, please hold up your hand (= raise your arm).
example.egtrans: 同意的请举手。

trans_examp.trans_en: to support something

example.eg: Will the rope be strong enough to hold my weight?
example.egtrans: 这根绳子禁得住我的重量吗？

example.eg: Each wheel is held on with four bolts.
example.egtrans: 每个轮胎都由4颗螺栓固定。

example.eg: The parts are held together with glue.
example.egtrans: 这些部件是用胶粘在一起的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to press your nose tightly between thumb and finger in order to close it

example.eg: I have to hold my nose when I jump into water.
example.egtrans: 当我跳到水里时必须捏住鼻子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: When two people hold hands, one person holds the other person's hand, especially to show that they love each other.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （尤指为了表示两人相爱）手拉着手

example.eg: They walked along holding hands.
example.egtrans: 他们手拉着手向前走。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to contain or be able to contain something

example.eg: This jug holds exactly one pint.
example.egtrans: 这只壶的容量刚好是1品脱。

example.eg: One bag won't hold all of the shopping - we'd better take two.
example.egtrans: 买的这些东西一个袋子装不下——我们最好拿两个。

example.eg: Computers can hold huge amounts of information.
example.egtrans: 计算机能存储海量的信息。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you say that the future holds something, you mean that that thing will happen

example.eg: Who can tell what the future holds?
example.egtrans: 谁又能知道将来会发生什么事呢？

trans_examp.trans_en: to have a particular quality

example.eg: She's very religious, so death holds no fear for her.
example.egtrans: 她笃信宗教，所以死亡对她来说一点也不可怕。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have something, especially a position or money, or to control something

example.eg: He currently holds the position of technical manager.
example.egtrans: 他目前担任技术经理的职务。

example.eg: The bank holds large reserves of gold.
example.egtrans: 这家银行拥有大量的黄金储备。

example.eg: Despite incurring heavy losses, the rebels now hold the town and the surrounding hills.
example.egtrans: 叛军尽管损失惨重，但现在控制了该镇及其周围的小山。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have a particular position in a competition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在竞赛中保持（某个）位置

example.eg: She holds the world record.
example.egtrans: 她保持着世界纪录

example.eg: They held the lead until the 89th minute.
example.egtrans: 他们一直到第89分钟还保持领先。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep something, especially when it might have been lost

example.eg: I asked the shop to hold the dress for me until this afternoon.
example.egtrans: 我让那家商店帮我把那条长裙留到今天下午。

example.eg: You have to be a fairly good speaker to hold an audience's attention/interest.
example.egtrans: 要想保持观众的注意力／兴趣，你得是一个相当出色的演讲者才行。

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep someone in a place so that they cannot leave

example.eg: The police are holding several people in custody (= at the police station) for questioning.
example.egtrans: 警方拘留了几个人进行讯问。

example.eg: The terrorists held him hostage for 18 months.
example.egtrans: 恐怖分子将他扣为人质达18个月之久。

example.eg: I was held prisoner in a tiny attic room.
example.egtrans: 我被囚禁在一间小阁楼里。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have something such as a meeting or an election
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使发生；举行（尤指会议或选举）

example.eg: Could we hold a meeting to discuss this tomorrow afternoon?
example.egtrans: 明天下午我们开会讨论这件事好吗？

example.eg: The election will be held on 8 August.
example.egtrans: 选举将于8月8日举行。

example.eg: I find it's almost impossible to hold a sensible conversation with her.
example.egtrans: 我发现几乎不可能和她进行理智的谈话。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause to stay or continue in the same way as before

example.eg: Let's hope our good luck holds.
example.egtrans: 希望我们好运不断。

example.eg: I hope the repair holds until we get the car to a garage.
example.egtrans: 我希望这样修一下能让我们把车子开到修车厂。

example.eg: The old adage that money talks still holds true (= is still true).
example.egtrans: 那句古老的谚语“有钱能使鬼推磨”现在依然所言非虚。

example.eg: The government is committed to holding exports at their present level.
example.egtrans: 政府承诺继续保持现有的出口水平。

example.eg: The ship/aircraft held its course.
example.egtrans: 这艘船／这架飞机保持了航向。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to believe an idea or opinion

example.eg: You sold it to me, so if it breaks I'll hold you responsible (= consider you to blame).
example.egtrans: 是你把它卖给了我，所以如果坏了你得负责。

example.eg: a legal decision that we hold to be unconstitutional
example.egtrans: 一个我们确信违宪的法律裁决

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to wait, or to stop something temporarily

example.eg: They've decided to hold all future deliveries until the invoice has been paid.
example.egtrans: 他们决定，在对方付清发货清单上的货款之前，暂停所有未来的交货。

example.eg: How long can you hold your breath (= stop breathing)?
example.egtrans: 你憋气能憋多久？

example.eg: Will you hold my calls for the next half hour please?
example.egtrans: 半小时内请不要把电话转进来，好吗？

example.eg: She's on the phone at the moment - will you hold (the line) (= wait on the phone until she can speak to you)?
example.egtrans: 她在打电话——你能等一会儿吗？

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you ask someone to hold something, you do not want them to include it.

example.eg: I'd like a ham sandwich on rye, hold the lettuce.
example.egtrans: 我要一个黑麦面包的三明治，不要加生菜。

hold.name: hold
hold.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of holding something or someone, or the way you do this

example.eg: Keep a tight hold on your tickets.
example.egtrans: 拿好你们的票。

example.eg: Don't worry if you lose hold of the reins - the horse won't wander off.
example.egtrans: 如果缰绳脱手也不用担心——这匹马是不会乱跑的。

trans_examp.trans_en: in fighting sports, a position in which one person holds another person so that they cannot move
a place to put the hands and feet, especially when climbing
trans_examp.trans_cn: （攀爬时的）支撑点，手攀（或脚踩）的地方

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to start holding something or someone

example.eg: He took hold of one end of the carpet and tugged.
example.egtrans: 他抓住地毯的一端用力拖。

example.eg: I just managed to grab hold of Lucy before she fell in the pool.
example.egtrans: 我刚好在露西要掉进水池时抓住了她。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: power or control over something or someone

example.eg: Their company has a strong hold on/over the computer market.
example.egtrans: 他们公司在计算机市场举足轻重。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you are on hold when using the phone, you are waiting to speak to someone.

example.eg: Mr Briggs is on hold.
example.egtrans: 布里格斯先生正在电话那头等着呢。

example.eg: He's on the phone at the moment- can I put you on hold?
example.egtrans: 他的电话占线——您不要挂断电话，等一会儿可以吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If an activity is on hold, it has been intentionally delayed.

example.eg: Everything's on hold again because of the bad weather.
example.egtrans: 因为天气恶劣，一切都再次推迟了。

example.eg: The movie has been put on hold until the financial situation improves.
example.egtrans: 那部电影被推迟拍摄，直到财务状况有所好转为止。

dsense.name: hold
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the space in a ship or aircraft in which goods are carried

holdover.name: holdover
holdover.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person or thing that continues from an earlier time, especially a person who continues in an organization after other people have been replaced

example.eg: The coach had a pointed message for newcomers to the team and a reminder for the holdovers.
example.egtrans: 教练给了新队员明确的信息，也对留任队员发出了提醒。

example.eg: Freud explained it as a holdover from a childhood problem.
example.egtrans: 弗洛伊德将之解释为童年问题的遗留。

hover.name: hover
hover.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay in one place in the air, usually by moving the wings quickly

example.eg: A hawk hovered in the sky, waiting to swoop down on its prey.
example.egtrans: 一只老鹰在天空中盘旋，要伺机俯冲捕捉猎物。

example.eg: I heard the noise of a helicopter hovering overhead.
example.egtrans: 我听到头顶上直升飞机盘旋的声音。

trans_examp.trans_en: to stand somewhere, especially near another person, eagerly or nervously waiting for their attention

example.eg: A waiter hovered at the table, ready to take our order.
example.egtrans: 一名侍者守在桌子旁，等着我们点菜。

example.eg: I could sense him behind me, hovering and building up the courage to ask me a question.
example.egtrans: 我能感觉到他在我身后犹豫徘徊，想鼓起勇气问我一个问题。

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay at or near a particular level

example.eg: Inflation is hovering at three percent.
example.egtrans: 通货膨胀率在3%左右徘徊。

trans_examp.trans_en: to put the cursor on a computer screen in a particular place without clicking on it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把光标放在电脑屏幕上的某个位置

example.eg: The link changes to green when the mouse hovers over it.
example.egtrans: 当光标放在链接文字上时，文字会变成绿色。

example.eg: If you hover the mouse pointer over the entry, the full web address will be displayed.
example.egtrans: 当你把光标放在这条记录上时，整个网站地址就会显示出来。

however.name: however
however.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: however
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: despite whatever amount or degree

example.eg: However hungry I am, I never seem to be able to finish off a whole pizza.
example.egtrans: 无论有多饿，我似乎都吃不下一整个比萨饼。

example.eg: If Emma likes something she'll buy it however much it costs.
example.egtrans: 如果埃玛喜欢某个东西，那无论多贵她都会买的。

example.eg: I'll see you after the show and give you £20 for the tickets, or however much (= whatever) they cost.
example.egtrans: 演出结束后我们再见面，我会给你20英镑或者是实际的门票钱。

dsense.name: however
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to express surprise
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于表示惊讶）究竟怎样，到底如何

example.eg: However did you manage to get him to agree to that?
example.egtrans: 你究竟是怎样设法让他同意的？

trans_examp.trans_en: in whatever way

example.eg: However you look at it, it's still a mess.
example.egtrans: 无论你怎么看，它仍是一团糟。

example.eg: You can do it however you like, it really doesn't matter.
example.egtrans: 你想怎么做就可以怎么做，真的没什么关系。

dsense.name: however
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: despite this

example.eg: This is one possible solution to the problem. However, there are others.
example.egtrans: 这是该问题的一种可能的解决办法，但还有其他的办法。

example.eg: There may, however, be other reasons that we don't know about.
example.egtrans: 然而，可能还有其他我们不知道的原因。

hue.name: hue
hue.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hue
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (a degree of lightness, darkness, strength, etc. of) a colour

example.eg: In the Caribbean waters there are fish of every hue.
example.egtrans: 加勒比海水域中的鱼五颜六色。

dsense.name: hue
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a different type or group

example.eg: Politicians of all hues wish to get sleaze off the agenda so that they can discuss the real issues.
example.egtrans: 各个党派的与会者都希望将那些卑劣之事从议事日程中去掉，这样他们就可以讨论真正的问题了。

hybrid.name: hybrid
hybrid.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: hybrid
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a plant or animal that has been produced from two different types of plant or animal, especially to get better characteristics
trans_examp.trans_cn: （动物或植物的）杂交种，混合种

example.eg: The garden strawberry is a large-fruited hybrid.
example.egtrans: 人工栽培的草莓是一种果实较大的杂交品种。

example.eg: The animal looks like a hybrid of a zebra and a horse.
example.egtrans: 这只动物看上去像是斑马和马杂交所得。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is a mixture of two very different things
trans_examp.trans_cn: （两种完全不同的东西的）混合

example.eg: His work is an interesting hybrid of popular and classical music.
example.egtrans: 他的作品是经典与流行音乐有趣的混合。

dsense.name: hybrid
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a vehicle with an engine that uses both petrol and another type of energy, usually electricity
trans_examp.trans_cn: 用汽油以及其他形式的能源（通常为电力）一同发动的机动车

hyphen.name: hyphen
hyphen.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the symbol -, used to join two words together, or to show that a word has been divided into two parts at the end of one line and the beginning of the next

example.eg: There are hyphens in "well-to-do".
example.egtrans: “well-to-do”中有连字符。

i.name: I
i.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: used as the subject of a verb to refer to the person speaking or writing

example.eg: I love you.
example.egtrans: 我爱你。

example.eg: Am I invited?
example.egtrans: 邀请我了吗？

example.eg: I'm not mistaken, am I?
example.egtrans: 我没弄错，对吧？

example.eg: I'd like a coffee, please.
example.egtrans: 请给我一杯咖啡。

idea.name: idea
idea.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: idea
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a suggestion or plan for doing something

example.eg: I've had an idea - why don't we go to the coast?
example.egtrans: 我有个主意——我们为什么不去海滨呢？

example.eg: "Let's go swimming." "That's a good idea!"
example.egtrans: “我们去游泳吧。”“好主意！”

example.eg: If you have any ideas for what I could buy Jack, let me know.
example.egtrans: 我给杰克买什么东西好，如果你有什么主意请告诉我。

example.eg: That's when I first had the idea of starting (= planned to start) my own business.
example.egtrans: 那是我首次有了自己创业的想法。

example.eg: I like the idea of living in the countryside but I'm not sure I'd like the reality.
example.egtrans: 我觉得住在乡村的想法很好，但我不肯定是否喜欢这样一种现实。

example.eg: She's full of bright (= good) ideas.
example.egtrans: 她满脑子好点子。

example.eg: It was Kate's idea to hire bikes.
example.egtrans: 租自行车是凯特的主意。

example.eg: It's not a good idea to drive for hours without a rest.
example.egtrans: 连续开车几个小时都不休息不是个好主意。

dsense.name: idea
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an understanding, thought, or picture in your mind

example.eg: Do you have any idea of what he looks like?
example.egtrans: 你知道他长什么样吗？

example.eg: Can you give me an idea of the cost (= can you tell me approximately how it costs)?
example.egtrans: 你能告诉我费用大致是多少吗？

example.eg: I don't like the idea of living so far away from my family.
example.egtrans: 我不喜欢生活在离家这么远的地方。

example.eg: I haven't the slightest/faintest idea where they've gone.
example.egtrans: 我根本不知道他们去了哪儿。

example.eg: I've got a pretty good idea why they left early.
example.egtrans: 我很清楚他们为什么早早就离开了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to not know something

example.eg: "Where's Serge?" "I've no idea."

dsense.name: idea
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a belief or opinion

example.eg: We have very different ideas about disciplining children.
example.egtrans: 我们对于如何管教孩子看法大不相同。

example.eg: Dr Leach puts forward the idea that it is impossible to spoil a child.
example.egtrans: 利奇提出的观点是，宠坏孩子是不可能的。

example.eg: I'm not married - where did you get that idea (= what made you believe that)?
example.egtrans: 我没有结婚——你这想法是从哪儿来的？

dsense.name: idea
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a purpose or reason for doing something

example.eg: The idea of the game is to get rid of all your cards as soon as you can.
example.egtrans: 游戏的目的是尽快出完手中的牌。

example.eg: The whole idea (= only purpose) of advertising is to make people buy things.
example.egtrans: 广告的唯一目的就在于让人买东西。

example.eg: The idea behind the lottery is to raise money for good causes.
example.egtrans: 发行彩票的目的在于为慈善事业筹款。

ideal.name: ideal
ideal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: perfect, or the best possible

example.eg: the ideal employer
example.egtrans: 无可挑剔的老板

example.eg: She's the ideal person (= exactly the right type of person) for the job.
example.egtrans: 她是这项工作的理想人选。

example.eg: The television also comes in a compact 36 cm screen size, ideal for bedroom or kitchen use.
example.egtrans: 这种电视机也有屏幕大小为36厘米的袖珍型，非常适合在卧室和厨房使用。

example.eg: It's the ideal opportunity to meet people.
example.egtrans: 这是结识人的绝好机会。

example.eg: In an ideal world no one would go hungry.
example.egtrans: 理想的世界里没有人忍饥挨饿。

ideal.name: ideal
ideal.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: ideal
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a principle or a way of behaving that is of a very high standard
trans_examp.trans_cn: 理想，标准极高的原则（或行为准则）

example.eg: democratic ideals
example.egtrans: 民主理想

example.eg: We are committed to the ideal of equality.
example.egtrans: 我们奉行平等原则。

example.eg: They share the same high ideals.
example.egtrans: 他们有着同样高标准的行为准则。

dsense.name: ideal
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a perfect thing or situation

example.eg: The ideal would be to have a house in the town and one in the country.
example.egtrans: 理想的情形应该是在城里和乡下都有住处。

ideally.name: ideally
ideally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used when describing the perfect situation

example.eg: Ideally, I'd like to work at home but it's just not practical.
example.egtrans: 对我来说最理想的是在家上班，可这根本不现实。

example.eg: She's ideally (= perfectly) suited to the job.
example.egtrans: 她非常适合这份工作。

identical.name: identical
identical.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: exactly the same, or very similar
trans_examp.trans_cn: 完全相同的；极为相似的

example.eg: I've got three identical blue suits.
example.egtrans: 我有3套完全相同的蓝色西装。

example.eg: The two rooms were virtually identical.
example.egtrans: 这两个房间几乎一模一样。

example.eg: The interests of both parties may not be identical, but they do overlap considerably.
example.egtrans: 双方的利益可能并不完全相同，但的确也有很多重合之处。

example.eg: The tests are identical to those carried out last year.
example.egtrans: 这些测试和去年进行的完全相同。

identifier.name: digital object identifier
identifier.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a unique series of numbers attached to a piece of digital information such as a website, file, or online article

example.eg: A digital object identifier is a permanent identifier given to an electronic document.
example.egtrans: 数字对象标识符是赋予电子文件的永久性标识符。

idiom.name: idiom
idiom.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of words in a fixed order that have a particular meaning that is different from the meanings of each word on its own

example.eg: To "have bitten off more than you can chew" is an idiom that means you have tried to do something which is too difficult for you.
example.egtrans: have bitten off more than you can chew 是一句习语，意思是试图承担力所不及的事。

trans_examp.trans_en: the style of expression in writing, speech, or music that is typical of a particular period, person, or group
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某一时期、个人或群体在写作、言语、音乐方面的）典型表达风格

example.eg: Both operas are very much in the modern idiom.
example.egtrans: 两部歌剧都很有现代风格。

if.name: if
if.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

dsense.name: if
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to say that a particular thing can or will happen only after something else happens or becomes true

example.eg: I'll pay you double if you get the work finished by Friday.
example.egtrans: 如果你周五前完工，我付你双倍的报酬。

example.eg: We'll have the party in the garden if the weather's good. If not (= if the weather is not good), it'll have to be inside.
example.egtrans: 如果天气好的话，我们将在花园里开派对。如果不好，就只好在室内了。

example.eg: If anyone calls, just say I'll be back in the office at four o'clock.
example.egtrans: 要是有人给我打电话，请告诉他们我4点钟回办公室。

example.eg: If she hadn't called, I wouldn't have known.
example.egtrans: 要不是她打来电话，我还不知道呢。

example.eg: I wouldn't work for them (even) if they paid me twice my current salary.
example.egtrans: 即使他们付给我的工资是现在的两倍，我也不会为他们干活。

example.eg: We'll deal with that problem if and when it arises.
example.egtrans: 等到那个问题出现我们再处理。

example.eg: If disturbed, the bird may abandon the nest, leaving the chicks to die.
example.egtrans: 如果受到惊扰，鸟可能会弃巢而去，留下雏鸟，任由它们死亡。

trans_examp.trans_en: although

example.eg: They're great kids, even if they can be demanding.
example.egtrans: 虽然他们要求多多，但他们是很好的孩子。

example.eg: It was a hot, if windy day.
example.egtrans: 那天虽然有风，却依然很热。

trans_examp.trans_en: every time

example.eg: If water is heated to 100°C it turns to steam.
example.egtrans: 水被加热到100摄氏度时，就会变成蒸汽。

example.eg: If I don't get enough sleep I get a headache.
example.egtrans: 我睡眠不足时就会头疼。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to mean "if it is true that"

example.eg: I'm very sorry if I've offended you.
example.egtrans: 如果我冒犯了你的话，我很抱歉。

dsense.name: if
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to introduce a clause, often in indirect speech, that shows two or more possibilities
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于引出从句，常为间接引语）是否

example.eg: Mrs Kramer called half an hour ago to ask if her cake was ready.
example.egtrans: 克雷默夫人半小时前来电话问她的蛋糕做好了没有。

example.eg: I don't care if he likes it or not - I'm coming!
example.egtrans: 我不在乎他乐不乐意，我反正要来！

example.eg: I was wondering if you'd like to come to the cinema with me this evening?
example.egtrans: 不知你今晚想不想与我一起去看电影？

dsense.name: if
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used when you want to make a polite request or remark
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于礼貌地作出请求或评论）

example.eg: If you'd like to take a seat, Mr Chang will be with you in a moment.
example.egtrans: 您请先坐一会儿吧，张先生一会儿就过来。

example.eg: Would you mind if I open/opened (= can I open) the window?
example.egtrans: 我开窗您介意吗？

example.eg: There are, if you don't mind me saying so, one or two problems with this plan.
example.egtrans: 恕我冒昧，我觉得这个计划有一两处问题。

if.name: if
if.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is not certain or not yet decided
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不确定因素；未决之事；疑问

example.eg: There's a big if hanging over the project (= it is uncertain whether the project will happen).
example.egtrans: 这个计划能否启动仍然悬而未决。

Ignore.name: ignore
Ignore.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to intentionally not listen or give attention to

example.eg: She can be really irritating but I try to ignore her.
example.egtrans: 她有时会特别烦人，不过我尽量不去理会她。

example.eg: Safety regulations are being ignored by company managers in the drive to increase profits.
example.egtrans: 为了增加利润，公司经理们对安全章程熟视无睹。

example.eg: How can the government ignore the wishes of the majority?
example.egtrans: 政府怎么能不顾大多数人的意愿呢？

example.eg: I smiled at her but she just ignored me.
example.egtrans: 我对她笑了笑，可她根本没理睬我。

illustrate.name: illustrate
illustrate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: illustrate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to draw pictures for a book, magazine, etc.

example.eg: a beautifully illustrated book/old manuscript
example.egtrans: 配有精美插图的书／旧手稿

dsense.name: illustrate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show the meaning or truth of something more clearly, especially by giving examples

example.eg: The lecturer illustrated his point with a diagram on the blackboard.
example.egtrans: 讲师在黑板上用图表来说明自己的观点。

example.eg: This latest conflict further illustrates the weakness of the UN.
example.egtrans: 最近的这次冲突进一步说明了联合国的软弱。

example.eg: The exhibition will illustrate how life evolved from water.
example.egtrans: 这次展览将展示生命是如何从水中演化而来的。

immediately.name: immediately
immediately.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: now or without waiting or thinking

example.eg: We really ought to leave immediately.
example.egtrans: 我们真的应该马上就走。

example.eg: The purpose of the meeting wasn't immediately obvious.
example.egtrans: 会议的目的并不明确。

trans_examp.trans_en: close to something or someone in distance or time

example.eg: Milton Street is on the left, immediately after the bank.
example.egtrans: 米尔顿大街在左边，一过银行就是。

example.eg: They moved in immediately before Christmas.
example.egtrans: 他们在圣诞节前不久才搬进来。

example.eg: We heard a loud crash from the room immediately above us.
example.egtrans: 我们听到从正上方的房间传来了一声巨响。

trans_examp.trans_en: closely or directly

example.eg: The people most immediately affected by the drought are the farmers themselves.
example.egtrans: 受干旱影响最直接的是农民自身。

immediately.name: immediately
immediately.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: as soon as

example.eg: Immediately she'd gone, the boys started to mess about.
example.egtrans: 她一走开，男孩们便闹成一团。

example.eg: I'll call you immediately I hear anything.
example.egtrans: 我一有什么消息就给你打电话。

immutable.name: immutable
immutable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not changing, or unable to be changed

example.eg: an immutable law
example.egtrans: 永恒的法则

example.eg: Some people regard grammar as an immutable set of rules.
example.egtrans: 有些人认为语法是一套不可更改的规则。

impact.name: impact
impact.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the force or action of one object hitting another

example.eg: The impact of the crash reduced the car to a third of its original length.
example.egtrans: 撞车时的冲击力使车身变形，仅剩原长的三分之一。

example.eg: The bullet explodes on impact (= when it hits another object).
example.egtrans: 子弹击中物体时爆炸。

trans_examp.trans_en: a powerful effect that something, especially something new, has on a situation or person
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指新事物的）巨大影响，强大作用

example.eg: The anti-smoking campaign had had/made quite an impact on young people.
example.egtrans: 禁烟运动对年轻人影响很大。

example.eg: The new proposals were intended to soften the impact of the reformed tax system.
example.egtrans: 新的提议旨在减轻改革后的税制所造成的影响。

impact.name: impact
impact.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an influence on something

example.eg: Falling export rates have impacted (on) the country's economy quite considerably.
example.egtrans: 出口率的下降对该国的经济造成了相当大的影响。

imperative.name: imperative
imperative.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: imperative
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: extremely important or urgent
trans_examp.trans_cn: 极重要的；紧急的；迫切的

example.eg: The president said it was imperative that the release of all hostages be secured.
example.egtrans: 总统说当前要务是确保所有人质都获释。

example.eg: It's imperative to act now before the problem gets really serious.
example.egtrans: 必须现在就采取行动，而不是等到问题变得难以收拾。

dsense.name: imperative
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe the form of a verb that is usually used for giving orders

example.eg: In the phrase "Leave him alone!", the verb "leave" is in the imperative form.
example.egtrans: 在句子 Leave him alone! 中，动词 leave 用的是祈使语气。

imperative.name: imperative
imperative.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: imperative
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the form of a verb that is usually used for giving orders

example.eg: In the phrase "Leave him alone!", the verb "leave" is an imperative/is in the imperative.
example.egtrans: 在句子 Leave him alone! 中，动词 leave 是祈使语气动词。

dsense.name: imperative
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is extremely important or urgent

example.eg: Getting the unemployed back to work, said the mayor, is a moral imperative.
example.egtrans: 市长说，让失业人员重返工作岗位是一件道义上必须做的事。

implement.name: implement
implement.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to start using a plan or system

example.eg: The changes to the national health system will be implemented next year.
example.egtrans: 国民医疗保健制度的改革将于明年实施。

implement.name: implement
implement.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a tool that works by being moved by hand or by being pulled across a surface

example.eg: garden/household/agricultural implements
example.egtrans: 园艺用具／家用工具／农具

example.eg: Shopkeepers are not supposed to sell knives and other sharp implements to children.
example.egtrans: 店主不应该向儿童出售小刀及其他锋利的器具。

implementation.name: implementation
implementation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of starting to use a plan or system

example.eg: implementation of the law/agreement
example.egtrans: 法律的实施/协议的执行

example.eg: Various projects for constructing new schools are under implementation in the region.
example.egtrans: 该地区正在实施多个建设新学校的项目。

implicit.name: implicit
implicit.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: implicit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: suggested but not communicated directly

example.eg: He interpreted her comments as an implicit criticism of the government.
example.egtrans: 他将她的评论理解为对政府的含蓄批评。

example.eg: Implicit in the poem's closing lines are the poet's own religious doubts.
example.egtrans: 在这首诗最后几行中隐含着诗人自己的宗教疑虑。

dsense.name: implicit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete and without any doubts

example.eg: implicit trust
example.egtrans: 绝对的信任

example.eg: All her life she had implicit faith in socialism.
example.egtrans: 她一生都坚定地信仰社会主义。

implicitly.name: implicitly
implicitly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: implicitly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is suggested but not communicated directly

example.eg: Value tends to be implicitly communicated through packaging.
example.egtrans: 价值往往通过包装隐含地传达。

example.eg: The people they are implicitly criticizing constitute the most responsible section of society.
example.egtrans: 他们含蓄地批评的那些人是社会中最负责任的一部分人。

dsense.name: implicitly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely and without any doubts

example.eg: He trusts her implicitly.
example.egtrans: 他绝对信任她。

example.eg: He believed implicitly in the power of prayer.
example.egtrans: 他深信祈祷的力量。

imply.name: imply
imply.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to communicate an idea or feeling without saying it directly

example.eg: Are you implying (that) I'm fat?
example.egtrans: 你是在暗示我长得胖吗？

example.eg: I'm not implying anything about your cooking, but could we eat out tonight?
example.egtrans: 我并不是暗示你做的饭不好吃，只是想提议我们今晚去外面吃，好吗？

example.eg: I detected an implied criticism of the way he was treated.
example.egtrans: 我觉察到他在含蓄地批评自己受到的待遇。

trans_examp.trans_en: to involve something or make it necessary

example.eg: Socialism implies equality.
example.egtrans: 社会主义必然包含平等。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to show that the name, etc. of something tells you something about it

example.eg: Variable rate loans, as the name implies, have a variable interest rate.
example.egtrans: 可变利率贷款，正如名字所暗示的，是一种利率可能变化的贷款。

in addition to.name: addition
in addition to.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of adding numbers or amounts together

example.eg: Twice a week the children are tested in basic mathematical skills such as addition (= calculating the total of different numbers put together) and subtraction.
example.egtrans: 孩子们每周要参加两次加减法等基础数学能力的测试。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that has been added to something else

example.eg: A secretary would be a welcome/useful addition to our staff.
example.egtrans: 增加一名秘书对于我们全体工作人员来说是好消息／会有助于我们全体工作人员的工作。

example.eg: I hear you're expecting a small addition to the family (= you are going to have a baby)!
example.egtrans: 我听说你家里要添一名小成员了！

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of adding a substance or thing to something else

example.eg: Most working environments are improved by the addition of (= by adding) a few plants and pictures.
example.egtrans: 多数情况下，只要摆上几盆花、几幅画，工作环境就能得到改善。

trans_examp.trans_en: a new part added to a house or other building

example.eg: We're building an addition to our house.
example.egtrans: 我们正在对房子进行扩建。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as well (as)

example.eg: In addition to his apartment in Manhattan, he has a villa in Italy and a castle in Scotland.
example.egtrans: 除了在曼哈顿拥有一套公寓外，他在意大利还有一座乡间别墅，在苏格兰有一座城堡。

in detail.name: detail
in detail.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: detail
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a single piece of information or fact about something

example.eg: She insisted on telling me every single detail of what they did to her in hospital.
example.egtrans: 她坚持要告诉我她在医院遭遇的一切。

example.eg: We don't know the full/precise details of the story yet.
example.egtrans: 我们还不知道故事的全部／具体情节。

example.eg: She refused to disclose/divulge any details about/of the plan.
example.egtrans: 她拒绝透露该计划的任何细节。

trans_examp.trans_en: the small features of something that you only notice when you look carefully

example.eg: I was just admiring the detail in the doll's house - even the tins of food have labels on them.
example.egtrans: 我只是感叹娃娃屋顶制作之精致——就连食品罐头上都还贴着标签呢。

example.eg: It's his eye for (= ability to notice) detail that distinguishes him as a painter.
example.egtrans: 他细致入微的观察能力使其成为一位与众不同的画家。

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of something that does not seem important
trans_examp.trans_cn: 细枝末节，无足轻重的小事

example.eg: Tony says, he's going to get the car, and finding the money to pay for it is just a minor detail.
example.egtrans: 托尼说，他要买那辆车，买车钱不过是小事一桩。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: information about someone or something

example.eg: A police officer took down the details of what happened.
example.egtrans: 一位警官详细记下了发生的一切。

example.eg: Can I have your details (= name and address, etc.), please?
example.egtrans: 可以告诉我你的个人详细情况吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: including or considering all the information about something or every part of something

example.eg: We haven't discussed the matter in detail yet.
example.egtrans: 我们还没有详细讨论此事。

example.eg: The book described her suffering in graphic detail.
example.egtrans: 这本书详尽地描述了她所遭受的种种痛苦。

example.eg: He talked in great detail about the furniture he's chosen for the living room.
example.egtrans: 他详细介绍了他为起居室选定的家具。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to tell or include all the facts about something

example.eg: I won't go into detail over the phone, but I've been having a few health problems recently.
example.egtrans: 我在电话里就不细说了，但最近我的身体一直有些不舒服。

dsense.name: detail
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people who have been given a particular task

in detail.name: detail
in detail.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: detail
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to describe something completely, giving all the facts

example.eg: Can you produce a report detailing what we've spent on the project so far?
example.egtrans: 你能不能写一个报告，详细列出到目前为止我们在这个项目上的花费？

dsense.name: detail
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to order someone, often a small group of soldiers or workers, to perform a particular task

example.eg: Four soldiers were detailed to check the road for troops.
example.egtrans: 派出了4名士兵为部队检查道路情况。

in order to.name: order
in order to.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a request to make, supply, or deliver food or goods

example.eg: "Can I take your order now?" said the waiter.
example.egtrans: 侍者问：“现在可以点菜了吗？”

example.eg: I would like to place (= make) an order for a large pine table.
example.egtrans: 我想订制一张大松木桌。

trans_examp.trans_en: a product or a meal that has been asked for by a customer

example.eg: I got an email saying that the order has been shipped.
example.egtrans: 我收到电子邮件说订的货已经发出了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is on order, you have asked for it but have not yet received it.

example.eg: The new drilling equipment has been on order for several weeks.
example.egtrans: 新的钻探设备已经订购有几星期了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do or make something especially for a person who has asked for it

example.eg: We make wedding cakes to order.
example.egtrans: 我们提供订做婚礼蛋糕。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which people or things are arranged, either in relation to one another or according to a particular characteristic

example.eg: The children lined up in order of age/height.
example.egtrans: 孩子们按照年龄／身高顺序排列成队。

example.eg: I can't find the file I need because they're all out of order (= they are no longer arranged in the correct way).
example.egtrans: 我找不到我需要的文件，因为它们都给弄乱了。

example.eg: Put the files in alphabetical/chronological order.
example.egtrans: 把文件按照字母／时间顺序放好。

example.eg: Here's the running order for the concert (= the order in which each item will happen).
example.egtrans: 这是音乐会的节目单。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that someone tells you you must do

example.eg: The soldiers fired as soon as their commander gave the order.
example.egtrans: 指挥官一声令下，士兵们立即开火。

example.eg: Soldiers must obey orders.
example.egtrans: 军人必须服从命令。

example.eg: What are your orders?
example.egtrans: 你接到了什么指示？

example.eg: My orders are to search everyone's bag as they come in.
example.egtrans: 我接到的命令是搜查每个进来的人的包。

example.eg: The road was closed all day by order of the police.
example.egtrans: 按照警方的命令，这条路全天封闭。

example.eg: Clean up this room immediately - and that's an order!
example.egtrans: 立刻清理好这间屋子——这是命令！

trans_examp.trans_en: an official instruction telling someone what they can or cannot do, or a written instruction to a bank to pay money to a particular person

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have been told that you must do something by someone in authority
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 命令就是命令，命令必须执行

example.eg: We are under orders not to allow anyone into the building.
example.egtrans: 我们接到命令不许任何人进入该大楼。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

phrase.phrase_title: in order (for sb/sth) to do sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: with the aim of achieving something

example.eg: He came home early in order to see the kids before they went to bed.
example.egtrans: 他早回家是为了在孩子们睡觉前看到他们。

example.eg: I agreed to her suggestion in order not to upset her.
example.egtrans: 为了不让她伤心，我同意了她的建议。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which everything is arranged in its correct place

example.eg: The house was such a mess that she spent the whole day trying to establish some kind of order.
example.egtrans: 房子里很乱，她花了一整天的时间想把它收拾得整洁一些。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to organize something well
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 使有条理；把…整理得井井有条

example.eg: I try to leave my desk in order when I go home.
example.egtrans: 我回家前整理了我的办公桌。

example.eg: He put his affairs in order (= made arrangements for his personal and business matters) before he went into the hospital.
example.egtrans: 他住院之前把自己的事情都安排好了。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of working correctly or of being suitable for use
trans_examp.trans_cn: 正常工作状况；良好使用状况

example.eg: TV for sale in (good) working order.
example.egtrans: 出售性能良好的电视机。

example.eg: Are your immigration papers in order (= legally correct)?
example.egtrans: 你的移民证件是否合法？

example.eg: The coffee machine is out of order (= not working).
example.egtrans: 咖啡机坏了。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which rules are obeyed and people do what they are expected to do

example.eg: The teacher found it hard to keep her class in order.
example.egtrans: 老师发现很难维持课堂秩序。

example.eg: As the demonstration began to turn violent, the police were called in to restore order.
example.egtrans: 当示威游行开始演变成暴力活动时，警察被召来恢复秩序。

example.eg: After some heated discussion, the chairperson called the meeting to order (= told everyone to stop talking so that the meeting could continue).
example.egtrans: 经过一番热烈的讨论后，主席请与会人员安静下来。

example.eg: Is it in order (= allowed) for me to park my car outside the building?
example.egtrans: 我可以把汽车停在大楼外面吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an expression used in a parliament or a formal meeting to get people's attention and make them stop talking, so that the meeting or discussion can start or continue
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 安静！安静！（用于议会或正式会议中）

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a social or political system

example.eg: The collapse of Communism at the end of the 1980s encouraged hopes of a new world order.
example.egtrans: 20世纪80年代末，共产主义的瓦解点燃了建立世界新秩序的希望。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people who join together for religious or similar reasons and live according to particular rules
trans_examp.trans_cn: （按照一定规范生活的）修道会；会社

example.eg: religious/holy orders
example.egtrans: 修道会／圣职

example.eg: monks of the Cistercian/Franciscan Order
example.egtrans: 西多会／方济各会的修道士

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group that people are made members of as a reward for services they have done for their country

example.eg: He was made a knight of the Order of the Garter.
example.egtrans: 他被封为嘉德勋爵士。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the type or size of something

example.eg: These were problems of a completely different order from anything we had faced before.
example.egtrans: 这些问题同我们以前所遇到过的完全不同。

example.eg: No successful business can be run without skills of the highest order (= great skills).
example.egtrans: 没有超群的才能是无法成功经营企业的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: approximately

example.eg: The cost will be something in the order of $500.
example.egtrans: 费用大约为500美元。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (used in the classification of plants and animals) a group of related plants or animals

example.eg: An order is below a class and above a family.
example.egtrans: 目低于纲，高于科。

in order to.name: order
in order to.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to ask for something to be made, supplied, or delivered, especially in a restaurant or shop
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指在饭店或商店）点（饭菜），订购，订制，订货

example.eg: I ordered some pasta and a mixed salad.
example.egtrans: 我点了意大利面条和一份什锦色拉。

example.eg: There are no shirts left in this size but we could order one for you/order you one.
example.egtrans: 这个尺寸的衬衫没有了，不过我们可以给您订购一件。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a person in authority orders someone to do something, or orders something to be done, they tell someone to do it.

example.eg: The management has ordered a cutback in spending.
example.egtrans: 管理层指示要减少开销。

example.eg: "Wait over there," she ordered.
example.egtrans: “在那儿等着，”她吩咐道。

example.eg: They ordered him to leave the room.
example.egtrans: 他们命令他离开房间。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange a group of people or things in a list from first to last

example.eg: The documents have been ordered alphabetically.
example.egtrans: 文件已经按字母顺序排列好了。

example.eg: I've ordered the application forms into three groups.
example.egtrans: 我将申请表整理成了3组。

inaccessible.name: inaccessible
inaccessible.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: inaccessible
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very difficult or impossible to travel to

example.eg: one of the most inaccessible places in the world
example.egtrans: 世界上最难到达的地方之一

example.eg: Some of the houses on the hillside are inaccessible to cars.
example.egtrans: 山坡上的一些房屋开车上不去。

dsense.name: inaccessible
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: difficult to understand or admire

example.eg: Why is opera so inaccessible to so many people?
example.egtrans: 为什么歌剧有这么多人无法欣赏？

example.eg: I found his lecture completely inaccessible.
example.egtrans: 我发觉他的讲座完全听不懂。

inaccurate.name: inaccurate
inaccurate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not completely correct or exact, or not able to do something correctly or exactly

example.eg: Their estimate of the cost of the project was wildly (= extremely) inaccurate.
example.egtrans: 他们对项目费用的估计非常不准确。

example.eg: an inaccurate device/weapon
example.egtrans: 不精确的设备／武器

inclusive.name: inclusive
inclusive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: An inclusive price or amount includes everything.

example.eg: My rent is $700 a month inclusive (of bills).
example.egtrans: 我的租金是每月700美元全包。

trans_examp.trans_en: including the first and last date or number stated
trans_examp.trans_cn: 包括首尾两天（或两个数字）的

example.eg: I'll be away from 20 to 31 May inclusive.
example.egtrans: 我将于5月20日（含）至31日（含）外出。

trans_examp.trans_en: An inclusive group or organization tries to include many different types of people and treat them all fairly and equally.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （团体或组织）可以包容各种人的

example.eg: Our aim is to create a fairer, more inclusive society.
example.egtrans: 我们的目标是建立一个更公平、更具包容性的社会。

incompatible.name: incompatible
incompatible.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not able to exist or work with another person or thing because of basic differences
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不相容的；不兼容的；不能和谐相处的

example.eg: When we started living together we realized how incompatible we were - our interests were so different.
example.egtrans: 开始共同生活后，我们发现彼此是多么合不来——我们的兴趣差别太大了。

example.eg: Maintaining quality is incompatible with increasing output.
example.egtrans: 保持质量和增加产量是相互对立的。

example.eg: Any new video system that is incompatible with existing ones has little chance of success.
example.egtrans: 任何与现有系统不兼容的新视频系统都难以成功。

incorporate.name: incorporate
incorporate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to include something as part of something larger

example.eg: Suggestions from the survey have been incorporated into/in the final design.
example.egtrans: 调查中取得的建议已被纳入了最终的设计之中。

example.eg: This aircraft incorporates several new safety features.
example.egtrans: 这种飞机具有几种新的安全特征。

incorrect.name: incorrect
incorrect.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not correct or not true

example.eg: an incorrect answer/diagnosis
example.egtrans: 错误的答案／诊断

example.eg: The assumptions made about the economy's rate of growth proved to be incorrect.
example.egtrans: 对经济增长率的推测证明是不正确的。

trans_examp.trans_en: not acceptable or not as it should be

example.eg: It's incorrect to address people by their first names at these formal events.
example.egtrans: 在这些正式的场合，直呼别人名字是不恰当的。

example.eg: incorrect grammar
example.egtrans: 不正确的语法

Incubation.name: incubation
Incubation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: incubation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process in which a bird, etc. keeps its eggs warm until the young come out, or the process in which an egg develops until the stage at which the young come out

example.eg: The incubation period varies depending on the time of year when the eggs were laid.
example.egtrans: 孵化期的长短取决于每年产卵的时间。

example.eg: The chemical makes eggshells so thin and porous that they break during incubation.
example.egtrans: 这种化学物质使蛋壳变得非常薄和多孔，以至于在孵化过程中会破裂。

dsense.name: incubation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process or period of time in which harmful bacteria or viruses increase in size or number in a person's or animal's body but do not yet produce the effects of disease

example.eg: In smallpox, there is an incubation period of 8–18 days between initial infection and first symptoms.
example.egtrans: 天花，从最初感染到出现第一个症状之间有8到18天的潜伏期。

example.eg: After about two weeks of incubation, symptoms begin.
example.egtrans: 大约两星期的潜伏期之后，症状开始出现。

indented.name: indent
indented.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: indent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a space at the edge or on the surface of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在…边沿（或表面）留出空间

example.eg: Each new paragraph should be indented about two centimetres from the margin.
example.egtrans: 每新起一段都应缩进约两厘米书写。

dsense.name: indent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make an official request for goods

example.eg: We indented for the engine spares last month.
example.egtrans: 我们上个月订购了发动机零件。

indented.name: indent
indented.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: indent
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a space at the edge or on the surface of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在…边沿（或表面）留出的空间

dsense.name: indent
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official request for goods

example.eg: We made an indent for the engine spares last week.
example.egtrans: 我们上周订购了发动机零件。

indicate.name: indicate
indicate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: indicate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show, point, or make clear in another way

example.eg: Exploratory investigations have indicated large amounts of oil below the sea bed.
example.egtrans: 勘测调查表明海床下有大量的石油。

example.eg: Please indicate which free gift you would like to receive.
example.egtrans: 请标出你想要哪种免费礼物。

example.eg: She indicated to me (that) she didn't want me to say anything.
example.egtrans: 她向我表示希望我什么都不要说。

dsense.name: indicate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show other road users that you intend to turn left or right when you are driving a vehicle
trans_examp.trans_cn: 打转向灯指示（车行方向）

trans_examp.trans_en: When a device indicates a value or change, it signals it.

example.eg: The gauge indicates a temperature below freezing.
example.egtrans: 测量器显示温度在冰点以下。

dsense.name: indicate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to suggest something as being suitable

example.eg: Antihistamine is indicated for this patient as a treatment for her allergies.
example.egtrans: 建议用抗组胺药来治疗这名病人的过敏症。

example.eg: I'm so hot and tired - I think a long cool drink is indicated!
example.egtrans: 我又热又累——需要来一大杯冷饮！

individual.name: individual
individual.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: individual
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a single person or thing, especially when compared to the group or set to which they belong

example.eg: Every individual has rights which must never be taken away.
example.egtrans: 每个人都有一些不可剥夺的权利。

example.eg: Like many creative individuals, she can be very bad-tempered.
example.egtrans: 像许多富有创造力的人一样，她的脾气有时会很不好。

example.eg: We try to treat our students as individuals.
example.egtrans: 我们力图把学生当成独立的个体来对待。

dsense.name: individual
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who thinks or behaves in their own original way
trans_examp.trans_cn: （思想或行为）与众不同的人，有个性的人

example.eg: If nothing else, the school will turn her into an individual.
example.egtrans: 即使不能有其他建树，这所学校至少会将她培养成为一个有其独特气质的人。

individual.name: individual
individual.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: individual
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing and considered separately from the other things or people in a group

example.eg: Each individual table is finished by hand.
example.egtrans: 每一张桌子都是手工做成的。

trans_examp.trans_en: given to or relating to a single, separate person or thing

example.eg: We deal with each case on an individual basis.
example.egtrans: 我们单独处理每个病例。

dsense.name: individual
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: belonging or relating to, or suitable for, people or things that are different or particular in some way

example.eg: children with individual needs
example.egtrans: 有各自需求的孩子

example.eg: Marion has a very individual writing style.
example.egtrans: 玛丽昂的写作风格与众不同。

industrial.name: industrial
industrial.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or related to industry, or having a lot of industry and factories, etc.

example.eg: industrial output
example.egtrans: 工业产量

example.eg: industrial expansion
example.egtrans: 工业扩张

example.eg: an industrial landscape/nation
example.egtrans: 工业地貌／国家

example.eg: He has an industrial background (= he has worked in industry).
example.egtrans: 他在业界工作过。

industrial.name: industrial
industrial.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a company whose main business is producing goods

example.eg: He owns a series of industrials across the US and beyond.
example.egtrans: 他在美国以及其他地区拥有一系列工业公司。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: shares in industrial companies

example.eg: On Thursday the industrials moved up more than 50 points.
example.egtrans: 在周四工业股上升了超过五十点。

example.eg: Industrials were up 1.2 percent at the close of trading.
example.egtrans: 在交易结束的时候工业股票上升了1.2个百分点。

infer.name: infer
infer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to form an opinion or guess that something is true because of the information that you have

example.eg: What do you infer from her refusal?
example.egtrans: 你从她的拒绝中能推断出什么？

example.eg: I inferred from her expression that she wanted to leave.
example.egtrans: 从她的表情上我可判断出她想离开。

inference.name: inference
inference.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a guess that you make or an opinion that you form based on the information that you have

example.eg: They were warned to expect a heavy air attack and by inference many casualties.
example.egtrans: 他们被警告可能会受到严厉的空中打击，由此推断会有许多人员伤亡。

example.eg: His change of mind was recent and sudden, the inference being that someone had persuaded him.
example.egtrans: 他最近突然改变了主意，估计是有人说服了他。

infinity.name: infinity
infinity.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: time or space that has no end

example.eg: the infinity of the universe
example.egtrans: 宇宙的无限

example.eg: the concept of infinity
example.egtrans: “无限”这个概念

trans_examp.trans_en: a place that is so far away that it cannot be reached

example.eg: The mountain range stretched away into infinity.
example.egtrans: 山脉延绵不绝。

trans_examp.trans_en: a number that is larger than all other numbers
an extremely large number of something

example.eg: an infinity of stars in the galaxy
example.egtrans: 星系中的点点繁星

ingredient.name: ingredient
ingredient.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a food that is used with other foods in the preparation of a particular dish

example.eg: The list of ingredients included 250 g of almonds.
example.egtrans: 清单上列出的原料包括250克的杏仁。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the parts of something successful

example.eg: Trust is a vital ingredient in a successful marriage.
example.egtrans: 信任是婚姻幸福的重要因素。

inherit.name: inherit
inherit.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: inherit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to receive money, a house, etc. from someone after they have died

example.eg: Who will inherit the house when he dies?
example.egtrans: 他死后由谁继承房子？

example.eg: All her children will inherit equally.
example.egtrans: 她所有的子女将平分遗产。

dsense.name: inherit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be born with the same physical or mental characteristics as one of your parents or grandparents

example.eg: Rosie inherited her red hair from her mother.
example.egtrans: 罗茜那头红发遗传自她母亲。

dsense.name: inherit
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to begin to have responsibility for a problem or situation that previously existed or belonged to another person
trans_examp.trans_cn: 接手，承担（遗留的问题等）

example.eg: When I took on the job of manager, I inherited certain financial problems.
example.egtrans: 我担任经理时接手了一些遗留的财务问题。

inheritance.name: inheritance
inheritance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: inheritance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: money or objects that someone gives you when they die

example.eg: The large inheritance from his aunt meant that he could buy his own boat.
example.egtrans: 从姑母那里继承的大笔遗产意味着他可以给自己买艘船了。

example.eg: At 21 she came into her inheritance (= it was given to her).
example.egtrans: 她21岁时继承了遗产。

dsense.name: inheritance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a physical or mental characteristic inherited from your parents, or the process by which this happens

example.eg: genetic inheritance
example.egtrans: 基因遗传

example.eg: A particular gene is responsible for the inheritance of eye colour.
example.egtrans: 眼睛颜色的遗传取决于特定的基因。

initialize.name: initialize
initialize.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to set the numbers, amounts, etc. in a computer program so that it is ready to start working

initially.name: initially
initially.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: at the beginning

example.eg: Initially, most people approved of the new plan.
example.egtrans: 起初，大部分人都同意这个新方案。

example.eg: The damage was far more serious than initially believed.
example.egtrans: 损失比开始认为的要严重得多。

inject.name: inject
inject.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: inject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use a needle and syringe (= small tube) to put a liquid such as a drug into a person's body

example.eg: Phil's a diabetic and has to inject himself with insulin every day.
example.egtrans: 菲尔患有糖尿病，每天都得给自己注射胰岛素。

dsense.name: inject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to introduce something new that is necessary or helpful to a situation or process

example.eg: A large amount of money will have to be injected into the company if it is to survive.
example.egtrans: 如果要挽救这家公司就必须注入大量资金。

example.eg: I tried to inject a little humour into the meeting.
example.egtrans: 我试图给会议增添些幽默气氛。

innermost.name: innermost
innermost.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: innermost
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: most secret and hidden

example.eg: This was the diary in which Gina recorded her innermost thoughts and secrets.
example.egtrans: 这是吉娜记载内心深处思想和秘密的那本日记。

dsense.name: innermost
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: nearest to the centre

example.eg: The spacecraft will fly through the innermost rings of Saturn.
example.egtrans: 宇宙飞船将穿越土星最内侧的光环。

inside.name: inside
inside.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the part, space, or side of something that is inside

example.eg: Did you clean the inside of the car?
example.egtrans: 你把车内部擦干净了吗？

example.eg: The hotel looked shabby from the street, but it was fine on the inside.
example.egtrans: 这家宾馆从街上看去显得很破旧，但里面很好。

example.eg: the insides of people's houses
example.egtrans: 人们的房子内部

trans_examp.trans_en: The inside of a part of the body such as the arm or leg is the part facing in towards the rest of the body.

example.eg: She dabbed perfume on the inside of her wrist.
example.egtrans: 她在手腕内侧搽了香水。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a person's or animal's internal organs, especially the stomach or bowels

example.eg: The dead seal's insides were spread all over the snow.
example.egtrans: 死海豹的内脏散落在雪地上。

inside.name: inside
inside.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in or into a room, building, container, or something similar
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（…）里面，在（…）内部；里面的，内部的

example.eg: "Is Anna in the garden?" "No, she's inside (= in the house)."
example.egtrans: “安娜在花园吗？”“不，她在屋里。”

example.eg: What's inside the box?
example.egtrans: 盒子里面是什么？

example.eg: Luckily, no one was inside the building when it collapsed.
example.egtrans: 幸运的是，房子倒塌时里面没有人。

example.eg: She couldn't cope with the grief she felt inside.
example.egtrans: 她无法承受内心的悲伤。

example.eg: Who can tell what goes on inside his head?
example.egtrans: 谁知道他脑袋里想的是什么？

example.eg: He put the documents carefully in his inside pocket (= pocket on the inside of a jacket or coat).
example.egtrans: 他把文件小心翼翼地放进外套内层的口袋里。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is inside out, it has the usual inside part on the outside and the usual outside part on the inside.

example.eg: She had her sweater on inside out.
example.egtrans: 她把羊毛衫穿反了。

inside.name: inside
inside.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you do something or if something happens inside (of) a particular time or limit, you do it or it happens in less than that amount of time or under the limit.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（某段时间）内；少于（某时间）

example.eg: The new faster trains can do the journey inside two hours.
example.egtrans: 新型快速列车两小时内就可跑完全程。

example.eg: He finished it inside of two hours.
example.egtrans: 他不到两个钟头就干完了。

inside.name: inside
inside.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of information) obtained by someone in a group, organization, or company and therefore involving special or secret knowledge

example.eg: inside information/knowledge
example.egtrans: 内部消息／内情

example.eg: I'll call up Clare and get the inside story (= a true report of the facts).
example.egtrans: 我将给克莱尔打电话了解内幕。

inside.name: inside
inside.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in prison

example.eg: Her husband's inside for armed robbery.
example.egtrans: 她的丈夫因持械抢劫而进了牢房。

insignificant.name: insignificant
insignificant.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: small or not noticeable, and therefore not considered important

example.eg: Why bother arguing about such an insignificant amount of money?
example.egtrans: 为什么为那点小钱争吵？

example.eg: The difference between the two results was insignificant.
example.egtrans: 两个结果之间的差别无足轻重。

inspection.name: inspection
inspection.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of looking at something carefully, or an official visit to a building or organization to check that everything is correct and legal

example.eg: Her passport seemed legitimate, but on closer inspection, it was found to have been altered.
example.egtrans: 她的护照看似合法，但仔细检查，发现做过手脚。

example.eg: She arrived to carry out/make a health and safety inspection of the building.
example.egtrans: 她来对大楼进行安全卫生检查。

trans_examp.trans_en: an examination of the structure of a building by a specially trained person

inspired.name: inspired
inspired.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: excellent, or resulting from inspiration

example.eg: an inspired performance/choice
example.egtrans: 精彩的表演／凭直觉做的选择

example.eg: an inspired suggestion/guess
example.egtrans: 凭灵感所做的建议／猜测

instance.name: instance
instance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular situation, event, or fact, especially an example of something that happens generally

example.eg: There have been several instances of violence at the school.
example.egtrans: 学校里发生过几起暴力事件。

example.eg: I don't usually side with the management, but in this instance I agree with what they're saying.
example.egtrans: 我通常并不站在资方一边，但在这件事情上我同意他们所说的。

instance.name: instance
instance.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something as an example

example.eg: She argued the need for legal reform and instanced several recent cases with grossly unfair verdicts.
example.egtrans: 她极力说明有必要进行司法改革，并引证了最近出现的几起非常不公平的判例。

instantiate.name: instantiate
instantiate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to represent or be an example of something

example.eg: He seems to instantiate a new type of masculinity.
example.egtrans: 他似乎在展示新的男子汉气概是什么样的。

instead of.name: instead of
instead of.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in place of someone or something

example.eg: You can go instead of me, if you want.
example.egtrans: 如果你愿意，你可以代替我去。

example.eg: Instead of complaining, why don't we try to change things?
example.egtrans: 与其抱怨，不如我们来作改变？

instead.name: instead
instead.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in place of someone or something else

example.eg: There's no coffee - would you like a cup of tea instead?
example.egtrans: 没有咖啡——来杯茶怎么样？

integer.name: integer
integer.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a whole number and not a fraction

example.eg: The numbers -5, 0, and 3 are integers.
example.egtrans: 数字-5，0和3都是整数。

integrate.name: integrate
integrate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to mix with and join society or a group of people, often changing to suit their way of life, habits, and customs
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）融入（某社会或群体）；（使）成为一体

example.eg: He seems to find it difficult to integrate socially.
example.egtrans: 他似乎觉得很难与别人打成一片。

example.eg: It's very difficult to integrate yourself into a society whose culture is so different from your own.
example.egtrans: 让自己融入一个文化上完全不同的社会是非常困难的。

example.eg: Children are often very good at integrating into a new culture.
example.egtrans: 孩子们常常很善于融入新的文化。

trans_examp.trans_en: to combine two or more things in order to become more effective

example.eg: You need to integrate exercise into your normal life.
example.egtrans: 你必须让锻炼成为你日常生活的一部分。

example.eg: The idea with young children is to integrate learning with play.
example.egtrans: 对幼儿的理念是寓教于乐。

integration.name: integration
integration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: integration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the action or process of successfully joining or mixing with a different group of people

example.eg: racial/cultural integration
example.egtrans: 种族/文化融合

example.eg: To promote integration, several schools' catchment areas were merged.
example.egtrans: 为了促进融合，合并了几所学校的学区。

trans_examp.trans_en: the action or process of combining two or more things in an effective way

example.eg: He creates a seamless integration of contemporary and historic images.
example.egtrans: 他完成了当代和历史图像的无缝整合。

example.eg: The heads of government were trying to encourage regional integration.
example.egtrans: 各国政府首脑正努力鼓励区域一体化。

dsense.name: integration
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of calculating the integral of a function

example.eg: Integration can be used to find areas, volumes, central points, and many other useful things in addition to finding the area under the graph of a function.
example.egtrans: 除了查找函数图形下的面积外，积分还可用于查找面积、体积、中心点和许多其他有用的东西。

intended.name: intended
intended.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the person that you are going to marry

example.eg: I shall be there with my intended.
example.egtrans: 我将和我的意中人一起去那儿。

interact.name: interact
interact.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to communicate with or react to
trans_examp.trans_cn: 交流，交往；互相作用，互相影响

example.eg: Dominique's teacher says that she interacts well with the other children.
example.egtrans: 多米尼克的老师说她与别的孩子相处得很好。

example.eg: It's interesting at parties to see how people interact socially.
example.egtrans: 在聚会上看人们如何交流沟通是很有趣的。

example.eg: We are studying how these two chemicals interact.
example.egtrans: 我们在研究这两种化学物质是如何相互作用的。

interaction.name: interaction
interaction.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when two or more people or things communicate with or react to each other
trans_examp.trans_cn: 交流，交往；相互作用，相互影响

example.eg: There's not enough interaction between the management and the workers.
example.egtrans: 管理部门与工人之间的沟通不够。

example.eg: Language games are usually intended to encourage student interaction.
example.egtrans: 语言游戏通常用来鼓励学生间的交流。

example.eg: The play follows the interactions of three very different characters.
example.egtrans: 该剧以3个性格迥异的人物之间的交往为主线展开情节。

interactive.name: interactive
interactive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: An interactive system or computer program is designed to involve the user in the exchange of information.

example.eg: an interactive game/video
example.egtrans: 交互式游戏／视频

example.eg: This is an interactive museum where children can actively manipulate the exhibits.
example.egtrans: 这是一个互动式博物馆，孩子们可以亲手摆弄展品。

trans_examp.trans_en: involving communication between people

example.eg: interactive teaching methods
example.egtrans: 互动式教学法

intercept.name: intercept
intercept.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stop and catch something or someone before that thing or person is able to reach a particular place

example.eg: Law enforcement agents intercepted a shipment of drugs from Central America.
example.egtrans: 执法人员截获了一批从中美洲运来的毒品。

example.eg: Barry intercepted Naylor's pass and scored the third goal.
example.egtrans: 巴里断下内勒尔的传球，射入了第3个球。

interchangeable.name: interchangeable
interchangeable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to be exchanged with each other without making any difference or without being noticed

example.eg: interchangeable parts
example.egtrans: 可相互替换的部件

example.eg: The terms "drinking problem" and "alcohol abuse" are often interchangeable.
example.egtrans: drinking problem 和 alcohol abuse 两个术语往往可以互换使用。

interconnect.name: interconnect
interconnect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of two or more things) to connect with or be related to each other
trans_examp.trans_cn: （两个或多个事物间）互相连接，互相联系

example.eg: The problems of poverty and unemployment are all interconnected.
example.egtrans: 贫穷与失业问题是互相联系的。

interface.name: interface
interface.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a connection between two pieces of electronic equipment, or between a person and a computer

example.eg: My computer has a network interface, which allows me to get to other computers.
example.egtrans: 我的计算机有网络接口，可以与其他计算机连在一起。

example.eg: The new version of the program comes with a much better user interface (= way of showing information to a user) than the original.
example.egtrans: 新版程序的用户界面比原来的好得多。

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation, way, or place where two things come together and affect each other

example.eg: the interface between technology and tradition
example.egtrans: 技术与传统的相互影响

example.eg: We need a clearer interface between management and the workforce.
example.egtrans: 我们希望管理层与员工之间的沟通更加顺畅。

interface.name: interface
interface.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to connect two or more pieces of equipment, such as computers

example.eg: The computers must be properly interfaced.
example.egtrans: 各计算机之间必须连接好。

trans_examp.trans_en: to communicate with someone, especially in a work-related situation
trans_examp.trans_cn: 互相联系；互相交流；（尤指）互相配合工作

example.eg: We use email to interface with our customers.
example.egtrans: 我们使用电子邮件与客户联系。

interfere.name: interfere
interfere.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to involve yourself in a situation when your involvement is not wanted or is not helpful

example.eg: It's their problem and I'm not going to interfere.
example.egtrans: 那是他们的问题，我不想干预。

example.eg: I'd never interfere between (US with) a husband and wife.
example.egtrans: 我从不会干涉两夫妻间的事。

example.eg: Interfering in other people's relationships is always a mistake.
example.egtrans: 干涉他人谈恋爱从来都是不对的。

interleave.name: interleave
interleave.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put layers or flat pieces of something between layers or flat pieces of something else
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在书页或扁平的物体间）插入

example.eg: They interleaved the pages with absorbent paper to dry them out.
example.egtrans: 他们在书页之间用吸水纸隔开，以便把书页弄干。

trans_examp.trans_en: to combine different things so that parts of one thing are put between parts of another thing

example.eg: The film interleaves extracts from her father's autobiography with family interviews.
example.egtrans: 这部电影将她父亲的自传片段与家庭访谈交织在一起。

intermediate.name: intermediate
intermediate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: being between two other related things, levels, or points

example.eg: There are three levels of difficulty in this game: low, intermediate, and high.
example.egtrans: 这个游戏有3个难度级别：低级、中级和高级。

example.eg: This novel is too difficult for intermediate students of English.
example.egtrans: 这部小说对于中等程度的英语学习者来说太难了。

internally.name: internally
internally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: internally
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that exists or happens within a person's mind

example.eg: What I did was symbolic of how I was feeling internally.
example.egtrans: 我的所作所为足以表达我的内心感受。

interpolation.name: interpolation
interpolation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the addition of something different in the middle of a text, piece of music, etc. or the thing that is added
trans_examp.trans_cn: 插入；插入物；插入的文字（或音乐等）

example.eg: An actor reads the poems in English translation, with brief musical interpolations.
example.egtrans: 一位演员朗读了诗歌的英文翻译，并配有简短的音乐插曲。

example.eg: The play is based on factual accounts with creative interpolation.
example.egtrans: 这部剧在叙述事实的基础上插入了虚构成分。

trans_examp.trans_en: the addition of a number or item into the middle of a series, calculated based on the numbers or items before and after it; a number or item added like this
trans_examp.trans_cn: 内插；插值；通过已知的数据点，在范围内推求新数据点的过程或方法。

example.eg: Sometimes the data were years apart and interpolations were made for all months in between.
example.egtrans: 有时数据相隔数年，并且在其间的所有月份都进行了插值。

example.eg: For other years estimates were made by interpolation.
example.egtrans: 其他年份的估算是通过插值进行的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a remark that interrupts someone or something

example.eg: They were not amused by his comical interpolations.
example.egtrans: 他的插科打诨令别人不快。

interpret.name: interpret
interpret.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: interpret
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to decide what the intended meaning of something is

example.eg: It's difficult to interpret these statistics without knowing how they were obtained.
example.egtrans: 不了解这些统计数字是怎样得来的就难以理解它们。

example.eg: A jury should not interpret the silence of a defendant as a sign of guilt.
example.egtrans: 陪审团不应该将被告的沉默看作是有罪的表示。
