dsense.name: interpret
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to express your own ideas about the intended meaning of a play or a piece of music when performing it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （表演者根据本人对作品的理解）表演，演绎

example.eg: If Shakespeare's plays are to reach a large audience they need to be interpreted in a modern style.
example.egtrans: 要使莎士比亚的戏剧让大量观众去接受，就需要用现代的风格去演绎。

dsense.name: interpret
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change what someone is saying into another language

example.eg: We had to ask our guide to interpret for us.
example.egtrans: 我们不得不请导游为我们翻译。

intersection.name: intersection
intersection.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: intersection
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when two lines cross, or the place where this happens

example.eg: The intersection of the lines on the graph marks the point where we start to make a profit.
example.egtrans: 图上几条线的交点就是我们的开始盈利点。

dsense.name: intersection
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the place where two or more roads join or cross each other

example.eg: a busy intersection
example.egtrans: 繁忙的十字路口

example.eg: Turn right at the next intersection.
example.egtrans: 在下个十字路口向右拐。

Interval.name: interval
Interval.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: interval
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a period between two events or times

example.eg: We see each other at regular intervals - usually about once a month.
example.egtrans: 我们定期见面——通常大约是每月一次。

trans_examp.trans_en: the space between two points

example.eg: The plants should be spaced at six-inch intervals.
example.egtrans: 这些植物应该以六英尺的间隔栽种。

trans_examp.trans_en: a short period between the parts of a performance or a sports event
trans_examp.trans_cn: （演出的）幕间休息；（体育比赛的）中间休息，中场休息

example.eg: There will be two 20-minute intervals during the opera.
example.egtrans: 歌剧演出中有两次20分钟的幕间休息。

example.eg: He scored his first goal of the match three minutes after the interval.
example.egtrans: 下半场刚开始3分钟，他就射入了他本场比赛的第一个进球。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: repeated after a particular period of time or a particular distance

example.eg: In the event of fire, the alarm will sound at 15-second intervals/at intervals of 15 seconds.
example.egtrans: 发生火灾时，警报每隔15秒就会响一次。

dsense.name: interval
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount by which one note is higher or lower than another

example.eg: an interval of a fifth (= between one note and another one four notes higher)
example.egtrans: 五度音程

intimately.name: intimately
intimately.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: closely in a personal or sexual way

example.eg: The two of them have been intimately involved for a year.
example.egtrans: 他们两人已经亲密交往了一年。

example.eg: I got to know him very intimately.
example.egtrans: 我和他的关系变得十分亲密。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a very detailed way

example.eg: She's been intimately involved in the project since it began.
example.egtrans: 自项目开始以来，她一直密切参与其中。

example.eg: He knew the area intimately.
example.egtrans: 他对这个地区了如指掌。

introduce.name: introduce
introduce.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: introduce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put something into use, operation, or a place for the first time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 采用；引进；推行；放入，插入

example.eg: Apple has sold many millions of iPods since the product was introduced in 2001.
example.egtrans: 自从2001年首次推出该产品以来，苹果公司已经售出了成百上千万台iPod。

example.eg: Such unpopular legislation is unlikely to be introduced before the next election.
example.egtrans: 如此不受欢迎的立法不可能在下次选举之前提出。

example.eg: The tube which carries the laser is introduced into the abdomen through a small cut in the skin.
example.egtrans: 传送激光的导管通过皮肤上的小切口插入腹部。

dsense.name: introduce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to tell someone another person's name the first time that they meet

example.eg: I'd like to introduce my son, Mark.
example.egtrans: 我想介绍一下我的儿子马克。

example.eg: Have you two been introduced (to each other)?
example.egtrans: 介绍你们俩认识了吗？

dsense.name: introduce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be the beginning of something

example.eg: A haunting oboe solo introduces the third movement of the concerto.
example.egtrans: 协奏曲第三乐章以一段摄人心魄的双簧管独奏开始。

trans_examp.trans_en: to speak or write before the beginning of a performance, programme or book and give information about it; to tell an audience about the person who is going to speak, sing, etc.

example.eg: The director will introduce the film personally at its premiere.
example.egtrans: 导演将在这部影片的全球首映式上亲自推介该片。

example.eg: This is the first official biography of her and it is introduced by her daughter.
example.egtrans: 这是她的第一部正式传记，由其女儿作序。

example.eg: I'd now like to introduce our next guest, who will be singing songs from her latest album.
example.egtrans: 现在我想介绍我们的下一位嘉宾，她将为我们演唱她最新大碟里的歌曲。

introduction.name: introduction
introduction.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: introduction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when something is put into use or brought to a place for the first time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 采用；引进；推行；放入，插入

example.eg: The introduction of new working practices has dramatically improved productivity.
example.egtrans: 采用新的工作方法已经显著提高了生产率。

example.eg: Within a year of its introduction, questions began to emerge about the safety of the drug.
example.egtrans: 投入使用不到一年，有关这种药品安全的问题就已经出现了。

example.eg: The introduction of the tube into the artery is a very delicate procedure.
example.egtrans: 将导管插入动脉是一个非常精细的手术。

dsense.name: introduction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the action of telling someone another person's name the first time that they meet

example.eg: You'll have to do/make the introductions - I don't know everyone's name.
example.egtrans: 你得作个介绍——我可不知道每个人的名字。

example.eg: My next guest needs no introduction (= is already known to everyone).
example.egtrans: 我的下一位客人大家都认识，就用不着介绍了。

dsense.name: introduction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the first part of something

example.eg: Have you read the introduction to the third edition?
example.egtrans: 你看了第三版的绪论吗？

example.eg: The song's great, but the introduction's a bit too long.
example.egtrans: 这首歌很棒，但前奏部分太长了。

dsense.name: introduction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the first time someone experiences something

example.eg: That trip was my introduction to winter sports.
example.egtrans: 那次旅行是我第一次接触冬季运动。

dsense.name: introduction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a book or course that provides basic knowledge about a subject

example.eg: an introduction to psychology
example.egtrans: 心理学入门

intuition.name: intuition
intuition.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (knowledge from) an ability to understand or know something immediately based on your feelings rather than facts

example.eg: Often there's no clear evidence one way or the other and you just have to base your judgment on intuition.
example.egtrans: 很多时候，往往没有这样或那样的确凿证据，你只得凭直觉进行判断。

example.eg: I can't explain how I knew - I just had an intuition that you'd been involved in an accident.
example.egtrans: 我无法解释我是如何知道的，我只是凭直觉感到你卷入了一场事故。

invalid.name: invalid
invalid.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: An invalid document, ticket, law, etc. is not legally or officially acceptable.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （文件、票、法律等）无效的，不合法的，官方不承认的

example.eg: I'm afraid your driving licence is invalid in Eastern Europe.
example.egtrans: 恐怕你的驾驶证在东欧无效。

trans_examp.trans_en: An invalid opinion, argument, etc. is not correct, usually because it is not logical or not based on correct information.

example.eg: an invalid argument
example.egtrans: 站不住脚的论点

invalid.name: invalid
invalid.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who is sick and unable to take care of himself or herself, especially for a long time
trans_examp.trans_cn: （常指需要他人长期照料的）病人

example.eg: Is the invalid in bed?
example.egtrans: 那位病人在床上躺着吗？

invent.name: invent
invent.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: invent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to design and/or create something that has never been made before

example.eg: The first safety razor was invented by company founder King C. Gillette in 1903.
example.egtrans: 第一把安全剃刀由公司创始人金‧坎普‧吉列于1903年发明。

dsense.name: invent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to create a reason, excuse, story, etc. that is not true, usually to deceive someone

example.eg: But I didn't invent the story - everything I told you is true.
example.egtrans: 但我没有胡编——我告诉你的都是真的。

inventor.name: inventor
inventor.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who has invented something or whose job is to invent things

inverse.name: inverse
inverse.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: opposite in relation to something else

example.eg: Their generosity was in inverse proportion/relation to their income (= the more money they had the less generous they were).
example.egtrans: 他们的慷慨程度与他们的收入水平成反比。

inverse.name: inverse
inverse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the opposite

example.eg: Dividing by two is the inverse of multiplying by two.
example.egtrans: 除以2与乘以2正好相反。

invert.name: invert
invert.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to turn something upside down or change the order of two things

example.eg: In some languages, the word order in questions is inverted (= the verb comes before the subject of the sentence).
example.egtrans: 在有些语言里，疑问句的词序是颠倒的。

invoke.name: invoke
invoke.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use a law in order to achieve something, or to mention something in order to explain something or to support your opinion or action

example.eg: Police can invoke the law to regulate access to these places.
example.egtrans: 警方可以借助有关法律来约束人们进入这些地方。

trans_examp.trans_en: to request help from someone, especially a god, when you want to improve a situation
trans_examp.trans_cn: 求助于，借助于（尤指神灵）

example.eg: Their sacred dance is performed to invoke ancient gods.
example.egtrans: 他们表演圣舞以祈求古代神灵保佑。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone have a particular feeling or remember something

involved.name: involved
involved.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: involved
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not simple and therefore difficult to understand

example.eg: an involved reason/excuse/argument
example.egtrans: 复杂的原因／借口／论据

example.eg: The plot of the film was too involved - I couldn't understand it.
example.egtrans: 这部影片的情节过分复杂——我看不懂。

dsense.name: involved
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: being in a close relationship with someone

example.eg: emotionally/romantically involved
example.egtrans: 产生感情的／堕入情网的

example.eg: Try not to become too emotionally involved with the children in your care.
example.egtrans: 尽量不要对你所照顾的孩子过于牵肠挂肚。

isolated.name: isolated
isolated.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not near to other places

example.eg: an isolated farm/village
example.egtrans: 偏僻的农场／村庄

trans_examp.trans_en: happening or existing only once, separate

example.eg: There were only a few isolated cases of violent behaviour.
example.egtrans: 只有几例孤立的暴力事件。

trans_examp.trans_en: feeling unhappy because of not seeing or talking to other people

example.eg: Working at home was making her feel increasingly isolated.
example.egtrans: 在家工作使她越来越觉得与世隔绝。

issue.name: issue
issue.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: issue
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a subject or problem that people are thinking and talking about

example.eg: environmental/ethical/personal issues
example.egtrans: 环境／道德／个人问题

example.eg: As employers we need to be seen to be addressing (= dealing with) these issues sympathetically.
example.egtrans: 作为雇主，我们需要让大家知道我们在处理这些问题时富有同情心。

example.eg: Don't worry about who will do it - that's just a side issue (= not the main problem).
example.egtrans: 不要担心这件事由谁来做——那只是次要问题。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: most important in what is being discussed
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （所讨论问题中）最重要的，关键的

example.eg: The point at issue is what is best for the child.
example.egtrans: 问题的关键在于什么样的东西对孩子最好。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make something seem more important than it should be, or to argue about it

example.eg: Of course I'll help you, there's no need to make an issue of it.
example.egtrans: 我当然会帮你，没必要把这一点小题大作。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to disagree strongly
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 对…持强烈异议，很不赞同

example.eg: I took issue with him over his interpretation of the instructions.
example.egtrans: 我不赞同他对命令的理解。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have difficulty or disagreement with someone or something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 有问题（或麻烦）；（与…）有分歧

example.eg: All the people in the study had low self-esteem and had issues with their bodies.
example.egtrans: 研究中的所有对象自尊心都不强，对自身体形都有所不满。

example.eg: Anna has major issues with her employer.
example.egtrans: 安娜与她的老板有严重分歧。

dsense.name: issue
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of newspapers or magazines published at the same time or a single copy of a newspaper or magazine

example.eg: There's an article on motorbikes in the latest/next issue.
example.egtrans: 在最近一期／下一期上有一篇关于摩托车的文章。

example.eg: An old issue of "Homes and Gardens" lay on the table.
example.egtrans: 桌子上放着一本过期的《家庭与花园》杂志。

trans_examp.trans_en: An issue of shares is a time when a company gives people the chance to buy part of it or gives extra shares to people who already own some.

issue.name: issue
issue.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to produce or provide something official

example.eg: The office will be issuing permits on Tuesday and Thursday mornings.
example.egtrans: 办事处将在周二和周四的上午颁发许可证。

example.eg: The school issued a statement about its plans to the press./The school issued the press with a statement about its plans.
example.egtrans: 学校就其计划向新闻界发表了一项声明。

iterate.name: iterate
iterate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to repeat a process, especially as part of a computer program
trans_examp.trans_cn: 反复（尤指电脑程序里重复某一过程）

iteration.name: iteration
iteration.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of doing something again and again, usually to improve it, or one of the times you do it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 反复（通常为了作出改善而重复做某事）

example.eg: the repetition and iteration that goes on in designing something
example.egtrans: 在设计某物时的重复与反复修改

example.eg: The software is on its fifth iteration.
example.egtrans: 这个软件已经是第五版。

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount that you get when you use a mathematical rule several times
trans_examp.trans_cn: 迭代，叠代（数学里若干次使用一个数学法则得出的量）

justify.name: justify
justify.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give or to be a good reason for
trans_examp.trans_cn: 为…辩护；证明…正当（或有理、正确）；是…的正当理由

example.eg: I can't really justify taking another day off work.
example.egtrans: 我真的找不出理由再多休一天假了。

example.eg: Are you sure that these measures are justified?
example.egtrans: 你确定这些措施合理吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you justify yourself, you give a good reason for what you have done.

example.eg: It was the only thing that I could do - I don't have to justify myself to anyone.
example.egtrans: 这是我唯一能做的——我不必向任何人解释。

knowledge.name: knowledge
knowledge.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: understanding of or information about a subject that you get by experience or study, either known by one person or by people generally
trans_examp.trans_cn: 知识；学问；学识；了解；理解

example.eg: Her knowledge of English grammar is very extensive.
example.egtrans: 她的英语语法知识很广博。

example.eg: He has a limited knowledge of French.
example.egtrans: 他对法语所知有限。

example.eg: The details of the scandal are now common knowledge (= familiar to most people).
example.egtrans: 丑闻的详情现在众所周知。

example.eg: She started to photograph the documents, safe in the knowledge that (= knowing that) she wouldn't be disturbed for at least an hour.
example.egtrans: 她开始对文件拍照，确信至少一小时内不会有人打扰。

example.eg: In this town there are only a couple of restaurants that to my knowledge (= judging from my personal experience and information) serve good food.
example.egtrans: 据我所知，这个镇上只有几家餐馆菜品不错。

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of knowing about or being familiar with something

example.eg: They both deny all knowledge of the affair.
example.egtrans: 他们俩完全否认知道此事。

example.eg: It has come/been brought to our knowledge (= we have discovered) that several computers have gone missing.
example.egtrans: 我们发现有几台电脑不见了。

label.name: label
label.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: label
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper or other material that gives you information about the object it is attached to

example.eg: Remember to put some address labels on the suitcases.
example.egtrans: 别忘了把地址标签贴在行李箱上。

example.eg: Washing instructions should be on the label.
example.egtrans: 标签上应该注明洗涤注意事项。

trans_examp.trans_en: a word or a phrase that is used to describe the characteristics or qualities of people, activities, or things, often in a way that is unfair
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用来描述人、活动或事物特点或特性的，常为不公正的）称号，绰号

example.eg: He seems to be stuck with the label of "troublemaker".
example.egtrans: 他好像被人贴上了“麻烦制造者”的标签。

dsense.name: label
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a company that produces goods for sale, the goods themselves, or the company's name or symbol
trans_examp.trans_cn: 公司；品牌商品；公司名称；公司标志

example.eg: Her favourite designer label (= maker of expensive clothes) is Armani.
example.egtrans: 她最喜欢的服装品牌是阿玛尼。

example.eg: Their own-label vegetarian products have been a huge success.
example.egtrans: 他们自有品牌的素食产品非常受欢迎。

example.eg: The group have just signed (= arranged to record) with a new record label.
example.egtrans: 该演唱组合刚刚与一家新的唱片公司签约。

label.name: label
label.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fasten a label to

example.eg: The parcel was clearly labelled "Fragile".
example.egtrans: 这个包裹上清楚地标着“易碎品”。

example.eg: If you spend any time in prison, you're labelled as a criminal for the rest of your life.
example.egtrans: 一旦入过狱，“罪犯”的帽子就会一辈子扣在你的头上。

landscape.name: landscape
landscape.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large area of countryside, especially in relation to its appearance
trans_examp.trans_cn: 乡间，野外；（尤指乡村的）风景，景色

example.eg: a rural/barren landscape
example.egtrans: 乡村／荒原

example.eg: The landscape is dotted with the tents of campers and hikers.
example.egtrans: 乡间散布着宿营者和远足者搭起的帐篷。

example.eg: The cathedral dominates the landscape for miles around.
example.egtrans: 大教堂在方圆数英里的乡间高高耸立着。

trans_examp.trans_en: a view or picture of the countryside, or the art of making such pictures
trans_examp.trans_cn: 乡村风景；乡村风景画；乡村风景绘画

example.eg: a watercolour landscape
example.egtrans: 水彩风景画

example.eg: J.M.W. Turner is one of the best-known British landscape painters.
example.egtrans: J.M.W.特纳是英国最著名的风景画画家之一。

landscape.name: landscape
landscape.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change the appearance of an area of land, especially next to a building or road so that it looks more like natural countryside
trans_examp.trans_cn: 给（建筑物周边）做园林美化；对（道路周边）做景观美化

landscape.name: landscape
landscape.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A landscape document is to be printed with the longer side of the paper at the top and bottom.

launch.name: launch
launch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an event to celebrate or introduce something new

example.eg: How much champagne will we need for the launch?
example.egtrans: 这次发布会我们需要多少香槟酒？

example.eg: Illness prevented her attending the launch party for her latest novel.
example.egtrans: 她因病无法出席为她新近推出的小说举办的庆祝聚会。

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when a ship is put into water, or a spacecraft is sent into space, for the first time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 下水（船首次出航）；发射（火箭首次升空）

example.eg: The launch of the space shuttle was delayed for 24 hours because of bad weather.
example.egtrans: 因天气情况不佳，宇宙飞船的发射被推迟了24个小时。

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a boat that has an engine and carries passengers for short distances, especially on a lake or a river, or from the land to a larger boat
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指河或湖上的）汽艇，摩托艇

launch.name: launch
launch.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to begin something such as a plan or introduce something new such as a product

example.eg: The programme was launched a year ago.
example.egtrans: 这项计划是1年前开始实施的。

example.eg: The airline will launch its new transatlantic service next month.
example.egtrans: 这家航空公司下个月将开辟一条新的跨越大西洋的航线。

example.eg: A devastating attack was launched on the rebel stronghold.
example.egtrans: 向叛军堡垒发起了猛烈的进攻。

example.eg: After working for the company for several years she decided to launch out on her own and set up in business.
example.egtrans: 在为该公司工作数年后，她决定在商界自立门户。

dsense.name: launch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send something out, such as a new ship into the water or a spacecraft into space

example.eg: A spokesman for the dockyard said they hoped to launch the first submarine within two years.
example.egtrans: 船厂发言人说他们希望在两年内让第一艘潜艇下水。

example.eg: to launch a missile
example.egtrans: 发射导弹

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to jump with great force

example.eg: The defender launched himself at the attacking player, bringing him to the ground.
example.egtrans: 防守队员猛地扑向进攻者，把他摔倒在地。

layer.name: layer
layer.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: layer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a level of material, such as a type of rock or gas, that is different from the material above or below it, or a thin sheet of a substance

example.eg: the ozone layer
example.egtrans: 臭氧层

example.eg: A thick layer of clay lies over the sandstone.
example.egtrans: 沙岩上面有一层厚厚的黏土。

example.eg: There was a thin layer of oil on the surface of the water.
example.egtrans: 水面上有一层薄薄的油膜。

example.eg: We stripped several layers of paint off the door.
example.egtrans: 我们从门上剥落了好几层漆。

dsense.name: layer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the group of people at a particular level in an organization

example.eg: We've cut the number of management layers from five to three.
example.egtrans: 我们把管理层次从五层砍到了三层。

layer.name: layer
layer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange something in layers
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…按层排列，把…分层放置

example.eg: Layer the pasta with slices of tomato.
example.egtrans: 把西红柿片分层摆放在意大利面里。

example.eg: potatoes layered with onions
example.egtrans: 土豆夹洋葱片

trans_examp.trans_en: to cut hair so that some top parts of the hair are shorter than the hair underneath, to give it a particular style or shape

example.eg: Can you layer it a little at the front, please?
example.egtrans: 能请你把前面的头发剪出一点层次吗？

leading.name: leading
leading.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very important or most important

example.eg: a leading expert on the country's ecology
example.egtrans: 研究该国生态的顶级专家

example.eg: the world's leading manufacturer of audio equipment
example.egtrans: 世界顶级音响制造商

leading.name: leading
leading.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the lead (= type of metal) used to cover (parts of) a roof

legacy.name: legacy
legacy.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: money or property that you receive from someone after they die

example.eg: An elderly cousin had left her a small legacy.
example.egtrans: 一位堂兄留给她一小笔遗产。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is a part of your history or that remains from an earlier time

example.eg: The Greeks have a rich legacy of literature.
example.egtrans: 希腊人有丰富的文学遗产。

example.eg: The war has left a legacy of hatred.
example.egtrans: 那场战争给人们留下了仇恨。

lenient.name: lenient
lenient.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not as severe or strong in punishment or judgment as would be expected
trans_examp.trans_cn: （处罚或判决）宽容的，宽大的，从轻的

example.eg: They believe that judges are too lenient with terrorist suspects.
example.egtrans: 他们认为法官对恐怖嫌疑分子过于宽容。

example.eg: In view of the quantity of drugs involved, 16 years was the most lenient sentence (= punishment) the judge could impose.
example.egtrans: 就涉及的毒品数量而言，16年徒刑已是法官所能作出的最轻判决了。

letter.name: letter
letter.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: letter
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a written message from one person to another, usually put in an envelope and sent by post

example.eg: I got a letter from the bank this morning.
example.egtrans: 今天早晨我收到了一封银行的来函。

dsense.name: letter
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any of the set of symbols used to write a language, representing a sound in the language

example.eg: the letter D
example.egtrans: 字母D

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the exact words of the law and not its more important general meaning

letter.name: letter
letter.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to a standard size of paper in the US, 8.5 inches by 11 inches
trans_examp.trans_cn: （美国）标准信纸（长11英寸，宽8.5英寸）

example.eg: Fliers are usually printed either on letter size or legal size paper.
example.egtrans: 印传单的纸一般是标准信纸或法律规格纸。

leverage.name: leverage
leverage.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: leverage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the action or advantage of using a lever

example.eg: Using ropes and wooden poles for leverage, they haul sacks of cement up the track.
example.egtrans: 利用绳子和木棍取得杠杆作用，他们把几大袋水泥从轨道上拖开。

dsense.name: leverage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: power to influence people and get the results you want

example.eg: If the United Nations had more troops in the area, it would have greater leverage.
example.egtrans: 如果联合国在该地区有更多的军队，就会有更大的影响力。

dsense.name: leverage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the relationship between the amount of money that a company owes to banks and the value of the company
trans_examp.trans_cn: 杠杆比率（公司举债数目与其价值之比）

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of using borrowed money to buy an investment or a company
trans_examp.trans_cn: 借贷收购，信贷投机，杠杆作用

example.eg: With leverage, the investor's $100,000 buys $500,000 or more of stock if he wants.
example.egtrans: 通过举债经营的方式，投资人的10万美元买到了价值50万美元或更多的股票。

leverage.name: leverage
leverage.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: leverage
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use something that you already have in order to achieve something new or better
trans_examp.trans_cn: 借助已有的…实现新（或更好）的目标

example.eg: We can gain a market advantage by leveraging our network of partners.
example.egtrans: 我们可以借助合伙人网络获得市场优势。

dsense.name: leverage
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use borrowed money to buy an investment or company
trans_examp.trans_cn: 借贷收购，信贷投机，杠杆作用

example.eg: Home equity is invaluable if you leverage it to build wealth.
example.egtrans: 你的房产如果能作为贷款担保融资，那将极有价值。

trans_examp.trans_en: to use money to get more money

example.eg: One of the easiest ways to leverage a charitable gift is to get your employer to match it.
example.egtrans: 让一笔慈善捐赠款增加的最容易的办法是让你的雇主捐出同样多的钱。

lexical.name: lexical
lexical.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to words

liability.name: liability
liability.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: liability
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that someone is legally responsible for something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （法律上对某事物的）责任，义务

example.eg: He denies any liability for the damage caused.
example.egtrans: 他对造成的损失拒绝承担任何责任。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: debts

example.eg: The business has liabilities of 2 million euros.
example.egtrans: 该公司负债达200万欧元。

dsense.name: liability
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something or someone that causes you a lot of trouble, often when that thing or person should be helping you

example.eg: After a certain age, a car's just a liability.
example.egtrans: 汽车在使用了一定年限后就会变成一个累赘。

example.eg: Sue always manages to upset somebody when we go out - she's a real liability.
example.egtrans: 我们出去玩时休总是让人扫兴——她真是个累赘。

liberally.name: liberally
liberally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: liberally
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is involves large amounts of something

example.eg: Apply the cream liberally to the affected area.
example.egtrans: 把药膏厚厚地涂在患处。

example.eg: Banks are lending money more liberally than ever.
example.egtrans: 银行放贷比以往都宽松。

dsense.name: liberally
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is not exact or exactly correct
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不确切地，模糊地，笼统地

example.eg: In describing him as an author I guess you're using the word very liberally?
example.egtrans: 把他描述成一个作家，我想你这个用词很大方啊？

dsense.name: liberally
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that allows a lot of freedom for different types of belief or behavior

example.eg: She was raised very liberally by her parents.
example.egtrans: 她的父母对她的教育非常宽松。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is politically liberal

example.eg: He mistakenly thought he could vote as liberally as he wanted in Washington.
example.egtrans: 他误以为自己可以在华盛顿随心所欲地投票。

license.name: license
license.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
US spelling of 
        
         licence

license.name: license
license.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone official permission to do or have something

example.eg: Several companies have been licensed to sell these products.
example.egtrans: 一些公司获得了这些产品的销售许可。

life.name: life
life.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the period between birth and death, or the experience or state of being alive
trans_examp.trans_cn: 寿命；生命；一生，人生；生活；性命

example.eg: Life's too short to worry about money!
example.egtrans: 人生短暂，何必为金钱而烦恼！

example.eg: I'm not sure I want to spend the rest of my life with him.
example.egtrans: 我不能肯定自己是否愿意与他共度余生。

example.eg: Unfortunately, accidents are part of life.
example.egtrans: 不幸的是，意外事故也是生活的一部分。

example.eg: He went mad towards the end of his life.
example.egtrans: 他在生命走向终了时疯掉了。

example.eg: Cats are supposed to have nine lives.
example.egtrans: 据说猫有九命。

example.eg: He doesn't know what he really wants in/out of life.
example.egtrans: 他不知道自己在生活中真正想要的是什么。

example.eg: The accident changed my whole outlook on life.
example.egtrans: 那场事故彻底改变了我对人生的看法。

example.eg: He lost his life (= died suddenly because of a violent event or accident) in the Great War.
example.egtrans: 他在一战中丧生。

example.eg: A simple mixture of glucose and water can save lives in many parts of the world.
example.egtrans: 在世界上很多地方，把葡萄糖和水混合在一起就可以用来拯救人的性命。

example.eg: He ran off with her life savings (= all the money she had saved).
example.egtrans: 他带着她毕生的积蓄跑掉了。

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of living or a particular part of someone's life
trans_examp.trans_cn: 生活方式；生活（的某一部分）

example.eg: her family/private/sex life
example.egtrans: 她的家庭／个人／性生活

example.eg: my working life
example.egtrans: 我的职业生涯

example.eg: We interviewed senior politicians, famous writers, and others in public life.
example.egtrans: 我们采访了资深政界人士、著名作家等公众人物。

example.eg: Drugs and violence are deeply rooted in American life.
example.egtrans: 毒品和暴力在美国社会生活中已经根深蒂固。

example.eg: I left home at 16 to see life (= have different experiences with a lot of people in lots of places).
example.egtrans: 我16岁离家出去闯荡世界。

example.eg: Teaching has been her life (= the most important and enjoyable thing in her life).
example.egtrans: 教书已成为了她的生命。

trans_examp.trans_en: the period for which a machine or organization lasts

example.eg: The newer batteries have a much longer life.
example.egtrans: 新一代电池的寿命要长得多。

example.eg: Careful use will prolong the life of your machine.
example.egtrans: 小心使用会延长机器的寿命。

example.eg: The legislation won't be passed during the life of the present parliament.
example.egtrans: 该项立法在当前议会的任期内不会获得通过。

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality that makes people, animals, and plants different from objects, substances, and things that are dead

example.eg: The doctor could find no sign of life in the old man's body.
example.egtrans: 医生发现老人已经没有了生命迹象。

example.eg: I looked through the window but I couldn't see any signs of life (= people moving).
example.egtrans: 我透过窗子向外望去，却看不到有任何人类活动的迹象。

trans_examp.trans_en: energy or enthusiasm

example.eg: She's so full of life.
example.egtrans: 她充满了活力。

trans_examp.trans_en: everything that is alive

example.eg: human/marine/plant life
example.egtrans: 人类／海洋生物／植物

trans_examp.trans_en: In art, if you work from life, you paint, draw, etc. real people or objects, usually while they are in front of you rather than from memory.

example.eg: life drawing classes
example.egtrans: 写生课

trans_examp.trans_en: especially in children's games, one of the limited number of times that you can lose, but still continue playing
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指儿童游戏中的）一次机会；命

example.eg: Every time the little man gets hit, you lose a life.
example.egtrans: 小人儿每被击中一次，你就丢了一条命。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make something more real or exciting

example.eg: It's always been an interesting period in history and this film really brought it to life.
example.egtrans: 这段历史总是令人饶有兴味，这部电影对此进行了真实的再现。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to become more real or exciting
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 使更加实在；使更有生机

example.eg: The game really came to life in the second half.
example.egtrans: 比赛下半场有了生机。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for the whole of a person's life

example.eg: I believe marriage is for life.
example.egtrans: 我相信婚姻是一辈子的事情。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be willing to die in order to defend or support someone or something

example.eg: They were ready to give their lives for their country.
example.egtrans: 他们已做好了为国捐躯的准备。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you believe in life after death, you believe that people continue to exist in some form after they die.
to completely change how or where you live

example.eg: She decided to start a new life in Australia.
example.egtrans: 她决定在澳大利亚开始新的生活。

Lifespan.name: lifespan
Lifespan.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the length of time for which a person, animal, or thing exists
trans_examp.trans_cn: 寿命；可持续年限，有效期

example.eg: The average human lifespan in the developed countries has increased over the last hundred years.
example.egtrans: 发达国家的人均寿命在过去的100年间延长了。

example.eg: The project's lifespan is estimated at about five years.
example.egtrans: 预计这项工程为期5年左右。

lightness.name: lightness
lightness.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of being light

Lightweight.name: lightweight
Lightweight.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: lightweight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: weighing only a little or less than average

example.eg: I need a lightweight jacket for the summer evenings.
example.egtrans: 我需要一件夏天晚上穿的薄夹克衫。

dsense.name: lightweight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not showing deep understanding or knowledge of any subject

example.eg: She's the author of some fairly lightweight historical novels.
example.egtrans: 她写了几部内容相当肤浅的历史小说。

Lightweight.name: lightweight
Lightweight.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: lightweight
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in some sports, including boxing, a person whose weight is between featherweight and welterweight

dsense.name: lightweight
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person whose work in a particular area of activity does not show a deep understanding or knowledge of that subject
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一知半解的人，理解不深的人

example.eg: In certain circles he has been dismissed as a literary lightweight.
example.egtrans: 在某些圈子里，他被斥为对文学一知半解。

likewise.name: likewise
likewise.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the same way

example.eg: Just water these plants twice a week, and likewise the ones in the bedroom.
example.egtrans: 这些植物一周浇两次水，卧室里的那些也一样。

example.eg: "I don't have time to spend hours preparing one dish!" "Likewise (= it's the same for me)."
example.egtrans: “我没有功夫花好几个小时去做一个菜！”“我也一样。”

lint.name: lint
lint.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: short threads that come off the surface of cloth when it is being produced
soft material made from cloth threads, used for protecting injuries
small loose pieces of cotton, wool, etc. that stick on the surface of a fabric, etc.

literal.name: literal
literal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: The literal meaning of a word is its original, basic meaning.

example.eg: The literal meaning of "television" is "seeing from a distance".
example.egtrans: television 的字面意思是“从远处看”。

example.eg: You will need to show more than just a literal understanding of the text.
example.egtrans: 你需要显示自己对文本的理解没有仅仅停留在字面含义上。

trans_examp.trans_en: A literal translation of a text is done by translating each word separately, without looking at how the words are used together in a phrase or sentence.

example.eg: Her translation is too literal, resulting in unnatural-sounding prose.
example.egtrans: 她的译文太拘泥于字面了，结果成了冗长而不自然的行文。

live.name: live
live.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (to continue) to be alive or have life

example.eg: He only lived a few days after the accident.
example.egtrans: 出事后他只活了几天就死了。

example.eg: I hope I live to see my grandchildren.
example.egtrans: 我希望我能活到看见我孙辈的那一天。

example.eg: Her granny lived to the ripe old age of 94.
example.egtrans: 她奶奶活到了94岁高龄。

example.eg: Can the right to live ever be denied to any human?
example.egtrans: 人的生存权可以剥夺吗？

example.eg: She lived on well into her 90s.
example.egtrans: 她一直活到了90多岁。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be kept usually in a particular place

example.eg: Where do the knives live in your kitchen?
example.egtrans: 刀具放在你厨房的什么地方？

example.eg: I'm not sure where this bowl lives.
example.egtrans: 我不知道这只碗该放在哪里。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have your home somewhere

example.eg: Where do you live?
example.egtrans: 你住在哪里？

example.eg: We live in Kingston.
example.egtrans: 我们住在京士顿。

example.eg: Some students live on the University campus.
example.egtrans: 有些学生住在大学校园里。

example.eg: He lives with four other people in a shared house.
example.egtrans: 他和另外4个人同住在一所房子里。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spend your life in a particular way

example.eg: After a while you get used to living alone.
example.egtrans: 过一段时间你会适应一个人生活的。

example.eg: When you retire, you want to live a comfortable life.
example.egtrans: 退休的时候，大家都希望能过上舒适的生活。

example.eg: So the couple got married and lived happily ever after.
example.egtrans: 于是这对情侣结了婚，从此过上了幸福的生活。

example.eg: He simply wants to live (out) (= experience) the rest of his days in peace.
example.egtrans: 他只想能安度余生。

example.eg: The TV's broken - we'll just have to live without (= not have) it for a while.
example.egtrans: 电视机坏了 ——这段时间我们只好不看电视了。

example.eg: She certainly lived her life to the full (= was always doing something interesting).
example.egtrans: 她当然活得非常充实。

example.eg: The US is living beyond its means (= spending more than it earns).
example.egtrans: 美国人过的是借钱享乐的日子。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay alive, especially by getting enough money to pay for food, a place to stay, clothing, etc.

example.eg: For several years she lived by begging.
example.egtrans: 她以乞讨为生过了好几年。

example.eg: She has an inheritance to live off (US also live off of) so she doesn't need to work.
example.egtrans: 她可以靠遗产生活，不必工作。

example.eg: He only agreed to marry her so he could live off her (money).
example.egtrans: 他同意和她结婚只是为了她的钱。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of things that are not alive) to exist or continue to exist
trans_examp.trans_cn: （指逝去的事物）继续存在，留存

example.eg: The memory of those terrible days lives on.
example.egtrans: 对那些恐怖的日子的记忆挥之不去。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have an interesting life
trans_examp.trans_cn: 享受生活的乐趣，尽情地享受生活

example.eg: I want to live a little before I settle down.
example.egtrans: 在安定下来之前我要好好享受一下生活。

example.eg: If you haven't seen Venice, you haven't lived.
example.egtrans: 如果你没到过威尼斯，就等于白活了一场。

live.name: live
live.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having life

example.eg: Millions of live animals are shipped around the world each year.
example.egtrans: 每年有数百万只动物被运到世界各地。

example.eg: There was a tank of live lobsters in the restaurant.
example.egtrans: 饭馆里有一箱活龙虾。

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a performance) broadcast, recorded, or seen while it is happening
trans_examp.trans_cn: 现场直播的，实况转播的

example.eg: This evening there will be a live broadcast of the debate.
example.egtrans: 今晚将现场直播这场辩论。

example.eg: a live recording
example.egtrans: 现场录音

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a wire) carrying or charged with electricity

example.eg: a live wire
example.egtrans: 火线

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to explode

example.eg: live rounds of ammunition
example.egtrans: 数发实弹

example.eg: live shells
example.egtrans: 实弹

dsense.name: live
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a fire, coals, or a match) still burning or able to burn
trans_examp.trans_cn: （火、煤炭或火柴）燃烧的，可燃的

example.eg: There are live coals in the fireplace.
example.egtrans: 壁炉里的煤还在燃烧。

live.name: live
live.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: broadcast as it happens; performing or being performed in front of an audience

example.eg: I've got two tickets to see them (perform) live.
example.egtrans: 我有两张看他们现场演出的门票。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a new system, especially a computer system, goes live, it starts to operate.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （新系统，尤指电脑系统）开始运行；开始工作

example.eg: Our new payments system will go live at the beginning of next month.
example.egtrans: 下个月初我们新的支付系统将开始运行。

load.name: load
load.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: load
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of weight carried, especially by a vehicle, a structure such as a bridge, or an animal
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指车辆、桥梁、动物等的）负重，负荷，载重

example.eg: The maximum load for this elevator is eight persons.
example.egtrans: 这部电梯的最大载客量为8人。

example.eg: One truck involved in the accident was carrying a heavy load of coal.
example.egtrans: 事故中的一辆卡车上装了大量煤炭。

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of electrical power that is supplied

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a lot

example.eg: I've got a load of work to get through before tomorrow.
example.egtrans: 明天之前我要完成很多工作。

example.eg: There were a load of people there.
example.egtrans: 那里有许多人。

example.eg: Have some more food - there's loads.
example.egtrans: 再吃点吧——有很多呢。

example.eg: She looks loads better with her new haircut.
example.egtrans: 她做了新发型后好看多了。

dsense.name: load
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of work to be done by a person

example.eg: If we share the organization of the party, that will help spread the load.
example.egtrans: 如果我们都分担一些聚会的组织工作，那么就不至于忙不过来了。

example.eg: I've got a heavy/light teaching load this term.
example.egtrans: 这学期我的教学任务很重／轻。

trans_examp.trans_en: a painful, difficult, or tiring situation to deal with

example.eg: I wish I could do something to lighten your load (= make your situation easier).
example.egtrans: 我真希望能做点什么帮你减轻一些负担。

load.name: load
load.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: load
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a lot of things into a vehicle or machine

example.eg: How long will it take to load this sand onto the lorry?
example.egtrans: 把这些沙子装上卡车需要多长时间？

example.eg: Let's load up the car and then we can go.
example.egtrans: 把东西都装上车吧，这样我们就可以走了。

example.eg: to load the dishwasher/washing machine
example.egtrans: 把洗碗机／洗衣机装满

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have too much to carry, or too much work to do
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 承受太多的（重量或工作），负担的（重量或工作）太多

example.eg: I was loaded down with shopping.
example.egtrans: 我带着重重的一堆买来的东西。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to contain a lot of something

example.eg: Most fast foods are loaded with fat.
example.egtrans: 快餐食品大多都富含脂肪。

dsense.name: load
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put film in a camera or bullets in a gun

example.eg: Do not load the film (= put it into the camera) in bright light.
example.egtrans: 不要在光线亮的地方装胶卷。

dsense.name: load
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put information or a program onto a computer
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把信息输入计算机；把程序载入计算机

example.eg: You need to load this program onto your computer.
example.egtrans: 你需要把这个程序载入你的计算机。

example.eg: The software is easy to load.
example.egtrans: 这个软件很容易载入。

load.name: -load
load.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: all the people or goods in the stated type of vehicle or container
trans_examp.trans_cn: （指车辆或容器的装载量）满…的，一…的

example.eg: a coachload of football fans
example.egtrans: 一车足球迷

example.eg: Busloads of tourists pour into this place in the summer.
example.egtrans: 夏天一辆辆满载游客的大客车涌到这里。

example.eg: Truckloads of food and medical supplies arrived in the refugee camp.
example.egtrans: 一车车食品和药品被送到了难民营。

locally.name: locally
locally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the particular small area that you are talking about

example.eg: The restaurant uses fruit and vegetables that are grown locally.
example.egtrans: 这家商店所有的水果和蔬菜都是当地出产的。

example.eg: Do they live locally?
example.egtrans: 他们住在当地吗？

locate.name: locate
locate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: locate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

phrase.phrase_title: be located in, near, on, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be in a particular place
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 位于…／在…附近／坐落在…（等等）

example.eg: Our office is located in midtown Manhattan.
example.egtrans: 我们的办事处位于曼哈顿市中心。

dsense.name: locate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to find or discover the exact position of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 确定…的位置，发现…的位置

example.eg: Police are still trying to locate the suspect.
example.egtrans: 警察仍在努力寻找嫌疑人。

dsense.name: locate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move to a place to do business

example.eg: The company hopes to locate in its new offices by June.
example.egtrans: 该公司希望在六月前搬进新的办公楼。

log.name: log
log.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: log
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thick piece of tree trunk or branch, especially one cut for burning on a fire

dsense.name: log
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a full written record of a journey, a period of time, or an event
trans_examp.trans_cn: （旅程、某段时间或事件的）日记，日志

example.eg: the ship's log
example.egtrans: 该船的航海日志

dsense.name: log
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
informal for
        
         logarithm

log.name: log
log.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: log
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cut down trees so that you can use their wood

example.eg: The forest has been so heavily logged that it is in danger of disappearing.
example.egtrans: 这片森林被过度砍伐，面临消失的危险。

dsense.name: log
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to officially record something

example.eg: The Better Business Bureau has logged more than 90 complaints.
example.egtrans: 商务改进局已经记录下了90多条投诉。

trans_examp.trans_en: to travel and record a particular distance

look.name: look
look.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to direct your eyes in order to see

example.eg: Look! There's grandma.
example.egtrans: 瞧！奶奶在那里。

example.eg: They looked at the picture and laughed.
example.egtrans: 他们看了看那幅画，笑了起来。

example.eg: Look at all these toys on the floor.
example.egtrans: 瞧瞧地上这些玩具。

example.eg: She looked up from her book and smiled at me.
example.egtrans: 她的视线从书本上移开，抬起头朝我笑了笑。

example.eg: I looked out (of) the window.
example.egtrans: 我朝窗外望去。

example.eg: Look over there - there's a rainbow!
example.egtrans: 看那里——有一道彩虹！

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to try to find something or someone

example.eg: I'm looking for my keys.
example.egtrans: 我在找钥匙。

example.eg: I looked everywhere, but I couldn't find my glasses.
example.egtrans: 我每个地方都找遍了，可就是没找到我的眼镜。

example.eg: Have you looked in the dictionary?
example.egtrans: 你查字典了吗？

example.eg: I looked down the list but couldn't see his name.
example.egtrans: 我查看了名单，但没找到他的名字。

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to appear or seem

example.eg: You look well!
example.egtrans: 你看起来气色不错！

example.eg: The roads look very icy.
example.egtrans: 这些路看起来很滑。

example.eg: That dress looks nice on you.
example.egtrans: 你穿那条裙子很好看。

example.eg: He has started to look his age (= appear as old as he really is).
example.egtrans: 他看上去开始显年纪了。

example.eg: It's looking good (= things are going well).
example.egtrans: 事情进展顺利。

example.eg: He looked (like) a friendly sort of person.
example.egtrans: 他看起来是那种很友善的人。

example.eg: The twins look just like their mother.
example.egtrans: 那对双胞胎长得很像他们的母亲。

example.eg: She looked as if/though she hadn't slept all night.
example.egtrans: 她看起来似乎整晚都没有睡觉。

example.eg: It looks like rain (= as if it is going to rain).
example.egtrans: 看起来天要下雨了。

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to face a particular direction

example.eg: The garden looks south.
example.egtrans: 那个花园朝南。

example.eg: This window looks out onto the lake.
example.egtrans: 这个窗户俯瞰着湖面。

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: used when you are telling someone to be careful or to pay attention

example.eg: Look where you're going!
example.egtrans: 小心看着点儿路！

example.eg: Look at the time - we're late!
example.egtrans: 注意时间——我们已经晚了！

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be planning to do something

example.eg: I'm looking to start my own business.
example.egtrans: 我计划自己开公司。

look.name: look
look.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of looking at someone or something

example.eg: She gave him a look of real dislike.
example.egtrans: 她厌恶地看了他一眼。

example.eg: Take a (good) look at this picture and see if you recognize anyone.
example.egtrans: 好好看看这张照片，看看能不能认出上面的什么人。

example.eg: Can I have a look at your dictionary?
example.egtrans: 我能看看你的字典吗？

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of trying to find someone or something

example.eg: I had another look for the watch, but couldn't find it.
example.egtrans: 我又找了一遍手表，但没有找到。

dsense.name: look
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an expression on someone's face

example.eg: She had a worried look about her.
example.egtrans: 她一脸焦急的神情。

example.eg: She gave me a questioning look.
example.egtrans: 她疑惑地看着我。

trans_examp.trans_en: a style or fashion

example.eg: The look this year will be relaxed and casual.
example.egtrans: 今年的时尚是放松随意。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the appearance of someone or something

example.eg: They liked the look of the hotel, but it was too expensive.
example.egtrans: 他们很喜欢酒店的样子，只是价格太贵了。

example.eg: I don't like the look of that fence (= it appears to have something wrong with it).
example.egtrans: 我不喜欢那道栅栏的样子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a person's appearance, especially how attractive they are

example.eg: I like her looks.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢她的相貌。

example.eg: Her looks improved as she grew older.
example.egtrans: 年纪稍大一些后，她变得好看多了。

example.eg: He put on weight and started to lose his looks.
example.egtrans: 他胖了，而且开始长得越来越难看了。

look.name: look
look.posTip: A word or phrase that you say loudly or suddenly to express strong feelings.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to express anger
trans_examp.trans_cn: 看看吧；瞧（用于表达愤怒）

example.eg: Look, I've already told you it's not possible.
example.egtrans: 看吧，我跟你说过这根本不可能。

example.eg: Look here, I've had enough of this.
example.egtrans: 好了，我已经受够了。

loosen.name: loosen
loosen.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: loosen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause to) become loose

example.eg: The screws holding the bed together had loosened.
example.egtrans: 床上的螺丝钉松了。

dsense.name: loosen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something such as your hair or a piece of clothing less tight

example.eg: He loosened his tie.
example.egtrans: 他松开了领带。

loud.name: loud
loud.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: making a lot of noise

example.eg: a loud explosion/noise/voice
example.egtrans: 巨大的爆炸声／巨大的吵闹声／洪亮的嗓音

example.eg: I heard a loud bang and then saw black smoke.
example.egtrans: 我听到砰的一声巨响，接着就看到了黑烟。

example.eg: Could you speak a little louder, please?
example.egtrans: 请你说话大声一点，好吗？

loud.name: loud
loud.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of clothes) having unpleasantly bright colours or too strong patterns, or (of a person) demanding attention and talking and laughing loudly
trans_examp.trans_cn: （衣服）过于鲜艳的，花哨的；（人）惹人注目的，招摇的

example.eg: You shouldn't wear anything too loud to a job interview.
example.egtrans: 你去参加求职面试时不要穿得太花哨。

example.eg: The men at the bar were loud and obnoxious.
example.egtrans: 酒吧里的那些男人咋咋呼呼的让人作呕。

lower.name: lower
lower.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: lower
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move something into a low position

example.eg: They lowered the coffin into the grave.
example.egtrans: 他们把棺材放入了墓穴。

example.eg: Heavily pregnant by now, she lowered herself carefully into the chair.
example.egtrans: 因为现在重孕在身，她小心翼翼地在椅子上坐下。

example.eg: He lowered his eyes (= looked down) in embarrassment when he saw me.
example.egtrans: 他看到我后尴尬地垂下了双眼。

dsense.name: lower
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to reduce something

example.eg: Interest rates have been lowered again.
example.egtrans: 利率又降了。

example.eg: Boil for five minutes, then lower the heat and simmer for half an hour.
example.egtrans: 煮上5分钟，然后调到小火再炖半小时。

example.eg: Please lower your voice (= speak more quietly).
example.egtrans: 请说话小声点儿。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something worse than it was before

example.eg: a lowering of standards
example.egtrans: 标准的降低

example.eg: Dale lowered the tone of the evening (= made it less socially acceptable) by telling a dirty joke.
example.egtrans: 戴尔讲了一个黄色笑话，破坏了晚会的气氛。

dsense.name: lower
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to behave in a way that makes people lose respect for you

example.eg: I wouldn't lower myself to respond to his insults if I were you.
example.egtrans: 我要是你就不会贬低自己的身份去理睬他的辱骂。

lower.name: lower
lower.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: positioned below one or more similar things, or of the bottom part of something

example.eg: the lower deck of a ship
example.egtrans: 轮船的下层甲板

example.eg: Her lower lip trembled as if she were about to cry.
example.egtrans: 她的下嘴唇颤抖着，好像要哭的样子。

example.eg: I've got a pain in my lower (= the bottom part of my) back.
example.egtrans: 我后腰有点痛。

mainly.name: mainly
mainly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: usually or to a large degree
trans_examp.trans_cn: 通常地；主要地；大部分地

example.eg: I mainly go to bed around midnight.
example.egtrans: 我通常午夜前后睡觉。

example.eg: The group is made up of mainly young people.
example.egtrans: 该团体主要由年轻人组成。

example.eg: They argued that the tax will mainly benefit the rich.
example.egtrans: 他们争辩说这项税收将主要让富人受益。

maintain.name: maintain
maintain.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: maintain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to continue to have; to keep in existence, or not allow to become less

example.eg: The army has been brought in to maintain order in the region.
example.egtrans: 军队已被调来维持这一地区的秩序。

example.eg: We have standards to maintain.
example.egtrans: 我们要坚持原则。

example.eg: Despite living in different countries, the two families have maintained close links.
example.egtrans: 尽管住在不同的国家，两个家庭仍保持着紧密联系。

example.eg: The film has maintained its position as the critics' favourite for another year.
example.egtrans: 这部电影再度被评论家评为年度最佳影片。

dsense.name: maintain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep a road, machine, building, etc. in good condition

example.eg: A large house costs a lot to maintain.
example.egtrans: 保养一座大房子花费很高。

example.eg: The roads in the town have been very poorly maintained.
example.egtrans: 城镇的道路保养得很差。

dsense.name: maintain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to express firmly your belief that something is true

example.eg: Throughout his prison sentence, Dunn has always maintained his innocence.
example.egtrans: 邓恩在监狱服刑期间一直坚称自己是无辜的。

example.eg: He maintains that he has never seen the woman before.
example.egtrans: 他坚称以前从未见过那位妇女。

dsense.name: maintain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide someone with food and whatever is necessary for them to live on

example.eg: They barely earn enough to maintain themselves and their four children.
example.egtrans: 他们赚的钱勉强够养活自己和4个孩子。

major.name: major
major.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: major
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: more important, bigger, or more serious than others of the same type
trans_examp.trans_cn: 较重要的；主要的；重大的

example.eg: All of her major plays have been translated into English.
example.egtrans: 她的主要剧本都被译成了英文。

example.eg: Sugar is a major cause of tooth decay.
example.egtrans: 糖是造成蛀牙的主要原因。

example.eg: There are two problems with this situation, one major, one minor.
example.egtrans: 这一情况牵涉到两个问题，一个主要的，一个次要的。

example.eg: Citrus fruits are a major source of vitamin C.
example.egtrans: 柑橘类水果是维生素C的重要来源。

example.eg: There has been a major change in attitudes recently.
example.egtrans: 态度近来有重大改变。

example.eg: The United States is a major influence in the United Nations.
example.egtrans: 美国是联合国中有重要影响的国家。

dsense.name: major
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: belonging or relating to a musical scale that is generally thought to have a happy sound

example.eg: the key of C major
example.egtrans: C大调

example.eg: a concerto in A major
example.egtrans: A 大调协奏曲

major.name: major
major.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: major
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an officer of middle rank in the British, US, and many other armed forces
trans_examp.trans_cn: （英军、美军及其他军队中的）少校

example.eg: Her father was a major in the Scots Guards.
example.egtrans: 她父亲曾是苏格兰近卫团的少校。

example.eg: Major Winters/Richard Winters
example.egtrans: 理查德·温特斯少校

example.eg: Thank you, Major.
example.egtrans: 谢谢您，少校。

dsense.name: major
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the most important subject that a college or university student is studying, or the student himself or herself
trans_examp.trans_cn: （大学生的）专业，主修课程；（大学专业的）主修学生

example.eg: What is your major, English or French?
example.egtrans: 你的专业是英语还是法语？

example.eg: She was a philosophy major at an Ivy League college.
example.egtrans: 她曾在一所长春藤大学主修哲学。

major.name: major
major.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to study something as your main subject at college or university

example.eg: She majored in philosophy at Harvard.
example.egtrans: 她曾在哈佛大学主修哲学。

majority.name: majority
majority.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: majority
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the larger number or part of something

example.eg: The majority of the employees have university degrees.
example.egtrans: 大部分雇员都有大学文凭。

example.eg: A large majority of people approve of the death sentence.
example.egtrans: 大多数人赞成死刑。

example.eg: In Britain women are in the/a majority.
example.egtrans: 在英国，女性占多数。

trans_examp.trans_en: in an election, the difference in the number of votes between the winning person or group and the one that comes second
trans_examp.trans_cn: 多数票（选举中胜者与第二名之间的选票差额）

example.eg: The Democratic candidate won by a narrow/large majority.
example.egtrans: 社会党人以微弱／绝对多数票胜出。

dsense.name: majority
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the age when you legally become an adult

example.eg: the age of majority
example.egtrans: 法定成年年龄

example.eg: She will inherit her father's estate when she reaches her majority.
example.egtrans: 她到法定年龄时将继承父亲的遗产。

make sure.name: sure
make sure.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: certain; without any doubt
trans_examp.trans_cn: 确定的，肯定的，毫无疑问的

example.eg: "What's wrong with him?" "I'm not really sure."
example.egtrans: “他怎么啦？”“我不太清楚。”

example.eg: I'm sure (that) I left my keys on the table.
example.egtrans: 我肯定我把钥匙放在桌上了。

example.eg: I feel absolutely sure (that) you've made the right decision.
example.egtrans: 我完全确信你的决定是正确的。

example.eg: It now seems sure (that) the election will result in another victory for the government.
example.egtrans: 现在看来，这次选举无疑又会以政府的胜利而告终。

example.eg: Shaun isn't sure whether/if he'll be able to come to the party or not.
example.egtrans: 肖恩不太确定他能否参加这次聚会。

example.eg: Is there anything you're not sure of/about?
example.egtrans: 还有不清楚的地方吗?

example.eg: We arrive early to be sure of getting a good seat.
example.egtrans: 我们早到一些，保证能找到好座位。

example.eg: There is only one sure way (= one way that can be trusted) of finding out the truth.
example.egtrans: 只有一种方法能够确保弄清真相。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you have a sure knowledge or understanding of something, you know or understand it very well.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 非常清楚的，十分了解的

example.eg: I don't think he has a very sure understanding of the situation.
example.egtrans: 我想他还不是十分了解情况。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: certain or certainly
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 肯定的（地），确定的（地），无疑的（地）

example.eg: I know for sure that I won't be able to go to the party.
example.egtrans: 我非常肯定自己不能参加这个晚会。

example.eg: One thing's for sure - once the baby's born, your lives will never be the same again.
example.egtrans: 有一点是肯定的——一旦孩子出生，生活就完全不一样了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be very or too confident

example.eg: She's become much more sure of herself since she got a job.
example.egtrans: 她找到工作以后自信多了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: be confident that something is true

example.eg: He said that he wasn't completely sure of his facts.
example.egtrans: 他说他还不能完全肯定自己掌握的情况是否属实。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have confidence in and trust someone

example.eg: Henry has only been working for us for a short while, and we're not really sure about him yet.
example.egtrans: 亨利才为我们工作了很短的一段时间，我们对他还不是很了解。

example.eg: You can always be sure of Kay.
example.egtrans: 你完全可以信任凯。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be certain to

example.eg: She's sure to win.
example.egtrans: 她肯定会赢。

example.eg: I want to go somewhere where we're sure to have good weather.
example.egtrans: 我想去一个肯定有好天气的地方。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to look and/or take action to be certain that something happens, is true, etc.

example.eg: Make sure you lock the door when you go out.
example.egtrans: 出门的时候一定要锁好门。

make sure.name: sure
make sure.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: certainly

example.eg: "Do you want to come swimming with us?" "Sure."
example.egtrans: “你想来跟我们一起游泳吗？”“当然。”

example.eg: "Will you help me with this?" "Sure I will."
example.egtrans: “能帮我拿一下这个吗？”“当然可以。”

example.eg: I sure am hungry.
example.egtrans: 我当然饿了。

example.eg: "I can't do it!" "Sure you can. I'll help you."
example.egtrans: “我干不了！”“你当然干得了。我会帮你。”

trans_examp.trans_en: said when someone has thanked you
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对别人表示感谢时的回应）没问题

example.eg: "Thanks for helping us out." "Sure, any time."
example.egtrans: “谢谢你帮我们。”“没问题，随时叫我。”

make up.name: make-up
make up.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: make-up
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: coloured substances used on your face to improve or change your appearance

example.eg: I put on a little eye make-up.
example.egtrans: 我在眼部上了淡妆。

example.eg: She wears a lot of make-up.
example.egtrans: 她化的妆很浓。

dsense.name: make-up
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: The make-up of something or someone is the combination of things that form it.

example.eg: They argue that the membership of the Council does not reflect the racial make-up of the city.
example.egtrans: 他们争辩说议会的成员结构并未反映出这座城市的种族构成。

example.eg: Organizational ability is not one of the most obvious parts of his make-up.
example.egtrans: 组织才能并不是他各项素质中最突出的部分。

mandate.name: mandate
mandate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the authority given to an elected group of people, such as a government, to perform an action or govern a country

example.eg: At the forthcoming elections, the government will be seeking a fresh mandate from the people.
example.egtrans: 在即将到来的选举中，政府将向人民寻求新的支持。

example.eg: The president secured the Congressional mandate to go to war by three votes.
example.egtrans: 总统以3票的优势获得了国会对开战的授权。

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the name of an area of land that has been given to a country by the UN, following or as part of a peace agreement
trans_examp.trans_cn: （联合国授权某国管理的）托管地

mandate.name: mandate
mandate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give official permission for something to happen

example.eg: The UN rush to mandate war totally ruled out any alternatives.
example.egtrans: 联合国匆匆授权开战，完全排除了其他选择。

dsense.name: mandate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to order someone to do something

example.eg: Our delegates have been mandated to vote against the proposal at the conference.
example.egtrans: 我们的代表受命在会议上对提议投反对票。

mandatory.name: mandatory
mandatory.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Something that is mandatory must be done, or is demanded by law.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 强制的；必须履行的；法定的

example.eg: The minister is calling for mandatory prison sentences for people who assault police officers.
example.egtrans: 部长呼吁把袭警者须受的惩罚定为强制监禁。

example.eg: Athletes must undergo a mandatory drugs test before competing in the championship.
example.egtrans: 运动员在锦标赛前必须进行强制性药检。

example.eg: In 1991, the British government made it mandatory to wear rear seat belts in cars.
example.egtrans: 1991年，英国政府强制要求汽车后座乘客系安全带。

manipulate.name: manipulate
manipulate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: manipulate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to control something or someone to your advantage, often unfairly or dishonestly
trans_examp.trans_cn: （常指以不正当手段）操纵，控制

example.eg: Throughout her career she has very successfully manipulated the media.
example.egtrans: 她在整个职业生涯中非常成功地控制了媒体。

example.eg: The opposition leader accused government ministers of manipulating the statistics to suit themselves.
example.egtrans: 反对派领导人指责政府部长篡改统计数据以满足自身利益。

dsense.name: manipulate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to control something using the hands

example.eg: The wheelchair is designed so that it is easy to manipulate.
example.egtrans: 轮椅设计得很容易用手控制。

trans_examp.trans_en: to treat a part of the body, using the hands to push back bones into the correct position and put pressure on muscles

example.eg: The doctor manipulated the base of my spine and the pain disappeared completely.
example.egtrans: 医生对我的脊柱底部进行了推拿，疼痛便完全消失了。

manual.name: manual
manual.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: done with the hands

example.eg: the manual sorting of letters
example.egtrans: 手工分拣信件

example.eg: She tried to cure the pain in my knee by putting manual pressure on the joint.
example.egtrans: 她尝试用手按压我的膝关节来治疗我的膝盖痛。

trans_examp.trans_en: A manual machine is operated with the hands rather than by electricity or a motor.

example.eg: He still works on an old manual typewriter.
example.egtrans: 他还在用一台老式手动打字机。

trans_examp.trans_en: involving physical work rather than mental work

example.eg: unskilled manual labour
example.egtrans: 无需技能的体力劳动

example.eg: 750 manual workers will lose their jobs as a result of company cutbacks.
example.egtrans: 750名体力劳动者将因公司裁员而失业。

example.eg: Computer-controlled robots are taking over manual jobs in many industries.
example.egtrans: 在许多行业中，体力工作正逐步由电脑控制的机器人代劳。

manual.name: manual
manual.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: manual
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a book that gives you practical instructions on how to do something or how to use something, such as a machine

example.eg: a DIY manual
example.egtrans: “自己动手”指南

example.eg: The computer comes with a 600-page instruction manual.
example.egtrans: 电脑附有一本600页的使用指南。

dsense.name: manual
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a keyboard, especially on an organ, designed to be played with the hands rather than the feet
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指在风琴上）用手操作的键盘

manually.name: manually
manually.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: by hand

example.eg: Few of the machines are operated manually.
example.egtrans: 很少有机器是手工操作的。

manufacturer.name: manufacturer
manufacturer.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a company that produces goods in large numbers
trans_examp.trans_cn: 制造商（大批量生产商品的企业）

example.eg: Germany is a major manufacturer of motor cars.
example.egtrans: 德国是汽车生产大国。

example.eg: Follow the instructions provided by the manufacturer.
example.egtrans: 按照制造商提供的指南操作。

map.name: map
map.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a drawing of the earth's surface, or part of that surface, showing the shape and position of different countries, political borders, natural features such as rivers and mountains, and artificial features such as roads and buildings

example.eg: a map of the world
example.egtrans: 世界地图

example.eg: a map of Paris
example.egtrans: 巴黎地图

example.eg: a road map
example.egtrans: 公路图

example.eg: We need a large-scale map showing all the footpaths that we can walk along.
example.egtrans: 我们需要一张大比例尺地图，上面要标出所有能走的小路。

example.eg: I'm terrible at map reading (= understanding maps).
example.egtrans: 我一点儿也看不懂地图。

trans_examp.trans_en: a drawing that gives you a particular type of information about a particular area
trans_examp.trans_cn: （提供特定区域特定信息的）图

example.eg: He bought a map showing the population distribution of Scotland.
example.egtrans: 他买了一张苏格兰人口分布图。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that shows the position of stars in the sky or the features on the surface of planets
trans_examp.trans_cn: （标明恒星位置或行星表面特征的）天体图

example.eg: a celestial map
example.egtrans: 天体图

example.eg: a map of Mars
example.egtrans: 火星地形图

trans_examp.trans_en: a very simple drawing that shows a direction of travel between one place and another

example.eg: I'll draw you a quick map if you're worried about finding the hotel.
example.egtrans: 如果你担心找不到那家旅馆，我给你画张简单的示意图。

map.name: map
map.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to represent an area of land in the form of a map
trans_examp.trans_cn: 绘制…的地图；在地图上标示出

example.eg: Parts of the mountainous region in the north of the country have still not been mapped.
example.egtrans: 人们还未为这个国家北部的部分山区绘制地图。

mark.name: mark
mark.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: mark
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.
