example.eg: Linguists explore the nuances of language.
example.egtrans: 语言学家研究语言的细微差别。

numerator.name: numerator
numerator.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the number above the line in a fraction

example.eg: In the fraction ¾, 3 is the numerator.
example.egtrans: 在3／4这个分数中，3为分子。

object-oriented.name: object-oriented
object-oriented.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: in computing, refers to something based on groups of information and their effects on each other, rather than on a series of instructions

example.eg: C++ is a common object-oriented programming language.
example.egtrans: C++ 是一种常见的面向对象的编程语言。

obtain.name: obtain
obtain.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: obtain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get something, especially by asking for it, buying it, working for it, or producing it from something else

example.eg: to obtain permission
example.egtrans: 获得许可

example.eg: First editions of these books are now almost impossible to obtain.
example.egtrans: 这些书的第一版现在已几乎弄不到了。

example.eg: In the second experiment they obtained a very clear result.
example.egtrans: 第二次试验他们获得了明确的结果。

example.eg: Sugar is obtained by crushing and processing sugar cane.
example.egtrans: 蔗糖是通过对甘蔗进行压榨和加工获得的。

dsense.name: obtain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of a situation) to exist

example.eg: Conditions of extreme poverty now obtain in many parts of the country.
example.egtrans: 目前该国的许多地方都极度贫困。

occasionally.name: occasionally
occasionally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: sometimes but not often

example.eg: I see him occasionally in town.
example.egtrans: 我偶尔在城里见到他。

example.eg: Occasionally I'll have a piece of chocolate, but it's very rare.
example.egtrans: 有时我会吃块巧克力，不过这种时候极少。

occur.name: occur
occur.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: occur
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of accidents and other unexpected events) to happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指事故及其他意外事件）发生

example.eg: An accident involving over ten vehicles has occurred in the east-bound lane.
example.egtrans: 在东向车道上发生了一起涉及十多辆汽车的交通事故。

example.eg: If any of these symptoms occur while you are taking the medication, consult your doctor immediately.
example.egtrans: 服药期间如果产生了这些症状中的任何一种，要立即就医。

dsense.name: occur
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to exist or be present in, among, etc.

example.eg: Violence of some type seems to occur in every society.
example.egtrans: 每个社会似乎都会存在某种形式的暴力。

example.eg: Minerals occur naturally in the earth's crust.
example.egtrans: 矿物自然存在于地壳中。

odd.name: odd
odd.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: odd
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: strange or unexpected
trans_examp.trans_cn: 奇怪的，古怪的；异常的；出人意料的

example.eg: Her father was an odd man.
example.egtrans: 她父亲是个古怪的人。

example.eg: What an odd thing to say.
example.egtrans: 这样说太奇怪了。

example.eg: The skirt and jacket looked a little odd together.
example.egtrans: 这裙子和夹克搭配看上去有点怪。

example.eg: That's odd - I'm sure I put my keys in this drawer and yet they're not here.
example.egtrans: 真奇怪——我肯定把钥匙放进这个抽屉了，可是却不见了。

example.eg: It's odd that no one's seen him.
example.egtrans: 奇怪的是没人见过他。

example.eg: It must be odd to go back to your home town after forty years away.
example.egtrans: 离开40年后回到家乡一定感觉很奇怪。

dsense.name: odd
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not happening often

example.eg: She does the odd teaching job but nothing permanent.
example.egtrans: 她有时教教课，但并不固定。

example.eg: You get the odd person who's rude to you but they're generally quite helpful.
example.egtrans: 你不巧遇到了一个对你粗鲁的人，不过他们一般是相当乐于助人的。

dsense.name: odd
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of numbers) not able to be divided exactly by two

example.eg: 3, 5, and 7 are all odd numbers.
example.egtrans: 3， 5， 7都是奇数。

example.eg: The houses on this side of the street all have odd numbers.
example.egtrans: 街道这边的房子都是单号的。

dsense.name: odd
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of something that should be in a pair or set) separated from its pair or set
trans_examp.trans_cn: （指一对或一组事物中）单个的，单只的，不成对的

example.eg: He's got a whole drawer full of odd socks.
example.egtrans: 他有一抽屉的单只袜子。

example.eg: I'd got a few odd (= I had various) balls of wool left over.
example.egtrans: 我有几个花色不同的、织毛衣剩下的毛线团。

odd.name: -odd
odd.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: used after a number, especially a number that can be divided by ten, to show that the exact number is not known
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤用于可被10整除的数字后）大约，…多一点

example.eg: I'd say Robert's about 40-odd - maybe 45.
example.egtrans: 我猜罗伯特大约有40几岁——也许45岁。

offhand.name: offhand
offhand.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not friendly, and showing little interest in other people in a way that seems slightly rude
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不友好的；漫不经心的；怠慢的

example.eg: I didn't mean to be offhand with her - it's just that I was in such a hurry.
example.egtrans: 我希望我没有表现出怠慢了她——我不过是太匆忙了。

offhand.name: offhand
offhand.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: without looking for information and without thinking carefully; immediately
trans_examp.trans_cn: 未经核实地；不假思索地；立刻

example.eg: I can't quote the exact statistics for you offhand, but they're there for you to see in the report.
example.egtrans: 我不能马上就给你举出确切的数据，不过这些数据可以在报告中查到。

official.name: official
official.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to a position of responsibility

example.eg: He visited China in his official capacity as America's trade representative.
example.egtrans: 他以美方贸易代表的身份访问了中国。

example.eg: Number Ten Downing Street is the British prime minister's official residence.
example.egtrans: 唐宁街10号是英国首相的官邸。

trans_examp.trans_en: agreed to or arranged by people in positions of authority

example.eg: the official photos of the president's tour of India
example.egtrans: 总统印度之行的官方照片

example.eg: The Queen will attend the official opening of the theatre in June.
example.egtrans: 女王将在6月份参加这家剧院的正式落成典礼。

example.eg: There is to be an official inquiry into the incident.
example.egtrans: 官方将调查这一事件。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a piece of information is official, it has been announced publicly with authority.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 公开的；公布的；据官方的

example.eg: Their engagement is now official.
example.egtrans: 他们订婚一事现在已经公开了。

example.eg: Inflation has fallen below two percent, and that's official.
example.egtrans: 通货膨胀率已经降至2%以下，这是官方公布的数据。

official.name: official
official.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who has a position of responsibility in an organization

example.eg: a government/trade-union/council official
example.egtrans: 政府官员／工会要员／市政会官员

omit.name: omit
omit.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fail to include or do something

example.eg: She was omitted from the list of contributors to the report.
example.egtrans: 这篇报道的撰稿人中漏掉了她的名字。

example.eg: The Prince's tour conveniently omitted the most deprived areas of the city.
example.egtrans: 亲王的巡查为避开麻烦，没有去该市最贫困的地区。

example.eg: She omitted to mention that she would be away next week.
example.egtrans: 她未提自己下星期不在这里的事。

one-off.name: one-off
one-off.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that happens or is made or done only once

example.eg: Will you be doing more talks in the future or was that just a one-off?
example.egtrans: 你将来还要作多次的讲话还是只此一次？

one-off.name: one-off
one-off.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening only once

example.eg: They gave him a one-off payment to compensate for the extra hours that he had to work.
example.egtrans: 他们一次性支付给他一笔钱作为他必须加班的补偿。

One-time.name: one-time
One-time.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

phrase.phrase_title: a one-time teacher, doctor, cleaner, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: someone who was a teacher, doctor, cleaner, etc. in the past
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 曾当过教师／医生／清洁工等的人

example.eg: Duggan, a TV personality and one-time journalist, made the announcement last week.
example.egtrans: 这是电视节目主持人、曾做过记者的达根上星期宣布的。

onward.name: onward
onward.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: moving forward to a later time or a more distant (= farther away) place

example.eg: the onward march of time
example.egtrans: 时间的推移

example.eg: If you are continuing on an onward flight, your bags will be transferred automatically.
example.egtrans: 如果你要转机继续飞行，你的行李也会自动转机。

onward.name: onward
onward.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en:
→ 
        
         onwards

opacity.name: opacity
opacity.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of being opaque, or the degree to which something is opaque
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不透明；不透明性，不透明度

opaque.name: opaque
opaque.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: preventing light from travelling through, and therefore not transparent or translucent

example.eg: opaque glass/tights
example.egtrans: 不透明的玻璃／连裤袜

trans_examp.trans_en: Opaque writing or speech is difficult to understand.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （文字或演讲）难理解的；晦涩的；含糊的

example.eg: I find her poetry a little too opaque.
example.egtrans: 我发现她的诗相当晦涩。

operand.name: operand
operand.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number or quantity that has something done to it in a calculation. For example, in 7 + y, 7 and y are the operands.

oppose.name: oppose
oppose.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to disagree with something or someone, often by speaking or fighting against it, him, or her

example.eg: The proposed new testing system has been vigorously opposed by teachers.
example.egtrans: 实行新考试制度的提议遭到了教师们的强烈反对。

example.eg: Most of the local residents opposed the closing of the school.
example.egtrans: 当地大多数居民反对关闭这所学校。

example.eg: I would certainly oppose changing the system.
example.egtrans: 我当然会反对改变这一制度。

opposite.name: opposite
opposite.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: opposite
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely different
trans_examp.trans_cn: 全然不同的，迥异的，截然相反的

example.eg: You'd never know they're sisters - they're completely opposite to each other in every way.
example.egtrans: 你怎么也不会知道她们是姐妹——她们各方面都全然不同。

example.eg: Police attempts to calm the violence had the opposite effect.
example.egtrans: 警方试图平息暴力活动，却适得其反。

dsense.name: opposite
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: being in a position on the other side; facing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 另一边的，相反的，对面的

example.eg: My brother and I live on opposite sides of the city.
example.egtrans: 我哥哥和我住在城里两个方向相反的区。

example.eg: The map on the opposite page shows where these birds commonly breed.
example.egtrans: 对页上的地图表明这些鸟一般在什么地方交配繁衍。

example.eg: They sat at opposite ends of the table (to/from each other), refusing to talk.
example.egtrans: 他们坐在桌子的两端，彼此互不搭理。

trans_examp.trans_en: facing the speaker or stated person or thing
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在说话者、所指的人或物）对面的

example.eg: If you want to buy tickets, you need to go to the counter opposite.
example.egtrans: 如果想买票，你得去对面的柜台。

example.eg: Who owns that house opposite (= on the other side of the road)?
example.egtrans: 对面那栋房子的主人是谁？

opposite.name: opposite
opposite.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a position facing someone or something but on the other side

example.eg: We're in the building opposite the government offices.
example.egtrans: 我们在正对着政府办公楼的大楼里。

example.eg: They sat opposite each other.
example.egtrans: 他们面对面地坐着。

example.eg: Put a tick opposite (= next to) the answer that you think is correct.
example.egtrans: 在你认为正确的答案旁边打个勾。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to act a part in a film or play with someone as a partner
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （在电影或戏剧中）与（某人）联袂出演，与（某人）合演

example.eg: Katharine Hepburn played opposite Henry Fonda in many films.
example.egtrans: 凯瑟琳‧赫本在许多电影中与亨利‧方达联袂出演。

opposite.name: opposite
opposite.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something or someone that is completely different from another person or thing
trans_examp.trans_cn: 对立的物（或人）；对立面；反面

example.eg: My father is a very calm person, but my mother is just the opposite.
example.egtrans: 我父亲是个非常沉着的人，而我母亲则正好相反。

example.eg: She's turned out to be the exact opposite of what everyone expected.
example.egtrans: 结果表明她是一个和大家的期盼恰恰相反的人。

example.eg: The opposite of "fast" is "slow".
example.egtrans: fast（快）的反义词是 slow（慢）。

example.eg: People say opposites attract.
example.egtrans: 他们总是说相异相吸。

opposite.name: opposite
opposite.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a position facing someone or something but on the other side

example.eg: She asked the man sitting opposite whether he'd mind if she opened the window.
example.egtrans: 她问坐在对面的那位男子是否介意她把窗打开。

example.eg: The people who live opposite (= on the other side of the road) are always making a lot of noise.
example.egtrans: 住在马路对面的人总是很闹腾。

opt-in.name: opt-in
opt-in.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of choosing to take part in an activity, arrangement, etc. rather than being forced to take part

example.eg: It is an opt-in rather than an opt-out system, which means that permission must be sought on a case-by-case basis.
example.egtrans: 这是一个主动选择加入而非主动选择退出的系统，这就意味着准许令必须酌情逐个考虑。

opt-out.name: opt-out
opt-out.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which some members of a group choose not to join or be involved in an activity

example.eg: Since the opt-out, the hospital has been responsible for its own budgeting.
example.egtrans: 自从主动选择退出后，这家医院要对自己的预算负责。

optimal.name: optimal
optimal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en:
→ 
        
         optimum

optimization.name: optimization
optimization.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of making something as good as possible

example.eg: the optimization of chemical processes
example.egtrans: 对化学工序流程的优化

optional.name: optional
optional.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something is optional, you can choose if you want to do it, pay it, buy it, etc.

example.eg: English is compulsory for all students, but art and music are optional.
example.egtrans: 英语是所有学生的必修课，而艺术和音乐则是选修的。

order.name: order
order.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a request to make, supply, or deliver food or goods

example.eg: "Can I take your order now?" said the waiter.
example.egtrans: 侍者问：“现在可以点菜了吗？”

example.eg: I would like to place (= make) an order for a large pine table.
example.egtrans: 我想订制一张大松木桌。

trans_examp.trans_en: a product or a meal that has been asked for by a customer

example.eg: I got an email saying that the order has been shipped.
example.egtrans: 我收到电子邮件说订的货已经发出了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is on order, you have asked for it but have not yet received it.

example.eg: The new drilling equipment has been on order for several weeks.
example.egtrans: 新的钻探设备已经订购有几星期了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do or make something especially for a person who has asked for it

example.eg: We make wedding cakes to order.
example.egtrans: 我们提供订做婚礼蛋糕。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which people or things are arranged, either in relation to one another or according to a particular characteristic

example.eg: The children lined up in order of age/height.
example.egtrans: 孩子们按照年龄／身高顺序排列成队。

example.eg: I can't find the file I need because they're all out of order (= they are no longer arranged in the correct way).
example.egtrans: 我找不到我需要的文件，因为它们都给弄乱了。

example.eg: Put the files in alphabetical/chronological order.
example.egtrans: 把文件按照字母／时间顺序放好。

example.eg: Here's the running order for the concert (= the order in which each item will happen).
example.egtrans: 这是音乐会的节目单。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that someone tells you you must do

example.eg: The soldiers fired as soon as their commander gave the order.
example.egtrans: 指挥官一声令下，士兵们立即开火。

example.eg: Soldiers must obey orders.
example.egtrans: 军人必须服从命令。

example.eg: What are your orders?
example.egtrans: 你接到了什么指示？

example.eg: My orders are to search everyone's bag as they come in.
example.egtrans: 我接到的命令是搜查每个进来的人的包。

example.eg: The road was closed all day by order of the police.
example.egtrans: 按照警方的命令，这条路全天封闭。

example.eg: Clean up this room immediately - and that's an order!
example.egtrans: 立刻清理好这间屋子——这是命令！

trans_examp.trans_en: an official instruction telling someone what they can or cannot do, or a written instruction to a bank to pay money to a particular person

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have been told that you must do something by someone in authority
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 命令就是命令，命令必须执行

example.eg: We are under orders not to allow anyone into the building.
example.egtrans: 我们接到命令不许任何人进入该大楼。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

phrase.phrase_title: in order (for sb/sth) to do sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: with the aim of achieving something

example.eg: He came home early in order to see the kids before they went to bed.
example.egtrans: 他早回家是为了在孩子们睡觉前看到他们。

example.eg: I agreed to her suggestion in order not to upset her.
example.egtrans: 为了不让她伤心，我同意了她的建议。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which everything is arranged in its correct place

example.eg: The house was such a mess that she spent the whole day trying to establish some kind of order.
example.egtrans: 房子里很乱，她花了一整天的时间想把它收拾得整洁一些。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to organize something well
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 使有条理；把…整理得井井有条

example.eg: I try to leave my desk in order when I go home.
example.egtrans: 我回家前整理了我的办公桌。

example.eg: He put his affairs in order (= made arrangements for his personal and business matters) before he went into the hospital.
example.egtrans: 他住院之前把自己的事情都安排好了。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the state of working correctly or of being suitable for use
trans_examp.trans_cn: 正常工作状况；良好使用状况

example.eg: TV for sale in (good) working order.
example.egtrans: 出售性能良好的电视机。

example.eg: Are your immigration papers in order (= legally correct)?
example.egtrans: 你的移民证件是否合法？

example.eg: The coffee machine is out of order (= not working).
example.egtrans: 咖啡机坏了。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which rules are obeyed and people do what they are expected to do

example.eg: The teacher found it hard to keep her class in order.
example.egtrans: 老师发现很难维持课堂秩序。

example.eg: As the demonstration began to turn violent, the police were called in to restore order.
example.egtrans: 当示威游行开始演变成暴力活动时，警察被召来恢复秩序。

example.eg: After some heated discussion, the chairperson called the meeting to order (= told everyone to stop talking so that the meeting could continue).
example.egtrans: 经过一番热烈的讨论后，主席请与会人员安静下来。

example.eg: Is it in order (= allowed) for me to park my car outside the building?
example.egtrans: 我可以把汽车停在大楼外面吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an expression used in a parliament or a formal meeting to get people's attention and make them stop talking, so that the meeting or discussion can start or continue
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 安静！安静！（用于议会或正式会议中）

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a social or political system

example.eg: The collapse of Communism at the end of the 1980s encouraged hopes of a new world order.
example.egtrans: 20世纪80年代末，共产主义的瓦解点燃了建立世界新秩序的希望。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people who join together for religious or similar reasons and live according to particular rules
trans_examp.trans_cn: （按照一定规范生活的）修道会；会社

example.eg: religious/holy orders
example.egtrans: 修道会／圣职

example.eg: monks of the Cistercian/Franciscan Order
example.egtrans: 西多会／方济各会的修道士

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group that people are made members of as a reward for services they have done for their country

example.eg: He was made a knight of the Order of the Garter.
example.egtrans: 他被封为嘉德勋爵士。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the type or size of something

example.eg: These were problems of a completely different order from anything we had faced before.
example.egtrans: 这些问题同我们以前所遇到过的完全不同。

example.eg: No successful business can be run without skills of the highest order (= great skills).
example.egtrans: 没有超群的才能是无法成功经营企业的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: approximately

example.eg: The cost will be something in the order of $500.
example.egtrans: 费用大约为500美元。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (used in the classification of plants and animals) a group of related plants or animals

example.eg: An order is below a class and above a family.
example.egtrans: 目低于纲，高于科。

order.name: order
order.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to ask for something to be made, supplied, or delivered, especially in a restaurant or shop
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指在饭店或商店）点（饭菜），订购，订制，订货

example.eg: I ordered some pasta and a mixed salad.
example.egtrans: 我点了意大利面条和一份什锦色拉。

example.eg: There are no shirts left in this size but we could order one for you/order you one.
example.egtrans: 这个尺寸的衬衫没有了，不过我们可以给您订购一件。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a person in authority orders someone to do something, or orders something to be done, they tell someone to do it.

example.eg: The management has ordered a cutback in spending.
example.egtrans: 管理层指示要减少开销。

example.eg: "Wait over there," she ordered.
example.egtrans: “在那儿等着，”她吩咐道。

example.eg: They ordered him to leave the room.
example.egtrans: 他们命令他离开房间。

dsense.name: order
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange a group of people or things in a list from first to last

example.eg: The documents have been ordered alphabetically.
example.egtrans: 文件已经按字母顺序排列好了。

example.eg: I've ordered the application forms into three groups.
example.egtrans: 我将申请表整理成了3组。

orientation.name: orientation
orientation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: orientation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the particular things that a person prefers, believes, thinks, or usually does
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某人的）特别喜好，价值取向，信仰观念

example.eg: We employ people without regard to their political or sexual orientation.
example.egtrans: 我们雇用人时并不考虑其政治或性取向。

dsense.name: orientation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the particular interests, activities, or aims of an organization or business

example.eg: the company's new eco-friendly orientation
example.egtrans: 公司保护生态环境的新定位

dsense.name: orientation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: training or preparation for a new job or activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对新工作、新活动的）培训，准备

example.eg: The department has arranged an orientation session.
example.egtrans: 这个部门安排了一次岗前培训。

dsense.name: orientation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: arrangement or direction

example.eg: The building has an east-west orientation (= it is built on a line between east and west).
example.egtrans: 这幢大楼是东西向的。

origin.name: origin
origin.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the beginning or cause of something

example.eg: It's a book about the origin of the universe.
example.egtrans: 这是一本关于宇宙起源的书。

example.eg: Her unhappy childhood was the origin of her problems later in life.
example.egtrans: 她不幸的童年导致了她后来生活中的诸多问题。

example.eg: What's the origin of this saying? (= Where did it come from?)
example.egtrans: 这一格言出自什么地方？

trans_examp.trans_en: where a person was born

example.eg: He is of North African origin.
example.egtrans: 他是北非裔人。

example.eg: What is your country of origin?
example.egtrans: 你出生在哪个国家？

trans_examp.trans_en: where an object was made

example.eg: The furniture was French in origin.
example.egtrans: 这家具产于法国。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to describe the particular way in which something started to exist or someone started their life

example.eg: The story has obscure origins (= no one knows how it started).
example.egtrans: 这个故事的起源已不可考。

example.eg: The president's family was of humble origins (= they were poor people without a good position in society).
example.egtrans: 总统家庭出身卑微。

trans_examp.trans_en: the end of a muscle attached to the bone that does not move when the muscle is used

original.name: original
original.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: original
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing since the beginning, or being the earliest form of something

example.eg: Is this the original fireplace?
example.egtrans: 这是原先的壁炉吗？

example.eg: The gardens have recently been restored to their original glory.
example.egtrans: 这些园林最近恢复了原先的辉煌。

trans_examp.trans_en: An original piece of work, such as a painting, etc. is produced by the artist and not a copy.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 原作的，真迹的，非赝品的

example.eg: an original drawing/manuscript
example.egtrans: 原画／稿

example.eg: Is this an original Rembrandt? (= Was it painted by him?)
example.egtrans: 这是伦勃朗的原作吗？

dsense.name: original
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not the same as anything or anyone else and therefore special and interesting
trans_examp.trans_cn: 独创的，有创意的，新颖的

example.eg: original ideas/suggestions/work
example.egtrans: 新颖的观点／独到的建议／独创性的工作成果

example.eg: She's a highly original young designer.
example.egtrans: 她是个很有创意的年轻设计师。

original.name: original
original.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the first one made and not a copy

example.eg: Can you give me the original of your report? I can't read this copy.
example.egtrans: 能把你报告的原件给我吗？我看不清这份复印件。

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of work by a famous artist or designer and not a copy by someone else

example.eg: If the painting is an original, it will be very valuable.
example.egtrans: 如果这幅画是原作，会非常值钱。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you read something in the original, you read it in the language in which it was first written.

originally.name: originally
originally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: first of all

example.eg: Originally it was a bedroom, but we turned it into a study.
example.egtrans: 这原本是间卧室，但我们把它改成了书房。

originate.name: originate
originate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to come from a particular place, time, situation, etc.

example.eg: Although the technology originated in the UK, it has been developed in the US
example.egtrans: 尽管这项技术起源于英国，但它在美国得到了发展。

example.eg: The game is thought to have originated among the native peoples of Alaska.
example.egtrans: 据认为，这项运动始于阿拉斯加的土著人。

trans_examp.trans_en: to start something or cause it to happen

example.eg: Who originated the saying "Small is beautiful"?
example.egtrans: “小即美”这句话最早是谁说的？

other than.name: other
other than.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

dsense.name: other
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

trans_examp.trans_en: as well as the thing or person already mentioned

example.eg: The product has many other time-saving features.
example.egtrans: 该产品还有许多其他的省时特性。

example.eg: There is no other work available at the moment.
example.egtrans: 眼下没有其他的活儿了。

example.eg: There is only one other person who could help us.
example.egtrans: 只有另外一个人可以帮助我们。

example.eg: Are there any other people we should ask?
example.egtrans: 另外还有我们应该问的人吗？

example.eg: I found one earring - do you know where the other one is?
example.egtrans: 我找到了一只耳环——你知道另一只在哪儿吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: used at the end of a list to show that there are more things, without being exact about what they are

example.eg: The plan has been opposed by schools, businesses and other local organizations.
example.egtrans: 该计划遭到了学校、企业及其他当地组织的反对。

example.eg: These two books will be especially useful for editors, journalists and other professional users of the language.
example.egtrans: 这两本书将对编辑、记者及其他使用该语言的专业人士尤为有用。

dsense.name: other
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the opposite side or end of something

example.eg: Put the chair at the other end of the desk.
example.egtrans: 把椅子放到桌子的另一边去。

example.eg: The man was waiting on the other side of the street.
example.egtrans: 那个人在街对面等着。

dsense.name: other
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun or adj to show which person or thing is being referred to.

trans_examp.trans_en: different from the thing or person already mentioned

example.eg: Idon't have any cash - is there no other way of paying?
example.egtrans: 我没有现金——没有其他支付方式吗？

example.eg: He likes travelling abroad and learning about other people's customs and traditions.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢到国外去旅行，并了解其他民族的风俗习惯。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: referring to a day, week, etc. in the recent past without saying exactly when it was
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （指最近某个大概的时间）那天/那个星期（等等）

example.eg: I saw him just the other day/night.
example.egtrans: 我那天／那天晚上刚见过他。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: different from or except

example.eg: Cruises other than the ones listed below are not discounted at this time.
example.egtrans: 除了下面列出的乘船游览项目以外，其他项目没有折扣。

example.eg: The form cannot be signed by anyone other than yourself.
example.egtrans: 除了你本人，谁也不能在这张表格上签字。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a negative sentence, used to mean "except"

example.eg: There's nothing on TV tonight, other than the usual rubbish.
example.egtrans: 今晚的电视除了惯常的垃圾，再没别的了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to introduce an explanation that is simpler than the one given earlier

example.eg: He was economical with the truth - in other words, he was lying.
example.egtrans: 他没讲多少实话——换言之，他在撒谎。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used when you cannot or do not want to be exact about the information you are giving

example.eg: The event was held in some park or other.
example.egtrans: 这个活动是在某个公园举行的。

example.eg: We'll find someone or other to help us.
example.egtrans: 我们会找个人来帮我们的。

other than.name: other
other than.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: the second of two things or people, or the thing or person that is left in a group or set of things
trans_examp.trans_cn: （两者中的）另一个，第二个；（一组或一套中的）另一个

example.eg: Hold the racquet in one hand and the ball in the other.
example.egtrans: 一只手握拍，另一只手持球。

example.eg: Some people prefer a vegetarian diet, while others prefer a meat-based diet.
example.egtrans: 有的人偏爱素食，而另一些人偏爱肉食。

example.eg: She gave me one book last week and promised to bring the others on Wednesday.
example.egtrans: 上周她给了我一本书，并答应周三把其他的书带来。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: more ones

example.eg: I only know about this book, but there might be others (= other books).
example.egtrans: 我只知道这本书，不过或许还有别的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: people in general, not including yourself

example.eg: You shouldn't expect others to do your work for you.
example.egtrans: 你不应该指望别人替你干活儿。

otherwise.name: otherwise
otherwise.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used after an order or suggestion to show what the result will be if you do not follow that order or suggestion

example.eg: I'd better write it down, otherwise I'll forget it.
example.egtrans: 我最好把它写下来，否则我会忘了的。

example.eg: Call home, otherwise your parents will start to worry.
example.egtrans: 给家里打个电话，不然你父母会开始担心的。

otherwise.name: otherwise
otherwise.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: otherwise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: differently, or in another way

example.eg: The police believe he is the thief, but all the evidence suggests otherwise (= that he is not).
example.egtrans: 警方认为他就是小偷，但所有的证据都显示他不是。

example.eg: Under the Bill of Rights, a person is presumed innocent until proved otherwise (= guilty).
example.egtrans: 根据《人权法案》，任何人在被证明有罪之前都被视为是无罪的。

example.eg: Protestors were executed, jailed or otherwise persecuted.
example.egtrans: 抗议者被处决、监禁或受到其他方式的迫害。

example.eg: Marion Morrison, otherwise known as the film star John Wayne, was born in 1907.
example.egtrans: 玛丽昂‧莫里森，即影星约翰‧韦恩，生于1907年。

example.eg: I can't meet you on Tuesday - I'm otherwise engaged/occupied (= doing something else).
example.egtrans: 星期二我不能与你见面——我要忙别的事。

dsense.name: otherwise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: except for what has just been referred to

example.eg: The bike needs a new wheel, but otherwise it's in good condition.
example.egtrans: 这辆自行车除了需要一个新轮子外，车况良好。

example.eg: The poor sound quality ruined an otherwise beautiful film.
example.egtrans: 本来是一部优秀的电影，可是却被这糟糕的音质给毁了。

otherwise.name: otherwise
otherwise.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to show that something is completely different from what you think it is or from what was previously stated
trans_examp.trans_cn: 全然不是那样的，根本不是那么回事的

example.eg: He might have told you he was a qualified electrician, but the truth is quite otherwise.
example.egtrans: 他或许告诉过你他是个合格的电工，可实际上完全不是这么回事。

outline.name: outline
outline.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the main shape or edge of something, without any details

example.eg: She drew the outline of the boat and then coloured it in.
example.egtrans: 她画了这只船的草图，然后给它着色。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as a shape with an edge but without any details

example.eg: The mountain was visible only in outline as the light faded.
example.egtrans: 光线暗了下来，只能看见山的轮廓。

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a description of the main facts about something

example.eg: If you read the minutes of the meeting, they'll give you a broad outline of what was discussed.
example.egtrans: 如果你看了会议记录，就会知道讨论的大概内容。

example.eg: Some novelists start by writing an outline (= plan of the main points of the story).
example.egtrans: 有些小说家创作时会先写个提纲。

outline.name: outline
outline.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to draw the main shape or edge of something

example.eg: The area we're interested in is outlined in red on the map.
example.egtrans: 我们感兴趣的地区已经用红笔在地图上勾出来了。

dsense.name: outline
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give the main facts about something

example.eg: At the interview she outlined what I would be doing.
example.egtrans: 面试时她简要介绍了一下我将要从事的工作。

overall.name: overall
overall.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in general rather than in particular, or including all the people or things in a particular group or situation
trans_examp.trans_cn: 总的（来说） ；全面的（地） ；包括一切的（地）

example.eg: The overall situation is good, despite a few minor problems.
example.egtrans: 尽管有一些小问题，局势总的来说是好的。

example.eg: Overall, it has been a good year.
example.egtrans: 总的来说，这一年很不错。

example.eg: The overall winner, after ten games, will receive $250,000.
example.egtrans: 10场比赛后，总冠军将获得25万美元。

Overarching.name: overarching
Overarching.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: most important, because of including or affecting all other areas
trans_examp.trans_cn: 首要的；包罗万象的，支配一切的

example.eg: a grand overarching strategy
example.egtrans: 关乎全局的重大策略

example.eg: The overarching theme of the election campaign was tax cuts.
example.egtrans: 竞选活动的首要主题是减税。

overhead.name: overhead
overhead.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: above your head, usually in the sky

example.eg: overhead cables
example.egtrans: 高架电缆

example.eg: A flock of geese flew overhead.
example.egtrans: 一群大雁从空中飞过。

example.eg: This room needs overhead lighting (= lights in the ceiling).
example.egtrans: 这个房间需要有顶灯。

overhead.name: overhead
overhead.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the overheads of a business
trans_examp.trans_cn: 企业日常开支的；日常经费的

example.eg: One way of increasing profit margins is to cut overhead costs.
example.egtrans: 增加利润额的一个方法是减少管理费用。

overhead.name: overhead
overhead.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: overhead
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a transparent sheet used for showing text or pictures with an overhead projector

dsense.name: overhead
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the regular and necessary costs, such as rent and heating, that are involved in operating a business
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （公司的）经常性开支，营运费用，经费

example.eg: We need to reduce our overheads.
example.egtrans: 我们需要减少经常性开支。

example.eg: Many businesses are moving out of New York because the overheads there are so high.
example.egtrans: 许多企业正迁出纽约，因为那里的运营成本太高了。

overkill.name: overkill
overkill.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: much more of something than is needed, resulting in less effectiveness

example.eg: Should I add an explanation, or would that be overkill?
example.egtrans: 我应该再解释一下吗，还是那样会画蛇添足？

overlap.name: overlap
overlap.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cover something partly by going over its edge; to cover part of the same space

example.eg: The fence is made of panels that overlap (each other).
example.egtrans: 这个围栏是由交叠的板条搭成的。

trans_examp.trans_en: If two or more activities, subjects, or periods of time overlap, they have some parts that are the same.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （活动、课程或时间）相互重叠，有共同之处

example.eg: My musical tastes don't overlap with my brother's at all.
example.egtrans: 我对音乐的喜好和我弟弟完全不一样。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a football player overlaps, they pass the ball to another member of their team and then run beyond that player so that they are ready to receive the ball again.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球）叠瓦式跑动，叠加式跑动

overlap.name: overlap
overlap.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: overlap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount by which two things or activities cover the same area

example.eg: The roof tiles will need an overlap of several centimetres.
example.egtrans: 屋顶的瓦片需要相互重叠几公分。

example.eg: There are some overlaps between the products of the two companies.
example.egtrans: 这两家公司的产品有些是相同的。

dsense.name: overlap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in football, a movement in which a player passes the ball to another member of their team and then runs beyond that player so that they are ready to receive the ball again
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球）叠瓦式跑动，叠加式跑动

overlay.name: overlay
overlay.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cover something with a layer of something

example.eg: The tiny carvings were overlaid with silver.
example.egtrans: 这些尺寸极小的雕刻品上贴了一层银。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: Something that is overlaid with something has a particular quality added to it that influences its character.

example.eg: Her new novel is overlaid with political concerns.
example.egtrans: 她的新小说包含着对政治的关注。

overlay.name: overlay
overlay.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thin covering of something

example.eg: The wood frame has a gold overlay.
example.egtrans: 这个木框表面覆了一层金箔。

overload.name: overload
overload.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put too many things in or on something

example.eg: Don't overload the washing machine, or it won't get the clothes clean.
example.egtrans: 别往洗衣机里塞太多衣服，否则就洗不干净衣服了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to put too much electricity through an electrical system
to give someone more work or problems than they can deal with

example.eg: Try not to overload yourself with work.
example.egtrans: 尽量不要让你自己工作负担太重。

overload.name: overload
overload.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that something or someone is overloaded

example.eg: People today suffer from information overload (= being given too much information).
example.egtrans: 如今过大的信息量使人们应接不暇。

example.eg: There was an overload on the electrical circuit and the fuse blew.
example.egtrans: 电路超负荷，保险丝烧断了。

overly.name: overly
overly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: too; very

example.eg: Earlier sales forecasts were overly optimistic.
example.egtrans: 早先的销售预测过于乐观了。

example.eg: His films have been criticized for being overly violent.
example.egtrans: 人们批评他的电影过于暴力。

override.name: override
override.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: override
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a person who has the necessary authority) to decide against or refuse to accept a previous decision, an order, a person, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （拥有必要权威的人）否决，推翻，撤销，使无效

example.eg: Every time I make a suggestion at work, my boss overrides me/it.
example.egtrans: 每次我对工作提出建议，我的老板都不听。

example.eg: The president used his veto to override the committee's decision.
example.egtrans: 总裁利用手中的否决权推翻了委员会的决定。

trans_examp.trans_en: to operate an automatic machine by hand
trans_examp.trans_cn: 对（自动机器）改用手控；超驰控制，超控

example.eg: He overrode the autopilot when he realized it was malfunctioning.
example.egtrans: 他意识到自动驾驶仪出了故障，就改为手动驾驶。

dsense.name: override
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take control over something, especially in order to change the way it operates
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指为改变运作方式而）操控，制服

example.eg: The pills are designed to override your body's own hormones.
example.egtrans: 这些药片用以调节人体自身的荷尔蒙分泌。

dsense.name: override
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be more important than something

example.eg: Parents' concern for their children's future often overrides all their other concerns.
example.egtrans: 父母对子女未来的考虑往往重于他们对其他任何事情的关心。

dsense.name: override
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to travel on public transport further than your ticket allows you to
trans_examp.trans_cn: （公共交通工具）超程乘车（实际距离超出车票允许的距离）

example.eg: There is a $20 penalty for passengers who travel without a ticket or override.
example.egtrans: 无票旅行或超程旅行的乘客将受到20美元的处罚。

override.name: override
override.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: override
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a device that changes the control of a machine or system in special situations, especially from automatic to manual
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指从自动改为手动的）超控装置

example.eg: The heating system has a manual override.
example.egtrans: 这套取暖系统有一个手动超控装置。

dsense.name: override
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in American politics, an occasion when an elected group of people refuses to accept a decision made by an elected leader
trans_examp.trans_cn: （美国政治中对选举产生的领导人所作决定的）否决，推翻

example.eg: The vote fell short of the majority needed for an override of the Governor's veto.
example.egtrans: 投票未过半数，未能推翻州长的否决。

overview.name: overview
overview.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a short description of something that provides general information about it, but no details

example.eg: I'll give you a brief overview of what the job involves.
example.egtrans: 这项工作包括些什么内容，我给你作个简要概括。

pain.name: pain
pain.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a feeling of physical suffering caused by injury or illness

example.eg: Her symptoms included abdominal pain and vomiting.
example.egtrans: 她的症状包括腹痛和呕吐。

example.eg: Are you in (= suffering from) pain?
example.egtrans: 你疼吗？

example.eg: She was in constant pain.
example.egtrans: 她一直疼个不停。

example.eg: These tablets should help to ease the pain.
example.egtrans: 这些药片会有助于缓解疼痛。

example.eg: I felt a sharp pain in my foot.
example.egtrans: 我感到脚上一阵剧痛。

example.eg: He's been suffering various aches and pains for years.
example.egtrans: 他多年来一直受着各种病痛的折磨。

trans_examp.trans_en: emotional or mental suffering

example.eg: It's a film about the pains and pleasures of parenthood.
example.egtrans: 这是一部描写为人父母者的酸甜苦辣的影片。

example.eg: The parents are still in great pain over the death of their child.
example.egtrans: 这对父母还在为孩子的死而悲痛万分。

pain.name: pain
pain.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something pains you, it causes you to feel sad and upset.

example.eg: It pains me to see animals being mistreated.
example.egtrans: 看到动物受虐待我很痛心。

painstakingly.name: painstakingly
painstakingly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that shows you have taken a lot of care or made a lot of effort

example.eg: She painstakingly explained how the machine worked.
example.egtrans: 她悉心地解释这台机器是如何运转的。

pair.name: pair
pair.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: two things of the same appearance and size that are intended to be used together, or something that consists of two parts joined together

example.eg: a pair of shoes/gloves
example.egtrans: 一双鞋／一副手套

example.eg: a pair of scissors/glasses
example.egtrans: 一把剪刀／一副眼镜

example.eg: I can't find a matching pair of socks.
example.egtrans: 我找不到两只成对的袜子。

example.eg: He packed two pairs of trousers and four shirts.
example.egtrans: 他把两条裤子和四件衬衣放进包里。

example.eg: I'd like you to do this exercise in pairs (= in groups of two).
example.egtrans: 我希望你们两人一组来做这个练习。

trans_examp.trans_en: two people who have a romantic relationship or are doing something together

example.eg: They seem a very happy pair.
example.egtrans: 他们像是很幸福的一对。

example.eg: What have the pair of you been up to?
example.egtrans: 你们俩在搞什么名堂？

trans_examp.trans_en: two animals that come together to have sex and produce young

example.eg: a breeding pair
example.egtrans: 进行繁殖的一对

example.eg: a mated pair of swans
example.egtrans: 一对天鹅

pair.name: pair
pair.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something one of a pair, or to become one of a pair

example.eg: Famous paintings have been paired with poems by Sandburg, Angelou, and others.
example.egtrans: 著名的油画作品与桑德伯格和安杰洛等人的诗配成对。

parameter.name: parameter
parameter.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of facts or a fixed limit that establishes or limits how something can or must happen or be done
trans_examp.trans_cn: 限定因素；界限；范围；规范

example.eg: The researchers must keep within the parameters of the experiment.
example.egtrans: 研究员必须在试验既定的范围内进行研究。

example.eg: The central office sets/establishes the parameters that guide policy at the local level.
example.egtrans: 中央办公室制定规范，指导地方政策。

parenthesis.name: parenthesis
parenthesis.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a remark that is added to a sentence, often to provide an explanation or extra information, that is separated from the main part of the sentence by commas, brackets, or dashes

example.eg: The sentence "Her youngest sister - the one who lives in Australia - is coming over next summer" contains a parenthesis.
example.egtrans: “她妹妹——住在澳大利亚的那一个——夏天会来”这句话中包含一个插入语。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If, while you are talking, you say something in parenthesis, you say it as something extra and then continue with the main part of the sentence.

example.eg: Of his origins he said very little, merely mentioning in parenthesis that his background was poor.
example.egtrans: 关于他的身世他谈得很少，只是附带地提到他家境贫寒。

parse.name: parse
parse.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to separate a sentence into grammatical parts, such as subject, verb, etc.

parsing.name: parse
parsing.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to separate a sentence into grammatical parts, such as subject, verb, etc.

partial.name: partial
partial.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: partial
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not complete

example.eg: The general has ordered a partial withdrawal of troops from the area.
example.egtrans: 将军已下令部队部分人员撤出该地区。

dsense.name: partial
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: influenced by the fact that you personally prefer or approve of something, so that you do not judge fairly
trans_examp.trans_cn: 偏向一方的，偏袒的，偏心的

example.eg: The reporting in the papers is entirely partial and makes no attempt to be objective.
example.egtrans: 报纸上的报道完全不客观，而且也没打算保持客观。

dsense.name: partial
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a liking for something

example.eg: I'm not partial to fish.
example.egtrans: 我并不特别爱吃鱼。

particularly.name: particularly
particularly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: especially, or more than usual

example.eg: We're particularly interested to hear from people who speak two or more European languages.
example.egtrans: 我们特别希望能收到说两种或两种以上欧洲语言的人的来信。

example.eg: I didn't particularly want to go, but I had to.
example.egtrans: 我并不是特别想去，但我不得不去。

pass.name: pass
pass.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go past something or someone or move in relation to it, him, or her

example.eg: I passed him on the stairs this morning.
example.egtrans: 今天早上我在楼梯上与他擦肩而过。

example.eg: You should only pass a slower vehicle if it is safe to do so.
example.egtrans: 只有在安全的情况下，你才应该超越较慢的车辆。

example.eg: If you pass a supermarket, could you get me some milk?
example.egtrans: 你若是路过超市的话，帮我买些牛奶好吗？

example.eg: I was just passing by (= going past the place where you are), so I thought I'd drop in for a chat.
example.egtrans: 我正好路过，所以想进来聊聊。

example.eg: A momentary look of anxiety passed across his face.
example.egtrans: 他脸上闪过一丝焦虑的神情。

example.eg: A cloud passed over the sun.
example.egtrans: 一朵云飘过，遮住了太阳。

trans_examp.trans_en: to go past a particular point in time

example.eg: Don't buy goods that have passed their sell-by date.
example.egtrans: 不要购买过了销售期限的商品。

trans_examp.trans_en: to go past something by being greater in amount or degree

example.eg: The company's turnover is expected to pass the $10 million mark by the end of this year.
example.egtrans: 公司营业额预计将在今年年底超过一千万美元大关。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you say a state or feeling will pass, you mean it will disappear.

example.eg: Don't worry, his depression is only temporary - it'll soon pass.
example.egtrans: 别担心，他的消沉只是暂时的——很快就会过去。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be successful in an exam, course, etc.

example.eg: Guess what? I've passed my driving test!
example.egtrans: 你猜怎么着？我通过驾驶考试了！

example.eg: The exam is so hard that only five percent of all applicants pass.
example.egtrans: 考试太难了，所有考生中只有5%通过。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something to someone

example.eg: Could you pass the salt please?
example.egtrans: 你能把盐递给我吗？

example.eg: I asked if I could see the letter, so she passed it to me reluctantly.
example.egtrans: 我问能不能看看那封信，她很不情愿地递给了我。

example.eg: Gerald passed me the note./Gerald passed the note to me.
example.egtrans: 杰拉尔德把便条递给了我。

example.eg: Genes are the means by which parents' characteristics are passed on to their children.
example.egtrans: 基因是一系列遗传指令，父母的特征通过它们遗传给子女。

trans_examp.trans_en: In sports, if you pass the ball, you kick, throw, or hit it to someone in your team.
If you pass money, you give someone false or stolen money without telling them.

example.eg: I haven't trusted him since he passed me a forged $100 bill.
example.egtrans: 自从他给了我一张100美元的假钞后我就不信任他了。

example.eg: She was arrested for passing stolen cheques.
example.egtrans: 她因使用偷窃的支票而被捕。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: When time passes, it goes past.

example.eg: Time seems to pass (by) so slowly when you're bored.
example.egtrans: 百无聊赖时，时间似乎过得很慢。

example.eg: I was a little worried about the party, but the evening passed without any great disasters.
example.egtrans: 我有点为晚会担心，但是一晚上过去了，并没出什么大纰漏。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you pass a period of time, you do something to stop yourself being bored during that period.

example.eg: The visitors pass their days swimming, windsurfing, and playing volleyball.
example.egtrans: 游客们通过游泳、冲浪和打排球来消磨时间。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of an official group of people) to give approval to something, especially by voting to make it law

example.eg: The government passed a law to restrict the sale of guns.
example.egtrans: 政府通过了一项限制枪支买卖的法律。

example.eg: The food supplement had been passed as safe for human consumption.
example.egtrans: 这种食品添加剂通过了检测，适合食用。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to express a judgment or opinion about something, especially someone else's behaviour

example.eg: As a convicted criminal, he's in no position to pass judgment (on the rest of us).
example.egtrans: 他是已定罪的罪犯，没资格（对我们其他人）品头论足。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to say officially, as a judge, what a criminal's official punishment will be

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove waste from the body

example.eg: to pass urine
example.egtrans: 排尿

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have blood in your urine or faeces (= solid waste)

example.eg: If you pass blood, you should go and see your doctor.
example.egtrans: 如果你便血的话应该去看医生。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to choose not to play in a part of a game or not to answer a question in a quiz
trans_examp.trans_cn: （牌戏中不出牌或竞赛中不回答问题时的用语）过

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change from one state to another

example.eg: Wax passes from solid to liquid when you heat it.
example.egtrans: 蜡受热后会从固体变成液体。

pass.name: pass
pass.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a successful result in an exam

example.eg: Jon Hill achieved two grade A passes at A-level.
example.egtrans: 乔‧希尔在高级证书考试中取得了 A 等成绩。

trans_examp.trans_en: a successful result in a course or exam for which the student will not be given a mark

example.eg: I got a pass in my Literature course.
example.egtrans: 我修习的文学课程考试及格了。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a movement of the ball from one player to another member of the same team in a team sport

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official document or ticket showing that you have the right to go somewhere or use a particular form of transport

example.eg: a bus pass
example.egtrans: 公共汽车乘车证

example.eg: a boarding pass
example.egtrans: 登机牌

example.eg: My guest pass allows me to use the club's facilities free of charge.
example.egtrans: 我有贵宾证，可以免费使用该俱乐部的设施。

trans_examp.trans_en: a document that allows a student to leave a class for a particular reason
trans_examp.trans_cn: 免课证（允许某一学生因为特殊原因离开课堂）

example.eg: She had a pass to go to the library.
example.egtrans: 她得到许可离开课堂去图书馆。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a path or road between or over mountains

example.eg: a mountain pass
example.egtrans: 山口

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a difficult or unpleasant condition

example.eg: If I'd been aware things had reached such a pass, I'd have told the police.
example.egtrans: 我要是知道事情已到了这步田地，早就报警了。

example.eg: It's come to a pretty pass (= it's a bad situation) when you can't even have a few quiet drinks with some friends.
example.egtrans: 当你连和几个朋友安静地喝几杯也不行时，处境真是糟透了。

dsense.name: pass
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to speak to or touch someone in a way that shows you would like to start a sexual relationship with them

patch.name: patch
patch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: patch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small area that is different in some way from the area that surrounds it

example.eg: Our dog has a black patch on his back.
example.egtrans: 我们的狗背上有块黑斑。

example.eg: The hotel walls were covered in damp patches.
example.egtrans: 旅馆的墙壁上满是湿渍。

example.eg: There were lots of icy patches on the road this morning.
example.egtrans: 今天早上路上有好多地方结了冰。

example.eg: This story is good in patches (= some parts are good), but I wouldn't really recommend it.
example.egtrans: 这部小说有些部分写得不错，但我不是很想推荐它。

trans_examp.trans_en: a local area within which someone works

example.eg: He's been working as a policeman on the same patch for 20 years.
example.egtrans: 他已经在同一个管区当了20年的警察。

dsense.name: patch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of material sewn or stuck over something to cover it

example.eg: I'll have to sew a patch onto these jeans - they're ripped at the knee.
example.egtrans: 我得给这条牛仔裤打个补丁——膝盖处撕破了。

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of material that can be stuck to the skin, from which particular substances can be absorbed into the body

example.eg: Some people wear nicotine patches to help them give up smoking.
example.egtrans: 有些人贴尼古丁戒烟贴片来帮助自己戒烟。

trans_examp.trans_en:
an 
        
         eyepatch

dsense.name: patch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small computer program that can be added to an existing program in order to make the existing program work as it should
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用来完善已有程序的）程序补丁

example.eg: I downloaded a patch from their website.
example.egtrans: 我从他们的网站上下载了一个程序补丁。

patch.name: patch
patch.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: patch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to connect electronic or phone equipment to a system
trans_examp.trans_cn: 接通，连接（电子设备或电话）

dsense.name: patch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a patch on something

dsense.name: patch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to solve a problem that a computer system or program has
trans_examp.trans_cn: 解决计算机系统或程序的某个问题

example.eg: They issued an update to patch the bug.
example.egtrans: 他们发布了一个更新来修补这个错误。

example.eg: We need to identify and patch vulnerabilities in internet security.
example.egtrans: 我们需要识别和修补互联网安全方面的漏洞。

pattern.name: pattern
pattern.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: pattern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular way in which something is done, is organized, or happens

example.eg: The pattern of family life has been changing over recent years.
example.egtrans: 近年来家庭生活的模式一直在变化。

example.eg: A pattern is beginning to emerge from our analysis of the accident data.
example.egtrans: 我们对事故数据进行分析后发现一种模式开始显现出来。

example.eg: In this type of mental illness, the usual pattern is bouts of depression alternating with elation.
example.egtrans: 这种精神病通常的发病症状是时而萎靡不振，时而兴高采烈。

example.eg: Many behaviour(al) patterns have been identified in the chimp colony.
example.egtrans: 黑猩猩群体中的许多行为模式已被识别。

dsense.name: pattern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any regularly repeated arrangement, especially a design made from repeated lines, shapes, or colours on a surface

example.eg: Look, the frost has made a beautiful pattern on the window.
example.egtrans: 看啊，霜在窗户上形成了美丽的图案。

example.eg: The curtains had a floral pattern.
example.egtrans: 窗帘上有花的图案。

dsense.name: pattern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is used as an example, especially to copy

example.eg: The design is so good it's sure to set the pattern for many others.
example.egtrans: 这个设计太好了，一定会成为许多其他设计的样板。

dsense.name: pattern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a drawing or shape used to show how to make something

example.eg: a knitting pattern
example.egtrans: 编织图样

example.eg: a dress pattern
example.egtrans: 服装底样

example.eg: Cut out all of the pieces from the paper pattern and pin them on the cloth.
example.egtrans: 剪下服装纸样上的每一片，把它们别在布上。

dsense.name: pattern
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of cloth or paper taken from a usual-sized piece and used to show what it looks like

example.eg: a pattern book
example.egtrans: 样书

payload.name: payload
payload.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of goods or people that a vehicle, such as a truck or aircraft, can carry
trans_examp.trans_cn: （运输工具的）净载重量，有用载重量；（导弹的）有效载荷，有效负荷

trans_examp.trans_en: the explosive that a missile carries
the equipment carried in a spacecraft

payment.name: payment
payment.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of money paid

example.eg: Usually we ask for payment on receipt of the goods.
example.egtrans: 我们通常要求对方货到付款。

example.eg: We need a deposit of £165 followed by twelve monthly payments of £60.
example.egtrans: 你需要先付165英镑的订金，之后12个月内每月支付60英镑。

example.eg: When is the first payment due?
example.egtrans: 第一期付款什么时候应该支付？

trans_examp.trans_en: reward

example.eg: Verbal abuse was hardly the payment I expected for my troubles.
example.egtrans: 我花了那么多力气，没料到换来的是一顿辱骂。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an amount of money received by an employee because of a pay rise at an earlier time
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （因早些时候涨工资而得到的）补发工资

peer.name: peer
peer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to look carefully or with difficulty

example.eg: When no one answered the door, she peered through the window to see if anyone was there.
example.egtrans: 没有人开门，她就费力地透过窗户朝里望去，看是否有人在。

example.eg: The driver was peering into the distance trying to read the road sign.
example.egtrans: 司机费力地看着远方，想要看清路标。

peer.name: peer
peer.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: peer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who is the same age or has the same social position or the same abilities as other people in a group
trans_examp.trans_cn: 同龄人；同辈；同等社会地位（或能力）的人

example.eg: Do you think it's true that teenage girls are less self-confident than their male peers?
example.egtrans: 你是否认为十几岁的女孩子不如同年龄的男孩子自信？

example.eg: He wasn't a great scholar, but as a teacher he had few peers (= not as many people had the same ability as him).
example.egtrans: 他算不上伟大的学者，但作为教师没有几个人能与他相提并论。

dsense.name: peer
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the UK, a person who has a high social position and any of a range of titles, including baron, earl, and duke, or a life peer

example.eg: a hereditary peer
example.egtrans: 世袭贵族

example.eg: a Conservative peer
example.egtrans: 保守党推荐任命的上议院议员

perceive.name: perceive
perceive.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: perceive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to come to an opinion about something, or have a belief about something

example.eg: How do the French perceive the British?
example.egtrans: 法国人是如何看待英国人的？

example.eg: Women's magazines are often perceived to be superficial.
example.egtrans: 女性杂志通常被认为是肤浅的。

dsense.name: perceive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to see something or someone, or to notice something that is obvious

example.eg: Bill perceived a tiny figure in the distance.
example.egtrans: 比尔注意到远处有个很小的身影。

example.eg: I perceived a note of unhappiness in her voice.
example.egtrans: 我从她的声音中觉察出一丝不快。

example.eg: Perceiving that he wasn't happy with the arrangements, I tried to book a different hotel.
example.egtrans: 感觉到他对安排不满意，我就设法预订另外一家宾馆。

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: percentage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of something, often expressed as a number out of 100

example.eg: What percentage of women return to work after having a baby?
example.egtrans: 生完小孩后继续工作的女性占多大比例？

example.eg: Interest rates have risen by two percentage points.
example.egtrans: 利率增长了两个百分点。

dsense.name: percentage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an advantage

example.eg: There's no percentage in working such long hours.
example.egtrans: 这样加班加点地工作可没什么好处。

perfect.name: perfect
perfect.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: perfect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete and correct in every way, of the best possible type or without fault

example.eg: a perfect day
example.egtrans: 美好的一天

example.eg: What is your idea of perfect happiness?
example.egtrans: 你认为完美的幸福是什么样的？

example.eg: This church is a perfect example of medieval architecture.
example.egtrans: 这座教堂是中世纪建筑的完美典范。

example.eg: You have a perfect English accent.
example.egtrans: 你有一口地道的英格兰口音。

example.eg: The car is five years old but is in almost perfect condition.
example.egtrans: 这辆车开了5年了，但车况还近乎完美。

example.eg: She thought at last she'd found the perfect man.
example.egtrans: 她认为自己终于找到了十全十美的男人。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize a noun
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于强调名词）十足的，地道的，完全的，绝对的

example.eg: It makes perfect sense.
example.egtrans: 这很有道理。

example.eg: a perfect stranger
example.egtrans: 完全陌生的人

trans_examp.trans_en: exactly right for someone or something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对某人或某物）最恰当的，完美的

example.eg: You'd be perfect for the job.
example.egtrans: 你做这份工作是最恰当的。

example.eg: The weather's just perfect for swimming.
example.egtrans: 这样的天气最适合游泳。

dsense.name: perfect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: of or relating to a verb indicating a completed action

example.eg: the present perfect tense
example.egtrans: 现在完成时

perfect.name: perfect
perfect.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the tense of a verb that shows action that has happened in the past or before another time or event

example.eg: In English, the perfect is formed with "have" and the past participle of the verb.
example.egtrans: 在英语中，完成时是由 have 加动词的过去分词构成的。

perfect.name: perfect
perfect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something free from faults

example.eg: He is keen to perfect his golfing technique.
example.egtrans: 他热衷于提高自己的高尔夫球技。

perform.name: perform
perform.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: perform
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to do an action or piece of work

example.eg: Computers can perform a variety of tasks.
example.egtrans: 计算机能执行多项任务。

example.eg: The operation will be performed next week.
example.egtrans: 手术将于下周进行。

example.eg: Most of the students performed well in the exam.
example.egtrans: 大多数学生都考得很好。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to operate/not operate in a satisfactory way

example.eg: The equipment performed well during the tests.
example.egtrans: 在检测中设备运行良好。

example.eg: These tyres perform badly/poorly in hot weather.
example.egtrans: 这些轮胎在天气炎热时性能很差／不好。

dsense.name: perform
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to entertain people by dancing, singing, acting, or playing music

example.eg: Thomas and Elisa performed a rousing duet for violin and piano.
example.egtrans: 托马斯和伊丽莎共同表演了一曲激动人心的小提琴钢琴二重奏。

example.eg: She composes and performs her own music.
example.egtrans: 她自己创作音乐自己演奏。

example.eg: A major Hollywood star will be performing on stage tonight.
example.egtrans: 今晚一位好莱坞大牌明星要登台表演。

example.eg: There are plans to ban circuses with performing animals.
example.egtrans: 有计划禁止马戏团使用动物进行表演。

performance.name: performance
performance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: performance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: how well a person, machine, etc. does a piece of work or an activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: 工作情况；业绩；表现；工作性能

example.eg: He was an experienced player who was always seeking to improve his performance.
example.egtrans: 他是一名有经验的选手，不断寻求提高自己的技能。

example.eg: High-performance cars (= those that are fast, powerful, and easy to control) are the most expensive.
example.egtrans: 性能卓越的车价格最高。

example.eg: This was a very impressive performance by the young player, who scored 14 points within the first ten minutes.
example.egtrans: 那位年轻球员的表现十分出色，在开场10分钟内就得了14分。

dsense.name: performance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the action of entertaining other people by dancing, singing, acting, or playing music

example.eg: a performance of Arthur Miller's play "The Crucible"
example.egtrans: 上演的阿瑟•米勒的戏剧《炼狱》

example.eg: She gave a superb performance as Lady Macbeth.
example.egtrans: 她出色地扮演了麦克白夫人。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an action or type of behaviour that involves a lot of attention to detail or to small matters that are not important

example.eg: Cleaning the oven is such a performance.
example.egtrans: 清理烤箱真是一件苦差。

example.eg: What a performance! Please stop shouting!
example.egtrans: 像什么样子！请别再大喊大叫了！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an occasion when an event or a situation happens again

example.eg: The police hope to avoid a repeat performance of last year, when the festivities turned into rioting.
example.egtrans: 警察希望避免去年庆典变成暴乱的事件再次发生。

permissive.name: permissive
permissive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: permissive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A person or society that is permissive allows behaviour that other people might disapprove of.

example.eg: It's a very permissive school where the children are allowed to do whatever they want.
example.egtrans: 这是一所放任自流的学校，孩子们想做什么都可以。

example.eg: He claims that society has been far too permissive towards drugs.
example.egtrans: 他宣称社会对吸毒过于放任。

dsense.name: permissive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A permissive path can be used because the owner of the land that it crosses has given permission.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 许可（路径，指获得土地主人同意可用来穿过其土地）

persist.name: persist
persist.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If an unpleasant feeling or situation persists, it continues to exist.

example.eg: If the pain persists, consult a doctor.
example.egtrans: 如果疼痛持续就去看医生。

example.eg: The cold weather is set to persist throughout the week.
example.egtrans: 寒冷天气很可能将持续整个星期。

trans_examp.trans_en: to try to do or continue doing something in a determined but often unreasonable way

example.eg: If he persists in asking awkward questions, then send him to the boss.
example.egtrans: 如果他没完没了地问令人尴尬的问题，就把他打发到老板那里去。

example.eg: The government is persisting with its ambitious public works programme.
example.egtrans: 政府在坚持实施其雄心勃勃的市政工程规划。

perspective.name: perspective
perspective.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: perspective
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular way of considering something

example.eg: Her attitude lends a fresh perspective to the subject.
example.egtrans: 她的态度为这一问题提供了新的视角。

example.eg: He writes from a Marxist perspective.
example.egtrans: 他从一个马克思主义者的视角进行写作。

example.eg: Because of its geographical position, Germany's perspective on the situation in Russia is very different from Washington's.
example.egtrans: 由于地理位置不同，德国对俄罗斯局势的看法与华盛顿大相径庭。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to think about a situation or problem in a wise and reasonable way
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 恰当地估计；合理地评价；正确地看待

example.eg: You must keep things in perspective - the overall situation isn't really that bad.
example.egtrans: 你必须正确看待问题——总体局势还没那么糟糕。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to compare something to other things so that it can be accurately and fairly judged
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 客观地比较；客观地审查

example.eg: Total investments for this year reached $53 million, and, to put this into perspective, investments this year were double those made in 2013.
example.egtrans: 今年的总投资额达到5300万美元，客观地来看，这是2013年的两倍。

dsense.name: perspective
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way that objects appear smaller when they are further away and the way parallel lines appear to meet each other at a point in the distance

example.eg: In 15th-century Italy, artists rediscovered the rules of perspective.
example.egtrans: 在15世纪的意大利，艺术家们重新发现了透视规则。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: An object or person that is in perspective has the correct size and position in comparison with other things in the picture.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 透视比例正确的；有透视效果的

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: An object or person that is out of perspective does not have the correct size or position in comparison with other things in the picture, and therefore does not look real or natural.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 透视尺度失真的；比例（或位置）不当的

Philosophy.name: philosophy
Philosophy.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the use of reason in understanding such things as the nature of the real world and existence, the use and limits of knowledge, and the principles of moral judgment

example.eg: René Descartes is regarded as the founder of modern philosophy.
example.egtrans: 勒内•揓卡尔被视为现代哲学的奠基人。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular system of beliefs, values, and principles

example.eg: the Ancient Greek philosophy of Stoicism
example.egtrans: 古希腊斯多葛哲学体系

trans_examp.trans_en: the way that someone thinks about life and deals with it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 人生哲学；生活（或工作）准则

example.eg: Live now, pay later - that's my philosophy of life!
