example.egtrans: 现在享受，以后还钱——这是我的人生哲学。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a group of theories and ideas related to the understanding of a particular subject

example.eg: the philosophy of education/religion/science
example.egtrans: 教育／宗教／科学基本原理

pick.name: pick
pick.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: pick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to take some things and leave others

example.eg: Pick a card from the pack.
example.egtrans: 从这纸牌中挑出一张。

example.eg: One of my sisters has been picked for the Olympic team.
example.egtrans: 我的一个姐姐入选了奥运代表队。

example.eg: She was picked to play for the team.
example.egtrans: 她被选中代表该队参赛。

example.eg: The police asked him if he could pick (out) the killer from a series of photos.
example.egtrans: 警察问他能否从一组照片中认出凶手。

example.eg: The fairest way to decide the winner is to pick a name out of a hat/at random (= without looking or choosing).
example.egtrans: 决出优胜者最公平的办法是任意／随机选取一个名字。

example.eg: They picked their way (= carefully chose a route) down the broken steps.
example.egtrans: 他们小心翼翼地走下断裂的台阶。

example.eg: He's brilliant at picking winners (= choosing what will be successful).
example.egtrans: 他在判断谁能获胜方面很有眼力。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to take some things but not others

example.eg: The richest universities can pick and choose which students they take.
example.egtrans: 最有钱的大学可以对生源精挑细选。

dsense.name: pick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove separate things or small pieces from something, especially with the fingers

example.eg: I picked a piece of fluff off my shiny black suit.
example.egtrans: 我从闪闪发亮的黑色套装上拽掉一根绒毛。

example.eg: The child continued picking (at) a sore on his leg (= trying to remove parts of it with his fingers).
example.egtrans: 那个孩子不停地抓挠他腿上的疮。

example.eg: The carcass had been picked clean (= all the flesh had been removed) by other animals and birds.
example.egtrans: 动物尸体上的肉已被别的动物和鸟吃得干干净净。

example.eg: He kept picking his nose (= removing mucus from it with his finger).
example.egtrans: 他在不停地掏鼻孔。

trans_examp.trans_en: When you pick flowers or fruit, you take them off a plant or tree.

example.eg: They were picking strawberries for twelve hours a day.
example.egtrans: 他们每天摘12小时的草莓。

example.eg: I picked some roses this morning.
example.egtrans: 今天早上我摘了一些玫瑰。

example.eg: Machines pick the fruit (from/off the trees).
example.egtrans: 机器把果子（从树上）摘下来。

dsense.name: pick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: When you pick a string on a guitar or similar instrument, you pull it quickly and release it suddenly with your fingers to produce a note.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 弹拨，弹奏（吉他等弦乐器）

pick.name: pick
pick.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: pick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: choice

example.eg: You can have first pick of the desserts.
example.egtrans: 你可以头一个挑选甜点。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have a large choice available

example.eg: The plane was fairly empty so we had our pick of seats.
example.egtrans: 飞机很空，所以我们可以自由选择座位。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to choose the one(s) you want from the different types available

example.eg: The shirts come in five different colours - just take your pick.
example.egtrans: 这种衬衣有5种不同的颜色——你随便挑吧。

dsense.name: pick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         pickaxe

example.eg: picks and shovels
example.egtrans: 镐和铲

trans_examp.trans_en: especially in combinations, a sharp pointed tool

example.eg: a toothpick
example.egtrans: 牙签

dsense.name: pick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small, thin piece of plastic, metal, etc. that isheld between the fingers and thumb and usedfor playing instruments such as the guitar

pipeline.name: pipeline
pipeline.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a very long large tube, often underground, through which liquid or gas can flow for long distances
trans_examp.trans_cn: （常指铺设在地下的）管道，管线

pixel.name: pixel
pixel.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the smallest unit of an image on a television or computer screen
trans_examp.trans_cn: 像素（电视或计算机屏幕图像的最小组成单位）

placeholder.name: placeholder
placeholder.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a symbol or piece of text in a mathematical expression or computer instruction that can be replaced by particular pieces of information

plain.name: plain
plain.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: plain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not decorated in any way; with nothing added
trans_examp.trans_cn: 朴素的；不加修饰的；简单的

example.eg: She wore a plain black dress.
example.egtrans: 她穿着一件朴素的黑色连衣裙。

example.eg: We've chosen a plain carpet (= one without a pattern) and patterned curtains.
example.egtrans: 我们挑了一块没有图案的地毯和带图案的窗帘。

example.eg: He prefers plain food - nothing too fancy.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢清淡简单的食物——不喜欢太讲究的。

example.eg: We're having plain blue walls in the dining room.
example.egtrans: 我们客厅里的墙壁要纯蓝色的。

example.eg: a catalogue sent in a plain brown envelope
example.egtrans: 用纯褐色信封寄出的目录

example.eg: a plain style of architecture
example.egtrans: 简朴的建筑风格

example.eg: plain yogurt (= with no added fruit or sugar)
example.egtrans: 原味酸奶

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: paper that has no lines on it

example.eg: a letter written on plain paper
example.egtrans: 用白纸写的一封信

dsense.name: plain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: obvious and clear to understand

example.eg: It's quite plain that they don't want to speak to us.
example.egtrans: 很明显，他们不想和我们说话。

example.eg: The reason is perfectly plain.
example.egtrans: 原因很清楚。

example.eg: I made it quite plain (that) (= explained clearly that) I wasn't interested.
example.egtrans: 我明白地表示我不感兴趣。

dsense.name: plain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (used for emphasis) complete

example.eg: It was plain stupidity on Richard's part.
example.egtrans: 理查德愚蠢至极。

dsense.name: plain
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of a woman or girl) not beautiful
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指女性）相貌平平的，不好看的

example.eg: She had been a very plain child.
example.egtrans: 她小时候并不是个漂亮的孩子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a woman or girl who is not attractive
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 平凡的珍妮（不漂亮的女人或女孩）

example.eg: If she'd been a plain Jane, she wouldn't have had all the attention.
example.egtrans: 如果她象平凡的珍妮，她就不会成为关注的焦点。

plain.name: plain
plain.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: plain
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large area of flat land

example.eg: the coastal plain
example.egtrans: 海边的平原

example.eg: High mountains rise above the plain.
example.egtrans: 高山从平原拔地而起。

dsense.name: plain
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of simple stitch in knitting

example.eg: a row of plain and two rows of purl
example.egtrans: 一排平针两排反针

plain.name: plain
plain.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely

example.eg: I mean, taking the wrong equipment with you - that's just plain stupid.
example.egtrans: 我的意思是，你拿错仪器简直是愚蠢透顶。

platform.name: platform
platform.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: platform
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flat raised area or structure
a long, flat raised structure at a railway station, where people get on and off trains

example.eg: The next train for Aberdeen will depart from platform 9.
example.egtrans: 下一趟去阿伯丁的火车将从9号站台开出。

trans_examp.trans_en: the raised part of the floor in a large room, from which you make a speech or give a musical performance

example.eg: Speaker after speaker mounted/took the platform to denounce the policy.
example.egtrans: 演讲者一个接一个走上讲台谴责这项政策。

example.eg: This brilliant young violinist has appeared on concert platforms all round the world.
example.egtrans: 这名才华横溢的年轻小提琴手曾在世界各地的音乐会舞台上演出。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the people who are up on a platform in order to speak to an audience

example.eg: An elderly lady stood up and said she had a question for the platform.
example.egtrans: 一个年老的女士站起来说，有一个问题要问讲台上的人。

example.eg: The platform party (= the group on the platform) applauded loudly.
example.egtrans: 讲台上的人热烈鼓掌。

dsense.name: platform
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an opportunity to make your ideas or beliefs known publicly
trans_examp.trans_cn: （公开表达看法或信仰的）机会，讲坛

example.eg: By refusing to give us a grant to make this programme, they are denying us a platform.
example.egtrans: 他们通过拒绝给我们提供组织这项活动的资金，剥夺了我们的发言权。

trans_examp.trans_en: all the things that a political party promises to do if they are elected

example.eg: We campaigned on a platform of low taxation.
example.egtrans: 我们竞选的纲领是降低税率。

dsense.name: platform
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the type of computer system or smartphone you are using, in relation to the type of software (= computer programs) you can use on it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 平台（指使用的计算机系统和软件）

example.eg: This new personal banking software can be used with any Windows platform.
example.egtrans: 这款新的个人银行软件可与任何版本的视窗操作平台兼容。

example.eg: Both Apple's iOS and Google's Android mobile platforms now have emoji keyboards built into their software.
example.egtrans: 苹果的iOS和谷歌的Android手机系统现在都在软件中安装了内置表情键盘。

plug.name: plug
plug.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: plug
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small plastic or rubber object with two or three metal pins, attached to the end of a wire on a piece of electrical equipment and pushed into a special opening in a wall to connect the equipment to a supply of electricity

example.eg: a three-pin/two-pin plug
example.egtrans: 三相／两相插头

example.eg: to fit/change a plug
example.egtrans: 安装／更换插头

example.eg: If a plug is wired incorrectly, it can be dangerous.
example.egtrans: 如果插头接线不对会很危险。

trans_examp.trans_en: an electric socket

example.eg: Is there a plug in the bedroom that I can use for my hairdryer?
example.egtrans: 卧室里有没有插座让我用一下电吹风？

trans_examp.trans_en: a metal pin at the end of a long wire joined to a piece of electrical equipment and used to connect it to another piece of electrical equipment

informal for
        
         spark plug
trans_examp.trans_cn: 火花塞（spark plug的非正式说法）

dsense.name: plug
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of rubber, plastic, wood, etc. that fits into a hole in order to close it
a round piece of rubber or plastic that fits into the hole in a sink or a bath

example.eg: a bath plug
example.egtrans: 浴缸塞

example.eg: Put the plug in the sink and run some water.
example.egtrans: 把洗涤槽排水孔塞上，然后放些水。

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of plastic or wood that you put into a hole in a wall before putting a screw into it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （打入墙上孔内以拧进螺钉的）螺钉楔子，螺钉栓塞

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of material such as cotton wool, twisted or pressed tightly so it is firm

dsense.name: plug
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of telling people publicly about a product, event, etc.

example.eg: She never misses an opportunity to get in a plug for her new film.
example.egtrans: 她从来不会错过向公众宣传自己新片的机会。

plug.name: plug
plug.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: plug
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to advertise something by talking about it a lot or praising it, especially on the radio or television
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指通过广播或电视）宣传，推广

example.eg: That interview was just a way for him to plug his new book.
example.egtrans: 那次采访只是宣传他的新书的一种方式。

example.eg: They're plugging this new chocolate bar everywhere at the moment.
example.egtrans: 此时他们正在到处宣传这种新巧克力。

dsense.name: plug
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to shoot someone with a gun

example.eg: Sure, boss, we plugged the guy (full of lead).
example.egtrans: 是的，头儿，我们（乱枪）打死了那家伙。

dsense.name: plug
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fill a hole with a piece of suitable material

example.eg: Have you plugged that leak (= stopped it by filling the hole) in the pipe?
example.egtrans: 你把管子上的裂缝堵起来了吗？

example.eg: My nose was bleeding and I plugged it with cotton wool.
example.egtrans: 我鼻子流血了，便塞了棉球止血。

policy.name: policy
policy.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: policy
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of ideas or a plan of what to do in particular situations that has been agreed to officially by a group of people, a business organization, a government, or a political party

example.eg: They believe that Europe needs a common foreign and security policy.
example.egtrans: 他们认为欧洲需要采取共同的外交和安全政策。

example.eg: What is your party's policy on immigration?
example.egtrans: 你们党关于移民的政策是什么？

dsense.name: policy
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a document showing an agreement you have made with an insurance company

example.eg: You should check your policy to see if you're covered for flood damage.
example.egtrans: 你应该查看一下你的保险单看看是否保了洪水险。

polygon.name: polygon
polygon.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flat shape with three or more straight sides

example.eg: Triangles and squares are polygons.
example.egtrans: 三角形和正方形是多边形。

populate.name: populate
populate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If an area is populated by people or animals, they live in that area.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 构成…的人口（或动物的总数）

example.eg: The inner cities are no longer densely populated.
example.egtrans: 市中心的人口密度已下降。

example.eg: The river is populated mainly by smaller species of fish.
example.egtrans: 这条河里大部分是小型鱼类。

trans_examp.trans_en: to live in an area or place

example.eg: The settlers began to move inland and populate the river valleys.
example.egtrans: 移民开始迁往内陆，居住在河谷地带。

trans_examp.trans_en: to automatically add information to a list or table on a computer
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在计算机的列表或表格上）自动增加信息

example.eg: There are several ways to populate the database.
example.egtrans: 有几种方式给数据库自动增加资料。

portal.name: portal
portal.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a page on the internet that allows people to get useful information, such as news and weather, and to find other websites

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a large, important entrance to a building

example.eg: Passing through the portals of the BBC for the first time, she felt slightly nervous.
example.egtrans: 第一次走进英国广播公司的大门，她觉得稍有些紧张。

portion.name: portion
portion.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part or share of something larger

example.eg: A large/major portion of the company's profit goes straight back into new projects.
example.egtrans: 公司利润的一大部分／主要部分又直接投入了新的项目。

example.eg: I accept my portion of the blame.
example.egtrans: 我承担部分责任。

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of a particular food that is served to one person, especially in a restaurant or a shop that sells food ready to be eaten

example.eg: The portions are very generous in this restaurant.
example.egtrans: 这家饭店每份菜量都很足。

portrait.name: portrait
portrait.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a painting, photograph, drawing, etc. of a person or, less commonly, of a group of people

example.eg: She's commissioned an artist to paint her portrait/paint a portrait of her.
example.egtrans: 她委托一位画家为她画一幅肖像。

example.eg: a portrait gallery
example.egtrans: 肖像画廊

example.eg: a portrait painter
example.egtrans: 肖像画家

trans_examp.trans_en: A film or book that is a portrait of something describes or represents that thing in a detailed way.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 电影（或书中）的描写，描述；表现

example.eg: Her latest novel paints a very vivid portrait of the aristocracy in the 1920s.
example.egtrans: 她最新的一部小说生动地描绘了20世纪20年代的贵族生活。

portrait.name: portrait
portrait.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A portrait computer document is to be printed with the shorter side of the paper at the top and bottom.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 竖向（描述计算机文件打印的一种方式，即纸的短边置于顶部和底部）

positive.name: positive
positive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: positive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: full of hope and confidence, or giving cause for hope and confidence
trans_examp.trans_cn: 建设性的；积极的；怀有希望的

example.eg: a positive attitude
example.egtrans: 乐观的态度

example.eg: On a more positive note, we're seeing signs that the housing market is picking up.
example.egtrans: 更乐观地说，我们看到了房地产市场正在好转的迹象。

example.eg: The past ten years have seen some very positive developments in East-West relations.
example.egtrans: 在过去的10年中东西方关系有了一些非常积极的发展。

example.eg: There was a very positive response to our new design - people seemed very pleased with it.
example.egtrans: 我们的新设计得到了非常积极的回应——看来人们对该产品非常满意。

dsense.name: positive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: certain and without any doubt
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有把握的，确信的，肯定的

example.eg: Are you positive (that) you saw me switch the iron off?
example.egtrans: 你肯定你看到我关掉了熨斗的开关吗？

example.eg: "Are you sure it's okay for me to use your mother's car?" "Positive."
example.egtrans: “你肯定我可以开你母亲的车？”“完全肯定。”

example.eg: "It was him - I saw him take it." "Are you positive about that?"
example.egtrans: “是他——我看到他拿的。”“你对此肯定吗？”

dsense.name: positive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a medical test) showing that a person has the disease or condition for which they are being tested

example.eg: a positive pregnancy test
example.egtrans: 呈阳性的妊娠检测

example.eg: He's HIV positive.
example.egtrans: 他艾滋病检测呈阳性。

example.eg: She tested positive for hepatitis.
example.egtrans: 她肝炎检测呈阳性。

dsense.name: positive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (used to add force to an expression) complete

example.eg: Far from being a nuisance, she was a positive joy to have around.
example.egtrans: 有她在身边完全是个乐趣，一点儿都不令人讨厌。

dsense.name: positive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a number or amount) more than zero

example.eg: Two is a positive number.
example.egtrans: 2是正数。

dsense.name: positive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: being the type of electrical charge that is carried by protons

dsense.name: positive
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having the rhesus factor in the blood
trans_examp.trans_cn: 血液中含猕因子的；Rh阳性的

example.eg: My blood type is O positive.
example.egtrans: 我的血型是 O 型 Rh 因子呈阳性。

post.name: post
post.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: letters, etc. that are delivered to homes or places of work

example.eg: I'd been away for a few days so I had a lot of post waiting for me.
example.egtrans: 我离开了几天，所以有好多信件等着我处理。

example.eg: My secretary usually opens my post, unless it's marked "private".
example.egtrans: 除非写有“亲启”，否则通常由我的秘书来拆我的信件。

example.eg: Has the post come/arrived yet?
example.egtrans: 信件到了吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: the public system that exists for the collecting and delivering of letters

example.eg: My letter must have got lost in the post.
example.egtrans: 我的信肯定在邮递中丢失了。

example.eg: If you don't want to take it there, you can just send it by post.
example.egtrans: 你不想送去的话，可以邮寄。

trans_examp.trans_en: the time during the day when letters, etc. are collected or delivered
trans_examp.trans_cn: 收集（或投递）邮件的时间；邮班

example.eg: I missed the post this morning.
example.egtrans: 我错过了上午的邮班。

example.eg: Did you manage to catch the post?
example.egtrans: 你赶上邮班了吗？

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a job in a company or organization

example.eg: Teaching posts are advertised in Tuesday's edition of the paper.
example.egtrans: 星期二的报纸上有招聘教师的广告。

example.eg: She's held the post for 13 years.
example.egtrans: 她担任该职已有13年之久。

example.eg: They have several vacant posts.
example.egtrans: 他们有几个职位空缺。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a vertical stick or pole stuck into the ground, usually to support something or show a position
used as a combining form

example.eg: a lamppost
example.egtrans: 路灯柱

example.eg: a signpost
example.egtrans: 路标

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in the sport of horse racing, the place where the race finishes or, less often, the place from which the race starts
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （赛马的）终点柱，终点标志；起点柱

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in sports such as football, a goalpost (= either of two vertical posts showing the area in which the ball is kicked to score points)

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the particular place where someone works, especially where a soldier is told to be for military duty, usually as a guard

example.eg: The soldier was disciplined for deserting his post.
example.egtrans: 这个士兵因为擅离岗位而受到处分。

example.eg: I was ordered to remain at my post until the last customer had left.
example.egtrans: 我奉命要坚守自己的岗位直到最后一名顾客离开。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something such as a message or picture that you publish on a website or using social media
trans_examp.trans_cn: 网站上公布的信息；帖子

example.eg: Lots of people have commented on my post.
example.egtrans: 许多人给我的帖子加了评论。

example.eg: You can change your privacy settings so that only certain people can see your posts.
example.egtrans: 你可以修改你的隐私设定，只让某些人看到你的帖子。

post.name: post
post.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send a letter or parcel by post

example.eg: Did you remember to post my letter?
example.egtrans: 你记得帮我寄信了吗？

example.eg: I must post that parcel (off) or she won't get it in time for her birthday.
example.egtrans: 我得把包裹寄走，否则她过生日就不能及时收到了。

example.eg: Could you post me the details/post the details to me?
example.egtrans: 你能否把详细资料寄给我？

trans_examp.trans_en: to put an object through a letterbox (= special opening in a door)

example.eg: Just post the key through the door after you've locked it.
example.egtrans: 门锁上后就把钥匙从门上的信箱里塞进去。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to send someone to a particular place to work

example.eg: He's been posted to Pakistan for six months.
example.egtrans: 他被派到巴基斯坦工作6个月。

example.eg: Guards were posted at all the doors.
example.egtrans: 所有门口处都布置了卫兵。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stick or pin a notice on a wall in order to make it publicly known

example.eg: Company announcements are usually posted (up) on the noticeboard.
example.egtrans: 公司通告通常张贴在布告栏里。

trans_examp.trans_en: to publish something such as a message or picture on a website or using social media
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在网站上）公布，发布（信息）；发（帖）

example.eg: I never post anything on the Internet that I wouldn't want my boss to see.
example.egtrans: 我从来没有在互联网上发布任何我不想让我老板看到的东西。

example.eg: She hardly ever posts on Facebook.
example.egtrans: 她几乎从未在脸书上发消息。

example.eg: Somebody's been posting obscene messages in this chat room.
example.egtrans: 有人一直在这个聊天室里发布淫秽信息。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pay money, especially so that a person who has been accused of committing a crime can be free until their trial

example.eg: She has agreed to post bail for her brother.
example.egtrans: 她已同意为她兄弟支付保释金。

dsense.name: post
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to announce a company's financial results

example.eg: The oil company posted profits of $25.1 billion.
example.egtrans: 石油公司公布利润为251亿美元。

post.name: post-
post.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: after or later than

example.eg: postgraduate
example.egtrans: 研究生

example.eg: postoperative
example.egtrans: 手术后的

example.eg: He took a post-lunch nap.
example.egtrans: 他午饭后小睡了一会儿。

potential.name: potential
potential.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: possible when the necessary conditions exist

example.eg: A number of potential buyers have expressed interest in the company.
example.egtrans: 一些潜在的买主表达了对该公司的兴趣。

example.eg: Many potential customers are waiting for a fall in prices before buying.
example.egtrans: 很多潜在的顾客都在等着降价再购买。

example.eg: The accident is a grim reminder of the potential dangers involved in North Sea oil production.
example.egtrans: 该事故残酷地提醒人们北海石油生产可能会出现的危险。

potential.name: potential
potential.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: potential
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone's or something's ability to develop, achieve, or succeed

example.eg: The region has enormous potential for economic development.
example.egtrans: 该地区经济发展潜力巨大。

example.eg: I don't feel I'm achieving my full potential in my present job.
example.egtrans: 我觉得目前的工作没有完全发挥我的潜力。

example.eg: You have the potential to reach the top of your profession.
example.egtrans: 你有潜力达到事业的顶峰。

example.eg: I think this room has got a lot of potential (= could be very nice if some changes were made to it).
example.egtrans: 我觉得这个房间有很多可改进之处。

dsense.name: potential
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of electricity passing through an electric circuit, measured in volts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 电势（电路中通过的电量，以伏特为单位）

potentially.name: potentially
potentially.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: possibly

example.eg: Hepatitis is a potentially fatal disease.
example.egtrans: 肝炎是可能致命的疾病。

example.eg: This crisis is potentially the most serious in the organization's history.
example.egtrans: 这场危机可能是该组织历史上最严重的一次。

power.name: power
power.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: ability to control people and events

example.eg: I've no power over him - he does what he wants to.
example.egtrans: 我管不了他——他想干什么就干什么。

example.eg: Once nicotine has you in its power, it's very difficult to stop smoking.
example.egtrans: 一旦尼古丁对你起了作用，戒烟就很难了。

example.eg: She has the power to charm any man she meets.
example.egtrans: 她有魅力令她碰见的每个男子都神魂颠倒。

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of political control a person or group has in a country

example.eg: Does the president have more power than the prime minister?
example.egtrans: 总统是否比总理权力更大？

example.eg: How long has the Conservative Party been in power?
example.egtrans: 保守党当政多久了？

example.eg: The army seized power after five days of anti-government demonstrations.
example.egtrans: 反政府示威5天后，军方夺取了政权。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: strength

example.eg: Our car doesn't have enough power to tow a trailer.
example.egtrans: 我们的轿车功率不够大，拖不动拖车。

example.eg: Weightlifters have tremendous power in their arms and legs.
example.egtrans: 举重运动员的臂力和腿力极大。

example.eg: Scientists are working to harness the power of the atom.
example.egtrans: 科学家们正在研究如何利用原子能。

example.eg: The economic power of many Asian countries has grown dramatically in recent years.
example.egtrans: 近年来许多亚洲国家的经济实力有了显著的增长。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official or legal right to do something

example.eg: I'd like to help but I don't have the power to intervene in this dispute.
example.egtrans: 我很想帮忙，但我无权介入此纠纷。

example.eg: It's not in your power to cancel the order.
example.egtrans: 你无权取消这份订单。

example.eg: I can't give you a refund - I'm afraid it's not within my power.
example.egtrans: 我不能给你退款——这恐怕不在我的职权范围内。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: authority

example.eg: You were acting beyond your powers when you agreed to give her a pay rise.
example.egtrans: 你答应给她加薪，这是在越权行事。

example.eg: Visitors to the city are respectfully reminded of the council's powers to remove illegally parked vehicles.
example.egtrans: 到该市游览的游客收到礼貌的提醒，市政委员会有权拖走违章停放的车辆。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: electricity, especially when considering its use or production

example.eg: You should disconnect the power before attempting to repair electrical equipment.
example.egtrans: 在检修电气设备之前应先切断电源。

example.eg: Our building lost power (= the electricity was stopped) during the storm.
example.egtrans: 暴风雨中我们的房子断电了。

example.eg: power cables/lines
example.egtrans: 电缆／线

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a natural skill or an ability to do something

example.eg: He was so shocked by what happened to his parents that he lost the power of speech.
example.egtrans: 发生在他父母身上的事使他惊呆了，他一句话也说不出来。

example.eg: The surgeon did everything in her power to save him.
example.egtrans: 医生竭尽全力抢救他。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: abilities

example.eg: My mental powers aren't as good as they used to be.
example.egtrans: 我的脑力不如以前了。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person, organization, or country that has control over others, often because of wealth, importance, or great military strength
trans_examp.trans_cn: 掌握大权的人；有影响力的机构；强国

example.eg: Spain was an important military power in the 16th century.
example.egtrans: 西班牙在16世纪是一个军事强国。

example.eg: Germany is on its way to becoming a world power with a permanent seat on the UN Security Council.
example.egtrans: 德国正在努力成为世界强国，谋求成为联合国安理会常任理事国。

example.eg: She is an increasingly important power in the company.
example.egtrans: 在公司中她的权力越来越大。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the rate at which energy is used, or the ability to produce energy

example.eg: The ship was only slightly damaged in the collision and was able to sail into port under its own power.
example.egtrans: 船在撞击中只是轻微受损，仍可依靠自身的动力驶入港口。

example.eg: The power rating of my amplifier is 40 watts per channel.
example.egtrans: 我的扬声器的功率（级别）是每声道40瓦。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount by which an image is increased by a device used for seeing things that are very small or a long distance away

example.eg: What's the magnification power of your binoculars?
example.egtrans: 你的双筒望远镜的放大倍数是多少？

example.eg: You'll need a very high-power microscope to see something as small as that.
example.egtrans: 要观察那么小的东西，你需要一台高倍显微镜。

example.eg: A low-power telescope is enough if you only want to look at the moon.
example.egtrans: 只观看月相用低倍望远镜就足够了。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the number of times that a number is to be multiplied by itself

example.eg: 2 to the fourth power is 2 times 2 times 2 times 2, which equals 16.
example.egtrans: 2的4次方就是2乘2乘2乘2，等于16。

example.eg: 3 to the power 4 is usually written as 34.
example.egtrans: 3的4次方通常写作34。

power.name: power
power.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide a machine with energy and the ability to operate

example.eg: Buses and trucks are usually powered by diesel engines.
example.egtrans: 公共汽车和卡车通常是由柴油机驱动的。

example.eg: Electricity costs less than petrol, so powering an electric vehicle is cheaper.
example.egtrans: 电比汽油的成本低，所以电动力车会比较省钱。

dsense.name: power
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to act with great strength or in a forceful way

example.eg: Halfway through, she powered into the lead and went on to win the race.
example.egtrans: 到半程时，她加速冲到前面，一直领先，赢得了赛跑冠军。

powerful.name: powerful
powerful.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: powerful
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a lot of power to control people and events
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有权力的；有力量的；强大的

example.eg: The president is more powerful than the prime minister.
example.egtrans: 总统比总理权力更大。

example.eg: She's the most powerful person in the organization.
example.egtrans: 她是该组织中最有影响力的人。

dsense.name: powerful
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a lot of strength or force

example.eg: She's an extremely powerful runner.
example.egtrans: 她是个非常矫健的赛跑运动员。

example.eg: The picture quality is bad because the TV signal isn't powerful enough.
example.egtrans: 图像效果不好，因为电视信号不强。

trans_examp.trans_en: having a very great effect

example.eg: a powerful drug
example.egtrans: 特效药

example.eg: Her speech about cruelty to children was very powerful.
example.egtrans: 她关于虐待儿童问题的发言很有感染力。

dsense.name: powerful
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having the power to increase the size of an image of something that is very small or far away many times
trans_examp.trans_cn: 高倍率的，高放大倍数的

example.eg: You'd need an extremely powerful microscope to see something so small.
example.egtrans: 看这么小的东西你需要超高倍显微镜。

practical.name: practical
practical.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: practical
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to experience, real situations, or actions rather than ideas or imagination
trans_examp.trans_cn: 实际的；实干的；有实际经验的

example.eg: Qualifications are important but practical experience is always a plus.
example.egtrans: 资历固然重要，但实际经验总是个优势。

example.eg: The service offers young people practical advice on finding a job.
example.egtrans: 这项服务向年轻人提供就业方面的实用建议。

example.eg: What's the use of theoretical knowledge that has no practical application?
example.egtrans: 理论知识如果没有实际应用又有什么用呢？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in fact

example.eg: Dr Frampton is in charge, but for all practical purposes, her assistant runs the office.
example.egtrans: 理论上是弗兰普顿博士负责，但实际上是她的助手在管理办公室。

dsense.name: practical
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: suitable for the situation in which something is used

example.eg: I tend to wear clothes that are practical rather than fashionable.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢穿实用而非时髦的衣服。

example.eg: Heavy boots aren't very practical for running.
example.egtrans: 厚重的靴子不太适合跑步。

dsense.name: practical
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to provide effective solutions to problems
trans_examp.trans_cn: 实用的，有效的；能解决问题的

example.eg: She has lots of interesting ideas, but they're not very practical.
example.egtrans: 她有很多有意思的想法，但都不太实用。

example.eg: We need someone practical who can cope with a crisis.
example.egtrans: 我们需要一个能够切实应付危机的人。

dsense.name: practical
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to be done or put into action
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可实施的，切实可行的；切合实际的

example.eg: It's simply not practical to divide the work between so many people.
example.egtrans: 把这份工作分给这么多人是完全不切实际的。

practical.name: practical
practical.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a class or exam in a scientific or technical subject in which students do things rather than just write or talk about them
trans_examp.trans_cn: 实践课，实验课；实验考核

example.eg: We had to dissect a worm and a frog in our biology practical today.
example.egtrans: 今天的生物实验课上，我们得解剖一条蚯蚓和一只青蛙。

precedence.name: precedence
precedence.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the condition of being dealt with before other things or of being considered more important than other things
trans_examp.trans_cn: （时间、顺序、重要程度等的）居前，领先

example.eg: Precedence must be given to the injured in the evacuation plans.
example.egtrans: 在疏散计划中应优先考虑伤者。

example.eg: Business people often think that fluency and communication take precedence over grammar when speaking.
example.egtrans: 商界人士常认为说话时流利程度和表达能力比语法重要。

trans_examp.trans_en: the order of importance given to people in particular societies, groups, or organizations

example.eg: The order of precedence for titled nobility in Britain is duke, marquis, earl, viscount, baron.
example.egtrans: 在英国有爵位的贵族级别依次为公爵、侯爵、伯爵、子爵和男爵。

preceding.name: preceding
preceding.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing or happening before someone or something

example.eg: The paintings are a development of ideas she explored in the preceding decade.
example.egtrans: 这些画是她过去10年以来思想探索的成果。

example.eg: In conclusion, I hope the preceding arguments have convinced you of the need for action.
example.egtrans: 总之，我希望前面的论证已使你相信采取行动是必要的。

precise.name: precise
precise.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: precise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: exact and accurate

example.eg: The bunker's precise location is a closely guarded secret.
example.egtrans: 掩体的确切位置严格保密。

example.eg: He caught me at the precise moment that I fainted.
example.egtrans: 他正好在我晕倒的那一刻抓住了我。

example.eg: There was a good turnout for the meeting - twelve of us to be precise.
example.egtrans: 出席会议的人不少——确切地说有我们12个人。

dsense.name: precise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very careful and accurate, especially about small details
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指在细节上）严谨的，细致的

example.eg: Years of doing meticulous research had made her very precise in her working methods.
example.egtrans: 多年来一丝不苟的研究使她养成了严谨的工作方法。

precisely.name: precisely
precisely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: precisely
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: exactly

example.eg: The fireworks begin at eight o'clock precisely.
example.egtrans: 烟花在8点整开始燃放。

example.eg: What do you think the problem is, precisely?
example.egtrans: 确切地说，你认为问题在哪里？

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize what you are saying

example.eg: "You look tired - you should go home and rest." "I'm going to do precisely that."
example.egtrans: “你看起来累了——应该回家休息。”“我正打算这么做。”

example.eg: But it's precisely because of the noise that they're thinking of moving.
example.egtrans: 说实在的，就是那些噪声使他们想搬家。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to express complete agreement with someone or suggest that what they have said is obvious
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于表示完全同意）对，正是，的确

example.eg: "It would be stupid to attempt the journey in the dark." "Precisely!" he answered.
example.egtrans: “想在黑暗中走这段路很傻。”“的确如此，”他答道。

dsense.name: precisely
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: carefully and accurately

example.eg: He works slowly and precisely whereas I tend to rush things and make mistakes.
example.egtrans: 他是慢工出细活儿，而我则匆匆了事常常出错。

precision.name: precision
precision.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: precision
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality of being exact

example.eg: Great precision is required to align the mirrors accurately.
example.egtrans: 校准反光镜需要极高的精确性。

example.eg: Precision bombing was used to destroy enemy airbases and armaments factories.
example.egtrans: 使用了精确轰炸来摧毁敌人的空军基地和军工厂。

dsense.name: precision
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the qualities of being careful and accurate

example.eg: His books are a pleasure to read because he writes with such clarity and precision.
example.egtrans: 他的书读起来赏心悦目，因为他的写作清晰而又严谨。

predefined.name: predefined
predefined.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: decided, set, or arranged before something is done
trans_examp.trans_cn: 预先设定的；预先明确的

example.eg: The chart can be filled out with a predefined set of values.
example.egtrans: 这个图表可以用预定义的一组值来填写。

example.eg: What happens when usage falls below predefined thresholds?
example.egtrans: 当使用量低于预定义阈值时，会发生什么？

predicate.name: predicate
predicate.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in grammar, the part of a sentence that contains the verb and gives information about the subject

example.eg: In the sentence "We went to the airport", "went to the airport" is the predicate.
example.egtrans: 在 We went to the airport 这句话中，went to the airport 是谓语。

predicate.name: predicate
predicate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say that something is true

example.eg: It would be unwise to predicate that the disease is caused by a virus before further tests have been carried out.
example.egtrans: 在进一步化验前就断言这种病由病毒引起是不明智的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If an idea or argument is predicated on something, it depends on the existence or truth of this thing.

example.eg: The sales forecast is predicated on the assumption that the economy will grow by four percent.
example.egtrans: 销售预测是基于经济将会增长4％这一假设之上的。

prefer.name: prefer
prefer.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: prefer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to like, choose, or want one thing rather than another
trans_examp.trans_cn: 宁可，更喜爱；觉得还是…更可取

example.eg: Do you prefer hot or cold weather?
example.egtrans: 你喜欢热天还是冷天？

example.eg: I prefer red wine to white.
example.egtrans: 比起白葡萄酒，我更喜欢红葡萄酒。

example.eg: He prefers watching football to playing it.
example.egtrans: 比起踢足球来，他更喜欢看足球比赛。

example.eg: I'd prefer not to discuss this issue.
example.egtrans: 我宁愿不讨论这个问题。

example.eg: I'd prefer you not to smoke (= I would like it better if you did not smoke), please.
example.egtrans: 我希望你别抽烟。

dsense.name: prefer
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to accuse someone officially

example.eg: The police have decided not to prefer charges against them because of insufficient evidence.
example.egtrans: 由于证据不足，警方决定不对他们提出诉讼。

preferable.name: preferable
preferable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: better or more suitable
trans_examp.trans_cn: 更可取的，更好的，较合适的

example.eg: Surely a diplomatic solution is preferable to war.
example.egtrans: 外交途径当然要比战争好。

preferred.name: preferred
preferred.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: liked or wanted more than anything else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 更合意的，更可取的，更好的

example.eg: The earlier train would be my preferred option.
example.egtrans: 乘早一些的火车更合我意。

prefix.name: prefix
prefix.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: prefix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to make a new word

example.eg: In the word "unimportant", "un-" is a prefix.
example.egtrans: 在单词 unimportant 中，un- 是前缀。

dsense.name: prefix
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         dialling code UK

prepare.name: prepare
prepare.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make or get something or someone ready for something that will happen in the future
trans_examp.trans_cn: 准备，预备；把…准备好，使预备好

example.eg: Have you prepared for your interview?
example.egtrans: 你作好面试的准备了吗？

example.eg: She'll prepare the food ahead of time and freeze it.
example.egtrans: 她会提前准备好食物并冷冻起来。

example.eg: This course prepares students for middle and senior managerial positions.
example.egtrans: 这门课旨在使学生在将来能够胜任中、高级管理职位。

example.eg: Are the players mentally and physically prepared to play a tough game?
example.egtrans: 运动员们是否已经在思想上和体能上对这场艰苦的比赛作好了准备？

example.eg: The meal took two hours to prepare.
example.egtrans: 准备这顿饭花了两个小时。

trans_examp.trans_en: to expect that something will happen and to be ready for it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在思想上或心理上）作好准备；防范

example.eg: It almost seems as if she is preparing to die.
example.egtrans: 看来她好像已经作好了赴死的准备。

example.eg: You need to prepare yourself for a long wait.
example.egtrans: 你需要作好长时间等待的准备。

prepend.name: prepend
prepend.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to add something to the beginning of something else, especially a piece of data (= information) to the beginning of a computer instruction
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在电脑指令的开头添加

example.eg: If the remote machine is Windows based, prepend the address with smb://.
example.egtrans: 如果远程机器是基于Windows的，在地址前加上smb://。

presence.name: presence
presence.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that someone or something is in a place
trans_examp.trans_cn: 出席，在场；（事物的）存在，出现

example.eg: She was overawed by the presence of so many people.
example.egtrans: 这么多人在场，把她吓坏了。

example.eg: The presence of pollen in the atmosphere causes hay fever in some people.
example.egtrans: 大气中花粉的存在会使一些人患上枯草热。

example.eg: He's usually quite polite in my presence.
example.egtrans: 在我面前他通常很有礼貌。

example.eg: The document was signed in the presence of two witnesses.
example.egtrans: 这项文件签署时有两个证人在场。

trans_examp.trans_en: a feeling that someone is still in a place although they are not there or are dead

example.eg: His daughter's presence seemed to fill her empty bedroom.
example.egtrans: 他女儿仍在的感觉似乎使她的卧室不那么空荡荡的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of police or soldiers who are watching or controlling a situation
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对形势观察控制的）一队警察（或部队）

example.eg: The United Nations has maintained a presence in the region for some time.
example.egtrans: 联合国派部队在该地区驻扎已有一段时间。

example.eg: There was a strong police presence at the demonstration.
example.egtrans: 在示威现场有大批警力。

trans_examp.trans_en: a quality that makes people notice or admire you, even when you are not speaking

example.eg: stage presence
example.egtrans: 舞台风度

example.eg: He stood there in the corner of the room, a dark, brooding (= worrying) presence.
example.egtrans: 他站在屋子的角落里，神色阴郁，愁容满面。

present.name: present
present.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you are given, without asking for it, on a special occasion, especially to show friendship, or to say thank you
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指表示友谊或致谢的）礼物，赠品

example.eg: a birthday/Christmas/wedding present
example.egtrans: 生日／圣诞／结婚礼物

example.eg: They gave me theatre tickets as a present.
example.egtrans: 他们送给我戏票作为礼物。

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the period of time that is happening now, not the past or the future

example.eg: That's all for the present.
example.egtrans: 暂且就讲这些。

example.eg: The play is set in the present.
example.egtrans: 这出戏以当代为背景。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the form of the verb that is used to show what happens or exists now

example.eg: The verb in this sentence is in the present.
example.egtrans: 这个句子中的动词是现在时。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: now

example.eg: "Are you busy?" "Not at present."
example.egtrans: “你忙吗？”“这会儿不忙。”

example.eg: At present she's working abroad.
example.egtrans: 她目前在国外工作。

present.name: present
present.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a particular place

example.eg: The whole family was present.
example.egtrans: 全家人都在场。

example.eg: There were no children present.
example.egtrans: 没有孩子在场。

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening or existing now

example.eg: I don't have her present address.
example.egtrans: 我不知道她现在的地址。

example.eg: Please state your present occupation and salary.
example.egtrans: 请说出你目前的职业和薪水。

present.name: present
present.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give, provide, or make something known

example.eg: The winners were presented with medals.
example.egtrans: 获胜者被授予奖牌。

example.eg: The letter presented the family with a problem that would be difficult to solve.
example.egtrans: 这封信给这家人提出了一个难题。

example.eg: The documentary presented us with a balanced view of the issue.
example.egtrans: 这部纪录片向我们呈现了对这一问题的客观看法。

example.eg: He presented the report to his colleagues at the meeting.
example.egtrans: 他在会议上向同事们做了报告。

example.eg: The classroom presented a cheerful busy atmosphere to the visitors (= appeared to them to have this).
example.egtrans: 整个班级向参观者展示出一派快乐繁忙的氛围。

example.eg: The school is presenting (= performing) "West Side Story" as its end-of-term production.
example.egtrans: 学校将上演《西区故事》作为期末作品。

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to introduce a television or radio show
trans_examp.trans_cn: 主持播出（电视或广播节目）

example.eg: She presents the late-night news.
example.egtrans: 她主持午夜新闻。

trans_examp.trans_en: to introduce a person

example.eg: May I present Professor Carter?
example.egtrans: 请允许我介绍卡特教授。

example.eg: Later on I'd like to present you to the headteacher.
example.egtrans: 过一会儿我会把你引见给校长。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to arrive somewhere and introduce yourself

example.eg: He presented himself at the doctor's at 9.30 a.m. as arranged.
example.egtrans: 他早上9点30分如约去了医生那里。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something presents itself, it happens.

example.eg: An opportunity suddenly presented itself.
example.egtrans: 突然出现了一个良机。

presented.name: present
presented.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you are given, without asking for it, on a special occasion, especially to show friendship, or to say thank you
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指表示友谊或致谢的）礼物，赠品

example.eg: a birthday/Christmas/wedding present
example.egtrans: 生日／圣诞／结婚礼物

example.eg: They gave me theatre tickets as a present.
example.egtrans: 他们送给我戏票作为礼物。

example.eg: "Are you busy?" "Not at present."
example.egtrans: “你忙吗？”“这会儿不忙。”

example.eg: At present she's working abroad.
example.egtrans: 她目前在国外工作。

example.eg: The whole family was present.
example.egtrans: 全家人都在场。

example.eg: There were no children present.
example.egtrans: 没有孩子在场。

example.eg: I don't have her present address.

example.eg: Please state your present occupation and salary.
example.egtrans: 请说出你目前的职业和薪水。

example.eg: The winners were presented with medals.

example.egtrans: 这部纪录片向我们呈现了对这一问题的客观看法。

example.eg: He presented the report to his colleagues at the meeting.
example.egtrans: 他在会议上向同事们做了报告。

example.eg: The classroom presented a cheerful busy atmosphere to the visitors (= appeared to them to have this).
example.egtrans: 整个班级向参观者展示出一派快乐繁忙的氛围。

example.eg: The school is presenting (= performing) "West Side Story" as its end-of-term production.
example.egtrans: 学校将上演《西区故事》作为期末作品。

dsense.name: present
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to introduce a television or radio show
trans_examp.trans_cn: 主持播出（电视或广播节目）

example.eg: She presents the late-night news.
example.egtrans: 她主持午夜新闻。

trans_examp.trans_en: to introduce a person

example.eg: May I present Professor Carter?
example.egtrans: 请允许我介绍卡特教授。

example.eg: Later on I'd like to present you to the headteacher.
example.egtrans: 过一会儿我会把你引见给校长。

example.eg: He presented himself at the doctor's at 9.30 a.m. as arranged.
example.egtrans: 他早上9点30分如约去了医生那里。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something presents itself, it happens.

example.eg: An opportunity suddenly presented itself.
example.egtrans: 突然出现了一个良机。

preserve.name: preserve
preserve.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyed

example.eg: to preserve the environment
example.egtrans: 保护环境

example.eg: We want to preserve the character of the town while improving the facilities.
example.egtrans: 我们想在改善市镇设施的同时保持其特色。

example.eg: The agreement preserved our right to limit trade in endangered species.
example.egtrans: 这项协议保留了我们限制濒危物种贸易的权利。

example.eg: Putting varnish on wood is a way of preserving it.
example.egtrans: 在木料上涂清漆是保护木料的一种方法。

example.eg: I need to get out of the house from time to time just to preserve (= prevent me from losing) my sanity.
example.egtrans: 我需要时不时到户外去以保持头脑清醒。

trans_examp.trans_en: to treat food in a particular way so that it can be kept for a long time without going bad

example.eg: preserved fruit
example.egtrans: 保鲜水果

example.eg: oranges preserved in brandy
example.egtrans: 浸在白兰地中贮存的橙子

preserve.name: preserve
preserve.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: preserve
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a food made from fruit or vegetables boiled with sugar and water until it becomes a firm sauce

example.eg: apricot preserve
example.egtrans: 杏酱

example.eg: jars of preserves
example.egtrans: 几罐蜜饯

dsense.name: preserve
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an activity that only one person or a particular type of person does or is responsible for

example.eg: Owning racehorses is the preserve of the rich.
example.egtrans: 拥有赛马是富人的专利。

example.eg: Sport used to be a male preserve.
example.egtrans: 体育曾经是男性的专利。

dsense.name: preserve
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         reserve
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指野生动物）保护区（同 reserve）

preset.name: preset
preset.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to prepare a machine so it will operate or stop later
trans_examp.trans_cn: 预调，预置，给…预定时间；预先安排

example.eg: I'll preset the oven to come on at 5 p.m.
example.egtrans: 我会把烤箱设在下午5点开始工作。

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange for or agree to something

example.eg: The agenda for the meeting has been preset.
example.egtrans: 会议的日程已预先确定好了。

preset.name: preset
preset.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: arranged, agreed, or chosen earlier
trans_examp.trans_cn: 预定的；提前同意的；预先挑选的

example.eg: We have a device which switches the lights on at a preset time in the evening.
example.egtrans: 我们有个装置，能在晚上按预设的时间打开电灯。

example.eg: The stock will be sold at a preset price.
example.egtrans: 这些股票将按预定价格出售。

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to part of a machine that is used to prepare it to operate or stop later

example.eg: Press and hold the numeric preset button.
example.egtrans: 按住数字预置按钮。

presumably.name: presumably
presumably.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to say what you think is the likely situation

example.eg: They can presumably afford to buy a bigger apartment.
example.egtrans: 他们大概买得起一套大一点的公寓。

example.eg: Presumably he just forgot to send the letter.
example.egtrans: 他可能是忘了寄信。

pretty.name: pretty
pretty.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: quite, but not extremely

example.eg: The house has four bedrooms, so it's pretty big.
example.egtrans: 这座房子有4个卧室，因此非常大。

example.eg: I'm pretty sure it was her.
example.egtrans: 我相当肯定是她。

example.eg: I've got a pretty good idea of how to get there.
example.egtrans: 我很清楚该怎么去那里。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: almost
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 差不多；几乎全部地，几乎完全地

example.eg: I've pretty much finished here.
example.egtrans: 我这儿基本上完成了。

example.eg: She knows pretty well everything there is to know on the subject.
example.egtrans: 对这个问题她几乎了如指掌。

pretty.name: pretty
pretty.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: pleasant to look at, or (especially of girls or women or things relating to them) attractive or pleasant in a delicate way
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指女孩、女子或与其相关事物）漂亮的，美丽的，标致的

example.eg: That's a pretty hat you're wearing.
example.egtrans: 你戴的帽子很漂亮。

example.eg: The sofa was covered in very pretty flowery material.
example.egtrans: 沙发面料是一种很漂亮的花朵图案的布料。

example.eg: She's got such a pretty daughter.
example.egtrans: 她有一个如此美貌的女儿。

prevent.name: prevent
prevent.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stop something from happening or someone from doing something

example.eg: Label your suitcases to prevent confusion.
example.egtrans: 在你的手提箱上贴上标签以防弄混。

example.eg: His disability prevents him (from) driving.
example.egtrans: 他有残疾，不能开车。

primarily.name: primarily
primarily.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: mainly

example.eg: We're primarily concerned with keeping expenditure down.
example.egtrans: 我们主要关心的是缩减开支。

example.eg: Baseball is primarily a summer game.
example.egtrans: 篮球基本上是一项夏季运动。

primitive.name: primitive
primitive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to human society at a very early stage of development, with people living in a simple way without machines or a writing system

example.eg: Primitive races colonized these islands 2,000 years ago.
example.egtrans: 原始种族2000年前开拓了这些岛屿。

example.eg: primitive man
example.egtrans: 原始人

example.eg: The spiny anteater is a mammal, although a very primitive one.
example.egtrans: 针鼹属于哺乳动物，尽管是非常原始的一种。

trans_examp.trans_en: Primitive living conditions are basic, unpleasant, and uncomfortable.

example.eg: Early settlers had to cope with very primitive living conditions.
example.egtrans: 早期殖民者不得不应付非常原始的生存条件。

prior.name: prior
prior.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: prior
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing or happening before something else, or before a particular time

example.eg: The course required no prior knowledge of Spanish.
example.egtrans: 这门课不要求先前学过西班牙语。

example.eg: They had to refuse the dinner invitation because of a prior engagement (= something already planned for that time).
example.egtrans: 因为事先另有约会，他们只好拒绝了吃饭的邀请。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: before a particular time or event

example.eg: the weeks prior to her death
example.egtrans: 她死之前的几个星期

dsense.name: prior
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: more important

example.eg: Mothers with young children have a prior claim on funds.
example.egtrans: 抚育幼儿的母亲拥有优先获得资助的权利。

prior.name: prior
prior.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a man who is in charge of a priory or who is second in charge of an abbey
trans_examp.trans_cn: 小隐修院院长；隐修院副院长

priority.name: priority
priority.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is very important and must be dealt with before other things

example.eg: The management did not seem to consider office safety to be a priority.
example.egtrans: 管理部门似乎并不认为应优先考虑办公室安全问题。

example.eg: My first/top priority is to find somewhere to live.
example.egtrans: 我首先要考虑的是找个地方住。

example.eg: You have to learn to get your priorities right/straight (= decide which are the most important jobs or problems and deal with them first).
example.egtrans: 你必须学会先处理最重要的事。

example.eg: Repairing the plumbing is a priority task (= more important than other jobs).
example.egtrans: 修好水管是当务之急。

example.eg: Banks normally give priority to large businesses when deciding on loans (= they deal with them first because they consider them most important).
example.egtrans: 银行在发放贷款时通常优先考虑大企业。

example.eg: Official business requirements obviously take/have priority over personal requests (= official business matters will be dealt with first).
example.egtrans: 公事显然应放在私事之上。

privilege.name: privilege
privilege.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an advantage that only one person or group of people has, usually because of their position or because they are rich
trans_examp.trans_cn: （特定个体或群体的）特权，特别待遇

example.eg: Healthcare should be a right, not a privilege.
example.egtrans: 医疗保健应该是权利，而非特权。

example.eg: Senior management enjoy certain privileges, such as company cars and health insurance.
example.egtrans: 高级管理层享受公司配车和私人医疗保健等特权。

trans_examp.trans_en: an opportunity to do something special or enjoyable

example.eg: I had the privilege of interviewing Picasso in the 1960s.
example.egtrans: 我在20世纪60年代很荣幸地采访到了毕加索。

example.eg: It was a real privilege to meet her.
example.egtrans: 见到她真是莫大的荣幸。

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which rich people or people from a high social class have most of the advantages in society
trans_examp.trans_cn: （富人或有权势者的）特权，特别待遇

example.eg: a life of privilege
example.egtrans: 特权生活

trans_examp.trans_en: the special right that some people in authority have that allows them to do or say things that other people are not allowed to

example.eg: diplomatic/parliamentary privilege
example.egtrans: 外交／议会言论特权

proceed.name: proceed
proceed.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to continue as planned

example.eg: His lawyers have decided not to proceed with the case.
example.egtrans: 他的律师已经决定不再继续打那场官司了。

example.eg: Preparations for the festival are now proceeding smoothly.
example.egtrans: 艺术节的准备活动正在顺利进行中。

trans_examp.trans_en: to move forward or travel in a particular direction

example.eg: Passengers for Madrid should proceed to gate 26 for boarding.
example.egtrans: 前往马德里的乘客应到26号登机门准备登机。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do something after you have done something else

example.eg: She sat down and proceeded to tell me about her skiing holiday.
example.egtrans: 她坐了下来，接着告诉我有关她滑雪度假的事情。

example.eg: He told me he was on a diet and then proceeded to eat a plateful of chips!
example.egtrans: 他告诉我他在节食，接着就吃了满满的一盘炸薯条！

process.name: process
process.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a series of actions that you take in order to achieve a result

example.eg: the peace process
example.egtrans: 和平进程

example.eg: Increasing the number of women in top management jobs will be a slow process.
example.egtrans: 增加高管职位妇女的人数将是一个缓慢的过程。

example.eg: This decision may delay the process of European unification.
example.egtrans: 这一决策可能会推迟欧洲一体化的进程。

example.eg: The party has begun the painful (= difficult) process of rethinking its policies and strategy.
example.egtrans: 该党开始了重新审视其政策和战略的艰难历程。

example.eg: Going to court to obtain compensation is a long process.
example.egtrans: 起诉要求赔偿是一个漫长的过程。

example.eg: She arrived at the correct answer by a process of elimination (= by deciding against each answer that was unlikely to be correct until only one was left).
example.egtrans: 她使用排除法找到了正确答案。

trans_examp.trans_en: a series of changes that happen naturally

example.eg: the digestive process
example.egtrans: 消化过程

example.eg: the ageing process
example.egtrans: 衰老的过程

example.eg: It's all part of the learning process.
example.egtrans: 这完全是学习过程的一部分。

trans_examp.trans_en: a method of producing goods in a factory by treating natural substances

example.eg: They have developed a new process for extracting aluminium from bauxite.
example.egtrans: 他们创造出一种从铝土矿中提炼铝的新工艺。

process.name: process
process.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: process
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to deal with documents in an official way

example.eg: Visa applications take 28 days to process.
example.egtrans: 办理签证申请需要28天的时间。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a computer processes information, it performs a particular series of operations on the information, such as a set of calculations.
to prepare, change, or treat food or natural substances as a part of an industrial operation

example.eg: a waste processing plant
example.egtrans: 废物处理厂

trans_examp.trans_en: to think about a difficult or sad situation so that you can gradually accept it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 消化，处理（艰难、悲伤的事情）

example.eg: Returning soldiers need time to process what they have experienced in combat.
example.egtrans: 返乡的士兵需要时间来消化他们在战场上经历的一切。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make pictures from photographic film

example.eg: I need to get those films processed.
example.egtrans: 我得把那些底片洗出来。

dsense.name: process
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to walk slowly

example.eg: We watched them process down the aisle.
example.egtrans: 我们看着他们沿着走廊慢慢地走了过去。

produce.name: produce
produce.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something or bring something into existence

example.eg: France produces a great deal of wine for export.
example.egtrans: 法国生产大量葡萄酒供出口。

example.eg: Red blood cells are produced in the bone marrow.
example.egtrans: 红细胞在骨髓内生成。

example.eg: She works for a company that produces (= makes for sale) electrical goods.
example.egtrans: 她在一家生产电子产品的公司工作。

example.eg: I was wondering whether I could produce a meal out of what's left in the fridge.
example.egtrans: 我不知道能否用冰箱里剩的东西做一顿饭。

example.eg: She's asked me to produce a report on the state of the project.
example.egtrans: 她要求我就这项工程的状况写一份报告。

trans_examp.trans_en: When animals produce young, they give birth to them.

example.eg: Our cat produced four kittens during the course of the night.
example.egtrans: 我们的猫在夜里生了4只小猫。

example.eg: All our friends seem to be busy producing offspring at the moment.
example.egtrans: 我们所有的朋友现在似乎都忙着生儿育女。

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause a reaction or result

example.eg: The senator's speech produced an angry response from the opposition.
example.egtrans: 参议员的发言招致了反对派愤怒的抨击。

example.eg: Her remarks produced an awkward silence.
example.egtrans: 她的讲话引起了一阵尴尬的沉默。

example.eg: If used on delicate skin, this cream may produce a stinging sensation.
example.egtrans: 这种药膏用在娇嫩的皮肤上会产生刺痛感。

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to organize the practical and financial matters relating to the preparation of a film, play, or television or radio programme
to be in charge of making a musical recording and to be responsible for the arrangement of the music, the combination of the different instruments or voices and the general sound of it

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to bring something out from somewhere and show it

example.eg: He produced a letter from his desk that he asked me to read.
example.egtrans: 他从书桌里拿出一封信让我读。

example.eg: One of the men suddenly produced a knife from his pocket.
example.egtrans: 其中一名男子突然从口袋里掏出一把刀。

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to result in or discover something, especially proof

example.eg: A lengthy police investigation failed to produce any evidence on which the suspect could be convicted.
example.egtrans: 警方的长期调查并未发现任何能证明疑犯有罪的证据。

produce.name: produce
produce.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: food or any other substance or material that is grown or obtained through farming
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指大量生产的）食品，农产品

example.eg: agricultural/dairy/fresh produce
example.egtrans: 农产品／乳产品／新鲜的农产品

profile.name: profile
profile.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: profile
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a short description of someone's life, work, character, etc.
information about a person's life, work, interests, etc. on a social networking website

example.eg: You can post your relationship status on your Facebook profile.
example.egtrans: 你可以在脸书的“个人资料”栏发布你的关系状态。

dsense.name: profile
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount of public attention and notice that something receives

example.eg: We need to increase our company's profile in Asia.
example.egtrans: 我们需要扩大公司在亚洲的影响力。

example.eg: There is a growing number of women in high-profile positions (= positions which they are noticed) in the government.
example.egtrans: 在备受注目的政府职位上，女性的数量在逐渐增长。

dsense.name: profile
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a side view of a person's face

example.eg: Drawing profiles is somehow easier than drawing the full face.
example.egtrans: 不知为什么画侧面像要比画整张脸容易。

example.eg: a strong profile
example.egtrans: 轮廓分明的侧影

example.eg: The actor is photographed in profile, smoking a cigarette.
example.egtrans: 这个演员被人从侧面拍了一张抽烟的照片。

programmatically.name: programmatically
programmatically.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that follows a plan or uses a particular method
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有规划地；有纲领地；有步骤地

example.eg: Programmatically, we are guided by a set of rules.
example.egtrans: 有一组规则提供有步骤的指导。

example.eg: We have to approach fundraising programmatically.
example.egtrans: 我们必须有规划地开展筹款活动。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that relates to or uses computer programs

example.eg: The style properties of a Web control can be programmatically manipulated.
example.egtrans: 可以通过编程方式操纵Web控件的样式属性。

example.eg: The spreadsheets can be embedded in other applications and controlled programmatically.
example.egtrans: 电子表格可以嵌入到其他应用程序中，并通过编程进行控制。

prohibit.name: prohibit
prohibit.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to officially refuse to allow something

example.eg: Motor vehicles are prohibited from driving in the town centre.
example.egtrans: 机动车辆禁止在市中心行驶。

example.eg: The government introduced a law prohibiting tobacco advertisements on TV.
example.egtrans: 政府颁布了一项法律： 禁止在电视上播放烟草广告。

example.eg: Parking is strictly prohibited between these gates.
example.egtrans: 这些大门之间严禁停车。

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent a particular activity by making it impossible

example.eg: The loudness of the music prohibits serious conversation in most nightclubs.
example.egtrans: 大多数夜总会里音乐声嘈杂，根本没法进行严肃的谈话。

prompt.name: prompt
prompt.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: prompt
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something happen

example.eg: The bishop's speech has prompted an angry response from both political parties.
example.egtrans: 主教的发言激起了两大政党的愤怒回应。

example.eg: Recent worries over the president's health have prompted speculation over his political future.
example.egtrans: 最近对总统健康状况的担忧引发了对其政治前途的猜测。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make someone decide to say or do something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 促使（某人）决定说（或做）某事

example.eg: What prompted you to say that?
example.egtrans: 什么促使你那么说的？

example.eg: I don't know what prompted him to leave.
example.egtrans: 我不知道是什么促使他离开的。

dsense.name: prompt
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to help someone, especially an actor, to remember what they were going to say or do

example.eg: I forgot my line and had to be prompted.
example.egtrans: 我忘词了，只好让人提词。

prompt.name: prompt
prompt.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of an action) done quickly and without delay, or (of a person) acting quickly or arriving at the arranged time

example.eg: They've written back already - that was a very prompt reply.
example.egtrans: 他们已经回信了——答复相当迅速。

example.eg: They're usually fairly prompt in dealing with enquiries.
example.egtrans: 他们回复咨询通常都比较快。

example.eg: Try to be prompt because we'll be very short of time.
example.egtrans: 尽量快点，因为我们时间很紧。

prompt.name: prompt
prompt.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: prompt
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sign on a computer screen that shows that the computer is ready to receive your instructions
trans_examp.trans_cn: （计算机屏幕上的）提示符（显示计算机已经准备好接受指令）

dsense.name: prompt
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: words that are spoken to an actor who has forgotten what he or she is going to say during the performance of a play
a person whose job is to help actors, during a performance, to remember words that they have forgotten

prompt.name: prompt
prompt.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: at the time stated and no later

example.eg: We'll be leaving at six o'clock prompt.
example.egtrans: 我们6点准时动身。

prone.name: prone
prone.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: prone
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: likely to suffer from an illness or show a particular negative characteristic
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 易于遭受（疾病）的；有（消极）倾向的

example.eg: I've always been prone to headaches.
example.egtrans: 我总是容易头疼。

example.eg: He was prone to depression even as a teenager.
example.egtrans: 甚至在青少年时期他就容易情绪抑郁。

example.eg: She's prone to exaggerate, that's for sure.
example.egtrans: 她喜欢夸大其词，这一点是肯定的。

dsense.name: prone
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: lying face down

example.eg: The photograph showed a man lying prone on the pavement, a puddle of blood around his head.
example.egtrans: 这张照片上一名男子趴在人行道上，头部周围有一滩血。

prone.name: -prone
prone.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: likely to experience a particular problem more often than is usual

example.eg: accident-prone
example.egtrans: 易出事故的

example.eg: injury-prone
example.egtrans: 易受伤的

propagation.name: propagation
propagation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: propagation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of producing a new plant from a parent plant

example.eg: Students researched the propagation of plants at the city's botanical garden.
example.egtrans: 学生们在该市的植物园研究了植物的繁殖问题。

example.eg: We saw a demonstration on horticultural propagation at the greenhouse.
example.egtrans: 我们在温室里看到了园艺繁殖的演示。

trans_examp.trans_en: the producing of young plants or animals

example.eg: The Game and Fish Department focuses on propagation, and other agencies monitor and protect breeding areas.
example.egtrans: 渔猎部专注于繁殖，其他机构监测和保护繁殖区。

dsense.name: propagation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act or process of spreading something, especially a harmful message or opinion, among a lot of people

example.eg: The site is a platform for the propagation of the group’s ideology.
example.egtrans: 这个网站是一个传播该团体意识形态的平台。

example.eg: They have allowed the propagation of hateful messages.
example.egtrans: 它们让仇恨信息得以传播。

example.eg: A file isn’t always necessary for the propagation of a computer virus.
example.egtrans: 计算机病毒的传播并不总是需要文件。

trans_examp.trans_en: the sending out or spreading of light or sound waves, movement, etc.

example.eg: The aircraft were gathering data on radio wave propagation.
example.egtrans: 飞机正在收集无线电波传播的数据。

example.eg: light/sound/electromagnetic wave propagation
example.egtrans: 光/声/电磁波的传播

proper.name: proper
proper.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: proper
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: real, satisfactory, suitable, or correct
trans_examp.trans_cn: 适合的；适当的；恰当的；正确的

example.eg: This is Sara's first proper job - she usually does temporary work just for the money.
example.egtrans: 这是萨拉的第一份正式工作——她通常只是为了挣钱而打零工。

example.eg: If you're going to walk long distances you need proper walking boots.
example.egtrans: 如果你要走那么远的路，就需要一双合脚的远足鞋。

example.eg: I would have done the job myself but I didn't have the proper equipment.
example.egtrans: 这活儿我倒是想自己做来着，只是没有合适的工具。

example.eg: I've had sandwiches but I haven't eaten a proper meal.
example.egtrans: 我吃了三明治，但还没有好好吃一顿饭。

example.eg: She likes everything to be in its proper place.
example.egtrans: 她喜欢所有东西都各居其所。

dsense.name: proper
