dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: showing standards of behaviour that are socially and morally acceptable

example.eg: In those days it was considered not quite proper for young ladies to be seen talking to men in public.
example.egtrans: 在那个年月，年轻女子被人看见在公共场合与男子谈话会被认为不成体统。

example.eg: She was very proper, my grandmother - she'd never go out without wearing her hat and gloves.
example.egtrans: 我祖母非常讲究仪表——出门时总要戴上帽子和手套。

dsense.name: proper
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: belonging to the main, most important, or typical part
trans_examp.trans_cn: 严格意义上的；属于最重要（或最典型）部分的

example.eg: It's a suburb of Los Angeles really - I wouldn't call it Los Angeles proper.
example.egtrans: 这实际上是洛杉矶郊区——严格来讲我不会称其为洛杉矶。

dsense.name: proper
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete

example.eg: I've got myself into a proper mess!
example.egtrans: 我把自己搞得一团糟！

proper.name: proper
proper.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: proper
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: sometimes used instead of the adverb "properly" to describe how someone speaks
trans_examp.trans_cn: 合适地，得体地（有时代替副词 properly，用于描述某人说话的方式）

example.eg: She was an educated lady so she talked proper.
example.egtrans: 她是位有教养的女士，因此谈吐很得体。

dsense.name: proper
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used for emphasizing what you are saying

example.eg: I was proper annoyed with him.
example.egtrans: 我对他非常生气。

property.name: property
property.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: property
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an object or objects that belong to someone

example.eg: The club does not accept responsibility for loss of or damage to club members' personal property.
example.egtrans: 该俱乐部不承担会员个人财产丢失或损坏的责任。

example.eg: Both books have "Government property" stamped inside them.
example.egtrans: 这两本书里都盖着“政府财产”的印章。

example.eg: Children need to be taught to have respect for other people's property.
example.egtrans: 应该教育孩子尊重他人的财产。

trans_examp.trans_en: a building or area of land, or both together

example.eg: He owns a number of properties on the south coast.
example.egtrans: 他在南部海滨拥有几处房产。

example.eg: The notice said "Private property - keep off!"
example.egtrans: 布告上写着“私人地产，请勿擅入”。

example.eg: Yes, I've bought my own house - I'm now a man/woman of property!
example.egtrans: 是的，我买了房子——我现在是有产阶级了！

trans_examp.trans_en: the legal right to own and use something

dsense.name: property
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quality in a substance or material, especially one that means that it can be used in a particular way

example.eg: One of the properties of copper is that it conducts heat and electricity very well.
example.egtrans: 铜的特性之一是导热导电能力强。

example.eg: We value herbs for their taste, but we forget that they also have medicinal properties.
example.egtrans: 我们因为草本植物的味道而珍视它们，不过我们忘了它们还有药用价值。

protect.name: protect
protect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep someone or something safe from injury, damage, or loss

example.eg: clothing that protects you against the cold
example.egtrans: 御寒的衣服

example.eg: It's important to protect your skin from the harmful effects of the sun.
example.egtrans: 保护皮肤不受太阳的伤害是很重要的。

example.eg: Surely the function of the law is to protect everyone's rights.
example.egtrans: 法律的作用当然是保护每个人的权利。

example.eg: Of course the company will act to protect its financial interests in the country if war begins.
example.egtrans: 如果战争爆发，这个公司当然会采取行动保护自己在该国的经济利益。

example.eg: Patients' names have been changed to protect their privacy.
example.egtrans: 病人的名字被改换了以保护他们的隐私。

example.eg: Public pressure to protect the environment is strong and growing.
example.egtrans: 公众要求保护环境的呼声越来越强烈。

example.eg: Vitamin C may help protect against cancer.
example.egtrans: 维生素C可能有助于抗癌。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a government protects a part of its country's trade or industry, it helps it by taxing goods from other countries.
to provide someone with insurance against injury, damages, etc.

prototype.name: prototype
prototype.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the first example of something, such as a machine or other industrial product, from which all later forms are developed

example.eg: a prototype for/of a new car
example.egtrans: 新型轿车的原型

prove.name: prove
prove.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: prove
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show a particular result after a period of time

example.eg: The operation proved a complete success.
example.egtrans: 这一手术结果大获成功。

example.eg: The dispute over the song rights proved impossible to resolve.
example.egtrans: 结果是，有关歌曲版权的争执根本无法解决。

example.eg: The new treatment has proved to be a disaster.
example.egtrans: 这种新的治疗方法结果是一场灾难。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to show that you are good at something

example.eg: I wish he'd stop trying to prove himself all the time.
example.egtrans: 但愿他不要再不停地试图证明自己的实力了。

dsense.name: prove
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show that something is true

example.eg: They suspected that she'd killed him but they could never actually prove that it was her.
example.egtrans: 他们怀疑她杀了他，但他们从来未能确切证明是她干的。

example.eg: They proved him innocent/guilty.
example.egtrans: 他们证明他是清白／有罪的。

example.eg: Under the present system, you're innocent until proven guilty.
example.egtrans: 在现行制度下，在被证明有罪之前你是清白的。

example.eg: "I lost £30 on the bus." "That just goes to prove what an idiot you are!"
example.egtrans: “我在公共汽车上丢了30英镑。”“那正好证明了你是个多么愚蠢的傻瓜！”

example.eg: Computers have been used to prove mathematical theorems.
example.egtrans: 计算机被用于证明数学定理。

example.eg: That theory was proved false.
example.egtrans: 那个理论被证实是错误的。

example.eg: He's so aggressive - it's as if he's always trying to prove something.
example.egtrans: 他好逞强——似乎他一直想证明些什么。

proxy.name: proxy
proxy.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: authority given to a person to act for someone else, such as by voting for them in an election, or the person who this authority is given to
trans_examp.trans_cn: （由个人委托的）代理人，代表；代理权；代表权

example.eg: a proxy vote
example.egtrans: 代投的一票

example.eg: My brother's voting for me by proxy in the club elections.
example.egtrans: 在俱乐部选举中，我弟弟代表我投票。

example.eg: Can I nominate someone as a proxy to sign for me?
example.egtrans: 我能提名某个人代表我签字吗？

pseudo.name: pseudo-
pseudo.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the beginning of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: pretended and not real

example.eg: pseudo-religious
example.egtrans: 伪宗教的

example.eg: a pseudo-intellectual
example.egtrans: 伪知识分子

publication.name: publication
publication.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of making information or stories available to people in a printed or electronic form

example.eg: The brochure will be ready for publication in September.
example.egtrans: 这本小册子将在9月份出版。

example.eg: Will you arrange the publication of the names of the winners?
example.egtrans: 你能安排公布得胜者的姓名吗？

example.eg: When is the publication date? (= When will the book be available to buy?)
example.egtrans: （书）哪天出版？

trans_examp.trans_en: a book, magazine, newspaper, or document in which information or stories are published

example.eg: Our latest publication is a magazine for health enthusiasts.
example.egtrans: 我们最近的出版物是一本为热爱健康的人士办的杂志。

publish.name: publish
publish.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make information available to people, especially in a book, magazine, or newspaper, or to produce and sell a book, magazine, or newspaper

example.eg: She's just had an article published in their weekend supplement.
example.egtrans: 她刚在他们周末版的增刊上发表了一篇文章。

example.eg: The government publishes figures every six months showing how many people are unemployed.
example.egtrans: 政府每半年公布一次失业人数。

example.eg: The names of the winners of the competition will be published in June.
example.egtrans: 竞赛优胜者名单将于6月份公布。

example.eg: She was only 19 when her first novel was published.
example.egtrans: 她的第一部小说出版时她年仅19岁。

Pulse.name: pulse
Pulse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: pulse
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the regular beating of the heart, especially when it is felt at the wrist or side of the neck

example.eg: The child's pulse was strong/weak.
example.egtrans: 那个孩子的脉搏很有力／虚弱。

example.eg: Exercise increases your pulse rate.
example.egtrans: 锻炼能加快你的脉搏。

trans_examp.trans_en: a short period of energy that is repeated regularly, such as a short, loud sound or a short flash of light

example.eg: The data, normally transmitted electronically, can be changed into pulses of light.
example.egtrans: 这一数据通常是电子传送的，现在可被改为光波脉冲。

trans_examp.trans_en: the action of switching power on and off again quickly on a food processor (= an electric machine that cuts and mixes food) to mix food

example.eg: Give the mixture a pulse or two until it is broken down.
example.egtrans: 对混合物进行一两次脉冲搅拌，直到搅碎。

example.eg: Set the food processor to pulse, adding olive oil and herbs.
example.egtrans: 将食物搅拌机设置为脉冲，加入橄榄油和香料。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to hold someone's wrist and count how many times the heart beats in one minute

dsense.name: pulse
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: seeds such as beans or peas that are cooked and eaten
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 豆类植物的种子；荚果；豆子

example.eg: Pulses include peas, lentils, and chickpeas.
example.egtrans: 豆类包括豌豆、小扁豆和鹰嘴豆。

Pulse.name: pulse
Pulse.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move or beat with a strong, regular rhythm
trans_examp.trans_cn: （以规律且强有力的节拍）跳动，搏动，振动

example.eg: I could feel the blood pulsing through my veins.
example.egtrans: 我能感觉到血液在我的血管里翻腾。

trans_examp.trans_en: to mix food by switching a food processor (= an electric machine for cutting or mixing food) on and off again quickly

example.eg: Place the prawns in a food processor and pulse to a coarse paste.
example.egtrans: 将大虾放入食品搅拌机中，搅拌成粗糊状。

pure.name: pure
pure.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: pure
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not mixed with anything else

example.eg: a pure cotton shirt
example.egtrans: 纯棉衬衣

example.eg: pure orange juice
example.egtrans: 纯橘子汁

example.eg: pure English honey
example.egtrans: 纯英格兰蜂蜜

example.eg: a pure Arab horse
example.egtrans: 纯种阿拉伯马

trans_examp.trans_en: A pure colour is not mixed with any other colour.

example.eg: a swan's pure white plumage
example.egtrans: 天鹅的纯白色羽毛

trans_examp.trans_en: A pure sound is clear and perfect.

example.eg: the pure vocal tones of the choirboy
example.egtrans: 唱诗班男童纯净的嗓音

trans_examp.trans_en: clean and free from harmful substances
trans_examp.trans_cn: 洁净的，纯净的，无有害物质的

example.eg: The mountain air was wonderfully pure.
example.egtrans: 山上的空气极为纯净。

example.eg: Tap water is never chemically pure.
example.egtrans: 自来水从来不是化学意义上的纯水。

dsense.name: pure
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete; only

example.eg: It was pure coincidence/chance that we met.
example.egtrans: 我们见面纯属巧合。

example.eg: This last month has been pure hell.
example.egtrans: 上个月是十足的地狱。

example.eg: Her face had a look of pure delight.
example.egtrans: 她满脸的愉悦。

example.eg: The president dismissed the newspaper reports as pure speculation.
example.egtrans: 总统将这篇新闻报道斥为纯粹的臆测。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to an area of study that is studied only for the purpose of developing theories about it, not for the purpose of using those theories in a practical way

example.eg: pure mathematics
example.egtrans: 理论数学

example.eg: pure economics
example.egtrans: 理论经济学

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used after a noun to mean "and nothing else"
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用于名词后）完全是，不折不扣，不过是

example.eg: He is motivated by greed, pure and simple.
example.egtrans: 他完全是被贪婪所驱使。

dsense.name: pure
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: behaving in a way that is morally good, especially in things related to sex
trans_examp.trans_cn: 纯洁的；无邪的；清白的；贞洁的

example.eg: I'm trying to think only pure thoughts.
example.egtrans: 我正试图保持思想纯洁，没有邪念。

example.eg: He invited me up to his flat for coffee, but I didn't think that his motives were entirely pure.
example.egtrans: 他邀请我去他的公寓喝咖啡，但我认为他动机不纯。

example.eg: In many cultures, it is considered important for a woman to keep herself pure (= not to have sex) until she marries.
example.egtrans: 许多文化对妇女在婚前保持贞洁这一点很是看重。

purely.name: purely
purely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: only

example.eg: On a purely practical level, it is difficult to see how such proposals would work.
example.egtrans: 从纯粹实践的角度来看很难看出这些计划的可行性。

example.eg: We made this decision purely for financial reasons.
example.egtrans: 我们作出这个决定纯粹是出于财务原因。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for only one reason or purpose

example.eg: They decided to close the museum purely and simply because it cost too much to run.
example.egtrans: 他们决定关闭博物馆纯粹是因为管理的费用太高。

purpose.name: purpose
purpose.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: why you do something or why something exists

example.eg: The purpose of the research is to try to find out more about the causes of the disease.
example.egtrans: 研究的目的是试图进一步探寻引起这种疾病的原因。

example.eg: His only purpose in life seems to be to enjoy himself.
example.egtrans: 他生活的唯一目的似乎就是享受。

example.eg: Her main/primary purpose in suing the newspaper for libel was to clear her name.
example.egtrans: 她控告这家报纸诽谤的主要目的是澄清她的清白。

example.eg: I came to Brighton for/with the express purpose of seeing you.
example.egtrans: 我到布赖顿是特地来看你的。

example.eg: Letters whose sole purpose is to make a political point will not be published.
example.egtrans: 以宣扬政治观点为唯一目的的来信是不会被发表的。

example.eg: She had the operation entirely for cosmetic purposes.
example.egtrans: 她做这次手术纯粹是为了美容。

example.eg: a multi-purpose kitchen knife
example.egtrans: 多用厨刀

example.eg: I can see no useful purpose in continuing this conversation.
example.egtrans: 我看不到继续这次谈话有任何益处。

example.eg: All my efforts were to no purpose (= failed).
example.egtrans: 我所有的努力都付诸东流了。

example.eg: He gave her a sum of money which she used to good purpose (= well).
example.egtrans: 他给她的那笔钱她都用在了该用的地方。

trans_examp.trans_en: determination or a feeling of having a reason for what you do

example.eg: I've always admired her for her strength of purpose.
example.egtrans: 我一直佩服她意志坚定。

example.eg: Parenthood would give him a sense of purpose.
example.egtrans: 身为人父会让他变得有意志。

trans_examp.trans_en: a need

example.eg: We haven't yet managed to find new premises that are suitable for our purposes.
example.egtrans: 我们还未找到符合我们需要的新营业场所。

example.eg: The fabric I bought isn't exactly what I wanted, but it will serve my purposes (= fulfil my needs).
example.egtrans: 我买的布料严格说不是我想要的那种，但可以满足我的需要。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something on purpose, you do it intentionally, not by accident.

example.eg: I didn't do it on purpose - it was an accident.
example.egtrans: 我不是故意这样做的，是个意外。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have a use

example.eg: These small village shops serve a very useful purpose.
example.egtrans: 村里的这些小商店非常有用。

puzzle.name: puzzle
puzzle.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation that is difficult to understand
trans_examp.trans_cn: 令人费解的情况；难题；谜

example.eg: Scientists have been trying to solve this puzzle for years.
example.egtrans: 多年来科学家们一直试图解开这个谜。

trans_examp.trans_en: a game or toy in which you have to fit separate pieces together, or a problem or question that you have to answer by using your skill or knowledge
trans_examp.trans_cn: 测验智力的游戏（或玩具）

example.eg: a jigsaw puzzle
example.egtrans: 智力拼图玩具

example.eg: a crossword puzzle
example.egtrans: 纵横字谜

example.eg: a puzzle book
example.egtrans: 谜语书

puzzle.name: puzzle
puzzle.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause someone to feel confused and slightly worried because they cannot understand something, or to think hard about something in order to understand it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）感到迷惑；（使）感到为难，（使）感到困窘

example.eg: The findings of the survey puzzle me - they're not at all what I would have expected.
example.egtrans: 调查的结果使我感到迷惑——它们根本不像我原本预料的那样。

example.eg: It puzzles me why she said that.
example.egtrans: 我想不通她为什么那么说。

example.eg: Management are still puzzling about/over how the accident could have happened.
example.egtrans: 管理层仍对事故发生的原因感到迷惑不解。

qualified.name: qualified
qualified.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: qualified
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having finished a training course, or having particular skills, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有资格的；合格的，胜任的

example.eg: Tim is now a qualified architect.
example.egtrans: 蒂姆现在是一个合格的建筑师了。

example.eg: What makes you think that you are qualified for this job?
example.egtrans: 什么使你觉得自己有资格从事这份工作？

example.eg: I'm not qualified to give advice on such matters.
example.egtrans: 在这样的事情上我没有资格提建议。

dsense.name: qualified
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: limited

example.eg: There seems to be qualified support for the idea.
example.egtrans: 对这个观点的支持似乎有所保留。

qualifier.name: qualifier
qualifier.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: qualifier
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a team or person who has won part of a competition and is therefore competing in the next part of it

example.eg: The qualifiers from the first round will advance to the quarter final.
example.egtrans: 通过第一轮比赛者将进入四分之一决赛。

trans_examp.trans_en: a game from which the winner will go on to compete in the next part of a competition

example.eg: Belgium and Italy are playing in tonight's qualifier.
example.egtrans: 比利时队和意大利队将在今晚的预赛中相遇。

dsense.name: qualifier
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in grammar, a word or phrase that limits the meaning of another word or phrase, or makes it less general, such as an adjective or adverb

qualify.name: qualify
qualify.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: qualify
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to successfully finish a training course so that you are able to do a job; to have or achieve the necessary skills, etc.

example.eg: She hopes to qualify (as a lawyer) at the end of the year.
example.egtrans: 她希望在年底获得（律师）资格。

example.eg: This course qualifies you to teach in any secondary school.
example.egtrans: 这门课程可以让你获得在任何中学任教的资格。

dsense.name: qualify
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have the legal right to have or do something because of the situation you are in, or to cause someone to have such a right

example.eg: She doesn't qualify for maternity leave because she hasn't been in her job long enough.
example.egtrans: 她无权休产假，因为她工作时间不够长。

example.eg: To qualify for the competition you need to be over 18.
example.egtrans: 18岁以上才有资格参赛。

example.eg: Being a single parent qualifies you for extra benefits.
example.egtrans: 单亲父母有资格领取额外补贴。

example.eg: He thinks the fact that he's worked here longer than the rest of us qualifies him (= gives him the right) to tell us all what to do.
example.egtrans: 他觉得自己在这里工作的时间比我们其他人都长，有权对大家发号施令。

dsense.name: qualify
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to succeed in getting into a competition

example.eg: Nigeria was the first team to qualify for the World Cup.
example.egtrans: 尼日利亚队是第一支取得世界杯参赛资格的球队。

example.eg: England has to win tonight's qualifying match to advance to the next round of the competition.
example.egtrans: 英格兰队必须在今晚的资格赛中获胜才能进入下一轮比赛。

example.eg: Our goal has always been to reach the qualifying rounds of the Champions League.
example.egtrans: 我们的目标一直是获得参加冠军杯预选赛的资格。

dsense.name: qualify
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to limit the strength or meaning of a statement

example.eg: I'd like to qualify my criticisms of the school's failings, by adding that it's a very happy place.
example.egtrans: 关于我对这所学校不尽人意之处的批评我想补充一点，就是这是个令人感到愉快的地方。

trans_examp.trans_en: In grammar, a word or phrase that qualifies another word or phrase limits its meaning and makes it less general

example.eg: In the sentence "He walked quickly along the road", "quickly" and "along the road" qualify "walked".
example.egtrans: 在 He walked quickly along the road 这句话里，quickly 和 along the road 修饰 walked。

quantity.name: quantity
quantity.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount or number of something, especially that can be measured
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指可测量或确定的）量，数量，分量

example.eg: Police found a large/small quantity of drugs in his possession.
example.egtrans: 警方发现他携带大／少量毒品。

example.eg: We consumed vast quantities of food and drink that night.
example.egtrans: 那天晚上我们大吃大喝了一通。

example.eg: The (sheer) quantity (= large amount) of equipment needed for the trip is staggering.
example.egtrans: 这次旅行所需的装备之多令人惊愕。

example.eg: They are now developing ways to produce the vaccine in large quantities and cheaply.
example.egtrans: 目前他们正在研究大批量廉价生产这种疫苗的方法。

example.eg: This recipe is only for four, so I usually double the quantity if I'm cooking for my family.
example.egtrans: 这一菜谱的量只够4个人吃，所以我在为全家人烧菜时通常会做双倍的量。

example.eg: It's quality not quantity that really counts.
example.egtrans: 真正重要的是质量而非数量。

quirk.name: quirk
quirk.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an unusual habit or part of someone's personality, or something that is strange and unexpected

example.eg: You have to get used to other people's quirks and foibles.
example.egtrans: 你得习惯别人的怪癖和小缺点。

example.eg: There is a quirk in the rules that allows you to invest money without paying tax.
example.egtrans: 这些规章的奇怪之处在于其允许人们投资而不必缴税。

example.eg: By some strange quirk/By an odd quirk of fate (= unexpectedly), we ended up on the same train.
example.egtrans: 说来奇怪，我们结果上了同一辆火车。

quota.name: quota
quota.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a fixed, limited amount or number that is officially allowed

example.eg: The country now has a quota on immigration.
example.egtrans: 该国现在对外来移民人数有限额。

example.eg: The class contains the usual quota (= number) of troublemakers.
example.egtrans: 班上也有那么些个捣蛋鬼。

quote.name: quote
quote.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: quote
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to repeat the words that someone else has said or written

example.eg: He's always quoting from the Bible.
example.egtrans: 他总是引用《圣经》上的话。

example.eg: "If they're flexible, we're flexible", the official was quoted as saying.
example.egtrans: 援引那位官员的话说：“如果他们能变通，我们也能变通。”

example.eg: She worked, to quote her daughter, "as if there were no tomorrow".
example.egtrans: 用她女儿的话来说，她工作起来“就像没有明天似的”。

example.eg: Can I quote you on that (= can I repeat to other people what you have just said)?
example.egtrans: 你讲的那些话我可以转述给别人听吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: If you quote a fact or example, you refer to it in order to add emphasis to what you are saying.

example.eg: Quote me one organization that doesn't have some bad managers.
example.egtrans: 请给我举出一个没有不善管理的经理的机构来。

dsense.name: quote
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give a price, especially one that will be charged for doing a piece of work

example.eg: The architect has quoted £90,000 to build a patio.
example.egtrans: 对露台部分，建筑师开价9万英镑。

quote.name: quote
quote.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: quote
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the price that a person or company says they will charge to do a piece of work

example.eg: I asked several companies to give me a quote for the building work.
example.egtrans: 我请了几位建造商为该工程报价。

dsense.name: quote
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the symbols “ ” or ‘ ’ that are put around a word or phrase to show that someone else has written or said it

example.eg: Put the title of the article in quotes.
example.egtrans: 给文章的标题加上引号。

railroad.name: railroad
railroad.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the metal tracks on which trains run

example.eg: We live close to the railroad line.
example.egtrans: 我们家离铁道线很近。

example.eg: She travelled across Siberia on the Trans-Siberian railroad.
example.egtrans: 她乘火车沿西伯利亚铁路横穿西伯利亚。

trans_examp.trans_en: the system of tracks, stations, trains, etc.

example.eg: a railroad station/timetable/siding
example.egtrans: 火车站／列车时刻表／铁路专用线等

example.eg: Thomas Grant worked on the railroad(s) for 50 years.
example.egtrans: 托马斯‧格兰特在铁路系统工作了50年。

railroad.name: railroad
railroad.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to force something to happen or force someone to do something, especially quickly or unfairly
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指以仓促或不公正的方式）强迫，迫使

example.eg: We were railroaded into signing the agreement.
example.egtrans: 我们被迫仓促签定协议。

randomly.name: randomly
randomly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is unexpected or does not seem to have any reason or cause

example.eg: He just randomly shouts stuff.
example.egtrans: 他只是随意地喊着什么。

rarely.name: rarely
rarely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: not often

example.eg: We rarely see each other now.
example.egtrans: 我们现在很少见面。

example.eg: I rarely have time to read a newspaper.
example.egtrans: 我难得有时间看报。

example.eg: Rarely have I seen such a beautiful sunset.
example.egtrans: 如此美丽的日落景象我真是难得一见。

rather than.name: rather
rather than.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: rather
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: quite; to a slight degree

example.eg: It's rather cold today, isn't it?
example.egtrans: 今天相当冷，是不是？

example.eg: That's rather a difficult book - here's an easier one for you.
example.egtrans: 那本书有点儿难——这本对你来说容易些。

example.eg: The train was rather too crowded for a comfortable journey.
example.egtrans: 这趟列车上相当拥挤，旅途不太舒服。

example.eg: She answered the phone rather sleepily.
example.egtrans: 她睡意朦胧地接电话。

example.eg: I rather doubt I'll be able to come to your party.
example.egtrans: 我说不太准能不能去参加你的聚会。

dsense.name: rather
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: more accurately; more exactly

example.eg: She'll fly to California on Thursday, or rather, she will if she has to.
example.egtrans: 她将于周四飞去加州，更确切地说，如果她不得不去的话。

example.eg: He's my sister's friend really, rather than mine.
example.egtrans: 确切地说，他是我妹妹的朋友，而不是我的。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to express an opposite opinion

example.eg: The ending of the war is not a cause for celebration, but rather for regret that it ever happened.
example.egtrans: 战争的结束并没有什么好庆祝的，恰恰相反，人们倒是应该为战争的爆发而感到痛惜。

example.eg: No, I'm not tired. Rather the opposite in fact.
example.egtrans: 不，不累。恰恰相反，我感觉精力还很充沛。

dsense.name: rather
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: instead of; used especially when you prefer one thing to another

example.eg: I think I'd like to stay at home this evening rather than go out.
example.egtrans: 我觉得我今晚更想呆在家里，而不是出去玩儿。

rather than.name: rather
rather than.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very; to a large degree

example.eg: Actually, I did rather well in my exams.
example.egtrans: 实际上我各科考试发挥得很好。

example.eg: I've got rather a lot of work to do at the moment.
example.egtrans: 现在我有很多工作要做。

rather than.name: rather
rather than.posTip: A word or phrase that you say loudly or suddenly to express strong feelings.

trans_examp.trans_en: certainly; yes

example.eg: "Do you want to come out for dinner with us this evening?" "Rather!"
example.egtrans: “你今天晚上想跟我们一块出去吃饭吗？”“当然！”

ratio.name: ratio
ratio.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the relationship between two groups or amounts that expresses how much bigger one is than the other

example.eg: The ratio of men to women at the conference was ten to one/10:1.
example.egtrans: 出席会议者的男女比例为10：1。

example.eg: The school is trying to improve its pupil-teacher ratio (= the number of teachers compared with the number of students).
example.egtrans: 该校正大力优化其师生间的人数比例结构。

rational.name: rational
rational.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: based on clear thought and reason

example.eg: There must be some rational explanation for what happened.
example.egtrans: 对发生的事一定有一个理性的解释。

example.eg: a rational act/course of action
example.egtrans: 理智的行为／行动方案

example.eg: a rational argument/decision
example.egtrans: 理智的辩论／决定

example.eg: He was too upset to be rational.
example.egtrans: 他心烦意乱得很，无法保持头脑清醒。

reach.name: reach
reach.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: reach
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrive at a place, especially after spending a long time or a lot of effort travelling
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指经过很长时间或费很大气力旅行后）到达，抵达

example.eg: We won't reach Miami until five or six o'clock.
example.egtrans: 我们得五六点钟才能到达迈阿密。

example.eg: They finally reached the coast after five weeks sailing.
example.egtrans: 他们经过5个星期的航行终于靠了岸。

example.eg: News of his accident had only just reached us.
example.egtrans: 我们刚刚得到他出事的消息。

phrase.phrase_title: reach a decision, agreement, conclusion, etc.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make a decision, agreement, etc. about something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 作出决定／达成协议／得出结论等

example.eg: She reached the conclusion that there was no more she could do.
example.egtrans: 她得出结论，她再也没有什么可做的了。

example.eg: We'll inform you when a decision has been reached.
example.egtrans: 作出决定后我们就通知你。

example.eg: The jury took four days to reach a verdict.
example.egtrans: 陪审团花了4天时间才作出裁决。

dsense.name: reach
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get to a particular level, especially a high one
trans_examp.trans_cn: 达到，发展到，提升到（尤指高的水平等）

example.eg: The temperature is expected to reach 30°C today.
example.egtrans: 今天的气温预计会达到30℃。

example.eg: He's just reached the grand old age of 95.
example.egtrans: 他刚到95岁高龄。

example.eg: I've reached the point where I'm not going to put up with her criticisms of me any more.
example.egtrans: 我已经受够了，我再也不能忍受她这样非难我了。

dsense.name: reach
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stretch out your arm in order to get or touch something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 伸出手臂（去拿或触摸），伸手及到

example.eg: She's grown so tall that she can reach the door handle now.
example.egtrans: 她个子长高了，能够着门把手。

example.eg: He reached for the phone and knocked over a glass.
example.egtrans: 他伸手去拿电话时，碰倒了一个杯子。

example.eg: The child reached down/out/over and picked up the kitten.
example.egtrans: 那个孩子弯腰伸手／伸出手／把手伸过去抱起那只小猫。

example.eg: He reached his hand out for the money.
example.egtrans: 他伸手去拿钱。

example.eg: Can you reach me (down) that book?
example.egtrans: 你能帮我把那本书拿下来吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: If an object reaches something, the top or bottom of it touches that thing.

example.eg: The ladder won't quite reach the top of the wall.
example.egtrans: 这架梯子够不着墙头。

example.eg: She was wearing a dress that reached (to) her ankles.
example.egtrans: 她身穿一件长及脚踝的连衣裙。

dsense.name: reach
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to communicate with someone in a different place, especially by phone or email
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指通过电话或信件）和…联系，与…取得联系

example.eg: I've been trying to reach you on the phone all day.
example.egtrans: 我一整天都在打电话试图和你联系。

trans_examp.trans_en: to understand and communicate with someone

example.eg: He's a strange child and his teachers find it difficult to reach him.
example.egtrans: 这个孩子很奇怪，老师们感到很难跟他沟通。

reach.name: reach
reach.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: reach
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: Your reach is the distance within which you can stretch out your arm and touch something.

example.eg: I like to keep a notebook and pencil within (arm's) reach.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢把笔记本和铅笔放在随手可及的地方。

example.eg: The top shelf is within/out of (his) reach.
example.egtrans: 架子最高层的隔板（他）够得着／够不着。

example.eg: Make sure that you keep all dangerous substances out of the reach of the children.
example.egtrans: 一定要把所有危险物品放在孩子拿不到的地方。

trans_examp.trans_en: the distance that can be travelled, especially easily

example.eg: We live within (easy) reach of the station.
example.egtrans: 我们家离车站很近。

trans_examp.trans_en: the length of your arm when you stretch it out

example.eg: You've got quite a long reach - can you get that box down from the top shelf for me?
example.egtrans: 你胳膊长——能替我从最高的架子上把那个盒子拿下来吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of stretching out your arm

example.eg: He made a sudden reach for his gun.
example.egtrans: 他突然伸手去拿枪。

dsense.name: reach
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the limit within which someone can achieve something

example.eg: An expensive trip like that would be completely beyond/out of (my) reach (= I would not have enough money to pay for it).
example.egtrans: 像那种花费大的旅行（我）完全承受不了。

example.eg: After years of saving, the car was at last within (her) reach (= she had enough money to pay for it).
example.egtrans: 存了好几年钱，（她）终于能买得起那辆汽车了。

dsense.name: reach
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a part of a river or part of an area of land

example.eg: The expedition set out for the upper reaches of the Amazon.
example.egtrans: 探险队动身向亚马孙河上游进发。

example.eg: There was little snow on the lower reaches of the ski run.
example.egtrans: 滑雪道下面的一段几乎没有雪。

example.eg: We know very little about the farthest/outermost reaches of the universe.
example.egtrans: 我们对宇宙最远处／最外围空间知之甚少。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the highest or lowest levels of an organization
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （一个组织中最高或最低的）层次，等级

example.eg: The news has shocked the upper reaches of the government.
example.egtrans: 这条消息震动了政府高层。

reaction.name: reaction
reaction.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: reaction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: behaviour, a feeling or an action that is a direct result of something else

example.eg: I love to watch people's reactions when I say who I am.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢观察人们在听到我说出我是谁时的反应。

example.eg: There has been an immediate/widespread/hostile reaction against the government's proposed tax increases.
example.egtrans: 人们对政府的增税计划迅速作出了反应／政府的增税计划引起了广泛的反应／政府的增税计划遭到了反对。

example.eg: Reactions to the proposal so far have been adverse/favourable/mixed.
example.egtrans: 到目前为止，人们对该计划一直持反对态度／表示支持／反应不一。

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of behaviour or opinion that is produced or held with the intention of being different from something else

example.eg: Her left-wing views are a reaction against the conservatism of her parents.
example.egtrans: 她的左翼观点是对父母保守主义政见的一种对抗。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: someone's ability to act quickly when something happens
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （对突发事件的）反应能力，反应灵敏度

example.eg: You need to have quick reactions to play these computer games.
example.egtrans: 玩这些电脑游戏要反应灵敏。

dsense.name: reaction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an unpleasant effect resulting from eating particular things or taking particular drugs
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对食物、药物等的）不良反应，过敏

example.eg: Some people have an allergic reaction to shellfish.
example.egtrans: 有些人吃贝类会有过敏反应。

dsense.name: reaction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when two or more substances react with and change each other

example.eg: a chemical reaction
example.egtrans: 化学反应

dsense.name: reaction
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the belief or principle that there should be no social or political change, and the attempt to stop such change from happening

example.eg: We must not allow reaction to stand in the way of progress.
example.egtrans: 我们一定不能让保守主义成为前进道路上的绊脚石。

readable.name: readable
readable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: easy and enjoyable to read
trans_examp.trans_cn: 易懂的；读起来有趣的；可读性强的

example.eg: It is an excellent and highly readable account of the army today.
example.egtrans: 它精彩地描述了现代军队的情况，可读性很强。

readable.name: -readable
readable.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a form that is able to be used by a computer
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 可机读的，可由计算机读取的

example.eg: Machine-readable passports will permit precise identity-checking.
example.egtrans: 计算机读取护照将使准确的身份验证成为可能。

reasonably.name: reasonably
reasonably.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: using good judgment
trans_examp.trans_cn: 理性地；有理智地；通情达理地

example.eg: Stop shouting and let's discuss this reasonably.
example.egtrans: 别吵吵嚷嚷了，我们来理智地讨论一下此事。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a satisfactory way

example.eg: She writes reasonably good children's books.
example.egtrans: 她写的儿童书相当不错。

example.eg: I did reasonably well at school but nowhere near as well as my sister or brother.
example.egtrans: 我的学习成绩还不错，但和我的弟弟妹妹没法比。

trans_examp.trans_en: at a price that is not too expensive

example.eg: You can eat out very reasonably these days.
example.egtrans: 现在你在外面吃饭是非常划算的。

example.eg: I bought a reasonably priced radio.
example.egtrans: 我买了一台价格很划算的收音机。

recall.name: recall
recall.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: recall
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to bring the memory of a past event into your mind, and often to give a description of what you remember

example.eg: The old man recalled the city as it had been before the war.
example.egtrans: 这位老人回忆起战前这座城市的样子。

example.eg: "As I recall," he said with some irritation, "you still owe me €150."
example.egtrans: “我记得，”他有些恼火地说：“你还欠我150英镑呢。”

example.eg: He recalled (that) he had sent the letter over a month ago.
example.egtrans: 他记得一个多月前就已经把信寄出了。

example.eg: Can you recall what happened last night?
example.egtrans: 你能记起昨晚发生什么了吗？

example.eg: She recalled seeing him outside the shop on the night of the robbery.
example.egtrans: 她记得在发生抢劫案的那天晚上在商店外面见过他。

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause you to think of a particular event, situation, or style
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使联想起；使想到；勾起（联想）

example.eg: His paintings recall the style of Picasso.
example.egtrans: 他的画作使人联想起毕加索的风格。

dsense.name: recall
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to order the return of a person who belongs to an organization or of products made by a company

example.eg: The ambassador was recalled when war broke out.
example.egtrans: 战争爆发后大使就被召回了。

example.eg: The company recalled thousands of jars of baby food after a salmonella scare.
example.egtrans: 由于沙门氏菌污染引起恐慌，该公司收回了几千罐婴儿食品。

recall.name: recall
recall.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: recall
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability to remember things

example.eg: Old people often have astonishing powers of recall.
example.egtrans: 老年人经常会表现出惊人的记忆力。

example.eg: My brother has total recall (= he can remember every detail of past events).
example.egtrans: 我弟弟对过去发生的事情记得清清楚楚。

dsense.name: recall
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when someone orders the return of a person who belongs to an organization, or orders the return of products made by a company

example.eg: an emergency recall of Parliament
example.egtrans: 紧急召回休会的议会议员开会

example.eg: The company issued a recall of all their latest antibiotics.
example.egtrans: 公司将他们最近生产的抗生素全部召回。

recap.name: recap
recap.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to repeat the main points of an explanation or description
trans_examp.trans_cn: 扼要重述；摘要说明；概括

example.eg: Finally, the teacher recapped the main points of the lesson.
example.egtrans: 最后老师又概括了一下这一课的重点。

example.eg: To recap, our main aim is to increase sales by 15 percent this year.
example.egtrans: 简要地说，我们的主要目标是把今年的销售额提高15%。

receipt.name: receipt
receipt.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: receipt
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper that proves that money, goods, or information have been received

example.eg: Make sure you are given a receipt for everything you buy.
example.egtrans: 买什么东西都一定记着要发票。

dsense.name: receipt
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act or state of receiving money or goods

example.eg: Goods will be delivered on receipt of payment (= after the money is received).
example.egtrans: 款到即发货。

example.eg: You have been in receipt of unemployment benefit for two months.
example.egtrans: 你领失业救济金已经两个月了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the amounts of money received during a particular period by a business

example.eg: The theatre's receipts for the winter were badly down.
example.egtrans: 该剧院冬季的收入大幅下降。

recipient.name: recipient
recipient.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who receives something

example.eg: Former Nobel Peace Prize recipients include Jimmy Carter and Barack Obama.
example.egtrans: 过去获得过诺贝尔和平奖的包括吉米·卡特和巴拉克·奥巴马。

example.eg: He was a recipient of the Civilian Service Award.
example.egtrans: 他被授予平民服务奖章。

recognize.name: recognize
recognize.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: recognize
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to know someone or something because you have seen or heard him or her or experienced it before

example.eg: I hadn't seen her for 20 years, but I recognized her immediately.
example.egtrans: 我20年没见她了，但我还是一眼就认出了她。

example.eg: Do you recognize this song?
example.egtrans: “你听出这首歌来了吗？”

example.eg: Doctors are trained to recognize the symptoms of different diseases.
example.egtrans: 医生受过训练可以辨识出不同疾病的症状。

dsense.name: recognize
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to accept that something is legal, true, or important

example.eg: The international community has refused to recognize (= officially accept the existence of) the newly independent nation state.
example.egtrans: 国际社会拒绝承认这个新独立的国家。

example.eg: He sadly recognized (that) he would die childless.
example.egtrans: 他接受了这个悲哀的事实：他将无儿无女、孤苦伶仃地度过残生。

example.eg: You must recognize the seriousness of the problems we are facing.
example.egtrans: 你必须认识到我们现在面临的问题有多严重。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a person's achievements are recognized, official approval is shown for them.

example.eg: The Queen recognized his services to his country by awarding him an MBE.
example.egtrans: 女王授予她大英帝国员佐勋章，以表彰她对国家的贡献。

recognized.name: recognized
recognized.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If someone or something is recognized, it is generally accepted that that person or thing has a particular position or quality.

example.eg: Professor Jones is a recognized authority on ancient Egypt.
example.egtrans: 琼斯教授是公认的古埃及研究的权威人士。

example.eg: Violence in schools is a recognized problem.
example.egtrans: 校园暴力是个公认的问题。

recommend.name: recommend
recommend.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to suggest that someone or something would be good or suitable for a particular job or purpose, or to suggest that a particular action should be done

example.eg: I can recommend the chicken in mushroom sauce - it's delicious.
example.egtrans: 我可以向您推荐蘑菇汁鸡肉——这道菜非常可口。

example.eg: She has been recommended for promotion.
example.egtrans: 已经有人推荐给她升职。

example.eg: The headmistress agreed to recommend the teachers' proposals to the school governors.
example.egtrans: 女校长同意把这位老师的建议提请学校董事们考虑。

example.eg: The doctor recommended (that) I get more exercise.
example.egtrans: 医生建议我多做运动。

example.eg: I recommend writing your feelings down on paper.
example.egtrans: 我建议你把自己的感受写下来。

example.eg: The city has much/little to recommend it (= it has many/few pleasant qualities).
example.egtrans: 这座城市可圈可点的地方很多／几乎没有。

reconciliation.name: reconciliation
reconciliation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which two people or groups of people become friendly again after they have argued

example.eg: It took hours of negotiations to bring about a reconciliation between the two sides.
example.egtrans: 双方谈了好几个小时才达成和解。

trans_examp.trans_en: the process of making two opposite beliefs, ideas, or situations agree

record.name: record
record.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: record
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to store sounds or moving pictures using electronic equipment so that they can be heard or seen later

example.eg: Cliff Richard has recorded more number one hit songs than any other British pop star.
example.egtrans: 在英国流行乐歌星中，克利夫．理查德录制的歌曲荣登排行榜榜首的数量最多。

example.eg: We recorded their wedding on video.
example.egtrans: 我们给他们的婚礼录了像。

example.eg: I tried to call her, but all I got was a recorded message saying that she was away for the weekend.
example.egtrans: 我每次给她打电话听到的都是电话答录机中说她外出度周末的录音。

example.eg: Was the concert live or was it recorded (= made before being broadcast)?
example.egtrans: 音乐会是直播还是录播的？

dsense.name: record
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep information for the future, by writing it down or storing it on a computer

example.eg: She records everything that happens to her in her diary.
example.egtrans: 她把发生在自己身上的一切事情都记在了日记里。

example.eg: Unemployment is likely to reach the highest total that has ever been recorded.
example.egtrans: 失业总人数很可能会创下有史以来的最高纪录。

example.eg: In his journal, Captain Scott recorded that he and his companions were weakened by lack of food.
example.egtrans: 在日志中，斯科特船长写道，因缺少食物他和同伴们身体虚弱不堪。

example.eg: The coroner recorded (= decided) a verdict of accidental death.
example.egtrans: 验尸官判定是意外死亡。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a device records a measurement, it shows that measurement.

example.eg: The thermometer recorded a temperature of 30 degrees Celsius.
example.egtrans: 温度计显示温度是30摄氏度。

record.name: record
record.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: record
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of information or a description of an event that is written on paper or stored on a computer

example.eg: The weather centre keeps a record of the weather.
example.egtrans: 气象中心对天气情况都备有记录。

example.eg: This summer has been the hottest on record (= the hottest summer known about).
example.egtrans: 今年夏天是有史以来最热的。

trans_examp.trans_en: information about someone or something that is stored by the police or by a doctor

example.eg: A person's medical records are confidential.
example.egtrans: 一个人的病历是保密的。

example.eg: He is well known to the police and has a long criminal record (= a list kept by the police of his previous crimes).
example.egtrans: 他是警察局的常客，有一大堆的犯罪前科。

trans_examp.trans_en: the facts that are known about a person or a company and the actions they have done in the past

example.eg: I won't fly with an airline that has a bad safety record (= whose aircraft have often had accidents).
example.egtrans: 我可不愿意搭乘安全纪录很差的航空公司的航班。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: something that you say before you tell someone something important that you want them to remember
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用于对听话人强调所说之话的重要性）为记录在案目的

example.eg: And, just for the record, we were never any more than good friends.
example.egtrans: 而且，我郑重声明，我们一直是好朋友，仅此而已。

dsense.name: record
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flat plastic disc on which music is recorded

example.eg: Would you like to listen to some records?
example.egtrans: 你想听些唱片吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: a song or music that has been recorded and is available for the public to buy

example.eg: The Beatles' first hit record was "Love Me Do".
example.egtrans: 甲壳虫乐队的第一首走红歌曲是《请爱我》。

dsense.name: record
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the best or fastest ever done

example.eg: He ran the 100 metres in 9.79 seconds and broke/smashed the world record.
example.egtrans: 他以9.79秒的成绩跑完了100米，打破了世界纪录。

example.eg: She set/established a new European record in the high jump.
example.egtrans: 她创造了欧洲跳高的新纪录。

record.name: record
record.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: at a higher level than ever achieved before

example.eg: The long hot summer has led to a record harvest this year.
example.egtrans: 这个夏天漫长而又炎热，使得今年成为一个创纪录的丰收年。

example.eg: Inflation has reached record levels.
example.egtrans: 通货膨胀已创历史最高。

example.eg: We finished the work in record time (= faster than had ever been done before).
example.egtrans: 我们以最短的时间完成了工作，这是以前从没有过的。

recursive.name: recursive
recursive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: involving doing or saying the same thing several times in order to produce a particular result or effect

reduce.name: reduce
reduce.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to become or to make something become smaller in size, amount, degree, importance, etc.

example.eg: Do nuclear weapons really reduce the risk of war?
example.egtrans: 核武器真的可以减小战争爆发的危险吗？

example.eg: The plane reduced speed as it approached the airport.
example.egtrans: 当飞临机场时，飞机减慢了速度。

example.eg: My weight reduces when I stop eating sugar.
example.egtrans: 我停止吃糖时体重就会下降。

example.eg: We bought a TV that was reduced from £500 to £350 in the sales.
example.egtrans: 我们在大减价时，买了一台从500英镑减至350英镑的电视。

example.eg: I reduced the problem to a few simple questions.
example.egtrans: 我把这个难题简化为几个简单的小问题。

trans_examp.trans_en: to heat a liquid until it becomes thicker and less in quantity; to become thicker and less in quantity in this way
trans_examp.trans_cn: （通过加热）使（液体）变稠；（液体因加热而）变稠

example.eg: Reduce the sauce by boiling for five minutes.
example.egtrans: 煮沸5分钟让调味汁变稠。

example.eg: Simmer until the liquid has reduced by about one third.
example.egtrans: 加微热直到液体减少三分之一。

redundant.name: redundant
redundant.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: redundant
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (especially of a word, phrase, etc.) unnecessary because it is more than is needed
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指词、短语等）多余的，不需要的，累赘的，啰唆的

example.eg: In the sentence "She is a single unmarried woman", the word "unmarried" is redundant.
example.egtrans: 在句子 She is a single unmarried woman 中，unmarried 一词是多余的。

dsense.name: redundant
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having lost your job because your employer no longer needs you
trans_examp.trans_cn: 失业的，被解雇的，被裁减的

example.eg: To keep the company alive, half the workforce is being made redundant.
example.egtrans: 为了使公司生存下去，一半的员工要被裁掉。

example.eg: New technology often makes old skills and even whole communities redundant.
example.egtrans: 新技术常常会使古老的技艺甚至是某个行业完全消失。

reference.name: reference
reference.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: reference
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a mention of something

example.eg: Knowing what had happened, I avoided making any reference to (= mentioning) weddings.
example.egtrans: 因为我知道发生了什么，所以就避开不谈婚礼的事儿。

example.eg: I am writing with/in reference to (= in connection with) your letter of 15 March.
example.egtrans: 现就3月15日贵函致复。

dsense.name: reference
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a writer or a book, article, etc. that is mentioned in a piece of writing, showing you where particular information was found
in a business letter, a number that tells you who to speak to or where to look for more information
trans_examp.trans_cn: （商务信函中为方便查询所用的）标识，编号，标记

example.eg: In all future letters on this subject, please use/quote our reference JW/155/C.
example.egtrans: 今后有关此事项的所有信件都请标明我方编号JW/155/C。

dsense.name: reference
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a letter that is written by someone who knows you, to describe you and say if you are suitable for a job, course, etc.

example.eg: My old headteacher said he would write/give me a glowing (= very good) reference.
example.egtrans: 我以前的中学校长说他会为我写一封很好的推荐信。

dsense.name: reference
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quick look at a book, piece of paper, etc. in order to find information and help

example.eg: He made the whole speech without reference to the notes in front of him.
example.egtrans: 他整场演讲完全没有参考自己面前的笔记。

refine.name: refine
refine.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something pure or improve something, especially by removing unwanted material
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指去除不需要的杂质而）精炼，提炼，提纯

example.eg: Crude oil is industrially refined to purify it and separate out the different elements, such as benzene.
example.egtrans: 原油经过工业提炼来提纯并且分离出诸如苯之类的不同元素。

trans_examp.trans_en: to improve an idea, method, system, etc. by making small changes

example.eg: Engineers spent many months refining the software.
example.egtrans: 工程师们花了数月来完善这个软件。

reflect.name: reflect
reflect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: reflect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a surface reflects light, heat, sound, or an image, it sends the light, etc. back and does not absorb it.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 反射（光、热、声等）；反映，映出（影像）

example.eg: He saw himself reflected in the water/mirror/shop window.
example.egtrans: 他在水中／镜子里／商店橱窗玻璃上看到了自己的影像。

example.eg: The light reflected off the surface of the water.
example.egtrans: 光在水面上产生反射。

dsense.name: reflect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show, express, or be a sign of something

example.eg: The statistics reflect a change in people's spending habits.
example.egtrans: 这些统计数据显示出人们的消费习惯发生了变化。

dsense.name: reflect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to think carefully, especially about possibilities and opinions
trans_examp.trans_cn: 深思，考虑，认真思考（尤指可能性或意见）

example.eg: The manager demanded time to reflect (on what to do).
example.egtrans: 经理要求给他一些时间好好想一想（怎么办）。

example.eg: She reflected that this was probably the last time she would see him.
example.egtrans: 她心想这很可能是她最后一次见他了。

regard.name: regard
regard.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to consider or have an opinion about something or someone

example.eg: Environmentalists regard GM technology with suspicion.
example.egtrans: 环境论者对转基因技术持怀疑态度。

example.eg: Her parents always regarded her as the smartest of their children.
example.egtrans: 她父母一贯把她看作是所有子女中最聪明的。

example.eg: He is generally/widely regarded as the father of international law.
example.egtrans: 他被普遍／广泛认为是国际法之父。

trans_examp.trans_en: to look carefully at something or someone

example.eg: The bird regarded me with suspicion as I walked up to its nest.
example.egtrans: 我走向鸟巢的时候，那只鸟怀疑地注视着我。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in connection with

example.eg: There is no problem as regards the financial arrangements.
example.egtrans: 资金筹备方面毫无问题。

regard.name: regard
regard.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: respect or admiration for someone or something

example.eg: The company holds her in high regard.
example.egtrans: 公司很器重她。

example.eg: He has no regard for other people's feelings.
example.egtrans: 他毫不尊重别人的感情。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in connection with

example.eg: I am writing to you with regard to your letter of 15 March.
example.egtrans: 兹复3月15日贵函。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in this particular way
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 在这／那方面；在这／那一点上

example.eg: The union is the largest in the country and in this/that regard is best placed to serve its members.
example.egtrans: 这家工会是全国最大的，从这方面说，可为其成员提供最好的服务。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: greetings

example.eg: Please give/send/convey my regards to your mother if you see her.
example.egtrans: 如果见到你母亲，请代我问候她／代我向她问好／向她转达我的问候。

regarding.name: regarding
regarding.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: about

example.eg: The company is being questioned regarding its employment policy.
example.egtrans: 该公司的用人政策正受到质疑。

regardless.name: regardless
regardless.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: despite; not being affected by something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不管怎样，无论如何；不管，不顾

example.eg: The plan for a new office building went ahead regardless of local opposition.
example.egtrans: 尽管遭到当地居民的反对，新建高层写字楼的计划还是付诸实施了。

example.eg: She knew it was dangerous to visit him except at night, but she set out regardless (of the risk).
example.egtrans: 虽然她知道除了晚上别的时候去看他都很危险，可她还是（不顾危险）动身去了。

example.eg: This job is open to all, regardless of previous experience.
example.egtrans: 这份工作任何人都可以应聘，不管其以前的工作经历如何。

region.name: region
region.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular area or part of the world, or any of the large official areas into which a country is divided
trans_examp.trans_cn: 区域，地区；（国家的）行政区

example.eg: one of China's autonomous regions
example.egtrans: 中国的自治区之一

example.eg: the Nordic/Asia-Pacific region
example.egtrans: 北欧／亚太地区

example.eg: the Basque region
example.egtrans: 巴斯克地区

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of a country, especially one that has a particular characteristic or is known for something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （一个国家内）有…特色，以…知名的地区

example.eg: a wine/farming region
example.egtrans: 葡萄酒产区／农业区

example.eg: mountainous/coastal regions
example.egtrans: 山区／沿海地区

example.eg: There's a shortage of cheap housing in the region.
example.egtrans: 这一地区缺少廉价住房。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular part of someone's body

example.eg: He said he had sharp pains in the stomach region/the region of the stomach.
example.egtrans: 他说他的胃部剧痛。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: approximately

example.eg: They estimate that the temperature yesterday was (somewhere) in the region of -30°C.
example.egtrans: 他们估计昨天的气温在零下30摄氏度左右。

example.eg: It will cost something in the region of $1 million.
example.egtrans: 花费估计为100万美元左右。

registry.name: registry
registry.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a place where official records are kept

example.eg: a land/business/electoral registry
example.egtrans: 土地注册处／工商企业注册处／选举登记处

relate.name: relate
relate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: relate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to find or show the connection between two or more things

example.eg: We need to explain why these issues are important and relate them to everyday life.
example.egtrans: 我们需要解释为什么这些问题很重要并且和他们的日常生活相关。

example.eg: Archaeologists hope to relate the discovery with the arrival of Vikings in the area in the tenth century.
example.egtrans: 考古学家希望把这些发现与公元十世纪维京人的到来联系起来。

example.eg: equations that relate variables of pressure, volume, and temperature
example.egtrans: 将压力、体积与温度相连的方程式

dsense.name: relate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to tell a story or describe a series of events

example.eg: She related the events of the previous week to the police.
example.egtrans: 她对警方讲述了上个星期发生的事情。

example.eg: She related that she had been approached by an employee asking for time off.
example.egtrans: 她提到有雇员找到她要求休假。

example.eg: He relates how at the age of 23 he was interned in a prison camp.
example.egtrans: 他讲述了他在23岁时被关押在战俘营中的经历。

dsense.name: relate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be able to understand a situation or someone's feelings because you have experienced something similar yourself

example.eg: I often wake very early - I'm sure most readers over 50 can relate.
example.egtrans: 我经常很早就醒了，我相信许多50岁以上的读者会有共鸣。

relative.name: relative
relative.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a member of your family

example.eg: I don't have many blood relatives (= people related to me by birth rather than by marriage).
example.egtrans: 我没有几个有血缘关系的亲戚。

example.eg: All her close/distant relatives came to the wedding.
example.egtrans: 她所有的近亲／远亲都来参加她的婚礼了。

relative.name: relative
relative.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: relative
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: being judged or measured in comparison with something else

example.eg: We weighed up the relative advantages of driving there or going by train.
example.egtrans: 我们权衡了一下，看看开车去那儿和乘火车去哪种方式更有利。

trans_examp.trans_en: true to a particular degree when compared with other things

example.eg: Since I got a job, I've been living in relative comfort (= more comfort than before).
example.egtrans: 自从我有了工作，日子过得就相对舒适一些了。

dsense.name: relative
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is relative to something else, it changes according to the speed or level of the other thing.

example.eg: The amount of petrol a car uses is relative to its speed.
example.egtrans: 汽车耗油量和其行驶速度是成比例的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is relative to a particular subject, it is connected with it.

example.eg: Are these documents relative to the discussion?
example.egtrans: 这些文件和我们讨论的问题有关吗？

relatively.name: relatively
relatively.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: quite good, bad, etc. in comparison with other similar things or with what you expect

example.eg: He's a relatively good squash player.
example.egtrans: 他是个比较不错的壁球运动员。

example.eg: There was relatively little violence.
example.egtrans: 暴力事件相对较少。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: said when you are judging one thing in comparison with other things

example.eg: Relatively speaking, it's a fairly poor country.
example.egtrans: 相对而言，这是个很贫穷的国家。

relevant.name: relevant
relevant.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: connected with what is happening or being discussed
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有关的；相关联的；切题的

example.eg: Education should be relevant to the child's needs.
example.egtrans: 教育应和孩子的需要挂钩。

example.eg: For further information, please refer to the relevant leaflet.
example.egtrans: 欲知详情，请参阅有关单页广告。

example.eg: The point is highly relevant to this discussion.
example.egtrans: 这一点和这次讨论的议题密切相关。

example.eg: I'm sorry but your personal wishes are not relevant (= important) in this case.
example.egtrans: 我很遗憾，你的个人愿望与本案无关。

trans_examp.trans_en: correct or suitable for a particular purpose

example.eg: plans to make schooling more relevant to life beyond school
example.egtrans: 使学校教育更有利于学生毕业后走向社会的计划

remain.name: remain
remain.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay in the same place or in the same condition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 停留，留下；保持不变，仍然是

example.eg: The doctor ordered him to remain in bed for a few days.
example.egtrans: 医生嘱咐他要继续卧床几天。

example.eg: Most commentators expect the basic rate of tax to remain at 25 percent.
example.egtrans: 大多数评论员预计基本税率会保持在25%。

example.eg: A great many things remain to be done (= have not yet been done).
example.egtrans: 还有很多事情要去做。

example.eg: He remained silent.
example.egtrans: 他保持沉默。

example.eg: It remains a secret.
example.egtrans: 这仍然是个秘密。

example.eg: The bank will remain open while renovations are carried out.
example.egtrans: 这家银行在修缮期间将依旧开门营业。

trans_examp.trans_en: to continue to exist when other parts or other things no longer exist

example.eg: After the flood, nothing remained of the village.
example.egtrans: 洪水过后，村庄荡然无存。

example.eg: Only a few hundred of these animals remain today.
example.egtrans: 现在这种动物只存留下来数百只。

remainder.name: remainder
remainder.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: remainder
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the part of something that is left after the other parts have gone, been used, or been taken away

example.eg: I ate most of it and gave the remainder to the dog.
example.egtrans: 我吃了一大半，剩下的喂狗了。

example.eg: It rained the first day but the remainder of the trip was fine.
example.egtrans: 旅行中第一天下了雨，不过其余的日子天气都很好。

dsense.name: remainder
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in mathematics, the amount that is left when one number cannot be exactly divided by another

example.eg: 9 divided by 4 is 2, remainder 1.
example.egtrans: 9除以4商2余1。

remainder.name: remainder
remainder.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to sell a book cheaply because it has not sold well and no more copies of it will be produced
trans_examp.trans_cn: 削价出售（滞销或剩余的图书）

example.eg: His autobiography never sold very well and was soon remaindered.
example.egtrans: 他的自传一直卖得不太好，过了不久就被削价处理了。

remaining.name: remaining
remaining.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: continuing to exist or be left after other parts or things have been used or taken away

example.eg: Bernstein's remaining lecture will take place on 22 January.
example.egtrans: 伯恩斯坦其余的两个讲座将安排在1月22日举行。

example.eg: Mix in half the butter and keep the remaining half for later.
example.egtrans: 将一半黄油掺入，剩下的一半留作以后使用。

render.name: render
render.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: render
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause someone or something to be in a particular state
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使成为；使变得；使处于某种状态

example.eg: His rudeness rendered me speechless.
example.egtrans: 他的粗暴无礼让我无言以对。

example.eg: New technology has rendered my old computer obsolete.
example.egtrans: 新技术发展太快，我的旧电脑已经过时了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to change words into a different language or form

example.eg: She is rendering the book into English from French.
example.egtrans: 她正在把这本书从法语译成英语。

dsense.name: render
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something such as a service, a personal opinion or expression, or a performance of a song or poem, etc. to people

example.eg: The singers rendered the song with enthusiasm.
example.egtrans: 歌手们热情洋溢地演唱了这首歌。

example.eg: We see that freight railroads make good profits while rendering excellent service.
example.egtrans: 我们看到铁路货运公司在提供优质服务的同时也赢得了丰厚的利润。

dsense.name: render
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a first layer of plaster or cement on a wall
trans_examp.trans_cn: 粉刷；给（墙壁）抹灰（或水泥）

repetition.name: repetition
repetition.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of doing or saying something again

example.eg: His books are full of repetition.
example.egtrans: 他的那些书都是在翻来覆去写同样的东西。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that happens in the same way as something that happened before

example.eg: We want to prevent a repetition of last summer's fires, which destroyed more than 500,000 acres of land.
example.egtrans: 去年夏天的火灾毁了超过50万英亩地，我们要防止此类火灾再次发生。

repetitive.name: repetitive
repetitive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: involving doing or saying the same thing several times, especially in a way that is boring
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指以乏味的方式）重复的，反复的

example.eg: a repetitive job/task
example.egtrans: 重复单调的工作／任务

represent.name: represent
represent.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: represent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to speak, act, or be present officially for another person or people
trans_examp.trans_cn: 作为…的代表（或代理人）；作为…的代言人

example.eg: They chose a famous barrister to represent them in court.
example.egtrans: 他们选了一位著名律师为他们出庭辩护。

example.eg: Union officials representing the teachers met the government today.
example.egtrans: 代表教师的工会干事今天与政府官员会谈。

example.eg: I sent my husband to represent me at the funeral.
example.egtrans: 我让我丈夫代表我参加葬礼。

example.eg: Women were well/poorly represented at the conference (= there were many/few present).
example.egtrans: 出席会议的女性很多／少。

trans_examp.trans_en: to be the Member of Parliament, or of Congress, etc. for a particular area
trans_examp.trans_cn: （在议会或国会中等）代表某一地区

example.eg: Ed Smythe represents Barnet.
example.egtrans: 艾德·斯迈思是巴尼特的代表。

trans_examp.trans_en: to be the person from a country, school, etc. that is in a competition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 代表（国家，学校等参加比赛）

example.eg: She was chosen to represent France at the Olympics.
example.egtrans: 她获选代表法国参加奥运会。

trans_examp.trans_en: to express or complain about something, to a person in authority

example.eg: We represented our grievances/demands to the boss.
example.egtrans: 我们向老板表达了我们的不满／要求。

dsense.name: represent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to show or describe something or someone

example.eg: The statue represents St. George killing the dragon.
example.egtrans: 这座雕像展现的是圣乔治斩龙的故事。

example.eg: This new report represents the current situation in our schools.
example.egtrans: 这份新的报告介绍了我们这儿的学校现状。

example.eg: He represents himself as an expert, but he knows nothing.
example.egtrans: 他自称是个专家，可是他一窍不通。

trans_examp.trans_en: to be a sign or symbol of something

example.eg: To many people the White House represents the identity of the United States.
example.egtrans: 在许多人看来，白宫是美国的象征。

dsense.name: represent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be the result of something, or to be something

example.eg: This book represents ten years of thought and research.
example.egtrans: 这本书是10年思考和研究的结晶。

example.eg: The new offer represented an increase of 10 percent on the previous one.
example.egtrans: 新的报价比上一次报价高出10%。

representation.name: representation
representation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: representation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person or organization that speaks, acts, or is present officially for someone else
trans_examp.trans_cn: 作为…的代表（或代理人）；作为…的代言人

example.eg: Can he afford legal representation?
example.egtrans: 他请得起律师吗？

dsense.name: representation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way that someone or something is shown or described

example.eg: He gave a talk on the representation of women in 19th-century art.
example.egtrans: 他作了一个演讲，是关于19世纪艺术中女性形象塑造的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a sign, picture, model, etc. of something

example.eg: This statue is a representation of Hercules.
example.egtrans: 这是一座大力神的雕像。

requirement.name: requirement
requirement.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you must do, or something you need

example.eg: A good degree is a minimum requirement for many jobs.
example.egtrans: 很多工作的最低要求是要有一个好的学位。

example.eg: It is a legal requirement that you have insurance for your car.
example.egtrans: 为你的车辆上保险是法律要求的。

example.eg: Students who fail to meet the requirements (of the course) will fail.
example.egtrans: 达不到（本门课程）要求的学生将不能及格。

resemble.name: resemble
resemble.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to look like or be like someone or something

example.eg: You resemble your mother very closely.
example.egtrans: 你长得很像你妈妈。

example.eg: After the earthquake, the city resembled a battlefield.
example.egtrans: 地震过后，这座城市看上去就像战场一般。

reserved.name: reserved
reserved.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: reserved
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Reserved people do not often talk about or show their feelings or thoughts.

example.eg: a quiet, reserved woman
example.egtrans: 一位安静、矜持的女子

example.eg: The English have a reputation for being reserved.
example.egtrans: 英国人以矜持闻名。

dsense.name: reserved
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Reserved tickets, seats, etc. are ones that you have arranged to be kept for you
trans_examp.trans_cn: 保留的，预订的（门票、座位等）

example.eg: May I sit here, or is this seat/table reserved?
example.egtrans: 我可以坐这儿吗？还是这个座位／餐桌已经被预订了？

Resolution.name: resolution
Resolution.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: resolution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official decision that is made after a group or organization has voted

example.eg: to approve/adopt a resolution
example.egtrans: 批准／通过决议

example.eg: The United Nations passed (= voted to support) a resolution to increase aid to developing nations.
example.egtrans: 联合国通过了一项向发展中国家增加援助的决议。

trans_examp.trans_en: a promise to yourself to do or to not do something

example.eg: I made a resolution to give up chocolate.
example.egtrans: 我下决心不再吃巧克力了。

dsense.name: resolution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: determination

example.eg: He showed great resolution in facing the robbers.
example.egtrans: 面对强盗，他表现得英勇无畏。

dsense.name: resolution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of solving or ending a problem or difficulty

example.eg: a successful resolution to the crisis
example.egtrans: 危机的成功解决

dsense.name: resolution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability of a microscope, or a television or computer screen, to show things clearly and with a lot of detail
trans_examp.trans_cn: （显微镜、电视、计算机显示屏等的）清晰度，分辨率

example.eg: a high/low resolution image
example.egtrans: 高／低清晰度图像

dsense.name: resolution
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of separating or being separated into clearly different parts

example.eg: the resolution of oil into bitumen and tar
example.egtrans: 石油分解成沥青和焦油

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: resolve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to solve or end a problem or difficulty

example.eg: Have you resolved the problem of transport yet?
example.egtrans: 你们解决交通问题了吗？

example.eg: The couple resolved their differences and made an effort to get along.
example.egtrans: 这对夫妻消除了他们之间的分歧，尽力融洽相处。

dsense.name: resolve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a decision formally or with determination

example.eg: She resolved that she would never speak to him again.
example.egtrans: 她决心再也不理他。

example.eg: After hours of argument, they resolved against taking legal action.
example.egtrans: 经过几个小时的争论，他们决定不提起诉讼。

example.eg: The company resolved to take no further action against the thieves.
example.egtrans: 公司决定不再继续追究这些窃贼。

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: strong determination

example.eg: to weaken/strengthen/test someone's resolve
example.egtrans: 削弱／增强／考验某人的决心

respect.name: respect
respect.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: respect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: admiration felt or shown for someone or something that you believe has good ideas or qualities
