example.eg: I have great/the greatest respect for his ideas, although I don't agree with them.
example.egtrans: 我非常尊重他的想法，不过我并不赞同这些想法。

example.eg: She is a formidable figure who commands a great deal of respect (= who is greatly admired by others).
example.egtrans: 她是个令人敬畏的人，赢得了大家的无限敬重。

example.eg: New teachers have to earn/gain the respect of their students.
example.egtrans: 新教师必须要赢得学生的尊重。

dsense.name: respect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: politeness, honour, and care shown towards someone or something that is considered important

example.eg: You really should treat your parents with more respect.
example.egtrans: 你待你父母真应该多几分尊重。

example.eg: She has no respect for other people's property (= she does not treat it carefully).
example.egtrans: 她对别人的财物一点都不爱惜。

trans_examp.trans_en: a feeling that something is right or important and you should not attempt to change it or harm it

example.eg: In their senseless killing of innocent people, the terrorists have shown their lack of respect for human life.
example.egtrans: 恐怖分子无谓滥杀无辜，暴露出他们草菅人命的本质。

example.eg: She grumbled that young people today have/show no respect for the law.
example.egtrans: 她抱怨说现在的年轻人漠视法律。

trans_examp.trans_en: the feeling you show when you accept that different customs or cultures are different from your own and behave towards them in a way that would not cause offence
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对不同风俗和文化的）尊重，开明

example.eg: She teaches the students to have respect for different races and appreciate the diversity of other cultures.
example.egtrans: 她教育学生要尊重不同种族的人，要认识到其他文化的多样性。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: polite formal greetings

example.eg: Please convey/give my respects to your parents.
example.egtrans: 请代我向你父母致以敬意／转达问候。

dsense.name: respect
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular feature or detail

example.eg: This proposal differs from the last one in many important respects/one important respect.
example.egtrans: 本提案在很多重要的方面／在一个重要的方面与上一提案不同。

example.eg: In most respects, the new film is better than the original.
example.egtrans: 在大多数方面，这部新翻拍的电影要比老版本好。

respect.name: respect
respect.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: respect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to feel or show admiration for someone or something that you believe has good ideas or qualities

example.eg: I deeply respect David for what he has achieved.
example.egtrans: 戴维的成就令我非常敬佩。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be proud of your own qualities or achievements

dsense.name: respect
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to treat something or someone with kindness and care

example.eg: to respect someone's feelings
example.egtrans: 尊重别人的感情

example.eg: We should respect the environment and not pollute it.
example.egtrans: 我们应当善待环境，避免污染。

trans_examp.trans_en: to accept the importance of someone's rights or customs and to do nothing that would harm them or cause offence
trans_examp.trans_cn: （对别人的权利或风俗）尊重，重视，礼待

example.eg: The agreement will respect the rights of both nations.
example.egtrans: 这项协议将会尊重两国各自的权利。

example.eg: I would appreciate it if you would respect my privacy.
example.egtrans: 如果您能尊重我的隐私我会非常感谢。

trans_examp.trans_en: to accept that something is right or important and not to attempt to change it or harm it

example.eg: The president pledged to respect the existing frontiers between the two countries.
example.egtrans: 总统承诺维持两国间疆界现状。

trans_examp.trans_en: to think that it is important to obey a law or rule

example.eg: I was always taught to respect the law.
example.egtrans: 我一直被教导要遵纪守法。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do what someone has asked to have done
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 尊重（某人）的意愿；按（某人）的要求去做

example.eg: His children respected his last wishes and held a simple funeral for him.
example.egtrans: 他的子女尊重他的遗愿，为他举行了简单的葬礼。

respective.name: respective
respective.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating or belonging to each of the separate people or things you have just mentioned

example.eg: Everyone would go into the hall for assembly and then afterwards we'd go to our respective classes.
example.egtrans: 所有人都去礼堂参加集会，会后各自回各自的班级。

example.eg: Clinton and Zedillo ordered their respective Cabinets to devise a common counter-drug strategy.
example.egtrans: 克林顿和塞迪略命令他们各自的内阁制订两国共同的反毒品战略。

rest.name: rest
rest.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: rest
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause someone or something to) stop doing a particular activity or stop being active for a period of time in order to relax and get back your strength

example.eg: The doctor told him that he should rest for a few days.
example.egtrans: 医生告诉他应该休息几天。

example.eg: He looked away from the computer screen to rest his eyes.
example.egtrans: 他把视线从电脑显示屏上移开，让眼睛休息一下。

example.eg: She promised that she would not rest (= would not stop looking) until the murderer of her son was caught and imprisoned.
example.egtrans: 她发誓杀害她儿子的凶手不被捕入狱，她就不会善罢甘休。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be an actor who does not have any work
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （演员）没有接到戏而呆在家里

example.eg: Over 90 percent of professional actors are resting at any given time.
example.egtrans: 任何时候都有超过90%的职业演员无戏可演。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: said by lawyers in a law court when they have finished the explanation of their case

dsense.name: rest
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to lie or lean on something, or to put something on something else so that its weight is supported

example.eg: She rested her head on my shoulder.
example.egtrans: 她把头靠在我的肩膀上。

example.eg: The bicycle was resting against the wall.
example.egtrans: 自行车靠墙放着。

dsense.name: rest
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remain in a particular state or place

example.eg: We cannot allow the matter to rest here (= to remain as it is)- further action has to be taken.
example.egtrans: 我们不能允许这件事保持现状，一定要继续采取行动。

rest.name: rest
rest.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: rest
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the other things, people, or parts that remain or that have not been mentioned
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 剩余部分；其余；其余的人

example.eg: I've got two bright students, but the rest are average.
example.egtrans: 我班上有两个特别聪明的学生，但是其他人都表现平平。

example.eg: I'll keep a third of the money and the rest is for you.
example.egtrans: 钱我留下1／3，其余的归你。

example.eg: Do you have anything planned for the rest of the day?
example.egtrans: 这天剩余的时间你安排什么事了吗？

dsense.name: rest
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of time in which you relax, do not do anything active, or sleep

example.eg: After they had carried the piano up the stairs, they stopped for a rest.
example.egtrans: 他们把钢琴搬到楼上后，停下来休息了一会儿。

example.eg: The doctor prescribed some pills and told her to get/have a week's rest.
example.egtrans: 医生开了些药，并嘱咐她休息一周。

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of silence between musical notes, or a symbol that represents this

example.eg: a minim rest
example.egtrans: 二分休止符

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: not doing anything active, or not moving

example.eg: Her heartbeat is only 55 at rest.
example.egtrans: 她在安静状态下心跳每分钟只有55次。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used as a polite way to say that someone is dead

example.eg: Your father was a very troubled man, but he's at rest now.
example.egtrans: 你父亲一生坎坷，但是他现在可以安息了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to stop, usually in a particular place
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （通常在某个地方）停止，停下来，静止下来

example.eg: The car hit the kerb, rolled over and came to rest in a ditch.
example.egtrans: 汽车撞到马路边石上，翻滚到路沟里停了下来。

dsense.name: rest
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an object that supports the weight of something

example.eg: I used a pile of books as a rest for my telescope.
example.egtrans: 我用一摞书作望远镜支架。

restrict.name: restrict
restrict.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to limit the movements or actions of someone, or to limit something and reduce its size or prevent it from increasing

example.eg: measures to restrict the sale of alcohol
example.egtrans: 限制酒类销售的措施

example.eg: The government has restricted freedom of movement into and out of the country.
example.egtrans: 政府已经限制出入境自由了。

example.eg: Having small children really restricts your social life.
example.egtrans: 家里有很小的孩子确实会妨碍你的社交生活。

restriction.name: restriction
restriction.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an official limit on something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 受（尤指官方）限制的，受约束的

example.eg: import/export/currency restrictions
example.egtrans: 进口／出口／货币限制

example.eg: speed/parking restrictions
example.egtrans: 速度／停车限制

example.eg: At the turn of the century, Congress imposed/placed a height restriction of 13 storeys on all buildings in Washington.
example.egtrans: 在世纪之交，国会对华盛顿的建筑实行了不得超过13层的高度限制。

example.eg: The president urged other countries to lift the trade restrictions.
example.egtrans: 总统敦促其他国家取消贸易限制。

resulting.name: resulting
resulting.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: caused by the event or situation that you have just mentioned
trans_examp.trans_cn: 因而发生的；作为结果的

example.eg: The tape was left near a magnetic source, and the resulting damage was considerable.
example.egtrans: 磁带放在了靠近磁源的地方，因此导致了严重损坏。

retain.name: retain
retain.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep or continue to have something

example.eg: She has lost her battle to retain control of the company.
example.egtrans: 她被打败了，失去了继续掌管公司的权力。

example.eg: He managed to retain his dignity throughout the performance.
example.egtrans: 在整个表演过程中，他设法保持了自己的尊严。

example.eg: She succeeded in retaining her lead in the second half of the race.
example.egtrans: 在比赛的后半程中，她成功地保住了领先地位。

example.eg: I have a good memory and am able to retain (= remember) facts easily.
example.egtrans: 我记忆力很好，记东西不费劲。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a substance retains something, such as heat or water, it continues to hold or contain it.

example.eg: The sea retains the sun's warmth longer than the land.
example.egtrans: 海水储存太阳的热量的时间比陆地要长。

trans_examp.trans_en: to get the services of a lawyer by paying them before you need them

retrieve.name: retrieve
retrieve.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to find and bring back something

example.eg: We taught our dog to retrieve a ball.
example.egtrans: 我们教狗捡球。

example.eg: Computers are used to store and retrieve information efficiently.
example.egtrans: 计算机用于快速高效地存储和检索信息。

reusable.name: reusable
reusable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to be used more than once

example.eg: reusable nappies/packaging
example.egtrans: 可重复使用的尿布/包装

example.eg: I always carry a reusable shopping bag.
example.egtrans: 我总是带着一个可重复使用的购物袋。

reuse.name: reuse
reuse.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use something again

example.eg: To conserve resources, please reuse this carrier bag.
example.egtrans: 为了节省资源，请重复利用本手提袋。

reveal.name: reveal
reveal.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret

example.eg: He was jailed for revealing secrets to the Russians.
example.egtrans: 他因为向俄国人泄密而被监禁。

example.eg: Her biography revealed that she was not as rich as everyone thought.
example.egtrans: 她的自传透露她并非像大家所想象的那样富有。

example.eg: He would not reveal where he had hidden her chocolate eggs.
example.egtrans: 他就是不说他把她的巧克力蛋藏在哪里了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to allow something to be seen that, until then, had been hidden

example.eg: A gap in the clouds revealed the Atlantic far below.
example.egtrans: 从云缝中可以看到远在下方的大西洋。

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion at the end of a television programme, etc. when something that has been hidden or kept secret until then is shown to the audience

example.eg: The final reveal of the new kitchen was a huge success.
example.egtrans: 最后大揭示的新厨房非常成功。

reverse.name: reverse
reverse.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: reverse
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change the direction, order, position, result, etc. of something to its opposite
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）反向；（使）倒转；彻底改变；推翻

example.eg: The new manager hoped to reverse the decline in the company's fortunes.
example.egtrans: 新经理希望能够扭转公司江河日下的状况。

example.eg: Now that you have a job and I don't, our situations are reversed.
example.egtrans: 你找到了工作，我倒没有工作了，我们的情况正好掉了个儿。

example.eg: The Court of Appeal reversed the earlier judgment.
example.egtrans: 上诉法院推翻了先前的判决。

dsense.name: reverse
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to drive a vehicle backwards

example.eg: He reversed into a lamppost and damaged the back of the car.
example.egtrans: 他倒车时撞到了路灯柱，造成车尾受损。

example.eg: She reversed the car into the parking space.
example.egtrans: 她把车倒进停车位。

dsense.name: reverse
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to make a phone call that is paid for by the person receiving it
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 打对方付费电话；使受话方付款

reverse.name: reverse
reverse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the method of controlling a vehicle that makes it go backwards

example.eg: To go backwards, you must put the car in/into reverse (gear).
example.egtrans: 要想倒车，你得挂倒车挡。

trans_examp.trans_en: a defeat or failure

example.eg: They suffered a serious military/political reverse.
example.egtrans: 他们遭受了一次重大的军事／政治失败。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the opposite of what has been suggested
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 相反的情况（或事物）；对立面

example.eg: You might think that people who don't worry about their diet are fatter and more unhealthy; in fact, the reverse is true.
example.egtrans: 你也许会认为不担心自己饮食的人会更胖更不健康，实际情况却刚好相反。

example.eg: Whatever official news broadcasts claimed, he believed the reverse.
example.egtrans: 不管官方新闻报什么，他都只相信相反的消息。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the back of a coin, medal, etc.

example.eg: The coin has a royal coat of arms on the reverse.
example.egtrans: 硬币的背面有王室盾徽的图案。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in the opposite order or way

example.eg: To stop the engine, you repeat the same procedures, but in reverse (order).
example.egtrans: 要想关掉发动机，你得按相反顺序重复同样的步骤。

revert.name: revert
revert.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to reply

example.eg: Please revert by email.
example.egtrans: 请通过电子邮件回复。

revise.name: revise
revise.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: revise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to look at or consider again an idea, piece of writing, etc. in order to correct or improve it

example.eg: His helpfulness today has made me revise my original opinion/impression of him.
example.egtrans: 他今天所表现出的乐于助人的品质使我改变了对他的最初看法／印象。

example.eg: His publishers made him revise his manuscript three times.
example.egtrans: 出版公司让他把手稿修改了3次。

dsense.name: revise
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an exam

example.eg: We're revising (algebra) for the test tomorrow.
example.egtrans: 我们正在为明天的（代数）考试进行复习。

revision.name: revision
revision.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: revision
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a change that is made to something, or the process of doing this

example.eg: These proposals will need a lot of revision.
example.egtrans: 这些提案需要进行大刀阔斧的修改。

example.eg: He was forced to make several revisions to his speech.
example.egtrans: 他被迫对发言稿作了几处修改。

dsense.name: revision
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: study of work you have done, in order to prepare for an exam

example.eg: She did no revision, but she still got a very high mark.
example.egtrans: 她没有复习，但是仍然考了很高的分数。

revoke.name: revoke
revoke.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say officially that an agreement, permission, a law, etc. is no longer in effect

example.eg: The authorities have revoked their original decision to allow development of this rural area.
example.egtrans: 当局原来决定允许开发这一乡村地区，但现在他们已经收回成命。

right-hand.name: right-hand
right-hand.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: on or to the right

example.eg: In North America, vehicles drive on the right-hand side of the road.
example.egtrans: 在北美洲，车辆靠右侧行驶。

risk.name: risk
risk.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the possibility of something bad happening

example.eg: In this business, the risks and the rewards are high.
example.egtrans: 这个行业的风险和回报都很高。

example.eg: There's a high risk of another accident happening in this fog.
example.egtrans: 这样大的雾，很有可能再次出事故。

example.eg: The risk (that) we might fail made us work twice as hard.
example.egtrans: 我们可能会失败，这种忧患意识使得我们加倍努力工作。

example.eg: It's always a risk starting up a new business.
example.egtrans: 创立一家新公司总是有风险的。

example.eg: The company is quite a good risk (= safe to lend money to).
example.egtrans: 贷款给这家公司风险很小。

example.eg: We want clean rivers and lakes, where you can swim without risk to your health.
example.egtrans: 我们需要干净清洁的河流湖泊，使我们游泳时不会危及健康。

example.eg: It's a low/high-risk strategy (= one that is safe/not safe).
example.egtrans: 这种策略风险很低／高。

trans_examp.trans_en: something bad that might happen

example.eg: This wire is a safety/fire risk.
example.egtrans: 这根电线是个安全／火灾隐患。

example.eg: His employers thought he was a security risk (= he might tell their secrets to a competitor).
example.egtrans: 雇主认为他是个会泄露商业机密的危险分子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a dangerous situation

example.eg: All houses within 100 metres of the seas are at risk of flooding.
example.egtrans: 所有离海岸不足100米的房子都有被洪水袭击的危险。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to mean that you are responsible for any damage, loss, or difficulty

example.eg: Drivers are reminded that they leave their cars here at their own risk.
example.egtrans: 车主受到提示说在此停车风险自负。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to do something that might be dangerous

example.eg: Don't take any risks - just call the police.
example.egtrans: 不要冒险行事——给警察打电话吧。

example.eg: You're running a big risk if oil prices drop sharply.
example.egtrans: 如果油价下跌，你就会冒上很大的风险。

risk.name: risk
risk.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to do something although there is a chance of a bad result

example.eg: "It's dangerous to cross here." "I'll just have to risk it."
example.egtrans: “从这儿穿行很危险。”“我不得不冒这个险。”

example.eg: He risked losing his house when his company went bankrupt.
example.egtrans: 他的公司破产时，他差点连自己家的房子都保不住了。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you risk something important, you cause it to be in a dangerous situation where you might lose it.

example.eg: I'm not risking my life (informal neck) in that old car.
example.egtrans: 我不会拿我的性命冒险去坐那辆旧车。

example.eg: He risked life and limb to get the cat down from the tree.
example.egtrans: 他冒着生命危险爬到树上去把猫救下来。

example.eg: She was prepared to risk everything on a last throw of the dice.
example.egtrans: 她准备不惜牺牲一切，作最后的一搏。

round.name: round
round.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a circular direction or position; around

example.eg: The moon goes round the earth.
example.egtrans: 月球围绕地球转。

example.eg: We ran round (the outside of the house) to the back, looking for the dog.
example.egtrans: 我们跑到房子后面去找狗。

example.eg: The idea has been going round and round in my head all day (= I can't stop thinking about it).
example.egtrans: 这个想法一整天都萦绕在我心头。

example.eg: When one engine stopped, we had to turn round (= turn to face the opposite direction) and fly home.
example.egtrans: 飞机的一台发动机熄火了，我们不得不掉头飞回。

example.eg: He tried to go round the keeper (= move with the football past a goalkeeper) but was forced wide.
example.egtrans: 他想绕过守门员但是球被迫射偏了。

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in every part of a place, or in various parts of a place

example.eg: The landlord showed me round (the house).
example.egtrans: 房主带我（在房子里）四处看了看。

example.eg: I had to go all round town to find a hotel that was open.
example.egtrans: 我不得不在城中四处寻找还在营业的宾馆。

example.eg: This virus has been going round (the school) (= many people have had it) .
example.egtrans: 这种病毒（在学校）四处传播。

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: on all or some sides of something

example.eg: We sat round the fire.
example.egtrans: 我们围着火炉坐着。

example.eg: The house has trees all round.
example.egtrans: 这座房子四周都是树。

example.eg: The pyramid is 50 metres high and 100 metres round (the base).
example.egtrans: 这座金字塔高50米，底部周长100米。

example.eg: Everyone for a mile round (= in the area) heard the explosion.
example.egtrans: 方圆1英里之内的人都听到了爆炸声。

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a particular direction

example.eg: The garden is round the back (of the house).
example.egtrans: 花园在（房子）后面。

example.eg: I used to live round (= near) here when I was a child.
example.egtrans: 我童年时曾住在这一带。

example.eg: You must come round (to my house) sometime soon.
example.egtrans: 你找个时间一定（到我家）来坐坐。

example.eg: We're going round (= to) the pub for a quick drink.
example.egtrans: 我们要去酒馆抓紧喝上一杯。

round.name: round
round.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: shaped like a ball or circle, or curved

example.eg: Tennis balls and oranges are round.
example.egtrans: 网球和橘子是圆的。

example.eg: a round hole/stone/table/window
example.egtrans: 圆孔／石／桌／窗

example.eg: a round face
example.egtrans: 圆脸

example.eg: round eyes
example.egtrans: 圆眼睛

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a number) whole or complete; given to the nearest 1, 10, 100, etc. and not as exact amounts
trans_examp.trans_cn: 整数的；用整数表示的；用约整数表示的

example.eg: 2.8 to the nearest round number is 3.
example.egtrans: 与2.8最接近的整数是3。

example.eg: "I've got 95 bottles here for you." "Could you make it a round hundred, please?"
example.egtrans: “我这儿有95瓶给你。”“能不能凑个整数，给100瓶怎么样？”

round.name: round
round.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of things or group of events
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一连串的事情；一系列的事件；一系列活动

example.eg: Russia and America will hold another round of talks next month.
example.egtrans: 俄罗斯和美国将在下个月举行又一轮会谈。

example.eg: When we were young life was just one long round of parties/pleasure.
example.egtrans: 我们年轻时，生活的内容好像就是一个又一个聚会／一件又一件令人开心的事情。

trans_examp.trans_en: drinks that you buy for a group of people
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某人给大家买的）每人一份（饮料），一巡（饮料）

example.eg: It's your turn to buy a round.
example.egtrans: 该你请大家都喝上一杯了。

example.eg: He bought a round of drinks to say thank you.
example.egtrans: 他请大家都喝了一杯以表示谢意。

trans_examp.trans_en: a single slice of toast, or a sandwich
a set of regular visits that you make to a number of places or people, especially in order to take products as part of your job
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指作为送货工作的）例行拜访

example.eg: He has a milk/paper round.
example.egtrans: 他挨家送奶／报纸。

trans_examp.trans_en: a song for several singers, who begin singing one after the other at various points in the song

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a competition

example.eg: She was knocked out of the championship in the third round.
example.egtrans: 她在锦标赛的第三轮被淘汰。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the periods of time during a boxing or wrestling match when the competitors are fighting
a complete game in golf
trans_examp.trans_cn: （高尔夫球比赛打完场中所有洞的）一场

dsense.name: round
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a bullet or other single piece of ammunition

example.eg: The soldiers had only 20 rounds left.
example.egtrans: 士兵们只剩下20发子弹了。

round.name: round
round.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go around something

example.eg: Colin rounded the corner at high speed.
example.egtrans: 科林急速拐弯。

trans_examp.trans_en: to move around and past another player while keeping the ball

example.eg: He rounded the keeper and scored.
example.egtrans: 他把球带过了守门员射门得分。

row.name: row
row.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: row
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a line of things, people, animals, etc. arranged next to each other

example.eg: a row of houses/books/plants/people/horses
example.egtrans: 一排房屋／一排书／一行植物／一队人／一队马

example.eg: We had seats in the front/back row of the theatre.
example.egtrans: 我们坐在剧场前／后排。

trans_examp.trans_en: a line of houses joined together along their side walls
used in the names of some roads
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于一些道路的名称中）路，街

example.eg: Prospect Row
example.egtrans: 普罗斯帕克特街

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: one after another without a break

example.eg: She's been voted Best Actress three years in a row.
example.egtrans: 她已经连续3年当选为最佳女演员。

dsense.name: row
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of making a boat move through water using oars (= poles with flat ends)

example.eg: They've gone for a row to the island.
example.egtrans: 他们划船去那个岛了。

row.name: row
row.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause a boat to move through water by pushing against the water with oars (= poles with flat ends)

example.eg: The wind dropped, so we had to row (the boat) back home.
example.egtrans: 风小了，我们只好划船回家。

row.name: row
row.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: row
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a noisy argument or fight

example.eg: My parents often have rows, but my dad does most of the shouting.
example.egtrans: 我父母经常吵架，但大部分时间都是我爸在那儿扯着嗓子嚷嚷。

example.eg: What was a political row over government policy on Europe is fast becoming a diplomatic row between France and Britain.
example.egtrans: 这本来是一场关于政府对欧洲政策的政治争论，却很快演变成法国和英国两国之间的外交摩擦。

dsense.name: row
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: loud noise

example.eg: I can't concentrate because of the row the builders are making.
example.egtrans: 建筑工人弄出那么大噪声，我没法集中注意力。

row.name: row
row.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to argue, especially loudly

example.eg: My parents are always rowing (about/over money).
example.egtrans: 我父母总是（为了钱的事情）吵个不休。

safeguard.name: safeguard
safeguard.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to protect something from harm

example.eg: The union safeguards the interests of all its members.
example.egtrans: 工会捍卫每个会员的利益。

satisfied.name: satisfied
satisfied.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: satisfied
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: pleased because you have got what you wanted, or because something has happened in the way that you wanted

example.eg: Some people are never satisfied!
example.egtrans: 有些人永远不会满足！

example.eg: a satisfied smile
example.egtrans: 满意的微笑

example.eg: Are you satisfied with the new arrangement?
example.egtrans: 你对新的安排满意吗？

dsense.name: satisfied
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If you are satisfied that something is true, you believe it.

example.eg: The judge was satisfied (that) she was telling the truth.
example.egtrans: 法官相信她在说实话。

satisfy.name: satisfy
satisfy.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: satisfy
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to please someone by giving them what they want or need

example.eg: They have 31 flavours of ice cream - enough to satisfy everyone!
example.egtrans: 他们有31种口味的冰激凌——足以让所有人都满意！

example.eg: Come on, satisfy my curiosity (= tell me what I want to know) - what happened last night?
example.egtrans: 来，满足一下我的好奇心，昨天晚上发生了什么事？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have or provide something that is needed or wanted
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 达到条件／满足需要／符合要求

example.eg: She satisfies all the requirements for the job.
example.egtrans: 她符合这项工作的所有要求。

example.eg: There are three main conditions you must satisfy in order to become a member of the club.
example.egtrans: 要想成为俱乐部成员，必须符合3个主要条件。

dsense.name: satisfy
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make someone believe that something is true

example.eg: His explanation satisfied the court.
example.egtrans: 法庭接受了他的解释。

example.eg: I satisfied myself (that) I had locked the door.
example.egtrans: 我确信自己已经锁门了。

example.eg: The authorities were satisfied of (= they accepted) the seriousness of his situation.
example.egtrans: 当局相信他的处境很危急。

saturation.name: saturation
saturation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: saturation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act or result of filling a thing or place completely so that no more can be added

example.eg: market saturation
example.egtrans: 市场饱和

example.eg: The airport is approaching saturation with more than 20 million passengers per year.
example.egtrans: 该机场正接近饱和，每年有超过 2000 万乘客。

example.eg: The theme park industry has already reached its saturation point.
example.egtrans: 主题公园行业已经达到饱和点。

dsense.name: saturation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of making something or someone completely wet
trans_examp.trans_cn: 饱和（程度）；浸透，渗透，湿透

example.eg: Saturation of the soils is greatly increased by any increased level of the lake.
example.egtrans: 土壤的饱和度随着湖水水位任何程度的升高而大大增加。

dsense.name: saturation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the degree to which something is dissolved in something else, compared with the maximum possible degree

example.eg: As the degree of saturation increases, the oil progresses towards being fully hydrogenated.
example.egtrans: 随着饱和程度上升，油朝着完全氢化的方向变化。

example.eg: His blood oxygen saturation should be between 98 and 100.
example.egtrans: 他的血氧饱和度应该在98和100之间。

scale.name: scale
scale.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of numbers, amounts, etc., used to measure or compare the level of something

example.eg: the Centigrade/Fahrenheit scale
example.egtrans: 摄氏／华氏温标

example.eg: How would you rate his work on a scale of 1 to 5?
example.egtrans: 按照1到5的等级，你给他的工作打几分？

trans_examp.trans_en: the relation between the real size of something and its size on a map, model, or diagram

example.eg: a scale of 1:50,000
This map is large scale (= things are shown in detail).
example.egtrans: 这张地图的比例尺很大。

example.eg: Is the bridge drawn to scale (= so that it shows the exact shape of the bridge, but much smaller)?
example.egtrans: 这座桥是按比例画的吗？

example.eg: He was building a scale model of the Empire State Building.
example.egtrans: 他正在做一个帝国大厦的比例模型。

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the size or level of something, especially when this is large

example.eg: We don't yet know the scale of the problem.
example.egtrans: 我们还不知道问题有多严重。

example.eg: Nuclear weapons cause destruction on a massive scale (= cause a lot of destruction).
example.egtrans: 核武器杀伤力很大。

example.eg: My parents used to entertain friends on a large/small scale (= they had large/small parties).
example.egtrans: 我父母过去常常举行大／小规模的宴会招待朋友。

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a device for weighing things or people

example.eg: kitchen/bathroom scales
example.egtrans: 厨房用秤／浴室体重秤

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a weighing device with two containers connected to a metal bar that is free to move up and down about its fixed central point. An object of known weight is put in one container and the thing to be weighed is put in the other.

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of notes played or sung in order, going up or down

example.eg: the scale of G major
example.egtrans: G大调音阶

example.eg: You should practise your scales every day.
example.egtrans: 你得每天练习音阶。

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the many very small, flat pieces that cover the skin of fish, snakes, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （鱼、蛇等动物皮肤表层的）鳞，鳞片

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a hard, white or grey layer of material that forms on the inside of pipes or containers that heat water

scale.name: scale
scale.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to climb up a steep surface, such as a wall or the side of a mountain, often using special equipment

example.eg: The prisoner scaled the high prison wall and ran off.
example.egtrans: 囚犯攀越监狱的高墙逃跑了。

dsense.name: scale
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove tartar (= hard white substance) and plaque (= soft substance in which bacteria breed) from teeth

example.eg: The dentist scaled and polished my teeth last week.
example.egtrans: 上星期牙医给我洗了牙并进行了抛光。

scenario.name: scenario
scenario.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: scenario
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a description of possible actions or events in the future

example.eg: There are several possible scenarios.
example.egtrans: 有几种可能出现的局面。

example.eg: a horrific/nightmare scenario such as a Third World War
example.egtrans: 可怕的／梦魇般的设想，如第三次世界大战

dsense.name: scenario
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a written plan of the characters and events in a play or film
trans_examp.trans_cn: 剧本提纲；剧情梗概；电影脚本

scientific notation.name: scientific notation
scientific notation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of writing very large or very small numbers by putting one number before the decimal point, then multiplying by a power of 10, e.g. 3.6 x 10³

scientific.name: scientific
scientific.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to science, or using the organized methods of science
trans_examp.trans_cn: 科学的；应用科学方法的

example.eg: a scientific discovery/experiment/theory
example.egtrans: 科学发现／实验／理论

example.eg: scientific data/evidence/research
example.egtrans: 科学数据／证据／研究

example.eg: The project has attracted considerable criticism from the scientific community (= from scientists).
example.egtrans: 这个项目招致了科学界广泛的批评。

trans_examp.trans_en: careful and using a system or method

example.eg: We will have to adopt a more scientific approach in the future.
example.egtrans: 我们将来得采用更审慎系统的方法。

example.eg: I try to arrange things in some kind of a system, but I'm not very scientific about it.
example.egtrans: 我尽量把事情安排得规矩些，但不是非常精确。

scope.name: scope
scope.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: scope
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the range of a subject covered by a book, programme, discussion, class, etc.

example.eg: I'm afraid that problem is beyond/outside the scope of my lecture.
example.egtrans: 恐怕那个问题超出了我的讲座范围。

example.eg: Oil painting does not come within the scope of a course of this kind.
example.egtrans: 油画不在这类课程范围内。

example.eg: We would now like to broaden/widen the scope of the enquiry and look at more general matters.
example.egtrans: 我们现在要扩大调查的范围，多注意一些普遍情况。

dsense.name: scope
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the opportunity for doing something

example.eg: There is limited scope for further reductions in the workforce.
example.egtrans: 进一步裁员的余地有限。

scope.name: -scope
scope.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to form nouns that refer to devices for looking at or discovering and measuring things
trans_examp.trans_cn: （构成名词，表示“观看”、“观察”、“测量”等用的仪器）

example.eg: a microscope
example.egtrans: 显微镜

example.eg: a telescope
example.egtrans: 望远镜

scrutiny.name: scrutiny
scrutiny.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the careful and detailed examination of something in order to get information about it

example.eg: The government's record will be subjected to/come under (close) scrutiny in the weeks before the election.
example.egtrans: 政府的所为将在选举前的几个星期接受审查。

seamlessly.name: seamlessly
seamlessly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: without any sudden changes, interruptions, or problems

example.eg: It's a children's film that seamlessly combines live action with computer-generated creatures.
example.egtrans: 这是一部将真人表演和电脑生成的角色完美结合的儿童电影。

seldom.name: seldom
seldom.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: almost never

example.eg: Now that we have a baby, we seldom get the chance to go to the cinema.
example.egtrans: 有了孩子以后，我们很少有机会看电影了。

example.eg: Seldom do we receive any apology when mistakes are made.
example.egtrans: 出错的时候，我们很少听到道歉的话语。

selector.name: selector
selector.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a device that allows you to choose something

example.eg: a channel/gear/height selector
example.egtrans: 频道转换器／变速器／高度选择器

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who chooses a sports team

example.eg: His performance persuaded the selectors that he should be included in the team.
example.egtrans: 他的表现说服了队员选拔人而被吸收入队。

semantic.name: semantic
semantic.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: connected with the meanings of words

semicolon.name: semicolon
semicolon.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the symbol ; used in writing between two parts of a sentence, usually when each of the two parts could form grammatical sentences on their own. A semicolon can also separate the things in a list.

sense.name: sense
sense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sense
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an ability to understand, recognize, value, or react to something, especially any of the five physical abilities to see, hear, smell, taste, and feel
trans_examp.trans_cn: 官能；感觉；知觉（尤指视觉、听觉、嗅觉、味觉和触觉）

example.eg: With her excellent sense of smell, she could tell if you were a smoker from the other side of the room.
example.egtrans: 她嗅觉灵敏，在房间的另一端就能知道你是否抽烟。

example.eg: My cold is so bad I've lost my sense of smell/taste (= I can't smell/taste anything).
example.egtrans: 我感冒很严重，闻不到任何气味了／尝不出任何味道了。

trans_examp.trans_en: a general feeling or understanding

example.eg: Did you get any sense of how they might react?
example.egtrans: 你预感他们会作何反应？

example.eg: The helicopters hovering overhead added to the sense of urgency.
example.egtrans: 在头顶盘旋的直升机加重了紧迫感。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the ability to enjoy life and not be too serious

example.eg: Don't be angry - it was just a joke - where's your sense of fun?
example.egtrans: 别生气——只是个笑话——你乐观的天性哪里去了？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: your ability to understand funny things

example.eg: She has a really good sense of humour.
example.egtrans: 她真的很有幽默感。

example.eg: We have the same sense of humour.
example.egtrans: 我们有同样的幽默感。

example.eg: Come on, lighten up! Where's your sense of humour?
example.egtrans: 好了，放轻松点！你的幽默感哪里去了？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the feeling people have when there is a very important event or celebration
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 隆重的气氛；节庆的气氛

example.eg: The decorations, flowers, and crowds gave the town a real sense of occasion.
example.egtrans: 灯彩、鲜花和人群给小镇带来了一种十足的节庆氛围。

dsense.name: sense
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the characteristic of having good judgment, especially when it is based on practical ideas or understanding
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指基于切实的想法或理解的）理智，明智

example.eg: I hope they'll have the (good) sense/have enough sense to shut the windows before they leave.
example.egtrans: 我希望他们走的时候会想到要关窗户。

example.eg: It makes (good) sense to buy a big pack because it works out cheaper in the end.
example.egtrans: 买大包的更划算，因为最终算下来更便宜。

example.eg: There's no sense in waiting (= it is not practical to wait) - the next train isn't for two hours.
example.egtrans: 继续等下去是不明智的——下一趟火车要过两个小时才会来。

example.eg: Where's/What's the sense (= what is the advantage) in paying someone when you could get a volunteer?
example.egtrans: 既然你可以找一个志愿者，何必花钱雇人呢？

example.eg: Planning so far ahead makes no sense - so many things will have changed by next year.
example.egtrans: 提前这么久作计划并不明智——到明年，许多事情都会发生变化。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the ability to use good judgment

example.eg: Have you taken leave of/lost your senses? (= Have you lost your ability to make a good judgment?)
example.egtrans: 你疯了吧？

example.eg: It's time you came to your senses (= started to use your good judgment) and realized that they are not going to help you.
example.egtrans: 你该醒醒了，你该明白他们是不会帮你的。

example.eg: The accident brought him to his senses (= caused him to use his good judgment again) and made him stop drinking.
example.egtrans: 这一事故使他醒悟过来，不再喝酒了。

dsense.name: sense
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the possible meanings of a word or phrase

example.eg: They are not immigrants, at least not in any sense that I understand.
example.egtrans: 至少就我所理解的意义上来说，他们不是移民。

example.eg: The packaging is green - in both senses of the word (= it is green in colour and it is good for the environment).
example.egtrans: 包装是绿色的——这个“绿色”有两层含义。

example.eg: Security defined in the broad/broadest sense of the term means getting at the root causes of trouble and helping to reduce regional conflicts.
example.egtrans: 广义上说，安全工作是指找出骚乱的根本原因并帮助减少地区冲突。

example.eg: This passage doesn't make (any) sense (= the meaning is not clear).
example.egtrans: 这篇文章意思不清楚。

example.eg: I've read the letter twice, but I can't make (any) sense of it (= I can't understand it).
example.egtrans: 我把信读了两遍，但还是不解其意。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in every way or feature

example.eg: It's a book which is, in every sense, about different ways of seeing the world.
example.egtrans: 从任何意义上说，这都是一本以不同角度看世界的书。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: thinking about something in one way, but not in every way

example.eg: She claims that the system is at fault and she's right, in a sense (= she is partly right).
example.egtrans: 她声称现行制度有问题，从某种意义上说，她是对的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: not at all

example.eg: We are in no sense obliged to agree to this.
example.egtrans: 我们绝不是非得同意这件事。

sense.name: sense
sense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to feel or experience something without being able to explain exactly how

example.eg: Although she said nothing, I could sense her anger.
example.egtrans: 尽管她什么都没说，但我能感觉到她的愤怒。

example.eg: He sensed something was about to happen.
example.egtrans: 他感觉到有事情要发生。

example.eg: He sensed (that) his guests were bored, although they were listening politely.
example.egtrans: 尽管客人们在礼貌地听着，但他意识到他们有些厌烦。

example.eg: Could you sense what was likely to happen?
example.egtrans: 你能感觉到可能会发生什么事情吗？

separate.name: separate
separate.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing or happening independently or in a different physical space

example.eg: The art department and the music department are in two separate buildings.
example.egtrans: 艺术系和音乐系在两座不同的大楼中。

example.eg: I try to keep meat separate from other food in the fridge.
example.egtrans: 我尽量把肉同冰箱里的其他食物分开放。

example.eg: I have my public life and my private life, and as far as possible I try to keep them separate.
example.egtrans: 我有自己的公众生活和私人生活，并尽可能使两者分开。

example.eg: Three youths have been shot and killed in separate incidents this month.
example.egtrans: 这个月有3名年轻人在不同的事件中被枪杀。

separate.name: separate
separate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: separate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause to) divide into parts

example.eg: The north and south of the country are separated by a mountain range.
example.egtrans: 这个国家的南北两部分被一条山脉隔开。

example.eg: You can get a special device for separating egg whites from yolks.
example.egtrans: 你可以买一种把蛋白与蛋黄分开的专用器具。

example.eg: The top and bottom sections are quite difficult to separate.
example.egtrans: 顶部和底部很难分开。

dsense.name: separate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make people move apart or into different places, or to move apart

example.eg: At school they always tried to separate Jane and me because we were troublemakers.
example.egtrans: 在学校里，他们总是设法把简和我分开，因为我们是捣蛋鬼。

example.eg: Somehow, in the rush to get out of the building, I got separated from my mother.
example.egtrans: 急急忙忙冲出大楼的时候，不知怎么的，我和妈妈走散了。

example.eg: Perhaps we should separate now and meet up later.
example.egtrans: 或许我们现在应该分开，晚些时候再见面。

dsense.name: separate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to consider two people or things as different or not related
trans_examp.trans_cn: 分开考虑；认为（两者）不相关

example.eg: You can't separate morality from politics.
example.egtrans: 你不能把道德与政治分开考虑。

dsense.name: separate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a liquid separates, it becomes two different liquids.

dsense.name: separate
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to start to live in a different place from your husband or wife because the relationship has ended

example.eg: My parents separated when I was six and divorced a couple of years later.
example.egtrans: 我6岁的时候父母分居，几年之后他们便离婚了。

separately.name: separately
separately.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: not together

example.eg: Detectives interviewed the men separately over several days.
example.egtrans: 几天内，侦探们分别盘问了那些人。

example.eg: I tend to wear the jacket and skirt separately rather than as a suit.
example.egtrans: 我想把上装同裙子分开穿，而不想当套装穿。

example.eg: I think we'd better deal with these two points separately.
example.egtrans: 我想我们最好还是分开处理这两件事。

sequence.name: sequence
sequence.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sequence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a series of related things or events, or the order in which they follow each other
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一连串；一系列；顺序，次序

example.eg: The first chapter describes the strange sequence of events that led to his death.
example.egtrans: 第一章描述了造成他死亡的一连串奇特事件。

example.eg: Is there a particular sequence in which you have to perform these tasks?
example.egtrans: 你是否得按一定的顺序完成这些任务？

example.eg: For the sake of convenience the photographs are shown in chronological sequence (= in the order in which they were taken).
example.egtrans: 为方便起见，照片按时间顺序展示。

dsense.name: sequence
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a film that shows a particular event or a related series of events

example.eg: The movie's opening sequence is of a very unpleasant murder.
example.egtrans: 影片开头的一组镜头呈现的是一起让人心悸的谋杀。

sequence.name: sequence
sequence.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to combine things in a particular order, or discover the order in which they are combined
trans_examp.trans_cn: 安排…的顺序；发现…的顺序

example.eg: They discussed how to sequence the steps in the plan.
example.egtrans: 他们讨论了如何安排计划各个步骤的顺序。

example.eg: reading books sequenced in order of difficulty
example.egtrans: 按照书本难度顺序阅读

trans_examp.trans_en: to discover the order in which nucleotides (= chemical substances) are combined within DNA

example.eg: Researchers sequenced the full genome of a rat.
example.egtrans: 研究者们测定了大鼠基因组的全部序列。

serialize.name: serialize
serialize.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a book is serialized, it is made into a number of television or radio programmes or published in a newspaper or a magazine in parts.

example.eg: The novel was serialized for TV back in the 1990s.
example.egtrans: 这部小说曾在20世纪90年代以连续剧的形式在电视上播出。

series.name: series
series.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: series
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of similar or related events or things, one following another

example.eg: There has been a series of sexual attacks on women in the area.
example.egtrans: 这个地区发生了一连串针对女性的性侵犯案件。

example.eg: She gave a series of lectures at Warwick University last year on contemporary British writers.
example.egtrans: 她去年在华威大学作了一系列有关当代英国作家的讲座。

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of games played one after another by two teams against each other

example.eg: The Yankees have a four-game series against the Orioles at home.
example.egtrans: 扬基队主场有一连四场对金莺队的比赛。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: Parts of an electrical system that are in series are arranged in a single line so that the current flows through each part, one after another.

dsense.name: series
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of television or radio broadcasts on the same subject or using the same characters but in different situations

example.eg: The star is to host a television series on extreme sports.
example.egtrans: 这位明星将主持一档关于极限运动的电视系列节目。

example.eg: a comedy series
example.egtrans: 喜剧系列片

example.eg: I missed the second episode of the series so I don't know what's going on now.
example.egtrans: 我错过了系列剧的第二集，所以不知道现在的剧情进展如何。

dsense.name: series
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of books published by the same company that deal with the same subject

example.eg: They do a series on architecture throughout the ages.
example.egtrans: 他们出版一套介绍各个时代建筑的系列图书。

serious.name: serious
serious.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: serious
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: severe in effect; bad

example.eg: a serious illness
example.egtrans: 严重的疾病

example.eg: There were no reports of serious injuries.
example.egtrans: 没有接到有人重伤的报告。

example.eg: The new tax regulations have landed some of the smaller companies in serious trouble.
example.egtrans: 新的纳税规定使一些较小的公司陷入了严重的困境。

example.eg: Drugs have become a serious problem in a lot of schools.
example.egtrans: 吸毒在许多学校已经成了很严重的问题。

example.eg: This is a very serious offence.
example.egtrans: 这是非常严重的违法行为。

example.eg: He's been taken to hospital where his condition is described as serious but stable.
example.egtrans: 他被送到了医院，医生说他病情严重但是比较稳定。

trans_examp.trans_en: very ill

dsense.name: serious
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not joking or intended to be funny

example.eg: Please don't laugh - I'm being serious.
example.egtrans: 请不要笑——我是认真的。

example.eg: He was wearing a very serious expression and I knew something was wrong.
example.egtrans: 他一脸严肃，我就知道出问题了。

example.eg: On the surface it's a very funny novel but it does have a more serious underlying theme.
example.egtrans: 表面上看，这是一部非常滑稽的小说，但它确实有更为深刻的主题。

trans_examp.trans_en: A serious person is quiet, thinks carefully about things, and does not laugh a lot.

example.eg: I remember her as a very serious child.
example.egtrans: 我记得她是个不爱笑的小孩。

dsense.name: serious
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: determined to follow a particular plan of action

example.eg: Is she serious about going to live abroad?
example.egtrans: 她真的想移居国外吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: If two people who have a loving relationship are serious about each other, they intend to stay with each other for a long time and possibly marry.

example.eg: She's had a lot of boyfriends but Simon's the only one she's been serious about.
example.egtrans: 她有很多男朋友，但西蒙是她唯一真正爱的人。

dsense.name: serious
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: needing or deserving your complete attention
trans_examp.trans_cn: 需要（或值得）认真对待的

example.eg: That's an interesting job offer - I'd give it some serious consideration if I were you.
example.egtrans: 那是个有意思的工作机会——我要是你的话就会认真考虑一下。

example.eg: We've got some serious talking to do, you and me.
example.egtrans: 我们有点重要的事情要谈，就你我两个人。

dsense.name: serious
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: extreme in degree or amount

example.eg: We did some fairly serious walking over the weekend.
example.egtrans: 我们周末走了很多路。

example.eg: I mean we're talking serious (= a large amount of) money, right?
example.egtrans: 我的意思是我们在谈很大一笔钱，是吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: very good of its type

example.eg: This is a serious wine, Belle, you have to try some.
example.egtrans: 这是上好的葡萄酒，贝儿，你得尝尝。

serve.name: serve
serve.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide food or drinks

example.eg: Do they serve meals in the bar?
example.egtrans: 这家酒吧提供饭菜吗？

example.eg: Breakfast is served in the restaurant between 7.00 and 11.00.
example.egtrans: 餐馆早上7点到11点供应早餐。

example.eg: We arrived at the hotel and were served with champagne and canapés.
example.egtrans: 我们到达宾馆后，宾馆提供了香槟和小吃。

example.eg: All recipes in this book, unless otherwise stated, will serve (= be enough for) four to five people.
example.egtrans: 本书里的所有食谱，除了特别标明的，都可供4至5人享用。

example.eg: Serve the pie warm with ice cream or whipped cream.
example.egtrans: 趁热上果馅糕点，配上冰淇凌或掼奶油。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to work for; to do your duty to

example.eg: He served in the army for 22 years.
example.egtrans: 他服了22年兵役。

example.eg: She has served on the committee for the last 15 years.
example.egtrans: 15年来，她一直在该委员会任职。

example.eg: He served under Ronald Reagan as Secretary of State.
example.egtrans: 他在罗纳德‧里根手下担任国务卿。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to help achieve something or to be useful as something

example.eg: An official investigation would not serve any useful purpose.
example.egtrans: 正式调查不会达到什么有益的成效。

example.eg: The judge said that the fine would serve as a warning to other drivers.
example.egtrans: 法官说此次罚款对其他司机会是一种警告。

example.eg: In the absence of anything better the settee could serve as a bed for a couple of nights.
example.egtrans: 如果没有更好的选择，长沙发可以当几天床用。

example.eg: Nothing serves to explain the violent fighting we have seen recently.
example.egtrans: 什么都无法解释我们最近所目睹的暴力斗殴。

example.eg: My umbrella will serve for a weapon.
example.egtrans: 我的伞可以当武器用。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide with something that is needed

example.eg: The report says the police are out of touch with the communities that they serve.
example.egtrans: 这份报告指出，警方对他们所服务的社区毫不了解。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a shop, restaurant, or hotel, to deal with a customer by taking their order, showing or selling them goods, etc.

example.eg: Are you being served, madam?
example.egtrans: 女士，有服务员招待您吗？

example.eg: Have you been served, ma'am?
example.egtrans: 女士，有服务员招待过您了吗？

example.eg: That's the restaurant where they refused to serve John because he was so rude.
example.egtrans: 就是那家餐馆拒绝接待约翰，因为他太粗鲁。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spend a period of time doing something

example.eg: He served four years in prison for robbery.
example.egtrans: 他因抢劫坐了4年牢。

example.eg: After he'd served his apprenticeship he set up his own business.
example.egtrans: 他学徒期满后自立门户。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to spend time in prison

example.eg: He's serving time for drug offences.
example.egtrans: 他因毒品犯罪正在服刑。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports such as tennis, to hit the ball to the other player as a way of starting the game

example.eg: Whose turn is it to serve?
example.egtrans: 轮到谁发球了？

example.eg: That's the third ace you've served this game.
example.egtrans: 那是你在这局比赛中第3次发球得分。

dsense.name: serve
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give a legal document to someone, demanding that they go to a law court or that they obey an order

example.eg: Less than two weeks ago Gough finally served a writ on Slater, claiming damages for alleged loss of royalties.
example.egtrans: 不到两个星期以前，高夫终于将传票送达给斯莱特，要求对其所涉及的版税损失作出赔偿。

example.eg: Each person served with a summons will be given six weeks before they have to appear in the Magistrates' Court.
example.egtrans: 每一个收到传票的人在地方法院出庭之前都有6个星期的时间。

serve.name: serve
serve.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports such as tennis, the act of hitting the ball to the other player to start play

example.eg: It's your serve.
example.egtrans: 该你发球了。

example.eg: Murray broke Federer's serve (= he won a game in which Federer hit the ball first).
example.egtrans: 穆雷破了费德勒的发球局。

session.name: session
session.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: session
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a formal meeting or series of meetings of an organization such as a parliament or a law court
trans_examp.trans_cn: （议会等机构的）会议；（法庭的）开庭

example.eg: The parliamentary session is due to end on 27 May.
example.egtrans: 议会会议将于5月27日结束。

example.eg: The UN Security Council met in emergency session to discuss the crisis.
example.egtrans: 联合国安理会举行了紧急会议讨论这一危机。

dsense.name: session
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of time or meeting arranged for a particular activity
trans_examp.trans_cn: （从事某项活动的）一段时间（或集会）；一场；一节

example.eg: The 21-year-old runner twisted his ankle in a training session last Friday.
example.egtrans: 这位21岁的赛跑运动员上周五在训练时扭伤了脚踝。

example.eg: As the European heads of state gathered, the press were allowed in for a photo session.
example.egtrans: 欧洲国家首脑聚集起来时，新闻记者获准进入拍照。

example.eg: The men had a heavy session last night (= they drank a lot of alcohol).
example.egtrans: 昨晚男人们喝了很多酒。

dsense.name: session
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: at a college, any of the periods of time that a teaching year or day is divided into, or the teaching year itself

example.eg: He taught a class during the summer session.
example.egtrans: 在夏季开学期间他教了一堂课。

example.eg: Access is restricted when school is in session.
example.egtrans: 学校上课时间是不能随便进入的。

set up.name: set-up
set up.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: set-up
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which things are organized or arranged
trans_examp.trans_cn: 组织结构；事物安排；体制

example.eg: When I started my new job, it took me a while to get used to the set-up.
example.egtrans: 我开始新工作的时候，花了一段时间才适应这种组织形式。

example.eg: "Nice little set-up you've got here," he said as we showed him around the house.
example.egtrans: “你们这里布置安排得真是不错，”我们带他看房子时他说道。

dsense.name: set-up
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which someone is tricked into doing something or is made to seem guilty of something they did not do

example.eg: When drugs were found in her luggage, she claimed it was a set-up.
example.egtrans: 在她的行李里发现了毒品后，她声称这是被人陷害的。

set.name: set
set.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put something in a particular place or position
trans_examp.trans_cn: 放，置；使处于（指定的地方、位置）

example.eg: He set a vase of flowers on the table.
example.egtrans: 他把一瓶花放在桌子上。

example.eg: The campsite is set in the middle of a pine forest.
example.egtrans: 宿营地设在松树林的中央。

example.eg: Our house is set back from the road.
example.egtrans: 我们的房子离公路有一定的距离。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a story, film, etc. is set in a particular time or place, the action in it happens in that time or place.

example.eg: "West Side Story" is set in New York City in the late 1950s.
example.egtrans: 《西区故事》是以20世纪50年代末的纽约为背景的。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause something or someone to be in the stated condition or situation

example.eg: It is believed that the building was set alight/ablaze/on fire deliberately.
example.egtrans: 据信，这幢大楼遭人故意纵火。

example.eg: The new director has set a lot of changes in motion in our department.
example.egtrans: 新主管在我们部门推行了很多变革。

example.eg: After years in prison, the men who had wrongfully been found guilty of the bombing were finally set free.
example.egtrans: 坐了多年牢之后，在爆炸案中遭错判有罪的数名男子终于被释放了。

example.eg: If I've made a mistake, then it's up to me to set it right (= correct it).
example.egtrans: 如果我犯了错，那就该由我来纠正。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to cause someone or something to start doing something

example.eg: His remarks set me thinking.
example.egtrans: 他的话引起我的深思。

example.eg: The thunderstorm set the radio crackling.
example.egtrans: 雷雨使收音机发出噼噼啪啪的声音。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to give someone work to do

example.eg: I was set to work dusting the bookshelves.
example.egtrans: 我被安排做清除书架尘土的工作。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to establish or decide something

example.eg: The school has been criticized for failing to set high standards for its students.
example.egtrans: 学校因未能为学生设定高标准而受到了批评。

example.eg: The committee has set new limits on spending.
example.egtrans: 委员会对开支设定了新的限制。

example.eg: Lewis has set a new world record.
example.egtrans: 刘易斯创造了一项新的世界纪录。

example.eg: The court's decision has set a legal precedent.
example.egtrans: 法庭的判决开创了一项判例。

example.eg: Parents should set a good example to their children.
example.egtrans: 父母应该为孩子树立良好的榜样。

example.eg: He's set himself the goal/target of making his first million by the time he's 30.
example.egtrans: 他给自己定的目标是在30岁前赚到第一个100万。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get something ready so that it comes into operation or can be used

example.eg: The heating is set to come on at 5 p.m.
example.egtrans: 暖气设定在下午5点钟启动。

example.eg: Have you set up the DVD player?
example.egtrans: 你把DVD播放机调定好了吗？

example.eg: I usually set my watch by the time on the computer.
example.egtrans: 我通常是按计算机显示的时间对表。

example.eg: He set the alarm for 7 a.m.
example.egtrans: 他把闹钟设在早上7点钟。

example.eg: Will you set the table (= put plates, knives, forks, etc. on it ready for use), please?
example.egtrans: 你来摆一下餐桌，好吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: to put furniture and other things on a stage so that it represents the time and the place in which the action of a play, film, or television programme is going to happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: 设置，布置（戏剧、电影或电视节目的布景）

example.eg: During the interval the stage was set for the second act.
example.egtrans: 在幕间休息时，工作人员布置了第二幕的布景。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fix or make certain

example.eg: Has a date/time been set for the meeting yet?
example.egtrans: 会议的日期／时间确定了吗？

example.eg: The price of the house has been set at €425,000.
example.egtrans: 这所房子的定价为42.5万欧元。

trans_examp.trans_en: When a doctor sets a broken bone, he or she puts it into the right position so that it will heal.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 固定（断骨）；接（骨）；把（断骨）复位

trans_examp.trans_en: When a broken bone sets, it heals in a particular position.
If you have your hair set, you have it arranged while it is wet so that it will be in a particular style when it is dry.
If you set a part of your body, you tighten the muscles around it in order to show that you are determined about something.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 绷紧（身体部位）；使显出坚定的表情

example.eg: "I'm never going back to him," she said, setting her jaw firmly.
example.egtrans: “我永远都不会回到他身边，”她咬紧牙关说。

example.eg: His face was set in determination.
example.egtrans: 他脸上显出坚定的表情。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a liquid or soft material sets, it becomes firm or hard.

example.eg: Leave the jelly in the fridge to set.
example.egtrans: 把果冻放在冰箱里凝固。

example.eg: Don't walk on the concrete until it has set.
example.egtrans: 混凝土还没凝固之前别在上面走。

phrase.phrase_title: set into sth/be set with sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If a precious stone is set in/into a piece of jewellery, or a piece of jewellery is set with a precious stone, the stone is fixed firmly to the piece of jewellery.

example.eg: a gold ring with a diamond set into it
example.egtrans: 镶着一颗钻石的金戒指

example.eg: a brooch set with rubies and pearls
example.egtrans: 镶有红宝石和珍珠的胸针

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone a piece of school work or homework to do

example.eg: My science teacher always sets a lot of homework.
example.egtrans: 我的科学课老师总是布置很多家庭作业。

example.eg: What books have been set for this term?
example.egtrans: 这学期布置学生要读哪些书？

example.eg: What homework have you been set for the holidays?
example.egtrans: 你在放假时被布置了哪些家庭作业？

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone a particular task to do

example.eg: Harry set them to work painting the walls.
example.egtrans: 哈利布置他们油漆墙壁。

example.eg: We set the kids the task of clearing the snow from the drive.
example.egtrans: 我们给孩子们布置了打扫门前路上积雪的任务。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to write or provide music for a poem or other words so that they can be sung

example.eg: poems set to music
example.egtrans: 谱了曲的诗歌

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of the sun, moon, or planets) to go down below the horizon (= the line at which the earth seems to join the sky)
trans_examp.trans_cn: （太阳、月球或行星）降于地平线之下，下落

example.eg: We sat on the beach and watched the sun set.
example.egtrans: 我们坐在海滩上观看日落。

example.eg: The setting sun cast long shadows across the lawn.
example.egtrans: 夕阳在草地上投下了长长的影子。

set.name: set
set.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of similar things that belong together in some way

example.eg: We bought Charles and Mandy a set of cutlery as a wedding present.
example.egtrans: 我们为查尔斯和曼迪买了一套刀叉餐具，作为送给他们的结婚礼物。

example.eg: I always keep a tool set in the back of my car.
example.egtrans: 我一直都在汽车的后备箱内放着一套工具。

example.eg: The doctor said that he hadn't seen this particular set of symptoms before.
example.egtrans: 医生说他以前没有见过这样一种症候群。

example.eg: We need to establish a new set of priorities.
example.egtrans: 我们需要重新安排应优先考虑的一组事项。

trans_examp.trans_en: a number of objects or pieces of equipment needed for a particular activity, especially playing a game

example.eg: a chess/train/chemistry set
example.egtrans: 一副象棋／一组模型火车／一套化学实验用品

trans_examp.trans_en: In mathematics, a set is a group of objects with stated characteristics.
a group of people who have similar interests and ways of living

example.eg: the fashionable set
example.egtrans: 一群时髦的人

example.eg: She's got in with a very arty set.
example.egtrans: 她和一群搞艺术的人在一起。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the place where a film or play is performed or recorded, and the pictures, furniture, etc. that are used

example.eg: a movie set
example.egtrans: 电影场景

example.eg: a stage set
example.egtrans: 舞台布景

example.eg: a set designer
example.egtrans: 布景师

example.eg: They first met on the set of "Star Wars".
example.egtrans: 他们第一次见面是在《星球大战》的外景地。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a game of tennis or volleyball

example.eg: They won in straight sets (= they won every set).
example.egtrans: 他们一局未失。

trans_examp.trans_en: a musical performance that forms part of a concert, especially one of pop music or jazz
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指流行音乐或爵士音乐会上的）一段表演

example.eg: The band's opening set lasted 45 minutes.
example.egtrans: 乐队的开场表演持续了45分钟。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of having your hair set

example.eg: a shampoo and set
example.egtrans: 洗头并做发型

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the position in which you hold a part of your body

example.eg: I could tell from the set of his jaw that he was angry.
example.egtrans: 看他绷得紧紧的下巴，我便知道他在生气。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a television

example.eg: We need a new television set.
example.egtrans: 我们需要一台新电视机。

set.name: set
set.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: ready and prepared

example.eg: Shall we go now - is everyone set?
example.egtrans: 我们可以走了吗——大家准备好了吗？

example.eg: Is everything all set for the party?
example.egtrans: 聚会一切都准备妥当了吗？

example.eg: At the start of the race, the starter said "On your marks, get set, go".
example.egtrans: 发令者在起跑时常说：“各就位，预备，跑。”

example.eg: We were just getting set to leave when Ben said he had something important to tell us.
example.egtrans: 当本说他有一些重要的事要告诉我们时我们正准备离开。

trans_examp.trans_en: likely or in a suitable condition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 可能的；在适当条件下的

example.eg: He looks set to become world champion again this year.
example.egtrans: 他今年似乎有可能再次成为世界冠军。

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: always the same, never changing

example.eg: My parents say I have to be home by a set time.
example.egtrans: 我父母说我得在规定的时间回家。

example.eg: The restaurant does a set lunch (= a meal which is offered at a fixed price, but with little or no choice about what you have to eat) on Sundays.
example.egtrans: 这家餐馆星期天午餐供应套餐。

example.eg: The receptionist had a bright set smile on his face, but I could tell that he was bored.
example.egtrans: 接待员带着一成不变的灿烂微笑，但我看得出其实他觉得很厌倦。

example.eg: My father has very set opinions/views on the matter.
example.egtrans: 我父亲在这件事上的看法很难改变。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a phrase in which the words are always used in the same order

dsense.name: set
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: a set book is one that must be studied for a particular course

example.eg: The students are reading "Lord of the Flies" as one of their set books/texts this year.
example.egtrans: 学生们今年的规定阅读书目中有《蝇王》。

severity.name: severity
severity.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: severity
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: seriousness

example.eg: Even the doctors were shocked by the severity of his injuries.
example.egtrans: 连医生也对他伤势的严重程度感到震惊。

example.eg: I don't think you quite understand the severity of our financial problems.
example.egtrans: 我认为你还不太了解我们财务问题的严重程度。

dsense.name: severity
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality of being very unkind or unpleasant

example.eg: He spoke with great severity.
example.egtrans: 他说话口气非常严厉。

example.eg: The severity of the punishment should match the seriousness of the crime.
example.egtrans: 惩罚的严厉程度应同所犯罪行的轻重相当。

dsense.name: severity
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: plainness

shadow.name: shadow
shadow.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: shadow
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of darkness, caused by light being blocked by something

example.eg: The children were playing, jumping on each other's shadows.
example.egtrans: 孩子们正在嬉戏，跳来跳去踩彼此的影子。

example.eg: Jamie followed his mother around all day like a shadow.
example.egtrans: 杰米像影子一样整天跟着他母亲。

example.eg: The sun shone through the leaves, casting/throwing shadows on the lawn.
example.egtrans: 阳光透过树叶，在草地上投下阴影。

example.eg: This corner of the room is always in shadow (= slight darkness).
example.egtrans: 房间的这个角落总是有些暗。

trans_examp.trans_en: a small dark area of skin under your eye

example.eg: She put on some make-up to cover the dark shadows under her eyes.
example.egtrans: 她化了点妆来掩盖她眼睛下的黑眼圈。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an area of darkness in which people and things cannot be seen

example.eg: Someone jumped out of the shadows and grabbed my handbag.
example.egtrans: 有个人从阴暗处窜出，抢走了我的手提包。

phrase.phrase_title: be in/under the shadow of sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be very close to a larger building or place
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 离（某个大的建筑物或场所）很近

example.eg: His workshop was in the shadow of the great church of San Paolo Maggiore.
example.egtrans: 他的工作坊离圣保罗大教堂很近。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be in a situation in which something unpleasant either seems likely to happen and to have a bad effect on your life, or is already having a bad effect on your life

example.eg: We are all living under the shadow of war.
example.egtrans: 我们都生活在战争的阴影中。

dsense.name: shadow
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small amount

example.eg: It is a tragic story, but there is a shadow of hope.
example.egtrans: 那是一个悲剧故事，但仍有一丝希望。

example.eg: There isn't a shadow of doubt that you've made the right decision.
example.egtrans: 毫无疑问，你作出的决定是正确的。

phrase.phrase_title: beyond/without a shadow of a doubt

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is true beyond a shadow of a doubt, there is no doubt that it is true.

example.eg: This is without a shadow of a doubt the best movie I've seen all year.
example.egtrans: 毫无疑问，这是我整年来看过最好的一部电影。

dsense.name: shadow
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who follows another person everywhere
trans_examp.trans_cn: 跟踪者，盯梢者；形影不离的人

example.eg: "I think we have a shadow on our tail," muttered the detective.
example.egtrans: “我认为有人在跟踪我们，”侦探低声说。

example.eg: Ever since he was able to walk, Stephen has been his older brother's shadow (= has followed him and copied his actions).
example.egtrans: 自从斯蒂芬会走路之后，就一直和他哥哥形影不离。

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who follows someone else while they are at work in order to learn about that person's job

shadow.name: shadow
shadow.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: shadow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to follow closely

example.eg: The police think that the robbers shadowed their victims for days before the crime.
example.egtrans: 警方认为抢劫者跟踪了受害人几天之后才实施犯罪的。

example.eg: The euro has closely shadowed the dollar.
example.egtrans: 欧元紧跟美元。

trans_examp.trans_en: to follow someone else while they are at work in order to learn about that person's job
trans_examp.trans_cn: （为了解某人的工作而）跟随见习

example.eg: Your first week in the job will be spent shadowing one of our more experienced employees.
example.egtrans: 你工作的第一周将是跟随我们其中一位经验丰富的雇员学习。

dsense.name: shadow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to produce a shadow

example.eg: We came across a glade shadowed by large trees.
example.egtrans: 我们偶然发现了一块被大树遮蔽的空地。

dsense.name: shadow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.
