trans_examp.trans_en: to make a person unhappy or to make their life less happy

example.eg: Mental illness had shadowed him for more than a decade.
example.egtrans: 十年来他的人生一直被精神疾病所困扰。

shadow.name: shadow
shadow.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used in the title of important politicians in the main opposition party (= the party not in government)
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于主要反对党的要员的头衔中）影子的

example.eg: the Shadow Foreign Secretary
example.egtrans: 影子外交大臣

example.eg: the Shadow Cabinet
example.egtrans: 影子内阁

shake.name: shake
shake.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move backwards and forwards or up and down in quick, short movements, or to make something or someone do this

example.eg: A young boy climbed into the apple tree and shook the branches so that the fruit fell down.
example.egtrans: 一个男孩爬上苹果树，用力摇着枝条好让苹果掉下来。

example.eg: Babies like toys that make a noise when they're shaken.
example.egtrans: 婴儿喜欢摇晃时能发出声响的玩具。

example.eg: The explosion shook buildings for miles around.
example.egtrans: 爆炸让好几英里以内的房屋都受到震动。

example.eg: People in southern California were shaken awake by an earthquake.
example.egtrans: 加利福尼亚南部的人们被地震震醒了。

example.eg: She shook her hair loose from its ribbon.
example.egtrans: 她抖了抖头发，把丝带抖掉。

example.eg: Anna shook some powdered chocolate over her coffee.
example.egtrans: 安娜往咖啡里撒了一些巧克力粉。

example.eg: Every time one of these big trucks goes by, all the houses shake.
example.egtrans: 每当这样的一辆大卡车经过时，所有的房屋都会颤动。

example.eg: The child's body was shaking with sobs.
example.egtrans: 这个孩子哭得身子一颤一颤的。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you are shaking, your body makes quick short movements, or you feel as if it is doing so, because you are frightened or nervous.

example.eg: She was shaking as she opened the letter.
example.egtrans: 她颤抖着拆开了信。

example.eg: I was shaking in my shoes/boots (= very nervous) about having to tell Dad what I'd done.
example.egtrans: 想到不得不告诉爸爸我的所作所为时，我害怕得直发抖。

example.eg: I was shaking like a leaf (= very nervous) before the test.
example.egtrans: 我考试前特别紧张。

trans_examp.trans_en: If your voice shakes, it makes you sound nervous or frightened.

example.eg: Her voice shook as she talked about the person who attacked her.
example.egtrans: 她谈起攻击她的人时声音直打颤。

phrase.phrase_title: shake sb's hand/shake sb by the hand

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to hold someone's hand and move it up and down, especially when you meet them for the first time or when you make an agreement with them
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （尤指初次见面或达成协议时）握（某人的）手

example.eg: "Pleased to meet you," he said, shaking my hand.
example.egtrans: “很高兴见到你，”他边说边与我握手。

example.eg: "Congratulations," she said, shaking the winner by the hand.
example.egtrans: “祝贺你，”她说着握了握获胜者的手。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If two people shake hands, they greet each other or say goodbye by briefly joining hands and moving them slightly up and down.

example.eg: The Princess was photographed shaking hands with AIDS victims.
example.egtrans: 王妃与艾滋病患者握手的场面被拍了下来。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If two people shake (hands) on something, they make an agreement by briefly joining hands and moving them slightly up and down.

example.eg: It seems that we have a deal, so let's shake (hands) on it.
example.egtrans: 看来我们成交了，来握个手吧。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to move your head from side to side, in order to express disagreement, sadness, or that you do not want or believe something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 摇头（表示不同意、悲伤、不想要或不信）

example.eg: I asked Tim if he'd seen Jackie lately but he shook his head.
example.egtrans: 我问蒂姆近来是否见过杰基，他摇了摇头。

example.eg: "That's incredible!" he said, shaking his head in disbelief.
example.egtrans: “简直难以置信！”他一边说，一边不相信地摇着头。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to hold your hand up in the air with your fingers and thumb bent, and move it forcefully backwards and forwards, to show that you are angry

example.eg: He shook his fist at the driver who pulled out in front of him.
example.egtrans: 他向那个突然由路边冲到他前面行驶的司机挥了挥拳头。

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause to feel upset and worried
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使烦恼；使心绪不定；使震惊

example.eg: The child seemed nervous and visibly shaken.
example.egtrans: 这孩子看上去很紧张，明显是吓着了。

example.eg: The news has shaken the whole country.
example.egtrans: 消息震惊了全国。

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something less certain, firm, or strong

example.eg: What has happened has shaken the foundations of her belief.
example.egtrans: 发生的事情动摇了她信仰的根基。

example.eg: After six defeats in a row, the team's confidence has been badly shaken.
example.egtrans: 在六连败后，球队的信心大挫。

example.eg: This discovery may shake (up) traditional theories on how mountains are formed.
example.egtrans: 这个发现可能会动摇关于山脉形成的传统理论。

dsense.name: shake
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get rid of or escape from something

example.eg: It's very difficult to shake the habit of a lifetime.
example.egtrans: 终身养成的习惯是很难改掉的。

example.eg: The company has so far been unable to shake (off) its reputation for being old-fashioned.
example.egtrans: 该公司到现在为止还未能摆脱其因循守旧的名声。

shake.name: shake
shake.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of shaking something

example.eg: She gave the box a shake to see if there was anything inside it.
example.egtrans: 她摇了摇盒子，看里面有没有东西。

example.eg: "No, no, no," he said with a shake of his head.
example.egtrans: “不，不，不，”他摇着头说。

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         milkshake

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: short, quick movements from side to side that your body makes because you are ill, are frightened, or have drunk too much alcohol

example.eg: I watched her hands as she prepared coffee and she definitely had the shakes.
example.egtrans: 她准备咖啡的时候，我看着她的手，她绝对在发抖。

shallow.name: shallow
shallow.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: shallow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having only a short distance from the top to the bottom

example.eg: The stream was fairly shallow so we were able to walk across it.
example.egtrans: 小溪很浅，所以我们可以趟水过去。

example.eg: She told her children to stay in the shallow end (of the swimming pool).
example.egtrans: 她叫孩子们留在（游泳池的）浅水区。

example.eg: Fry the onions in a shallow pan.
example.egtrans: 用浅平底锅把洋葱煎一下。

example.eg: These beech trees have shallow roots (= roots which do not go very deep into the ground).
example.egtrans: 这些山毛榉的根不深。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: breathing in which you only take a small amount of air into your lungs with each breath

dsense.name: shallow
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not showing serious or careful thought

example.eg: I thought the film was pretty shallow.
example.egtrans: 我认为这部电影很肤浅。

example.eg: He's physically attractive, but shallow.
example.egtrans: 他外表吸引人，但是内心肤浅。

shallow.name: shallow
shallow.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the shallow part of an area of water

example.eg: Alligators live in the shallows.
example.egtrans: 短吻鳄生活在浅水处。

Shareable.name: shareable
Shareable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: able to be shared with other people, especially over the internet
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指通过互联网）可与他人分享的

example.eg: an online shareable calendar
example.egtrans: 网上可分享的日历

shared.name: shared
shared.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: owned, divided, felt, or experienced by more than one person

example.eg: The company is in shared ownership.
example.egtrans: 这家公司是由多人共同拥有的。

example.eg: She and her husband have many shared interests.
example.egtrans: 她和她丈夫有许多共同的兴趣。

example.eg: We talked about our shared experiences of India.
example.egtrans: 我们谈论着我们在印度的共同经历。

sharpen.name: sharpen
sharpen.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something sharp or sharper

example.eg: My pencil is blunt - I'll have to sharpen it.
example.egtrans: 我的铅笔钝了——我得削一下。

example.eg: The company is cutting production costs in an attempt to sharpen its competitive edge (= in order to improve how competitive it is).
example.egtrans: 这家公司正降低生产成本，以增强竞争力。

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something stronger

example.eg: Recent changes have sharpened competition between the airlines.
example.egtrans: 近来的种种变化加剧了航空公司之间的竞争。

example.eg: The prison riots have sharpened the debate about how prisons should be run.
example.egtrans: 监狱暴动加剧了有关监狱该如何管理的争论。

trans_examp.trans_en: to improve

example.eg: I hope this course will help me sharpen my computer skills.
example.egtrans: 我希望这门课程能帮助我提高电脑操作技能。

example.eg: I went to university to sharpen my mind.
example.egtrans: 我上大学是为了让自己的头脑更加敏锐。

example.eg: We'll need to sharpen our wits if we're going to defeat Jack's team.
example.egtrans: 要击败杰克的队，我们需要更加聪明一些。

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something clearer

example.eg: How do you sharpen the focus on this camera?
example.egtrans: 这台相机的焦距怎么调清楚呢？

dsense.name: sharpen
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something play a higher musical note
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使提高音调；使提高半音

example.eg: You need to sharpen the A string on your violin.
example.egtrans: 你小提琴上的 A 弦应升半音。

sheet.name: sheet
sheet.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sheet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large piece of thin cloth used on a bed for sleeping on or under

example.eg: I've put clean sheets on the bed.
example.egtrans: 我已经给床铺上了干净的床单。

dsense.name: sheet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large, thin, flat, usually rectangular piece of something

example.eg: a sheet of glass
example.egtrans: 一片玻璃

example.eg: They fixed a polythene/plastic sheet over the broken window.
example.egtrans: 他们在破损的窗户上补上了一块聚乙烯／塑料纸。

dsense.name: sheet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper

example.eg: some sheets of wrapping paper
example.egtrans: 几张包装纸

example.eg: The application form was a single sheet of paper.
example.egtrans: 申请表只有一张纸。

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper with something printed on it

example.eg: The tourist office provides a weekly information sheet about things that are happening in the town.
example.egtrans: 旅游办公室每周提供一份有关本市新闻的信息通报。

dsense.name: sheet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a large, wide mass of something such as fire or ice

example.eg: A sheet of flame shot up into the air immediately after the explosion.
example.egtrans: 爆炸之后，紧接着腾起一片烈焰。

example.eg: A thick sheet of ice had formed over the water.
example.egtrans: 水面上结了厚厚的一层冰。

dsense.name: sheet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a large quantity of rain

example.eg: The rain was coming down in sheets.
example.egtrans: 大雨如注。

sheet.name: sheet
sheet.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to rain very hard

example.eg: We can't go out yet, it's sheeting down outside.
example.egtrans: 我们还不能出去，外面正下着倾盆大雨。

example.eg: Rain sheeted against the windows.
example.egtrans: 雨水敲打着窗户。

shorten.name: shorten
shorten.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to become shorter or to make something shorter

example.eg: As you grow older, your spine shortens by about an inch.
example.egtrans: 随着年龄变老，你的脊柱将缩短约1英寸。

example.eg: I've asked him to shorten my grey trousers.
example.egtrans: 我已经请他把我的灰色裤子改短一些。

example.eg: The name William is often shortened to Bill.
example.egtrans: “威廉”这个名字经常被简称为“比尔”。

shorthand.name: shorthand
shorthand.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a system of fast writing that uses lines and simple signs to represent words and phrases

example.eg: Their conversations were taken down in shorthand by a secretary.
example.egtrans: 他们谈话的内容由一位秘书速记了下来。

Sibling.name: sibling
Sibling.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a brother or sister

example.eg: I have four siblings: three brothers and a sister.
example.egtrans: 我有4个兄弟姐妹：3个兄弟，1个姐姐。

example.eg: There was great sibling rivalry (= competition) between Peter and his brother.
example.egtrans: 彼得和他的弟弟之间争斗得很厉害。

side effect.name: side effect
side effect.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an unpleasant effect of a drug that happens in addition to the main effect

example.eg: Does this drug have any side effects?
example.egtrans: 这种药有什么副作用吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: an unexpected result of a situation

example.eg: A side effect of the new law is that fewer people will take out insurance.
example.egtrans: 这项新法律的一个未曾预料的结果是购买保险的人少了。

side-effect.name: side effect
side-effect.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an unpleasant effect of a drug that happens in addition to the main effect

example.eg: Does this drug have any side effects?
example.egtrans: 这种药有什么副作用吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: an unexpected result of a situation

example.eg: A side effect of the new law is that fewer people will take out insurance.
example.egtrans: 这项新法律的一个未曾预料的结果是购买保险的人少了。

side.name: side
side.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flat outer surface of an object, especially one that is not the top, the bottom, the front, or the back

example.eg: The names of ships are usually painted on their sides.
example.egtrans: 船的名字通常漆在船的侧面。

example.eg: The window on the right side of the house was open.
example.egtrans: 房子右侧的窗户开着。

example.eg: Please write on one side of the paper only.
example.egtrans: 请只在纸的一面书写。

example.eg: I've already written four sides (= pages of writing) for my essay.
example.egtrans: 我的论文已经写了4页纸了。

example.eg: Canadian coins have a picture of the British Queen's head on one side.
example.egtrans: 加拿大硬币的一面有女王的头像。

example.eg: Please use the side entrance.
example.egtrans: 请走侧门。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an edge or border of something

example.eg: A square has four sides.
example.egtrans: 正方形有4条边。

example.eg: There are trees on both sides of the road.
example.egtrans: 公路两旁都有树。

example.eg: They were surrounded on all sides/on every side by curious children.
example.egtrans: 他们被好奇的孩子们团团围住。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a place next to something

example.eg: I have a small table at/by the side of (= next to) my bed.
example.egtrans: 我的床边有一张小桌子。

example.eg: He stayed at/by her side (= with her) throughout her long illness.
example.egtrans: 在她久病期间，他一直陪伴着她。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a restaurant, an extra dish of food, for example vegetables or salad, that is served with the main dish, sometimes on a separate plate

example.eg: I’ll have a side of onion rings.
example.egtrans: 我要一个洋葱圈当配菜。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: next to each other
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 肩并肩地；一个挨一个地

example.eg: The children sat side by side on the sofa watching television.
example.egtrans: 孩子们肩并肩地坐在沙发上看电视。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of something, especially in relation to a real or imagined central line

example.eg: He likes to sleep on the right side of the bed.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢睡在床的右边。

example.eg: In Britain, cars drive on the left side of the road.
example.egtrans: 在英国，汽车靠左侧行驶。

example.eg: There is no money on my mother's side (of the family).
example.egtrans: 我娘家那边没有钱。

example.eg: I could just see Joan on the far/other side of the room.
example.egtrans: 我能看见琼在房间的另一边。

example.eg: Children came running from all sides (= from all directions).
example.egtrans: 孩子们从四面八方跑来。

trans_examp.trans_en: the part of the body from under the arm to the top of the leg

example.eg: I have a pain in my side.
example.egtrans: 我的肋部疼痛。

trans_examp.trans_en: a television channel

example.eg: What side is "Coronation Street" on?
example.egtrans: 哪家电视台在播出《加冕街》？

trans_examp.trans_en: half of an animal's body, considered as meat

example.eg: She bought a side of lamb from the butcher.
example.egtrans: 她从肉店里买了半扇羔羊肉。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: from left to right and from right to left

example.eg: The curtains were swinging from side to side in the breeze.
example.egtrans: 窗帘在微风中来回摆动。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of two or more opposing teams or groups
trans_examp.trans_cn: （多个相互对立的团队中的）一方

example.eg: This is a war which neither side can win.
example.egtrans: 这是一场双方都无法打赢的战争。

example.eg: Our side (= team) lost again on Saturday.
example.egtrans: 我们队星期六又输了。

example.eg: Which/Whose side are you on (= which team are you playing for/supporting)?
example.egtrans: 你是哪个队的？

example.eg: Don't be angry with me - I'm on your side (= I want to help you).
example.egtrans: 不要生我的气——我是站在你这边的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to support one person or group rather than another, in an argument or war
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （在争论或战争中）表明立场，支持一方

example.eg: My mother never takes sides when my brother and I argue.
example.egtrans: 我和弟弟吵架时，我母亲从不偏袒任何一方。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to support someone in an argument

example.eg: My mother always takes my father's side when I argue with him.
example.egtrans: 我和父亲争论时，母亲总是站在他一边。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an opinion held in an argument, or a way of considering something

example.eg: There are at least two sides to every question.
example.egtrans: 每个问题至少有两个方面。

example.eg: I've listened to your side of the story, but I still think you were wrong to do what you did.
example.egtrans: 我已经听过你对此事的说法，但我仍然认为你的所作所为是错误的。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a situation, system, etc. that can be considered or dealt with separately
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某一情形或系统中可单独处理的）一部分

example.eg: She takes care of the financial side of things.
example.egtrans: 她负责财务方面的事务。

example.eg: Fortunately my boss did see the funny side of the situation.
example.egtrans: 还好，我的上司也看到了其中好笑的一面。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of someone's character

example.eg: She seems quite fierce, but actually she has a gentle side.
example.egtrans: 她看起来很凶，但实际上她也有温柔的一面。

side.name: side
side.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not in or at the centre or main part of something

example.eg: We parked the car on a side street/road (= a small road, especially one that joins on to a main road).
example.egtrans: 我把汽车停在小道上。

example.eg: I think that's a side issue (= a subject which is separate from the main one) which we should talk about later.
example.egtrans: 我认为这是个次要问题，我们应该以后再讨论。

example.eg: I'd like a side dish of potatoes (= some potatoes on a separate plate).
example.egtrans: 我想要盘土豆作为配菜。

sign.name: sign
sign.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to write your name, usually on a written or printed document, to show that you agree with its contents or have written or created it yourself

example.eg: to sign a letter/cheque/contract/lease/agreement
example.egtrans: 在信件／支票／合同／租约／协议上签名

example.eg: Sign here, please.
example.egtrans: 请在这儿签名。

example.eg: He signed his name at the end of the letter.
example.egtrans: 他在信的末尾签上了自己的名字。

example.eg: He signed himself "Mark Taylor".
example.egtrans: 他签上了自己的名字“马克‧泰勒”。

example.eg: She said the painting was by Picasso, but it wasn't signed.
example.egtrans: 她说这幅画是毕加索创作的，但画上没有他的签名。

trans_examp.trans_en: in sport, to make a legal written agreement to employ a player

example.eg: The team has just signed a new player.
example.egtrans: 球队刚刚与一名新球员签约。

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give an order or information, or make a request, using hand and body movements

example.eg: He signed for/to the waiter to bring him another drink.
example.egtrans: 他示意侍者再给他一份饮料。

example.eg: He signed to the waiter that he wanted another drink.
example.egtrans: 他向侍者示意，想再要一份饮料。

trans_examp.trans_en: to use sign language (= language used by people who cannot hear or talk)

sign.name: sign
sign.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a notice giving information, directions, a warning, etc.

example.eg: a road sign
example.egtrans: 路标

example.eg: a shop sign
example.egtrans: 商店招牌

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a movement of the body that gives information or an instruction

example.eg: She pointed to her watch as a sign that it was getting late and she wanted to leave.
example.egtrans: 她指着手表示意已经很晚了，她想离开。

example.eg: He made/gave a sign to his boyfriend to stop talking.
example.egtrans: 她示意男朋友停止讲话。

example.eg: The priest made the sign of the cross (= made the shape of a cross by moving his hand between four points on his chest) when he entered the church.
example.egtrans: 牧师走进教堂时，在胸前画了个十字。

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something showing that something else exists or might happen or exist in the future

example.eg: His inability to handle the situation is a sure sign of weakness.
example.egtrans: 他无法控制局面无疑是一种软弱的表现。

example.eg: The fact that he's eating more is a sign that he's feeling better.
example.egtrans: 他能多吃东西表明他感觉好些了。

example.eg: I've searched for my hat, but there's no sign of it anywhere (= I can't find it).
example.egtrans: 我在找我的帽子，但到处都没有它的踪影。

example.eg: There was no sign of life in the building (= there seemed to be no one in it).
example.egtrans: 建筑物里看不到人影。

example.eg: Billy's work at school has shown signs of improvement this year.
example.egtrans: 比利的学业今年有进步的迹象。

example.eg: There is every sign that/All the signs are that the worst is over.
example.egtrans: 各种迹象表明，最糟糕的时期已经过去了。

dsense.name: sign
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a written or printed mark that has a standard meaning

example.eg: + and - are mathematical signs.
example.egtrans: ＋和－是数学符号。

example.eg: £ is the sign for the British pound.
example.egtrans: £是表示英镑的符号。

signature.name: signature
signature.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: your name written by yourself, always in the same way, usually to show that something has been written or agreed by you

silent.name: silent
silent.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: silent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: without any sound

example.eg: The empty house was completely silent.
example.egtrans: 那座空房子一片寂静。

example.eg: It was four o'clock in the morning and the streets were as silent as the grave (= completely silent).
example.egtrans: 那是凌晨四点，街道如坟墓一样寂静。

dsense.name: silent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: without talking

example.eg: She whispered a silent prayer that her wounded brother would not die.
example.egtrans: 她默默地祷告，希望她受伤的兄弟不会死去。

example.eg: The police officer told the criminal that he had the right to remain silent.
example.egtrans: 警官告诉罪犯他有权保持沉默。

example.eg: He was silent on/about his plans for the future.
example.egtrans: 他对将来的打算保持沉默。

example.eg: Arthur has always been the strong, silent type (= a type of person, usually a man, who says very little).
example.egtrans: 阿瑟一直是那种坚强而沉默的人。

silent.name: silent
silent.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a setting on an electronic device that stops it from making a noise when it receives a message

example.eg: The show's about to start so I'm putting my phone on silent.
example.egtrans: 演出马上开始了，我把电话改到了静音。

similarity.name: similarity
similarity.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that people or things look or are the same

example.eg: I can see the similarity between you and your mother.
example.egtrans: 我能看出你和你母亲的相似之处。

example.eg: The book bears several striking similarities to last year's bestseller.
example.egtrans: 这本书和去年的畅销书有几个方面惊人地相似。

similarly.name: similarly
similarly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a similar way

example.eg: The children were similarly dressed.
example.egtrans: 孩子们的打扮很相似。

example.eg: Cars must stop at red traffic lights: similarly, bicycles have to stop too.
example.egtrans: 汽车遇到红灯时必须停下来，同样，自行车也应该停下来。

simple.name: simple
simple.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: simple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: easy to understand or do; not difficult

example.eg: The instructions were written in simple English.
example.egtrans: 这些说明书是用简单易懂的英语写成的。

example.eg: It's simple to find our house.
example.egtrans: 我们的房子很容易找到。

example.eg: I want an explanation, but keep/make it simple.
example.egtrans: 我需要解释，不过要简单些。

dsense.name: simple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe the one important fact, truth, etc.

example.eg: We didn't go swimming for the simple reason that the water was too cold.
example.egtrans: 我们没去游泳纯粹是因为水太凉了。

dsense.name: simple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: without decoration; plain

example.eg: I like simple food better than fancy dishes.
example.egtrans: 比起精美的菜肴，我更喜欢平常的食物。

dsense.name: simple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having or made of only one or a few parts

example.eg: A hammer is a simple tool.
example.egtrans: 锤子是一种简单的工具。

example.eg: Simple forms of life have only one cell.
example.egtrans: 简单的生命形式只有一个细胞。

dsense.name: simple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: ordinary; traditional or natural rather than modern and complicated

example.eg: He was just a simple fisherman.
example.egtrans: 他只是个淳朴的渔夫。

dsense.name: simple
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A simple person does not have a normal level of intelligence.

example.eg: He was simple, but harmless.
example.egtrans: 他有点儿傻，但不会伤人。

simplicity.name: simplicity
simplicity.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: simplicity
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that something is easy to understand or do

example.eg: The advantage of the plan is its simplicity.
example.egtrans: 这项计划的优点是简单易行。

example.eg: The test was simplicity itself (= very easy).
example.egtrans: 考试非常简单。

dsense.name: simplicity
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that something is ordinary, traditional, or natural, and not complicated

example.eg: The old people led a life of great simplicity (= with few possessions and little money).
example.egtrans: 这位老人过着十分简朴的生活。

dsense.name: simplicity
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that something is plain and has no decoration

simply.name: simply
simply.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: simply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely or as much as possible

example.eg: You look simply (= really) beautiful in that dress.
example.egtrans: 你穿那条裙子看上去真漂亮。

example.eg: The hunger in parts of Africa is terrible - there's (quite) simply (= without doubt) no other word for it.
example.egtrans: 非洲部分地区的饥荒真可怕——简直没有什么语言可以形容。

trans_examp.trans_en: only

example.eg: I don't like my job - I simply do it for the money.
example.egtrans: 我不喜欢自己的工作——我纯粹是为了钱才干的。

dsense.name: simply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in an easy way

example.eg: He explained it as simply as he could, but the class still didn't understand.
example.egtrans: 他尽可能解释得简单些，但学生们依然理解不了。

dsense.name: simply
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a plain way

example.eg: a simply decorated apartment
example.egtrans: 一套朴素装修的公寓

since.name: since
since.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

example.eg: Emma went to work in New York a year ago, and we haven't seen her since.
example.egtrans: 埃玛一年前去纽约工作了，自那时起我们就没有见过她。

example.eg: He started working for the company in 1995, and has been there ever since (= and is still there).
example.egtrans: 他1995年就开始为那家公司工作，在此之后就一直在那里。

example.eg: I've long since (= long ago) forgotten any Latin I ever learned.
example.egtrans: 我早就把我学过的那点拉丁语忘光了。

since.name: since
since.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

example.eg: He hasn't won a game since last year.
example.egtrans: 他自去年起就再没有赢过比赛。

example.eg: It was the hottest October since records began.
example.egtrans: 这是有史以来最热的十月。

since.name: since
since.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

dsense.name: since
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: because; as

example.eg: Since we've got a few minutes to wait for the train, let's have a cup of coffee.
example.egtrans: 既然等火车还需要几分钟，我们去喝杯咖啡吧。

dsense.name: since
dsense.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: from a particular time in the past until a later time, or until now

example.eg: I've been very busy since I came back from holiday.
example.egtrans: 我度完假回来后就一直很忙。

singleton.name: singleton
singleton.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: singleton
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a man or woman who does not have a romantic or sexual partner

dsense.name: singleton
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one baby or baby animal that is born and is not a twin, etc.

dsense.name: singleton
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a playing card that is the only one of that suit that a player has
trans_examp.trans_cn: 单张（所发13张牌中属某一花色的唯一的一张那个牌）

example.eg: Jack has a singleton in hearts.
example.egtrans: 杰克有一张唯一的红桃。

site.name: site
site.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: site
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a place where something is, was, or will be built, or where something happened, is happening, or will happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （建筑物的）地点，位置；建筑工地；（某事发生的）地点，现场

example.eg: a building site
example.egtrans: 建筑工地

example.eg: The company hasn't yet chosen the site for the new hospital.
example.egtrans: 公司尚未选定新医院的院址。

example.eg: This is the site of the accident.
example.egtrans: 这就是事故现场。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: inside a factory, office building, etc.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 在（工厂、办公楼等的）内部

example.eg: There are two restaurants on site.
example.egtrans: 内部有两家饭店。

example.eg: The office complex has an on-site nursery.
example.egtrans: 这片办公楼群有一个内部托儿所。

dsense.name: site
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a website

dsense.name: site
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the piece of ground on which you can put up a tent, park a caravan, etc.

example.eg: We chose a large, level site for our tent.
example.egtrans: 我们选了一大片平坦的地方搭帐篷。

site.name: site
site.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to exist or be built in a particular place

example.eg: The company's head office is sited in Rome.
example.egtrans: 该公司的总部设在罗马。

situation.name: situation
situation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the set of things that are happening and the conditions that exist at a particular time and place

example.eg: the economic/political situation
example.egtrans: 经济／政治形势

example.eg: Her news put me in a difficult situation.
example.egtrans: 她的消息让我陷入困难的境地。

example.eg: "Would you get involved in a fight?" "It would depend on the situation."
example.egtrans: “你会和别人打架吗？”“这要看具体情况。”

example.eg: I'll worry about it if/when/as the situation arises (= if/when/as it happens).
example.egtrans: 如果这种情况发生/这种情况发生时，我会担忧的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a job

example.eg: My sister has a good situation as a teacher in the local school.
example.egtrans: 我姐姐有一份好工作，在当地学校当老师。

trans_examp.trans_en: the position of something, especially a town, building, etc.

example.eg: The house's situation in the river valley is perfect.
example.egtrans: 房子在河谷中的位置极佳。

skeleton.name: skeleton
skeleton.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the frame of bones supporting a human or animal body

example.eg: We found an old sheep skeleton up on the cliffs.
example.egtrans: 我们在悬崖上发现了一副老绵羊的骨架。

example.eg: Her long illness reduced her to a skeleton (= made her very thin).
example.egtrans: 长期的疾病使她瘦得只剩皮包骨头了。

trans_examp.trans_en: the most basic form or structure of something

example.eg: The skeleton of my book is written/My book is in skeleton form - now I just have to add the details.
example.egtrans: 我的书已经有了框架——现在我只需要添加细节了。

slash.name: slash
slash.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cut with a sharp blade using a quick, strong movement

example.eg: The museum was broken into last night and several paintings were slashed.
example.egtrans: 昨晚有人闯进了博物馆，有几幅画被划破了。

example.eg: She tried to commit suicide by slashing her wrists.
example.egtrans: 她试图割腕自杀。

example.eg: We had to slash (our way) through the long grass to clear a path.
example.egtrans: 我们不得不在茂盛的草丛里踩出一条通道。

trans_examp.trans_en: to very much reduce something, such as money or jobs
trans_examp.trans_cn: 大幅削减，大幅减少（金钱、工作等）

example.eg: Prices have been slashed by 50 percent!
example.egtrans: 价格直降50%！

slash.name: slash
slash.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: slash
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the symbol / used in writing to separate letters, numbers, or words

example.eg: You often write a slash between alternatives, for example, "and/or".
example.egtrans: 通常在选择项之间会加斜线号，比如“和／或”。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to mean "or", or to show that something has two uses
trans_examp.trans_cn: 原意为“斜线号”，表示“或者”

example.eg: The room functions as a guest bedroom slash study.
example.egtrans: 这间屋子用作客房或书房。

dsense.name: slash
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, deep cut
a fast, long movement to hit something

example.eg: Ben took a wild slash at the ball and luckily managed to hit it.
example.egtrans: 本拼命地挥棒击球，居然幸运地击中了。

trans_examp.trans_en: a decorative opening in a piece of clothing, often with a different colour showing through it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （衣服上的）装饰性开叉（常有不同的颜色透过开叉显示出来）

example.eg: My new dress is pale blue, with a dark blue slash in the sleeves.
example.egtrans: 我的新衣服是淡蓝色的，在袖口上有一个深蓝色的装饰性开叉。

dsense.name: slash
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of going to the toilet and urinating

slightly.name: slightly
slightly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: slightly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: a little

example.eg: She's slightly taller than her sister.
example.egtrans: 她比她姐姐稍高一点儿。

example.eg: I'm slightly upset she forgot my birthday.
example.egtrans: 她忘了我的生日，我有点儿不高兴。

example.eg: I'm slightly worried that she'll get lost on the way.
example.egtrans: 我有点担心她会迷路。

dsense.name: slightly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: Someone who is slightly built is thin and delicate.

slip.name: slip
slip.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to slide without intending to

example.eg: She slipped on the ice.
example.egtrans: 她在冰上滑倒了。

example.eg: Careful you don't slip - there's water on the floor.
example.egtrans: 小心别滑倒了——地板上有水。

example.eg: The razor slipped while he was shaving and he cut himself.
example.egtrans: 他刮胡子时剃须刀一滑，把自己划伤了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to move out of the correct position

example.eg: Her hat had slipped over one eye.
example.egtrans: 她的一只眼睛被滑下的帽子盖住了。

example.eg: He could feel the rope slipping out of his grasp.
example.egtrans: 他能感觉到绳子正从他手中滑走。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go somewhere or put something somewhere quickly, often so that you are not noticed
trans_examp.trans_cn: 溜走；迅速地做；悄悄地做

example.eg: Just slip out of the room while nobody's looking.
example.egtrans: 趁没人注意时溜出房间。

example.eg: She slipped between the cool cotton sheets and was soon asleep.
example.egtrans: 她钻进凉爽的棉褥单里，很快就睡着了。

example.eg: He slipped a piece of paper into my hand with his address on it.
example.egtrans: 他偷偷把一张写有他地址的纸塞到我的手里。

example.eg: If you slip the waiter some money/slip some money to the waiter he'll give you the best table.
example.egtrans: 如果你偷偷塞点钱给侍者，他会为你安排最好的位置。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go into a worse state, often because of lack of control or care

example.eg: Productivity in the factory has slipped noticeably in the last year.
example.egtrans: 工厂一年来生产率显著下降。

example.eg: The schedule has started to slip (= things are happening later than planned).
example.egtrans: 日程开始推迟。

example.eg: I don't know what went wrong, I must be slipping.
example.egtrans: 我不知道哪里出了问题，我一定是退步了。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get free from, leave, or escape something

example.eg: The ship slipped its moorings.
example.egtrans: 船漂离了停泊处。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go down in value

example.eg: The dollar slipped against the Japanese yen.
example.egtrans: 美元对日元汇率下降。

slip.name: slip
slip.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of paper

example.eg: a slip of paper
example.egtrans: 一张纸条

example.eg: If you want to order a book fill out the green slip.
example.egtrans: 如果想订购书，就填写那张绿色单子。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small mistake

example.eg: She's made one or two slips - mainly spelling errors - but it's basically well written.
example.egtrans: 她犯了一两个小错误——主要是拼写错误——不过基本上写得很不错。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of falling or sliding

example.eg: One slip meant a long tumble to the rocks below.
example.egtrans: 一旦滑倒就意味着一路摔滚到下面的石头上。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an occasion when something becomes worse

example.eg: A slip in the value of the U.S. dollar helped push prices higher.
example.egtrans: 美元下跌推高了价格。

example.eg: a slip in standards
example.egtrans: 水平下跌

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of underwear for a woman or girl that is like a dress or skirt

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a place where a boat or ship can be parked, between two piers
trans_examp.trans_cn: 两座码头之间可停船的水面

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: small and thin, usually because of being young

example.eg: I knew her when she was a slip of a girl.
example.egtrans: 她还是个小女孩的时候我就认识她了。

dsense.name: slip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to escape from someone who is following or chasing you

sneaky.name: sneaky
sneaky.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: doing things in a secret and unfair way
trans_examp.trans_cn: 偷偷摸摸的；鬼鬼祟祟的

example.eg: a sneaky plan
example.egtrans: 偷偷摸摸的计划

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe something you do, eat, or drink especially when you do it without telling anyone or when you should not really do it

example.eg: She snuck out for a sneaky cigarette.
example.egtrans: 她跑出去悄悄地抽了根烟。

example.eg: There's always the temptation to take a sneaky peek at the presents under the Christmas tree.
example.egtrans: 去悄悄地偷看一眼放在圣诞树下的礼物是件诱人的事。

snippet.name: snippet
snippet.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small and often interesting piece of news, information, or conversation
trans_examp.trans_cn: 一条，一则（新闻、消息或谈话）

example.eg: I heard an interesting snippet on the radio this morning.
example.egtrans: 今天早上我从广播里听到了一则有趣的新闻。

example.eg: I love listening to snippets of conversation in restaurants.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢在饭店里听一些谈话的片断。

so-called.name: so-called
so-called.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to show that you think a word that is used to describe someone or something is not suitable or not correct

example.eg: It was one of his so-called friends who supplied him with the drugs that killed him.
example.egtrans: 是他一个所谓的朋友为他提供毒品，让他丧了命。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to introduce a new word or phrase that is not yet known by many people

example.eg: It isn't yet clear how dangerous these so-called "super-rats" are.
example.egtrans: 目前还不清楚这种名叫“超级老鼠”的东西有多危险。

solely.name: solely
solely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: only and not involving anyone or anything else

example.eg: I bought it solely for that purpose.
example.egtrans: 我仅仅是为那个目的才买的。

example.eg: It seems he's not solely to blame for the accident.
example.egtrans: 发生这起事故似乎不能只责怪他。

example.eg: The product's success cannot be attributable solely to the ads.
example.egtrans: 该产品的成功不能只归因于广告宣传。

sophisticated.name: sophisticated
sophisticated.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having a good understanding of the way people behave and/or a good knowledge of culture and fashion
trans_examp.trans_cn: 精于世故的，老练的；见多识广的；很有品位的

example.eg: She was slim, svelte, and sophisticated.
example.egtrans: 她身材苗条，体态娇美，处事练达。

example.eg: I don't think I have any books that would suit your sophisticated tastes.
example.egtrans: 我认为我没有什么书能满足你那高雅的品位。

example.eg: He was older than me and from London and I thought him very sophisticated.
example.egtrans: 他比我大，而且来自伦敦，我觉得他为人很老练。

trans_examp.trans_en: intelligent or made in a complicated way and therefore able to do complicated tasks

example.eg: I think a more sophisticated approach is needed to solve this problem.
example.egtrans: 我认为要解决这个问题需要更为高明的方法。

example.eg: These are among the most sophisticated weapons in the world.
example.egtrans: 这些属于世界上最尖端的武器。

sort.name: sort
sort.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of things that are of the same type or that share similar qualities

example.eg: We both like the same sort of music.
example.egtrans: 我们俩喜欢同一类音乐。

example.eg: I'm going to have a salad of some sort.
example.egtrans: 我想吃一些色拉。

example.eg: What sort of shoes will I need?
example.egtrans: 我需要什么样的鞋子呢？

example.eg: We saw all sorts (= many types) of animals in the park.
example.egtrans: 我们在公园里看见了各种各样的动物。

example.eg: Many sorts of bacteria are resistant to penicillin.
example.egtrans: 有很多种细菌能抵抗青霉素。

example.eg: This sort of camera is very expensive.
example.egtrans: 这种照相机很贵。

example.eg: Plants of this sort need shady conditions.
example.egtrans: 这种植物需要在阴凉的环境下生长。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the type of thing or person that you like

example.eg: Hmm, this is my sort of wine!
example.egtrans: 嗯，这是我喜欢的葡萄酒！

example.eg: I'd have thought these black trousers were more your sort of thing.
example.egtrans: 我本以为这条黑色裤子才是你喜欢的那种。

example.eg: I wouldn't have thought he was your sort (= was the type of man you would be attracted to).
example.egtrans: 我没想到你喜欢他这种类型。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to show that what you have just said is only an example from a much larger group of things

example.eg: They sell souvenirs, postcards, that sort of thing.
example.egtrans: 他们卖纪念品、明信片之类的东西。

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person having the stated or suggested character

example.eg: He seemed like a decent sort to me.
example.egtrans: 在我看来，他似乎是很正派的那种人。

sort.name: sort
sort.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a number of things in an order or to separate them into groups

example.eg: Paper, plastic, and cans are sorted for recycling.
example.egtrans: 纸张、塑料和罐子分开归类以便回收。

example.eg: I'm going to sort these old books into those to be kept and those to be thrown away.
example.egtrans: 我打算把这些旧书分成要留下的和要扔掉的两类。

example.eg: You can use the computer to sort the newspaper articles alphabetically, by date, or by subject.
example.egtrans: 你可以用电脑把这些报刊文章按字母顺序、日期或主题进行排列。

example.eg: She found the ring while sorting (through) some clothes.
example.egtrans: 她在整理衣服时找到了那枚戒指。

dsense.name: sort
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to deal with something by repairing or organizing it

example.eg: Can you sort the car by tomorrow?
example.egtrans: 你明天能把汽车修好吗？

example.eg: We must get the phone sorted soon.
example.egtrans: 我们必须马上找人把电话修好。

example.eg: I must get this paperwork sorted before I go on holiday next week.
example.egtrans: 我下星期度假之前必须把这些文书工作处理完。

sound.name: sound
sound.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you can hear or that can be heard

example.eg: They could hear the sound of a bell tolling in the distance.
example.egtrans: 他们能听到远处的钟声。

example.eg: She stood completely still, not making a sound.
example.egtrans: 她静静地站在那儿，一声不吭。

example.eg: Suddenly we heard a loud knocking sound from the engine.
example.egtrans: 突然我们听见引擎发出响亮的砰砰声。

example.eg: Sound can travel over very large distances in water.
example.egtrans: 声音在水中能传播得很远。

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of recording and broadcasting sound such as from a performance of music or for a film
trans_examp.trans_cn: （音乐演出、电影等的）音响录制和播出，音响制作

example.eg: a sound engineer/recording
example.egtrans: 音响师／录音

trans_examp.trans_en: the volume or quality of the sound of a television or film

example.eg: Could you turn the sound down/up on the TV?
example.egtrans: 你把电视机的音量调低／高一点好吗？

trans_examp.trans_en: the particular quality of the music that a musician or a group of musicians produce
trans_examp.trans_cn: （个人或乐队的）音乐特色，音乐风格

example.eg: The band's sound is a distinctive mixture of funk and rap.
example.egtrans: 这支乐队结合了乡土爵士乐和说唱乐的音乐风格，很有特色。

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: how something seems to be, from what is said or written
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: …给人的印象（或感觉）；…的言外之意

example.eg: I like the sound of the beef in red wine sauce.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢牛肉浇红酒汁的感觉。

example.eg: By/From the sound of it I don't think it was her fault.
example.egtrans: 听上去我认为不是她的错。

example.eg: I'm going to be talking to over 90 people? I don't like the sound of that!
example.egtrans: 我要和90多个人谈话，是吗？我可不喜欢那样！

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a passage of sea connecting two larger areas of sea, or an area of sea mostly surrounded by land

example.eg: the Kalmar Sound
example.egtrans: 卡尔马海峡

sound.name: sound
sound.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to seem good, interesting, strange, etc. from what is said or written
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 听起来不错／听上去有意思／似乎很奇怪（等等）

example.eg: Your job sounds really interesting.
example.egtrans: 你的工作听起来真有趣。

example.eg: I know it sounds silly, but I'll miss him when he's gone.
example.egtrans: 我知道这听起来很傻，但他走了我会想他的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to seem like something, from what is said or written

example.eg: That sounds like a good idea.
example.egtrans: 那听起来像是个不错的主意。

example.eg: It sounds like you've got a sore throat.
example.egtrans: 你听上去好像喉咙有些发炎。

example.eg: It sounds as if they had a good holiday.
example.egtrans: 听起来他们似乎度过了一个愉快的假期。

example.eg: You're going skiing with three friends? That sounds like fun.
example.egtrans: 你要和3个朋友去滑雪？听起来很好玩。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to seem angry, happy, rude, etc. when you speak
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 听起来很生气／高兴／无礼（等等）

example.eg: He sounded very depressed when we spoke on the phone yesterday.
example.egtrans: 我们昨天通电话的时候，他听上去很沮丧。

example.eg: At the press conference, he sounded at his most relaxed.
example.egtrans: 新闻发布会上，他听起来十分轻松。

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a noise

example.eg: If the alarm sounds, leave the building immediately.
example.egtrans: 如果警报声响起，马上离开大楼。

example.eg: It sounds like a bird.
example.egtrans: 听起来像一只鸟。

example.eg: He sounds (= speaks) just like someone I used to work with.
example.egtrans: 他说话很像我以前的一个同事。

example.eg: Sounding the car's horn, she drove at high speed through the crowded streets.
example.egtrans: 她按响汽车喇叭，猛踩油门，飞速穿过熙熙攘攘的大街。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to cause a noise to be made or say or shout a message to warn people about something

example.eg: Quick, sound the alarm - there's a fire in the machine room!
example.egtrans: 快，拉警报——机房里着火了！

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to measure the depth of a mass of water, such as the sea, usually by sonar

sound.name: sound
sound.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not broken or damaged; healthy; in good condition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 无损伤的；完好的；健康的，健全的

example.eg: It's an old building but it's still structurally sound.
example.egtrans: 这是一座老建筑物，但结构依然完好。

example.eg: Considering his age, his body is surprisingly sound.
example.egtrans: 考虑到他的年龄，他的身体异常健康。

example.eg: Was she of sound mind (= not mentally ill) at the time of the incident?
example.egtrans: 事故发生时，她精神没有问题吧？

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: showing good judgment; able to be trusted

example.eg: She gave me some very sound advice.
example.egtrans: 她给了我一些非常好的建议。

example.eg: Are these pesticides environmentally sound (= will they not damage the environment)?
example.egtrans: 这些杀虫剂是否对环境无害？

example.eg: Government bonds are a sound investment.
example.egtrans: 购买政府债券是一种稳妥的投资。

dsense.name: sound
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: complete

example.eg: How sound is her knowledge of the subject?
example.egtrans: 她对这一学科了解得是否透彻？

sound.name: sound
sound.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of sleep) deep and peaceful

example.eg: He was sound asleep within moments of getting into bed.
example.egtrans: 他上床没多久就进入了梦乡。

soundness.name: soundness
soundness.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: soundness
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact of being in good condition

dsense.name: soundness
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality of having good judgment

source.name: source
source.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the place something comes from or starts at, or the cause of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 来源，出处；发源地；起源，根源

example.eg: a source of heat/energy/light
example.egtrans: 热源／能源／光源

example.eg: a heat/energy/light source
example.egtrans: 热源／能源／光源

example.eg: Oranges are a good source of vitamin C.
example.egtrans: 橙子富含维生素C。

example.eg: Experts are trying to track down the source of the contamination in the water supply.
example.egtrans: 专家们正试图找到水源中污染物的来源。

example.eg: We walked up the river to its source in the hills.
example.egtrans: 我们沿河上溯而行，一直走到其在山中的源头。

example.eg: Money is often a source of tension and disagreements in young married couples.
example.egtrans: 金钱往往是年轻夫妇关系紧张不和的起因。

trans_examp.trans_en: someone or something that supplies information

example.eg: The journalist refused to reveal her sources (= say who had given the information to her).
example.egtrans: 记者拒绝透露消息的来源。

example.eg: According to government sources (= people in the government) many MPs are worried about this issue.
example.egtrans: 政府方面透露，很多下议院议员对这个问题表示担忧。

example.eg: According to congressional sources (= people who work in Congress) many Representatives are worried about this issue.
example.egtrans: 国会方面透露，很多众议员对这个问题表示担忧。

example.eg: Always acknowledge your sources (= say which books you have used) at the end of a paper.
example.egtrans: 论文的末尾务必列出参考书目。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: at the place where something comes from

example.eg: Tax is deducted from my income at source.
example.egtrans: 我的工资还没拿到手就扣去了税金。

source.name: source
source.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get something from a particular place

example.eg: Where possible the produce used in our restaurant is sourced locally.
example.egtrans: 我们餐厅尽可能用当地出产的农产品。

spec.name: spec
spec.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
informal for
        
         specification   (= a detailed description of how something should be or has been done, made, etc.)
trans_examp.trans_cn: 规格；规范；标准；明细单；详细说明（specification的非正式说法）

example.eg: The article compares the specs of ten of the best-selling cars.
example.egtrans: 这篇文章比较了10款畅销汽车的规格配置。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: taking a chance, without being sure that you will get what you want

example.eg: We just turned up at the airport on spec, hoping that we'd be able to get tickets.
example.egtrans: 我们只不过到机场去碰碰运气，希望能买到机票。

example.eg: You could always send your CV to a few companies on spec.
example.egtrans: 你总还可以给几家公司寄去你的简历，碰碰运气嘛。

specific.name: specific
specific.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: specific
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to one thing and not others; particular

example.eg: The virus attacks specific cells in the brain.
example.egtrans: 这种病毒专门攻击大脑内特定的细胞。

example.eg: The money is intended to be used for specific purposes.
example.egtrans: 这笔钱有特定的用途。

example.eg: The disease seems to be specific to (= only found in) certain types of plant.
example.egtrans: 这种病似乎是某些植物所特有的。

example.eg: Is there anything specific you want from the shops?
example.egtrans: 在这些商店里你有什么特别的东西要买吗？

dsense.name: specific
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: clear and exact

example.eg: No specific allegations have yet been made about the prison officers' behaviour.
example.egtrans: 对于典狱官的行为，尚未作出明确的指控。

example.eg: Can you be more specific about where your back hurts?
example.egtrans: 你能不能更具体一点说你的背哪里疼？

specification.name: specification
specification.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a detailed description of how something should be done, made, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 规格；规范；标准；明细单；详细说明

example.eg: All products are made exactly to the customer's specifications.
example.egtrans: 所有产品完全按照客户的具体要求制造。

example.eg: A specification has been drawn up for the new military aircraft.
example.egtrans: 新型军用飞机的规格已经草拟出来了。

example.eg: a job specification
example.egtrans: 职位详细说明

example.eg: The cars have been built to a high specification (= a high standard).
example.egtrans: 汽车是按照高标准制造的。

specify.name: specify
specify.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to explain or describe something clearly and exactly

example.eg: He said we should meet but didn't specify a time.
example.egtrans: 他说我们应该见见面，但没说具体时间。

example.eg: The peace treaty clearly specifies the terms for the withdrawal of troops.
example.egtrans: 和平条约明确规定了撤军的条件。

example.eg: The newspaper report did not specify how the men were killed.
example.egtrans: 该报的报道并未说明被害人是如何被杀的。

example.eg: My contract specifies (that) I must give a month's notice if I leave my job.
example.egtrans: 我的合同上明确规定，如果我打算辞职，必须提前一个月告知。

example.eg: The loan must be repaid within a specified period/by a specified date.
example.egtrans: 贷款必须在指定期限内／指定日期前偿还。

sponsor.name: sponsor
sponsor.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to support a person, organization, or activity by giving money, encouragement, or other help

example.eg: The team is sponsored by JVC, so the players wear the letters JVC on their shirts.
example.egtrans: 该队是由JVC公司赞助的，所以队员们的衬衫上都有JVC几个字母。

example.eg: Eva said she was doing a ten-mile walk for charity and asked if I'd sponsor her.
example.egtrans: 伊娃说她打算步行10英里募集慈善捐款，问我愿不愿意赞助她。

spotty.name: spotty
spotty.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: spotty
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe a person with spots on their skin
trans_examp.trans_cn: （人的皮肤）多丘疹的，多粉刺的

example.eg: I knew him when he was just a spotty youth.
example.egtrans: 在他还是个满脸粉刺的少年时，我就认识他了。

dsense.name: spotty
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: bad in some parts
trans_examp.trans_cn: （质量）参差不齐的，有好有坏的

example.eg: She has a fairly spotty work record.
example.egtrans: 她的工作业绩时好时坏。

example.eg: Sales have picked up a little but they're still spotty.
example.egtrans: 销售有所好转，但仍然起伏不定。

spread.name: spread
spread.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause to) cover, reach, or have an effect on a wider or increasing area
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）展开，（使）铺开；（使）蔓延，（使）扩散

example.eg: The fire spread very rapidly because of the strong wind.
example.egtrans: 风很大，火势迅速蔓延开来。

example.eg: It started off as cancer of the liver but it spread to other areas of the body.
example.egtrans: 开始的时候是肝癌，后来扩散到了身体的其他部位。

example.eg: The redundancies are spread across the banking and building industries.
example.egtrans: 裁员之风席卷了银行业和建筑业。

example.eg: We spread the picnic rug out on the ground and sat down to eat.
example.egtrans: 我们把野餐毯铺在地上，坐下来吃东西。

example.eg: The virus is spread (= given to other people) through contact with blood and other body fluids.
example.egtrans: 病毒通过血液及其他体液的接触而传染。

example.eg: Are you spreading (= telling a lot of people) gossip/rumours again?
example.egtrans: 你是不是又在四处散播谣言了？

example.eg: If we spread (= divide) the work between us, it won't seem so bad.
example.egtrans: 如果我们大家分担一下工作，情况可能就没那么糟糕了。

example.eg: She spread her toast with a thick layer of butter./She spread a thick layer of butter on her toast.
example.egtrans: 她在吐司上涂了厚厚的一层黄油。

example.eg: It's a special sort of butter that spreads easily even when cold.
example.egtrans: 这是一种很特别的黄油，在凉的时候也很容易涂抹。

example.eg: The suburbs spread (out) for miles to either side of the city.
example.egtrans: 郊区向城市两边都伸展出数英里。

example.eg: Slowly a smile spread across her face.
example.egtrans: 她的脸上慢慢露出了微笑。

spread.name: spread
spread.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the development or growth of something so that it covers a larger area or affects a larger number of people

example.eg: The spread of the disease in the last few years has been alarming.
example.egtrans: 近几年这种疾病的广泛传播着实令人担忧。

trans_examp.trans_en: the area or range covered by something

example.eg: The survey found a wide spread of opinion over the proposed new building.
example.egtrans: 调查广泛征集了对于拟议中的新建筑的意见。

trans_examp.trans_en: a large article or advertisement covering one or more pages in a newspaper or magazine
trans_examp.trans_cn: 整版（或横贯几版的）文章（或广告）

example.eg: There's a double-page spread on the latest fashions.
example.egtrans: 有一篇横贯两版的文章介绍最新的时尚。

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a soft food for putting on bread and biscuits
trans_examp.trans_cn: 涂在面包（或饼干）上的食物；酱

example.eg: cheese/chocolate/fish spread
example.egtrans: 奶酪／巧克力／鱼酱

example.eg: There's bread and various spreads for tea.
example.egtrans: 茶点有面包和各种抹酱。

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         ranch   or other large area of land or water

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a meal, especially one for a special occasion with a lot of different dishes arranged on a table

example.eg: Sheila laid on (= made) a magnificent spread for us.
example.egtrans: 希拉为我们准备了丰盛的饭菜。

dsense.name: spread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the difference between two amounts, such as two prices or interest rates
trans_examp.trans_cn: 差异，差距；（价格或利率等之间的）差额

example.eg: The issue was priced at a spread of 115 basis points above Treasury bonds.
example.egtrans: 这一期的价格定在比财政部债券高115点的位置。

square.name: square
square.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flat shape with four sides of equal length and four angles of 90°

example.eg: First draw a square.
example.egtrans: 首先画一个正方形。

example.eg: It's a square-shaped room.
example.egtrans: 这是个正方形的房间。

trans_examp.trans_en: any square-shaped object

example.eg: When cooled, cut the chocolate brownies into squares.
example.egtrans: 冷却之后，将巧克力蛋糕切成四方块。

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of approximately square-shaped land in a city or a town, often including the buildings that surround it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （城镇中的）广场（常包括周围的建筑）

example.eg: Are they still living at 6 Eaton Square?
example.egtrans: 他们还住在伊顿广场6号吗？

example.eg: A band were playing in the town square.
example.egtrans: 一个乐队当时正在镇广场上演出。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular space on a board used for playing games

example.eg: She moved her castle forward three squares.
example.egtrans: 她把自己的车向前走了3格。

trans_examp.trans_en: a tool for drawing or testing a right angle

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a boring person who does not like new and exciting ideas

example.eg: He's a bit of a square.
example.egtrans: 他有点儿古板。

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the result of multiplying a number by itself

example.eg: The square of 7 is 49.
example.egtrans: 7的平方是49。

square.name: square
square.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having the shape of a square

example.eg: The recipe recommends that you use a square cake tin.
example.egtrans: 食谱建议使用方形蛋糕烤盘。

example.eg: He's got that square-jawed masculinity that a lot of women seem to find attractive.
example.egtrans: 他有个刚毅的方下巴，这在许多女人眼中似乎很有吸引力。

trans_examp.trans_en: used with units of measurement of length to express the total size of an area

example.eg: The floor is 3 m wide by 5 m long, so its total area is 15 sq m.
example.egtrans: 房间的地面是3米宽5米长，总面积是15平方米。

example.eg: The city itself covers 13 square miles.
example.egtrans: 该城市占地13平方英里。

example.eg: Ensure that the exposed area is less than 2 cm2.
example.egtrans: 要确保暴露在外的面积小于2平方厘米。

trans_examp.trans_en: Square is used immediately after measurements of length when expressing the length of the four sides of a square-shaped area.

example.eg: So you want carpet for a room that's eight metres square (= eight metres long and eight metres wide).
example.egtrans: 因此你需要8米见方的室内地毯。

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: equal or level

example.eg: Could you stand back from these shelves and tell me if they're square (= level)?
example.egtrans: 你能不能往后站一些，告诉我这些架子摆得正不正？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If two people are all square, one of them has paid off a debt to the other and neither now owes or is owed any money.
If two teams or players are (all) square, they have an equal number of goals or points.

example.eg: They're all square at 30 points each.
example.egtrans: 他们打成平局，每个都是30分。

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a straight line

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe a person who is boring and does not like new and exciting things

example.eg: Do you think my new haircut makes me look a bit square?
example.egtrans: 你觉得我的新发型是不是让我看上去有点儿古板？

square.name: square
square.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to multiply a number by itself

example.eg: 10 squared equals a hundred.
example.egtrans: 10的平方是100。

example.eg: 42 means four squared, and equals 16.
example.egtrans: 4的二次方就是4的平方，等于16。

dsense.name: square
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to pull your shoulders up and back because you feel determined to do something
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （表示决心已定）挺起胸膛，挺直身子

example.eg: He squared his shoulders and took a deep breath before diving into the pool.
example.egtrans: 他挺直肩膀，做了个深呼吸，然后扎进了游泳池。

stable.name: stable
stable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: firmly fixed or not likely to move or change

example.eg: If the foundations of the house aren't stable, collapse is possible.
example.egtrans: 如果房子的地基不稳，就有可能倒塌。

example.eg: After several part-time jobs, he's now got a stable job in a bank.
example.egtrans: 干了几份兼职工作之后，他目前在银行找到了一份稳定的工作。

example.eg: The hospital said she was in a stable condition (= not likely to get worse) following the operation.
example.egtrans: 院方说她手术之后情况稳定。

trans_examp.trans_en: A stable person is mentally healthy.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 精神健全的，精神状态稳定的

example.eg: She seems more stable these days.
example.egtrans: 她这些日子看来情绪稳定些了。

trans_examp.trans_en: A stable substance keeps the same chemical or atomic state.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （物质的化学状态或原子状态）稳定的

stable.name: stable
stable.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a building in which horses are kept
a group of racehorses that are owned or trained by one person
trans_examp.trans_cn: （属同一马主或驯马师的）一群赛马

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people who perform a similar activity and who are trained by the same person or employed by the same organization
trans_examp.trans_cn: （受训于同一人或受雇于同一机构的）一批人

example.eg: During the 1950s, Sun Records' stable of singers included Johnny Cash and Jerry Lee Lewis.
example.egtrans: 20世纪50年代，太阳唱片公司旗下的歌手包括约翰尼•卡什和杰瑞•李•刘易斯。

stable.name: stable
stable.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep a horse in a stable

stack.name: stack
stack.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stack
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a pile of things arranged one on top of another

example.eg: He chose a cartoon from the stack of DVDs on the shelf.
example.egtrans: 他从架子上的一摞DVD中挑了盘卡通片。

trans_examp.trans_en: a large amount

example.eg: Don't worry, we've got stacks of time.
example.egtrans: 别担心，我们有的是时间。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a set of shelves in a library that are positioned close together so that a lot of books can be stored on them
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （图书馆中排列密集的）藏书书架；书库

dsense.name: stack
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of aircraft circling over an airport at different heights waiting for permission to land
trans_examp.trans_cn: 多架在机场上空盘旋等待降落许可的飞机

example.eg: We were in the stack for over an hour before we landed.
example.egtrans: 我们和其它飞机在机场上空盘旋等待了一个多小时后才降落。

dsense.name: stack
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of storing data (= information) on a computer so that the last piece of data to be stored is the first one to be found by the computer

dsense.name: stack
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a car accident, especially one that causes damage

stack.name: stack
stack.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stack
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange things in an ordered pile
trans_examp.trans_cn: 把…放成整齐的一摞；把…码成堆

example.eg: Once the last few people had left the hall, the caretaker began stacking (up) the chairs.
example.egtrans: 最后几个人一离开大厅，看门人就开始把椅子摞起来。

trans_examp.trans_en: to fill something with objects

example.eg: I got a job stacking shelves in a supermarket.
example.egtrans: 我在一家超市找到了一份在货架上码货的工作。

example.eg: Will you stack the dishwasher and switch it on, please?
example.egtrans: 请把洗碗机装满然后打开开关好吗？

dsense.name: stack
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to circle over an airport waiting for permission to land, or to make an aircraft do this
trans_examp.trans_cn: （使）飞机在机场上空盘旋等待降落许可

example.eg: The airline uses thousands of tonnes of fuel a year when its planes are stacking above Heathrow and Gatwick.
example.egtrans: 这家航空公司的飞机在希思罗机场和盖特威克机场上空盘旋等待降落时，每年要消耗数千吨燃料。

example.eg: Planes stacked up at LAX when a radar failure caused problems nationwide.
example.egtrans: 当雷达故障在全国范围内引发问题时，洛杉矶国际机场的上空有大批的飞机盘旋不能降落。

example.eg: We were stacked up for hours waiting to land.
example.egtrans: 我们在机场上空盘旋了好几个小时等待降落。

stage.name: stage
stage.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of an activity or a period of development

example.eg: The project is in its final stages and should be completed by August.
example.egtrans: 这个项目已进入最后阶段，应于8月份完成。

example.eg: They did the last stage of their journey on foot.
example.egtrans: 他们步行走完了旅途的最后一段路。

example.eg: Our marriage is going through a difficult stage at the moment.
example.egtrans: 目前我们的婚姻正处于一个困难阶段。

example.eg: Their youngest child is at the stage where she can say individual words but not full sentences.
example.egtrans: 他们最小的孩子目前所处的阶段是会说单个的词，但还不会说整句话。

example.eg: I'm not tired at the moment but I will need a rest at some stage (= at some time) during the walk.
example.egtrans: 我现在不累，但在步行过程中的某个时候需要休息一下。

example.eg: Andrew spends all his spare time playing with his computer but it's probably just a stage he's going through (= a period of development that will end soon).
example.egtrans: 安德鲁的业余时间全花在了玩电脑上，不过这可能只是一个阶段罢了。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the separate parts of a rocket, each part having its own engine

example.eg: Once its fuel supply runs out, each stage separates from the main part of the rocket and falls back to earth.
example.egtrans: 每一级在燃料燃尽后，就会从火箭主体上脱落，落回到地球上。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something in stages, you divide the activity into parts and complete each part separately.

example.eg: We're decorating the house in stages so it won't be ready for another couple of months.
example.egtrans: 我们在逐步装修房子，所以还得几个月才能就绪。

dsense.name: stage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the area in a theatre that is often raised above ground level and on which actors or entertainers perform

example.eg: Hamlet is on stage for most of the act.
example.egtrans: 这一幕的大部分时间哈姆雷特都出场。

example.eg: The orchestra went on/off stage to great applause.
example.egtrans: 管弦乐队在雷鸣般的掌声中登场／走下舞台。

example.eg: The play is a stage adaptation of William Golding's novel.
example.egtrans: 这部戏是根据威廉‧戈尔丁的小说改编的舞台剧。

example.eg: The singer returns to the Oslo stage (= will perform again in Oslo) this summer.
example.egtrans: 那位歌手今夏将重返奥斯陆舞台。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular area of public life

example.eg: The president was extremely popular on the world stage but was disliked in his own country.
example.egtrans: 总统在世界舞台上极受欢迎，但在本国却不受拥戴。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to go onto the stage and start to perform

stage.name: stage
stage.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange and perform a play or show

example.eg: The local drama group is staging a production of the musical "Grease".
example.egtrans: 当地剧团正在演出音乐剧《油脂》。

trans_examp.trans_en: to organize an event

example.eg: London staged the Olympic Games in 2012.
example.egtrans: 伦敦于2012年举办了奥运会。

stance.name: stance
stance.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of thinking about something, especially expressed in a publicly stated opinion

example.eg: The doctor's stance on the issue of abortion is well known.
example.egtrans: 这位医生在堕胎问题上的立场众人皆知。

dsense.name: stance
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular way of standing

example.eg: Jenny took up a stance with her feet slightly apart, ready to catch the ball.
example.egtrans: 珍妮两脚稍稍分开站好了姿势，准备接球。

standard.name: standard
standard.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a level of quality

example.eg: This essay is not of an acceptable standard - do it again.
example.egtrans: 这篇文章未达标准——重新写。

example.eg: This piece of work is below standard/is not up to standard.
example.egtrans: 这项工作做得不合要求。

example.eg: We have very high safety standards in this laboratory.
example.egtrans: 我们这个实验室有很高的安全标准。

example.eg: Not everyone judges success by the same standards - some people think happiness is more important than money.
example.egtrans: 每个人衡量成功的标准不尽相同——有些人认为快乐比金钱更重要。

example.eg: Her technique became a standard against which all future methods were compared.
example.egtrans: 她的技术成了后来所有方法的参照标准。

trans_examp.trans_en: a moral rule that should be obeyed

example.eg: Most people agree that there are standards (of behaviour) that need to be upheld.
example.egtrans: 大多数人认同人们需要遵守一定的（行为）准则。

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a pattern or model that is generally accepted

example.eg: This program is an industry standard for computers.
example.egtrans: 这一程序是计算机的一个行业标准。

trans_examp.trans_en: a song or other piece of music that has been popular and often played over a long period of time
trans_examp.trans_cn: （经常演唱或演奏的）常规曲目，保留曲目

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a car with gears that are changed by hand

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flag, especially a long, narrow one ending with two long points
