trans_examp.trans_cn: 旗；（尤指）末端有两个尖的窄长旗

example.eg: the royal standard
example.egtrans: 王室旗

standard.name: standard
standard.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: usual rather than special, especially when thought of as being correct or acceptable

example.eg: White is the standard colour for this model of refrigerator.
example.egtrans: 白色是这种型号的冰箱的标准色。

example.eg: These are standard procedures for handling radioactive waste.
example.egtrans: 这些是处理放射性废料的标准程序。

example.eg: The metre is the standard unit for measuring length in the SI system.
example.egtrans: 米是国际单位制中衡量长度的标准单位。

example.eg: Your new TV comes with a two year guarantee as standard.
example.egtrans: 你的新电视机按照行业规范带有两年的保修服务。

trans_examp.trans_en: Language described as standard is the form of that language that is considered acceptable and correct by most educated users of it

example.eg: Most announcers on the BBC speak standard English.
example.egtrans: 英国广播公司的大多数播音员说的都是标准英语。

example.eg: In Standard American, "gotten" is used as a past participle of "get".
example.egtrans: 在规范的美国英语中，get 的过去分词为 gotten。

trans_examp.trans_en: A standard book or writer is the one that is most commonly read for information on a particular subject

example.eg: Her book is still a standard text in archaeology, even though it was written more than 20 years ago.
example.egtrans: 虽然她的著作成书于20多年前，但时至今日仍被奉为考古学的权威读本。

standardize.name: standardize
standardize.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make things of the same type all have the same basic features

example.eg: We standardize parts such as rear-view mirrors, so that one type will fit any model of car we make.
example.egtrans: 我们对后视镜之类的零部件进行标准化生产，这样只要一种型号便能匹配我们制造的所有款式的汽车了。

example.eg: The profile summarizes key information about a product in a standardized format designed to make it easier to compare products.
example.egtrans: 产品介绍包含产品的一些关键信息，用一种专门格式写成，以便在产品之间进行比较。

state.name: state
state.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: state
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a condition or way of being that exists at a particular time

example.eg: The building was in a state of disrepair.
example.egtrans: 这栋大楼年久失修。

example.eg: She was found wandering in a confused state (of mind).
example.egtrans: 有人发现她到处游荡，神志恍惚。

example.eg: Give me the keys - you're not in a state to drive.
example.egtrans: 把钥匙给我——你状态不佳，不能开车。

example.eg: After the accident I was in a state of shock.
example.egtrans: 事故之后，我惊魂未定。

example.eg: I came home to an unhappy state of affairs (= situation).
example.egtrans: 我回到家时，心情十分沉重。

example.eg: The kitchen was in its original state, with a 1920s sink and stove.
example.egtrans: 厨房还保留着最初的样子，有一个20世纪20年代的水槽和炉子。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the present situation

example.eg: The article provides a useful summary of the current state of play in the negotiations.
example.egtrans: 这篇文章对谈判的现状作出了有用的总结。

dsense.name: state
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a country or its government

example.eg: The drought is worst in the central African states.
example.egtrans: 中非国家旱情最重。

example.eg: Britain is one of the member states of the European Union.
example.egtrans: 英国是欧盟的成员国之一。

example.eg: The government was determined to reduce the number of state-owned industries.
example.egtrans: 政府下决心要减少国有企业的数量。

example.eg: Some theatres receive a small amount of funding from the state.
example.egtrans: 一些剧院从政府那里获得少量的资金扶持。

example.eg: His diary included comments on affairs/matters of state (= information about government activities).
example.egtrans: 他的日记中有对国事的评论。

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a large country with its own government, such as in Germany, Australia, or the US
trans_examp.trans_cn: （德国、澳大利亚、美国等的）州，邦

example.eg: Alaska is the largest state in the US
example.egtrans: 阿拉斯加是美国最大的州。

example.eg: Representatives are elected from each state.
example.egtrans: 代表是从各州选出的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to refer to the US
If a king, queen, or government leader does something in state, they do it in a formal way as part of an official ceremony.
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （君主或政府首脑）正式地，隆重地

example.eg: The Queen rode in state to the opening of Parliament.
example.egtrans: 女王隆重地乘车前往出席议会开幕典礼。

state.name: state
state.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to say or write something, especially clearly and carefully
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指清楚谨慎地）陈述，说明，声明

example.eg: Our warranty clearly states the limits of our liability.
example.egtrans: 我们的保修证书清楚地界定了我们的保修范围。

example.eg: Union members stated (that) they were unhappy with the proposal.
example.egtrans: 工会成员对提案表示不满。

example.eg: Please state why you wish to apply for this grant.
example.egtrans: 请说明申请这笔补助的原因。

example.eg: Children in the stated (= named) areas were at risk from a lack of food, the report said.
example.egtrans: 报告中称，上述地区的儿童面临着食物匮乏的威胁。

state.name: state
state.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: provided, created, or done by the state (= government of a country)

example.eg: state education/industries
example.egtrans: 公办教育／国有企业

example.eg: state legislature/law
example.egtrans: 国家立法机构／法律

example.eg: state control
example.egtrans: 国家控制

example.eg: state funding/pensions/subsidies
example.egtrans: 政府资助／养老金／补贴

trans_examp.trans_en: State events are formal official ceremonies that involve a leader of a country or someone who represents the government.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 国事的；国事规格的；正式的

example.eg: the state opening of Parliament
example.egtrans: 隆重的议会开幕典礼

example.eg: a state funeral
example.egtrans: 国葬

statement.name: statement
statement.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that someone says or writes officially, or an action done to express an opinion

example.eg: The government is expected to issue a statement about the investigation to the press.
example.egtrans: 预计政府会就该调查向新闻界作出说明。

example.eg: He produced a signed statement from the prisoner.
example.egtrans: 他出示了一份犯人签字画押的口供。

example.eg: He threw paint over the fur coats because he wanted to make a statement about cruelty to animals.
example.egtrans: 他把颜料洒在毛皮大衣上，借此表明自己对虐待动物一事的态度。

example.eg: We were not surprised by their statement that jobs would be cut.
example.egtrans: 我们对他们宣布将进行裁员的消息并不感到吃惊。

trans_examp.trans_en: a record of the amounts of money paid into and taken out of your bank account during a particular period of time

statement.name: statement
statement.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to a piece of clothing, jewellery, etc. that is designed to be very noticeable and stylish

example.eg: People don't mind spending £500 for a statement piece.
example.egtrans: 人们不吝花费500英镑在一件吸睛的时尚服饰上。

stick.name: stick
stick.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thin piece of wood or other material

example.eg: The old man was carrying a load of sticks.
example.egtrans: 那个老人抱着一捆树枝。

example.eg: Police said that the child had been beaten with a stick.
example.egtrans: 警方说那个孩子被人用木棍打了。

example.eg: Find some dry sticks and we'll make a campfire.
example.egtrans: 找些干树枝，我们来点堆篝火。

example.eg: A lollipop is a sweet on a stick.
example.egtrans: 棒棒糖是一团裹在小棍上的糖。

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin wooden pole that especially old or injured people use to help them walk
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指长者或伤者用的）手杖，拐杖

example.eg: a walking stick
example.egtrans: 拐杖

example.eg: At 84 he's still quite active, although he walks with the aid of a stick.
example.egtrans: 他84岁了，虽然走路需要拄着拐杖，可仍旧非常硬朗。

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin piece of wood used in playing various sports
trans_examp.trans_cn: （曲棍球或兜网球）球棍；（马球）球杆

example.eg: a hockey/lacrosse/polo stick
example.egtrans: 曲棍球球棍／兜网球球棍／马球球杆

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin piece of something

example.eg: carrot/bread sticks
example.egtrans: 胡萝卜条／面包棍

example.eg: a stick of celery/rhubarb/chewing gum/chalk/dynamite
example.egtrans: 一根芹菜／一棵大黄／一片口香糖／一根粉笔／一根雷管

trans_examp.trans_en: a car with a stick shift

example.eg: Do you drive a stick?
example.egtrans: 你开手动车吗？

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a piece of furniture

example.eg: When they got married, they didn't have a stick of furniture.
example.egtrans: 他们结婚时，一件家具都没有。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to hit someone or something with a long, thin piece of wood

example.eg: He said that when he was a boy, his father used to take a stick to him to punish him.
example.egtrans: 他说他小的时候，他爸爸经常用棍子惩罚他。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: severe criticism

example.eg: I really got/took stick from my boss about being late for work again.
example.egtrans: 我因为上班又迟到了，被老板狠狠数落了一通。

example.eg: We gave him some stick for wearing that silly hat.
example.egtrans: 他戴着那顶愚蠢透顶的帽子，被我们批评了一通。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an area in the countryside that is far from a town or city

example.eg: I'm sick of living in the sticks.
example.egtrans: 我受够了偏僻乡村的生活。

example.eg: They live out in the sticks somewhere.
example.egtrans: 他们住在某个偏远的地方。

stick.name: stick
stick.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause something to become fixed, for example with glue or another similar substance

example.eg: I tried to stick the pieces together with some glue/tape.
example.egtrans: 我想用胶水／胶带把这些部件粘到一起。

example.eg: He stuck up an announcement on the board with pins.
example.egtrans: 他用大头针把告示钉在布告板上。

example.eg: This glue won't stick.
example.egtrans: 这种胶水粘不牢。

example.eg: My car's stuck in the mud.
example.egtrans: 我的车陷在泥里了。

example.eg: Stir the sauce so that it doesn't stick to the pan.
example.egtrans: 不断搅拌酱汁，以免粘锅。

example.eg: My book got wet and all the pages have stuck together.
example.egtrans: 我的书湿了，书页都粘在一起了。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a name sticks, it continues to be used.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （名字）继续使用的，保持不变的

example.eg: Although her name is Clare, her little sister called her Lali, and somehow the name stuck.
example.egtrans: 虽然她的名字是克莱尔，她的妹妹却叫她拉莉，不知怎么的，这个名字就叫开了。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put something somewhere, especially in a not very careful way

example.eg: "Where shall I put these books?" "Oh, just stick them on the table for now."
example.egtrans: “我该把这些书放在哪儿？＂“噢，就先放在桌子上吧。＂

example.eg: She stuck her fingers in her ears so that she couldn't hear the noise.
example.egtrans: 她用手指塞住耳朵，这样就听不到那些噪音了。

example.eg: I'll pay for lunch - I can stick it on my expenses.
example.egtrans: 午餐我来请客——我可以把它算入报销费用。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you tell someone to stick something or where they can stick something, it means that you do not want to keep that thing.

example.eg: "I've had enough of working here," she said, "You can stick your job!"
example.egtrans: “我这儿要干的事已经够多了，＂她说，“你的活儿自己留着吧！＂

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to push a pointed object into or through something, or (of a pointed object) to be pushed into or through something and stay there

example.eg: She stuck the needle into my arm.
example.egtrans: 她把针头扎进我的胳膊。

example.eg: We decided where to go for our holiday by closing our eyes and sticking a pin in the map.
example.egtrans: 我们闭上眼睛，用大头针往地图上插，这样决定了去哪里度假。

example.eg: A thorn stuck in her finger.
example.egtrans: 她的手指扎了一根刺。

example.eg: The metal springs were sticking through the mattress.
example.egtrans: 金属弹簧穿透垫子露了出来。

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: In some card games, if you stick, you say that you do not want to be given any more cards.

dsense.name: stick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to bear or accept something or someone unpleasant

example.eg: I don't think I can stick this job a day longer.
example.egtrans: 我认为这份工作我一天也忍受不下去了。

example.eg: I don't know how you can stick living in this place.
example.egtrans: 我不知道你住在这样的地方怎么能受得了。

sticky.name: sticky
sticky.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: sticky
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: made of or covered with a substance that stays attached to any surface it touches
trans_examp.trans_cn: 黏性的；黏的；涂有黏胶的

example.eg: a sticky mess
example.egtrans: 黏胶带

example.eg: sticky fingers
example.egtrans: 黏乎乎的手指

example.eg: The floor's still sticky where I spilled the juice.
example.egtrans: 我把果汁洒在了地板上，现在那里还黏乎乎的。

example.eg: The children's faces were sticky with chocolate.
example.egtrans: 孩子们的脸上沾满了巧克力，黏乎乎的。

trans_examp.trans_en: If the weather is sticky, it is very hot and the air feels wet.

dsense.name: sticky
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: difficult

example.eg: There were a few sticky moments during the meeting, but everything turned out all right in the end.
example.egtrans: 会议过程中有几处卡壳，但最后总算是一切顺利。

dsense.name: sticky
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: unwilling to agree
trans_examp.trans_cn: 持有异议的，抱不合作态度的

example.eg: Their bank manager was sticky about lending them the money they wanted to borrow.
example.egtrans: 他们的银行经理不愿意借给他们那笔钱。

dsense.name: sticky
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe a website or shop where people like to spend a long time
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用来形容人们会停留很长时间的网站或商店）有黏性的

example.eg: Big media groups are drawn to social networking sites because of their "sticky" nature.
example.egtrans: 大媒体公司被社交媒体所吸引，因为他们具有黏性。

store.name: store
store.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: store
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a large shop where you can buy many different types of goods

example.eg: a department store
example.egtrans: 百货商场

example.eg: a DIY/furniture store
example.egtrans: DIY／家具商场

trans_examp.trans_en: any type of shop

example.eg: a clothing/liquor store
example.egtrans: 服装店／买酒的店铺

example.eg: a department store
example.egtrans: 百货商店

example.eg: a furniture store
example.egtrans: 家具商店

example.eg: a convenience store
example.egtrans: 便利店

dsense.name: store
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of something that is being kept for future use

example.eg: He has an impressively large store of wine in his cellar.
example.egtrans: 他的酒窖里储存了数量惊人的葡萄酒。

example.eg: Food stores are reported to be running dangerously low in the capital.
example.egtrans: 据报道，首都的食品储备量很低，形势危急。

example.eg: My grandmothers store of memories was shared over the dinner table.
example.egtrans: 晚餐时，奶奶和外婆互相谈起自己关于过去的记忆。

trans_examp.trans_en: a building in which things are kept until they are needed

example.eg: a grain/weapons store
example.egtrans: 粮仓／武器库

store.name: store
store.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put or keep things in a special place for use in the future

example.eg: The data is stored on a hard disk and backed up on a CD.
example.egtrans: 数据储存在一个硬盘上，并用光盘做了备份。

example.eg: I stored my possessions in my mother's house while I was living in Spain.
example.egtrans: 我在西班牙居住期间，把我的东西放在我母亲那儿了。

example.eg: I've stored my thick sweaters and jackets (away) until next winter.
example.egtrans: 我把厚毛衣和外套收了起来，等到来年冬天再穿。

example.eg: Squirrels store (up) nuts for the winter.
example.egtrans: 松鼠为过冬储藏坚果。

straightforward.name: straightforward
straightforward.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: straightforward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: easy to understand or simple

example.eg: Just follow the signs to Bradford - it's very straightforward.
example.egtrans: 顺着路标走就到布拉德福德了——非常简单。

dsense.name: straightforward
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a person) honest and not likely to hide their opinions

example.eg: Roz is straightforward and lets you know what she's thinking.
example.egtrans: 罗兹很坦诚，会告诉你她的想法。

strangely.name: strangely
strangely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that is unusual, unexpected, or difficult to understand
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不寻常地；奇怪地；不可思议地

example.eg: She was strangely calm while everyone else was panicking.
example.egtrans: 大家慌作一团的时候，她却出奇地平静。

example.eg: He looked at me rather strangely.
example.egtrans: 他很奇怪地看着我。

example.eg: Strangely, nobody seemed to notice.
example.egtrans: 很奇怪，好像没人注意到。

strategic.name: strategic
strategic.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: helping to achieve a plan, for example in business or politics
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有助于计划成功的；战略（性）的

example.eg: strategic planning
example.egtrans: 战略规划

example.eg: a strategic withdrawal/advance
example.egtrans: 战略性撤退／推进

example.eg: Their bombs are always placed in strategic positions to cause as much chaos as possible.
example.egtrans: 他们总是把炸弹安放在战略要地，务求最大程度地制造混乱。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to provide military forces with an advantage
trans_examp.trans_cn: （武器、战争或地方）战略性的，有战略优势的

example.eg: There are plans to modernize the US strategic forces.
example.egtrans: 美国制订了战略力量现代化的计划。

example.eg: strategic arms reduction talks
example.egtrans: 削减战略武器会谈

strategy.name: strategy
strategy.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a detailed plan for achieving success in situations such as war, politics, business, industry, or sport, or the skill of planning for such situations
trans_examp.trans_cn: 战略；策略；计谋；行动计划；策划，部署

example.eg: The president held an emergency meeting to discuss military strategy with the Pentagon yesterday.
example.egtrans: 总统昨天召开紧急会议，跟五角大楼商讨军事战略。

example.eg: Their marketing strategy for the product involves obtaining as much free publicity as possible.
example.egtrans: 他们对这一产品采取的市场策略包括尽可能去争取免费宣传的机会。

example.eg: We're working on new strategies to improve our share of the market.
example.egtrans: 我们正在制订新策略来增加我们的市场份额。

stream.name: stream
stream.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: water that flows naturally along a fixed route formed by a channel cut into rock or ground, usually at ground level

example.eg: a mountain stream
example.egtrans: 山涧

example.eg: underground streams
example.egtrans: 地下溪流

example.eg: There's a bubbling stream that flows through their property.
example.egtrans: 一条汩汩的小溪流过他家的土地。

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any current of water or liquid

example.eg: the level of cholesterol in your blood stream
example.egtrans: 血液中的胆固醇水平

trans_examp.trans_en: the direction in which water is moving

example.eg: She stopped rowing and let the boat float with the stream.
example.egtrans: 她不再划，任由小船顺流漂荡。

trans_examp.trans_en: a continuous flow of things or people

example.eg: There has been a steady stream of phone calls from worried customers.
example.egtrans: 不断有忧心忡忡的顾客打电话来。

example.eg: I had a constant stream of visitors while I was ill.
example.egtrans: 我生病时一直有人来看我。

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of school students with similar ability who are approximately the same age and are taught together
trans_examp.trans_cn: （同龄学生依照学习能力编排的）班，组

example.eg: I'm in the A stream for maths, and the B stream for English.
example.egtrans: 我数学在 A 组，英语在 B 组。

example.eg: the top/bottom stream
example.egtrans: 程度高／低的班

stream.name: stream
stream.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to flow somewhere or produce liquid, quickly and in large amounts without stopping

example.eg: There were tears streaming down his face.
example.egtrans: 泪水顺着他的脸滑落。

example.eg: One woman was carried from the scene of the accident with blood streaming from her head.
example.egtrans: 一名头部流血的妇女被从事故现场抬走了。

example.eg: I've got a terrible cold and my nose has been streaming all week.
example.egtrans: 我得了重感冒，整个星期都在流鼻涕。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to move continuously in one direction

example.eg: We were all very excited as we streamed out of our final exam.
example.egtrans: 期终考试结束后，我们涌出考场时都非常兴奋。

example.eg: Officials estimate that 20,000 refugees streamed into the city last week.
example.egtrans: 官员们估计上周有两万名难民涌入这个城。

example.eg: His hair streamed out behind him as he rode off.
example.egtrans: 他骑车离开，头发在脑后飘扬。

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to listen to or watch sound or video on a computer directly from the internet rather than downloading it and saving it first

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to group and teach together school students with similar abilities who are approximately the same age
trans_examp.trans_cn: （把同龄学生依照学习能力）编排成班（或组）

example.eg: We start to stream the children in the third form.
example.egtrans: 我们从三年级开始把孩子们按能力分班。

stress.name: stress
stress.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: great worry caused by a difficult situation, or something that causes this condition
trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧张，压力；造成紧张的因素

example.eg: People under a lot of stress may experience headaches, minor pains, and sleeping difficulties.
example.egtrans: 压力大的人可能会出现头痛、轻微疼痛和睡眠障碍。

example.eg: Yoga is a very effective technique for combating stress.
example.egtrans: 练瑜伽是舒缓压力的非常有效的方法。

example.eg: the stresses and strains of the job
example.egtrans: 工作的紧张和压力

example.eg: stress-related illness
example.egtrans: 压力引起的疾病

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way that a word or syllable is pronounced with greater force than other words in the same sentence or other syllables in the same word

example.eg: The meaning of a sentence often depends on stress and intonation.
example.egtrans: 句子的意思常常取决于重音和语调。

example.eg: When "insert" is a verb, the stress is on the second syllable, but when it is a noun, the stress is on the first syllable.
example.egtrans: Insert（插入）用作动词时重音在第二个音节上，但用作名词时重音在第一个音节上。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a force that acts in a way that often changes the shape of an object

example.eg: Computers work out the stresses that such a craft will encounter in flight.
example.egtrans: 计算机计算出诸如此类的飞行器在飞行中承受的压力。

example.eg: Jogging puts a lot of stress on your knee joints.
example.egtrans: 慢跑使膝关节承受很大的压力。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: emphasis

example.eg: During his speech, he laid particular stress on the freedom of the press.
example.egtrans: 他在讲话中特别强调了新闻自由。

stress.name: stress
stress.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give emphasis or special importance to something

example.eg: He is careful to stress (that) the laboratory's safety standards are the best in the country.
example.egtrans: 他谨慎地强调实验室的安全标准是全国最高的。

example.eg: I'd just like to stress the importance of neatness and politeness in this job.
example.egtrans: 我只想强调一下整洁和礼貌在这份工作中的重要性。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pronounce a word or syllable with greater force than other words in the same sentence or other syllables in the same word, or to play a musical note with greater force than others in a group

example.eg: In the word "engine" you should stress the first syllable.
example.egtrans: 在 engine 这个词中，应该重读第一个音节。

dsense.name: stress
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to feel worried and nervous

example.eg: Don't stress over it - we'll soon get it sorted out.
example.egtrans: 不用担心——我们很快会解决的。

stretch.name: stretch
stretch.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause something to reach, often as far as possible, in a particular direction

example.eg: I tripped on a piece of wire that someone had stretched across the path.
example.egtrans: 我被不知是谁拉在路上的一根电线绊倒了。

example.eg: She stretched out her hand and helped him from his chair.
example.egtrans: 她伸手将他从椅子上扶起来。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make your body or your arms and legs straight so that they are as long as possible, in order to exercise the joints (= place where two bones are connected) after you have been in the same place or position for a long time

example.eg: "I'm so tired," she said, yawning and stretching.
example.egtrans: “我太累了，”她打着呵欠伸了个懒腰说。

example.eg: It's a good idea to stretch before you do vigorous exercise.
example.egtrans: 在进行剧烈运动前应该先伸展一下身体。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spread over a large area or distance

example.eg: A huge cloud of dense smoke stretched across the horizon.
example.egtrans: 一大团浓烟在地平线上蔓延开来。

example.eg: The Andes stretch for 7,250 km along the west coast of South America.
example.egtrans: 安第斯山脉沿南美洲西海岸绵延达7250公里。

example.eg: Unsettled weather will stretch from the middle Mississippi Valley to the southern Middle Atlantic States.
example.egtrans: 自密西西比河流域中部至濒大西洋中部诸州的南部天气均不稳定。

example.eg: The refugee camps stretch as far as the eye can see.
example.egtrans: 难民营绵延不绝，一眼望不到头。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to go as far as or past the usual limit of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 到…的限度；超过…的限度；竭尽

example.eg: Many families' budgets are already stretched to breaking point.
example.egtrans: 许多家庭的预算已经撑到了极限。

example.eg: We can't work any harder, Paul. We're already fully stretched.
example.egtrans: 我们无法再更卖力了，保罗。我们已经竭尽全力了。

example.eg: This movie really stretches the patience of the audience to the limit.
example.egtrans: 这部电影简直就是在考验观众的耐性。

example.eg: Normally, people under 18 aren't allowed, but I guess we can stretch the rules for you as it's your birthday tomorrow.
example.egtrans: 我们通常不接纳未满18岁的人，但考虑到明天是你的生日，我想我们可以稍稍变通一下。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to (cause a material to) become longer or wider than usual as a result of pulling at the edges

example.eg: an exercise to stretch the leg muscles
example.egtrans: 拉伸腿部肌肉的锻炼

example.eg: That elastic band will snap if you stretch it too far.
example.egtrans: 那根橡皮筋拉得太长会断的。

example.eg: This substance stretches to any shape you want.
example.egtrans: 这种物质可以拉伸成你想要的任何形状。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a material stretches, it can become longer or wider when pulled and then return to its original size.

example.eg: to stretch fabrics
example.egtrans: 弹力织物

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to spread over a long period of time

example.eg: The dispute stretches back over many years.
example.egtrans: 这场争论可追溯到许多年以前。

example.eg: Although we were supposed to finish this month, it looks like the work will stretch well into next year.
example.egtrans: 虽然我们应该在本月完工，但看来工作要拖到明年了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to make a process or task continue for a longer period of time than was originally planned

example.eg: I'd like to stretch my mortgage payments out over a longer period if possible.
example.egtrans: 如果可能的话，我想把按揭贷款的期限延长一些。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If jobs or tasks stretch you, they make you learn new things that use your skill and experience more than before.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （工作或任务）使施展本领，对…具有挑战性

example.eg: My present job doesn't stretch me, so I'm looking for something more demanding.
example.egtrans: 我目前的工作不能让我尽展所长，所以我在寻找更有挑战性的工作。

stretch.name: stretch
stretch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a continuous area of land or water

example.eg: This particular stretch of coast is especially popular with hikers.
example.egtrans: 在这一段海岸散步的人特别多。

example.eg: Traffic is at a standstill along a five-mile stretch of the ring-road.
example.egtrans: 环城公路有5英里的路段交通陷入瘫痪。

example.eg: Some very rare birds inhabit our stretch of the river.
example.egtrans: 一些非常珍稀的鸟类栖息在我们这个河段。

trans_examp.trans_en: a stage in a race, or a part of a racetrack

example.eg: She looked certain to win as she entered the final stretch.
example.egtrans: 她进入最后一段跑道时似乎已经赢定了。

example.eg: He fell as he galloped down the home stretch (= towards the finish).
example.egtrans: 他在冲向终点时跌倒了。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of stretching

example.eg: I always have a good stretch when I get up in the morning.
example.egtrans: 我早上起床总会好好地伸展一下筋骨。

example.eg: This is a really good stretch for your hip flexors.
example.egtrans: 这对你的髋部屈肌是很好的舒展活动。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fact that something has gone past its usual limits
trans_examp.trans_cn: 超过限度；过分；离谱；破例

example.eg: His idea may be a stretch, but it's not outside the realm of possibility.
example.egtrans: 他的主意可能有点儿夸大其词，但并不是完全没有可能。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the degree to which a material can be made longer or wider by pulling

example.eg: This fabric doesn't have much stretch in it, does it?
example.egtrans: 这种织物没什么弹性，是吗？

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a continuous period of time

example.eg: The elderly generally need far less rest than the young, and tend to sleep in several short stretches.
example.egtrans: 年长者一般需要的休息时间比年轻人要少得多，而且往往会分成几个小段时间睡觉。

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of time that a criminal spends in prison

example.eg: Her brother's doing a ten-year stretch for armed robbery.
example.egtrans: 她弟弟因持械抢劫正在服刑，刑期10年。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: continuously or without any interruptions

example.eg: There's no way I could work for ten hours at a stretch.
example.egtrans: 要我连续工作10个小时是不可能的。

dsense.name: stretch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a job, task , or role that is difficult for someone because it is very different from what they usually do
trans_examp.trans_cn: （演员的）有难度的表演，拓宽戏路的表演

example.eg: Playing a budding opera star was not much of a stretch for this classically trained singer.
example.egtrans: 饰演一位崭露头角的歌剧明星对这个受过古典音乐训练的歌手而言不是什么难事。

strictly.name: strictly
strictly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that would bring severe punishment if not obeyed

example.eg: The speed limit is strictly enforced on urban roads.
example.egtrans: 城市道路上严格限速行驶。

example.eg: The use of cameras in this museum is strictly forbidden.
example.egtrans: 本博物馆中严禁使用相机。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a very limited or limiting way

example.eg: Should I mark this letter to your accountant "strictly confidential"?
example.egtrans: 我是否应该把这封给你会计师的信标注上“绝密”字样？

example.eg: The proposed change in the law would make abortion illegal except for strictly defined medical reasons.
example.egtrans: 对该法拟议中的修改将把堕胎列为非法行为，只有经严格界定属医学需要者除外。

example.eg: This unrepeatable offer is only available for a strictly limited period.
example.egtrans: 这么好的条件，机会难得稍纵即逝。

trans_examp.trans_en: exactly or correctly

example.eg: I have acted strictly in accordance with the regulations at all times.
example.egtrans: 我自始至终都是严格照章办事。

example.eg: It is essential that the safety procedures are strictly adhered to.
example.egtrans: 必须严格遵守安全规程。

example.eg: Their salaries are not strictly comparable (= cannot be directly compared) because of the differences in UK and US tax rates.
example.egtrans: 由于英美两国的税率不同，他们的薪酬严格来讲不能相提并论。

example.eg: Are all these questions strictly (= really) necessary?
example.egtrans: 所有这些问题真有必要吗？

string.name: string
string.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (a piece of) strong, thin rope made by twisting very thin threads together, used for fastening and tying things

example.eg: a package tied with string
example.egtrans: 用细绳捆扎的包裹

example.eg: a ball/piece of string
example.egtrans: 线团／一根细绳

example.eg: When you pull the strings, the puppet's arms and legs move.
example.egtrans: 你扯动细绳，木偶的手脚就会动。

trans_examp.trans_en: a set of objects joined together in a row on a single rope or thread

example.eg: a string of beads/pearls
example.egtrans: 一串珠子／珍珠

example.eg: A string of onions hung from a beam in the kitchen.
example.egtrans: 厨房的横梁上挂着一串洋葱。

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a series of related things or events

example.eg: What do you think of the recent string of political scandals?
example.egtrans: 你怎么看最近一连串的政治丑闻？

example.eg: He had a string of top-20 hits during the 80s.
example.egtrans: 80年代，他创作了一系列进入排行榜前20名的作品。

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thin wire that is stretched across a musical instrument and is used to produce a range of notes depending on its thickness, length, and tightness

example.eg: A violin has four strings.
example.egtrans: 小提琴有4根弦。

example.eg: Guitar strings are made from steel or nylon.
example.egtrans: 现在的吉他弦是由钢丝或尼龙制成的。

example.eg: You can pluck the strings on a guitar with your fingers or a plectrum.
example.egtrans: 你可以用手指或拨子拨动吉他的琴弦。

example.eg: a twelve-string guitar
example.egtrans: 十二弦吉他

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the group of instruments that have strings and are played with a bow or with the fingers, or the players in a musical group who play these instruments

example.eg: I prefer his compositions for strings.
example.egtrans: 我更喜欢他为弦乐器组谱写的乐曲。

example.eg: He played the cello and joined the strings in the school orchestra.
example.egtrans: 他演奏大提琴，还加入了学校管弦乐团的弦乐器组。

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the thin plastic strings that are stretched between the sides of the frame of a racket used in sport

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a usually short piece of text consisting of letters, numbers, or symbols that is used in computer processes such as searching through large amounts of information

example.eg: If you type in the search string "ing", the computer will find all the words containing "ing".
example.egtrans: 如果你输入搜索字符串 ing，计算机会把所有包含ing的单词找出来。

string.name: string
string.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: consisting of or relating to string instruments
trans_examp.trans_cn: 由弦乐器组成的；弦乐器的

example.eg: the string section
example.egtrans: 弦乐部

example.eg: a string quartet
example.egtrans: 弦乐四重奏

string.name: string
string.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put strings on a musical instrument

example.eg: First you need to learn how to string and tune your guitar.
example.egtrans: 首先你需要学会如何给吉他装弦并调音。

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put new strings onto a racket used in sport

example.eg: You ought to have your racket re-strung before the competition.
example.egtrans: 比赛之前你应该重装一下球拍的弦。

dsense.name: string
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a string through a number of objects
trans_examp.trans_cn: 用细绳（或线等）把…串在一起

example.eg: Would you help me string these beads?
example.egtrans: 你能帮我把这些珠子串起来吗？

strip.name: strip
strip.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: strip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove, pull, or tear the covering or outer layer from something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 除去，剥除，撕掉（外皮或表层）

example.eg: Because of the pollution, the trees are almost completely stripped of bark.
example.egtrans: 由于受到污染，树木的表皮几乎完全脱落。

example.eg: The paintwork was so bad that we decided to strip off all the paint and start again.
example.egtrans: 漆面太糟，我们决定铲去所有的油漆，重漆一遍。

example.eg: During the summer months, the sheep strip the mountains bare.
example.egtrans: 夏天的几个月里，羊群把山上啃得光秃秃的。

dsense.name: strip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove your clothing, or to remove all the clothing of someone else

example.eg: The men were ordered to strip.
example.egtrans: 那些男人被命令把衣服脱光。

example.eg: Suddenly he stripped off and ran into the sea.
example.egtrans: 他突然脱掉衣服冲进大海。

example.eg: He had been stripped naked, beaten and robbed.
example.egtrans: 他被脱光衣服，遭受殴打，东西还被抢了。

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove your clothing as an entertainment

example.eg: She stripped to pay her way through college.
example.egtrans: 她通过跳脱衣舞来挣钱付大学学费。

dsense.name: strip
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove parts of a machine, vehicle, or engine in order to clean or repair it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 拆卸，拆开（机器、车辆或引擎）

example.eg: I've decided to strip down my motorbike and rebuild it.
example.egtrans: 我已经决定了把摩托车拆开重新组装。

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove the parts of a car, etc. in order to sell them

strip.name: strip
strip.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: strip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, flat, narrow piece

example.eg: a narrow strip of land
example.egtrans: 狭长地带

example.eg: He didn't have a bandage, so he ripped up his shirt into thin strips.
example.egtrans: 他没有绷带，就把衬衫撕成细条。

example.eg: Protect the magnetic strip on your credit card from scratches, heat, or other damage.
example.egtrans: 注意保护信用卡的磁条，防止划伤、受热及其他损伤。

dsense.name: strip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the clothing worn by a football team that has the team's colours on it

example.eg: The team will be wearing its new strip at next Saturday's match.
example.egtrans: 球队在下周六的比赛中将穿新队服亮相。

dsense.name: strip
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an entertainment in which the performer removes all his or her clothing

example.eg: He jumped up on the table and started to do a strip.
example.egtrans: 他跳上桌子，开始跳起了脱衣舞。

strongly.name: strongly
strongly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: strongly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very much or in a very serious way

example.eg: They strongly believe their children should make choices for themselves.
example.egtrans: 他们坚信应该由孩子们自己来选择。

example.eg: Many locals are strongly opposed to the development.
example.egtrans: 许多当地居民强烈反对这项地产开发。

dsense.name: strongly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way or form that is difficult to break

example.eg: Equipment will have to be strongly made to endure the weather conditions on the ice cap.
example.egtrans: 设备必须制造得非常坚固，才能经受住冰盖上的天气条件。

structural.name: structural
structural.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: structural
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the way in which parts of a system or object are arranged

example.eg: The political reforms have led to major structural changes in the economy.
example.egtrans: 政治改革导致了经济结构的重大变化。

dsense.name: structural
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the structure of a building or similar object
trans_examp.trans_cn: （建筑物或类似物体）结构上的

example.eg: Hundreds of houses in the typhoon's path suffered structural damage.
example.egtrans: 台风所过之处，数百所房屋遭到了结构性破坏。

structure.name: structure
structure.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: structure
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which the parts of a system or object are arranged or organized, or a system arranged in this way

example.eg: the grammatical structure of a sentence
example.egtrans: 句子的语法结构

example.eg: The structure of this protein is particularly complex.
example.egtrans: 这种蛋白质的结构特别复杂。

example.eg: They have a very old-fashioned management structure.
example.egtrans: 他们的管理体系非常落伍。

example.eg: Some people like the sense of structure that a military lifestyle imposes.
example.egtrans: 一些人喜欢军事化生活方式所特有的条理性。

dsense.name: structure
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that has been made or built from parts, especially a large building
trans_examp.trans_cn: 结构体；（尤指）大型建筑物

example.eg: The proposed new office tower is a steel and glass structure 43 storeys high.
example.egtrans: 拟议建造的新办公大楼是一栋高43层的钢铁玻璃结构的建筑物。

dsense.name: structure
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an organ in the body, or part of an organ, that does a particular job

structure.name: structure
structure.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to plan, organize, or arrange the parts of something

example.eg: We must carefully structure and rehearse each scene.
example.egtrans: 我们每一场戏都必须认真构思、认真排练。

example.eg: a well-structured argument
example.egtrans: 结构严谨的论证

subject.name: subject
subject.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the thing that is being discussed, considered, or studied
trans_examp.trans_cn: （讨论、考虑或研究的）主题，话题；问题；题目

example.eg: Our subject for discussion is homelessness.
example.egtrans: 我们讨论的话题是无家可归问题。

example.eg: She has made a series of documentaries on the subject of family relationships.
example.egtrans: 她拍摄了一系列以家庭关系为题材的纪录片。

example.eg: The guest lecturer took as her subject (= decided to speak about) "punishment and imprisonment in modern society".
example.egtrans: 特邀演讲人演讲的题目是“现代社会的刑罚与监禁”。

example.eg: The number of planes flying over the town has been the subject of (= has caused) concern since last summer.
example.egtrans: 自去年夏天开始，从小镇上空飞过的飞机数量一直让人们忐忑不安。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an area of knowledge that is studied in school, college, or university
trans_examp.trans_cn: （中小学或大学的）学科；科目；专业

example.eg: My favourite subjects at school were history and English.
example.egtrans: 上学时我最喜欢的科目是历史和地理。

example.eg: Her subject (= special area of study) is low-temperature physics.
example.egtrans: 她的专业是低温物理学。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to start talking about a different subject

example.eg: I'd tried to explain the situation, but he just changed the subject.
example.egtrans: 我想把情况解释清楚，他却岔开了话题。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person, thing, or situation that is written about in a book, article, etc. or shown in a picture, etc.

example.eg: The mill by the bridge was the subject of an unfinished painting by J. M. W. Turner.
example.egtrans: 桥边磨坊是特纳一副未完成油画的主题。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the person or thing that performs the action of a verb, or is joined to a description by a verb

example.eg: "Bob" is the subject of the sentence "Bob threw the ball."
example.egtrans: Bob 是句子 Bob threw the ball 的主语。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who lives in or who has the right to live in a particular country, especially a country with a king or queen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指君主制国家的）臣民，国民

example.eg: He is a British subject.
example.egtrans: 他是英国臣民。

subject.name: subject
subject.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to defeat people or a country and then control them against their wishes and limit their freedom

example.eg: The invaders quickly subjected the local tribes.
example.egtrans: 入侵者很快就征服了当地的部落。

subject.name: subject
subject.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have or experience a particular thing, especially something unpleasant

example.eg: Cars are subject to a high domestic tax.
example.egtrans: 买汽车要交很高的国内税。

example.eg: In recent years, she has been subject to attacks of depression.
example.egtrans: 近年来，她一直饱受抑郁症的折磨。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: only able to happen if something else happens

example.eg: We plan to go on Wednesday, subject to your approval.
example.egtrans: 如果你同意，我们打算周三走。

example.eg: Moving all the books should not take long, subject to there being (= if there are) enough helpers.
example.egtrans: 如果有足够的人手，把所有的书都搬走花不了多少时间。

dsense.name: subject
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: under the political control of another country or state

example.eg: subject peoples/states
example.egtrans: 被征服的民族／国家

subscribe.name: subscribe
subscribe.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to pay money to an organization in order to receive a product, use a service regularly, or support the organization
trans_examp.trans_cn: 订阅，订购（产品）；（为某项服务）定期付费；定期捐助

example.eg: 2.3 million people subscribe to this online music service.
example.egtrans: 有230万人订购了这个在线音乐服务。

example.eg: She subscribes to several women's magazines.
example.egtrans: 她订阅了几本女性杂志。

example.eg: I subscribe €10 a month to the charity.
example.egtrans: 我每个月向这个慈善团体捐助10欧元。

trans_examp.trans_en: to offer to buy something or pay an amount for something as part of your business activities

example.eg: Existing shareholders subscribed to only 49 percent of the new share issue.
example.egtrans: 现有股东只认购了新股的49%。

subsequent.name: subsequent
subsequent.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening after something else

example.eg: The book discusses his illness and subsequent resignation from politics.
example.egtrans: 书中讲述了他患病及随后隐退政坛的事。

example.eg: Those explosions must have been subsequent to our departure, because we didn't hear anything.
example.egtrans: 那些爆炸一定是在我们离开后发生的，因为我们什么也没听到。

substantial.name: substantial
substantial.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: substantial
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: large in size, value, or importance
trans_examp.trans_cn: 大的；可观的；价值巨大的；重大的

example.eg: The findings show a substantial difference between the opinions of men and women.
example.egtrans: 这些发现表明男性和女性之间存在着重大的意见分歧。

example.eg: She inherited a substantial fortune from her grandmother.
example.egtrans: 她从祖母那里继承了一笔数目可观的遗产。

example.eg: The first draft of his novel needed a substantial amount of rewriting.
example.egtrans: 他小说的初稿有很多地方需要重写。

dsense.name: substantial
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the main or most important things being considered

example.eg: The committee was in substantial agreement (= agreed about most of the things discussed).
example.egtrans: 委员会基本上达成了一致意见。

substantially.name: substantially
substantially.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: substantially
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: to a large degree

example.eg: The new rules will substantially change how we do things.
example.egtrans: 新规则会在很大程度上改变我们的行事方式。

dsense.name: substantially
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: generally

example.eg: This model has leather seats, but the two cars are substantially the same.
example.egtrans: 这一型号有几个附加装置，但两款车大体上是一样的。

substitute.name: substitute
substitute.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use something or someone instead of another thing or person

example.eg: You can substitute oil for butter in this recipe.
example.egtrans: 这道菜中你可以用食用油代替黄油。

example.eg: Dayton was substituted for Williams in the second half of the game.
example.egtrans: 下半场比赛戴顿换下了威廉姆斯。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to perform the same job as another thing or to take its place

example.eg: Gas-fired power stations will substitute for less efficient coal-fired equipment.
example.egtrans: 以煤气为燃料的发电站将会代替效率较低的燃煤装置。

substitute.name: substitute
substitute.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thing or person that is used instead of another thing or person

example.eg: Tofu can be used as a meat substitute in vegetarian recipes.
example.egtrans: 素食菜谱中豆腐可用以替代肉类。

example.eg: Vitamins should not be used as a substitute for a healthy diet.
example.egtrans: 维生素不应用于替代健康饮食。

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports, a player who is used for part of a game instead of another player

example.eg: Johnson came on as a substitute towards the end of the game.
example.egtrans: 约翰逊在比赛接近尾声时作为替补队员上场。

example.eg: The manager brought on another substitute in the final minutes of the game.
example.egtrans: 比赛还剩下最后几分钟时，主教练又换上了一位替补队员。

trans_examp.trans_en:
a 
        
         substitute teacher

phrase.phrase_title: there is no substitute for sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: nothing is as good as the stated thing

example.eg: You can read about other countries, but there's no substitute for visiting them yourself.
example.egtrans: 你可以阅读有关其他国家的信息，但是什么也代替不了亲自到访体验。

subtle.name: subtle
subtle.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way
trans_examp.trans_cn: 隐约的；暗淡的；不易察觉的，不明显的；微妙的

example.eg: The room was painted a subtle shade of pink.
example.egtrans: 房间被刷成了淡粉色。

example.eg: The play's message is perhaps too subtle to be understood by young children.
example.egtrans: 这部戏的内涵过于隐晦，小孩子可能难以理解。

trans_examp.trans_en: small but important

example.eg: There is a subtle difference between these two plans.
example.egtrans: 两个计划之间有一点细微的差别。

trans_examp.trans_en: achieved in a quiet way that does not attract attention to itself and is therefore good or clever

example.eg: a subtle plan/suggestion
example.egtrans: 巧妙的计划／建议

example.eg: subtle questions
example.egtrans: 巧妙的问题

subtract.name: subtract
subtract.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove a number from another number

example.eg: Four subtracted from ten equals six.
example.egtrans: 10减去4等于6。

such.name: such
such.posTip: A word used before a determiner.

trans_examp.trans_en: used before a noun or noun phrase to add emphasis
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于名词或名词短语前表示强调）如此，这么

example.eg: That's such a good film.
example.egtrans: 那部电影真不错。

example.eg: It seems like such a long way to drive for just one day.
example.egtrans: 一天之内要开这么远的路好像不太可能。

example.eg: You're such an idiot!
example.egtrans: 你真是个白痴！

example.eg: Such cruelty really is beyond my comprehension.
example.egtrans: 如此残忍真是让我无法理解。

example.eg: It was such a small room that the bed only just fit.
example.egtrans: 那个房间实在太小了，刚够放进去一张床。

such.name: such
such.posTip: A word used before a determiner.

trans_examp.trans_en: of a particular or similar type

example.eg: Small companies such as ours are very vulnerable in a recession.
example.egtrans: 像我们这样的小公司在经济不景气的时候非常容易受影响。

example.eg: I'm looking for a cloth for cleaning silver. Do you have such a thing?
example.egtrans: 我在找擦银器的布。你有这样的东西吗？

example.eg: Present on this grand occasion were Andrew Davies, Melissa Peters, and other such stars.
example.egtrans: 出席这次盛大典礼的有安德鲁‧戴维斯、梅利莎‧彼得斯等大牌明星。

example.eg: I tried to tell her in such a way that she wouldn't get offended.
example.egtrans: 我尽量用一种不得罪她的方式告诉她。

example.eg: He said it was an Edwardian washstand or some such thing - I can't remember exactly.
example.egtrans: 他说那是一个爱德华时代的盥洗盆之类的东西——我记不清了。

example.eg: I just bought one or two things - bread and milk and such (also suchlike).
example.egtrans: 我只买了一两样东西——面包、牛奶之类的。

example.eg: Our lunch was such (= of a type) that we don't really need dinner.
example.egtrans: 我们午饭大吃了一顿，都不怎么需要再吃晚饭了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for example

example.eg: That money is to cover costs such as travel and accommodation.
example.egtrans: 那笔钱是用来支付交通费和住宿费的。

such.name: such
such.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in the true or exact meaning of the word or phrase
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 从字面意义来看，严格地说

example.eg: There wasn't much vegetarian food as such, although there were several different types of cheese.
example.egtrans: 尽管有几种不同的奶酪，但严格意义上的素食没有多少。

example.eg: We don't have a secretary as such, but we do have a student who comes in to do some filing.
example.egtrans: 我们没有真正意义上的秘书，不过确实有个学生来做些文件整理工作。

sudden.name: sudden
sudden.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening or done quickly and without warning

example.eg: Drop the gun, put your hands in the air, and don't make any sudden movements.
example.egtrans: 把枪放下，手举起来，别轻举妄动。

example.eg: He had a sudden heart attack while he was on holiday.
example.egtrans: 他度假时心脏病突然发作。

example.eg: First they announce their engagement and then they tell me Angie's pregnant - it's all a bit sudden.
example.egtrans: 他们先是宣布了订婚，接着告诉我安吉怀孕了——一切都有点太突然了。

suffix.name: suffix
suffix.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a letter or group of letters added at the end of a word to make a new word

example.eg: The suffix "-ness" added to the end of the word "sweet" forms the word "sweetness", changing an adjective into a noun.
example.egtrans: 后缀 -ness加在 sweet 之后构成 sweetness，把形容词变成了名词。

summary.name: summary
summary.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a short, clear description that gives the main facts or ideas about something

example.eg: At the end of the news, they often give you a summary of the main stories.
example.egtrans: 在新闻结束的时候，他们常常会总结一下主要的新闻内容。

example.eg: In summary, they decided against the proposal.
example.egtrans: 总而言之，他们决定反对这项提议。

summary.name: summary
summary.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: done suddenly, without discussion or legal arrangements
trans_examp.trans_cn: （未经讨论或法律程序）立即的，速决的，草率的

example.eg: summary arrest/dismissal/execution
example.egtrans: 立即逮捕／解散／执行

supply.name: supply
supply.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to provide something that is wanted or needed, often in large quantities and over a long period of time

example.eg: Electrical power is supplied by underground cables.
example.egtrans: 电力是由地下电缆输送的。

example.eg: Three people have been arrested for supplying arms to the terrorists.
example.egtrans: 有三个人因为向恐怖分子提供武器而被捕。

example.eg: The company has supplied the royal family (= provided them with something they need) for years.
example.egtrans: 多年来该公司一直为皇室供货。

example.eg: At the beginning of termthe semester, students are supplied with a list of books that they are expected to read.
example.egtrans: 在学期初，学生们拿到了一份阅读书目清单。

supply.name: supply
supply.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an amount of something that is available for use

example.eg: Whenever she goes out with her baby, she always takes a large supply of baby food with her.
example.egtrans: 每次她带孩子出门，总会带上大量的婴儿食品。

example.eg: In the capital, demand for cheap housing far outstrips supply (= what is provided).
example.egtrans: 在首都，廉价住房远远供不应求。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: food or other things necessary for living

example.eg: The refugees are urgently in need of food and medical supplies.
example.egtrans: 难民急需食品和医疗用品。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an amount of something available

example.eg: Extensive mining has reduced the supplies of coal in the area.
example.egtrans: 大量开采，已减少了该地区的煤炭供应量。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the system used for supplying gas, electricity, etc. to people

example.eg: Someone has turned off the electricity supply.
example.egtrans: 有人切断了供电系统。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is in short supply, there is little of it available.

example.eg: Strawberries are in short supply this summer.
example.egtrans: 今年夏天草莓供应不足。

suppose.name: suppose
suppose.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: suppose
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to think that something is likely to be true

example.eg: Dan didn't answer his phone, so I suppose (that) he's busy.
example.egtrans: 丹没有接我的电话，所以我想他应该很忙。

example.eg: He found it a lot more difficult to get a job than he supposed it would be.
example.egtrans: 他发现找工作比他想象的要难多了。

example.eg: Do you suppose (that) Gillian will marry him?
example.egtrans: 你认为吉莉恩会嫁给他吗?

example.eg: It is widely supposed (that) the CEO will be forced to resign.
example.egtrans: 很多人都猜测总裁会被迫辞职。

example.eg: We all supposed him to be German, but in fact he was Swiss.
example.egtrans: 我们都以为他是德国人，可事实上他是瑞士人。

example.eg: Her new book is supposed to be (= generally people think it is) very good.
example.egtrans: 很多人都认为她的新书写得非常好。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to show that you think something is true, although you wish that it were not
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于表示与愿望相反的估计）猜，推测

example.eg: I suppose (that) all the tickets will be sold by now.
example.egtrans: 我想现在所有的票恐怕都已经卖完了。

trans_examp.trans_en: used when you are annoyed

example.eg: I suppose (that) you're going to be late again.
example.egtrans: 我看你又要迟到了。

example.eg: I suppose (that) you think that's funny. Well, I certainly don't.
example.egtrans: 我想你会认为这很有趣。但我一点儿也不这么认为。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to show unwillingness to agree

example.eg: "Can I go out tonight?" "Oh, I suppose so."
example.egtrans: “我今晚能出去吗?”“哦，行吧。”

example.eg: I don't agree with it, but I suppose (that) it's for the best.
example.egtrans: 我对此并不赞同，但我想这也是最好的办法了。

trans_examp.trans_en: used in making polite requests

example.eg: I don't suppose (that) you could lend me £5 till tomorrow?
example.egtrans: 您能借给我5英镑，我明天还给您吗？

dsense.name: suppose
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to expect and need

example.eg: Investment of this kind supposes (= would not be possible without) an increase in the company's profits this year.
example.egtrans: 公司今年的利润要有增长才能进行这样的投资。

suppose.name: suppose
suppose.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: used at the beginning of a sentence or clause to mean 'what would happen if'

example.eg: Suppose we miss the train - what will we do then?
example.egtrans: 假设我们错过了火车——那我们该怎么办?

example.eg: We'd love to come and see you on Saturday, supposing (= if) I don't have to work that day.
example.egtrans: 如果我星期六不用上班的话，我们会来看你。

swipe.name: swipe
swipe.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: swipe
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hit or try to hit something, especially with a sideways movement
trans_examp.trans_cn: 击打，尤指抡起（某物）猛打

example.eg: She opened the window and swiped at the flies with a rolled-up newspaper to make them go out.
example.egtrans: 她打开窗户，挥舞着卷起的报纸一阵猛打，想把苍蝇赶出去。

example.eg: She swiped him round the head.
example.egtrans: 她挥手打了他的头。

example.eg: The car swiped the side of the garage as he pulled out.
example.egtrans: 他把车开出去的时候撞上了车库的大门。

dsense.name: swipe
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to steal

example.eg: Okay, who swiped my keys?
example.egtrans: 好吧，是谁偷了我的钥匙？

dsense.name: swipe
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to move a card containing information stored on a magnetic strip through a device that reads this information
to move your finger over the screen of a mobile phone or tablet in order to move onto the next page, choose something, etc.

example.eg: Swipe left to see more search results.
example.egtrans: 左滑查看更多搜索结果。

swipe.name: swipe
swipe.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: swipe
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a criticism of someone or something, or an attempt to annoy them or damage it

example.eg: In a recent interview, she takes a swipe at the theatre management.
example.egtrans: 在最近的一次采访中，她批评了剧院的管理。

dsense.name: swipe
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of hitting or trying to hit someone or something

example.eg: Ed took a swipe at the ball and missed.
example.egtrans: 埃迪挥臂击球，但没打中。

symbol.name: symbol
symbol.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sign, shape, or object that is used to represent something else

example.eg: A heart shape is the symbol of love.
example.egtrans: 心形是爱的象征。

example.eg: The wheel in the Indian flag is a symbol of peace.
example.egtrans: 印度国旗上的轮子象征和平。

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is used to represent a quality or idea
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某种特性或思想的）代表，象征

example.eg: Water, a symbol of life, recurs as an image throughout her poems.
example.egtrans: 水作为生命的一种象征，在她的诗歌中反复出现。

trans_examp.trans_en: a number, letter, or sign used in mathematics, music, science, etc.

example.eg: The symbol for oxygen is O.
example.egtrans: 氧的化学符号是O。

trans_examp.trans_en: An object can be described as a symbol of something else if it seems to represent it because it is connected with it in a lot of people's minds

example.eg: The private jet is a symbol of wealth.
example.egtrans: 私人喷气式飞机是财富的象征。

syntactically.name: syntactically
syntactically.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that relates to the grammatical arrangement of words in a sentence

example.eg: a syntactically complicated language
example.egtrans: 句法复杂的语言

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that relates to the structure of statements or elements in a computer language

example.eg: I hoped the query was syntactically correct.
example.egtrans: 我希望这个检索的语法是正确的。

syntax.name: syntax
syntax.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the grammatical arrangement of words in a sentence

Table.name: table
Table.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: table
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flat surface, usually supported by four legs, used for putting things on
the people sitting at a table

example.eg: There was a really noisy table behind us celebrating someone's birthday.
example.egtrans: 我们后面的一桌人在给人庆祝生日，吵吵闹闹的。

trans_examp.trans_en: a table that you work at in an office

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to put a cloth, knives, and forks, etc. on the table in preparation for a meal

example.eg: Could you set the table for lunch, please?
example.egtrans: 你来摆下餐桌准备吃午饭好吗？

dsense.name: table
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an arrangement of facts and numbers in rows or blocks, especially in printed material

a 
        
         multiplication table

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a list of the information that is contained in a book

Table.name: table
Table.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to suggest something for discussion

example.eg: An amendment to the proposal was tabled by Mrs James.
example.egtrans: 该项提案的修正案是詹姆斯夫人提交讨论的。

trans_examp.trans_en: to delay discussion of a subject

example.eg: The suggestion was tabled for discussion at a later date.
example.egtrans: 这一提议被留待日后讨论。

tablet.name: tablet
tablet.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: tablet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small, solid piece of medicine

example.eg: a sleeping tablet
example.egtrans: 一片安眠药

example.eg: a vitamin tablet
example.egtrans: 一片维生素

dsense.name: tablet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thin, flat, often square piece of hard material such as wood, stone, or metal

example.eg: The poem was engraved on a tablet of stone.
example.egtrans: 这首诗刻在了一块石匾上。

example.eg: a tablet of soap
example.egtrans: 一块肥皂

dsense.name: tablet
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small, flat computer that is controlled by touching the screen or by using a special pen

tap.name: tap
tap.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hit something gently, and often repeatedly, especially making short, sharp noises

example.eg: The branches tapped against the window.
example.egtrans: 树枝轻轻敲打着窗户。

example.eg: I could hear him tapping his fingers on the desk.
example.egtrans: 我能听见他用手指轻叩桌子的声音。

example.eg: I was tapping my feet (= hitting the floor gently with my feet) to the music.
example.egtrans: 我随着音乐用脚打着拍子。

example.eg: Someone tapped me on the shoulder.
example.egtrans: 有人轻轻拍我的肩膀。

trans_examp.trans_en: to touch the screen of a phone, tablet computer, etc. in order to give an instruction for something to happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: 轻触（手机或平板电脑等给予指令）

example.eg: You can manage the repeat and shuffle options by tapping the screen once and swiping to the left.
example.egtrans: 你可以通过轻触一下屏幕向左滑动来使用重复和移动功能。

example.eg: When I tapped on the update button, the screen went blank.
example.egtrans: 当我轻触升级按钮时，屏幕显示消失了。

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to get or make use of something

example.eg: For more than a century, Eastern cities have expanded their water supplies by tapping ever more remote sources.
example.egtrans: 一个多世纪以来，东部的城市通过开发更偏远地区的水源，扩大了水的供应。

example.eg: There is a rich vein of literary talent here just waiting to be tapped by publishers.
example.egtrans: 众多文学才俊会聚于此，等待着出版商慧眼识珠。

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use a small device attached to a phone in order to listen secretly to what people are saying
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（电话或电报线）上装窃听器；窃听

example.eg: He suspected that his phone had been tapped.
example.egtrans: 他怀疑自己的电话被人窃听了。

tap.name: tap
tap.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a device that controls the flow of liquid, especially water, from a pipe

example.eg: the hot/cold tap
example.egtrans: 热水／冷水龙头

example.eg: Turn the tap on/off.
example.egtrans: 打开／关掉水龙头

trans_examp.trans_en: a device that controls the flow of gas from a pipe

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used to describe beer that is served from a barrel through a tap
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （啤酒）装在有旋塞的桶里的，散装的

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: available for use at any time

example.eg: Working in a library as I do, I have all this information on tap.
example.egtrans: 我在图书馆工作，可以随时查阅所有这些资料。

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a gentle knock or touch, or the noise made by knocking something gently
trans_examp.trans_cn: 轻扣，轻敲，轻拍；轻轻拍打（或敲击）的声响

example.eg: I gave her a tap on the shoulder and she turned around.
example.egtrans: 我轻轻拍了她的肩一下，她回过头来。

example.eg: There was a tap on the window - Dad was outside!
example.egtrans: 有人轻轻敲了一下窗子－－是爸爸在外面！

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en:
→ 
        
         tap dancing

example.eg: He teaches tap and ballroom.
example.egtrans: 他教人跳踢踏舞和交谊舞。

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small piece of equipment that can be attached to a phone in order to listen secretly to someone's phone calls
trans_examp.trans_cn: 在（电话或电报线）上装窃听器；窃听

example.eg: He claims that he knew nothing of government phone taps on journalists during those years.
example.egtrans: 他宣称自己对那几年政府监听记者电话的事一无所知。

dsense.name: tap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sound made by the tongue moving upwards and downwards very quickly and hitting the alveolar area

task.name: task
task.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: task
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of work to be done, especially one done regularly, unwillingly, or with difficulty
trans_examp.trans_cn: 任务；（尤指经常、不情愿或很难做的）工作；（苦）差事

example.eg: We usually ask interviewees to perform a few simple tasks on the computer just to test their aptitude.
example.egtrans: 我们通常让接受面试者在电脑上进行一些简单操作，只想测测他们的能力。

example.eg: The government now faces the daunting task of restructuring the entire health service.
example.egtrans: 政府现在面临着重新改组整个医疗卫生体系的艰巨任务。

dsense.name: task
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to criticize or speak angrily to someone for something that they have done wrong

example.eg: She took her assistant to task for/over her carelessness.
example.egtrans: 她责备助手太粗心大意。

task.name: task
task.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone a task

example.eg: We have been tasked with setting up camps for refugees.
example.egtrans: 我们接到了建难民营的任务。

technique.name: technique
technique.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of doing an activity that needs skill

example.eg: We have developed a new technique for detecting errors in the manufacturing process.
example.egtrans: 我们开发了一项新技术，用于检测生产流程中的错误。

example.eg: She's a wonderfully creative dancer but she doesn't have the technique of a truly great performer.
example.egtrans: 她是一个很有创造力的舞蹈演员，但她缺乏一个真正伟大的舞蹈家的技巧。

tedious.name: tedious
tedious.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: boring

example.eg: a tedious job
example.egtrans: 单调乏味的工作

example.eg: The problem is I find most forms of exercise so tedious.
example.egtrans: 问题是我觉得大多数形式的锻炼都很乏味。

temporal.name: temporal
temporal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: temporal
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to practical matters or physical things, rather than spiritual ones

dsense.name: temporal
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to the temple (= the side of the head behind the eyes) or the temporal bone of the skull beneath the temple

example.eg: the temporal bone/lobe
example.egtrans: 颞骨／叶

tempting.name: tempting
tempting.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If something is tempting, you want to do or have it.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 诱人的，吸引人的；使人禁不住想尝试（或拥有）的

example.eg: a tempting offer
example.egtrans: 诱人的提议

example.eg: That pie looks very tempting.
example.egtrans: 那个馅饼看起来很诱人。

example.eg: It's tempting to blame video games for violent behaviour in young men.
example.egtrans: 人们禁不住要把犯罪率的升高归咎于电子游戏。

term.name: term
term.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: term
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the fixed period of time that something lasts for

example.eg: He served a short term for drunk driving.
example.egtrans: 他因酒后开车而短期入狱。

example.eg: He was sentenced to a 150-year prison term for cheating thousands of ordinary people out of their savings.
example.egtrans: 他因诈骗几千人的积蓄而被判入狱150年。

example.eg: The government's term of office (= the period in which they have power) expires at the end of the year.
example.egtrans: 这届政府的任期年底届满。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the periods into which a year is divided at school, college, or university

example.eg: In Britain, the spring term starts in January and ends just before Easter.
example.egtrans: 在英国，春季学期从一月份开始，到复活节前夕结束。

example.eg: Our college has three terms that we call trimesters.
example.egtrans: 我们的大学有三个学期，我们称之为三学期制。

example.eg: We're very busy in term-time (= during the term).
example.egtrans: 学期里我们很忙。

trans_examp.trans_en: the period of time that a legal agreement lasts for

example.eg: The lease on our house is near the end of its term.
example.egtrans: 我们房子的租赁期快满了。

trans_examp.trans_en: the end of a pregnancy when a baby is expected to be born

example.eg: Her last pregnancy went to term (= the baby was born after the expected number of weeks).
example.egtrans: 她上次怀孕是足月生的。

example.eg: a full-term pregnancy
example.egtrans: 足月妊娠

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for a long, medium, or short period of time in the future

example.eg: This decision will cost us more in the short term, but will be beneficial in the long term.
example.egtrans: 这一决定短期来说我们的代价会较大，但从长期看是有益处的。

dsense.name: term
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a word or expression used in relation to a particular subject, often to describe something official or technical

example.eg: "Without let or hindrance" is a legal term that means "freely".
example.egtrans: “毫无阻碍地”是法律用语，意思为“自由地”。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an unkind or unpleasant name to call someone
a kind or friendly name to call someone
used to describe which particular area of a subject you are discussing
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 在…方面；从…方面来说；根据…来看

example.eg: In financial terms, the project was not a success.
example.egtrans: 从经济方面来说，这个项目并不成功。

example.eg: In terms of money, I was better off in my last job.
example.egtrans: 就挣钱而言，我上一份工作挣得更多。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: in a very clear way
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 毫不含糊地，直截了当地

example.eg: She told him what she thought of his behaviour in no uncertain terms (= she made her disapproval very clear).
example.egtrans: 她直截了当地告诉了他自己对他的行为有何看法。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: using language that clearly shows your feelings

example.eg: He complained in the strongest terms.
example.egtrans: 他以极其强烈的措词表达了自己的不满。

example.eg: She spoke of his achievements in glowing terms (= in a very approving way).
example.egtrans: 谈到他的成就，她赞不绝口。

dsense.name: term
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the conditions that control an agreement, arrangement, or activity

example.eg: terms of employment
example.egtrans: 雇佣条款

example.eg: Under the terms of their contract, employees must give three months' notice if they leave.
example.egtrans: 根据合同条款，雇员离职必须提前3个月通知公司。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you buy something on easy terms, you pay for it over a period of time.
having the same rights, treatment, etc.

example.eg: All companies will compete for the government contract on equal terms.
example.egtrans: 所有公司将平等竞争政府的合同。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the matters to which a study or report is limited

term.name: term
term.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something a name or to describe it with a particular expression

example.eg: Technically, a horse that is smaller than 1.5 metres at the shoulder is termed a pony.
example.egtrans: 严格地说，肩高低于1.5米的马称为矮种马。

term.name: -term
term.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: lasting a long/medium/short time

example.eg: The project will have long-term benefits.
example.egtrans: 这个项目将带来长期的好处。

terminal.name: terminal
terminal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: terminal
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a disease or illness) leading gradually to death

example.eg: She has terminal cancer.
example.egtrans: 她患有晚期癌症。

trans_examp.trans_en: A terminal patient is one who is seriously ill and will die soon.

dsense.name: terminal
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: extreme, when referring to something unpleasant or negative
