example.eg: She claims that the shipbuilding industry is in terminal decline.
example.egtrans: 她声称造船业已经衰败到了极点。

example.eg: He has nothing to do all day and is suffering from terminal boredom.
example.egtrans: 他终日无所事事，极其无聊。

terminal.name: terminal
terminal.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: terminal
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the area or building at a station, airport, or port that is used by passengers leaving or arriving by train, aircraft, or ship

example.eg: Terminal 3 is used mostly for domestic flights.
example.egtrans: 三号航站楼主要用于国内航班。

dsense.name: terminal
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of equipment consisting of a keyboard and screen, used for communicating with the part of a computer system that deals with information

dsense.name: terminal
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the point at which a connection can be made in an electric circuit

terms.name: term
terms.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: term
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: We're very busy in term-time (= during the term).
example.egtrans: 学期里我们很忙。

trans_examp.trans_en: the period of time that a legal agreement lasts for

example.eg: The lease on our house is near the end of its term.
example.egtrans: 我们房子的租赁期快满了。

trans_examp.trans_en: the end of a pregnancy when a baby is expected to be born

example.eg: Her last pregnancy went to term (= the baby was born after the expected number of weeks).
example.egtrans: 她上次怀孕是足月生的。

example.eg: a full-term pregnancy
example.egtrans: 足月妊娠

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: for a long, medium, or short period of time in the future

example.eg: This decision will cost us more in the short term, but will be beneficial in the long term.
example.egtrans: 这一决定短期来说我们的代价会较大，但从长期看是有益处的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an unkind or unpleasant name to call someone

dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 毫不含糊地，直截了当地

example.eg: She told him what she thought of his behaviour in no uncertain terms (= she made her disapproval very clear).
example.egtrans: 她直截了当地告诉了他自己对他的行为有何看法。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: using language that clearly shows your feelings

example.eg: He complained in the strongest terms.
example.egtrans: 他以极其强烈的措词表达了自己的不满。

example.eg: She spoke of his achievements in glowing terms (= in a very approving way).
example.egtrans: 谈到他的成就，她赞不绝口。

dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the conditions that control an agreement, arrangement, or activity

example.eg: terms of employment
example.egtrans: 雇佣条款

example.eg: Under the terms of their contract, employees must give three months' notice if they leave.
example.egtrans: 根据合同条款，雇员离职必须提前3个月通知公司。

example.egtrans: 所有公司将平等竞争政府的合同。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the matters to which a study or report is limited

terms.name: term
terms.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to give something a name or to describe it with a particular expression

example.eg: Technically, a horse that is smaller than 1.5 metres at the shoulder is termed a pony.
example.egtrans: 严格地说，肩高低于1.5米的马称为矮种马。

terms.name: -term
terms.posTip: A letter or group of letters added to the end of a word to make a new word.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: lasting a long/medium/short time

example.eg: The project will have long-term benefits.
example.egtrans: 这个项目将带来长期的好处。

terribly.name: terribly
terribly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: terribly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very badly

example.eg: I slept terribly last night.
example.egtrans: 我昨晚睡得很不好。

dsense.name: terribly
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: very

example.eg: I'm terribly pleased to hear that you've got a job.
example.egtrans: 听说你找到了工作，我高兴坏了。

example.eg: I was terribly sorry to hear about the death of your mother.
example.egtrans: 听到你母亲去世的消息，我非常难过。

terse.name: terse
terse.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: using few words, sometimes in a way that seems rude or unfriendly

example.eg: "Are you feeling any better?" "No!" was the terse reply.
example.egtrans: “你觉得好点儿了吗？”“没有。”回答简短而生硬。

therefore.name: therefore
therefore.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: for that reason

example.eg: We were unable to get funding and therefore had to abandon the project.
example.egtrans: 我们无法筹到资金，因此不得不放弃计划。

third-party.name: third party
third-party.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a third person or organization less directly involved in a matter than the main people or organizations that are involved

though.name: though
though.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: despite the fact that

example.eg: She hasn't called, even though she said she would.
example.egtrans: 虽然她说过要打电话，可还没打。

trans_examp.trans_en: but

example.eg: They're coming next week, though I don't know which day.
example.egtrans: 他们下周要来，但我不知道是哪天。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as if

example.eg: You look as though you've been running a marathon!
example.egtrans: 你看上去好像跑了个马拉松似的！

though.name: though
though.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: despite this

example.eg: We went to high school together. I haven't seen her for years, though.
example.egtrans: 我们是高中校友，但我已多年没见过她了。

thread.name: thread
thread.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: thread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (a length of) a very thin fibre

example.eg: needle and thread
example.egtrans: 针线

example.eg: loose threads
example.egtrans: 松散的线

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin line of something such as light or smoke

example.eg: A thin thread of light made its way through the curtains.
example.egtrans: 一缕光线透过帘子照进来。

dsense.name: thread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: The thread of a book, discussion, speech, etc. is its story or the way that it develops, one part connecting with another

example.eg: One of the main threads of the film is the development of the relationship between the boy and his uncle.
example.egtrans: 电影的一条主线是男孩和他叔叔之间关系的发展。

example.eg: The sound distracted me and I lost the thread of (= forgot) what I was saying.
example.egtrans: 我被那个声音打扰了，忘了刚才在说什么。

trans_examp.trans_en: a connected group of pieces of writing on the internet, where people are talking about a particular subject

example.eg: I was so glad to find this thread, and to know that lots of people have the same problem as me!
example.egtrans: 我很高兴看到这张帖子，发现很多人也有我同样的问题！

dsense.name: thread
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a continuous raised line, such as the one that goes around the outside of a screw or bolt or the inside of a hole

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: clothes

thread.name: thread
thread.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: thread
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put something long and thin such as string or thread through a narrow hole or into a small space

example.eg: to thread a needle
example.egtrans: 穿针

example.eg: The sari had gold strands threaded through the material.
example.egtrans: 这件莎丽的布料间穿上了金线。

dsense.name: thread
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to remove hair from someone's face using a long piece of thread

example.eg: Have you ever had your eyebrows threaded?
example.egtrans: 你有没有用长细线修过眉毛？

throttle.name: throttle
throttle.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a valve which allows more or less fuel to go into an engine and so changes the power with which the engine operates

throttle.name: throttle
throttle.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: throttle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to press someone's throat very tightly so that they cannot breathe

example.eg: Sometimes he annoys me so much that I could throttle him.
example.egtrans: 有时他真让我讨厌，我恨不得掐死他。

dsense.name: throttle
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to prevent something from succeeding

example.eg: The reduction in funds is throttling the development of new programmes.
example.egtrans: 经费的削减将阻碍新计划的开展。

throughout.name: throughout
throughout.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: in every part, or during the whole period of time

example.eg: People throughout the country are out of work.
example.egtrans: 全国各地的人都失去了工作。

example.eg: He yawned throughout the performance.
example.egtrans: 演出期间他一直在打哈欠。

example.eg: The school has been repainted throughout.
example.egtrans: 学校各处都重新粉刷了一遍。

thumb.name: thumb
thumb.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the short, thick finger on the side of your hand that makes it possible to hold and pick things up easily

thumb.name: thumb
thumb.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to stand near the edge of a road and hold out your hand with the thumb raised as a signal for a vehicle to stop and take you somewhere
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 竖起拇指要求免费搭车

example.eg: We thumbed a lift to London.
example.egtrans: 我们搭便车去了伦敦。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to show no respect, or to raise the end of your thumb to the end of your nose to show that you do not respect someone

example.eg: He has thumbed his nose at authority all his life.
example.egtrans: 他一生都藐视权威。

Thus.name: thus
Thus.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in this way

example.eg: Bend from the waist, thus.
example.egtrans: 弯腰，就这样。

trans_examp.trans_en: with this result

example.eg: They planned to reduce staff and thus to cut costs.
example.egtrans: 他们计划裁员，从而达到降低成本的目的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: as far as this or until now

example.eg: We haven't had any problems thus far.
example.egtrans: 我们至今没有出现任何问题。

tie.name: tie
tie.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fasten together two ends of a piece of string or other long, thin material, or to (cause to) hold together with a long, thin piece of string, material, etc.

example.eg: Could you tie this piece of string for me?
example.egtrans: 你能帮我把这个绳子打个结吗？

example.eg: This skirt ties at the waist.
example.egtrans: 这条连衣裙是在腰间系带的。

example.eg: She tied the ribbon tightly in a bow/knot.
example.egtrans: 她把丝带打成一个紧紧的蝴蝶结。

example.eg: I tie my hair back when it's hot.
example.egtrans: 天热时我就把头发系在脑后。

example.eg: Tie (up) your shoelaces, or you'll trip over them.
example.egtrans: 把鞋带系好，不然会摔跤的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to force someone to stay in a place

example.eg: I felt tied to the job while I had a mortgage to pay.
example.egtrans: 因为有按揭贷款要还，我感到自己被这份工作束缚住了。

example.eg: Her job ties her to the east coast.
example.egtrans: 她的工作把她约束在东海岸。

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to relate to or connect to

example.eg: Is the allergy tied to dairy products, for example?
example.egtrans: 比如说，过敏症与奶制品有关系吗？

example.eg: Can you tie his behaviour up with anything that's happened recently?
example.egtrans: 你认为他的行为与最近发生的什么事有关联吗？

example.eg: The Republicans are trying to tie the funding up with this bill.
example.egtrans: 共和党试图把资金与这项法案联系起来。

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to finish at the same time or score the same number of points, etc. in a competition as someone or something else

example.eg: Jane and I tied (for first place) in the spelling test.
example.egtrans: 在拼写比赛中（争夺第一名时）我和简打成平手。

example.eg: We tied with a team from the south in the championships.
example.egtrans: 在锦标赛中我们和一支南方队打成平手。

tie.name: tie
tie.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a long, thin piece of material that is worn under a shirt collar, especially by men, and tied in a knot at the front

example.eg: He always wears a jacket and tie to work.
example.egtrans: 他上班时总是穿西服打领带。

trans_examp.trans_en: any piece of string, plastic, metal, etc. that is used to fasten or hold together something

example.eg: Can you see the ties for the rubbish bags in the cupboard?
example.egtrans: 你看到柜子里扎垃圾袋的带子了吗？

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the friendly feelings that people have for other people, or special connections with places

example.eg: Family ties are weaker if you move a long way away.
example.egtrans: 离家太远就会与家人疏远。

example.eg: I no longer feel any ties with my home town.
example.egtrans: 我对我的家乡再也没有任何亲切感了。

example.eg: He urged governments worldwide to break diplomatic ties with the new regime.
example.egtrans: 他敦促世界各国政府断绝与新政权的外交关系。

dsense.name: tie
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which two or more people finish at the same time or score the same number of points

example.eg: It's a tie for first place.
example.egtrans: 两人并列第一。

example.eg: They have changed the scoring system because there have been too many ties.
example.egtrans: 因为常常出现不分胜负的结果，他们改变了计分制。

tight.name: tight
tight.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (held or kept together) firmly or closely
trans_examp.trans_cn: 紧的；密封的（地）；牢固的（地）

example.eg: I can't untie the knot - it's too tight.
example.egtrans: 我解不开这个结——太紧了。

example.eg: This lid is on very tight.
example.egtrans: 这盖子盖得很紧。

example.eg: The people stood talking in tight groups.
example.egtrans: 大家一群群地紧挨着站在那里说话。

example.eg: Hold on tight when we go around the corner.
example.egtrans: 我们转弯时大家都要抓牢扶好。

example.eg: Check that windows and doors are shut tight (= completely closed) before you leave.
example.egtrans: 走之前检查一下窗户和门是否关严了。

example.eg: The plastic cover was stretched tight (= stretched as much as it could be) across the tank.
example.egtrans: 水箱上的塑料罩子绷得很紧。

tight.name: tight
tight.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: tight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Clothes or shoes that are tight fit the body too closely and are uncomfortable.

example.eg: That jacket's too tight - you need a bigger size.
example.egtrans: 那件夹克太紧身了——你需要号大一点的。

trans_examp.trans_en: If you have a tight feeling in your chest you have an uncomfortable feeling of pressure, caused by illness, fear, etc.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （由于疾病、恐惧等）憋闷的，不适的

dsense.name: tight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Controls or rules that are tight are ones that severely limit what can happen.

example.eg: tight security
example.egtrans: 严密的安全措施

dsense.name: tight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If time or money is tight, there is only just enough of it.

example.eg: I'm sorry I can't stay for a chat, time's really tight.
example.egtrans: 对不起我不能停，时间真的很紧。

example.eg: They're raising three kids on one small salary so money is very tight.
example.egtrans: 他们靠一份微薄的薪水抚养3个孩子，所以手头很紧。

dsense.name: tight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en:
→ 
        
         tight-fisted informal disapproving
trans_examp.trans_cn: 用钱不大方的，吝啬的（同 tight-fisted）

dsense.name: tight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: having drunk too much alcohol

example.eg: Jim, you're tight!
example.egtrans: 吉姆，你醉了！

dsense.name: tight
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If two people are tight, they know each other very well and like each other a lot.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 亲密的；个人关系密切的

example.eg: The two of them were pretty tight at school.
example.egtrans: 他们俩在学生时代关系非常亲密。

timeline.name: timeline
timeline.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a line that shows the time and the order in which events have happened
a plan that shows how long something will take or when things will happen
trans_examp.trans_cn: （显示做某事所需时间或某事何时发生的）时间表

trans_examp.trans_en: the part of a social media website where items that have been added by you, or that relate to you, are shown

example.eg: You can use these tools to control what you share on your profile and timeline.
example.egtrans: 你可以使用这些工具来控制你在个人资料里和时间轴上所分享的内容。

tinker.name: tinker
tinker.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make small changes to something, especially in an attempt to repair or improve it

example.eg: He spends every weekend tinkering (around) with his car.
example.egtrans: 他每个周末都在摆弄他的汽车。

example.eg: I wish the government would stop tinkering with the health service.
example.egtrans: 我希望政府不要再在公共医疗卫生服务上折腾了。

tinker.name: tinker
tinker.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: tinker
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: especially in the past, a person who travelled from place to place, repairing pans or other metal containers
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指过去游走四方的）补锅匠

dsense.name: tinker
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a child who behaves badly

example.eg: You tinker, Nicky, you shouldn't have done that.
example.egtrans: 尼基，你这个小淘气，你不该那么做。

example.eg: Don't be such a tinker.
example.egtrans: 别这么淘气。

dsense.name: tinker
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of making small changes to something

example.eg: I'll just have a tinker with the TV and see if I can get it to work.
example.egtrans: 我就摆弄一下电视，看能不能修好。

tinkering.name: tinker
tinkering.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make small changes to something, especially in an attempt to repair or improve it

example.eg: He spends every weekend tinkering (around) with his car.
example.egtrans: 他每个周末都在摆弄他的汽车。

example.eg: I wish the government would stop tinkering with the health service.
example.egtrans: 我希望政府不要再在公共医疗卫生服务上折腾了。

tinkering.name: tinker
tinkering.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: tinker
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: especially in the past, a person who travelled from place to place, repairing pans or other metal containers
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指过去游走四方的）补锅匠

dsense.name: tinker
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a child who behaves badly

example.eg: You tinker, Nicky, you shouldn't have done that.
example.egtrans: 尼基，你这个小淘气，你不该那么做。

example.eg: Don't be such a tinker.
example.egtrans: 别这么淘气。

dsense.name: tinker
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of making small changes to something

example.eg: I'll just have a tinker with the TV and see if I can get it to work.
example.egtrans: 我就摆弄一下电视，看能不能修好。

token.name: token
token.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: token
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that you do, or a thing that you give someone, that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect

example.eg: As a token of our gratitude for all that you have done, we would like you to accept this small gift.
example.egtrans: 为了表示我们对你们所做的一切的感谢，希望你们接受我们这份小小的礼物。

example.eg: It doesn't have to be a big present - it's just a token.
example.egtrans: 礼物不必大——只是为了表示一下。

dsense.name: token
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper with a particular amount of money printed on it that can be exchanged in a shop for goods of that value

example.eg: a £20 book/gift/record token
example.egtrans: 一张价值20英镑的书券／礼券／唱片券

dsense.name: token
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a round metal or plastic disc that is used instead of money in some machines
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某些机器中用以代替纸币的）代币，专用辅币

token.name: token
token.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Token actions are done to show that you are doing something, even if the results are limited in their effect.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有标志性的；有象征意义的

example.eg: The troops in front of us either surrendered or offered only token (= not much) resistance.
example.egtrans: 我们前面的军队要么投降，要么只作了象征性的抵抗。

example.eg: They were the only country to argue for even token recognition of the Baltic states' independence.
example.egtrans: 他们是唯一为波罗的海沿岸国家争取哪怕是象征性承认的国家。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to something that is done to prevent other people complaining, although it is not sincerely meant and has no real effect

example.eg: The truth is that they appoint no more than a token number of women to managerial jobs.
example.egtrans: 事实上他们只装装样子，任命了一些女性担任管理工作。

tolerable.name: tolerable
tolerable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: of a quality that is acceptable, although certainly not good

example.eg: At their best the conditions in these prisons are barely tolerable.
example.egtrans: 即使在最好的时候，这些监狱里的条件也让人难以忍受。

example.eg: For me it's friendships that make life tolerable.
example.egtrans: 对我而言，是友谊才使生活尚且过得去。

totally.name: totally
totally.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely

example.eg: Her second husband is totally different from Mark.
example.egtrans: 她的第二任丈夫与马克截然不同。

example.eg: I totally agree with you.
example.egtrans: 我完全同意你的看法。

touch.name: touch
touch.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put your hand or another part of your body lightly onto and off something or someone

example.eg: That paint is wet - don't touch (it).
example.egtrans: 那块油漆没干——别碰（它）。

example.eg: He touched the girl on the arm to get her attention.
example.egtrans: 他碰了碰女孩的胳膊以引起她的注意。

example.eg: The boy touched the worm with (= using, in his hand) a twig.
example.egtrans: 小孩用小树枝碰了碰虫子。

example.eg: The setting sun touched the trees with red (= made them appear red for a short time).
example.egtrans: 落日的余晖染红了树林。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of two or more things) to be so close together that there is no space between; to be in contact
trans_examp.trans_cn: （两个或两个以上的物品）接触

example.eg: He fell asleep as soon as his head touched the pillow.
example.egtrans: 他头一沾枕头就睡着了。

example.eg: She pushed the two bookcases together until they touched/were touching.
example.egtrans: 她把两个书柜推到一起。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to harm someone, or use or damage something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 伤害（某人）；使用（某物）；破坏（某物）

example.eg: Please don't touch any of my stuff while I'm away.
example.egtrans: 我不在时候请不要碰我的东西。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (usually used in negative sentences) to eat or drink something

example.eg: They didn't touch any of the food we left for them.
example.egtrans: 我们留下来给他们的食物，他们一点也没碰。

example.eg: Honestly, I haven't touched a drop (= drunk any alcohol) all night.
example.egtrans: 老实说，我整晚滴酒未沾。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to influence someone or something emotionally, or cause feelings of sympathy in someone

example.eg: Tragedy touched their lives when their son was 16.
example.egtrans: 他们儿子16岁那年，他们的生活中发生了悲剧。

example.eg: The TV report about the children's work for charity touched thousands of people's hearts.
example.egtrans: 电视上报道的孩子们为慈善团体所做的事令成千上万的人深受触动。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: (usually used in negative sentences) to have or reach the same standard (= level of quality) as someone or something

example.eg: Her novels can't touch (= are not as good as) those of her sister.
example.egtrans: 她的小说不及她姐姐的好。

example.eg: There's no one to touch him as an illustrator of children's books.
example.egtrans: 在为儿童读物创作插图方面，没人比他画得好。

touch.name: touch
touch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small amount

example.eg: "Would you like milk?" "Just a touch."
example.egtrans: “你要牛奶吗？”“只要一点儿。”

example.eg: There was a touch of irony/humour in her voice.
example.egtrans: 她的话音中带着点儿讽刺／幽默的意味。

trans_examp.trans_en: To show that an illness is not too serious, you can say you have had a touch of it.

example.eg: I had a touch of flu/hay fever.
example.egtrans: 我得了轻度流感／枯草热。

trans_examp.trans_en: a small addition or detail that makes something better

example.eg: The speech had several comic touches.
example.egtrans: 这一演讲有几分滑稽色彩。

example.eg: Using a sailing ship as the company logo was a touch of genius (= a good/clever idea or action).
example.egtrans: 用大帆船作公司的标志真是个天才的想法。

example.eg: The flowers on the table provided the finishing touch.
example.egtrans: 桌上的花是最后一道点缀。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: slightly

example.eg: The weather has turned a touch too cold for my liking.
example.egtrans: 天气变得有点儿凉，我不太喜欢。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the ability to know what something is like by feeling it with the fingers

example.eg: the sense of touch
example.egtrans: 触觉

example.eg: I found the right coin in the dark by touch.
example.egtrans: 我在黑暗中摸索着找对了硬币。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used after an adjective to express how something feels when you put your hand on it

example.eg: The material was soft to the touch.
example.egtrans: 这块布料摸起来很柔软。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quick, light movement of one thing, especially a hand, onto and off another thing

example.eg: I felt a cold touch on my arm.
example.egtrans: 我感到有什么冰凉的东西碰到了我的胳膊。

example.eg: At a/the touch of a button, the door opened.
example.egtrans: 一碰按钮，门就开了。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

phrase.phrase_title: be, get, keep, etc. in touch

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to communicate or continue to communicate with someone by using a phone or writing to them

example.eg: Are you still in touch with any of your old school friends?
example.egtrans: 你还和以前学生时代的老朋友有联系吗？

example.eg: Jen and I never kept in touch after college.
example.egtrans: 我和简大学毕业后就没有联系过。

example.eg: We're in close touch with our office in Spain.
example.egtrans: 我们与西班牙的办事处有密切的联系。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to stop communicating with someone, usually because they do not live near you now

example.eg: We lost touch over the years.
example.egtrans: 我们这些年失去了联系。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an ability to do things in the stated, especially positive, way

example.eg: He has a deft touch with tricky painting jobs.
example.egtrans: 他很善于做复杂的油漆活。

example.eg: She gave the job her own special/magic/professional/personal touch.
example.egtrans: 这项工作展现了她独特／神奇／专业／个人的才能。

example.eg: I admire her lightness/sureness of touch as a cook.
example.egtrans: 我欣赏她做厨师的精细／踏实劲儿。

example.eg: He used to be a good writer but I think he's losing his touch.
example.egtrans: 他曾经是个好作家，但我觉得他的创作能力正在下降。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports such as football, a player's ability to control the ball and make it do what they want, or an occasion when a player controls the ball with their foot
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球等体育中）触球能力；触球

example.eg: Nicolas Anelka squandered the chance to score when his touch let him down in front of goal.
example.egtrans: 尼古拉·安内尔卡在球门前触球不当，浪费了一次进球机会。

example.eg: Hazard took several touches before crossing.
example.egtrans: 哈扎德触了好几次球之后把球传中。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the area outside either of the long edges of the space on which football and rugby are played
trans_examp.trans_cn: （足球及类似体育运动的）边线以外区域

example.eg: Playing for safety, he kicked the ball into touch.
example.egtrans: 为了安全起见，他把球踢出了界外。

dsense.name: touch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you are in touch/out of touch with a subject, activity, or situation, your knowledge about it is recent/not recent.

example.eg: He's not really in touch with what young people are interested in.
example.egtrans: 他并不真正了解年轻人现在对什么感兴趣。

example.eg: I didn't see any news all the time I was on holiday, so I'm completely out of touch.
example.egtrans: 我在度假期间一直都没有看新闻，所以现在对外界一无所知。

track.name: track
track.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the pair of long metal bars fixed on the ground at an equal distance from each other, along which trains travel

example.eg: a ten-mile stretch of track
example.egtrans: 10英里长的铁轨

example.eg: Passengers are requested not to walk across the tracks.
example.egtrans: 乘客不要穿越铁轨。

trans_examp.trans_en: a path or rough road that is made of soil rather than having a surface covered with stone or other material

example.eg: The house is at the end of a dirt/an unmade track.
example.egtrans: 房子在一条泥土路／尚未铺好的小路的尽头。

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of path or road, often in the shape of a ring, that has been specially designed and built for sports events, especially racing

example.eg: an all-weather track
example.egtrans: 全天候赛道

example.eg: a dog/horse track
example.egtrans: 赛狗／马的跑道

example.eg: The runners are now on their final lap of the track.
example.egtrans: 赛跑选手正在跑最后一圈。

trans_examp.trans_en: a sport in which people compete with each other by running a race on a specially prepared circular path

example.eg: a track event
example.egtrans: 径赛

example.eg: Sam runs track on the high school team.
example.egtrans: 萨姆参加了高中径赛队。

trans_examp.trans_en: the general name for a particular group of sports in which people compete, including running, jumping, and throwing

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a mark or line of marks left on the ground or on another surface by an animal, person, or vehicle that has moved over it, showing the direction they moved in

example.eg: Police found tyre tracks in the mud.
example.egtrans: 警方在泥地里发现了轮胎印。

example.eg: The hunters followed the tracks of the deer for hours.
example.egtrans: 猎人循着鹿的脚印追了几个小时。

example.eg: The burglars were careful not to leave any tracks behind them.
example.egtrans: 盗贼小心翼翼地不留下任何踪迹。

phrase.phrase_title: be on the track of sb/sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be examining marks or pieces of information that show where a person or animal has gone, in order to catch him, her, or it

example.eg: The police are on the track of the killer.
example.egtrans: 警方正在追踪该杀人犯。

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the direction that something has taken or will take through the air

example.eg: People living in the track of the hurricane have been advised to leave their homes until it has passed.
example.egtrans: 已经建议居住在飓风经过之处的人们从家中撤离，直到飓风过后再回去。

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the direction in which someone's job or education develops

example.eg: She was a lawyer, but then she changed track completely and became a doctor.
example.egtrans: 她当过律师，但后来彻底转行成了医生。

trans_examp.trans_en: the way in which a thought or idea has developed or might develop

example.eg: I found it difficult to follow the track of his argument.
example.egtrans: 我觉得难以跟上他论证的思路。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to start talking about something that is not part of what you should be talking about

example.eg: I think we're getting off the track here - we're supposed to be discussing our advertising campaign.
example.egtrans: 我觉得我们离题了——我们应该讨论的是广告宣传活动。

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of school students with similar ability who are approximately the same age and are taught together
trans_examp.trans_cn: （同龄学生依智力编排的）班，组

example.eg: Students who do well in their 8th grade classes will qualify for the honors track in high school.
example.egtrans: 在八年级成绩比较好的学生可以在高中加入荣誉学位班。

example.eg: the top/bottom track
example.egtrans: 程度高／低的班

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of several songs or pieces of music on a CD or other musical recording
trans_examp.trans_cn: （光盘、录音磁带等上的）一首歌，一支乐曲

example.eg: The album includes four previously unreleased tracks.
example.egtrans: 这张专辑收录了4首以前未曾面世的歌曲。

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a magnetic strip onto which sound can be recorded, with several tracks on one magnetic strip

example.eg: When a piece of music is recorded, each instrument is recorded separately on a 24 or 48–track tape.
example.egtrans: 录制音乐时，每一种乐器分别被录制在一盘24或48声道的磁带上。

track.name: track
track.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to follow a person or animal by looking for proof that they have been somewhere, or by using electronic equipment

example.eg: It's difficult to track an animal over stony ground.
example.egtrans: 很难在多石的地面上追踪动物。

example.eg: The military use radar satellites to track targets through clouds and at night.
example.egtrans: 军队用雷达卫星透过云雾和夜幕追踪目标。

example.eg: The terrorists were tracked to (= found in) Amsterdam.
example.egtrans: 恐怖分子在阿姆斯特丹被追踪到。

trans_examp.trans_en: to record the progress or development of something over a period

example.eg: The study tracked the careers of 1,226 doctors who trained at the Medical School.
example.egtrans: 该研究对1226名医学院学生的事业发展情况进行跟踪调查。

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a film or video camera tracks in a particular direction, it moves along while it is filming.

example.eg: The movie ends with a long tracking shot around the deserted house.
example.egtrans: 影片的结尾场景是一个围绕这幢废弃房子拍摄的跟踪长镜头。

trans_examp.trans_en: If a moving part of a recording machine tracks, it gets into the correct position for operating.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （录制设备的移动部件）运转正常

example.eg: Our VCR tracks automatically.
example.egtrans: 我们的录像机能自动摄录。

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to follow the level of an interest rate, share price, etc.

example.eg: The mortgage deal will track the Bank of England base rate plus 0.75 percent.
example.egtrans: 这個抵押貸款的利率将跟随英格兰银行的利率并加0.75个百分点。

example.eg: Tony is putting £500 a month into a a savings account that tracks the FTSE All-Share index.
example.egtrans: 托尼每个月把500英镑存入一个利率跟随金融时报指数变动的储蓄账号。

dsense.name: track
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to group and teach together school students with similar abilities who are approximately the same age
trans_examp.trans_cn: （同龄学生依智力编排的）班，组

example.eg: We start to track the children in the third form.
example.egtrans: 我们从三年级开始把孩子们按能力分班。

tracker.name: tracker
tracker.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who is able to find animals or people by following the marks they leave on the ground as they move over it

example.eg: An Aboriginal tracker led them to the place where the plane had crashed.
example.egtrans: 一个土著追踪者将他们带到了飞机坠毁的地方。

trade-off.name: trade-off
trade-off.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which you balance two opposing situations or qualities

example.eg: There is a trade-off between doing the job accurately and doing it quickly.
example.egtrans: 工作做得准确无误和迅速快捷之间有个平衡。

example.eg: She said that she'd had to make a trade-off between her job and her family.
example.egtrans: 她说她必须平衡好工作和家庭。

trans_examp.trans_en: a situation in which you accept something bad in order to have something good

example.eg: For some car buyers, lack of space is an acceptable trade-off for a sporty design.
example.egtrans: 对一些购车者而言，设计成跑车风格的车型即使空间狭小也是可以接受的。

trademark.name: trademark
trademark.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: trademark
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a name or symbol on a product that shows it was made by a particular company, and that it cannot be used by other companies without permission

example.eg: Velcro is a registered trademark.
example.egtrans: 维可牢是一个注册商标。

dsense.name: trademark
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something very noticeable that a person typically has or does

example.eg: He was wearing one of the brightly coloured ties that are his trademark.
example.egtrans: 他戴着一条他标志性的亮色领带。

example.eg: She gave one of her trademark smiles.
example.egtrans: 她露出了她那特有的微笑。

traditional.name: traditional
traditional.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: following or belonging to the customs or ways of behaving that have continued in a group of people or society for a long time without changing

example.eg: The villagers retain a strong attachment to their traditional values/customs/beliefs.
example.egtrans: 村民们依然固守着传统的价值观／习俗／信仰。

example.eg: The school uses a combination of modern and traditional methods for teaching reading.
example.egtrans: 该校采用传统与现代方式相结合的方法教授阅读。

example.eg: The dancers were wearing traditional Hungarian dress/costume.
example.egtrans: 舞蹈者身着传统匈牙利服装。

example.eg: She's very traditional (in her ideas and opinions).
example.egtrans: 她这人（在思想观念上）非常传统。

trailing.name: trailing
trailing.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Trailing plants grow along the ground or over the surface of something.

example.eg: a trailing rose
example.egtrans: 蔓生的玫瑰

transition.name: transition
transition.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a change from one form or type to another, or the process by which this happens

example.eg: The health-care system is in transition at the moment.
example.egtrans: 医疗保健制度目前正在变革中。

example.eg: There will be an interim government to oversee the transition to democracy.
example.egtrans: 将会有一个临时政府来监督向民主政治的过渡。

trans_examp.trans_en: a change in which someone starts living their life as a person of a different gender

example.eg: She began her transition from male to female almost seven years ago.
example.egtrans: 大约七年前，她开始了从男性到女性的转变。

transition.name: transition
transition.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to start living as a person of a different gender

example.eg: Bornstein transitioned from male to female almost 20 years ago.
example.egtrans: 大约20年前，伯恩斯坦从男人变成了女人。

example.eg: It wasn't easy transitioning gender in the military.
example.egtrans: 在军队中转换性别并不容易。

transitive.name: transitive
transitive.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a verb) having or needing an object

example.eg: In this dictionary, transitive verbs, such as "put", are marked [T].
example.egtrans: 在这本词典中，像 put 这样的及物动词都用 [T] 标记。

transitive.name: transitive
transitive.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a transitive verb

transitivity.name: transitivity
transitivity.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: (of a verb) the fact of being transitive (= having or needing an object) or intransitive (= not having or needing an object)

example.eg: What we want to try to identify is what is the dominant transitivity pattern.
example.egtrans: 我们想要确定什么是主要的及物性模式。

example.eg: The task allowed us to examine the extent to which children had mastered the transitivity of the verbs.
example.egtrans: 这项作业任务使我们能够检查儿童对动词及物性的掌握程度。

transparency.name: transparency
transparency.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: transparency
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the characteristic of being easy to see through

example.eg: The old-fashioned type of plastic lacked transparency.
example.egtrans: 老式塑料透明性不好。

trans_examp.trans_en: a photograph or picture printed on plastic that you can see on a screen by shining a light through it

dsense.name: transparency
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality of being done in an open way without secrets
trans_examp.trans_cn: （公开处理，非秘密进行的）透明度

example.eg: We want more transparency in government.
example.egtrans: 我们想要政府更透明。

transparent.name: transparent
transparent.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: transparent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a substance or object is transparent, you can see through it very clearly.

example.eg: Grow the bulbs in a transparent plastic box, so the children can see the roots growing.
example.egtrans: 把球茎种在透明的塑料盒里，这样孩子们就能看到根的生长。

example.eg: Her blouse was practically transparent!
example.egtrans: 她的衬衫几乎是透明的！

dsense.name: transparent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: clear and easy to understand or recognize
trans_examp.trans_cn: 清楚易懂的；显而易见的

example.eg: I think we should try to make the instructions more transparent.
example.egtrans: 我觉得我们应该尽可能使指令更清楚易懂些。

dsense.name: transparent
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: open and honest, without secrets
trans_examp.trans_cn: 公开和诚实的，无秘密的

example.eg: We are committed to being totally transparent about our charges.
example.egtrans: 我们致力于让收费完全透明。

treat.name: treat
treat.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: treat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to behave towards someone or deal with something in a particular way

example.eg: My parents treated us all the same when we were kids.
example.egtrans: 小时候父母对我们一视同仁。

example.eg: He treated his wife very badly.
example.egtrans: 他对妻子很不好。

example.eg: It's wrong to treat animals as if they had no feelings.
example.egtrans: 把动物当成没有感情的东西来对待是错误的。

example.eg: I treat remarks like that with the contempt that they deserve.
example.egtrans: 那种说法根本不值一提，我对其嗤之以鼻。

dsense.name: treat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use drugs, exercises, etc. to cure a person of a disease or heal an injury

example.eg: He is being treated for a rare skin disease.
example.egtrans: 他患了一种罕见的皮肤病，正在接受治疗。

example.eg: Western medicine tends to treat the symptoms and not the cause.
example.egtrans: 西医往往治标不治本。

dsense.name: treat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to buy or pay for something for another person

example.eg: Put your money away - I'm going to treat you (to this).
example.egtrans: 把钱收起来吧——（这次）我请你。

example.eg: I'm going to treat myself to (= buy for myself) a new pair of sandals.
example.egtrans: 我要给自己买一双新凉鞋。

dsense.name: treat
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to put a special substance on material such as wood, cloth, metal, etc. or put it through a special process, in order to protect it from damage or decay

example.eg: The material has been treated with resin to make it waterproof.
example.egtrans: 这种材料涂上了树脂以防水。

treat.name: treat
treat.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: treat
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a special and enjoyable occasion or experience

example.eg: We're going to Italy for the weekend - it's my birthday treat.
example.egtrans: 我们要去意大利度周末——为我庆祝生日。

example.eg: As a special treat, I'll take you to my favourite restaurant.
example.egtrans: 我要带你到我最喜欢的餐馆去，这是个特别待遇。

dsense.name: treat
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: an occasion when I, you, etc. buy or pay for something for another person

example.eg: No, you paid for dinner last time - this is my treat.
example.egtrans: 不，上次吃饭是你付的钱——这次我请客。

trick.name: trick
trick.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: trick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an action that is intended to deceive, either as a way of cheating someone, or as a joke or form of entertainment

example.eg: She played a really nasty trick on me - she put syrup in my shampoo bottle!
example.egtrans: 她对我搞了一个很讨厌的恶作剧——把糖浆放进了我装洗发剂的瓶子里。

example.eg: My niece was showing me all the tricks that she's learned to do with her new magic set.
example.egtrans: 我侄女给我表演了她学过的用她那套新魔术道具所能变出的所有戏法。

example.eg: It's trick photography - she's supposed to look like she's walking on water.
example.egtrans: 这有点儿特技摄影的样子——她想要看上去像在水上行走一般。

phrase.phrase_title: be a trick of the light

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be an effect caused by light, making something appear different

example.eg: For a moment I thought you had a patch of grey hair, but it's just a trick of the light.
example.egtrans: 一时间我以为你长了一撮白发，看来只是光线造成的错觉而已。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def:
what children say when they go 
        
         trick-or-treating   at Halloween
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: “不款待就捣蛋”（孩子们在万圣节玩这个游戏时所说的话）

dsense.name: trick
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an effective or quick way of doing something

example.eg: What's the trick to getting this chair to fold up?
example.egtrans: 把这张椅子折叠起来有什么诀窍？

example.eg: On page 21, some tricks to speed up your beauty routine.
example.egtrans: 第21页介绍了日常快速化妆的技巧。

trick.name: trick
trick.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to deceive someone, often as a part of a plan

example.eg: Dean tricked the old lady into giving him eight hundred dollars.
example.egtrans: 迪安骗这个老妇人给了他800美元。

trick.name: trick
trick.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: trick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to deceive someone, either as a joke or form of entertainment or so that they makes a mistake
trans_examp.trans_cn: 捉弄的，戏弄的；恶作剧的

example.eg: a trick question
example.egtrans: 一个捉弄人的问题

dsense.name: trick
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: A trick part of the body, especially a joint (= place where two bones are connected), sometimes feels weak suddenly and unexpectedly.

example.eg: I have a trick ankle that gives me problems if I run too much.
example.egtrans: 我的脚脖子有时会突然发软，跑多了会给我带来不少麻烦。

tricky.name: tricky
tricky.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: tricky
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: If a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill.

example.eg: It's tricky to learn to ride a skateboard, but you never forget how.
example.egtrans: 学习滑板挺难的，但是一旦学会就不会忘记。

example.eg: I'm in a tricky situation - whatever I do I'll offend someone.
example.egtrans: 我的处境真有点儿难办——我无论怎么做都会得罪人。

dsense.name: tricky
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: likely to deceive people
trans_examp.trans_cn: 欺骗性的；狡猾的；诡计多端的

example.eg: He's a tricky one.
example.egtrans: 他是一个诡计多端的人。

triggered.name: triggered
triggered.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: experiencing a strong emotional reaction of fear, shock, anger, or worry, especially because you are made to remember something bad that has happened in the past
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指在被迫回忆起过去发生的可怕事件时）情绪反应强烈的，情绪被触发的

example.eg: With my PTSD I'm very easily triggered.
example.egtrans: 因为患有创伤后应激障碍，我的情绪很容易被触发。

tuple.name: tuple
tuple.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a structure of data that has several parts

tutorial.name: tutorial
tutorial.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a period of study with a tutor involving one student or a small group

type.name: type
type.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: type
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular group of people or things that share similar characteristics and form a smaller division of a larger set

example.eg: There were so many different types of bread that I didn't know which to buy.
example.egtrans: 面包种类繁多，我不知该买哪一种。

example.eg: What type of clothes does she wear?
example.egtrans: 她穿什么类型的衣服？

example.eg: It was dark so I didn't notice what type of car it was.
example.egtrans: 天太黑，我没有注意到是什么车型。

example.eg: He's the type of man you could take home to your mother.
example.egtrans: 他是那种你可以带回家见母亲的男人。

example.eg: He's very attractive, if you like the blond, athletic type.
example.egtrans: 假如你喜欢白肤金发、爱好运动那一类型的话，他算是很有魅力的。

example.eg: They sell dried flowers and baskets and that type of thing.
example.egtrans: 他们卖干花、花篮之类的东西。

example.eg: We have a range of moisturizers for all different skin types.
example.egtrans: 我们有一系列适合各种肤质的润肤品。

example.eg: She was young and she was wearing student-type clothes, so I assumed she was studying here.
example.egtrans: 她年龄不大，穿得又像学生，所以我还以为她在这儿上学。

example.eg: He took me to a bar full of actor types trying to get noticed.
example.egtrans: 他带我去了一个酒吧，那里到处是演员一类的人，希望能引起他们的注意。

trans_examp.trans_en: a person who seems to represent a particular group of people, having all the qualities that you usually connect with that group

example.eg: He doesn't use fully rounded characters in his plays - he uses types.
example.egtrans: 他在剧中不用个性丰满的人物——他用的是类型化的人物。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be the type of person that someone thinks is attractive
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 是（某人）喜欢的那种类型

example.eg: He's a nice enough guy - he's just not my type.
example.egtrans: 他人倒是挺好，只是不是我喜欢的那种类型。

example.eg: I would have thought Ben was more your type.
example.egtrans: 我还以为你会更喜欢本这种类型的人。

dsense.name: type
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the style and size of printed letters used in a piece of printed writing such as in a newspaper, book, or article

example.eg: Use bold type for your headings.
example.egtrans: 标题用黑体字。

example.eg: The software allows you to choose from over 20 styles of typeface.
example.egtrans: 用这种软件有20多种字体可选择。

type.name: type
type.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: type
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to write using a machine, either a computer keyboard or a typewriter
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用电脑键盘或打字机等）打字

example.eg: She asked me to type a couple of letters.
example.egtrans: 她叫我打几封信。

example.eg: He can type very quickly.
example.egtrans: 他打字很快。

example.eg: I was typing away into the early hours of the morning just to get it done.
example.egtrans: 我打字打到凌晨，就为把事情做完。

typical.name: typical
typical.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: showing all the characteristics that you would usually expect from a particular group of things

example.eg: I must look like the typical tourist with my shorts and my camera.
example.egtrans: 穿着短裤，带着相机，我看上去一定像个典型的游客。

example.eg: This kind of hot and spicy food is very typical of the food in the south of the country.
example.egtrans: 这种辛辣食品是该国南部具代表性的食物。

example.eg: Typical symptoms would include severe headaches, vomiting and dizziness.
example.egtrans: 典型的症状包括剧烈的头疼、呕吐和眩晕。

trans_examp.trans_en: showing all the bad characteristics that you expect from someone or something, often in a way that is annoying
trans_examp.trans_cn: （不良品质等）特有的，一向如此的，不出所料的

example.eg: It's just typical of Dan to spend all that money on the equipment and then lose interest two months later.
example.egtrans: 丹就是这种人，先把所有的钱花在买装备上，两个月以后又失去了兴趣。

example.eg: "He called at the last minute to say he wasn't coming." "Typical!"
example.egtrans: “他在最后时刻打电话说不来了。”“他老是这样！”

typically.name: typically
typically.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in a way that shows all the characteristics that you would expect from the stated person, thing, or group

example.eg: She has that reserve and slight coldness of manner which is typically English.
example.egtrans: 她像典型的英国人那样态度矜持，略显冷淡。

example.eg: Paul, in his typically blunt manner, told him he wasn't interested.
example.egtrans: 保罗以惯有的生硬口气说他不感兴趣。

trans_examp.trans_en: used when you are giving an average or usual example of a particular thing

example.eg: Typically, a doctor will see about 30 patients a day.
example.egtrans: 医生通常每天要看约30位病人。

example.eg: Tickets for these events will typically cost around thirty dollars.
example.egtrans: 这种活动的票价通常在30美元左右。

typo.name: typo
typo.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small mistake in a text made when it was typed or printed

ultimately.name: ultimately
ultimately.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: finally, after a series of things have happened

example.eg: Everything will ultimately depend on what is said at the meeting with the directors next week.
example.egtrans: 一切将最终取决于下周开会和董事们商议的结果。

example.eg: Ultimately, of course, he'd like to have his own business but that won't be for some time.
example.egtrans: 当然，他最终想拥有自己的企业，但那不会很快实现的。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize the most important fact in a situation

example.eg: Ultimately, he'll have to decide.
example.egtrans: 他终究要作出决定。

undergo.name: undergo
undergo.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to experience something that is unpleasant or something that involves a change
trans_examp.trans_cn: 经历，经受（令人不快的事或变化）

example.eg: She underwent an operation on a tumour in her left lung last year.
example.egtrans: 她在去年做了一次左肺肿瘤切除手术。

example.eg: Playing board games is undergoing a revival in popularity.
example.egtrans: 棋盘游戏正经历着一场复兴。

underlying.name: underlying
underlying.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

dsense.name: underlying
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: real but not immediately obvious

example.eg: And what might be the underlying significance of these supposedly random acts?
example.egtrans: 这些看似偶然的行为，其暗含的意义可能是什么呢？

dsense.name: underlying
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to describe something on which something else is based

example.eg: The price of the investment fell below the value of the underlying assets.
example.egtrans: 这一投资项目的价格已经跌至低于标的资产价值。

dsense.name: underlying
dsense.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: positioned under the surface of something

example.eg: The currents are affected by the shape of the underlying rocks.
example.egtrans: 水流受水下岩石形状的影响。

underscore.name: underscore
underscore.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en:
to 
        
         underline
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指为了强调）在（词语）下面画线

underscore.name: underscore
underscore.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the character _ on a computer keyboard, used to draw a line under a letter or word, and also used in file names where a space is not allowed

understanding.name: understanding
understanding.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: understanding
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: knowledge about a subject, situation, etc. or about how something works

example.eg: She doesn't have any understanding of politics/human nature/what it takes to be a good manager.
example.egtrans: 她对政治／人性／如何成为一个好经理一无所知。

example.eg: My understanding of the agreement (= what I think it means) is that they will pay $50,000 over two years.
example.egtrans: 我对协议的理解是他们会在两年内支付5万美元。

dsense.name: understanding
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a positive relationship between two people or groups in which they feel sympathy for each other

example.eg: For peace to exist in the region there needs to be a much improved understanding between all the parties concerned.
example.egtrans: 为了地区和平，需要有关各方大力增进彼此的谅解。

dsense.name: understanding
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an informal agreement between people

example.eg: It took several hours of discussion before they could come to/reach an understanding.
example.egtrans: 他们讨论了几个小时才达成协议。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something on the understanding that something else can or will happen, you do it because someone else has promised that it can or will.

example.eg: We bought the sofa on the understanding that we could return it if it didn't fit in the room.
example.egtrans: 我们买下这个沙发，前提是不合适可以退货。

understanding.name: understanding
understanding.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: An understanding person who has the ability to know how other people are feeling, and can forgive them if they do something wrong.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 善解人意的；体谅人的；通情达理的

example.eg: He had expected her to be horrified, but she was actually very understanding.
example.egtrans: 他本以为她会惊慌失措，但她实际上非常通情达理。

undesirable.name: undesirable
undesirable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not wanted, approved of, or popular
trans_examp.trans_cn: 令人讨厌的；不受欢迎的

example.eg: Houses near industrial sites often do not sell so quickly because they are regarded as undesirable.
example.egtrans: 工厂附近的房子销路不是很好，因为人们认为那里的环境不理想。

unexpected.name: unexpected
unexpected.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not expected

example.eg: Her resignation was completely unexpected.
example.egtrans: 她的辞职完全是个意外。

example.eg: How lovely to see you here - this really is an unexpected pleasure!
example.egtrans: 在这里见到你真好，实在是没想到！

unfortunately.name: unfortunately
unfortunately.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to say that something is sad, disappointing, or has a bad effect

example.eg: Unfortunately, I didn't have my credit card with me, or else I would have bought it.
example.egtrans: 很不凑巧，我没带信用卡，否则我肯定早买了。

unification.name: unification
unification.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act or process of bringing together or combining things or people

example.eg: the unification of East and West Germany
example.egtrans: 东西德统一

example.eg: His party's long-term goal remained eventual unification.
example.egtrans: 他所在政党的长期目标仍然是最终的统一。

uniform.name: uniform
uniform.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular set of clothes that has to be worn by the members of the same organization or group of people

example.eg: military/school uniform
example.egtrans: 军装／校服

example.eg: a nurse's uniform
example.egtrans: 护士服

example.eg: I love a man in uniform!
example.egtrans: 我喜欢穿制服的男人！

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of clothes that is connected with a particular group of people
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某一群体的人穿的）典型服装，特有服装

example.eg: Photographs show him wearing the T-shirt and ripped jeans that were the student's uniform of the time.
example.egtrans: 照片上的他穿着T恤衫和破洞牛仔裤，一幅当时学生的典型打扮。

uniform.name: uniform
uniform.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: the same; not changing or different in any way
trans_examp.trans_cn: 相同的；一律的；整齐划一的

example.eg: The office walls and furniture are a uniform grey.
example.egtrans: 办公室的墙壁和家具一律都是灰色的。

example.eg: Small businesses are demanding that they receive uniform treatment from the banks.
example.egtrans: 小企业要求银行给予它们一视同仁的待遇。

unify.name: unify
unify.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to bring together; combine

example.eg: If the new leader does manage to unify his warring party it will be quite an achievement.
example.egtrans: 如果新领导人能将党内互相争斗的各派力量整合起来，那将是个了不起的成就。

unintended.name: unintended
unintended.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not intended
trans_examp.trans_cn: 无意的，无心的；没有计划的

example.eg: The group argues that many of the proposed reforms will have unintended consequences.
example.egtrans: 该团体认为许多拟议中的改革措施将会带来意想不到的后果。

unit.name: unit
unit.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: unit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a single thing or a separate part of something larger

example.eg: Each unit of the text book focuses on a different grammar point.
example.egtrans: 课本的每个单元各有不同的语法重点。

example.eg: The first year of the course is divided into four units.
example.egtrans: 该课程的第一年分为4个单元。

example.eg: The company plans to split into two or three units.
example.egtrans: 公司计划拆分成三个部分。

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of furniture or equipment that is intended to be fitted as a part of a set of similar or matching pieces

example.eg: kitchen/shelf/sink units
example.egtrans: 厨房／书架／水槽组合件

trans_examp.trans_en: a small machine or part of a machine that has a particular purpose

example.eg: the central processing unit of a computer
example.egtrans: 计算机的中央处理器

example.eg: a waste-disposal unit
example.egtrans: 废物处理装置

trans_examp.trans_en: a single complete product of the type that a business sells
a single apartment in a bigger building

example.eg: The old house has been divided up into three rental units.
example.egtrans: 这栋老房子被分成三套住房出租。

example.eg: a public housing unit
example.egtrans: 一套公共住房

dsense.name: unit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people living or working together, especially for a particular purpose
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指具有特定目的的）班组，小队

example.eg: the traditional family unit
example.egtrans: 传统的家庭单位

example.eg: Both soldiers spent two weeks in training before being allowed to rejoin their unit (= the particular part of the army to which they belonged).
example.egtrans: 两名士兵均在接受了两周的训练后才被允许归队。

example.eg: Dr Nussbaum is director of the Civil Liberties Research Unit at King's College, London.
example.egtrans: 努斯鲍姆博士是伦敦国王学院公民自由研究中心的主任。

dsense.name: unit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a standard measure that is used to express amounts

example.eg: A centimetre is a unit of length.
example.egtrans: 厘米是长度单位。

example.eg: The standard unit of currency in the US is the dollar.
example.egtrans: 美国的标准货币单位是美元。

trans_examp.trans_en: a standard measure of alcohol

example.eg: Experts say that women should not drink more than 14 units of alcohol a week.
example.egtrans: 专家称妇女每周饮酒不要超过14个酒精单位。

dsense.name: unit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a department in a hospital for the treatment of people with similar illnesses or conditions

example.eg: She's in the burns/paediatric/psychiatric unit.
example.egtrans: 她在烧伤科／儿科／精神科。

dsense.name: unit
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any whole number less than ten

example.eg: Tens go in the left-hand column and units in the right.
example.egtrans: 十位数在左栏，个位数在右栏。

trans_examp.trans_en: the number 1

universal.name: universal
universal.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: existing everywhere or involving everyone

example.eg: a universal truth
example.egtrans: 普遍真理

example.eg: Food, like sex, is a subject of almost universal interest.
example.egtrans: 像性一样，食物几乎也是人们普遍感兴趣的话题。

example.eg: The new reforms have not met with universal approval within the party.
example.egtrans: 新的改革措施在政府内部还没有得到一致赞同。

unless.name: unless
unless.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: except if

example.eg: You can't get a job unless you have experience (= you can only get a job if you have experience).
example.egtrans: 除非有工作经验，否则你找不到工作。

example.eg: Unless you call me to say you're not coming, I'll see you at the theatre (= I will see you there if you do not call to say you are not coming).
example.egtrans: 除非你打电话说你不来了，否则我就在剧院等你。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def:
→ 
        
         quote... unquote informal

unusable.name: unusable
unusable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: Something that is unusable cannot be used, especially because it is broken or not safe.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指因破损或不安全而）不能用的，无法使用的

example.eg: The normal supply of water has turned brown and unusable.
example.egtrans: 日常用水变成褐色的了，不能用了。

example.eg: The virus deletes files and corrupts essential core microchips, leaving computers unusable.
example.egtrans: 这种病毒删除文件，损坏关键的核心微芯片，造成电脑瘫痪。

upcoming.name: upcoming
upcoming.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: happening soon

example.eg: Tickets are selling well for the group's upcoming concert tour.
example.egtrans: 该乐队即将举行的巡演门票销售情况良好。

update.name: update
update.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something more modern or suitable for use now by adding new information or changing its design

example.eg: an updated version of the software
example.egtrans: 该软件的升级版

trans_examp.trans_en: to give someone the most recent information

example.eg: We'll update you on this news story throughout the day.
example.egtrans: 我们将全天向您报道该新闻事件的最新进展。

update.name: update
update.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an act of updating something or someone with new information

example.eg: Jo's just doing an update on the mailing list.
example.egtrans: 乔正在更新邮寄名单。

example.eg: I'll need regular updates on your progress.
example.egtrans: 我要定期了解你的最新进展。

trans_examp.trans_en: a new form of something that existed at an earlier time

example.eg: It's an update of an old 60s movie.
example.egtrans: 它翻拍自一部60年代的老电影。

upgrade.name: upgrade
upgrade.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to improve the quality or usefulness of something, such as a machine or a computer program, or give a person a more important job or state that their job is more important than it was in the past
trans_examp.trans_cn: 使（机器、计算机程序等）升级；提升，提拔（某人）

example.eg: It's very simple to upgrade the indexing software.
example.egtrans: 升级索引软件很简单。

example.eg: There were no seats left in economy so we were upgraded to business class.
example.egtrans: 经济舱没有座位了，所以我们被升级到商务舱。

upgrade.name: upgrade
upgrade.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of software or equipment that improves the quality or usefulness of a computer or machine
trans_examp.trans_cn: （能提高电脑等效能的）软件（或设备）

example.eg: a hardware upgrade
example.egtrans: 硬件的升级

example.eg: The upgrade to version 5.0 costs $395.
example.egtrans: 升级到5.0版本要花费395美元。

upper.name: upper
upper.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: at a higher position or level than something else, or being the top part of something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （位置或水平）较高的，较上的；上层的

example.eg: The office building's upper floors were being repainted.
example.egtrans: 办公楼的上面几层在重新油漆。

example.eg: If the infection is not checked it will probably spread to the upper body.
example.egtrans: 如果感染不控制住，很有可能扩散到上身。

upper.name: upper
upper.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: upper
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the top part of a shoe that covers a person's foot and to which the heel and the sole are attached

example.eg: These shoes have leather uppers and synthetic soles.
example.egtrans: 这些鞋子的鞋帮是皮质的，鞋底是合成材质的。

dsense.name: upper
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a drug that causes a person taking it to feel very active and excited

usage.name: usage
usage.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: usage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way a particular word in a language, or a language in general, is used

example.eg: a guide to common English usage
example.egtrans: 常用英语用法指南

example.eg: The earliest recorded usage of the word is in the twelfth century.
example.egtrans: 关于这个词用法的最早记载见于12世纪。

trans_examp.trans_en: the way something is treated or used

example.eg: Sports equipment is designed to withstand hard usage.
example.egtrans: 运动装备在设计上要结实耐用。

dsense.name: usage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the bad and unfair way someone treats you

example.eg: Many had complained about the usage they'd received at his hands.
example.egtrans: 很多人都曾抱怨在他手下受到了不公待遇。

usual.name: usual
usual.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: normal; happening, done, or used most often

example.eg: I went to bed at my usual time.
example.egtrans: 我和平常一样准时上床睡觉。

example.eg: There was more rainfall than usual this summer in the mountain areas.
example.egtrans: 山区今年夏天的降雨量比往年多。

example.eg: You'll find the cutlery in its usual place.
example.egtrans: 你可以在平常放餐具的地方找到刀叉餐具。

example.eg: Terry was, as usual, slow to respond.
example.egtrans: 泰瑞一向反应迟钝。

example.eg: The library is open for business as usual despite the snowstorm.
example.egtrans: 尽管有雪暴，图书馆还是照常开门。

usual.name: usual
usual.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: Someone's usual is the drink, especially an alcoholic one, that they most often have, for example when in a bar

example.eg: A gin and tonic for my dad, and I'll have the/my usual.
example.egtrans: 给我爸来杯加奎宁水的杜松子酒，我还是照旧。

Usually.name: usually
Usually.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the way that most often happens

example.eg: He usually gets home about six o'clock.
example.egtrans: 他通常在6点左右到家。

example.eg: I usually just have a sandwich for lunch.
example.egtrans: 通常我午饭只吃一个三明治。

example.eg: Is your friend usually so rude?
example.egtrans: 你的朋友经常这么无礼吗?

example.eg: Usually we go skiing in February.
example.egtrans: 一般我们在2月份去滑雪。

example.eg: "Do you cook your own meals in the evenings?" "Usually."
example.egtrans: “你们晚上自己做饭吗?”“通常是的。”

utility.name: utility
utility.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: utility
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a service that is used by the public, such as an electricity or gas supply or a train service
trans_examp.trans_cn: 公用事业；（电、煤气、铁路等）公共设施

example.eg: utility bills
example.egtrans: 水电煤气账单

dsense.name: utility
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the usefulness of something, especially in a practical way

valid.name: valid
valid.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: based on truth or reason; able to be accepted
trans_examp.trans_cn: 确凿的；合理的；有根据的；让人信服的

example.eg: a valid argument/criticism/reason
example.egtrans: 令人信服的论据／批评／理由

example.eg: My way of thinking might be different from yours, but it's equally valid.
example.egtrans: 我的想法也许和你的不同，但同样站得住脚。

trans_examp.trans_en: A ticket or other document is valid if it is based on or used according to a set of official conditions that often include a time limit
trans_examp.trans_cn: （票或其他文件）有效的，正式认可的

example.eg: My passport is valid for another two years.
example.egtrans: 我的护照还有两年有效期。

trans_examp.trans_en: having legal force
trans_examp.trans_cn: 有法律效力的，有法律约束力的

example.eg: Is this contract/ticket/agreement still valid?
example.egtrans: 这份合同／这张票据／这份协议还有法律效力吗？

validate.name: validate
validate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something officially acceptable or approved, especially after examining it
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指经检查后）批准，认可，使生效

example.eg: The data is validated automatically by the computer after it has been entered.
example.egtrans: 数据输入后，计算机会自动识别其有效性。

example.eg: It is a one-year course validated by London's City University.
example.egtrans: 这是由伦敦城市大学批准设立的一年制课程。

trans_examp.trans_en: to prove that something is correct

example.eg: He feels that today's economic problems validate his opposition to the policy.
example.egtrans: 他觉得目前的经济问题说明他反对这项政策是对的。

validation.name: validation
validation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act or process of making something officially or legally acceptable or approved

example.eg: Parking is free with validation of your ticket by one of the outlets in the mall.
example.egtrans: 停车是免费的，您可以在购物中心里的任一商店验证您的车票。

example.eg: The system enables electronic validation of an applicant's identity and certificates.
example.egtrans: 该系统能够对申请人的身份和证书进行电子验证。

trans_examp.trans_en: proof that something is correct

example.eg: He saw this result as validation of his theory.
example.egtrans: 他认为这个结果证实了他的理论。

example.eg: The court's ruling is a validation of the new funding plan.
example.egtrans: 法院的裁决是对新拨款计划的确认。

variable.name: variable
variable.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: likely to change often

example.eg: a variable interest rate
example.egtrans: 不断变化的利率

example.eg: British weather is perhaps at its most variable in the spring.
example.egtrans: 在英国，春季的天气可能是最变幻莫测的。

variable.name: variable
variable.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a number, amount, or situation that can change

example.eg: The variables in the equation are X, Y, and Z.
example.egtrans: 方程式中的变量是X，Y和Z。

example.eg: The data was analysed according to neighbourhoods, but other key variables like credit rating and marital status were ignored altogether.
example.egtrans: 对这些数据按照所在街区进行了分析，但像信用等级、婚姻状况等其他关键变量则一概忽略不计。

variant.name: variant
variant.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is slightly different from other similar things

example.eg: There are many colas on the market now, all variants on the original drink.
example.egtrans: 现在市场上有多种可乐，都跟最初的差别不大。

example.eg: There are four variants of malaria, all transmitted to humans by a particular family of mosquitoes.
example.egtrans: 疟疾有4个变种，都是通过一种特殊的蚊子传播给人。

variant.name: variant
variant.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: different
trans_examp.trans_cn: 不同的；有差别的；变异的

example.eg: a variant form
example.egtrans: 变体

example.eg: The dictionary shows "neighbour" with the American variant spelling "neighbor".
example.egtrans: 字典里标出了“neighbour”这个词的美式拼写“neighbor”。

variation.name: variation
variation.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: variation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a change in amount or level

example.eg: Unemployment rates among white-collar workers show much less regional variation than corresponding rates among blue-collar workers.
example.egtrans: 白领工作者的失业率与蓝领工人相比，地区性差异要小得多。

example.eg: The medical tests showed some variation in the baby's heart rate.
example.egtrans: 医学检验表明婴儿的心率有些不齐。

example.eg: global temperature variations over the last 140 years
example.egtrans: 过去140年间全球气温的变化

dsense.name: variation
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is slightly different from the usual form or arrangement
trans_examp.trans_cn: 变种，变体；变化了的东西

example.eg: There are wide variations in the way pensioners have benefited from the system.
example.egtrans: 养老金领取者从这个体制中受益的情况有很大差别。

example.eg: The films she makes are all variations on the same theme.
