example.egtrans: 她拍的电影围绕的都是同一主题。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of several short tunes that are based on the same simple tune, but are different from it and from the others

example.eg: symphonic variations
example.egtrans: 交响乐变奏曲

variety.name: variety
variety.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: variety
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the characteristic of often changing and being different

example.eg: When planning meals, you need to think about variety and taste as well as nutritional value.
example.egtrans: 做饭时，你既需要考虑饭菜的营养价值，又需要考虑饭菜的花样和味道。

example.eg: Sexual reproduction serves to create genetic variety.
example.egtrans: 有性繁殖可以使基因多样化。

example.eg: Work on the production line is monotonous and lacks variety.
example.egtrans: 在流水线上工作很单调，缺乏变化。

dsense.name: variety
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a different type of something

example.eg: The article was about the different varieties of Spanish spoken in South America.
example.egtrans: 这篇文章讲的是南美洲西班牙语的各种变种。

example.eg: This variety of rose is especially hardy and drought-resistant.
example.egtrans: 这种玫瑰特别耐寒及耐旱。

example.eg: Our supermarket stocks apples in several different varieties.
example.egtrans: 我们超市有几个不同品种的苹果。

trans_examp.trans_en: many different types of things or people

example.eg: She does a variety of fitness activities.
example.egtrans: 她参加各种各样的健身活动。

example.eg: The equipment could be used for a variety of educational purposes.
example.egtrans: 这套设备可以用于多种教学活动。

example.eg: Manufacturers need large sales to justify offering a big variety in export markets.
example.egtrans: 生产厂家需要极高的销量来证明向出口市场提供种类繁多的产品是值得的。

dsense.name: variety
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a type of entertainment which includes several separate short performances, such as singing, dancing, magic tricks, and telling jokes

example.eg: a variety show
example.egtrans: 综艺节目

various.name: various
various.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: many different
trans_examp.trans_cn: 各种不同的；各种各样的

example.eg: We had various problems on our journey, including a flat tyre.
example.egtrans: 我们在旅途中遇到了各种各样的问题，包括轮胎被扎破了。

example.eg: The author gave various reasons for having written the book.
example.egtrans: 作者给出了写那本书的各种理由。

example.eg: Girardo was out of action with various injuries for most of last season.
example.egtrans: 上个赛季大多数时间吉拉多都因为各种伤病而不能上场。

example.eg: Various people whom we weren't expecting turned up at the meeting.
example.egtrans: 形形色色让我们意想不到的人出现在了会场。

vary.name: vary
vary.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: vary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: If things of the same type vary, they are different from each other, and if you vary them, you cause them to be different from each other.

example.eg: Salary scales vary between states/from state to state/according to state/with each state.
example.egtrans: 工资高低各州／州与州／不同的州／每个州都不同。

example.eg: The samples varied in quality but were generally acceptable.
example.egtrans: 这些样品质量有差异，但是大体上可以接受。

example.eg: We have tried several different approaches, with varying degrees of success.
example.egtrans: 我们尝试过不同的方法，成功率也不同。

dsense.name: vary
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to change or cause something to change in amount or level, especially from one occasion to another

example.eg: My taste in classical music varies greatly/widely, but I usually prefer Mozart or Brahms.
example.egtrans: 我对各种古典音乐的喜好程度很不相同，但我通常比较喜欢莫扎特或勃拉姆斯的音乐。

example.eg: Some people give a regular monthly donation while others vary the amount they give.
example.egtrans: 有些人每月捐赠固定数目的钱款，而有些人每月捐赠的数额多少不一。

vendor.name: vendor
vendor.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: someone who is selling something

example.eg: For the past few months she's been working as a street vendor, selling fruit and vegetables.
example.egtrans: 几个月以来，她一直在街头卖水果和蔬菜。

example.eg: The vendor of the house wants to exchange contracts this week.
example.egtrans: 这栋房子的卖主想在本周办理房产过户手续。

verbose.name: verbose
verbose.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: using or containing more words than are necessary

example.eg: a verbose explanation/report/speech/style
example.egtrans: 啰唆的解释／冗长的报告／冗长的演讲／言辞冗赘的风格

example.eg: He was a notoriously verbose after-dinner speaker.
example.egtrans: 他在饭后讲起话来是出了名地啰唆。

verification.name: verification
verification.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the act of verifying something (= proving or checking that it exists, or is true or correct)

example.eg: I've never asked for verification of his CV.
example.egtrans: 我从来没有要求核实他的简历。

example.eg: The lender will probably require written verification of employment from your current employer.
example.egtrans: 贷方可能会要求您当前雇主提供书面就业证明。

version.name: version
version.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular form of something that is slightly different from other forms of the same thing

example.eg: The official version of events is that the police were attacked and were just trying to defend themselves.
example.egtrans: 事件的官方说法是警察受到了攻击，他们只是想自卫。

example.eg: You can make a reduced fat version of the cheesecake by using cottage cheese instead of cream cheese.
example.egtrans: 你可以用农家奶酪代替奶油奶酪来制作低脂肪的奶酪蛋糕。

example.eg: An English-language version of the book is planned for next year.
example.egtrans: 那本书的英语版本计划在明年推出。

example.eg: The TV series is a watered-down version of the movie, especially designed for family viewing.
example.egtrans: 这部电视剧对其电影版作了弱化处理，专为合家观赏而制作。

vertical.name: vertical
vertical.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: standing or pointing straight up or at an angle of 90° to a horizontal surface or line

example.eg: vertical lines/stripes
example.egtrans: 竖线／竖条纹

example.eg: She looked over the cliff and found she was standing at the edge of a vertical drop.
example.egtrans: 她从悬崖上向下看，发现自己正站在陡直悬崖的边缘。

vertical.name: vertical
vertical.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a vertical line, surface, or position
trans_examp.trans_cn: 垂直线；垂直面；竖直位置

example.eg: In a two-stage operation, the steel structure will be raised to the vertical.
example.egtrans: 在分成两个步骤的操作中，钢结构将被竖成垂直状态。

via.name: via
via.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

dsense.name: via
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: going through or stopping at a place on the way to another place

example.eg: The London-Addis flight goes via Rome.
example.egtrans: 从伦敦到阿迪斯的航班要途经罗马。

dsense.name: via
dsense.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: using a particular machine, system, or person to send or receive something

example.eg: Reports are coming in via satellite.
example.egtrans: 报道通过卫星传送进来。

example.eg: I only found out about it via my sister.
example.egtrans: 我是从我姐姐那儿才知道了这件事。

View.name: view
View.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: view
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an opinion, belief, or idea, or a way of thinking about something

example.eg: Do you have any views about/on what we should do now?
example.egtrans: 对于我们现在该做什么你有什么看法？

example.eg: In my view, her criticisms were completely justified.
example.egtrans: 在我看来，她的批评完全在理。

example.eg: It's my view that the price is much too high.
example.egtrans: 在我看来，这个价格太高了。

example.eg: Many people have/hold/share/take the view that children should not be physically punished.
example.egtrans: 很多人都认为不应该体罚孩子。

example.eg: Everyone will have a chance to make their views known at the meeting.
example.egtrans: 每个人都有在会上表达自己看法的机会。

example.eg: We had a friendly exchange of views (= discussion).
example.egtrans: 我们友好地交换了意见。

example.eg: I take a very dim/poor view of this kind of behaviour (= think that this type of behaviour is unacceptable).
example.egtrans: 我认为这种行为让人无法接受。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: a way of thinking about the world

example.eg: Our world view is quite different from that of writers in the fourth century BC.
example.egtrans: 我们的世界观与公元前4世纪那些作家们的大不相同。

dsense.name: view
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: what you can see from a particular place, or the ability to see from a particular place

example.eg: The view from the top of the mountain is breathtaking/magnificent/spectacular.
example.egtrans: 从山顶上望去，景色令人叹为观止／美不胜收／壮观极了。

example.eg: The rooftop restaurant affords a panoramic view (= allows you to see a wide area) across the bay.
example.egtrans: 从这家屋顶餐厅可以看到海湾的全貌。

example.eg: Don't stand in front of me - you're blocking/obstructing my view of the stage.
example.egtrans: 别站在我前面——你挡着，我看不见舞台了。

example.eg: The cloud lifted, and the tops of the mountains suddenly came into view (= could be seen).
example.egtrans: 云层散去，群山的顶峰突然出现在眼前。

example.eg: She turned a corner, and disappeared from view/out of view.
example.egtrans: 她转了个弯，消失不见了。

trans_examp.trans_en: a picture of a particular place

example.eg: He paints rural views (= pictures of the countryside).
example.egtrans: 他画的是乡村风景。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: close enough to be seen

example.eg: I always make sure I keep the children in view whenever we're in a public place.
example.egtrans: 在公共场所我总是要确保孩子们在我的视线之内。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If something is on view, it is arranged so that it can be seen by the public.

example.eg: The plans for the new road will soon be on view to the public in the library.
example.egtrans: 修建新公路的计划将很快在图书馆公示。

View.name: view
View.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: view
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to have a particular opinion or way of thinking about someone or something

example.eg: A reporter asked the minister how he viewed recent events.
example.egtrans: 记者问部长如何看待最近发生的那些事件。

example.eg: She is viewed as a strong candidate for the job.
example.egtrans: 她被认为是那个职位的有力争夺者。

example.eg: We view these latest developments with concern/suspicion/satisfaction.
example.egtrans: 我们对这些最新进展表示关注／怀疑／满意。

example.eg: If we view the problem from a different angle, a solution may become more obvious.
example.egtrans: 如果我们从不同的角度看这个问题，可能更容易找到解决办法。

example.eg: How do you view your prospects/chances (= what do you consider your chances to be) in tomorrow's race?
example.egtrans: 你觉得明天比赛的把握有多大？

dsense.name: view
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to watch something

example.eg: There's a special area at the airport where you can view aircraft taking off and landing.
example.egtrans: 机场里有一个特定的区域，在那里你可以看到飞机起落。

example.eg: Viewing figures (= the number of people watching) (= ) for the show were very low.
example.egtrans: 这个节目的收视率非常低。

trans_examp.trans_en: to look at something in a complete or careful way

example.eg: We have two people coming to view the house this afternoon.
example.egtrans: 今天下午有两个人要来看房。

example.eg: The extent of the flooding can only be fully appreciated when viewed from the air.
example.egtrans: 只有从空中观察才能全面了解洪水的严重程度。

violate.name: violate
violate.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to break or act against something, especially a law, agreement, principle, or something that should be treated with respect
trans_examp.trans_cn: 违反，违背，违犯（尤指法律、协议、原则等）

example.eg: They were charged with violating federal law.
example.egtrans: 他们被控违犯了联邦法律。

example.eg: It seems that the troops deliberately violated the ceasefire agreement.
example.egtrans: 那些军队似乎是故意违反停火协议。

example.eg: The doctor has been accused of violating professional ethics.
example.egtrans: 那名医生被控违反了职业道德。

trans_examp.trans_en: to go, especially forcefully, into a place or situation which should be treated with respect and in which you are not wanted or not expected to be

example.eg: The fishermen claimed that ships from another country had violated their territorial waters.
example.egtrans: 那些渔民宣称另一个国家的船只侵犯了他们的水域。

example.eg: Questions of this kind violate my privacy and I am not willing to answer them.
example.egtrans: 这种问题侵犯了我的隐私，我拒绝回答。

trans_examp.trans_en: to rape someone

example.eg: She said that she had been treated so roughly by the hospital staff that she felt violated.
example.egtrans: 她说医护人员待她非常粗暴，她感觉受到了侮辱。

visual.name: visual
visual.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: relating to seeing

example.eg: visual stimulus/impact/abilities
example.egtrans: 视觉刺激／冲击／视力

visual.name: visual
visual.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something such as a picture, photograph, or piece of film used to give a particular effect or to explain something
trans_examp.trans_cn: 视觉材料（展示或说明用的图画、照片、影片等）

example.eg: The wildlife programme has some stunning visuals.
example.egtrans: 这个关于野生动物的节目中有一些令人惊叹的视觉效果。

example.eg: Using both words and visuals makes it easier for students to focus on and improve their writing methods.
example.egtrans: 同时使用文字和图像可以使学生们更容易将注意力集中在改进他们的写作方法上。

visualize.name: visualize
visualize.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to form a picture of someone or something in your mind, in order to imagine or remember him, her, or it

example.eg: I was so surprised when he turned up - I'd visualized someone much older.
example.egtrans: 他出现的时候我非常惊讶——我想象中他应该老得多。

vulnerability.name: vulnerability
vulnerability.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the quality of being vulnerable (= able to be easily hurt, influenced, or attacked), or something that is vulnerable

example.eg: You want a doctor who understands the patient's vulnerability.
example.egtrans: 您需要一位了解患者脆弱心情的医生。

example.eg: Those who organized the attacks exploited vulnerabilities in the nation's defences.
example.egtrans: 那些组织袭击的人利用了该国防御上的弱点。

watch.name: watch
watch.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: watch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to look at something for a period of time, especially something that is changing or moving

example.eg: I had dinner and watched TV for a couple of hours.
example.egtrans: 我吃了饭，然后看了几个小时电视。

example.eg: He spent the entire afternoon watching a cricket match.
example.egtrans: 他整个下午都在看一场板球比赛。

example.eg: I watched him get into a cab.
example.egtrans: 我看着他坐上一辆出租车。

example.eg: I got the feeling I was being watched.
example.egtrans: 我有种被人监视的感觉。

example.eg: I sit by the window and watch people walking past.
example.egtrans: 我坐在窗边，看着人来人往。

example.eg: Just watch how he slides that ball in past the goalkeeper.
example.egtrans: 看看他是多么巧妙地带球越过守门员而入网的。

example.eg: Bonner watched helplessly as they drove away without him.
example.egtrans: 邦纳无助地看着他们开着车扬长而去，没有带上他。

example.eg: She'll pretend that she hasn't seen us - you watch.
example.egtrans: 她会假装没看见我们的——你看着吧。

trans_examp.trans_en: to stay with someone or something, such as a child, for a short time to make certain that he, she, or it is safe

example.eg: If you want me to watch the kids for a couple of hours while you go out, just let me know.
example.egtrans: 如果你想在出门时让我帮忙照看孩子们几个小时，跟我说一声就行了。

example.eg: Could you watch my bags for me, while I go to the toilet?
example.egtrans: 我去一趟卫生间，你帮我看一下这些包好吗？

dsense.name: watch
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to be careful of something

example.eg: I have to watch my weight (= be careful not to become too heavy) now I'm not exercising so much.
example.egtrans: 我必须注意自己的体重，因为我现在不怎么运动。

example.eg: Watch your language (= do not use rude words), young man!
example.egtrans: 请注意言语得体，年轻人！

example.eg: Watch (that) you don't get glue on your fingers.
example.egtrans: 注意别把胶水粘到你的手指上。

example.eg: Watch what you're doing with that knife, Jim, it's sharp.
example.egtrans: 用那把刀时小心点，吉姆，它很锋利的。

example.eg: You need to watch him - he's a strange character.
example.egtrans: 你得盯着他——他有点奇怪。

watch.name: watch
watch.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: watch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a small clock that is worn on a strap around the wrist or, sometimes, connected to a piece of clothing by a chain

example.eg: My watch seems to have stopped (= stopped working).
example.egtrans: 我的手表好像停了。

example.eg: He glanced nervously at his watch.
example.egtrans: 他紧张地瞥了一眼手表。

dsense.name: watch
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the activity of watching or giving attention to something or someone, especially to make certain nothing bad happens

example.eg: The police keep a close watch on gang members.
example.egtrans: 警方严密监视着一个帮派成员。

example.eg: The soldiers slept at night, except for one who stayed awake on watch/to keep watch.
example.egtrans: 夜里除了一个人站岗之外，其他的士兵都睡觉了。

trans_examp.trans_en: a person or group of soldiers or guards whose duty is to protect a person, place, or thing from danger or attack
trans_examp.trans_cn: 警卫；哨兵警卫队；治安队

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular period of time during which a person or a group of soldiers or guards has the duty of protecting and warning of danger
trans_examp.trans_cn: 警戒时间；（警卫或治安队等的）值班时间

example.eg: the night watch
example.egtrans: 值夜班

way.name: way
way.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a route, direction, or path

example.eg: Do you know the way to the restaurant?
example.egtrans: 你知道去餐馆怎么走吗？

example.eg: I've only been living in Madrid for a couple of weeks so I don't really know my way around it yet.
example.egtrans: 我只在马德里住了几个星期，所以还不太认识周围的路。

example.eg: We'll have to stop for petrol on the way to the airport.
example.egtrans: 我们得在去机场的路上停下来加油。

example.eg: Can you find your own way out of the building?
example.egtrans: 你自己能找对路走出这栋楼吗？

example.eg: He elbowed/pushed his way (= hit/pushed people so that he could go past them) to the front of the crowd.
example.egtrans: 他用胳膊肘／手推搡出一条路，挤到了人群前面。

example.eg: The bus stopped for us to eat lunch but within half an hour we were on our way/under way (= travelling) again.
example.egtrans: 长途汽车停下来让我们吃午饭，不过不到半小时，我们又上路了。

example.eg: There's no way through here - you'll have to go round.
example.egtrans: 这里没有路通过去——你们得绕行。

example.eg: They flew from Los Angeles to Toronto by way of Chicago.
example.egtrans: 他们途径芝加哥从拉斯维加斯飞到多伦多。

example.eg: Many people have lost their way (= become lost) in the forest.
example.egtrans: 很多人在森林里迷了路。

example.eg: Only local people could find their way through the maze of narrow streets.
example.egtrans: 只有本地人才能在迷宫般的狭窄街道中找到路。

trans_examp.trans_en: used to talk about the direction in which something is facing

example.eg: "Which way does the room face?" "North."
example.egtrans: “这个房间朝哪个方向？”“朝北。”

example.eg: Which way up should this box be? (= Which side should be on top?)
example.egtrans: 这个箱子应该哪一面朝上？

example.eg: The numbers are the wrong way round - it should be 71, not 17.
example.egtrans: 那个数字颠倒了——应该是71，不是17。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to travel or move to a place

example.eg: We slowly made our way down the river.
example.egtrans: 我们慢慢地沿河而下。

example.eg: It's getting late - we should make our way home soon.
example.egtrans: 天晚了——我们应该动身回家了。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: happening in the opposite way
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 相反地，倒过来，以相反方式

example.eg: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way round.
example.egtrans: 我以为那位老人会比年轻人更加生气，结果情况恰恰相反。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: happening in the opposite way
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 相反地，倒过来，以相反方式

example.eg: I thought the older people would be more offended than the young people, but it was the other way around.
example.egtrans: 我以为那位老人会比年轻人更加生气，结果情况恰恰相反。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: used in the names of some roads

example.eg: Our offices are at 17 King's Way.
example.egtrans: 我们的办事处在国王路17号。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a distance or a period of time

example.eg: We walked a long way yesterday.
example.egtrans: 昨天我们走了很长的一段路。

example.eg: The holiday seems like it's a long way off.
example.egtrans: 假期似乎还很遥远。

example.eg: We managed to pull ourselves all the way from 12th place to first place.
example.egtrans: 我们设法从第12名一直上升到第一名。

example.eg: They still have a ways to go.
example.egtrans: 他们还要走一段路。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular choice, opinion, belief, or action, especially from among several possibilities

example.eg: I like the way you've done your hair.
example.egtrans: 我喜欢你的发型。

example.eg: In some/many ways it would be better if we met on Monday rather than Wednesday.
example.egtrans: 从某些／好多方面来说，我们周一见面要比周三见面好一些。

example.eg: In a way (= partly), I would rather they didn't come because it will mean extra work.
example.egtrans: 从某一方面来说，我不太愿意他们来，因为那将意味着要额外操劳。

example.eg: He might have to resign or he might be demoted, but either way, his career is effectively over.
example.egtrans: 他可能要被迫辞职或被降职，但不管怎么说，他的事业实际上已经结束了。

example.eg: They don't write songs the way (= as) they used to.
example.egtrans: 他们不像以前那样写歌了。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the manner in which someone behaves or thinks, or in which something happens
trans_examp.trans_cn: （思维）风格；（行事）作风；（某事发生的）方式

example.eg: Don't worry - it's just his way.
example.egtrans: 别害怕——他就那样。

example.eg: He looked at me in a sinister way.
example.egtrans: 他恶狠狠地看着我。

example.eg: It's amazing the way she manages to stay so calm.
example.egtrans: 她能保持如此镇定真让人惊讶。

example.eg: The way he was shouting, you'd have thought he was badly hurt.
example.egtrans: 看他大喊大叫的样子，还以为他受了重伤。

example.eg: To my way of thinking, they shouldn't be building so many roads.
example.egtrans: 依我看，他们不该修这么多路。

example.eg: It's always the way at work - either I have nothing to do or I'm rushed off my feet!
example.egtrans: 我工作时总是这样——要么无事可做，要么忙得停不住脚！

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: types of behaviour

example.eg: Over the years we've got used to his funny little ways.
example.egtrans: 多年来，我们已经习惯了他那些滑稽的举动了。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an action that can produce the result you want; a method

example.eg: There are many ways of solving the problem.
example.egtrans: 解决这个问题有多种方法。

example.eg: That's not the way to do it - let me show you.
example.egtrans: 这样做不对——让我给你示范一下。

example.eg: That method hasn't worked, so let's try your way.
example.egtrans: 那个方法没用，所以让我们试试您的方法。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the space needed for a particular movement or action

example.eg: "Sorry, am I in your way? I'll move."
example.egtrans: 对不起，我挡了您的路吗？我马上让开。

example.eg: I couldn't see the stage because there was a pillar in the way (= between me and the stage).
example.egtrans: 我看不到舞台，因为有一根柱子挡在我和舞台之间。

example.eg: Make way for some new clothes by clearing out ones you never wear.
example.egtrans: 通过清除那些不穿的为新衣服清理出一些空间来。

example.eg: You need to get out of the way of that car.
example.egtrans: 你需要给那辆车让开道。

example.eg: She's determined to succeed and she won't let anything get/stand in her way (= prevent her).
example.egtrans: 她下决心要取得成功，她不会让任何事情妨碍她。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: If someone gets or has their way, what they want happens.

example.eg: If she doesn't get/have her (own) way, she sulks like a four-year-old.
example.egtrans: 如果一切不是都按她的意愿来，她就会像个四岁小孩一样生气。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the bad condition or state of someone or something, especially the state of a person's health

example.eg: He's been in a bad way (= very ill) ever since the operation.
example.egtrans: 自从那次手术以来，他一直病得很重。

way.name: way
way.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to emphasize degree or separation, especially in space or time
trans_examp.trans_cn: 过度，大幅（尤其用于强调时间或空间中的程度或距离）

example.eg: After the third lap, she was way behind the other runners.
example.egtrans: 跑过第三圈后，她已远远落后其他运动员。

example.eg: She spends way too much money on clothes.
example.egtrans: 她花太多的钱买衣服。

dsense.name: way
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: in the direction of

example.eg: I think they live Birmingham way.
example.egtrans: 我认为他们住在伯明翰那一带。

weight.name: weight
weight.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: weight
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount that something or someone weighs

example.eg: What weight can this lorry safely carry?
example.egtrans: 这辆卡车的安全载重量是多少？

example.eg: There was a slight decrease in his weight after a week of dieting.
example.egtrans: 经过一周的节食之后，他的体重略有减轻。

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of metal of known heaviness that can be used to measure the heaviness of other objects
any object that is heavy

example.eg: Try not to lift heavy weights.
example.egtrans: 不要试图举起重物。

example.eg: I lift weights twice a week at the gym.
example.egtrans: 我每周去健身房两次练习举重。

dsense.name: weight
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: respect, influence, trust, or importance

example.eg: Her experience does give her opinions quite a bit of weight.
example.egtrans: 她的经验的确给她的观点增加了分量。

example.eg: After he was voted out of office, few people attached much weight to what he said.
example.egtrans: 他落选下台以后，就没什么人重视他所说的话了。

example.eg: Radical views don't carry much weight any more.
example.egtrans: 激进的观点影响力不再那么大了。

weight.name: weight
weight.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to fasten something heavy to something

example.eg: Paper tablecloths need to be weighted down or they blow away in the wind.
example.egtrans: 纸桌布需要有东西压着，否则会被风吹走。

weird.name: weird
weird.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: very strange and unusual, unexpected, or not natural
trans_examp.trans_cn: 怪异的；不寻常的；出乎意料的；超自然的

example.eg: He was sitting alone by a window with a weird contraption on the table in front of him.
example.egtrans: 他独自坐在窗边，面前的桌子上摆着个奇怪的装置。

example.eg: Her boyfriend's a bit weird but she's nice.
example.egtrans: 她的男朋友有点怪，不过她人倒很好。

example.eg: That's weird - I thought I left my keys on the table but they're not there.
example.egtrans: 真奇怪——我记得把钥匙放在桌子上了，但现在却不见了。

example.eg: There is nothing to rival the weird and wonderful things that come out on the Rio streets at carnival time.
example.egtrans: 没有什么可以和狂欢节期间里约热内卢大街上出现的那些奇妙而古怪的东西相媲美。

whatever.name: whatever
whatever.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: it is not important what is; it makes no difference what (is)

example.eg: We'll go whatever the weather.
example.egtrans: 无论天气怎样我们都要去。

example.eg: Whatever happens, you know that I'll stand by you.
example.egtrans: 你知道无论发生什么，我都会支持你。

example.eg: Whatever else may be said of him, Mr Meese is not scared of a fight.
example.egtrans: 无论别人还说他什么，米斯先生并不害怕打上一架。

example.eg: Whatever the outcome of the war, there will be no winners.
example.egtrans: 无论战争的结果如何，谁都不会是胜利者。

example.eg: Whatever the reason, more people are emigrating to Australia today than at any time since the 1950s.
example.egtrans: 不论出于什么原因，如今移民澳大利亚的人比20世纪50年代以来的任何时候都要多。

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: anything or everything

example.eg: I eat whatever I want and I still don't seem to put on weight.
example.egtrans: 我想吃什么就吃什么，仍然不见体重有所增长。

example.eg: "What can we do tonight?" "It's up to you - whatever you want."
example.egtrans: “那我们今天晚上做什么呢？”“由你决定──你想做什么都可以。”

example.eg: Whatever I say I always seem to get it wrong.
example.egtrans: 无论我说什么，似乎总是说错。

example.eg: Don't, whatever you do, tell Patrick (= you certainly should not tell him).
example.egtrans: 无论做什么，千万别告诉帕特里克。

example.eg: Do whatever you want - it won't affect me.
example.egtrans: 你想做什么就做什么吧——不会影响到我的。

example.eg: "So, I'll bring red wine." "Sure, whatever (= bring that or anything else)."
example.egtrans: “那么我就带红酒来了。”“当然可以，带什么都行。”

example.eg: Apparently he "discovered himself" in India, whatever that means (= I do not know what that means).
example.egtrans: 显然他在印度“发现了自己”，不管那究竟意味着什么。

whatever.name: whatever
whatever.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: used instead of the word "what" to add emphasis to a phrase, usually expressing surprise
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于代替 what，加以强调以表示惊讶）到底什么，究竟是什么

example.eg: Whatever is he doing with that rod?
example.egtrans: 他拿着那根竿子到底在做什么？

example.eg: Whatever's that yellow thing on your plate?
example.egtrans: 你盘子里那团黄色的东西到底是什么？

example.eg: Whatever did you say that for?
example.egtrans: 你说那种话到底是为什么？

example.eg: Whatever does she see in him - he's horrible!
example.egtrans: 她究竟看中了他什么——他真让人反感！

example.eg: Whatever made him buy that jacket?
example.egtrans: 他怎么买了那件夹克衫？

whatever.name: whatever
whatever.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en:
→ 
        
         whatsoever
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于否定句后表强调）无论怎样

example.eg: There is no evidence whatever to show that this is in fact the case.
example.egtrans: 根本就没有任何证据表明这就是实际情况。

dsense.name: whatever
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is said to show no respect to someone who is asking you to agree with them or agree to do something
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于有人强迫自己同意其观点或做某事的的时候）怎样都行，无所谓

example.eg: "Bryce, could you do what I ask you to once in a while?" "Whatever."
example.egtrans: “布赖斯，我要你做的事你能不能偶尔做一次？”“无所谓。”

whereas.name: whereas
whereas.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: compared with the fact that; but

example.eg: He must be about 60, whereas his wife looks about 30.
example.egtrans: 他肯定有60岁上下了，可他妻子看起来只有30岁左右。

example.eg: You eat a huge plate of food for lunch, whereas I have just a sandwich.
example.egtrans: 你午饭吃了一大盘东西，可我只吃了个三明治。

whether.name: whether
whether.posTip: A word used to join parts of a phrase or sentence.

trans_examp.trans_en: (used especially in reporting questions and expressing doubts) if, or not
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤用于转述问题或表达疑问）是否

example.eg: I wasn't sure whether you'd like it.
example.egtrans: 我拿不准你是否喜欢它。

example.eg: She asked me whether I was interested in working for her.
example.egtrans: 她问我是否有兴趣为她工作。

example.eg: I'm wondering whether to have the fish or the beef.
example.egtrans: 我正在考虑是吃鱼还是吃牛肉。

example.eg: I doubt whether it'll work.
example.egtrans: 我怀疑这是否能起作用。

example.eg: I was merely questioning whether we have the money to fund such a project.
example.egtrans: 我只是想问问我们有没有钱来资助这样一个项目。

example.eg: It all depends on whether or not she has the time.
example.egtrans: 这完全取决于她是否有时间。

example.eg: Anyway, it's a good story, whether or not it's true.
example.egtrans: 不管怎么说，这是一个不错的说法，无论它是真是假。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: (used to introduce two or more possibilities) it is not important if
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （用于引出两种或多种可能性）不管…还是…；或者…或者…

example.eg: I'm going, whether she likes it or not.
example.egtrans: 不管她高不高兴我都要走。

example.eg: Someone has to tell her, whether it's you or me.
example.egtrans: 总得有人告诉她，不论是你还是我。

example.eg: Let's face it - you're going to be late whether you go by bus or train.
example.egtrans: 让我们面对现实吧——不论你是乘公共汽车还是火车，都要迟到的。

wholly.name: wholly
wholly.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: completely

example.eg: I wasn't wholly convinced by her explanation.
example.egtrans: 她的解释未能让我完全信服。

example.eg: That's a wholly different issue.
example.egtrans: 那完全是另一回事。

example.eg: a machine that is wholly British-made
example.egtrans: 完全由英国制造的一台机器

widely.name: widely
widely.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: including a lot of different places, people, subjects, etc.

example.eg: They have both travelled widely.
example.egtrans: 他们俩都游历过很多地方。

example.eg: His plays are still widely performed in the USA.
example.egtrans: 他的戏剧仍在美国各地上演。

example.eg: French used to be widely spoken in Cambodia.
example.egtrans: 在柬埔寨，过去人们普遍讲法语。

example.eg: His work on DNA was widely admired.
example.egtrans: 他在 DNA 研究方面的工作得到了广泛赞誉。

example.eg: This is a widely held but mistaken belief.
example.egtrans: 这是一种普遍但是错误的看法。

example.eg: This theory is no longer widely accepted.
example.egtrans: 这一理论不再被人们广泛接受。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to be very different

example.eg: Prices vary widely from shop to shop.
example.egtrans: 商店之间的价格相差很大。

widget.name: widget
widget.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any small device whose name you have forgotten or do not know
trans_examp.trans_cn: （不知名的）小玩意儿，小器械，小装置

trans_examp.trans_en: an imagined small product made by a company

example.eg: Let's assume the company makes ten cents profit on every widget they sell.
example.egtrans: 我们假设该公司每卖1件小产品获利10美分。

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of software that is used on a page of a website to give the user changing information of a particular type in a small area of the computer screen

example.eg: This new widget will bring fresh content to your website every hour.
example.egtrans: 这个新的窗口小工具每小时都会给你的网站送来新的内容。

wield.name: wield
wield.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to hold a weapon or tool and look as if you are going to use it
trans_examp.trans_cn: 挥舞，握，抓着（武器或工具）

example.eg: She was confronted by a man wielding a knife.
example.egtrans: 她受到一名持刀男子的威胁。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to have a lot of influence or power over other people
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 施加影响／运用权力（等等）

example.eg: He still wields enormous influence in politics.
example.egtrans: 他在政坛仍然很有影响。

within.name: within
within.posTip: Word used before noun, pronoun or -ing form of verb to show place, direction, etc.

trans_examp.trans_en: inside or not further than an area or period of time

example.eg: Two thirds of Californians live within 15 miles of the coast.
example.egtrans: 三分之二的加利福尼亚人居住在离海岸15英里以内的地区。

example.eg: In 1992 cross-border controls within the EU were dismantled.
example.egtrans: 1992年，欧盟内部取消了边境通行管制。

example.eg: For orders within the UK, please enclose £2.50 for post and packing.
example.egtrans: 英国国内的订货，请附上2.5英镑的邮资及包装费用。

example.eg: The resort lies within easy reach of (= not far from) the ski slopes.
example.egtrans: 该景点距离滑雪坡道不远。

example.eg: We recommend that this wine should be consumed within six months.
example.egtrans: 我们建议该酒在6个月内饮用完毕。

example.eg: Within hours of the tragedy happening, an emergency rescue team had been assembled.
example.egtrans: 悲剧发生后几小时之内，就集结起来一支紧急救援队伍。

example.eg: The tickets should reach you within the week (= before the end of this week).
example.egtrans: 票将在本周内送到你处。

example.eg: He's very highly regarded within his profession.
example.egtrans: 他在业内得到很高的评价。

example.eg: She managed to complete her last film well within budget.
example.egtrans: 她设法在预算内拍完了她最新一部电影。

example.eg: The target was now within range and so she took aim and fired.
example.egtrans: 当时目标正处于射程范围内，于是她瞄准并开火。

example.eg: He could sense that his goal was within reach (= it could be reached).
example.egtrans: 他可以感觉到自己的目标能够实现。

example.eg: The cathedral spire was now within sight (= it could be seen).
example.egtrans: 已经可以看到教堂的尖顶了。

example.eg: I was acting within the law (= legally).
example.egtrans: 我在法律允许范围内行事。

example.eg: We came within five points of beating them (= we would have beaten them if we had had five more points).
example.egtrans: 我们要是再多拿5分就可以击败他们了。

wonder.name: wonder
wonder.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: wonder
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to ask yourself questions or express a wish to know about something

example.eg: Shouldn't you phone home? Your parents will be wondering where you are.
example.egtrans: 你是不是最好给家里打个电话？你父母会想知道你在哪儿的。

example.eg: He's starting to wonder whether he did the right thing in accepting this job.
example.egtrans: 他现在开始怀疑自己接受这份工作是否正确。

example.eg: Will this turkey be big enough for eight, I wonder?
example.egtrans: 我不知道这只火鸡够不够8个人吃。

example.eg: "Have you decided where you're going next summer?" "I've been wondering about (= considering) going to Florida."
example.egtrans: “你决定好明年夏天去哪里了吗？”“我一直在考虑去佛罗里达。”

trans_examp.trans_en: used in phrases, at the beginning of a request, to make it more formal and polite
trans_examp.trans_cn: （用于短语中，使请求更加正式和礼貌）不知能否…

example.eg: We were wondering if/whether you'd like to have dinner with us some time?
example.egtrans: 不知道你是否愿意什么时候跟我们一起吃顿晚饭?

example.eg: I wonder whether you could pass me the butter?
example.egtrans: 你能不能把黄油递给我？

example.eg: I wonder if you could give me some information about places to visit in the area?
example.egtrans: 不知你能否给我提供一些这个地区可供游玩的地方的情况。

dsense.name: wonder
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to feel or express great surprise at something

example.eg: I don't wonder (that) she burst into tears after the way you spoke to her.
example.egtrans: 你那样对她说话，难怪她会突然哭起来。

wonder.name: wonder
wonder.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a feeling of great surprise and admiration caused by seeing or experiencing something that is strange and new

example.eg: The sight of the Grand Canyon stretching out before them filled them with wonder.
example.egtrans: 大峡谷展现在眼前的景象让他们惊叹万分。

example.eg: The boys gazed in wonder at the shiny red Ferrari.
example.egtrans: 男孩子们惊讶地盯着那辆锃亮的红色法拉利跑车。

trans_examp.trans_en: an object that causes a feeling of great surprise and admiration

example.eg: We spent a week visiting the wonders of Ancient Greek civilization.
example.egtrans: 我们花了一周时间游览古希腊文明的奇观。

example.eg: With all the wonders of modern technology, why has no one come up with a way to make aircraft quieter?
example.egtrans: 既然现代科技创造了如此多的奇迹，为什么没人想个办法让飞行更安静一些呢？

trans_examp.trans_en: an extremely useful or skilful person

example.eg: Our new babysitter's a wonder - she'll come at very short notice and the kids love her.
example.egtrans: 我们家新来的保姆确实非常能干——她能在接到通知后很快赶来，而且孩子们也喜欢她。

workaround.name: workaround
workaround.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a way of dealing with a problem or making something work despite the problem, without completely solving it

example.eg: The software still has a few glitches but we've come up with a workaround.
example.egtrans: 这个软件还是有一些小故障，但是我们已经想出了一个变通办法。

workflow.name: workflow
workflow.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the way that a particular type of work is organized, or the order of the stages in a particular work process

example.eg: The right software tools can improve workflow and productivity.
example.egtrans: 正确的软件工具能够改善工作流程并提高生产能力。

worse.name: worse
worse.posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en:
comparative of 
        
         bad  : more unpleasant, difficult, or severe than before or than something else that is also bad

example.eg: The conditions they're living in are worse than we thought.
example.egtrans: 他们的居住条件比我们想象的更糟糕。

example.eg: If the rain gets any worse we'll have to go back.
example.egtrans: 如果雨再下大些的话，我们就只好回去了。

example.eg: His manners are even worse than his sister's.
example.egtrans: 他的举止甚至比他妹妹还糟糕。

example.eg: The heat is much worse in the daytime.
example.egtrans: 白天天气要炎热得多。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to become more ill, or to become a more severe condition

example.eg: My cold seems to be getting worse.
example.egtrans: 我的感冒似乎在加重。

example.eg: If he gets any worse I'll take him to the doctor's.
example.egtrans: 如果他的病情再加重的话，我就带他去看医生。

worse.name: worse
worse.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: something that is more unpleasant or difficult

example.eg: By the third month of the expedition they had endured many hardships, but worse was to follow.
example.egtrans: 到探险的第3个月，他们已经受了很多磨难，但更艰苦的还在后面。

example.eg: "What about the bride's dress - wasn't it terrible?" "I don't know, I've seen worse."
example.egtrans: “新娘穿的礼服你怎么看──糟透了，不是吗？”“我不知道，我还见过更糟的。”

worse.name: worse
worse.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en:
comparative of 
        
         badly

example.eg: He did worse than he was expecting in the exams.
example.egtrans: 他考得比他预期的还要糟。

example.eg: He was treated much worse than I was.
example.egtrans: 他的待遇比我的还要差很多。

wrap.name: wrap
wrap.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cover or surround something with paper, cloth, or other material

example.eg: She wrapped the present and tied it with ribbon.
example.egtrans: 她把礼物包起来并用丝带绑好。

example.eg: Wrap the chicken in foil and cook it for two hours.
example.egtrans: 用锡箔纸将鸡肉包起来，烹饪两个小时。

trans_examp.trans_en: to cover someone with a piece of material in order to protect them

example.eg: She wrapped the baby in a blanket.
example.egtrans: 她用一条毯子把婴儿包起来。

example.eg: He wrapped a towel around his shoulders.
example.egtrans: 他用毛巾裹住他的肩膀。

wrap.name: wrap
wrap.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: wrap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a sandwich made with one piece of very thin bread that is folded around a filling

dsense.name: wrap
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: material that is used to cover or protect objects

example.eg: plastic wrap
example.egtrans: 塑料包装布

example.eg: gift wrap
example.egtrans: 礼品包装纸

trans_examp.trans_en: a loose piece of clothing that is worn tied around the body

example.eg: a beach wrap
example.egtrans: 沙滩浴衣

trans_examp.trans_en: a long piece of cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders to keep her warm or for decoration

example.eg: a chiffon/silk wrap
example.egtrans: 雪纺／丝绸披肩

wrapper.name: wrapper
wrapper.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: wrapper
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a piece of paper, plastic, or other material that covers and protects something

example.eg: a sweet wrapper
example.egtrans: 糖果包装纸

trans_examp.trans_en: a loose piece of clothing that is worn in the house, sometimes over other clothes

dsense.name: wrapper
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a financial product that gives advantages such as reduced tax
trans_examp.trans_cn: 包管账户（一种财务产品，可获得避税等好处）

example.eg: The shares will be held in a tax-free individual savings account wrapper.
example.egtrans: 股份将通过免税的个人储蓄包管账户持有。

yet.name: yet
yet.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

dsense.name: yet
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: still; until the present time

example.eg: I haven't spoken to her yet.
example.egtrans: 我还没和她谈过。

example.eg: He hasn't finished yet.
example.egtrans: 他还没完成。

example.eg: "Are you ready?" "Not yet - wait a minute."
example.egtrans: “你准备好了吗？”“还没呢──稍等。”

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: the best, worst, etc. until now
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 迄今最好的／最差的（等等）

example.eg: Of all the songs I've heard tonight, that's the best yet.
example.egtrans: 在我今晚听到的所有歌中，那首是最好的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: until and including this time

example.eg: We haven't needed extra staff as yet, but we may in the future.
example.egtrans: 到目前为止，我们尚不需要增加员工，但将来也许会需要。

example.eg: No ambulances had as yet managed to get across the river.
example.egtrans: 到目前为止还没有救护车顺利过河。

dsense.name: yet
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: from now and for a particular period of time in the future
trans_examp.trans_cn: 从现在起至将来某个时间，还

example.eg: She won't be back for a long time yet.
example.egtrans: 她很长一段时间都不会回来的。

example.eg: Our holiday isn't for weeks yet.
example.egtrans: 我们的假期还远着呢。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you have yet to do something, you have not done it.

example.eg: They have yet to make a decision.
example.egtrans: 他们还没有作出决定。

dsense.name: yet
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: even at this stage or time

example.eg: We could yet succeed - you never know.
example.egtrans: 我们仍然有可能成功——谁也说不好。

example.eg: You might yet prove me wrong.
example.egtrans: 你也许还会证明我是错的。

example.eg: He may win yet.
example.egtrans: 他仍有可能胜出。

dsense.name: yet
dsense.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to add emphasis to words such as another and again, especially to show an increase in amount or the number of times something happens
trans_examp.trans_cn: 再，还（用于强调 another 或 again 之类的词，尤指数量增加或某事发生频繁）

example.eg: Rachel bought yet another pair of shoes to add to her collection.
example.egtrans: 雷切尔已经有那么多鞋，居然又买了一双。

example.eg: I'm sorry to bother you yet again.
example.egtrans: 我很抱歉又来麻烦你。

example.eg: He's given us yet more work to do.
example.egtrans: 他又给我们布置了很多工作。

yet.name: yet
yet.posTip: A word that describes or gives more information about a verb, adjective or other adverb.

trans_examp.trans_en: (and) despite that; used to add something that seems surprising because of what you have just said

example.eg: simple yet effective
example.egtrans: 简单而又高效

example.eg: He's overweight and bald, (and) yet somehow, he's attractive.
example.egtrans: 他肥胖且秃头，然而不知为何却很有魅力。

You.name: you
You.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

dsense.name: you
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: used to refer to the person or people being spoken or written to

example.eg: You look nice.
example.egtrans: 你看起来不错。

example.eg: I love you.
example.egtrans: 我爱你。

example.eg: You said I could go with you.
example.egtrans: 你说过我可以和你一起去。

example.eg: You're coming tonight, aren't you?
example.egtrans: 你今晚会过来，对吗?

example.eg: Are you two ready?
example.egtrans: 你俩准备好了吗？

example.eg: You painted that yourself? That's great!
example.egtrans: 那个是你自己画的？太棒了！

dsense.name: you
dsense.posTip: A word used instead of a noun, which has usually already been talked about.

trans_examp.trans_en: people in general

example.eg: You learn to accept these things as you get older.
example.egtrans: 年纪大些之后，你开始学会接受这些事情。

example.eg: You can't get a driving licence till you're 17 in this country.
example.egtrans: 在这个国家，17岁以下人士不能获得驾驶执照。

example.eg: Too much alcohol is bad for you.
example.egtrans: 饮酒过量对身体有害。

example.eg: How do you get this thing to start?
example.egtrans: 怎样才能让这东西启动？
